144 - My father told me, saying: Zaid bin Al-Hubab told us, saying: Sufyan Al-Thawri told us from Ata bin Al-Sa'ib, who said: Sa'id bin Jubayr said to me: "Are you not amazed that I stay from Friday to Friday and no one asks me about anything?" Abdullah bin Ahmad bin Hanbal informed us by license (*Ijazah*), saying:
145 - My father told me, saying: Waki' told us, saying: I heard Al-A'mash in the year forty-five [145 AH], then the news of Muhammad—meaning Ibn Abdullah bin Al-Hasan—came to us that he had revolted in Medina. Waki' said: Hisham bin Urwah was with us in Kufa.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
146 - My father told me, saying: I heard Musa bin Dawud say: I heard Sufyan Al-Thawri say in the year one hundred and fifty-eight: "Abu Ishaq died thirty years ago." And Abu Ishaq used to sometimes say: "Silah told us sixty years ago." He said: And I heard Sufyan say that year: "I am sixty-one years old."
147 - My father told me, saying: Abdur-Rahman bin Mahdi told us, saying: Malik bin Anas told us from Al-Zuhri, who said: I used to sit with Tha'labah bin Abi Malik, so he said to me one day: "Do you want this [knowledge]?" I said: "Yes." He said: "Stick to Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib." He said: So I sat with him for ten years [which seemed] like a single day.
148 - My father told me, saying: Abdur-Razzaq told us, saying: Ma'mar told us from Al-Zuhri, who said: My knee touched the knee of Ibn Al-Musayyib for eight years.
149 - My father told me, saying: Abdur-Razzaq told us, saying: Ma'mar informed us, saying: I heard Al-Zuhri say: I caught four oceans [of knowledge] from Quraysh: Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib, Urwah bin Al-Zubayr, Abu Salamah bin Abdur-Rahman, and Ubaydullah bin Abdullah.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
150 - My father told me, saying: Abdur-Razzaq told us, saying: Ma'mar informed us, saying: It was said to Al-Zuhri: "Is Qatadah more knowledgeable in your opinion, or Makhul?" He said: "No, rather Qatadah; Makhul only had a little bit."
151 - My father told me, saying: Umayyah bin Khalid told us: The name of Abu Sheikh Al-Huna'i is Haywan bin Khalid. And Uqbah bin Abd Al-Ghafir is from 'Awdh from Al-Azd; his Kunya is Abu Nahar. And Abu Ayyub, the companion of Qatadah, is from Al-Atik; his name is Yahya. And Uqbah bin Sahban is from Al-Huddan. My father said: Umayyah told me all of this.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
152 - My father told me, saying: Husayn bin Al-Walid Al-Naysaburi told us—my father said: He is trustworthy—that Abdullah bin Umar, meaning Al-Umari, was asked about something from Hadith, so he said: "As for while Abu Uthman is alive, then no," meaning Ubaydullah bin Umar.
153 - My father told me, saying: Yahya bin Abi Bukayr told us, saying: I heard Shu'bah say: "Sufyan never narrated a hadith to me from a person and I asked him about it, except that it was [exactly] as he narrated it to me."
154 - My father told me, saying: Waki' told us, saying: Shu'bah said—and he mentioned Najiyah, meaning Ibn Sa'd—so he mentioned playing chess, as if he criticized him [for it].
155 - My father told me, saying: Waki' told us: Shu'bah mentioned Dawud bin Farahij and disparaged him, meaning he spoke against him. My father said: Yahya bin Sa'id said: He is Madinan, Dawud bin Farahij. My father said: Abu Ghassan Muhammad bin Mutarrif narrated from him.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
156 - My father told me, saying: Yunus told us, saying: Hammad bin Zaid told us from Ma'mar from Al-Zuhri, who said: Abu Salamah used to ask Ibn Abbas, but he would withhold from him. Ubaydullah used to be gentle with him, so he would pour [knowledge] onto him abundantly.
157 - My father told me, saying: Abdur-Razzaq told us, saying: Ma'mar informed us, saying: I heard Al-Zuhri say: I used to come to the door of Urwah and sit, then leave without entering. And if I had wished to enter, I would have entered, meaning out of veneration for him.
158 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us, saying: I heard Sa'id bin Ibrahim say to Ibn Shihab—and he narrated from him—he said: "Who is Abu Al-Ahwas?" He said: "Did you not see the Sheikh who was at such-and-such place?" He described him.
159 - My father told me, saying: Abdur-Razzaq told us from Ma'mar, who said: I heard Al-Zuhri say: Umar bin Abdul-Aziz performed Hajj and I was with him. Sa'id bin Jubayr came to me at night, while he was in his [state of] fear, and entered my residence. He said: "Do you fear your companion for me?" I said: "No, rather be safe."
160 - My father told me, saying: Affan told us, saying: Bishr bin Al-Mufaddal told us, saying: Abdur-Rahman bin Ishaq told us from Al-Zuhri, who said: I never asked for a hadith to be repeated ever, nor did I doubt a hadith except one hadith. I asked my companion, and behold, it was just as I had memorized.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
161 - My father told me, saying: Aswad bin 'Amir told us, saying: Hammad bin Zaid told us from Yahya bin Sa'id, who said: I never saw a Hashimite ever better than him, meaning Ali bin Husayn.
162 - My father told me, saying: Aswad bin 'Amir told us, saying: Abu Bakr—meaning Ibn Ayyash—told us from Ata bin Al-Sa'ib, who said: I heard Abu Ja'far say: By Allah, there is no man on earth more knowledgeable about Hajj than Ata.
163 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us from Al-Zuhri, who said: If he approaches her (his wife) before he makes expiation, he must expiate twice. It was said to him: Did you hear it from Al-Zuhri? He said: No.
164 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us, saying: Ibn Tariq was such that there was no one like him in Mecca.
165 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us, saying: Abu Al-Zubayr used not to dye [his hair/beard].
166 - My father said: Sufyan is the most reliable of people regarding Amr bin Dinar and has the best hadith [from him].
167 - My father said: Muslim Al-Musabbih is the one who lights the lamps in the mosque.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text: 168 - My father told me, saying: Ibn 'Uyaynah told us, saying: As for Amr bin Dinar, he heard it from Kulthum bin Jabr from a man from his father. Abu Jazi said: So I asked him—meaning Kulthum—and he said: "An old Bedouin man only informed me from his father."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
169 - My father said: And it was read to Sufyan that a man fasted during a journey, so Umar ordered him to repeat the fast.
170 - My father said: The one from whom Amr bin Dinar narrated, from Murrah, this is another man called Murrah; he is not Murrah Al-Tayyib.
171 - My father said: Sufyan said: Bajalah performed Hajj with Mus'ab in the year seventy.
172 - I heard my father say: Muhammad bin Muslim Al-Ta'ifi, how weak his hadith is! And he considered him very weak.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
173 - My father told me, saying: Ibn 'Uyaynah told us, saying: I heard Malik ask him—meaning Zaid bin Aslam—about the hadith of his father that Umar provided a horse [for Jihad]. My father said: The hadith of Busr bin Mihjan was mentioned to Sufyan, so he said: Zaid said: A man told us from his father.
174 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan said: I said to a man: "Ask Zaid"—meaning Ibn Aslam—"did you hear from Abdullah"—meaning Ibn Umar—"the hadith: 'The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, entered the mosque of Banu Amr bin Awf'?' I was afraid to ask him. So he [the man] said: "O Abu Usamah, did you hear it from Abdullah bin Umar?" He said: "As for me, I saw him and spoke to him."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
175 - I asked my father: Did Ziyad bin Sa'd hear from Ibn Hadir? He said: Yes. I said: Did Ibn Hadir hear from Ibn Abbas? He said: Yes.
176 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us, saying: Amr bin Yahya bin Umarah bin Abi Hasan Al-Mazini told us from his father from Abdullah bin Zaid that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, performed ablution. Sufyan said: Yahya bin Sa'id told us from Amr bin Yahya since seventy-four years [ago?]. Then I asked shortly after that, and Yahya was older than him. My father said: Sufyan said: I heard three hadiths from him. My father said: And I heard this hadith from Sufyan three times. My father said: Sufyan said: I did not hear from him the hadith of Amr bin Yahya from his father from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, regarding the bathhouse and the graveyard. My father said: Sufyan told us it; he did Tadlis in it.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
177 - My father told me, saying: Ibn 'Uyaynah told us, saying: I did not memorize from Ibn Urwah Uthman except one [hadith], and Hisham said to me: "He reports it from me."
178 - My father told me, saying: Ibn 'Uyaynah told us from Muhammad bin Abdur-Rahman bin Sa'd bin Zurarah, the nephew of 'Amrah. Sufyan said: I heard it from him before Al-Zuhri came. Sufyan said: I sat with him when I was fifteen years old. He came here and stayed. I did not comprehend Hadith well [at that time]. Umar bin Abdul-Aziz had appointed him over Al-Yamamah, and he possessed virtue.
179 - My father told me, saying: They said to Sufyan that Munkadir narrates from his father from Jabir. He said: "So where do I come across Sa'id bin Abdur-Rahman bin Yarbu' from Jubayr bin Al-Huwayrith: 'I saw Abu Bakr standing at Quzah'?' My father said: It is actually Abdur-Rahman bin Sa'id bin Yarbu'.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text: 180 - My father told me, saying: Ibn 'Uyaynah told us from Ibn Al-Munkadir, who heard it from Ata bin Yasar, and [from] Abdul-Aziz bin Rufay' from Abu Salih from Ata bin Yasar. Sufyan said: Amr had narrated to us from him, so I came to Kufa and found him alive. I said: "How old are you?" He said: "Eighty-four," meaning Abdul-Aziz.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
181 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us, saying: It reached me regarding Ibn Al-Munkadir that it was said to him: "Which deed is most beloved to you?" He said: "Bringing joy to the believer." It was said to him: "So what do you desire?" He said: "Bestowing favors upon the brothers."
182 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us, saying: We heard it from four people from Aisha; they did not raise it [to the Prophet]: Ruzayq, Abdullah bin Abi Bakr, Yahya, and Abdu-Rabbih; they heard it from 'Amrah, meaning [the hadith about] cutting [the hand] for a quarter of a dinar. Abu Abdur-Rahman said: I heard Abu Ma'mar say: I heard Sufyan say: "And Al-Zuhri raised it, and he is the most retentive of the people."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
183 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us from Abdullah bin Abi Bakr: They were gathered, so I asked them, this one and that one. And Abdullah was the most retentive of the people for Hadith—meaning [more than] Muhammad bin Abi Bakr. Sufyan said: And he had been appointed to the judiciary, meaning Muhammad.
184 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told me the hadith of Damrah from Abu Sa'id. I said to Sufyan: "Did he hear it?" He said: "He claimed so," meaning from Abu Sa'id.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
185 - My father told me, saying: I heard Sufyan mention him a second time, so he said: "A Sheikh from the Ansar," meaning Damrah. My father said: Malik narrated from him; he is trustworthy.
186 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us, saying: I was sitting with Ibn Jurayj, and he saw him circumambulating [the Kaaba]. So he said to me: "This Sheikh used to come to Ata and narrate to him, so go and ask him." Sufyan said: He came during an Umrah. So I went to the Tawaf and asked him. They said: "This is Musa bin Uqbah."
187 - My father told me, saying: I heard Sufyan say: Sulayman bin Suhaym told me—Sufyan said: I did not memorize from him other than it—he heard it from Ibrahim bin Abdullah bin Ma'bad bin Abbas from his father from Ibn Abbas: The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, uncovered the curtain while the people were in rows behind Abu Bakr.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
188 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan said: I do not know if I heard it or not. Some of the Sheikhs used to avoid him, meaning Asim bin Ubaydullah. I saw him using the Siwak (tooth-stick) countless times.
189 - My father said: Ibn Abi Labid used to hold the view of Qadar. Sufyan heard from him in Kufa, and his origin is Madinan.
190 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us, saying: Hisham bin Urwah added in the story of Ibn Al-Lutbiyyah: Abu Humayd said: "My ear heard and my eye saw. Ask Zaid bin Thabit."
191 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us, saying: Hisham bin Urwah said: My father said: "I left her [stopped asking her] before she died by such-and-such [time]." Sufyan said: "I left her two years before she died; I did not ask her about anything," meaning Aisha. My father said: Yahya bin Adam asked Sufyan about this hadith.
192 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us from Hisham who said: Ibn Umar wiped my head and prayed (*salla*) over me. Sufyan said: Meaning he supplicated (*da'a*) for me.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
193 - My father told me: Sufyan told us twice from Ibn Ajlan from Iyad bin Abdullah bin Sa'd bin Sarh, he heard Abu Sa'id from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace: "And everything that the spring grows kills by distension (*habatan*)." And Yazid bin Harun said from Hisham from Yahya from Hilal, and he said in it "*khabatan*" [striking randomly], and he erred; it is only "*habatan*". Sufyan said: Al-A'mash used to ask me about the hadith of Iyad, the hadith of Ibn Ajlan, meaning this hadith.
194 - My father told me, saying: I heard Ibn 'Uyaynah say: Muhammad bin Ajlan told us, and he was trustworthy.
195 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us from Ibn Ajlan who said: A famine afflicted the people, so I saw them burning hooves and eating them, meaning in Medina.
196 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us from Yahya bin Sa'id from Yazid, the Mawla of Al-Munba'ith. Yahya said: Rabi'ah informed me that he said from Zaid bin Khalid. Sufyan said: So I asked Rabi'ah, and he said: He informed me of it from Zaid bin Khalid: The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was asked about the lost item. So Sufyan mentioned the hadith.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text: 197 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us, saying: Yahya—meaning Ibn Sa'id—told us in the year one hundred and twenty-four in that place—a place in the Sacred Mosque—with us was a man from the people of Al-Yamamah called Ibrahim bin Tarif. He said: Ibn Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib informed me that his father used to say when he saw the House (Kaaba): "O Allah, You are the Peace, and from You is peace; greet us, our Lord, with peace." Ibrahim said: Humayd bin Ya'qub informed me—and he is alive in Medina—he said: I heard Sa'id say: I heard a word from Umar... Sufyan said: And he once said: "[While] someone other than me was alive, I heard him say when he saw the Kaaba: 'O Allah, You are the Peace, and from You is peace; greet us, our Lord, with peace.'" Sufyan said: So I arrived in Medina, and they said: "He is sick and does not go out," meaning Humayd bin Ya'qub.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text: 198 - My father told me, saying: Aswad bin 'Amir told us, saying: Sharik told us from Abu Ishaq, who said: I saw Ibn Abbas with long hair after the days of Sacrifice, [which touched him?] when he prostrated, and he was wearing a yellow lower garment (*Izar*) with some things [patterns] on it.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 199 - My father told me, he said: Aswad bin Amir told us, he said: Sharik told us, from Jabir, from Amir, he said: I saw Al-Hasan and Al-Husayn asking Al-Harith about the Hadith of Ali. 200 - My father told me, he said: Aswad bin Amir told us, he said: Sharik told us, from Salim bin Abd Al-Rahman Al-Nakha'i, he said: Ibrahim heard Al-Suddi interpreting [the Quran], so he said: 'His interpretation is the interpretation of the people (partisans).' Sharik said: Ibrahim was severe in speech regarding the Murji'ah; as if he did not hold the view of Irja'. 201 - My father told me, he said: Sayyar told us, he said: Ja'far told us, he said: Abu Imran Al-Jawni told us, from Abu Al-Jald, he said: Ibn Abbas spoke to me in his house for two years asking me, and he asked me about the sky: 'What is it?' I said: 'A restrained wave.' My father said: Abu Al-Jald's name is Jaylan bin Farwah.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 202 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: My father told us, he said: I saw Zubayd bin Al-Harith at the funeral of Abd Al-Rahman bin Sa'id bin Wahb. He turned the women back, so they came [from another way]. Then he intercepted them in another place and turned them back, but they refused. When they overcame him, he returned. 203 - My father said: Al-A'mash is Sulayman bin Mihran Al-Kahili. Khalid Al-Hadhdha' (the shoemaker) is Ibn Mihran Abu Manazil. Thabit Al-Bunani is Thabit bin Aslam Abu Muhammad. 204 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Adam told us, he said: Zuhayr told us, from Abu Ishaq, he said: We used to sit with Al-Bara', one of us behind the other. 205 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Adam told us, he said: Zuhayr told us, from Abu Ishaq, he said: I saw the wives of the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, performing Hajj during the time of Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah in howdahs covered with Tayalisah (cloaks). It was said to me: 'Those are the wives of the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 206 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Adam told us, he said: Zuhayr told us, from Abu Ishaq, from Al-Bara', he said: As for us, we name what you call the Conquest of Mecca; we used to call the Day of Hudaibiyah the Pledge of Ridwan. 207 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Adam told us, he said: Abd Al-Rahman bin Humayd told us, he said: I heard Abu Ishaq say: Abu Abd Al-Rahman Al-Sulami taught the Quran in the mosque for forty years. 208 - My father told me, he said: Abd Al-Samad told us, he said: Aban bin Khalid told us, he said: I heard Al-Hasan say: It reached me that Pharaoh used to worship a god in secret.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 209 - My father told me, he said: Abd Al-Quddus bin Bakr bin Khunays Abu Al-Jahm told us, from Muhammad bin Al-Nadr Al-Harithi, he said: It used to be said: The beginning of knowledge is silence for it, then listening to it, then memorizing it, then acting upon it, then spreading it. 210 - My father told me, he said: Shadhan told us, he said: Sharik told us, from Ibrahim bin Muhajir, from Habib bin Salim, and he was a scribe for Al-Nu'man bin Bashir. 211 - My father told me, he said: Shadhan told us, he said: Hasan bin Salih told us, from Ayyub, from Mujahid, that he prostrated a prostration, then did not prostrate another until he died.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 212 - My father told me, he said: Shadhan told us, he said: Ja'far bin Ziyad Al-Ahmar Abu Abdullah informed us, from Abd Al-Malik bin Umayr, he said: I saw Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah after Asr before the sun set, and he was striving or rushing. 213 - My father told me, he said: Shadhan told us, he said: Sharik informed us, from Umar bin Ya'la, he said: I heard him—meaning Abu Abd Al-Rahman—say: Ali was the most reciting of people with his tongue, meaning the tongue (dialect) of Quraysh. 214 - My father told me, he said: Muhammad bin Abdullah Al-Ansari told us, he said: Awf bin Abi Jamilah Al-A'rabi told us, he said: Abdullah bin Amr bin Hind Al-Jamali told me that Ali said—Awf said: And he did not hear it from Ali—he said: I do not care which of my limbs I start with if I complete the Wudu (ablution).

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 215 - My father told me, he said: Muhammad bin Abdullah told us, he said: Hisham bin Hassan told us that Anas bin Malik died while Muhammad bin Sirin was imprisoned for a debt he owed. He said: So Anas willed that Muhammad wash him. He said: So Umar bin Yazid was spoken to on his behalf, and he intervened for him such that he was brought out of prison. He said: So he washed him, then Muhammad returned to the prison until he was back in it. He said: Muhammad continued to be grateful for it to the family of Umar bin Yazid until he died. 216 - He said: I heard my father mentioning Abu Qatadah Al-Harrani, so he said: There was no harm in him; a righteous man resembling the People of Asceticism (Nusk), except that perhaps he made mistakes. It was said to him: Indeed, some people speak against him. He said: There was no harm in him. I said: They say he did not distinguish between Sufyan and Yahya bin Abi Anisah. He said: False, he was intelligent. My father said: There was nothing in Abu Qatadah that I disliked except that he used to wear a garment and not wash it until it fell apart.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 217 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, from Sufyan, from Zayd—meaning Al-Burjumi—he said: I heard Ibrahim cursing Al-Hajjaj. 218 - And I heard him mentioning Mughirah bin Miqsam Al-Dabbi, so he said: He was a man of Sunnah, intelligent, a Hafiz. But the general body of his Hadith from Ibrahim is defective (Madkhul). The generality of what he narrated from Ibrahim, he only heard from Hammad, from Yazid bin Al-Walid, Al-Harith Al-Ulkali, from Ubaydah, and from others. And he began weakening the Hadith of Al-Mughirah from Ibrahim alone.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 219 - My father told me, he said: Abd Al-Rahman bin Mahdi said: I asked Sufyan about it—meaning the Hadith of Hammad bin Salamah from Hajjaj from Abu Bakr bin Abi Al-Jahm that the people of Kufa ordered him to ask Qabisah bin Dhu'ayb about the child of a female slave freed upon death (Mudabbarah) from a Mudabbar marriage [?]—so Sufyan said: I heard it from Abu Bakr, but I cannot bring it forth as I wish. 220 - My father said: Abd Al-Rahman bin Mahdi said: I have heard from Dawud bin Qays, yet they do not ask me about it; they ask me about the Hadith of Sufyan from Dawud bin Qays. 221 - My father told me, he said: Abd Al-Rahman bin Mahdi told us, he said: Sufyan told us, from Habib, he said: I saw Sa'id bin Jubayr kissing a son of his, a man. Abd Al-Rahman said: I said to Sufyan: Habib bin Abi Thabit? He said: No. I said: Habib bin Abi Amrah? He said: No. I said: Then who is Habib? He said: A Sheikh of ours. My father said: I think he is Habib bin Abi Al-Ashras.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 222 - My father told me, he said: Ibn Mahdi told us, he said: Sufyan told us, from Mujammi' bin Sam'an. Sufyan said: He is Al-Taymi. 223 - My father told me, he said: Ibn Mahdi told us, from Sufyan, from Al-Hasan bin Yazid. And he said once: From Abu Yunus Al-Tawwaf. My father said: He is Abu Yunus Al-Qawi. My father said: Abd Al-Rahman only called him Abu Yunus Al-Tawwaf due to his frequent Tawaf (circumambulation). And Yahya bin Sa'id called him Abu Yunus Al-Qawi. 224 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Sufyan, Isra'il, and Ubayy told us, from Abu Ishaq, from Asim bin Damrah, he said: I asked Ali about the voluntary prayer of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, during the day. He said: 'Indeed, you cannot bear it,' and he narrated the Hadith.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 225 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: My father said: Habib bin Abi Thabit said: 'O Abu Ishaq, I would not love to have this mosque of yours full of gold in exchange for this Hadith of yours.' 226 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, from Sufyan, from Ata' bin Al-Sa'ib, from Al-Qasim bin Abi Ayyub. Waki' said: Sufyan used to say: Ibn Ayyub. My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, from Sufyan, from Husayn bin Abd Al-Rahman, from Al-Qasim bin Abi Ayyub, from Sa'id bin Jubayr. My father said: Waki' said once: Al-Qasim bin Ayyub, and likewise Sufyan said. My father said: It is only Al-Qasim bin Abi Ayyub. My father told me, he said: Hushaym narrated from him but did not hear from him, and Asbagh bin Zayd and Shu'bah narrated from him. The correct [name] is Al-Qasim bin Abi Ayyub.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 227 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Abu Ka'b Abd Rabbih bin Ubayd told me. My father said: Abu Ka'b is trustworthy (Thiqah). 228 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, from Sufyan, from Ibn Abi Najih, from Abdullah bin Abi Kathir, from Abu Al-Minhal, from Ibn Abbas. My father said: Thus Waki' said, and it is a mistake. My father said: It is only Abdullah bin Kathir.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 229 - I heard my father say: Waki' told us, he said: Sufyan told us, from Khalid bin Salamah Al-Makhzumi Al-Fa'fa' (the stutterer). 230 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, from Khalid Abu Abdullah, he said: I saw Al-Sha'bi judging at the door of his house. My father said: This is Khalid Al-Zayyat. 230b - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Sufyan told us, from Abu Ghiyath. My father said: He is the grandfather of Hafs bin Ghiyath. Talq said: He is Abu Ghiyath.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 231 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: My father told us, from Abdullah bin Hanash, he said: I saw them writing on their palms with reeds/canes in the presence of Al-Bara'. 232 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, from Ikrimah bin Ammar, from Yahya, from Ibn Abbas: 'Bind knowledge with writing. Who will buy knowledge from me for a dirham?' 233 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, from Ibn Awn, from Muhammad: I said to Ubaydah: 'Shall I write?' He said: 'No.' I said: 'I found a book, shall I read it?' He said: 'No.' 234 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Al-Mundhir bin Tha'labah told me, from Ilba' bin Ahmar Al-Yashkuri, he said: Ali said: 'Who will buy knowledge from me for a dirham?'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 235 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, from Al-Hakam bin Atiyyah, from Muhammad: They used to think that the Children of Israel only went astray because of books they found from their fathers. 236 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Talhah bin Yahya told me, from Abu Burdah, he said: I wrote a book from my father, so he called for a basin of water and washed it (erased it) in it. 237 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, from Sharik, from Mughirah, from Ibrahim, he said: I used to write in the presence of Ubaydah, so he said: 'Do not immortalize a book from me.' 238 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Imran—meaning Ibn Hudayr—told us, from Lahiq, from Bashir bin Nahik, he said: I wrote a book from Abu Hurayrah. When I wanted to part from him, I said: 'O Abu Hurayrah, I wrote a book from you; shall I narrate it from you?' He said: 'Yes.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 239 - My father told me, he said: Ishaq bin Sulayman Al-Razi told us, he said: I heard Abu Ja'far, from Al-Rabi' bin Anas, say: It is written in the First Book: 'O Son of Adam, teach for free just as you were taught for free.' 240 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Sufyan told us, from Al-Nu'man bin Qays: Indeed, Ubaydah willed that his books be burnt or erased. 241 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Sharik told us, he said: I heard a Sheikh in the mosque—and I described him—he said: That is Abu Sakhrah Jami' bin Shaddad. He said: I saw Hammad writing in the presence of Ibrahim, wearing an Anbijani (coarse woolen garment), saying: 'By Allah, I do not desire the world with it.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 242 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Al-A'mash told us, from Ibrahim, he said: Masruq said to Alqamah: 'Write the counterparts (similarities) for me.' He said: 'Do you not know that writing is disliked?' He said: 'I only learn it then erase it.' He said: 'No harm.' 243 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Al-Hasan bin Uqbah—meaning Abu Kayran—told me, he said: I heard Al-Sha'bi saying: 'If you hear something, write it, even on the wall.' 244 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Sufyan told us, from Muhammad bin Al-Zubayr, he said: I saw Umar bin Abd Al-Aziz see a son of his writing the remembrance of Allah on the wall, so he hit him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 245 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Husayn bin Uqayl told me, he said: Al-Dahhak dictated the rituals of Hajj to me. 246 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Al-Walid bin Tha'labah told us, from Abdullah, a muezzin for Al-Dahhak, from Al-Dahhak, he said: Do not adopt quires (notebooks) for Hadith like the quires of the Mushafs. 247 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Hasan told us, from Layth, from Mujahid, that he disliked quires. 248 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: We found it with Abu Awanah, from Sulayman bin Abi Al-Atik, from Abu Ma'shar, from Ibrahim, that he disliked quires.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 249 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Fudayl—meaning Ibn Iyad—told us, from Ubayd—meaning Al-Muktib—he said: I saw them writing Tafsir in the presence of Mujahid. 250 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Al-Hasan bin Abd Al-Rahman Al-Katib told us—and he was trustworthy (Thiqah), thus said Waki'. 251 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, from Sufyan, from someone who heard Ata' dislike that a man has intercourse facing the Qiblah. My father said: This is Talhah bin Amr; Hammad Al-Khayyat narrated it to us. 252 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Yusuf bin Maymun Abu Khuzaymah Al-Sabbagh told us.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 253 - I heard my father say: Malik bin Anas did not hear anything from Bukayr bin Abdullah. Waki' narrated to us from Malik from Bukayr bin Abdullah. My father said: They say it is the books of his son. 254 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, from Al-Umari, from Nafi', from Ibn Umar that Umar did not use to perform Qunut (supplication) in the Jumu'ah (Friday prayer). I heard my father say: This is Munkar (rejected), meaning the Hadith of Al-Umari. 255 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Sufyan told us, from Abu Hashim, from Sa'id bin Jubayr, he said: Read to me a verse about washing clothes. I asked my father: Who is this Abu Hashim? My father said: Isma'il bin Kathir, and he is not Al-Rummani.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 256 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Ubaydullah bin Habib bin Abi Thabit told us, from his father that Al-Hasan bin Ali blew his nose with his right hand. My father said: This is the brother of Abdullah bin Habib bin Abi Thabit. 257 - I asked my father, I said: Shu'bah from Asim Al-Nakha'i from Talhah bin Musarrif. My father said: I do not know who this Asim Al-Nakha'i is. 258 - My father told me, he said: Abu Dawud told us, he said: Shu'bah said: Sufyan said to me: You overcame us in Wasit—meaning their Sheikhs. 259 - My father told me, he said: Abu Dawud told us, he said: Shu'bah informed us, he said: I used to hear Simak say: 'The two sons of Umm Hani told me.' So I came to the better and more virtuous of them and asked him, and he was called Ja'dah.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 260 - My father told me, he said: Abu Dawud told us, saying: Thabit bin Aslam; in my book, regarding Sulayman bin Al-Mughirah, it is Nabit bin Aslam. 261 - My father told me, he said: Abu Dawud told us, he said: Shu'bah informed us, from Furat—meaning Al-Qazzaz—he said: I heard a Mawla (freed slave) of Umm Salamah say: Umm Salamah named me 'Mikhwad' (Stirrer/Churner), and I was tall. 262 - My father told me, he said: Ibrahim bin Khalid told us, he said: Rabah told us, from Umar bin Habib, that he saw Ata' squatting (sitting on his heels/iq'a) when he raised his head from the first prostration. Umar said: And Tawus used to squat when he raised his head from the first prostration. Umar said: And Sulayman Al-Ahwal told me that he said: I heard Abu Iyad forbidding that. So Tawus said: 'The dissenters (Khawarij) of Abu Iyad have emerged.' 263 - Abu Abd Al-Rahman said: Umar bin Habib is not the judge; this is a Meccan man.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 264 - My father told me, he said: Ibrahim bin Khalid told us, he said: Rabah told me, he said: Umar bin Habib told me that Amr bin Dinar had gout. Perhaps when the pain struck him, he would say: 'O the struggle of Amr!' 265 - My father told me, he said: Abu Sa'id Mawla of Banu Hashim told us, he said: Ishaq bin Uthman told us, he said: I heard Abu Ayyub Abdullah bin Abi Sulayman, Mawla of Uthman bin Affan. My father said: Abu Ayyub, his Hadith is Muqarib (acceptable/average), and Hammad bin Salamah narrated from him. 266 - My father told me, he said: Abu Sa'id told us, he said: Ishaq bin Uthman Abu Ya'qub told us, he said: Shuways Abu Al-Ruqad told us.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 267 - My father told me, he said: Abu Sa'id Mawla of Banu Hashim told us, he said: Ishaq bin Uthman Abu Ya'qub Al-Kilabi told us, he said: Abu Ayyub Mawla of Ibn Affan told us, from Abu Hurayrah, who said: 'If I wished to name the Caliph who will be at the head of two hundred years, I would name him.' 268 - My father told me, he said: Muhammad bin Ja'far told us, he said: Sa'id bin Abi Arubah told us, from Qatadah, from Sa'id bin Abi Burdah, from Abu Burdah, from his father: That two men disputed before the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, regarding a beast, and neither of them had proof. So he made it (divided) between them in halves. 269 - My father told me, he said: Abu Kamil Muzaffar bin Mudrik told us, he said: Hammad—meaning Ibn Salamah—told us, from Qatadah, from Al-Nadr bin Anas, from Abu Burdah bin Abi Musa: That two men claimed a beast they found with a man. Each of them established two witnesses that it was his beast. The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, judged regarding it between them. Hammad said: Simak bin Harb said to me: 'I narrated this Hadith to Abu Burdah.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 270 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, from Sufyan, from Simak bin Harb, from Tamim bin Tarfah: That two men claimed a she-camel, and each of them established proof that it was his. So they disputed before the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, and he judged that it be (divided) between them in halves. 271 - My father told me, he said: Abd Al-Samad told us, he said: Hammam told us, he said: Qatadah told us, from Sa'id bin Abi Burdah, from his father: That two men claimed a camel, and each of them established proof with two witnesses. So the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, divided it between them. 272 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il bin Ibrahim told us, he said: Ibn Awn informed us, from Imran Al-Khayyat, from Abu Sulayman Zayd bin Wahb. 273 - I heard my father say: Muhammad bin Ziyad Al-Alhani's Kunya is Abu Sufyan. 274 - I heard my father say: The Kunya of Dhu Al-Kala' is Abu Shurahbil.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 275 - My father told me, he said: Abu Dawud told us, he said: Shu'bah informed us, he said: I asked Amr bin Murrah about Uwais Al-Qarni, 'Do they know him among you?' He said: 'No.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 276 - I heard my father say: These are the companions of Ibn Abbas: Tawus, Mujahid, Sa'id bin Jubayr, Ata', Jabir bin Zayd, and Ikrimah is the last of them. Abu Abd Al-Rahman said: It seems that according to him (his father), this is the second layer, who says: 'And Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib and so-and-so and so-and-so are before them.' 277 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Adam told us, he said: Ibn Abi Za'idah told us, from Sa'id bin Abi Arubah, he said: Some of my companions told me, from me, from Abu Ma'shar, from Ibrahim, regarding a man who acknowledges a child then denies him. He said: 'He engages in Li'an (mutual imprecation) according to the Book of Allah, and the child is bound [to him] by the judgment of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him.' 278 - My father said: Yahya used to disapprove of Hammam adding to the Isnad (chain of narration). Then he said: Affan claimed, he said: Yahya used to ask me about Hammam, 'How did Hammam say it?' when Mu'adh bin Hisham arrived; and that was because he agreed with Hammam in Hadiths. My father said: And Yahya used to view that he [Hammam] was not like Sa'id.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 279 - My father told me, he said: I heard Abd Al-Rahman say: 'Hammam is, in my view, like Sa'id bin Abi Arubah in truthfulness.' 280 - My father told me, from Ibn Idris, he said: Shu'bah said to me: 'Your father used to provide me with benefit (knowledge).' 281 - My father told me, he said: Hajjaj bin Muhammad told us: I saw Ibn Abi Layla judging in the mosque, and I saw Yahya bin Sa'id Al-Ansari judging in the mosque, and I saw Uthman bin Umar judging in his house. My father said: This one was a judge in Basra. And Sawwar used to judge in his house.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 282 - My father told me, he said: We mentioned a Hadith from the Hadith of Uqayl in the presence of Yahya bin Sa'id. Yahya said to me: 'O Abu Abdullah, Uqayl and Ibrahim bin Sa'd? Uqayl and Ibrahim bin Sa'd?' As if he was weakening them. My father said: And what benefit does that do him? These are trustworthy men (Thiqat); Yahya did not test them [know them well]. 283 - My father told me, he said: Yazid bin Harun told us, from Shu'bah, from Ash'ath bin Sulaym, from Amr bin Maymun, from Abu Hurayrah, from the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, who said: 'Whoever loves to find the taste of faith, let him love a person, loving him only for the sake of Allah.' My father said: I said to Yazid: 'What is the name of Abu Balj?' He said: 'Yahya bin Abi Sulaym.' Yazid said: 'I heard it from Shu'bah in Baghdad, and I was among the last of the people, and I have doubted it since I heard it.' So Yazid retracted it and said: 'Write it from a man.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 284 - My father told me, he said: Muhammad bin Ja'far Ghundar told us, he said: Shu'bah told us, from Abu Balj, from Amr bin Maymun, from Abu Hurayrah, from the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, who said: 'Whoever loves to find the taste of faith, let him love a person, loving him only for the sake of Allah.' 285 - My father told me, he said: Ubaydah told us, he said: Hilal—meaning Ibn Abi Humayd, meaning Al-Wazzan—told me. 286 - My father told me, he said: Hammad—meaning Al-Khayyat—told us, he said: Abu Mawdud told us: Abd Al-Aziz bin Sulayman [told us].

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 287 - My father told me, from Affan, he said: I and Bahz went out to Kufa. Bahz said to me: 'Go with us to Abu Maryam.' I said: 'No.' 288 - I heard my father say: Shurayh bin Ubayd is Abu Al-Salt. Hawshab bin Sayf is Abu Ruh. Abdullah bin Busr is Abu Safwan. Muhammad bin Ziyad Al-Alhani is Abu Sufyan. My father said: Abu Al-Mughirah told us this from Safwan with these Kunyas. My father said: Artah bin Al-Mundhir is Abu Adi. Damrah bin Habib is Abu Utbah. Safwan bin Amr is Abu Amr. Khalid bin Ma'dan is Abu Abdullah. Amr bin Al-Aswad Al-Ansi is Abu Iyad. Yahya bin Abi Kathir is Abu Nasr. Humayd bin Al-Hilal is Abu Nasr.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 289 - My father told me, he said: Hajjaj told us, he said: Mandal told me, from Ja'far bin Abi Al-Mughirah, from Sa'id bin Al-Jubayr: 'I used to write in the presence of Ibn Abbas on my tablets until I filled them, then I would write on my sandal.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 290 - My father told me, he said: Bahz told us, he said: Hammam said: I mentioned to Abu Al-Tayyah—meaning the Hadith of Abu Al-Khalil from Abdullah bin Al-Harith from Hakim bin Hizam from the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him: 'The two parties in a sale have the option as long as they have not separated'—Abu Al-Tayyah said: 'I was with Abu Al-Khalil when Abdullah bin Al-Harith narrated this Hadith to him.' 291 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il bin Ibrahim told us, he said: Yunus told us, from Al-Hasan: That some people said to Uqayl bin Abi Talib: 'O Abu Yazid.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 292 - I presented to my father Hadiths from Isa Al-Hannat. He said: 'You have come upon Isa with something ugly/worthless (?); Isa Al-Hannat is worth nothing,' twice. I said to him: 'Do you see him like Al-Sari bin Isma'il?' He said: 'No, Al-Sari is better than Isa; Al-Sari is more beloved to us than him.' 293 - My father said: A companion of ours called Abu Ya'qub Mawla of Abu Ubaydullah told me, he said: Abbad bin Al-Awwam used to say: 'Abu Al-Hudhayl said,' and 'Abu Al-Hudhayl said.' [Meaning] Husayn bin Abd Al-Rahman. 294 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Al-A'mash said: 'Were it not for fame, I would have eaten Suhur after the prayer.' 295 - My father said: Makhul Al-Shami, his Kunya is Abu Abdullah. I said: 'Whose son is he?' He said: 'A captive.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 296 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Al-Hasan bin Abd Al-Rahman Al-Katib told us, and he was trustworthy (Thiqah); thus said Waki'. 297 - My father told me, he said: Abu Ja'far Al-Suwaydi told us, from Muhammad bin Fudayl, he said: We used to come to Al-A'mash, and he had a blind man with him who memorized better than Abu Mu'awiyah. When we stood up (to leave), he would dictate it to us. Ibn Fudayl said: 'Except for us, for we knew it.' 298 - My father told me, from Abu Mu'awiyah, he said: When we stood up from Al-A'mash's presence, I would dictate it to them. My father said: Like Al-Ahdab, Ya'la, and those, meaning the younger ones. And Jarir Al-Razi claimed, saying: 'We used to patch it up at Al-A'mash's; this one writing from that one, and that one from this one.' 299 - I heard my father say: Yahya Al-Jabir is Abu Al-Harith Al-Taymi.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 300 - I heard my father say: Mahdi bin Maymun, Sallam bin Miskin, Abu Al-Ashhab, and Hawshab bin Uqayl are all trustworthy (Thiqat), except that Mahdi seems more beloved to me; he is the sweetest of them to the heart. 301 - I heard my father say: Husayn bin Abd Al-Rahman Abu Al-Hudhayl Al-Sulami is the trustworthy, reliable one, from the senior People of Hadith. But Husayn bin Abd Al-Rahman Al-Harithi is not known. No one narrated from him other than Hajjaj bin Artah, and Isma'il bin Abi Khalid narrated one Hadith from him. His Hadiths are Manakir (rejected/objectionable); everything Hajjaj narrated from him is Munkar.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 302 - My father said: And Husayn bin Abd Al-Rahman, from whom Hafs bin Ghiyath narrated from Al-Sha'bi: I have not heard anyone narrate from him other than Hafs. Abu Abd Al-Rahman said: I was informed that he is the brother of Salim bin Abd Al-Rahman Al-Nakha'i. I did not hear this letter alone from my father. 303 - I heard my father say: And Husayn bin Abd Al-Rahman is Madini (from Medina); Muhammad bin Ishaq narrated from him. 304 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Zakariya bin Abi Za'idah told us, he said: Muhammad bin Ishaq told me, from Husayn bin Abd Al-Rahman. My father said: This one is Madini, from Mahmud bin Labid, from Ibn Shafi'—and he was a doctor—he said: I cut the sciatic vein (Irq al-Nasa) for Usayd bin Hudayr.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 305 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Zakariya bin Abi Za'idah told us, he said: Al-Hajjaj informed us, from Husayn bin Abd Al-Rahman—my father said: Meaning Al-Harithi Al-Kufi—from Amir, from Al-Harith, from Ali regarding the expiation for an oath. He said: 'He feeds them lunch and dinner: bread and meat, bread and ghee, bread and dates.' 306 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Zakariya bin Abi Za'idah told us, he said: Hajjaj bin Artah told us, from Husayn bin Abd Al-Rahman Al-Harithi, from Amir, from Al-Harith, from Ali, he said: 'A man was found in a breach (tunneling), but Ali did not cut (his hand).' 307 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Abd Al-Malik bin Humayd bin Abi Ghaniyah told us, he said: Isma'il bin Abi Khalid told us, from Husayn Al-Harithi, he said: Ali came to Zayd bin Arqam visiting him (when sick), and he had people with him. He said: I do not know if Ali said 'Listen' or 'Be silent.' 'By Allah, you will not ask me about anything until I stand up except that I will tell you about it.' He said: So Zayd said to him: 'I adjure you by Allah, did you kill Uthman?' He said: So Ali lowered his head for a while, then raised his head, then said: 'No, by the One who split the grain and created the soul, I did not kill him nor did I order his killing.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 308 - My father said: How good was the appearance of Yahya bin Abd Al-Malik bin Abi Ghaniyah! I said: 'What was good about his appearance?' He said: 'Perhaps I saw him wearing a patched garment.' 309 - My father told me, he said: Hafs bin Ghiyath told us, he said: Husayn bin Abd Al-Rahman told us. My father said: This is another man who is not known, and he is not one of those three. This is another man; no one narrated from him other than Hafs. He said: I heard Al-Sha'bi say: 'I do not know which we fasted more: thirty or twenty-nine.' 310 - Abu Abd Al-Rahman said: When my father was pleased with a person and considered him trustworthy, he would narrate from him while he was alive. So he narrated to us from Al-Hakam bin Musa while he was alive, and from Haytham bin Kharijah, Abu Al-Ahwos, Khalaf, and Shuja' while they were alive.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 311 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Abd Al-Malik bin Abi Ghaniyah told us, he said: I said to Amr bin Qays: 'O Abu Abdullah.' 312 - My father told me, from Affan, he said: Abu Jazi—and his name was Nasr bin Tarif—came to Jarir bin Hazim interceding for a person, so he narrated to him. Jarir said: Qatadah told us, from Anas, he said: 'The pommel of the sword of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, was of silver.' Abu Jazi said: 'He lied; by Allah, Qatadah did not narrate it to us except from Sa'id bin Abi Al-Hasan.' My father said: And it is the saying of Abu Jazi—meaning he was correct—and Jarir erred.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 313 - My father told me, he said: I heard Abd Al-Rahman bin Mahdi say: A man said to Sulayman bin Al-Mughirah: 'How did you hear these long Hadiths from Humayd?' He said: 'I used to wade through the mud for them.' 314 - I heard my father say: Muhammad bin Sirin heard from Abu Hurayrah in Medina. 315 - My father said: Abu Razin Mas'ud bin Malik. Al-A'mash, Asim, Isma'il bin Abi Khalid, and Isma'il bin Sami' narrated from him. He prayed behind Ali and was a righteous man. He is Abu Razin Al-Asadi. Shu'bah used to deny that he heard anything from Abdullah bin Mas'ud.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
316 - I heard my father say: Ghudayf bin Al-Harith is Abu Asma, and Abu Bahriyah is Abdullah bin Qays Al-Taraghumi.
317 - My father told me, saying: I heard Yahya bin Adam say: Sufyan narrated this Hadith from Hakim bin Jubayr—the Hadith of Ibn Mas'ud regarding begging: "Whoever asks [begs], will come [on Judgment Day] with scratches or lacerations on his face." Sufyan said to Abdullah bin Uthman—meaning the companion of Shu'bah, Abu Bistam—"Does he narrate from Hakim bin Jubayr?" Abdullah bin Uthman said: "No." So Sufyan said: "Zubayd Al-Iyami narrated it to us from Muhammad bin Abdur-Rahman." My father said: Shu'bah used not to narrate from Hakim bin Jubayr, and Abdur-Rahman used not to narrate to us from him; he abandoned his Hadith. And he is Abu Ja'far Al-Mada'ini; he is Ibn Miswar.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
318 - My father said: Yahya bin Sa'id said: I never wrote anything from Sufyan unless he said "He told me" (*haddathani*) or "He told us" (*haddathana*), except for two Hadiths. Then my father said: Yahya bin Sa'id told us from Sufyan from Simak from Ikrimah and Mughirah from Ibrahim: "Even if he was from a people who are enemies to you" [Quran 4:92]. They both said: He is the man who becomes Muslim in the Abode of War (*Dar al-Harb*) and is killed; there is no blood money (*Diyah*) for him, [only] expiation (*Kaffarah*).
319 - My father said: Amr bin Maymun is Abu Abdullah, Sa'd bin Malik is Abu Ishaq, Ka'b Al-Ahbar is Abu Ishaq, Uthman Al-Batti is Abu Amr, Salim bin Abi Hafsah is Abu Yunus, Amir bin Abdah's Kunya is Abu Iyas, and Al-Harith bin Suwayd is Abu Aisha.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text: 320 - My father told me, saying: Isma'il bin Ibrahim told us from Ayyub, who said: Ibn Abi Mulaykah mentioned visiting graves and [using certain] containers (*Al-Aw'iyah*). I said: "O Abu Bakr, who told you?" He said: "Abu Al-Zinad told me from some of the Kufans." My father said: And this Hadith is narrated by Rawh from Bistam bin Muslim from Ibn Abi Mulaykah from Aisha from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
321 - My father told me, saying: Abu Usamah told us, saying: Mufaddal told me from Mughirah, who said: I heard Al-Sha'bi say: "Al-Harith told me, and I bear witness that he is one of the liars."
322 - My father told me, saying: Abu Usamah told us from Mufaddal bin Muhalhal from Mughirah, who said: "No one corrupted the Hadith of Kufa except Abu Ishaq—meaning Al-Sabi'i—and Sulayman Al-A'mash."
323 - I heard my father say: A man came to Isma'il bin Ibrahim bin Ulayyah and narrated to him a Hadith from a man from Amr bin Shu'ayb from his father from his grandfather. He [the narrator] said: I said: "O Messenger of Allah, shall I write from you what I hear from you?" He said: "Yes." I said: "O Messenger of Allah, in contentment and in anger?" He said: "Yes, for it is not fitting that I say regarding that except the truth." Isma'il shook out his garment when that man narrated this Hadith to him and said: "I seek refuge in Allah from lying and its people," several times. My father said: Ibn Ulayyah used to follow the methodology (*Madhhab*) of the Basrans.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
324 - My father told me, saying: Isma'il bin Ibrahim told us from Ibn Awn from Muhammad that he used to dislike writing [Hadith].
325 - My father told me, saying: Isma'il told us, saying: Hammam told me from Zaid bin Aslam from Ata bin Yasar from Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace: "Do not write anything from me." This is its meaning.
326 - I heard my father say: The Hadith of Saif bin Muhammad, the nephew of Sufyan Al-Thawri, is not to be written. Saif is nothing [in terms of reliability], and Saif used to fabricate Hadith.
327 - I heard my father say: Sa'id bin Jubayr was a scribe for Abdullah bin Utbah.
328 - I heard my father say: Mis'ar bin Habib Al-Jarmi is a trustworthy Sheikh; Yazid bin Harun narrated from him.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
329 - I heard my father say: Abdullah bin Yunus is a trustworthy Sheikh; Yazid bin Harun narrated from him, from Abdullah bin Yunus from Sayyar Abu Al-Hakam.
330 - I heard my father say: Amr bin Khalid—meaning the one who narrates from Habib bin Abi Thabit from Asim bin Damrah from Ali that he prayed with the people while he was Junub (in a state of major ritual impurity), so he repeated [the prayer] and ordered them, so they repeated [it]. My father said: This Amr bin Khalid is nothing; he is *Matruk al-Hadith* (abandoned in Hadith).
331 - I asked my father: Which is more beloved to you regarding [narrating from] Khasif: Attab bin Bashir or Marwan bin Shuja'? He said: Attab bin Bashir, his Hadiths are *Manakir* (denounced) Hadiths. Marwan, people narrated from him; my father narrated to us from him, and [narrated] from Waki' from him.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
332 - I said to my father: The Hadith of Mansur from Thabit from Ali Al-Azdi: "Three [qualities], whoever has them is not arrogant." Who is this Thabit? He said: "I do not know."
333 - I said to him: Mansur from Kathir bin Mudrik Al-Ashja'i. He said: "Abu Malik Al-Ashja'i narrated from him."
334 - I heard my father say regarding the Hadith of Yahya from Sufyan from Qays bin Muslim from Ibrahim: "{And let them not expose their adornment}": My father said: Yahya bin Yaman erred; it is only from Alqamah bin Marthad from Ibrahim.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
335 - I heard my father say regarding the Hadith of Yahya bin Yaman from Sufyan from Abu Hashim Al-Wasiti from Tawus, who said: "Do not cut the head until the hide is cast [away]." I heard my father say: I consider him to be Abu Hashim Al-Makki, and I do not consider him to be Al-Wasiti.
336 - I heard my father say: Ubaydah bin Humayd is more correct in Hadith from Mansur than Al-Baka'i—meaning Ziyad.
337 - I heard my father say: Abdullah bin Yazid—meaning Al-Madini; he is called Ibn Fantas; Ibn Abi Dhi'b, Ali bin Thabit, Al-Thawri, and Abu Khalid Al-Ahmar narrated from him. I know nothing but good [about him]. His Hadith is *Muqarib* (approachable) Hadith—meaning Abdullah bin Yazid.
338 - I asked my father about a Sheikh whom 'Aththam bin Ali narrated from, called Sulayman Abu Umar, who narrated from Sa'id bin Jubayr. He said: "I do not know him."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
339 - I heard my father say: Abu Awn Muhammad bin Ubaydullah is more established and more trustworthy than Abdul-Malik bin Umayr.
340 - I asked my father about a Sheikh whom Mis'ar narrated from, Abu Alqamah, from Aisha: "Indeed Allah loves to be called upon like this"—and he pointed with his finger. He said: "I do not know [him]."
341 - My father told me, saying: Yahya bin Adam told us, saying: Abu Bakr bin Ayyash told us from Asim bin Abi Al-Najud, who said: Thawb bin Taldah Al-Walibi from Banu Asad said: "I overtook three 'Walbahs' [generations of Walibah]." He said: And he had reached two hundred and forty years of age. He says: "Every eighty years is a generation (*Qarn*) of Banu Walibah."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
342 - I asked my father about Bishr bin Harb, and I said: "Is his Hadith relied upon?" He said: "He is not among those whose Hadith is abandoned."
343 - I heard my father say: Abdul-Hamid, the companion of Al-Ziyadi, is Abdul-Hamid bin Kardid.
344 - My father said: Shu'bah said: "I used to desire to hear from Abu Sufyan bin Al-Ala—meaning the Hadith of Ibn Mughaffal from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace: 'Were it not that dogs are a nation among nations, I would have commanded killing them'—because Al-Hasan heard from Ibn Mughaffal."
345 - My father told me, saying: Waki' told us from Abu Sufyan bin Al-Ala, who said: I heard Al-Hasan narrating that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "Were it not that dogs are a nation among nations, I would have commanded killing them; so kill every pure black one." A man said to him: "O Abu Sa'id, from whom did you hear this?" He said: "Abdullah bin Mughaffal told it to me"—then he swore—"from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, since such-and-such [time], and he narrated to us in that gathering."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
346 - I asked my father: Which of them is more knowledgeable in Fiqh: Al-Hakam or Hammad? He said: Al-Hakam is more beloved to us, and he is more knowledgeable in Fiqh. Then he said: Al-Hakam saw Zaid bin Arqam and Abu Juhayfah.
347 - Abdullah told us, saying: Muhammad bin Salam Al-Jumahi told me, saying: I heard Hammad bin Salamah reading "*Al-Shajan*" (sadness/grief).
348 - I heard my father say: Sharik spoke about Abu Ishaq and said: "He was established (*Thabt*) in it." Sharik said: A person said to him: "How abundant is your Hadith from Abu Ishaq!" He said: "I wish I had written his [very] breath/soul." And he used to regret [missing out on more of] him.
349 - I heard my father say: Sulayman bin Kathir is Abu Dawud, and he is the brother of Muhammad bin Kathir.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
350 - My father told me, saying: Hajjaj bin Muhammad told us, saying: I asked Ibn Shubrumah about the Takbir on the day of Fitr (Eid) while I do not hear the Imam. He said: "Seek out [try to synchronize with] the Takbir of the Imam."
351 - My father told me, saying: Hajjaj said: I saw Ibn Shubrumah, and I saw Yahya bin Sa'id Al-Ansari.
352 - My father told me, saying: Hajjaj told us, saying: I asked Ibn Shubrumah.
353 - I heard my father say: Raja' bin Haywah is Abu Al-Miqdam, Nawf Al-Bikali is Abu Yazid, Abdul-Khaliq bin Salamah is Abu Ruh, Isa bin Dinar is Abu Ali, and Al-Qasim bin Muhammad is Abu Abdur-Rahman.
354 - I heard my father say: Abu Al-Nadr said: "I was born in the year one hundred and thirty-four."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
355 - My father told me, saying: Yahya bin Adam told us, saying: Abu Bakr Al-Nahshali told us from Hammad, who said: "I never saw anyone ever who had more ready analogy (*Mikyas*) than Ibrahim."
356 - My father told me, saying: Ibn Mahdi told us from Sufyan, who said: I said to Al-A'mash: "The Hadith of the hazelnut (*Bunduqah*) is not from your Hadith." He said: "What could I do? They did not leave me be; they said that Shu'bah narrated it from you."
357 - I heard my father say: Salam bin Abi Muti' is among the trustworthy (*Thiqat*); Ibn Mahdi narrated to us from him. Then my father said: Abu Awanah had compiled a book containing the faults of the Companions of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and in it were calamities. So Salam bin Abi Muti' came and said: "O Abu Awanah, give me that book." So he gave it to him, and Salam took it and burned it. My father said: Salam was from the companions of Ayyub, and he was a righteous man.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
358 - I heard my father say: Umar bin Muhammad bin Zaid bin Abdullah bin Umar bin Al-Khattab is a trustworthy Sheikh, there is no harm in him. Sufyan Al-Thawri and Isma'il—meaning Ibn Ulayyah—narrated from him.
359 - My father told me, saying: Abu Al-Yaman told us, saying: Isma'il bin Ayyash told us from Muhammad bin Ziyad Al-Alhani from Abu Inabah Al-Khawlani, who said: "I let my hair grow long to cut it for an idol we had in the Pre-Islamic period (*Jahiliyyah*), but Allah delayed that until I cut it in Islam."
360 - My father told me, saying: Muhammad bin Ja'far told us, saying: Shu'bah told us from Sulayman—meaning Al-A'mash—who said: I heard Abu Al-Duha narrating from Masruq, who said: "Do not spread your cloth/goods except with one who seeks it." My father said: He means Hadith.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
361 - My father told me, saying: Abdur-Razzaq told us, saying: Ma'mar informed us from Asim—meaning Ibn Sulayman Al-Ahwal—who said: I heard Abu Al-Aliyah say: "You perform more prayer and fasting than those who were before you, but lying has run upon your tongues."
362 - My father told me, saying: Hushaym told us, saying: A Sheikh from the people of Khurasan whose Kunya is Abu Sasan informed us, saying: I asked Al-Dahhak. My father said: Abu Sasan is Mushash, whom Shu'bah narrated from.
363 - I said to my father: "How much did Hushaym hear from Jabir Al-Ju'fi?" He said: "Two Hadiths." I said: "Then the rest?" He said: "Mudallasah (obfuscated/hidden source)."
364 - I said to my father: "The Hadiths of Al-A'mash from Mujahid, from whom are they?" He said: Abu Bakr bin Ayyash said: A man said to Al-A'mash regarding something he narrated from Mujahid: "From whom did you hear it?" He said: "*Mar Kazaz Mar*" [meaning "A draper passed by"], "Layth narrated it to me from Mujahid."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
365 - I heard my father say: Abu Ayyub Abdullah bin Abi Sulayman, the Mawla of Uthman bin Affan, his Hadith is *Muqarib* (approachable) Hadith. Hammad bin Salamah and Ishaq bin Uthman Al-Kilabi narrated from him.
366 - I heard my father say: Abdullah bin Muslim bin Hurmuz—Al-Thawri narrates from him—is weak in Hadith, he is nothing.
367 - I asked my father, I said: "Is the Hadith of Samurah from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, 'Whoever leaves the Friday prayer owes a Dinar or half a Dinar to give in charity,' authentic?" He said: "Qudamah bin Wabrah narrates it, and he is not known. Ayyub Abu Al-Ala narrated it but did not connect its chain as Hammam connected it. He [Ayyub] said: 'Half a Dirham or a Dirham.' He opposed him in the ruling and fell short in the chain of narration."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
368 - My father told me, saying: Waki' told us from Sufyan from Simak bin Harb from Tamim bin Tarfah that two men laid claim to a she-camel. Each of them established proof that it was his she-camel. So they disputed before the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, judged that it be [divided] between them by halves.
369 - My father told me, saying: Abdus-Samad told us, saying: Hammam told us, saying: Qatadah told us from Sa'id bin Abi Burdah from his father that two men laid claim to a camel. Each of them established proof with two witnesses. So the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, divided it between them.
370 - My father told me, saying: Muhammad bin Ja'far told us, saying: Sa'id told us from Qatadah from Sa'id bin Abi Burdah from Abu Burdah from his father that two men disputed before the Prophet of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, regarding an animal, and neither of them had proof. So he made it between them by halves.
371 - My father told me, saying: Abu Kamil Muzaffar bin Mudrik told us, saying: Hammad—meaning Ibn Salamah—told us from Qatadah from Al-Nadr bin Anas from Abu Burdah bin Abi Musa that two men laid claim to an animal they found with a man. Each of them established two witnesses that it was his animal. So the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, judged it [to be divided] between them. Hammad said: Simak bin Harb said to me: "I narrated this Hadith to Abu Burdah."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
372 - My father told me, saying: Ibrahim bin Sa'd bin Ibrahim bin Abdur-Rahman bin Awf told us, saying: My father told me from his father, who said: Umar said to Abu Dharr, Abdullah, and Abu Darda: "What is this Hadith that you narrate from Muhammad?" He said: And I think he said: He detained them with him.
373 - My father told me, saying: Ibrahim bin Sa'd told us, saying: My father told me from Al-Sha'bi—Ibrahim said: And I did not hear my father narrate from Al-Sha'bi except this—from Ka'b bin Qarazah or Amr bin Qarazah (the doubt is from Ibrahim bin Sa'd), who said: We came to Umar bin Al-Khattab in a delegation from the people of Kufa. He said: So he fulfilled for us what he fulfilled of our needs. Until when we bade him farewell and left, Umar caught up with us, calling out, hanging his sandals in his hands. He said: When we saw him, we stopped for him. Until when he came, he said: "I remembered that you are arriving tomorrow upon a people..." My father said: Ibrahim spoke words I did not understand... "So minimize narration from the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and I am your partner."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
374 - My father told me, saying: Ibrahim bin Sa'd told us, saying: Ibn Ishaq told me from Abdullah bin Abi Bakr, who said: Just as that happened, he said to them: "You will surely leave this [excessive] Hadith [narration], or else I will surely separate from you / exile you."
375 - My father told me, saying: 'Arim bin Al-Fadl Abu Al-Nu'man told us, saying: I heard Hammad bin Zaid say: I heard Hisham bin Urwah—and he mentioned the Hadith: "The fugitive slave is cut"—he said: "I did not hear it from my father, but the just, the pleasing, the trustworthy over what is absent from him narrated it to me: Yahya bin Sa'id Al-Ansari."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
376 - My father told me, saying: 'Arim bin Al-Fadl told us, saying: I heard Abu Al-Aswad—meaning Humayd bin Al-Aswad—say: I mentioned to Malik bin Anas the Hadith of Abu Hamas regarding goods being subject to Zakat, from Yahya bin Sa'id Al-Ansari. So he [Malik] said: "Yahya is a collector (*Qammash*)."
377 - My father told me, saying: Musa bin Dawud told us, saying: Amatullah, the Mawla of Tawus, told me, saying: I saw Layth bin Abi Sulaym writing in the presence of Tawus on large tablets while he [Tawus] was dictating to him.
378 - My father told me, saying: Mu'ammal bin Isma'il told us, saying: I heard Hammad bin Zaid narrating, saying: Ayyub said: "Abu Uthman—meaning Al-Nahdi—was a friend of mine, and I do not memorize from him other than these two Hadiths"—meaning the Hadith of Abu Musa: "We were with the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, on a journey, and whenever they ascended or descended, they raised their voices with Tahlil," and the Hadith of Abu Musa: "The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, entered a garden," in the story of Al-Quff.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 379 - My father told me, he said: Mu'ammal told us, he said: Hammad bin Zayd told us, and he mentioned a Hadith, saying: I used to ask Yunus bin Ubayd in the gathering of Ayyub, and he would gesture with his hand like this and place his hand over his mouth. And my father placed his hand over his mouth. 380 - My father told me, from Qurad Abu Nuh, he said: I used to come to Abdullah bin Uthman—meaning the companion of Shu'bah—and write the Hadith of Shu'bah. Then I would come to Shu'bah and ask him, and he would narrate to me just as he dictated to me. Then my father said: Abu Al-Nadr told us from his father Uthman.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 381 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, from Abdullah bin Uthman, from Al-Akhdar bin Ajlan, from Abu Bakr Al-Hanafi, from Anas that the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, sold a cup and a saddle blanket to the highest bidder. 382 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Sa'id and Mu'tamir told us, from Akhdar, the like of it. 383 - My father told me, he said: Zayd bin Hubab told us, from Abu Yazid Al-Fadl, he said: I saw Abu Sufyan Sa'id bin Masruq bin Habib bin Rafi' praying in the arch (Mihrab).

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 384 - My father told me, he said: Zayd bin Hubab told us, he said: Rabi'ah bin Kulthum informed me, he said: Sa'id bin Jubayr kissed me while I was a small boy. 385 - I heard my father say: Abd Al-Rahman bin Harmalah, his Kunya is Abu Harmalah. And Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib, his Kunya is Abu Muhammad. 386 - My father told me, he said: Mu'adh bin Mu'adh Al-Anbari told us, he said: Sulayman Al-Taymi told us, from Abdullah Al-Dana. My father said: Some of them said Al-Danaj, and Al-Dana and Al-Danaj are one. And my father said: Abu Mu'awiyah told us, from Hajjaj bin Abi Uthman Al-Sawwaf, from Abdullah Al-Danaq. 387 - My father said: Abdullah bin Unays is Abu Yahya. 388 - My father told me, he said: Yazid bin Abd Rabbih told us, he said: Our companions told us, from Abu Mansur, from Amr bin Qays—meaning the one whom Isma'il bin Ayyash narrates from, and he is Al-Sakuni—that Al-Hajjaj bin Yusuf asked him about his birth. He said: The Year of the Congregation (Al-Jama'ah), the year forty. Al-Hajjaj said: That is my birth [year]. Abu Mansur said: Amr bin Qays died in the year one hundred and forty. My father said: Amr bin Qays died while he was a hundred years old.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 389 - My father told me, from Affan, he said: Hammad bin Zayd might say to me: 'How did Abu Salamah—meaning Hammad bin Salamah—say in the Hadith of Ayyub?' Because they used to differ with him. My father said: Hammad bin Zayd did not care if Al-Thaqafi and Wuhib differed with him, but he used to respect or fear Isma'il bin Ulayyah if he differed with him. 390 - My father said: Abd Al-Rahman bin Abi Nu'm is Abu Al-Hakam Al-Bajali. 391 - My father told me, from Yahya bin Sa'id, he said: I saw with him—meaning Sufyan Al-Thawri—tablets [containing narrations] from Ibn Jurayj.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 392 - My father told me, he said: Affan and Bahz told us, they said: Hammam told us, he said: Qatadah informed us. Affan said in his Hadith: Sharik bin Khalifah told me. Bahz said in his Hadith: And he was from the Azariqah. He said: I asked Abdullah bin Amr: 'Can I eat while I am Junub (ritually impure)?' He said: 'Perform your Wudu for prayer, then eat.' Affan said: I said to Yahya: 'Hisham and Sa'id erred, and Hammam was correct.' He said: 'How, O madman?' I said: 'Sa'id agreed with Hammam regarding Abdullah bin Amr, and Hisham agreed with Hammam regarding Sharik.' My father said: And Sa'id bin Abi Arubah said from Qatadah from Abu Ayyub from Abdullah bin Amr. And Hisham said from Sharik bin Khalifah from Ibn Umar regarding the Junub washing his head. 393 - I heard my father say: Whoever's Kunya among the Companions of the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, is Abu Abd Al-Rahman: Abdullah bin Mas'ud is Abu Abd Al-Rahman. Mu'adh bin Jabal is Abu Abd Al-Rahman. Abdullah bin Umar is Abu Abd Al-Rahman. Abdullah bin Amr is Abu Abd Al-Rahman—and they say Abu Muhammad. Fayruz bin Al-Daylami is Abu Abd Al-Rahman. Safinah is Abu Abd Al-Rahman. And Mu'awiyah bin Abi Sufyan is Abu Abd Al-Rahman.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 394 - My father told me, he said: Bahz bin Asad Abu Al-Aswad Al-Ammi told us, he said: We stopped Abu Al-Ashhab, so he stopped for us and said: Al-Hasan told us. My father said: Affan said: Bahz only came with us to Abu Al-Ashhab for one or two sessions. 395 - I heard my father say: Ubayd Al-Muktib is Ubayd bin Mihran. 396 - My father told me, from Abd Al-Rahman bin Mahdi, he said: When we stopped Abu Al-Ashhab, we would say to him: 'Say: I heard Al-Hasan.' He would say: 'I heard Al-Hasan or someone else.' 397 - My father said: Abu Ubaydah Al-Haddad said: I wrote for Abu Hurrah his Hadith 'I heard Al-Hasan' or 'Al-Hasan told us'. He [Abu Hurrah] said: 'I did not say this; I say this.' He said: So he did not say in anything 'I heard Al-Hasan' except in three things.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 398 - I heard my father say: It was a habit of Jarir bin Hazim to say 'Al-Hasan told us, he said: Amr bin Taghlib told us.' While Abu Al-Ashhab says: 'From Al-Hasan, he said: It reached me that the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, said to Amr bin Taghlib.' 399 - I heard my father say: Yahya bin Sa'id said: Sufyan Al-Thawri said: 'And what did I narrate to you from Abu Ishaq? I did not narrate to you anything except what my heart clung to.' 400 - My father said: Yahya said: Sufyan said to me: 'Go out to Kufa so you can bring my books, so I can narrate them to you.' He said: So Yahya bin Sa'id refused him. 401 - My father said: Rifa'ah bin Shaddad's Kunya is Abu Asim. 402 - My father said: I heard Abd Al-Rahman bin Mahdi say: Hisham Al-Dastawa'i said: 'If I were to testify to the striking of Qatadah's neck, it would be permissible'—meaning regarding Hadith, as if he had verified it.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 403 - My father said: Isma'il bin Ulayyah said: Al-Taymi used to say 'From Abu Murayyah', and Qatadah used to say 'From Abu Murayah'. 404 - My father told me, from Hasan Al-Ashyab, from a man in Sham whose origin was Basri, Abbas—and he is not Abbas Al-Ansari—from Hammad bin Salamah, he said: Ayyub said: 'Let them bring the likes of our young man, Hammad bin Salamah.' 405 - I heard my father say: They are three brothers: Salim bin Abi Al-Ja'd, Ubayd bin Abi Al-Ja'd, and Ziyad bin Abi Al-Ja'd. They are from Ashja'. And Yazid bin Ziyad bin Abi Al-Ja'd is a trustworthy Sheikh, and he is their nephew. 406 - My father told me, he said: Sufyan bin Uyaynah told us, he said: Sulayman bin Abi Al-Mughirah Abu Abdullah told me; he is trustworthy and excellent. 407 - My father told me, he said: Sufyan told me, he said: I heard three Hadiths from him: From Amr bin Yahya bin Umarah bin Abi Hasan Al-Mazini.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 408 - My father told me, he said: Hamid bin Yahya Al-Balkhi told us, he said: Hasan bin Muhammad bin Ubaydullah bin Abi Yazid told us, he said: This is a recitation I took from Shibl bin Abbad. And Shibl bin Abbad recited to Muhammad bin Abdullah bin Muhaysin and to Abdullah bin Kathir Al-Dari Al-Makki. They mentioned that they presented [recited] to Dirbas, the freed slave of Ibn Abbas. And Dirbas recited to Abdullah bin Abbas. And Abdullah bin Abbas recited to the Companions of the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him. 409 - My father told me, from Abd Al-Rahman bin Mahdi, he said: We were in Mecca discussing Hadith. While we were like that, a person entered among us and heard our conversation. We said to him: 'Who are you?' He said: 'I am Mu'awiyah bin Salih.' He said: So we surrounded him. My father said: Waki' said: Shu'bah said the like of it: 'He is nothing [in Hadith].'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 410 - Abdullah told us, he said: Amr bin Muhammad Al-Naqid told us, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Shu'bah said the like of it: 'He does not suffice.' And Sufyan said: 'He suffices.' 411 - My father told me, he said: Muhammad bin Sawa' told us, he said: Shu'bah came to Awf and began asking him: 'Did you see Qatadah with Khilas?' 412 - My father told me, he said: Mu'ammal bin Isma'il told us, he said: Hammad—meaning Ibn Salamah—told us, he said: I heard Simak say: My eyesight went, so I saw Ibrahim, the Friend of the Most Merciful (Abraham), in a dream. He wiped his hand over my eye and said to me: 'Go to the Euphrates and immerse yourself in it, and open your eyes in the water.' I did so, and Allah returned my eyesight to me. 413 - My father told me, he said: Mu'ammal told us, he said: Hammad—meaning Ibn Salamah—told us, he said: I heard Simak say: 'I saw'—or he said—'I met eighty of the Companions of the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 414 - My father told me, he said: Sulayman bin Dawud told us, he said: Shu'bah informed us, from Mansur bin Abd Al-Rahman Al-Ghudani, he said: I heard Al-Sha'bi say: I caught up with more than five hundred of the Companions of the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him. They said: 'Indeed, Uthman, Ali, Talhah, and Al-Zubayr are in Paradise.' 415 - My father told me, he said: Hajjaj told us, he said: Ibn Jurayj said: Wahb bin Sulayman informed me, from Shu'ayb Al-Jaba'i: That the name of the mother of Yahya is Al-Ashba'. 416 - My father told me, he said: Hajjaj told us, he said: Ibn Jurayj informed us, from Wahb bin Sulayman, from Shu'ayb Al-Jaba'i: That the name of the Mountain of the Cave is Banajlus, and the name of the Cave is Hayram, and the dog is Humran. 417 - My father told me, he said: Hajjaj told us, from Ibn Jurayj, he said: I was told from Ikrimah that the name of the mother of Maryam is Hannah.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 418 - Abdullah told us, he said: Ahmad bin Ibrahim Al-Dawraqi told me, he said: Hajjaj told us, from Ibn Jurayj, he said: Wahb bin Sulayman informed me, from Shu'ayb Al-Jaba'i: That the names of the magicians who said to Pharaoh 'Decide whatever you are deciding; you only decide this worldly life' were Satur, 'Azunum, Hathat, and Musaffa. 419 - My father told me, he said: I heard Sahl bin Hassan bin Abi Khaduwayh say: Abu Qilabah said: My two friends from the people of Basra are a tanner and a shoemaker. My father said: The shoemaker is Khalid, and the tanner is Ayyub Al-Sakhtiyani. 420 - My father told me, he said: Abd Al-Razzaq told us, he said: I was born in the year one hundred and twenty-six. We used to present [recite] first, then the stranger would come and we would listen to the thing until we had finished listening. And Abdullah—meaning Ibn Al-Mubarak—used to read the Tafsir to him, and Ma'mar used to read to him. 421 - My father said: And Abdullah bin Mutarrif, his Kunya is Abu Jazi.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 422 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Ibrahim bin Khalid Al-Mu'adhdhin Al-San'ani told us, he said: Rabah told me, he said: Al-Nu'man bin Ubayd told me, from Wahb bin Sulayman, from Shu'ayb Al-Jaba'i, he said: If the water of the earth had not preceded the water of the sky by forty days, the water of the sky, when it came from the sky like mountains with the anger of Allah, would have destroyed the water of the earth, crushed the mountains, and furrowed the earth with furrows that would never be inhabited. But the gates of the sky were opened, and the water of the sky came, and the earth was a sea.
