So Noah, peace be upon him, remained in the Ark from the time he embarked on it until it was said: 'O earth, swallow your water, and O sky, withhold,' for six months and some days. Then it began to recede for forty days. Then Noah landed on Judi. The Ark had performed Hajj with Noah; it stood with him at the standing of Arafah, then it moved with him just as the pilgrim moves, then it spent the night at Muzdalifah, then it moved on, then it began to stand with him at the Jamarat, then it poured forth with him to the House (Kaaba) and circumambulated it seven times, and went between Safa and Marwa seven times. The water rose above the tallest mountain on earth a distance of five months journey upwards. Ma'mar claimed that the water rose above everything by fifteen cubits—or he said fathoms. Rabah said: It reached me that the tree from which Noah made the Ark sprouted when Noah was born; its length was three hundred cubits and its width eighty or sixty cubits. Ma'mar said: Judi is in Al-Jazirah.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 423 - Abdullah told us, he said: Muhammad bin Qudamah Al-Jawhari told us, he said: Hajjaj told us, he said: Ibn Jurayj informed us, from Wahb bin Sulayman, from Shu'ayb Al-Jaba'i, he said: The name of the boy whom Al-Khidr killed was Jaysur. He said: And the name of the one who used to seize every ship by force was Hudad bin Budad. He said: And the name of the one who raced the sun but did not beat it except by a stone's throw was 'Ajj bin Ba'r. 424 - Abdullah told us, he said: Muhammad bin Qudamah Al-Jawhari told me, he said: Shababah told us, he said: Warqa' told us, from Ibn Najih, from Mujahid regarding His saying, Almighty and Glorious: 'Have you not seen the one who argued with Abraham about his Lord?' He said: Nimrod bin Canaan. 425 - Abdullah told us, he said: Ahmad bin Ibrahim Al-Dawraqi told us, he said: Hajjaj bin Muhammad told us, from Ibn Jurayj, he said: Wahb bin Sulayman informed me, from Shu'ayb Al-Jaba'i, he said: Isaac was slaughtered when he was nine years old. Sarah gave birth to him when she was ninety years old. His place of slaughter was two miles from Bayt Iliya (Jerusalem). When Sarah knew what was intended for Isaac, she became sick (Batunat) for two days and died on the third day. 'Batunat' means she was afflicted with abdominal illness.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 426 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Rawh bin Ubadah told us, he said: Ibn Jurayj told us, he said: Wahb—meaning Ibn Sulayman—informed me, from Shu'ayb Al-Jaba'i, he said: The name that was on the ring of Solomon son of David, peace be upon him, was 'Yahya Shariya', and it is one name. Shu'ayb said: It is one of the Greatest Names, and by it Solomon controlled the Jinn and mankind. 427 - Whoever heard Hajjaj from Ibn Jurayj told me, he said: Wahb bin Sulayman informed me, from Shu'ayb Al-Jaba'i: That the name of the boy whom Al-Khidr killed was Jaysur. 428 - Whoever heard Hisham bin Yusuf in the Tafsir of Ibn Jurayj told me: Ya'la bin Muslim and Amr bin Dinar informed me, from Sa'id bin Jubayr—and he used to recite it: 'And there was behind them'—and Ibn Abbas used to recite it: 'And there was in front of them a king.' The murdered boy, they claim his name was Jaysur.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 429 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Ibrahim bin Khalid told us, he said: Rabah told us, he said: I was told from Wahb bin Sulayman, from Shu'ayb Al-Jaba'i, he said: The name of the believer from the family of Pharaoh was Sam'an. 430 - I found in my father's book: Ibrahim bin Khalid told us, he said: Rabah told us, he said: I was told from Shu'ayb Al-Jaba'i, he said: The tree which Allah forbade Adam, peace be upon him, and his wife [from eating] resembled wheat; its name was Al-Da'ah. 431 - Abdullah told us, he said: Sufyan bin Waki' and Abu Ma'mar told me, they said: Sufyan bin Uyaynah told us, from Ali bin Zayd bin Jud'an, from Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib, from Sa'd—meaning Ibn Abi Waqqas—he said: I said: 'O Messenger of Allah, who am I?' He said: 'You are Sa'd bin Malik bin Ahyab bin Abd Manaf bin Zuhrah. Whoever says other than this, upon him is the curse of Allah.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 432 - Abdullah told us, he said: Sufyan bin Waki' told me, he said: My father told us, from Sharik, from Uthman bin Mawhab, from Abu Hurayrah, he said: He was asked: 'Did the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, dye his hair?' He said: 'Yes.' 433 - Abdullah told us, he said: Sufyan bin Waki' told me, he said: Yunus bin Bukayr told us, he said: Muhammad bin Ishaq told us, he said: Muhammad bin Ibrahim told me, from Malik bin Abi Amir, he said: I was with Talhah bin Ubaydullah, so he said: 'Abu Hurayrah was a poor man who stuck to the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, eating with him. By Allah, I do not doubt that he heard what we did not hear, and you will not find anyone in whom there is good who lies against the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 434 - Abdullah told us, he said: Sufyan bin Waki' told me, he said: Ibn Uyaynah told us, from Abu Ishaq, he said: A man said to Masruq: 'Indeed I love you for the sake of Allah.' He said: 'You have loved Allah, so you loved the one who loves Allah.' 435 - Abdullah told us, he said: Sufyan told me, he said: Hafs bin Ghiyath told us, from Al-A'mash, from Ibrahim, he said: Abd Al-Rahman bin Yazid did not use to do anything except with an intention, even if he was drinking water, [he did it] with an intention. 436 - Abdullah told us, he said: Sufyan bin Waki' told me, he said: Hafs bin Ghiyath told us, from Al-A'mash, from Ibrahim, from Abd Al-Rahman bin Yazid: That he used to accompany the weaker of the two groups in the battle. 437 - Abdullah told us, he said: Sufyan bin Waki' told me, he said: My father told us, from his father, from Al-Hazhaz bin Mayzan, he said: I saw Adi bin Faras; his tongue did not become big in his mouth so that he became arrogant, nor did it become small so that he became rash.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 438 - Abdullah told us, he said: Sufyan told me, he said: My father told us, from his father, from Al-Hazhaz, he said: Adi bin Faras heard two men from the tribe mentioning him with something disliked. He said: So he went out for the Asr prayer, and he was in Itikaf. He said: 'I heard your speech just now. Stand up and ask Allah for forgiveness for what you said and perform ablution.' 439 - I heard my father say: Waki' bin Al-Jarrah bin Malih bin Adi bin Faras Al-Ru'asi Abu Sufyan. 440 - Abdullah told us, he said: Sufyan bin Waki' told me, he said: Ibn Uyaynah told us, from Al-Majishun, he said: Umar bin Abd Al-Aziz spoke to Al-Walid, so he said to him: 'You lied.' So Umar said to him: 'I have not lied since I knew that lying harms its people.' 441 - Abdullah told us, he said: Sufyan and Ibrahim bin Dinar told me, they said: Muhammad bin Fudayl told us, from Isma'il bin Abi Khalid, from Abu Juhayfah, he said: We came to the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, and he ordered twelve young she-camels for us. We went to take them, but his death came to us. Isma'il said: I said to Abu Juhayfah: 'Describe him to me.' He said: 'He was white with streaks of grey hair.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 442 - My father told me, he said: Muhammad bin Ubayd told us, he said: I heard Al-A'mash say: I used to pass by Qays bin Abi Hazim while I was going back and forth to Zayd bin Wahb. 443 - My father told me, he said: Al-Nadr bin Isma'il bin Hazim Abu Al-Mughirah told us, he said: I heard Ibn Abi Layla say: A boy loses his milk teeth at seven, reaches puberty at fourteen, his height stops at twenty-one, and his intellect is completed at twenty-eight; he does not increase in intellect except through experiences. 444 - My father told me, he said: Muhammad bin Al-Sammak Abu Al-Abbas told us, from a Sheikh, from Malik bin Dinar, he said: Pride is closer to the wearer of the cloak than it is to the wearer of the shirt.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
445 - My father told me, saying: Muhammad bin Al-Sammak Abu Al-Abbas told us, saying: I saw Sufyan Al-Thawri drinking from a silver-inlaid cup.
446 - My father told me, saying: Qabisah Abu 'Amir told us, saying: Sufyan told us from Habib, who said: Tawus said to me: "If I narrate a Hadith to you and I have established it for you, do not ask anyone else about it."
447 - My father told me, saying: Qabisah told us, saying: Sufyan bin Sa'id told us from Abdullah bin Abi Al-Safar from Al-Sha'bi, who said: "I am not a scholar, and I do not leave a scholar [without benefiting from him?]. Indeed, Abu Husayn is a righteous man."
448 - My father told me, saying: Qabisah told us, saying: Sufyan told us from Abdullah bin Al-Sa'ib from Zadhan, who said: "I asked Abdullah bin Mas'ud about things that no one asks me about."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
449 - My father told me, saying: Qabisah told us, saying: Sufyan told us from Al-A'mash from Abu Wa'il, who said: "I do not equate anyone with him," meaning Abdullah bin Mas'ud.
450 - My father told me, saying: Jabir bin Sulaym Al-Ansari told us, saying: I heard Jurm bin Abi Rashid from Ibn Abi 'Atiq from Abdullah bin Amr, who said: "If a man narrates a Hadith to you and puts something forward or backward [in order], he has fulfilled his duty."
451 - My father told me, saying: Yahya bin Sa'id Al-Qattan told us, saying: Sufyan—meaning Al-Thawri—wrote to the Commander of the Faithful: "It used to be said: The living should be envied for what the dead are envied for."
452 - My father told me, saying: Yahya bin Sa'id told us, saying: Sufyan dictated to Shu'bah, saying: I heard 'Amr bin Murrah [narrate] the Hadith of supplication.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
453 - My father told me, saying: Abdur-Rahman bin Mahdi told us from Sufyan Al-Thawri, who said: It was said to Al-Sha'bi: "Who will remain after you?" [He said]: "I am not a Faqih, and I do not leave behind a Faqih. Indeed, Uthman bin Asim is a righteous man."
454 - My father told me, saying: Abdur-Rahman bin Mahdi told us, saying: Malik bin Mighwal said: Al-Sha'bi said to me: "What they narrate to you from the Companions of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, take it. And what they narrate to you from their own opinion, throw it in the latrine."
455 - My father told me, saying: Ya'qub bin Ibrahim bin Sa'd told us, saying: My father told us from Ibn Ishaq, who said: Abdullah bin Abi Bakr bin Muhammad told me from 'Amrah bint Abdur-Rahman from Aisha, who said: "Ibrahim, the son of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, died when he was eighteen months old."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
456 - My father told me, saying: Miskin bin Bukayr told us, saying: Shu'bah informed us from 'Amr bin Murrah, who said: I said to Abu Ubaydah: "Do you remember anything from your father?" He said: "No." I said: "Did Ibn Mas'ud witness the Night of the Jinn?" He said: "No."
457 - My father told me, saying: Muhammad bin Ja'far Al-Mada'ini told us, saying: Shu'bah informed us, saying: I asked Al-Hakam about the blood money (*Diyah*) of a Jew and a Christian. He said: Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib said: Umar set the blood money of a Jew and a Christian at four thousand—four thousand dirhams—and he set the blood money of a Magian at eight hundred. I said to Al-Hakam: "Did you hear it from Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib?" He said: "If I wished, I could have heard it. I heard it from Thabit Al-Haddad." Shu'bah said: So I went to Thabit Al-Haddad, and he informed me of it from Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib from Umar bin Al-Khattab with the like of it.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text: 458 - Abdullah told us, saying: Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaybah told me, saying: Sharik told us from Yahya bin Sa'id from Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib from Umar: "The blood money of a Jew and a Christian is four thousand, and the Magian is eight hundred." I narrated this to my father, and he denied that it was from the Hadith of Yahya bin Sa'id. He said: "This is the Hadith of Thabit Al-Haddad; Al-Hakam narrated it from him." And he denied that this was from the Hadith of Yahya bin Sa'id. My father said: "And Qatadah narrated it from Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
459 - My father told me, saying: It was said to Hushaym: "And Zirr bin Hubaysh?" He said: "One hundred and twenty-two years." It was said to him: "And Suwayd bin Ghaflah?" He said: "One hundred and twenty-eight." It was said to him: "Who mentioned it?" He said: "Isma'il bin Abi Khalid."
460 - Abdullah told us, saying: I heard Muhammad bin Salam Al-Jumahi say: Khalid Al-Rasiti said: Khalid Al-Hadhdha' said: "I never made a sandal ever, but I married a woman from Banu Mujashi' among the sandal-makers (*Hadhdha'in*), so I was attributed to them."
461 - My father told me, saying: Ali bin Hafs Al-Mada'ini told us, saying: Shu'bah informed us from Mujalid bin Sa'id, who said: I heard Al-Sha'bi say to Isma'il bin Abi Khalid: "Why do you ask about this? Do you have no estate (*Day'ah*) [to occupy you]?" He said: "I ask as I used to ask." Al-Sha'bi said: "I wish I had not asked about any of this."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
462 - My father told me, saying: Umayyah bin Khalid told us, saying: I said to Shu'bah: "Abu Shaybah told us from Al-Hakam from Abdur-Rahman bin Abi Layla that he said: Seventy men from the people of Badr witnessed Siffin." He said: "He lied, by Allah. I discussed that with Al-Hakam, and we mentioned it in his house, and we did not find that anyone from the people of Badr witnessed Siffin except Khuzaimah bin Thabit."
463 - My father told me, saying: Abu Qutaybah told us, saying: Hammad bin Zaid told us, saying: I witnessed Jarir—meaning Ibn Hazim—reading to Ayyub books from the books of Abu Qilabah. Ayyub said: "Some of it I heard from Abu Qilabah, and some of it I did not hear from Abu Qilabah." And among what he read to him was: "From the Servant of Allah, Umar, Commander of the Faithful, to Abdullah bin Qays Abu Musa. As to what follows: Whoever comes to you from the wicked strippers (*Al-Jarradin*) encroaching upon the people without an order from me, imprison him in irons until my command comes to you regarding him."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
464 - My father dictated to me, saying: This is the naming of those who narrated from Umar bin Al-Khattab from the people of Mecca: Ya'la bin Umayyah, Abdullah bin Al-Zubayr, Abu Al-Tufayl, Abdullah bin Safwan, and Ubayd bin Umayr.
My father dictated to me: And from the people of Medina: Abdullah bin Abbas, Abdullah bin Umar, Asim bin Umar, Jabir, Abu Hurairah, Al-Miswar bin Makhramah, Muhammad bin Hatib, Nafi' bin Abdul-Harith, Aslam his Mawla, Yasar bin Numayr, Abdur-Rahman bin Abza, Abdullah bin Muti', Abdur-Rahman bin Hatib, Al-Mughirah bin Al-Akhnas, Yarfa' his Mawla, Al-Sa'ib bin Yazid, Abdullah bin Utbah, Marwan bin Al-Hakam, Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib, Al-Musayyib bin Hazn, Abdur-Rahman bin Abi Amrah from the Ansar, Al-Farafisah Al-Kalbi, Sulayman bin Abi Hathmah, Yazid bin Abi Sufyan, Tha'labah bin Abi Malik, Abdullah bin Tha'labah bin Su'ayr, Sunayn Abu Jamilah, and Ibrahim bin Abdur-Rahman bin Awf. And Humayd narrated from Umar, but I do not know if he heard from him or not. Ibn Abi Dhi'b said from Al-Zuhri from Humayd: "I saw Umar."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text: And Ibrahim bin Abdur-Rahman, there is no doubt about him; he heard from Umar. And Abdullah bin Amir bin Rabi'ah, Rabi'ah bin Abdullah bin Al-Hudayr, Malik bin Abi Amir, Malik bin Aws bin Al-Hadathan, Ubaydullah bin Adi bin Al-Khiyar, Abu Ubayd the Mawla of Ibn Azhar, and Malik Al-Dar—Abu Salih Al-Samman narrated from him. And Yahya bin Abdullah bin Malik Al-Dar from his father from his grandfather: "I saw Umar," narrated by Ibn Ajlan. And Alqamah bin Waqqas, Zubayd bin Al-Salt, Al-Sharid, Ibrahim bin Abdullah bin Qariz, Ibn Al-Sabbaq, and Abdur-Rahman bin Al-Harith bin Hisham Abu Abi Bakr said: "I took Suhur with Umar." And Abdur-Rahman

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
Al-Taymi, Hisham Abu Hizam, Tarif Abu Abi Ghatafan bin Tarif, Muhammad bin Rabi'ah bin Al-Harith, Abdullah bin Abdullah bin Abi Umayyah, Abdullah bin Al-Sa'di—Al-Sa'ib bin Yazid narrated from him—and Abdullah bin Ayyash bin Abi Rabi'ah—Sulayman bin Yasar narrated from him. And Abu Umamah bin Sahl, Abu Sinan Al-Du'ali, and Ibn Al-Sa'idi—Busr bin Sa'id narrated from him. And Farrukh the Mawla of Uthman narrated from Umar. And Muhammad bin Jubayr bin Mut'im, Abdullah bin Shaddad bin Al-Had, and Abdullah bin Babi from his father the Mawla of Aisha.
465 - My father said: And those who narrated from Umar from the people of Basra: Abdullah bin Sarjis, Anas bin Malik, Abu Uthman Al-Nahdi Abdur-Rahman bin Mull, Abu Rafi' his Mawla—and he was a goldsmith—Abu Al-Aliyah Rufay', Muslim bin Yasar narrated from Umar, Yahya bin Sirin narrated from Umar, Abu Raja' Al-Ataridi, Abu Tamimah, Shuways Al-Adawi, Abu Qatadah Al-Adawi, Al-Ahnaf bin Qays, Mutarrif bin Abdullah bin Al-Shikhkhir, Ziyad bin Matar Al-Adawi, Khalid bin Umayr, Al-Fudayl bin Zaid Al-Raqashi, Subayh—I saw him in the book of Ubayy bin Ta'bi but he did not say it—Qasamah bin Zuhayr, Abu Al-Muhallab Al-Jarmi, Ziyad bin Al-Rabi', Al-Muhallab bin Abi Sufrah—he fought in the time of Umar, Harim bin Hayyan Al-Abdi, Ma'mar bin Sumayr Al-Adawi, Ziyad the Mawla of Abdur-Rahman bin Barthan, Hudayn bin Al-Mundhir Al-Raqashi, and Amir bin

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
Abdullah—meaning Amir bin Abd Qays—and Abu Sheikh Al-Huna'i—he fought in the time of Umar with Uthman bin Abi Al-As, and his name is Haywan bin Khalid—and Abu Al-Malih Al-Hudhali, Shaqiq bin Thawr Al-Sadusi, Abu Al-Halal Al-Ataki—his name is Rabi'ah bin Zurarah, Silah bin Ashyam Al-Adawi, Juwayriyah bin Qudamah Al-Tamimi, Iyas bin Qatadah, Qays bin Abbad Al-Qaysi, 'Ati bin Damrah Al-Sa'di, Sa'sa'ah bin Mu'awiyah Al-Tamimi, Asid bin Al-Mutashammis, Ghunaym bin Qays Al-Mazini, Usayr bin Jabir, and Salman bin Rabi'ah Al-Bahili—Abu Uthman narrated from him. And Abu Sa'id the Mawla of Abu Asid, Abu Al-Ajfa' Al-Sulami, Abu Firas—Abu Nadrah narrated from him, Abu Labid—he narrated from Amr, Abu Al-Aswad Al-Du'ali, Hanzalah bin Nu'aym, and Abdullah bin Al-Harith bin Nawfal, nicknamed Babbah.
466 - My father said: And those who narrated from Ali bin Abi Talib from the people of Basra: Imran bin Husayn: "The son of Abi Talib reminded us of the prayer of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace," Al-Hasan, Khilas regarding the Shurta (police/guards), Abu Labid Limazah bin Zabbar, Hudayn bin Al-Mundhir Al-Raqashi, Abu Nadrah Al-Abdi, Abu Raja' Al-Ataridi, Abu Al-Aliyah Al-Riyahi, Abu Al-Wadi' Al-Azdi, Abu Al-Aswad Al-Du'ali, Abdullah bin Al-Harith—nicknamed Babbah—bin Nawfal, Qays bin Abbad Al-Qaysi, Jurayy Al-Nahdi, Abdullah bin Shaqiq, and Al-Nabighah.
467 - Those who narrated from Uthman bin Affan from the people of Medina: Aban bin Uthman, Zaid bin Khalid Al-Juhani, Abu Hurairah, Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib, Abdur-Rahman bin Abi Amrah, Ibrahim bin Abdur-Rahman bin Awf, Sulayman bin Yasar, Humayd bin Abdur-Rahman bin Awf, Nufay'—"I asked Uthman," Yazid, Abu Salamah, Malik bin Abi Amir, Abdullah bin Rashid the Mawla of Uthman bin Affan,

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
Abdullah bin Darah the Mawla of Uthman, Abu Umamah bin Sahl bin Hunayf, Abu Salih the Mawla of Uthman, Hani' the Mawla of Uthman, Marwan bin Al-Hakam, Amr bin Uthman bin Affan—Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib narrated from him, Humran bin Aban—Urwah narrated from him, Abu Ubayd the Mawla of Ibn Azhar, Amir bin Sa'd, Ubaydullah bin Adi bin Al-Khiyar, Mahmud bin Labid, Abdur-Rahman bin Abi Dhubab, Al-Harith the Mawla of Uthman, Abdullah bin Al-Harith bin Nawfal, and Musa bin Talhah.
468 - What is narrated from Umar from the people of Kufa:
I heard my father [say]: And those who narrated from Umar from the people of Kufa: Al-Nu'man bin Bashir, Tariq bin Shihab, Al-Aswad, Qays bin Abi Hazim, Abu Ma'mar, Masruq, Abu Maysarah, Alqamah, Ubaydah, Amr bin Maymun, Ma'rur bin Suwayd, Zaid bin Wahb, Abayah bin Rif'ah, Sayyar bin Ma'rur—Simak narrated from him, Subay bin Ma'bad, Salman bin Rabi'ah, Suwayd bin Ghaflah, Sa'id bin Dhi La'wah, Abayah bin Rif'ah, Abdur-Rahman bin Abi Layla, Alqamah bin Qays from Al-Qurtha' from Qays or Ibn Qays—Khaythamah narrated from Qays bin Marwan from Umar, Harithah bin Mudarrib, Kulayb Al-Jarmi Abu Asim bin Kulayb, Zirr bin Hubaysh, and Abu Wa'il.
469 - I heard my father say: Hafs bin Ghiyath used to weaken Abu Sahl Muhammad bin Salim and would say: "These are the books of his brother." Abu Abdur-Rahman said: He abandoned the Hadith of Muhammad bin Salim regarding inheritance laws (*Fara'id*) and other things due to his weakness.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
470 - My father told us, saying: Waki' told us from Sufyan from Ibrahim—meaning Ibn Abdul-A'la—who said: I asked Sa'id bin Jubayr about *Al-Qabalah* (advance payment/guarantee). He said: "Regret or sin." Isra'il said "*Al-Qiblah*." My father said: Isra'il erred; it is only *Al-Qabalah*.
471 - My father told me, saying: Waki' told us from Shu'bah from Mughirah and Hammad regarding a man who rents it out for more—meaning the house or the thing. Hammad said: "Whatever he gains is Riba (usury)." Mughirah said: "Ibrahim used to dislike it." Then Mughirah said: "*Durugh Kaft*." My father said: "*Durugh Kaft*" [means] Hammad lied.
472 - My father told me, saying: Waki' told us the Hadith of Sufyan from Al-Mughirah bin Al-Nu'man from Hani' bin Hizam. And so said Yahya bin Adam. Ibn Mahdi said "Haram"; Abdur-Rahman misread it, for it is Hizam.
473 - I heard my father mention that Humayd Al-A'raj's Kunya is Abu Safwan, and he is Humayd bin Qays.
474 - I heard him mention that Abdullah bin Abi Al-Hudhayl is Abu Al-Mughirah, Al-Harith bin Suwayd is Abu Aisha, Masruq is Abu Aisha, and Usayd bin Hudayr is Abu Atik.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
475 - My father told me, saying: Shu'ayb bin Harb told us, saying: Malik bin Anas said: "Our early ones did not take from your early ones. Alqamah, Al-Aswad, and Masruq used to pass by, and no one from us would take from them. Likewise, our later ones do not take from your later ones." He said: Then he mentioned Sufyan—meaning Al-Thawri—and said: "However, he agreed with me not to drink Nabidh."
476 - My father told me, saying: Shu'ayb bin Harb told us, saying: Malik bin Anas said: We used to sit with Al-Zuhri and with Muhammad bin Al-Munkadir. Al-Zuhri would say: "Ibn Umar said such-and-such." When it was after that, we sat with him and said to him: "That which you mentioned from Ibn Umar, who informed you of it?" He said: "His son Salim."
477 - I heard my father say: These are the companions of Ibn Abbas: Mujahid, Tawus, Sa'id bin Jubayr, Ata, Jabir bin Zaid, and Ikrimah is the last of them. My father said: The companions of Ibn Abbas are the Hadith scholars and the Muftis.
478 - I heard my father say: I heard Ibrahim bin Sa'd say: "I never saw a drunkard in Medina ever until I left it."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
479 - My father told me, saying: Hammad Al-Khayyat told us from Shu'bah, who said: Ibrahim—meaning Al-Nakha'i—did not meet Abu Abdullah—meaning Al-Jadali. And Hammad Al-Khayyat said: Ibn Abi Dhi'b used to be likened to Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib.
480 - My father told me, saying: Yahya Al-Qattan told us, saying: I asked Shu'bah: "How many did you hear from Abu Ma'shar?" He said: "Four, cut off (*butr*)," meaning Mursal narrations.
481 - My father told me, saying: Abdur-Razzaq told us that Ma'mar's Kunya is Abu Urwah.
482 - I heard my father say: I heard Waki' say: Al-Hasan bin Abdur-Rahman Al-Katib told us, and he was trustworthy.
483 - I heard him say: Abu Dhubyan, Shu'bah and Hisham narrated from him from Hafsah, and Sulayman bin Al-Mughirah.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
484 - My father told me, saying: Rawh told us, saying: Sulayman bin Al-Mughirah told us, saying: I heard in the gathering of Humayd bin Hilal—either from Humayd bin Hilal or from Abu Dhubyan, thus said Rawh—he said: Imran bin Husayn said: "Do not fast a day that you see as obligatory upon you."
485 - I heard him say: Abu Al-Zubayr Al-Makki's name is Muhammad bin Muslim bin Tadrus, the Mawla of Hakim bin Hizam. And Abu Bakrah Nufay' Al-Harith Al-A'war bin Abdullah. And Amr bin Shu'ayb is Abu Ibrahim. Abu Al-Ajfa' Al-Sulami is Harim bin Nusayb. Yahya bin Abi Kathir is Abu Nasr. And Humayd bin Hilal is

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text: Abu Nasr. And Habib bin Sahban is Abu Malik. Nafi' bin Jubayr is Abu Muhammad. Abdur-Rahman bin Al-Aswad is Abu Hafs. Abu Al-Adabbas is Mani' bin Sulayman. Ma'qil bin Yasar is Abu Ali. Abdullah bin Mughaffal is Abu Sa'id, and other than my father said Abu Ziyad. A'idh bin Amr is Abu Hubayrah. And Al-A'raj is Abu Dawud. And Mughirah

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
bin Miqsam is Abu Hisham. Wathilah bin Al-Asqa' is Abu Al-Asqa'. Abu Ghaffar is Al-Muthanna bin Sa'd. Habib bin Abi Mulaykah's Kunya is Abu Thawr; Kulayb bin Wa'il and Al-Sha'bi narrated from him. And Abu Al-Bakhtari, and he is the one called Al-Hadda'i.
486 - My father told me, saying: Yahya bin Sa'id told us from Malik, saying: Abu Al-Rijal bin Amrah told us from his mother.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
487 - My father told me, saying: Abu Sa'id the Mawla of Banu Hashim told us, saying: Abdur-Rahman bin Muhammad bin Abdur-Rahman bin Abi Al-Rijal from Banu Al-Najjar told us, saying: I heard my father Abu Al-Rijal narrating from Amrah. My father said: Abu Al-Rijal's name is Muhammad bin Abdur-Rahman. And Harithah is Ibn Muhammad bin Abdur-Rahman Abu Al-Rijal.
488 - My father told me, saying: Waki' told us from Sufyan from Abu Al-Rijal from his mother Amrah bint Abdur-Rahman.
489 - My father told me, saying: Ya'qub told us, saying: My father told us from Ibn Ishaq, and he mentioned a Hadith and traced the lineage of Amrah bint Abdur-Rahman bin Sa'd bin Zurarah.
490 - My father told me, saying: Ya'qub told us, saying: My father told us from Ibn Ishaq, who said: Abu Al-Rijal Muhammad bin Abdur-Rahman told me from his mother Amrah bint Abdur-Rahman.
491 - My father told me, saying: Muhammad bin Ja'far told us, saying: Shu'bah told us from Muhammad bin Abdur-Rahman bin Sa'd bin Zurarah, who said: I heard my uncle narrating—and I never met a man among us resembling him—narrating that As'ad bin Zurarah, who is the grandfather of Muhammad from his mother's side, was seized by a pain in his throat called *Al-Dhabhah* (angina/quinsy).

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
492 - I said to my father: Waki' from Sadaqah? My father said: He is Sadaqah Al-Samin. What is raised (*Marfu'*) from his Hadith is Denounced (*Munkar*), and what is Disconnected (*Mursal*) from his Hadith from Makhul is easier. He said: He is very weak. He is Sadaqah bin Abdullah Al-Samin. And Sadaqah bin Khalid is trustworthy, trustworthy, more established than Al-Walid bin Muslim, righteous in Hadith—Sadaqah bin Khalid.
493 - My father said regarding the Hadith of Sufyan from Hammad from Ibrahim from Al-Aswad that he used to say "*Indaraym*" (a type of food/drink?): Sufyan did not hear it from Hammad in the dictation of Yemen from Jabir from Hammad. I heard my father say: Al-Sha'bi and Zaid bin Wahb narrated from him, Abdur-Rahman bin Abd Rabb Al-Ka'bah.
494 - Waki' said: *Batnan Al-Jannah* (The middle of Paradise) is its center.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 495 - My father said: Abu Nu'aym used to say in it: 'From Al-Shaybani, from Ikrimah: And strike a parable for them, the People of the Town.' I said to him: 'It is only from Al-Suddi.' So he brought out a book, a collection (Sahifah), and behold, it was from Al-Suddi. 496 - I heard him say: Waki' said: 'They say that Sulayman was the more correct of the two in Hadith'—meaning the two sons of Buraydah. 497 - My father said: I do not deny the Hadith of Husayn bin Waqid and Abu Al-Munib from Ibn Buraydah. 498 - My father said: Waki' said: We used to memorize them with Sufyan then count them. 499 - I heard my father say: Khalid bin Al-Mudarrab; Abu Ishaq narrated from him. It is likely that he is the brother of Harithah bin Mudarrib.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 500 - I heard him say: Hujr bin Anbas; Salamah bin Kuhayl, Musa bin Qays, and Al-Mughirah bin Abi Al-Hurr narrated from him. 501 - I heard him say: Umarah bin Zadhan is a trustworthy Sheikh, there is no harm in him. 502 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Ziyad bin Khaythamah, the uncle of Zuhayr, told me. My father said: And he is not his uncle. 503 - I heard him say: Usamah bin Zayd narrated from Nafi' objectionable (Manakir) Hadiths. 504 - Waki' said: Ibn Al-Asbahani is a client of Jadilah Qays.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 505 - And Waki' said regarding the Hadith of Sufyan from Abu Ishaq from Abd Al-Rahman bin Adhnan. And Isra'il said: From Abu Ishaq from Abd Al-Rahman bin Danil—meaning the Hadith of Ali that he recited: 'And indeed their plot was such that the mountains should vanish from it.' 506 - I heard my father say: If Al-Jurayri had not narrated anything but this Hadith, it would be [sufficient]: The Hadith of Abu Al-Ward from Al-Lajlaj from Mu'adh from the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him: 'O Allah, I ask you for the completion of favor,' and he narrated the Hadith.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 507 - I heard him say: Jawab Al-Taymi from Abu Qilabah from Al-Hasan; I think he is Abu Qilabah Abdullah bin Zayd Al-Jarmi. And Waki' said: Abu Yunus told us, he heard Al-Hasan. My father said: And he is Mubarak bin Hassan—meaning the Hadith 'Everyone acts according to his Shakilah (way/mode)'; he said: [meaning] his intention. 508 - My father said: Waki' said: Ibn Hakim bin Jubayr claimed that his father was a client of Banu Umayyah. 509 - My father said: Waki' said, and he mentioned Yazid bin Abi Salih, so he said: He was a tanner and had a good appearance; he had four Hadiths. 510 - I heard my father say: The Hadiths of Ibn Maysur are all fabricated, objectionable (Manakir); strike them out. 511 - My father said: Hisham bin Al-Ghaz is righteous in Hadith (Salih Al-Hadith). 512 - My father told me, he said: Abu Badr told us, he said: Shabib bin Shaybah Abu Ma'mar mentioned him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 513 - My father told me, he said: I said to Isma'il bin Ulayyah: 'Did Ma'mar use to narrate to you from his memory?' He said: 'He used to narrate to us from his memory.' 514 - My father said: Ghundar brought out to us his book from Sufyan bin Uyaynah and said: 'Do you find any mistake in it?' Then he threw it to us.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 515 - My father told me, he said: Abu Qatan told us, he said: A man contradicted Shu'bah—meaning in the Hadith of Abu Ishaq from Qays bin Abi Hazim who heard Abdullah: 'If one of you is invited to food while he is fasting, let him say: I am fasting.' My father said: Abu Qatan said: So I said to Yunus bin Abi Ishaq [about it]. He said: 'He did not memorize—meaning the one who contradicted Shu'bah—I was with my father when he entered upon him—meaning Qays—but I did not memorize the Hadith.' Abu Abd Al-Rahman said: I said to Yahya bin Ma'in: 'Do you preserve anything from Yunus bin Abi Ishaq from Qays?' He said: 'No.' I narrated this Hadith to him, so he said: 'Who narrated this?' I said: 'My father narrated it to me from Abu Qatan.' He said: 'I did not hear it,' or 'This was not with Hajjaj'—meaning the Hadith of Abu Qatan. 516 - I heard him say: Al-Awza'i heard from Yahya bin Abi Kathir in Al-Yamamah, and from Abu Kathir Al-Suhaymi in Al-Yamamah, and he heard from Qatadah in Basra, and he entered upon Ibn Sirin. 517 - My father told me, he said: Abu Ubaydah Al-Haddad told us, from Hammad bin Salamah, he said: Ammar bin Abi Ammar used to wash the dead. My father said: He is trustworthy, meaning Ammar. 518 - I heard my father say: Abd Al-A'la Al-Taymi is a righteous man; Mis'ar and Al-Mas'udi narrated from him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 519 - I heard him say: I asked Abd Al-Razzaq about Yunus bin Sulaym Al-San'ani. He said: He is better than Amr Biraqq (or Baraq). My father said: He is Amr bin Abdullah who narrated from Ikrimah, meaning Amr Biraqq. 520 - My father said: Abd Al-Wahhab bin Al-Ward, and it is said Wuhib bin Al-Ward, is the brother of Abd Al-Jabbar bin Al-Ward. 521 - My father said: Yazid bin Hazim and Jarir bin Hazim are brothers. And Ubaydullah bin Abi Ja'far and Abdullah bin Abi Ja'far are brothers. 522 - My father said: Bishr bin Kathir Abu Talhah Al-Usaydi is trustworthy, trustworthy (Thiqah Thiqah). 523 - My father said: I saw the front of Hafs bin Ghiyath's mouth; his teeth were fastened with gold.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 524 - My father told me, he said: Khalid bin Khidash told us, he said: Hammad bin Zayd said: Al-Hasan died on the first day of Rajab in the year ten [110 AH], and I prayed over him. And Muhammad died on the ninth of Shawwal in the year ten [110 AH]. 525 - My father told me, he said: Khalid bin Khidash told us, he said: Hammad bin Zayd told us, he said: Shu'ayb bin Al-Habhab died in the year thirty [130 AH] from Al-Humayra', something resembling pustules. And Ayyub died in the year one hundred and thirty-one in Ramadan.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 526 - I heard him say: The 'Afriqi' from Muslim bin Yasar; this is not Muslim bin Yasar Al-Basri. This is a man I see as being from the region of Africa (Ifriqiya). He narrates from Ibn Al-Musayyib and Sufyan bin Wahb Al-Khawlani. As for Muslim bin Yasar Al-Basri, Muhammad bin Sirin, Qatadah, and his son Abdullah bin Muslim narrate from him. This is other than that. 527 - My father said: Ma'mar Al-Raqqi told us: 'I did not hear anything from Isma'il bin Abi Khalid; it was only read to us,' meaning it was presented to him (Ardan). 528 - My father told me, he said: Abd Al-Razzaq told us, he said: Ibn Jurayj said: And I saw Safiyyah bint Shaybah dyed (with henna), wearing clothes dyed with safflower.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 529 - I heard my father say: The Hadith of Maysarah Abu Salih was difficult for me, so I spoke to a person, and Hushaym dictated it to me by dictation from Hilal bin Khabbab. 530 - My father told me, he said: Abu Ubaydah Al-Haddad told us, he said: I wrote for Abu Hurrah regarding the Hadith of Al-Hasan 'I heard Al-Hasan'. He did not say in any of them 'I heard' except in three Hadiths, and he did not say 'I heard' in the rest of them. 531 - And my father said: Abu Ammar Al-Hamdani's name is Arib bin Humayd. And Al-Mustazill bin Husayn is Abu Al-Maytha'. 532 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Sa'id told us, I heard him say: Shu'bah used to deny the Hadith of Abu Ishaq from Abu Al-Ahwos from Abdullah regarding Taslim (Salutation in prayer) to his right and to his left. And he used to deny the Hadith of Hammad from Ibrahim from Abdullah, Marfu' (elevated to the Prophet).

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 533 - My father said: I heard Waki' say: From Shu'bah from Qatadah from Waqi' bin Sahban. Then I heard him another time say: 'Waqi' bin Sahba'.' So I mentioned it to Waki', and he retracted and said: 'Ibn Sahban'. 534 - I heard my father say: Waqi' bin Sahban is Basri. And Usayr bin Jabir is Basri; Abu Nadrah, Humayd bin Hilal, and Waqi' bin Sahban narrated from him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 535 - I heard my father mention Shaddad Abu Ammar Al-Shami, so he said: Al-Awza'i, Ikrimah bin Ammar, and Al-Nahhas bin Qahm narrated from him. 536 - My father said: Ata' Al-Kaykharani—and they say Al-Kaykharani, Al-Kaykharali, and Al-Kaykharali—is Ata' bin Ya'qub.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 537 - I heard him say: Ibrahim Al-Nakha'i, Al-Hakam bin Utaybah, Al-A'mash, Jami' bin Shaddad, and Al-Salt bin Bahram narrated from Umarah bin Umayr. 538 - My father said: Hajjaj narrated from Amr bin Shu'ayb, from his father, from his grandfather that the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, returned her with a new marriage—meaning Zaynab, his daughter, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him—to Abu Al-As bin Al-Rabi'. 539 - And I heard him say: I read in some books from Hajjaj, he said: Muhammad bin Ubaydullah Al-Arzami told me, from Amr bin Shu'ayb, from his father, from his grandfather, from the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him. My father said: And Muhammad bin Ubaydullah, people abandoned his Hadith.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 540 - My father said regarding the Hadith of Yazid bin Zuray' from Shu'bah, he said: Amr bin Murrah informed me, from Abdullah bin Salamah, he said: We entered upon Umar as a group, a delegation of Madhhij, and I was among the closest of them to him in seating. Umar began looking at Al-Ashtar and turning his gaze away. He said to me: 'Is this one of you?' I said: 'Yes, O Commander of the Faithful.' He said: 'What is with him? May Allah fight him! May Allah suffice the Ummah of Muhammad against his evil. By Allah, I reckon that for the Muslims there will be a difficult day from him.' 541 - Abu Abd Al-Rahman said: And the Hadith was narrated to us by Bashshar Al-Khaffaf, he said: Yazid bin Zuray' told us, he said: Shu'bah told me, he said: Amr bin Murrah told me, and he mentioned much speech in it, more than this. 542 - My father said: I read it in the book of my uncle Salih bin Hanbal from Al-Haytham bin Adi from Abdullah bin Amr bin Murrah from his father—meaning this Hadith.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 543 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Adam told us, he said: Zuhayr told us, from Abu Ishaq, from Abu Al-Aliyah—and he is Abdullah bin Salamah. My father said: Thus said Yahya bin Adam in this Hadith. 544 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Adam told us, he said: Ibn Al-Mubarak told me, he said: Makhramah bin Bukayr told me, he said: I read in the book of my father Bukayr. 545 - My father said: I heard Hammad Al-Khayyat mention from Makhramah, he said: 'I did not hear anything from my father.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 546 - I heard him mention Muhammad bin Mus'ab Al-Da'a' (the Supplicator), so he said: He was a righteous man. He used to narrate stories and supplicate in the past in the mosque. Then he said: Perhaps Ibn Ulayyah would sit with him in the Jami' Mosque listening to his supplication. My father said: He came to me once and wrote Hadiths, and he sat in this sitting place of yours and said: 'My Lord, hide me under Your Throne; my Lord, hide me under Your Throne.' 547 - My father told me, he said: Affan said: Yahya bin Sa'id said that Abd Al-Rahman bin Mahdi says: Indeed, Shu'bah used not to say 'So-and-so told us' [regarding] the one Shu'bah narrated from. My father said: Affan only intended to fault Abd Al-Rahman with this. 548 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, from Sharik, from Abdullah bin Ism. Waki' said: Isra'il said 'Ibn Ismah'. Waki' said: And he is Ibn Ism, meaning the correct [name]. 549 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: And Miskin Abu Hurayrah Al-Taymi was reliable (Thabt). 550 - My father told me, he said: Yazid bin Harun told us, from Yahya bin Sa'id, he said: I heard Salim bin Abdullah mention the Hadith of Umar's charity regarding camels. My father said: I said to Yazid: 'Indeed, a person in Kufa narrates it from Yahya, saying: It reached me from Salim.' So he fell silent. When it was later, Yazid said: 'Where is Ibn Hanbal? That Hadith, Salim used to narrate.' My father said: I heard it from Ya'la bin Ubayd from Yahya bin Sa'id, he said: 'It reached me from Salim.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 551 - My father was asked while I was listening about Firas bin Yahya and Isma'il bin Salim. He said: Firas died earlier than Isma'il, and Isma'il is more trustworthy than him—meaning in Hadith. Firas has some weakness in him. Isma'il bin Salim has better uprightness than him in Hadith and earlier hearing; Isma'il heard from Sa'id bin Jubayr, and Firas died earlier. 552 - My father said: Abd Al-Razzaq said: My father said: My mother used to send me to Hujr Al-Madari with something. My father said: And Tawus narrated from him, and Shaddad bin Jaban narrated from him, saying: 'I spent the night at Hujr Al-Madari's.' My father said: This Shaddad is a Sheikh from whom Ma'mar narrated. Abd Al-Razzaq said: And he lived in Sana'a, meaning Hujr.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 553 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Abi Bukayr told us, he said: Hammad bin Salamah told us, from Humayd that he took the books of Al-Hasan from him, copied them, then returned them. 554 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Abi Bukayr told us, he said: Hammad bin Salamah told us, from Ali bin Zayd, he said: Three of his companions used to elevate the Hadith (Raf') when they heard it: Al-Hasan, Abu Al-Aliyah, and another man. 555 - My father said: Abu Muslim Al-Mustamli said: I came to Ghundar, and it was mentioned that he was difficult regarding Hadith. I said to him: 'This Ibrahim bin Sadaqah has the Book of Divorce from Ibn Abi Arubah; I will go to him.' He said to me: 'Come back, so I can narrate it to you.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 556 - My father said: Abu Khaythamah said: Mu'adh and Yahya bin Sa'id denied the Hadith of Al-Ansari—meaning Muhammad bin Abdullah—from Habib bin Al-Shahid from Maymun bin Mihran from Ibn Abbas: 'The Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, was cupped while he was in Ihram and fasting.' I heard my father say: Maymun bin Mihran is more trustworthy than Ikrimah. Maymun is trustworthy (Thiqah), and he mentioned him with good. 557 - I heard my father say: Abd Al-Rahman, the companion of Al-Siqayah (water-giving), from whom Al-Taymi narrated, is Abd Al-Rahman bin Adam, and he is Abd Al-Rahman bin Bartham, and they say: Mawla of Umm Barthan.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
558 - My father told me, saying: Abu Ya'qub, the Mawla of Abu Ubaydullah, told me: The name of Abu Fakhitah is Sa'id bin 'Alaqah. I heard it from Ibn 'Uyaynah—meaning Abu Ya'qub heard it from Ibn 'Uyaynah.
559 - I heard my father mention Ibn Abi Al-Rabi' Al-Samman, and he said: I do not regard him except as truthful (*Saduq*).
560 - My father told me, saying: Sa'id bin 'Amir told us, saying: I heard Hisham say: Yahya—meaning Ibn Sirin—used to be preferred over Muhammad.
561 - My father told me, saying: Shadhan told us from Sharik from Silm bin Abdur-Rahman, who said: Ibrahim heard Al-Suddi explaining [the Quran], so he said: "His explanation is the explanation of the people [meaning certain groups]." Sharik said: Ibrahim was severe in speech regarding the Murji'ah.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
562 - My father told me, saying: Yazid bin Harun told us, saying: Ja'far bin Kaysan informed us, saying: Shuways Abu Al-Raqqad told us.
563 - I said to my father: "Why did you not write from Walid bin Salih?" He said: "I saw him praying in the grand mosque, performing the prayer badly."
564 - I heard him say regarding the Hadith of Waki' from Sufyan from Mutarrif from Abu Al-Safar: Sa'id bin Ahmad Al-Thawri, Thawr of Hamdan. Thus said Waki'.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
565 - I asked him about Abdur-Rahman bin 'A'idh, from whom Ibn Abi Khalid narrated. He said: "I do not know who he is."
566 - I heard him say regarding the Hadith of Sufyan—from whomever heard Al-Sha'bi—Zaid used to say regarding accidental killing (*Khata'*): thirty *Hiqqah* (four-year-old she-camels). I think he heard it from Ash'ath or Muhammad bin Salim.
567 - I heard him mention Waki', so he said: "I have not seen anyone more retentive of knowledge than him, nor more memorizing."
568 - My father said: Waki' said: Sufyan said: Abu Al-Za'ra' is 'Amr bin 'Amir. My father said: Ibn 'Uyaynah said: 'Amr bin 'Amr. My father said: The correct one is the saying of Ibn 'Uyaynah.
569 - Waki' said: 'Urwah—meaning Abu Farwah—was with us.
570 - My father said: Waki' said: Abu Mas'ud was 'Aqabi (present at Aqabah) and did not witness Badr. Thus the people say.
571 - I asked my father about Al-Hasan Abu Musafir, from whom Sharik narrated. He said: "I do not know him."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text: 572 - I asked him about the Hadith of Sufyan from Ali bin Abi Talhah, a Kufan, from Al-Qasim from Abdullah. He said: Ali bin Abi Talhah is trustworthy (*Thiqa*), a Kufan; Hasan bin Salih narrated from him. And Hajjaj Al-A'war said: "I have seen him."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
573 - And my father said regarding the Hadith of Waki' from Sufyan from Mansur from Ibrahim regarding a Muslim who kills a Dhimmi (non-Muslim citizen) by mistake; he said: "Their expiation is the same." My father said: "No one narrates it except Waki'; I do not see it as anything but a mistake."
574 - I asked him about a Sheikh from whom Sharik narrated, called Abu Al-Wadin. He said: "Al-Thawri and Sharik narrated from him. Sufyan said his name is Abdul-Malik; Yahya Al-Qattan named him."
575 - I heard my father say: The hearing (*Sama'*) of Waki' from Al-Mas'udi in Kufa is old, and Abu Nu'aym as well. Al-Mas'udi only became confused (*Ikhtalata*) in Baghdad. Whoever heard from him in Basra and Kufa, his hearing is good.
576 - My father said: Waki' said: Al-Qasim bin Al-Fadl said from Muhammad bin Ziyad, the Mawla of Uthman bin Maz'un, and he is the companion of Abu Hurairah.
577 - I asked my father about Abu Al-Hasan, a Mawla of Banu Kilab, from whom Hammad bin Salamah narrated from Abu Salamah from Abu Sulayman from Ali. He said: "Abu Sulayman is Zaid bin Wahb, and Abu Al-Hasan, I do not know him."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
578 - I said to my father: Waki' said: Isma'il bin Muslim, the Mawla of Banu Makhzum, told us. My father said: "He is Al-Makki."
579 - My father said regarding the Hadith of Sufyan from Wasil from a man from Banu Asad: My father said: Waki' said: "I think he is Wasil bin Abi Hurrah." My father said: Jarir narrated from him; he is Wasil, the owner of Al-Sabiri (fine cloth).
580 - I heard my father say: Ja'far, who narrated from Abu Uthman from Umar that he raised his hands in the Qunut of Fajr—Sufyan said: Ja'far, the owner of Al-Anmat (carpets/rugs). My father said: It is said that he is Ja'far bin Maymun; Yahya narrated to us from him.
581 - I asked him about Qurrah bin Khalid and Imran bin Hudayr. He said: "There is no one among them except a trustworthy person (*Thiqa*). Imran died earlier. Qurrah's Kunya is Abu Khalid, and Imran bin Hudayr's Kunya is Abu Ubaydah."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
582 - I heard my father say: Ahmad, the nephew of Abdur-Razzaq, is one of the biggest liars among people. I said to him: "Did he hear anything from Ma'mar?" He said: "No, he was younger than me. There was a man in Yemen who heard from Wahb bin Munabbih. So I asked this nephew of Abdur-Razzaq: 'Is he alive?' He said: 'No, he has died.' So we went out to his village, and lo and behold, he was alive, so we heard from him Hadiths he heard from Wahb."
583 - I heard my father say: How likely it is that Ubaydah Al-Salmani bin Amr... This has circulated in my ear.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
584 - My father said: Al-Qasim bin Ma'n is hidden (*Mastur*), trustworthy (*Thiqa*). He held the judiciary of Kufa. Ibn Mahdi narrated from him; there is no harm in him. And Ma'n bin Abdur-Rahman, his father, was among the best of Muslims.
585 - My father said: Dawud bin Abi Hind is Basran. They used to say that his origin is Khurasani. So I said: "Which of them is more impressive to you: Isma'il bin Abi Khalid or Dawud—meaning Ibn Abi Hind?" He said: "Isma'il is more retentive (*Ahfaz*) in my opinion than him. Rare is what differs from Isma'il, while Dawud is differed from."
586 - I said to my father: Yahya bin Sa'id said from Sufyan from Al-A'mash from Yahya bin Umarah from Sa'id bin Jubayr from Ibn Abbas that Abu Talib fell ill, so the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, visited him. And Abu Usamah said: Al-A'mash told us, saying: Abbad told us from Sa'id bin Jubayr from Ibn Abbas the like of it. My father said: And Al-Ashja'i said from Sufyan from Al-A'mash from Yahya bin Abbad Abu Hubayrah. So I said: "Who was correct?" He said: "I do not know."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
587 - I said to my father: Al-Mas'udi said: Abu Umar Al-Dimashqi informed me. Who is Abu Umar? He said: "I do not recall anyone narrating from him other than Al-Mas'udi."
588 - I said to my father: The Hadith of Bashir Abu Isma'il from Sayyar Abu Al-Hakam from Tariq from Abdullah from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace: "Whoever is afflicted by poverty..." My father said: "It is only Sayyar Abu Hamzah, and it is not Sayyar Abu Al-Hakam. Abu Al-Hakam did not narrate anything from Tariq." My father told me, saying: Abdur-Razzaq told us, saying: Sufyan informed us. My father said: Sufyan dictated it to them in Yemen from Bashir Abu Isma'il from Sayyar Abu Hamzah, and he mentioned this exact Hadith.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
589 - My father said: Hammad bin Najih is trustworthy (*Thiqa*), approachable (*Muqarib*) in Hadith. Waki' and Abu Ubaydah Al-Haddad narrated from him.
590 - I said: "Yazid bin Ibrahim is trustworthy?" He said: "Trustworthy." I said: "Is he more beloved to you or Ali bin Ali Al-Rifa'i?" He said: "Yazid is more beloved to me than him."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
591 - And he said regarding the Hadith of Waki' from Ishaq bin Uthman Al-Kilabi from Abu Ayyub Al-Hajari: "The sun eclipsed in Basra while Ibn Abbas was the governor." My father said: "It is only Abu Ayyub the Mawla of Uthman; Hammad bin Salamah and Al-Khazraj narrated from him. And Al-Hajari—meaning Abu Ayyub from whom Qatadah narrates—his name is Yahya bin Malik."
592 - And he said regarding the Hadith of Waki' from Hisham bin Urwah from Ayyub bin Maysarah from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace: "Give gifts to the one who does not give to you, and visit the one who does not visit you." Some of them said thus Hisham bin Urwah said: Ayyub bin Maysarah is Al-Sakhtiyani. And others said: Ibn Kaysan.
593 - I asked him: "Did Ibrahim hear anything from Masruq?" He said: "Yes, from Ibrahim bin Muhammad bin Al-Muntashir."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
594 - I asked him about Al-Hakam bin Abi Al-Fadl—Waki' narrated from him; he heard from Al-Hasan. He said: "A Sheikh of his, Basran."
595 - I asked him about a Sheikh from whom Waki' narrated, called Abu Mutarrif, from his father from his grandfather from Shurayh. He said: "It is not him. Yunus bin Ubayd is old; he narrates from Mutarrif bin Utbah, and Abu Al-Mutarrif is the son of this one."
596 - I asked him about a Sheikh from whom Sharik narrated, called Abu Hind Al-Marhabi from Al-Dahhak bin Muzahim. He said: "I do not know who he is."
597 - I asked him about a Sheikh from whom Waki' narrated, he said: Abu Al-Muhajjal, a Mawla of Banu Hashim, told me from Umar bin Abdul-Aziz. I said to him: "Is he not the one from whom Sharik narrated?" He said: "No, this is another one; this is a Mawla of Banu Hashim."
598 - I asked him about a Sheikh from whom Hasan bin Salih narrated, called Abu Tawq, from Ata: "Do not sell grapes to one who makes them into wine." He said: "I do not know him."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
599 - My father mentioned the Hadith of Waki' from Shu'bah from Abdul-Malik bin Abi Sulayman from Ata from Jabir from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, regarding Preemption (*Shuf'ah*). He said: "It is not in the book of Ghundar."
600 - I asked him about a Sheikh from whom Waki' narrated, called Hisham bin Al-Mughirah Al-Thaqafi. He said: "A Kufan Sheikh."
601 - I heard him say: Hushaym died in the year [one hundred and] eighty-three in Sha'ban.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
602 - My father said: The most correct person in Hadith from Sa'id Al-Maqburi is Layth bin Sa'd. Ubaydullah bin Umar is given precedence regarding Sa'id. And Yahya bin Sa'id bin Ajlan said: He did not come across the Hadith of Sa'id Al-Maqburi, what was from his father from Abu Hurairah and what he himself narrated from Abu Hurairah. The weakest of them in Hadith from him is Abu Ma'shar.
603 - My father said: The most correct person in Hadith from Al-Sha'bi is Isma'il bin Abi Khalid. I said: "What about Zakariya, Firas, and Ibn Abi Al-Safar?" He said: "Ibn Abi Khalid drinks knowledge copiously. Ibn Abi Khalid is the most retentive of them. Ibn Abi Khalid's Kunya is Abu Abdullah." And he said regarding the Hadith of Ibn Abi Al-Safar and Zakariya: "Both of them used to go to Al-Sha'bi together."
604 - And Ibrahim bin Al-Hakam bin Aban said: Kadih bin Ja'far came to us; he came walking to Aden. When he heard these doubts—meaning the doubt of Al-Hakam bin Aban in Hadith—he started saying: "May Allah have mercy on your father," twice. My father said: The doubt of Al-Hakam bin Aban in Hadith was that he would say: "My narration has settled on this. So if I added or decreased, then I seek forgiveness from Allah."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
605 - I asked my father about the Hadith of Waki', who said: Al-Hasan bin Abi Yazid Al-Hamdani told me. My father said: "He is Abu Muhammad bin Al-Hasan."
606 - My father said: Mutarrif did not hear anything from Al-Hasan; rather, he narrates from Isma'il bin Muslim from him.
607 - My father told me, saying: Waki' told us from Sufyan from Rabi' who said: I asked Ibrahim about a man who owes a year's fasting. He said: "He fasts consecutively (*Tatra*)." Waki' once said: "Rabi' bin Abi Rashid," then he said: "A man." My father said: "And it is not Rabi' bin Abi Rashid."
608 - My father told me, saying: Waki' told us, saying: Sufyan told us from Asim Al-Ahwal from Abu Sa'id Al-Raqqashi from Ibn Abbas: "Do not eat from cheese except what the Muslims and the People of the Book have made." My father said: In our book it was "from Sulayman Al-Taymi," but Waki' said "Asim Al-Ahwal," and it is the correct one. And we had copied it from the book of Ibn Abi Shaybah.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
609 - My father told me, saying: Waki' told us from Malik bin Mighwal from Abu Fulan from Al-Aswad bin Hilal. And in our copy it was Jami' bin Shaddad, so he said: From so-and-so. My father said: Waki' said: From Abu Fulan.
610 - My father said: Salih bin Muslim is Bakri.
611 - I asked him about the Hadith of Sufyan from Abu 'Amir Al-Hamdani from Al-Dahhak from Ibn Abbas regarding His saying: "But they betrayed them" [Quran 66:10]. He said: "I do not know the name of this Abu 'Amir."
612 - I asked him about Abu Hujayr. He said: "I have not heard anyone [narrate] from him except Waki', and I do not know his name."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
613 - My father said: Waki' dictated to us the Hadith of Sufyan from Awn bin Abi Juhayfah, Habib bin Abi Thabit, and Ali bin Al-Aqmar. When he finished with them, he said: "This is a gathering to which I will not return."
614 - I said to my father: Sufyan from Abdullah bin Isa from Abdullah bin Abi Al-Ja'd from Thawban. I said: "Is this the brother of Salim bin Abi Al-Ja'd?" He said: "It seems so."
615 - I said to him: Sufyan from a man called Zakariya from Ibrahim that he wept when death approached him. Who is this Zakariya? He said: "I do not know." And he said to me in another place: "I think he is Zakariya Al-Razi."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
616 - My father said: Hushaym died in the year [one hundred and] eighty-three in Sha'ban. Ali bin 'Asim was at his funeral and he narrated, so people crowded around him. Then Abbad bin Al-Awwam came. He said: And I entered Kufa in the year eighty-three.
617 - My father said: Yunus told us, saying: Hammad bin Zaid told us: The sleeve of Ayyub was four hand-spans. Abu Abdur-Rahman said: Meaning its length.
618 - My father told me, saying: Yahya bin Adam told us, saying: Al-Ashja'i told us from Sufyan from Al-A'mash from Sa'd bin Iyad, and he was one of the companions of Abdullah.
619 - My father told me, saying: Abu Mu'awiyah Al-Ghallabi told us, saying: Yahya bin Sa'id Al-Qattan told us from Al-Thawri, who said: "If I saw Mansur praying, I would say: He will die right now."
620 - I heard him say: Muhammad bin Hilal is a trustworthy (*Thiqa*) Sheikh, meaning the Madinan.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
621 - My father told me, saying: Abdullah bin Numayr told us, saying: Al-Harith bin Hasirah told us, saying: I heard Abu Sulayman Al-Juhani. My father said: Meaning Zaid bin Wahb. My father said: Ibn Numayr did not hear from him except one Hadith, meaning this Hadith.
622 - My father told me, saying: Affan told us, saying: Mu'adh bin Mu'adh told me, saying: Al-Ash'ath bin Abdul-Malik came to Qatadah. Qatadah said to him: "Where from? Perhaps you have entered into [the beliefs of] these Mu'tazilah?" A man said to him: "He stuck to Al-Hasan and Muhammad." He said: "It is indeed them! So stick to them."
623 - I said to my father: Shu'bah from Abu Sulayman: I heard Anas say: "A Hajj for one who has not performed Hajj is better than ten military expeditions." Who is this Abu Sulayman? He said: "A Khurasani; Shu'bah met him in Wasit."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
624 - I said to my father: Ali bin Al-Mubarak from Yahya bin Abi Kathir from Abu Maymunah from Abu Hurairah: A woman came to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, whose husband had divorced her. He said: "I do not think Yahya heard it except from Hilal bin Usamah from Abu Maymunah." I said to him: "So Abu Maymunah is the one from whom Qatadah narrated?" He said: "I think so."
625 - I heard him mention Bishr bin Al-Sari. He said: "When I saw him, I recognized the night vigil in his face." He mentioned Bishr bin Al-Sari another time and said: "He was amazingly comprehending in Hadith." He mentioned Imran bin Hudayr and said: "Neither Al-Thawri nor Hushaym narrated anything from him." He mentioned Yunus bin Al-Harith who narrates from Abu Burdah, and said: "His Hadiths are disturbed (*Mudtarib*)." And Al-Nu'man bin Qays who narrates from Ubaydah: "Righteous (*Salih*) in Hadith." Al-Ja'd bin Dhakwan: "I know nothing but good [about him]." I said to him: "Is he more beloved to you or Al-Nu'man bin Qays?" He said: "I do not know."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 626 - I asked him about Zakariya Al-Abdi, whom Al-Thawri narrated from, from Abu Wa'il. I said: 'Is he Kufan?' He said: 'Some of them said he is Razi (from Rayy).' 627 - I asked him about Harmalah bin Qays. He said: 'I do not see any harm in his Hadith.' 628 - I asked him about the Hadith of Mis'ar, from Abd Al-Aziz, from Talhah, from Ibrahim. He said: 'I do not know him'—meaning Abd Al-Aziz. 629 - Waki' said: Abd Al-A'la Al-Tha'labi is Abd Al-A'la bin Amir. Waki' said: Abdullah bin Abi Basir, whom Abu Ishaq narrated from, is Ghanami. Waki' said regarding the Hadith of Sufyan, from Al-Hasan, from Ibrahim, that he disliked saying 'I shortened (awjaztu) the prayer': 'He is either Al-Hasan bin Ubaydullah or Al-Hasan bin Amr.' And he said regarding the Hadith of Abu Ishaq, from Sulaym bin Abd, from Hudhayfah regarding the Fear Prayer (Salat al-Khawf): 'Waki' used to narrate it to us in the books from Sharik, and he said after that another time: Sufyan, from Abu Ishaq. So I do not know if he heard it from both of them together or from one of them.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 630 - I asked my father, saying: 'Is Ibrahim bin Abi Hafsah the brother of Salim bin Abi Hafsah?' He said: 'He is not his brother.' 631 - Hushaym used to make Tasbih (glorifying Allah) frequently between Hadiths. He would say in between: 'La ilaha illa Allah' (There is no god but Allah), elongating his voice with it. And if Hushaym arrived and the first Takbir [of prayer] had escaped him, he would not enter, but would pray with them in another small mosque.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 632 - I heard him mention Ishaq bin Abdullah bin Abi Talhah, so he said: 'Hammad and Hammam heard from him in Basra.' My father said: Waki' said: 'Abu Al-Miqdam, the client of the Bakris, has died.' 633 - My father said: Waki' used to say regarding the Hadith of the Eclipse—the Hadith of Sufyan, from Habib, from Tawus, that the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, prayed during the eclipse six Rak'ahs with four prostrations. I said to him: 'Isma'il bin Ulayyah and Yahya bin Sa'id said: Eight Rak'ahs with four prostrations.' So when it was after that, he retracted to eight.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 634 - My father told me, he said: Hajjaj bin Muhammad Al-Tirmidhi told us, from Ibn Jurayj, he said: Abu Ja'far Muhammad bin Ali informed me that Ibrahim, the son of the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, when he died, was carried to his grave on the saddle-pad (mansij) of a horse. My father said: Yahya and Abd Al-Rahman denied this from him. So he brought out to us his original book, a parchment, and said: 'Here, Abu Ja'far Muhammad bin Ali informed me.' 635 - I said to him: 'Which of the children of Zayd bin Aslam is most trustworthy?' He said: 'Abdullah bin Zayd bin Aslam is the most trustworthy of them.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 636 - My father told me, he said: Abu Al-Jawab told us, he said: Ammar bin Ruzayq told us, from Khalid bin Abi Karimah, from Abu Ja'far Al-Mada'ini. My father said: His name is Abdullah bin Miswar bin Awn bin Ja'far bin Abi Talib. My father said: 'Strike out his Hadith; his Hadiths are fabricated.' And he refused to narrate to us from him. 637 - My father told me, he said: Husayn bin Hasan told us, he said: Sharik told us, from Abu Rabi'ah Al-Ayadi, he said: 'And I saw Mis'ar hearing from him.' 638 - My father told me, he said: Husayn bin Hasan told us, he said: Sharik told us, he said: Abu Ja'far Al-Farra' informed me, he said: 'We used to—Al-A'mash would hear from Abu Ishaq and come and write it on something.' He said: 'And Al-A'mash said to me: Come, look into a book I have.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 639 - My father told me, he said: Husayn bin Hasan told us, he said: Sharik told us, from Kharijah Al-Sayrafi, from Abd Al-Rahman bin Abi Layla, he said: I asked Al-Hasan bin Ali about the saying of Ali regarding the option (Al-Khiyar, in trade). He called for a box (Rab'ah) and took out from it a yellow scroll in which was written the saying of Ali regarding the option. 640 - Abdullah told us, he said: Uthman bin Abi Shaybah or someone else told us, from Jarir, from Raqabah, he said: 'Abdullah bin Miswar used to fabricate Hadith.' 641 - I heard him say: 'Mujahid did not hear from Ya'la bin Umayyah. Ata' narrates from Safwan bin Ya'la.' 642 - I heard him say: 'Rashid bin Sa'd did not hear from Thawban.' 643 - My father said: 'I saw Abu Bakr bin Ayyash wearing a Burnus (hooded cloak).'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 644 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us, he said: Mujalid claimed, from Al-Sha'bi, he said: 'Ziyad used to winter in Basra and take Shurayh with him to summer in Kufa.' My father said: 'Hushaym was... I think Hushaym received it—meaning he committed Tadlis (concealed the source)—from Haytham bin Adi.' (Chapter on Grammatical Errors - Al-Lahn). 645 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us, he said: 'Iyas bin Mu'awiyah used to make many grammatical errors (Lahn). Sufyan bin Husayn said to him: 'Our companion, if only you looked into this Arabic language.' He said: 'So I would perhaps dictate a letter or something to him.' He said: 'So I dictated to him, and he said: You have constricted my speech; I have no need for it.'' 646 - My father said: 'It reached me from Hushaym, he said: I saw Iyas bin Mu'awiyah.' 647 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us, he said: 'Isma'il bin Abi Khalid—and he had met the Companions of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him—made atrocious grammatical errors. He said: He used to say: 'Such and such told me from Abuhu (his father - grammatically incorrect, should be Abihi).''

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 648 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us, from Khalid bin Salamah Al-Makhzumi, he said: 'I saw Ibrahim Al-Nakha'i, and I saw a man who made grammatical errors (Lahhan).' 649 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Adam told us, he said: Abu Bakr told us, from Asim, he said: 'Ibrahim was a truthful man, but if you heard him read, you would say: This one does not do anything well (due to poor recitation/grammar).' 650 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Isma'il told us, from Al-Sha'bi, from Al-Hazhaz bin Mayzan. Waki' said: My father said: 'I heard it from Al-Hazhaz.' And Abd Al-Rahman said: Sufyan told us, he said: Al-Hazhaz told us, from a man of his people, the Hadith of the option (Al-Khiyar). 651 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Sufyan told us, from Ibn Jurayj, from Ata', that the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, disliked taking from the woman seeking Khul' (divorce) more than what he gave her. My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: 'I asked Ibn Jurayj about it, and he denied it and did not know it.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 652 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, from Sharik, from Hilal bin Abdullah, and he said once: Hilal bin Humayd. 653 - I heard him say: Abdullah bin Abdullah Al-Razi; Al-A'mash, Al-Hakam, Fitr, and Ibn Abi Layla narrated from him. He said: I heard it from Muhammad bin Muqatil—meaning Al-Marwazi—he said: Abbad bin Al-Awwam informed us, he said: Hajjaj told us, from Abdullah bin Abdullah, and he was trustworthy, and Al-Hakam used to take from him. 654 - I heard my father say: Ja'far bin Abi Thawr; his grandfather is Jabir bin Samurah from his mother's side. Simak bin Harb, Uthman bin Abdullah bin Mawhab, and Ash'ath bin Abi Al-Sha'tha narrated from him. And his grandfather is Jabir bin Samurah from his mother's side. 655 - My father said: Waki' said: Abu Ka'b—meaning the silk merchant—is Abd Rabbih bin Ubayd. 656 - My father said: Abd Al-Rahman bin Abd Rabb Al-Ka'bah; Al-Sha'bi and Zayd bin Wahb narrated from him. 657 - My father said: Waki' said: Shu'bah mentioned Dawud bin Farahij and criticized him (qasabahu) strongly—meaning he spoke against him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 658 - My father said: It reached me from Yahya bin Sa'id, he said: Ibn Ajlan did not verify—meaning the Hadith of Sa'id Al-Maqburi from his father from Abu Hurayrah—so he left it (the mention of the father) and would say: 'Sa'id Al-Maqburi from Abu Hurayrah,' omitting his father. 659 - I heard him say: The most correct of people in Hadith from Sa'id bin Abi Sa'id Al-Maqburi is Layth bin Sa'd. He distinguishes what he narrated from Abu Hurayrah and what is from his father from Abu Hurayrah. He is very firm in his Hadith. 660 - My father said: Waki' said, from Sufyan, from Abu Umar Al-Bazzar. Waki' said: 'And he was trustworthy.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 661 - My father told me [sic] Abu Qatan told us, he said: Shu'bah told us, from Salamah, from Abu Amr Al-Shaybani, from Abdullah bin Mas'ud, he said: 'The Sa'ibah (one who sets a slave free without loyalty ties) places his wealth wherever he wishes.' My father said: Abu Qatan said: Shu'bah said: 'Sufyan did not hear this'—meaning from Salamah. My father said: And Waki' narrated it to us, saying: Shu'bah told us the like of it. 662 - My father told me, from Ibn Mahdi, he said: I said to Hushaym: 'O Abu Mu'awiyah, how is it that you have so many narrations from Al-Awwam?' He said: 'He was among the last of our Sheikhs to remain, so I scrutinized him.' 663 - My father said: Waki' said: Shu'bah mentioned Najiya and mentioned playing chess. 664 - I heard him say: Muhammad bin Sirin said regarding Abu Hurayrah: 'No one is put ahead of him.' I said: 'Then Abu Salih Dhakwan?' He said: 'Muhammad bin Sirin—meaning he is above him—and Abu Salih is older than him; I do not put anyone ahead of him.' I said: 'Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib?' He said: 'Both of them; they are sufficient for you. Sa'id is older than Abu Salamah.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 665 - My father informed me, from Abu Abd Al-Samad Al-Ammi, he said: I mentioned Sa'id bin Abi Arubah and his memory to Jabir Al-Ju'fi—and Jabir used to be impressed by a man with memory—so Jabir said to me: 'What a man is this Sa'id bin Abi Arubah!' 666 - My father said: These are the companions of Qatadah about whom Shu'bah, Hisham, and Sa'id bin Abi Arubah do not differ. 667 - My father told me, he said: I heard Ibrahim bin Sa'd swearing by Allah: 'Ibn Sam'an certainly used to lie.' My father said: Ibn Sam'an's name is Abdullah bin Ziyad bin Sam'an. Muhammad bin Ishaq and Ibn Sam'an gathered at Abu Ubaydullah's—or someone else's—so Ibn Sam'an began saying: 'Mujahid told us.' So Ibn Ishaq began saying: 'By Allah, I have never seen the likes of today! I am older than you, yet I never heard from Mujahid nor saw him.' My father said: Ibn Sam'an was only known in Medina for prayer and was not known for Hadith. My father said: The Syrians narrate from him more than anyone else.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 668 - My father told me, he said: Ibn Sam'an was mentioned in the presence of Ibrahim bin Sa'd while I was witnessing, so he said: 'By Allah, I never saw him in any circle of Fiqh circles. Indeed, the nephew of Ibn Shihab informed me, when I asked him about him: Did you see him with Muhammad your uncle? He said: By Allah, I never saw him with him.' 669 - Abdullah told us, he said: I heard Shayban say: I heard Salam bin Miskin say: 'If I were given the like of this pillar in gold, I would not sell a Mushaf.' 670 - My father told me, he said: Hasan bin Musa told us, he said: Abu Ruh Salam bin Miskin told us. 671 - My father said: Yahya bin Sa'id used to say: Ibn Abi Adi came to Sa'id bin Abi Arubah at the end—meaning while he was confused (mixed up). My father said: I said to Muhammad bin Abi Adi: 'Did Sa'id use to dictate to you?' He said: 'If we wanted, he would dictate to us.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 672 - My father said: And I heard Abd Al-Wahhab Al-Khaffaf say: 'Rawh borrowed the book of Ibn Abi Dhi'b from me and did not return it to me.' My father said: So I mentioned that to Rawh, and he said: 'Yes, indeed I sent it with his brother or his nephew.' 673 - My father said: They used to say that Rawh was not known—meaning in Hadith. I heard Uthman bin Umar say: 'I borrowed the book of Hisham from Rawh, and it was a complete book.' 674 - My father said: It was said to Abu Asim, and they asked him about Rawh: 'Do you know him?' He said: 'How could I not know him? He used to intercede for us with Ibn Jurayj.' My father said: And Abu Zayd Al-Harawi said, narrating from Shu'bah: 'We were with him, and a man asked him for clarification, so he said: Do not be like my brother from Qays bin Tha'labah'—meaning Rawh bin Ubadah.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 675 - My father said: And I heard Affan say: They used to mention Abd Al-Wahid bin Ziyad to Yazid bin Zuray', and he would say: 'Who is this liar who narrates from Yunus? I do not know him.' He said: Then he met him one day on some road, and it was said to him: 'This is Abd Al-Wahid bin Ziyad.' He said: 'This one used to be our sitting companion with Yunus.' So they said: 'This is Abd Al-Wahid bin Ziyad.' 676 - I heard my father say: Yazid bin Zuray' was the sweet basil (Rayhanah) of Basra. 677 - I heard my father say: Yahya bin Sa'id used to set a time regarding whoever heard from Sa'id bin Abi Arubah before the defeat; his hearing is good. The defeat was in the year one hundred and forty-five. My father said: This is the defeat of Ibrahim bin Abdullah bin Al-Hasan, who had rebelled against Abu Ja'far. 678 - My father said: Abu Qatan said—and he was reliable (Thabt)—'I never lent my book to anyone.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 679 - I heard my father say: Abu Yusuf the Judge and Malik bin Anas gathered at Harun's (Al-Rashid's). Abu Yusuf asked him about an issue, but he did not answer him. So Abu Yusuf said to Harun: 'O Commander of the Faithful, tell him to answer me.' Malik turned to him and said: 'How badly your family taught you manners!' 680 - My father told me, he said: Affan told us, he said: I memorized it from a trustworthy Sheikh, Abd Al-Mu'min bin Ubaydullah Al-Sadusi, he said: Al-Hasan Al-Basri is Al-Hasan bin Yasar. 681 - I heard him say: A man said to Isma'il bin Ulayyah: 'The Hadith of Yazid Al-Rishk.' Isma'il said: 'Ishaq bin Suwayd told us.' He said: 'O Abu Bishr, I only want the Hadith of Yazid Al-Rishk.' He said: 'I say to you Ishaq bin Suwayd told us, and you say Yazid Al-Rishk?'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 682 - I heard my father say: Affan said: Hammam narrated to us one day. I said to him: 'Yazid bin Zuray' narrated to us from Sa'id, from Qatadah, mentioning the opposite of that Hadith.' He said: So he went and looked in the book, then came and said: 'O Affan, do you not see me erring while I do not know?' Affan said: And when Hammam narrated to us with recent knowledge of the book, he rarely erred. 683 - My father said: Whoever heard from Hammam at the end, it is better, because Hammam, at the end of his life, was afflicted with a disability (Zamanah), so his engagement with the book was recent, thus he rarely erred. Followed in the Second Part, if Allah wills. I heard my father say: I heard Ibrahim bin Sa'id say: I asked Sufyan Al-Thawri—or he was asked—about Nabidh. He said: 'Eat dates and drink water; it will become Nabidh in your stomach.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: Part Two of the Book of Defects and Knowledge of Men

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
Read to Abu Ali bin Al-Sawwaf on Monday, the sixth of Rajab, the year three hundred and forty-three, while I was looking at the original [manuscript], and I heard: In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful.
684 - I heard my father say: I heard Ibrahim bin Sa'd say: I asked Sufyan Al-Thawri, or he was asked, about Nabidh (date-wine). He said: "Eat dates and drink water; it will become Nabidh in your stomach."
685 - My father told me, saying: Waki' told us from Sharik from Hajiz Al-Jasri, who said: "Ali appointed me over the charity (Sadaqah)."
686 - I heard my father say: Hajjaj bin Muhammad told us, saying: Sharik told us from Hajiz bin Abdullah.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
687 - My father told me, saying: Hushaym told us, saying: Ya'la bin Ata informed us from Mujahid, who said: Ibn Umar said to me: "For Nafi' to memorize as you memorize is more beloved to me than having a Zayf (counterfeit/bad) Dirham." I said to him: "Why don't you make it a good [Dirham]?" He said: "That is how it was in my soul [that is what I felt]."
688 - I heard my father say: When Abu Mu'awiyah was asked about the Hadiths of Al-A'mash, he would say: "The Hadith of Al-A'mash has become like colocynth (bitter) in my mouth," or "more bitter than colocynth," due to how often he repeated the Hadith of Al-A'mash.
689 - I asked my father about Matar Al-Warraq, did he hear from Raja' bin Haywah? He said: "He did hear from him, I think." My father said: Some people said Qatada did not hear from Raja' bin Haywah, rather it is from Matar. My father denied that strongly and said: "No, Qatada narrated from him."
690 - I heard my father say: Umar bin Abi Za'idah is the brother of Zakariya bin Abi Za'idah, and Umar is older than Zakariya. Umar heard from Qais bin Abi Hazim, and Zakariya died before him. Both are trustworthy. My father said: And they say that Umar used to hold the view of Qadar (free will), and he was older than Zakariya.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
691 - I heard my father say: Abdul-Warith said: When Ayyub arrived from Mecca or Hijaz, he would say: "Memorize, for I forget."
692 - I asked my father about the Hadith of Hammad bin Zaid from Dawud from Ata that Abu Darda prayed Maghrib as four [Rak'ahs] then prayed one Rak'ah, then said: "Three and two." My father said: He means Ata Al-Khurasani.
693 - I asked my father about the Hadith of Hammad bin Zaid from Khalid from Abu Qilaba from Abu Al-Ash'ath, hearing Uthman regarding Zakat al-Fitr being a Sa'. My father said: Sulayman bin Harb told us from Hammad bin Zaid from Ayyub with this. My father said: So I narrated it to Ibn Mahdi, and he said: "He erred." So I returned to Sulayman later, and he retracted and said: "It is from Khalid."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
