694 - I asked my father about the Hadith of Hammad bin Zaid from Mujalid from Al-Sha'bi from Jabir bin Abdullah, who said: "Umar sent us in a group to Kufa, and he walked with us to a place which he named." My father said: "It is only from Al-Sha'bi from Qaraza bin Ka'b."
695 - Abdullah told us, saying: Uqbah bin Mukram Al-Ammi told me, saying: Al-Walid bin Khalid bin Sakhr—meaning Abu Al-Abbas Al-A'rabi—told us from Shu'ba, who said: Ayyub said to me: "Do not narrate from Khilas, for he is a Sahafi (one who learns from manuscripts/books and misreads)."
696 - Abdullah told us, saying: I heard Abu Malik say: Husayn bin Habban and Abbas said to Yahya bin Ma'in: "If only you would hold your tongue regarding people, for indeed Ahmad is cautious about that." He said: "By Allah, he was harsher in speaking about men (narrators) than me, but today he is holding himself back."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
697 - My father told me, saying: Abdul-Wahid Al-Haddad Abu Ubaydah told us, saying: Umar—meaning Ibn Abi Za'idah—told us from Abdullah bin Abi Al-Safar from Al-Sha'bi, who said: Qatada asked me about the two ears: Are they from the head or from the face? He said: I said: "What is in front of them is from the face, and the back of them is from the head."
698 - My father told me, saying: Asbat told us, saying: Mutarrif told us from 'Amir, who said: Mu'awiyah bin Qurra asked me about the two ears, and I did not know what to say to him except that I said: "As for what faces forward, it is from the face, and what faces backward is from the head."
699 - My father told me, saying: Affan told us, saying: Shu'ba told us from Qatada, who said: I and Abu Ma'shar went to Al-Sha'bi, and they said: "He is not here." He said: I said: "Where does he go?" They said: "We do not know." He said: I said: "Does he go without informing his family?"

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
700 - Abdullah told us, saying: Abu Hafs Amr bin Ali told me, saying: Affan told us, saying: Shu'ba told us: Qatada informed me, saying: I and Abu Ma'shar went to Al-Sha'bi's house but we did not find him. I said: "Where does he go?" They said: "He went for a need." I said: "Does he go without consulting you?" They said: "Yes."
701 - My father told us, saying: Abu Bakr bin Ayyash told us in Kufa from Abdul-Malik bin Umayr, who said: I saw a Burnus (hooded cloak) on Abu Musa.
702 - My father told me, saying: Ahmad bin Abdul-Malik told us, saying: Zuhayr told us, saying: Abdul-Malik bin Umayr told us, saying: I saw Abu Musa wearing a Muqatta'ah (cut garment) and a Mutraf (bordered garment).
703 - My father told me, saying: Ghassan bin Al-Rabi' told us, saying: Abu Isra'il told us from Abdul-Malik bin Umayr, who said: It used to be said: "The distress of Hadith is lying, its blight is forgetfulness, and its waste is narrating it to one who is not fit for it."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
704 - My father told me, saying: Abu Bakr bin Ayyash told us, saying: I said to Ata bin Al-Sa'ib: "O Abu Zaid!"
705 - My father told me, saying: Abu Bakr bin Ayyash told us in Kufa from Al-Hasan bin Ubaydullah, who said: I said to Abdur-Rahman bin Al-Aswad: "What is the matter with you that you do not have [a Mushaf/commentary] like Ibrahim?" He said: "It used to be said: Strip the Quran [keep it bare of commentary or dots]."
706 - My father told me, saying: Abu Bakr bin Ayyash told us in Kufa, saying: Aslam Al-Minqari told me, saying: I caught Salih bin Musarrih in prayer while he was reciting, and his eyes were pouring tears. I heard my father say: Salih bin Musarrih was from the Kharijites, I think.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
707 - My father told me, saying: Abu Bakr bin Ayyash told us, saying: Abu Sa'd said: "I saw the Mushafs in their hands and the swords in their hands while they were running violently," meaning on the day of Shabib the Kharijite.
708 - I asked my father about the Hadith of Al-Bara' bin Azib regarding raising [hands], so he said: Muhammad bin Ja'far Ghundar told us, saying: Shu'ba told us from Yazid bin Abi Ziyad, who said: I heard Ibn Abi Layla saying: I heard Al-Bara' narrating to a people, among them was Ka'b bin Ujrah. He said: "I saw the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, when he started the prayer, he raised his hands." My father said: Sufyan bin Uyaynah used to say: "We heard it from Yazid like this." Sufyan said: "Then I came to Kufa one time, and he was saying: 'Then he did not repeat,' [raising them]." My father told me from Muhammad bin Abdullah bin Numayr, who said: "I looked into the book of Ibn Abi Layla, and behold, he narrates it from Yazid bin Abi Ziyad." My father said: Waki' narrated it to us; he heard it from Ibn Abi Layla from Al-Hakam and Isa from Abdur-Rahman bin Abi Layla. And my father used to mention the Hadith of Al-Hakam and Isa, saying: "It is only the Hadith of Yazid bin Abi Ziyad, just as Ibn Numayr saw in the book of Ibn Abi Layla." My father said: Ibn Abi Layla had a bad memory, and Yazid bin Abi Ziyad was not a Hafiz.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
709 - I said to my father: The Hadith of Asim bin Kulayb, the Hadith of Abdullah. He said: Waki' narrated it to us in the Jama'ah. He said: Sufyan told us from Asim bin Kulayb from Abdur-Rahman bin Al-Aswad from Alqamah, who said: Ibn Mas'ud said: "Shall I not pray with you the prayer of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace?" He said: "So he prayed and did not raise his hands except once." My father told me, saying: Waki' narrated it to us another time with his exact chain, so he said: Abdullah said: "I will pray with you the prayer of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace," so he raised his hands in the beginning.
710 - My father told me, saying: Abu Abdur-Rahman Al-Darir told us, saying: Waki' used to sometimes say: "Meaning, then he did not repeat." My father said: Waki' used to say this from himself: "Meaning, then he did not repeat."
711 - My father said: Al-Ashja'i said: "So he raised his hands in the first thing."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
712 - I mentioned to my father the Hadith of Al-Thawri from Husayn from Ibrahim from Abdullah that he used to raise his hands at the beginning of the prayer and then not repeat it. My father said: Hushaym told us, saying: Husayn told us from Ibrahim—Ibrahim did not pass it beyond himself [Mursal]. And Hushaym is more knowledgeable about the Hadith of Husayn.
713 - My father said: The Hadith of Asim bin Kulayb was narrated by Ibn Idris, and he did not say: "Then he did not repeat."
714 - My father told me, saying: Yahya bin Adam told us, saying: Abdullah bin Idris dictated it to me from his book from Asim bin Kulayb from Abdur-Rahman bin Al-Aswad, who said: Alqamah told us from Abdullah, who said: "The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, taught us the prayer. He said 'Allahu Akbar' and raised his hands, then he bowed and clasped his hands (*Tabbaqa*) and placed them between his knees." So this reached

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text: Sa'd [bin Abi Waqqas], so he said: "My brother spoke the truth. We used to do that, then we were commanded with this [instead] and he grabbed his knees." Asim bin Kulayb narrated it to me like this. My father said: This wording is different from the wording of Waki'. Waki' used to consolidate/summarize (*Yuthabbij*) the Hadith because he used to burden himself with memorizing the Hadith [without looking at the book].

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text: 715 - My father told me, saying: Waki' told us from his father from Yazid from Ibn Abi Layla from Al-Bara' from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, similar to it—meaning the Hadith of Shu'ba from Yazid—and he did not say: "Then he did not repeat."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text: 716 - I mentioned to my father the Hadith of Muhammad bin Jabir from Hammad from Ibrahim from Alqamah from Abdullah regarding raising [hands]. He said: "What is this Ibn Jabir's Hadith worth? This is a Denounced (*Munkar*) Hadith; I deny it strongly."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
717 - My father told me, saying: Waki' told us, saying: Abu Bakr bin Abdullah Al-Nahshali told us from Asim bin Kulayb from his father from Ali that he used to raise his hands when he started the prayer, then he would not repeat. He said: "And he had witnessed Siffin with him." My father said: "No one narrated it from Asim other than Abu Bakr Al-Nahshali, as far as I know."
718 - I heard my father say: Ibn Uyaynah said: "Two righteous men told us, by whom rain is sought: Ibn Ajlan and Yazid bin Yazid bin Jabir."
719 - I asked Yahya bin Ma'in about Muhammad bin Jabir, so he criticized him and said: "No one narrates from him except one who is worse than him."
720 - My father told me, saying: Yahya bin Sa'id told us from Sufyan from

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
Tariq, who said: I asked Al-Sha'bi about a woman who left, disobeying her husband. He said: "Even if she stayed for twenty years, she has no maintenance (*Nafaqah*)."
721 - My father told me, saying: Waki' told us from Sufyan from Musa Al-Juhani from Al-Sha'bi similarly. My father said: It was said to Yahya that people narrate it from Musa Al-Juhani. So he said: "If it were from Musa, it would be more beloved to me; how can I come across Tariq?" Musa was more impressive to Yahya than Tariq; Tariq has some weakness in his Hadith. I said to my father: "But Abu Khaythama narrated it to us; he heard it from Al-Ashja'i from Sufyan from Tariq AND Musa Al-Juhani from Al-Sha'bi." He said: "Yahya was correct, and Waki' was correct."
722 - I heard my father say: Ibn Uyaynah narrated to us one day the Hadith of Asim from Zirr from Safwan regarding wiping over the socks. He said: Asim told us, he heard Zirr, I came to Safwan. Then Sufyan said: "Who remains who narrates this from Asim?" My father said: When he reached the place of wiping, he said: "We used to, when we were on a journey or travelers..." He faltered

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
[with] doubt, then he said: "I see we took what we said."
723 - I heard my father say: Hushaym narrated to us one day, saying: Ibn Shubruma informed us from Abdullah bin Shaddad from Ibn Abbas: "Wine was forbidden itself," then he narrated the Hadith. My father said: Abu Al-Ahwas Muhammad bin Hayyan informed me that Hushaym narrated to them from Ibn Shubruma, then Hushaym moved his lips and said: "From whom did he narrate it?" Then he said: "From Abdullah bin Shaddad from Ibn Abbas this Hadith." My father said: Ibn Shubruma did not hear anything from Abdullah bin Shaddad.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
724 - My father said: A man informed me that when Ibn Ulayyah spoke regarding the Quran [createdness], he entered upon Muhammad bin Harun while he was sitting on his throne. When he saw Ibn Ulayyah, he said: "O Son of Such-and-Such"—he mentioned the Zay [for Zaniyah/Adulteress]—"You left everything until you spoke regarding the Quran?" He said: So Ibn Ulayyah said: "May I be made your ransom, a slip of a scholar."
725 - My father told me, saying: Ibn Abi Za'idah told us, saying: Mujalid told us from 'Amir, who said: Abdullah bin Ja'far told me, saying: "I never asked Ali for anything ever and said 'By the right of Ja'far' except that he gave it to me."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
726 - My father said: Abu Mu'awiyah Al-Darir is disturbed (*Mudtarib*) in other than the Hadith of Al-A'mash; he does not memorize them well.
727 - My father said: Abbad bin Abbad used to dye either his beard or his head yellow.
728 - My father told me, saying: Abbad bin Abbad bin Habib bin Al-Muhallab bin Abi Sufrah told us, saying: Awf told us from Abu Raja' from Samurah from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. My father said: It is as if I hear Abbad saying in this Hadith: "The stone rolled (*Tadahdah*) here."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
729 - I heard my father, and he dictated to me an dictation, saying: "Write: As for the one who says that saying, neither Friday [prayer] nor any other is to be prayed behind him. However, we do not leave attending it; but if a man prays, he repeats the prayer"—meaning whoever says the Quran is created.
730 - My father said: We entered upon Abbad bin Abbad while he was reclining. He was an intelligent, cultured man. I saw him having come out from Harun [Al-Rashid], wearing black.
731 - I heard my father say: Hasan bin Salih is more established (*Athbat*) to me in Hadith than Sharik.
732 - My father told me, saying: Al-Hajjaj told us, saying: I asked Shu'ba about the 'Ata (stipend/pension). He said: "Every person narrated from him except a few who were in the 'Ata. Sa'd bin Ubaydah was with the group when Al-Husayn was killed. Al-Hasan, Ibn Sirin, Abu Ishaq, Zubayd, and others were in the 'Ata. Zubayd was among those who attended the mosque when Zaid was killed. Yusuf bin Umar ordered: 'Whoever from the people of the Diwan (registry) does not attend the mosque, I will do such-and-such to him.' So they attended, and among them was Zubayd. Mis'ar did not attend, and he was in the 'Ata."
733 - My father said: Yahya bin Sa'id Al-Qattan used to choose Mulazim bin Amr over Ikrimah bin Ammar; meaning he says he is more established in Hadith than him. My father said: Mulazim is trustworthy. Ikrimah bin Ammar is disturbed (*Mudtarib*) regarding other than Iyas bin Salamah; and it seems his Hadith from Iyas bin Salamah is good (*Salih*).

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
734 - I heard my father say: Yahya bin Sa'id Al-Qattan heard from Malik bin Anas during the life of Hisham bin Urwah. So in most of it are good things. "Ibn Shihab told us," "Nafi' told us." Yahya said: So Malik used to say to me: "What did Hisham bin Urwah tell you?"
735 - I heard my father say: A man told us—and he once said: Some of our companions claimed—he said: Hushaym told us from Mansur from Al-Hasan from Al-Ahnaf bin Qays, who said: "The one consulted is entrusted."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text:
736 - Abdullah told us, he said: Al-Qawariri told us, he said: Hushaym told us, from Mansur, from Al-Hasan, from Al-Ahnaf, he said: The one consulted is entrusted. 737 - My father told me, he said: Hasan Al-Ashyab told us, he said: Sa'd bin Ibrahim bin Sa'd came to me and said: 'Compare with me the Hadith of Shu'bah.' 738 - My father said: Matar Al-Warraq bin Tahman, his Kunya is Abu Raja'. 739 - My father told me, he said: Hajjaj told us, from Jarir bin Hazim, he said: I saw Abdullah bin Kathir, and I saw an eloquent man. 740 - I heard my father say: Abd Al-Wahhab Al-Thaqafi is more reliable than Abd Al-A'la Al-Sami. Al-Thaqafi is more known and trustworthy among his companions than Abd Al-A'la. 741 - I heard my father say: Dawud bin Abi Hind is trustworthy, trustworthy (Thiqah Thiqah). 742 - My father said: Ali bin Mushir is more reliable than Abu Mu'awiyah Al-Darir in Hadith.

736 - Abdullah told us, he said: Al-Qawariri told us, he said: Hushaym told us, from Mansur, from Al-Hasan, from Al-Ahnaf, he said: The one consulted is entrusted. 737 - My father told me, he said: Hasan Al-Ashyab told us, he said: Sa'd bin Ibrahim bin Sa'd came to me and said: 'Compare with me the Hadith of Shu'bah.' 738 - My father said: Matar Al-Warraq bin Tahman, his Kunya is Abu Raja'. 739 - My father told me, he said: Hajjaj told us, from Jarir bin Hazim, he said: I saw Abdullah bin Kathir, and I saw an eloquent man. 740 - I heard my father say: Abd Al-Wahhab Al-Thaqafi is more reliable than Abd Al-A'la Al-Sami. Al-Thaqafi is more known and trustworthy among his companions than Abd Al-A'la. 741 - I heard my father say: Dawud bin Abi Hind is trustworthy, trustworthy (Thiqah Thiqah). 742 - My father said: Ali bin Mushir is more reliable than Abu Mu'awiyah Al-Darir in Hadith.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text:
743 - My father said: Ali bin Hafs told us, he said: Mahdi bin Maymun said: Hisham said: When Muhammad bin Sirin used to narrate the Hadith of Al-A'maq (the depths/valleys?), he would say: 'Meet Humayd bin Hilal and ask him about his Hadith.' Mahdi said: So Humayd bin Hilal Al-Adawi from Banu Tamim told us, he said: Abu Qatadah Al-Adawi told us, from Usayr bin Jabir, he said: We were with Abdullah bin Mas'ud when a red wind blew... and he mentioned the Hadith.

743 - My father said: Ali bin Hafs told us, he said: Mahdi bin Maymun said: Hisham said: When Muhammad bin Sirin used to narrate the Hadith of Al-A'maq (the depths/valleys?), he would say: 'Meet Humayd bin Hilal and ask him about his Hadith.' Mahdi said: So Humayd bin Hilal Al-Adawi from Banu Tamim told us, he said: Abu Qatadah Al-Adawi told us, from Usayr bin Jabir, he said: We were with Abdullah bin Mas'ud when a red wind blew... and he mentioned the Hadith.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text:
744 - My father told me, he said: Muhammad bin Ja'far told us, he said: Shu'bah told us, he said: I heard Khalid—meaning Al-Hadhdha'—narrating from Ghaylan bin Jarir from Mutarrif that he said: Do not say 'Indeed Allah says,' but say 'Indeed Allah said.' He said: And one of them lies twice; if he is asked 'What is this?', he says 'Nothing,' while it is something, not nothing. 745 - I heard my father, and he mentioned Abu Usamah, he said: He was reliable (Thabt); he hardly ever erred; how reliable he was! My father said: Yahya bin Sa'id said—and that was because it was said to him that Abu Usamah claims that Shu'bah dictated to him—so Yahya said: 'Abu Usamah lied. Shu'bah said: I did not dictate to anyone except so-and-so'—I think he mentioned Ibn Bazi'—'a person who was with Al-Mahdi. He said: Either you dictate to me or I will inflict harm upon you.' He said: 'So I dictated to him.' 746 - I heard my father say: Yahya bin Sa'id was a soft-hearted man; he would perhaps cry—meaning when he narrated. My father said: And we have not seen the like of Yahya bin Sa'id in this matter—meaning in Hadith—he is the master of this matter. I said to him: 'Nor Hushaym?' He said: 'Hushaym was a Sheikh; we have not seen the like of Yahya.' And he began elevating his status greatly. 747 - I heard my father say: Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaybah is truthful (Saduq).

744 - My father told me, he said: Muhammad bin Ja'far told us, he said: Shu'bah told us, he said: I heard Khalid—meaning Al-Hadhdha'—narrating from Ghaylan bin Jarir from Mutarrif that he said: Do not say 'Indeed Allah says,' but say 'Indeed Allah said.' He said: And one of them lies twice; if he is asked 'What is this?', he says 'Nothing,' while it is something, not nothing. 745 - I heard my father, and he mentioned Abu Usamah, he said: He was reliable (Thabt); he hardly ever erred; how reliable he was! My father said: Yahya bin Sa'id said—and that was because it was said to him that Abu Usamah claims that Shu'bah dictated to him—so Yahya said: 'Abu Usamah lied. Shu'bah said: I did not dictate to anyone except so-and-so'—I think he mentioned Ibn Bazi'—'a person who was with Al-Mahdi. He said: Either you dictate to me or I will inflict harm upon you.' He said: 'So I dictated to him.' 746 - I heard my father say: Yahya bin Sa'id was a soft-hearted man; he would perhaps cry—meaning when he narrated. My father said: And we have not seen the like of Yahya bin Sa'id in this matter—meaning in Hadith—he is the master of this matter. I said to him: 'Nor Hushaym?' He said: 'Hushaym was a Sheikh; we have not seen the like of Yahya.' And he began elevating his status greatly. 747 - I heard my father say: Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaybah is truthful (Saduq).

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text:
748 - I asked my father about Abd Al-Rahman bin Qays Al-Za'farani. He said: He was a neighbor of Hammad bin Mas'adah, narrating from Ibn Awn. He said: I saw him in Basra, and he came to us in Baghdad. He was from Wasit, and he was nothing [in Hadith]; his Hadith is weak Hadith. Then he went out to Nishapur, and he was nothing; abandoned in Hadith (Matruk al-Hadith). 749 - My father said: Zayd bin Al-Hubab Abu Al-Husayn Al-Ulkali said to me: 'Benefit me from Ibn Ulayyah.' He said: So I brought him books from the Hadith of Isma'il. He began hardly writing anything except the opinions of men, small things; Ibn Awn from Muhammad, and Khalid from Abu Qilabah, and the opinion of men. Then he went to Ibn Ulayyah and asked him about those Hadiths. And Ibn Ulayyah used to like, if he was asked, to be asked about Musnad Hadiths or Isnad. 750 - My father said: Shu'ayb bin Harb said to me: 'Give me the book of Ibn Uyaynah from Al-Zuhri.' So I brought him my book. I came after he had taken the book from him (?), and he passed by a Hadith and said: 'Did Sufyan hear this from Al-Zuhri?' So I remained silent, or I said: 'I do not know.' 751 - I asked my father about Farqad Al-Sabakhi. He said: 'He is not strong in Hadith.' I said: 'Is he weak?' He said: 'He is not [as bad] as that.'

748 - I asked my father about Abd Al-Rahman bin Qays Al-Za'farani. He said: He was a neighbor of Hammad bin Mas'adah, narrating from Ibn Awn. He said: I saw him in Basra, and he came to us in Baghdad. He was from Wasit, and he was nothing [in Hadith]; his Hadith is weak Hadith. Then he went out to Nishapur, and he was nothing; abandoned in Hadith (Matruk al-Hadith). 749 - My father said: Zayd bin Al-Hubab Abu Al-Husayn Al-Ulkali said to me: 'Benefit me from Ibn Ulayyah.' He said: So I brought him books from the Hadith of Isma'il. He began hardly writing anything except the opinions of men, small things; Ibn Awn from Muhammad, and Khalid from Abu Qilabah, and the opinion of men. Then he went to Ibn Ulayyah and asked him about those Hadiths. And Ibn Ulayyah used to like, if he was asked, to be asked about Musnad Hadiths or Isnad. 750 - My father said: Shu'ayb bin Harb said to me: 'Give me the book of Ibn Uyaynah from Al-Zuhri.' So I brought him my book. I came after he had taken the book from him (?), and he passed by a Hadith and said: 'Did Sufyan hear this from Al-Zuhri?' So I remained silent, or I said: 'I do not know.' 751 - I asked my father about Farqad Al-Sabakhi. He said: 'He is not strong in Hadith.' I said: 'Is he weak?' He said: 'He is not [as bad] as that.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text:
752 - And I asked him about Hisham bin Hujayr. He said: 'He is not strong.' I said: 'Is he weak?' He said: 'He is not [as bad] as that.' 753 - My father said: Shu'ayb bin Harb died in Mecca at night, and he had abdominal illness, so we feared for him. 754 - I said to my father: Amr bin Muslim Al-Jandi, from whom Ibn Uyaynah and Ma'mar narrated. I said: 'Is he weaker than Hisham?' He said: 'He is weak.' 755 - I asked my father about Abu Al-Muhajjal. He said: Al-Thawri, Jarir, Abu Ishaq Al-Fazari, and Sharik narrated from him. I have known nothing but good. I said: 'What is his name?' He said: 'I do not know.'

752 - And I asked him about Hisham bin Hujayr. He said: 'He is not strong.' I said: 'Is he weak?' He said: 'He is not [as bad] as that.' 753 - My father said: Shu'ayb bin Harb died in Mecca at night, and he had abdominal illness, so we feared for him. 754 - I said to my father: Amr bin Muslim Al-Jandi, from whom Ibn Uyaynah and Ma'mar narrated. I said: 'Is he weaker than Hisham?' He said: 'He is weak.' 755 - I asked my father about Abu Al-Muhajjal. He said: Al-Thawri, Jarir, Abu Ishaq Al-Fazari, and Sharik narrated from him. I have known nothing but good. I said: 'What is his name?' He said: 'I do not know.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text:
756 - I heard Muhammad bin Ishkab mention from Ja'far bin Awn, from Abu Janab, from Abu Al-Muhajjal Al-Rudayni bin Makhlad. 757 - I said to my father: Do you preserve from Ibn Yaman, from Sufyan, from Bayan, from Sa'id bin Jubayr: 'And Fitna is worse than killing,' he said: 'Shirk'? He said: 'This is like a dream.' 758 - I heard my father mention Qabisah and Abu Hudhayfah. He said: Qabisah is much more reliable than him—meaning in the Hadith of Sufyan. Abu Hudhayfah is almost nothing. And I have written from both of them. 759 - I heard him mention Raqabah bin Masqalah. He said: A trustworthy Sheikh from the trustworthy ones (Thiqat). Jarir, Ibn Uyaynah, and Ibn Abi Ghaniyah narrated to us from him. And Abu Awanah narrated from him; a trustworthy, reliable Sheikh.

756 - I heard Muhammad bin Ishkab mention from Ja'far bin Awn, from Abu Janab, from Abu Al-Muhajjal Al-Rudayni bin Makhlad. 757 - I said to my father: Do you preserve from Ibn Yaman, from Sufyan, from Bayan, from Sa'id bin Jubayr: 'And Fitna is worse than killing,' he said: 'Shirk'? He said: 'This is like a dream.' 758 - I heard my father mention Qabisah and Abu Hudhayfah. He said: Qabisah is much more reliable than him—meaning in the Hadith of Sufyan. Abu Hudhayfah is almost nothing. And I have written from both of them. 759 - I heard him mention Raqabah bin Masqalah. He said: A trustworthy Sheikh from the trustworthy ones (Thiqat). Jarir, Ibn Uyaynah, and Ibn Abi Ghaniyah narrated to us from him. And Abu Awanah narrated from him; a trustworthy, reliable Sheikh.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text:
760 - I heard my father say: A man passed by Raqabah, so Raqabah said to him: 'Where did you come from?' He said: 'From Abu Hanifa.' He said: 'Speech you have not chewed, and you return to your family without trust.' 761 - My father said: Al-Thawri did not hear from Abu Awn except one Hadith from Abdullah bin Shaddad. 762 - My father said: Yunus bin Ubayd did not hear anything from Nafi'; he only heard from Ibn Nafi' from his father. 763 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Abd Al-Malik bin Humayd bin Abi Ghaniyah told us, he said: A man from the perfumers (Attarin) told us, from Raqabah bin Masqalah, he said: He narrated a Hadith to us and made grammatical errors in it. He said: We said: 'What is wrong with you making errors?' He said: 'This is how he narrated to me.' 764 - I asked my father about Al-Hasan bin Yazid Al-Asamm who narrates from Al-Suddi. He said: Trustworthy, there is no harm in him, except that he narrated from Al-Suddi from Aws bin Dab'aj—this is how he used to say it. I said: Then Aws bin Dam'aj, who narrates from him? He said: Isma'il bin Raja' Al-Zubaydi, Abu Ishaq Al-Hamdani, Al-Suddi, and Ibn Abi Khalid.

760 - I heard my father say: A man passed by Raqabah, so Raqabah said to him: 'Where did you come from?' He said: 'From Abu Hanifa.' He said: 'Speech you have not chewed, and you return to your family without trust.' 761 - My father said: Al-Thawri did not hear from Abu Awn except one Hadith from Abdullah bin Shaddad. 762 - My father said: Yunus bin Ubayd did not hear anything from Nafi'; he only heard from Ibn Nafi' from his father. 763 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Abd Al-Malik bin Humayd bin Abi Ghaniyah told us, he said: A man from the perfumers (Attarin) told us, from Raqabah bin Masqalah, he said: He narrated a Hadith to us and made grammatical errors in it. He said: We said: 'What is wrong with you making errors?' He said: 'This is how he narrated to me.' 764 - I asked my father about Al-Hasan bin Yazid Al-Asamm who narrates from Al-Suddi. He said: Trustworthy, there is no harm in him, except that he narrated from Al-Suddi from Aws bin Dab'aj—this is how he used to say it. I said: Then Aws bin Dam'aj, who narrates from him? He said: Isma'il bin Raja' Al-Zubaydi, Abu Ishaq Al-Hamdani, Al-Suddi, and Ibn Abi Khalid.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text:
765 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Sa'id told us, from Isma'il bin Abi Khalid, he said: I heard Aws bin Dam'aj say: I was informed that whoever misses the Asr prayer, it is as if he has lost his family and wealth. 766 - I asked my father about Dawud bin Al-Muhabbar. He laughed and said: 'Almost nothing; did that one even know what Hadith is?' 767 - I said to my father: Husayn and Al-Suddi from Abu Malik; what is the name of Abu Malik? He said: 'I do not know.' I asked Yahya bin Ma'in about the name of this Abu Malik. He said: 'His name is Ghazwan Al-Ghifari.' 768 - I asked my father about Bazi' who narrates from Al-Dahhak. He said: 'I do not see him as significant in Hadith.' 769 - I asked Yahya bin Ma'in about the name of Abu Malik. He said: 'His name is Ghazwan.' 770 - And I asked him about Muhammad bin Jabir. He was harsh regarding him and said: 'No one narrates from him except one who is worse than him.'

765 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Sa'id told us, from Isma'il bin Abi Khalid, he said: I heard Aws bin Dam'aj say: I was informed that whoever misses the Asr prayer, it is as if he has lost his family and wealth. 766 - I asked my father about Dawud bin Al-Muhabbar. He laughed and said: 'Almost nothing; did that one even know what Hadith is?' 767 - I said to my father: Husayn and Al-Suddi from Abu Malik; what is the name of Abu Malik? He said: 'I do not know.' I asked Yahya bin Ma'in about the name of this Abu Malik. He said: 'His name is Ghazwan Al-Ghifari.' 768 - I asked my father about Bazi' who narrates from Al-Dahhak. He said: 'I do not see him as significant in Hadith.' 769 - I asked Yahya bin Ma'in about the name of Abu Malik. He said: 'His name is Ghazwan.' 770 - And I asked him about Muhammad bin Jabir. He was harsh regarding him and said: 'No one narrates from him except one who is worse than him.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text:
771 - I asked my father about Qabus bin Abi Zibyan. He said: 'He is not that strong.' And he said: Jarir was asked about something from the Hadiths of Qabus, so he said: 'Qabus has perished (nafaqa), perished.'

771 - I asked my father about Qabus bin Abi Zibyan. He said: 'He is not that strong.' And he said: Jarir was asked about something from the Hadiths of Qabus, so he said: 'Qabus has perished (nafaqa), perished.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text:
772 - My father was asked about Abu Usamah and Abu Asim: Who is more reliable among them in Hadith? He said: 'Abu Usamah is more reliable than a hundred like Abu Asim.' My father said: 'Abu Usamah was reliable (Thabt), correct in his book.' 773 - My father told me, he said: Abd Al-Razzaq told us, he said: Sufyan said: Bukayr bin Ata' had two Hadiths; Shu'bah heard one of them and did not hear the other. 774 - I heard my father mention Musa bin Qays, so he said: 'I know nothing but good.'

772 - My father was asked about Abu Usamah and Abu Asim: Who is more reliable among them in Hadith? He said: 'Abu Usamah is more reliable than a hundred like Abu Asim.' My father said: 'Abu Usamah was reliable (Thabt), correct in his book.' 773 - My father told me, he said: Abd Al-Razzaq told us, he said: Sufyan said: Bukayr bin Ata' had two Hadiths; Shu'bah heard one of them and did not hear the other. 774 - I heard my father mention Musa bin Qays, so he said: 'I know nothing but good.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text:
775 - I heard my father mention Al-Jald bin Ayyub, so he said: 'His Hadith is worth nothing.' I said to him: 'Is Al-Jald weak?' He said: 'Yes, weak in Hadith.' I heard Abu Ma'mar say: I never heard Ibn Al-Mubarak mention anyone with evil except one day Al-Jald bin Ayyub was mentioned in his presence, so he said: 'What is the Hadith of Al-Jald? And what is Al-Jald from Al-Jald (toughness/endurance)?' And my father said: Yazid bin Zuray' said: 'That Abu Hanifa did not find anything to use as proof except Al-Jald, the Hadith of menstruation.' 776 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Adam told us, he said: Zuhayr said: I saw Ash'ath bin Sawwar at Abu Al-Zubayr's standing, with people between him (and Abu Al-Zubayr). Abu Al-Zubayr was narrating, and Ash'ath would say: 'How did he say?' and 'What did he say?' 777 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Adam told us, he said: Zuhayr told us, from Mutarrif, from Abu Al-Jahm, and he praised him with good. 778 - My father said: Abu Shihab Al-Hannat died before Sharik.

775 - I heard my father mention Al-Jald bin Ayyub, so he said: 'His Hadith is worth nothing.' I said to him: 'Is Al-Jald weak?' He said: 'Yes, weak in Hadith.' I heard Abu Ma'mar say: I never heard Ibn Al-Mubarak mention anyone with evil except one day Al-Jald bin Ayyub was mentioned in his presence, so he said: 'What is the Hadith of Al-Jald? And what is Al-Jald from Al-Jald (toughness/endurance)?' And my father said: Yazid bin Zuray' said: 'That Abu Hanifa did not find anything to use as proof except Al-Jald, the Hadith of menstruation.' 776 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Adam told us, he said: Zuhayr said: I saw Ash'ath bin Sawwar at Abu Al-Zubayr's standing, with people between him (and Abu Al-Zubayr). Abu Al-Zubayr was narrating, and Ash'ath would say: 'How did he say?' and 'What did he say?' 777 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Adam told us, he said: Zuhayr told us, from Mutarrif, from Abu Al-Jahm, and he praised him with good. 778 - My father said: Abu Shihab Al-Hannat died before Sharik.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text:
779 - My father told me, he said: Abu Ahmad Al-Zubayri told us, he said: Abd Al-Rahman bin Al-Ghasil told us, he said: I saw Sahl bin Sa'd; he had shoulder-length hair (Jummah), he dyed his beard yellow, and upon him was a Qatari cloak. 780 - Abdullah told us, he said: Abu Dawud Al-Mubaraki told us, he said: Abu Shihab Al-Hannat died in the year seventy-one or seventy-two—Abdullah is in doubt.

779 - My father told me, he said: Abu Ahmad Al-Zubayri told us, he said: Abd Al-Rahman bin Al-Ghasil told us, he said: I saw Sahl bin Sa'd; he had shoulder-length hair (Jummah), he dyed his beard yellow, and upon him was a Qatari cloak. 780 - Abdullah told us, he said: Abu Dawud Al-Mubaraki told us, he said: Abu Shihab Al-Hannat died in the year seventy-one or seventy-two—Abdullah is in doubt.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text:
781 - I heard my father say: Mukhariq bin Khalifah Al-Ahmasi is trustworthy, trustworthy (Thiqah Thiqah). Tariq bin Abd Al-Rahman is below him; his Hadith is not that (strong). 782 - My father said: Yafi' bin Wahb, whom Shu'bah narrated from, is weak in Hadith. 783 - My father told us, he said: I heard Muhammad bin Al-Sammak say: I wrote to a friend of mine: 'Indeed, hope is a rope in your heart, a shackle on your foot. So remove hope from your heart, and you will untie the shackle from your foot.' 784 - My father said: Waki', when he came upon a Hadith of Al-A'mash, would clarify and say: 'Al-A'mash told us, Al-A'mash told us.' 785 - My father said: Waki' said: The first judge sent to Kufa was... and he mentioned Salman bin Rabi'ah.

781 - I heard my father say: Mukhariq bin Khalifah Al-Ahmasi is trustworthy, trustworthy (Thiqah Thiqah). Tariq bin Abd Al-Rahman is below him; his Hadith is not that (strong). 782 - My father said: Yafi' bin Wahb, whom Shu'bah narrated from, is weak in Hadith. 783 - My father told us, he said: I heard Muhammad bin Al-Sammak say: I wrote to a friend of mine: 'Indeed, hope is a rope in your heart, a shackle on your foot. So remove hope from your heart, and you will untie the shackle from your foot.' 784 - My father said: Waki', when he came upon a Hadith of Al-A'mash, would clarify and say: 'Al-A'mash told us, Al-A'mash told us.' 785 - My father said: Waki' said: The first judge sent to Kufa was... and he mentioned Salman bin Rabi'ah.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text:
786 - I asked him about Ata' Al-Attar. He said: Hammad bin Salamah and Hisham bin Hassan narrated from him. I said: 'How is his Hadith?' He said: 'How much did he narrate? A small amount.' 787 - My father said: Abd Al-A'la Al-Tha'labi is weak in Hadith. 788 - My father told me, he said: Hajjaj bin Muhammad told us, he said: Shu'bah said: Abu Mijlaz did not meet Hudhayfah. 789 - My father said: I saw Ibn Khasif, and it used to be said that he held the view of the Khawarij. 790 - I heard my father say: Ibn Mahdi makes more Tashif (misreading/mispronunciation) than Waki', and Waki' makes more errors than Ibn Mahdi. Waki' has little Tashif.

786 - I asked him about Ata' Al-Attar. He said: Hammad bin Salamah and Hisham bin Hassan narrated from him. I said: 'How is his Hadith?' He said: 'How much did he narrate? A small amount.' 787 - My father said: Abd Al-A'la Al-Tha'labi is weak in Hadith. 788 - My father told me, he said: Hajjaj bin Muhammad told us, he said: Shu'bah said: Abu Mijlaz did not meet Hudhayfah. 789 - My father said: I saw Ibn Khasif, and it used to be said that he held the view of the Khawarij. 790 - I heard my father say: Ibn Mahdi makes more Tashif (misreading/mispronunciation) than Waki', and Waki' makes more errors than Ibn Mahdi. Waki' has little Tashif.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text:
791 - My father said: Hajjaj said: Shu'bah said: They used to say to Simak: 'Ikrimah from Ibn Abbas?' and he would say: 'Yes.' Shu'bah said: 'But I did not do that with him.' 792 - My father was asked about Ata' bin Al-Sa'ib and Simak. He said: 'How close they are! Simak elevates them from Ikrimah from Ibn Abbas, and Ata' from Sa'id from Ibn Abbas. How close they are!' 793 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Iyas bin Dughful told us, from Urwah bin Qabisah, from Adi bin Artah. Waki' said once: 'Amr bin Utbah,' but Yahya bin Ma'in corrected him and said later: 'Amr Al-Sulami.' He said: 'Friday is two steps: a step of degree (reward) and a step of expiation.' 794 - My father told me, he said: Abu Nu'aym told us, from Iyas bin Dughful, from Urwah bin Qabisah, from Adi bin Artah, from Amr bin Abasah, he said: 'Friday is two steps: a step of expiation and a step of degree.' 795 - I asked my father about Sulayman bin Abi Al-Mughirah. He said: 'A trustworthy Kufan Sheikh.' 796 - I heard my father say: 'Al-Ala' bin Abd Al-Karim is a trustworthy Kufan Sheikh.'

791 - My father said: Hajjaj said: Shu'bah said: They used to say to Simak: 'Ikrimah from Ibn Abbas?' and he would say: 'Yes.' Shu'bah said: 'But I did not do that with him.' 792 - My father was asked about Ata' bin Al-Sa'ib and Simak. He said: 'How close they are! Simak elevates them from Ikrimah from Ibn Abbas, and Ata' from Sa'id from Ibn Abbas. How close they are!' 793 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Iyas bin Dughful told us, from Urwah bin Qabisah, from Adi bin Artah. Waki' said once: 'Amr bin Utbah,' but Yahya bin Ma'in corrected him and said later: 'Amr Al-Sulami.' He said: 'Friday is two steps: a step of degree (reward) and a step of expiation.' 794 - My father told me, he said: Abu Nu'aym told us, from Iyas bin Dughful, from Urwah bin Qabisah, from Adi bin Artah, from Amr bin Abasah, he said: 'Friday is two steps: a step of expiation and a step of degree.' 795 - I asked my father about Sulayman bin Abi Al-Mughirah. He said: 'A trustworthy Kufan Sheikh.' 796 - I heard my father say: 'Al-Ala' bin Abd Al-Karim is a trustworthy Kufan Sheikh.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text:
797 - I asked my father about Bukayr bin Amir. He said: 'Kufan, he is not that strong in Hadith; he is not strong in Hadith.' 798 - I asked my father about Hakim bin Jubayr and Zayd bin Jubayr: Are they brothers? He said: 'No. Zayd bin Jubayr is Jushami then from Banu Tamim, and he is righteous in Hadith (Salih Al-Hadith). Hakim is weak in Hadith, inconsistent (Mudtarib), and he is a client of Banu Umayyah.' 799 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Ibn Hakim bin Jubayr claimed that his father was a client of Banu Umayyah. 800 - My father told me, he said: Muhammad bin Sawa' told us one day, saying: 'Musa bin Sarhan told us.' So I said to him: 'Abu Ubaydah Al-Haddad said: Musa bin Sarwan said.' So he retracted it or fell silent.

797 - I asked my father about Bukayr bin Amir. He said: 'Kufan, he is not that strong in Hadith; he is not strong in Hadith.' 798 - I asked my father about Hakim bin Jubayr and Zayd bin Jubayr: Are they brothers? He said: 'No. Zayd bin Jubayr is Jushami then from Banu Tamim, and he is righteous in Hadith (Salih Al-Hadith). Hakim is weak in Hadith, inconsistent (Mudtarib), and he is a client of Banu Umayyah.' 799 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Ibn Hakim bin Jubayr claimed that his father was a client of Banu Umayyah. 800 - My father told me, he said: Muhammad bin Sawa' told us one day, saying: 'Musa bin Sarhan told us.' So I said to him: 'Abu Ubaydah Al-Haddad said: Musa bin Sarwan said.' So he retracted it or fell silent.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text:
801 - I asked my father about Sulayman Al-Ahwal. He said: 'Meccan, the maternal uncle of Ibn Abi Najih, and he is Ibn Abi Muslim; trustworthy.' 802 - My father told me, he said: I heard Ibn Uyaynah say: 'Sulayman bin Abi Muslim Al-Ahwal, the maternal uncle of Ibn Abi Najih, told me.' 803 - I asked my father about Ya'qub bin Ata' bin Abi Rabah. He said: 'Weak in Hadith.' 804 - I asked my father about Yahya bin Abdullah Al-Jabir. He said: 'There is no harm in him. Shu'bah narrated a Hadith from him from Abu Majid, and Abu Majid is an unknown man, not known.' 805 - I asked him about Abd Rabbih. He said: 'A trustworthy Madini Sheikh, the brother of Yahya bin Sa'id.'

801 - I asked my father about Sulayman Al-Ahwal. He said: 'Meccan, the maternal uncle of Ibn Abi Najih, and he is Ibn Abi Muslim; trustworthy.' 802 - My father told me, he said: I heard Ibn Uyaynah say: 'Sulayman bin Abi Muslim Al-Ahwal, the maternal uncle of Ibn Abi Najih, told me.' 803 - I asked my father about Ya'qub bin Ata' bin Abi Rabah. He said: 'Weak in Hadith.' 804 - I asked my father about Yahya bin Abdullah Al-Jabir. He said: 'There is no harm in him. Shu'bah narrated a Hadith from him from Abu Majid, and Abu Majid is an unknown man, not known.' 805 - I asked him about Abd Rabbih. He said: 'A trustworthy Madini Sheikh, the brother of Yahya bin Sa'id.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text:
806 - I asked him about Ya'qub bin Qays. He said: 'Kufan, Yahya Al-Qattan and Muhammad bin Ubayd narrated from him; trustworthy.' 807 - I asked my father about Sulayman bin Suhaym. He said: 'There is no harm in him.' 808 - And Humayd Al-A'raj Humayd bin Qays, Meccan, the reciter of the people of Mecca; he is not strong in Hadith. 809 - My father said: Kathir bin Kathir is from Quraysh; trustworthy. 810 - My father told me, he said: Abu Sa'id Al-Haddad told us, from Ibn Uyaynah, from Humayd Al-A'raj, from Mujahid, that he recited: 'Khasir al-Dunya' (Loser of the world). 811 - And Yunus bin Abdullah Al-Jarmi is Kufan; Yahya bin Sa'id and Ibn Uyaynah narrated from him.

806 - I asked him about Ya'qub bin Qays. He said: 'Kufan, Yahya Al-Qattan and Muhammad bin Ubayd narrated from him; trustworthy.' 807 - I asked my father about Sulayman bin Suhaym. He said: 'There is no harm in him.' 808 - And Humayd Al-A'raj Humayd bin Qays, Meccan, the reciter of the people of Mecca; he is not strong in Hadith. 809 - My father said: Kathir bin Kathir is from Quraysh; trustworthy. 810 - My father told me, he said: Abu Sa'id Al-Haddad told us, from Ibn Uyaynah, from Humayd Al-A'raj, from Mujahid, that he recited: 'Khasir al-Dunya' (Loser of the world). 811 - And Yunus bin Abdullah Al-Jarmi is Kufan; Yahya bin Sa'id and Ibn Uyaynah narrated from him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text:
812 - I asked my father about Abd Al-Aziz bin Suhayb Al-Bunani. He said: 'Trustworthy; Abd Al-Warith has the most narrations from him among people.' I said to my father: 'Then Yahya bin Abi Ishaq?' He spoke regarding his Hadith as if... I said: 'Which of them is more beloved to you: Abd Al-Aziz or Yahya?' He said: 'Abd Al-Aziz is more trustworthy in Hadith than Yahya. Abd Al-Aziz is among the trustworthy (Thiqat). Yahya, in his Hadith there is some...' meaning weakness. 813 - I heard my father say: I heard Abd Al-Rahman bin Mahdi say: 'Al-Qasim bin Al-Fadl Al-Huddani is among our trustworthy Sheikhs.' 814 - I heard my father say: 'Strike out the Hadith of Mubarak bin Suhaym.' 815 - I heard my father say: 'Mughirah bin Ziyad is inconsistent (Mudtarib); [his] Hadiths are objectionable (Munkarah).'

812 - I asked my father about Abd Al-Aziz bin Suhayb Al-Bunani. He said: 'Trustworthy; Abd Al-Warith has the most narrations from him among people.' I said to my father: 'Then Yahya bin Abi Ishaq?' He spoke regarding his Hadith as if... I said: 'Which of them is more beloved to you: Abd Al-Aziz or Yahya?' He said: 'Abd Al-Aziz is more trustworthy in Hadith than Yahya. Abd Al-Aziz is among the trustworthy (Thiqat). Yahya, in his Hadith there is some...' meaning weakness. 813 - I heard my father say: I heard Abd Al-Rahman bin Mahdi say: 'Al-Qasim bin Al-Fadl Al-Huddani is among our trustworthy Sheikhs.' 814 - I heard my father say: 'Strike out the Hadith of Mubarak bin Suhaym.' 815 - I heard my father say: 'Mughirah bin Ziyad is inconsistent (Mudtarib); [his] Hadiths are objectionable (Munkarah).'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text:
816 - My father said: It reached me that Sharik met Abu Waki' and greeted him. Sharik said to him: 'O Abu Waki', how is Waki'?' 817 - My father said: Ma'mar errs regarding Abd Al-Aziz bin Suhayb; he says 'Abd Al-Aziz Mawla of Anas', but he is only the Mawla of Lubanah.

816 - My father said: It reached me that Sharik met Abu Waki' and greeted him. Sharik said to him: 'O Abu Waki', how is Waki'?' 817 - My father said: Ma'mar errs regarding Abd Al-Aziz bin Suhayb; he says 'Abd Al-Aziz Mawla of Anas', but he is only the Mawla of Lubanah.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
818 - I asked him about Badr, and he said: He is Kufan. Waki' narrated from him, saying: Badr bin Huwayzah told us. I said: How is his Hadith? He said: He has only one Hadith that I know of.
819 - I asked my father about Ibn Abi Husayn. He said: Qurashi, Meccan, trustworthy (*Thiqa*).
820 - I asked him about Abdul-Karim Abu Umayyah. He said: Basran, settled in Mecca, and was a teacher (*Mu'allim*). He is Ibn Abi Al-Mukhariq. Ibn 'Uyaynah used to consider him weak. I said to him: He said he is weak? He said: Yes.
821 - I heard my father say: Abdullah bin Sa'id bin Abi Hind is a Madinan Sheikh, trustworthy (*Thiqa*).
822 - And Abu Al-Za'ra' is Kufan, trustworthy (*Thiqa*). He is the nephew of Abu Al-Ahwas, among the trustworthy ones. His name is Amr bin Amr.
823 - Khalid bin Abi Karima is a Kufan Sheikh, trustworthy (*Thiqa*).
824 - Hisham bin Hujayr is Meccan, weak in Hadith.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
825 - My father said: Ibn 'Uyaynah said: Ibn Shubrumah said: There is no one in Mecca more knowledgeable in Fiqh than him, meaning Hisham bin Hujayr.
826 - My father said: Ibrahim bin Maysarah is from Ta'if, lived in Mecca, trustworthy (*Thiqa*).
827 - My father said: Muhammad bin Abi Isma'il is a Kufan Sheikh, trustworthy (*Thiqa*).
828 - My father said: Qasim Al-Rahhal, I think he is Basran; Ibn 'Uyaynah narrated to us from him.
829 - My father said: Ja'far bin Khalid, I think he is Madinan; Ibn Jurayj narrated from him, and Ibn 'Uyaynah narrated to us from him. I said to my father: Is he trustworthy? He said: Yes.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
830 - My father said: Abdullah bin Abi Labid is Madinan, and he came to Kufa. I do not know of any harm in his Hadith. Ibn Ishaq, Ibn 'Uyaynah, and Al-Thawri narrated from him. He used to hold the view of Qadar (free will), meaning Ibn Abi Labid.
831 - My father said: Abbas bin Abdullah bin Ma'bad bin Abbas is Madinan, there is no harm in him.
832 - And Yazid bin Al-Asamm, he said: He used to live in Raqqa, and his maternal aunt was Maymunah. I said: Is he trustworthy? He said: Al-Zuhri narrated from him.
833 - I heard my father say: Ikrimah bin Khalid did not hear anything from Ibn Abbas; he only narrates from Sa'id bin Jubayr.
834 - My father told me, saying: Abu Nu'aym told us, saying: Al-A'mash told us from Ibrahim, who said: Abdullah said: "Dreams are three: The man is concerned about something during the day [and dreams of it], the presence of Satan, and the dream which is the [true] dream." Al-Musayyib bin Sharik said to Al-A'mash: "You only narrated it to us from Abu Zabyan from Alqamah from Abdullah." He said: "You spoke the truth; you are more memorizing than me."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text: 835 - I asked Yahya bin Ma'in about Al-Mughirah bin Ziyad, and he said: "There is no harm in him." I asked my father, and he said: "Weak in Hadith." And he said: "He narrated from Ata from Ibn Abbas regarding a man who attends a funeral: 'There is no harm if he prays over it and performs Tayammum.'" My father said: "Ibn Jurayj and Abdul-Malik narrated it from Ata as Mursal." My father said: "And it was narrated from Ata from Aisha from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace: 'Whoever prays twelve Rak'ahs in a day.' And people narrate this from Ata from Anbasah from Umm Habibah: 'Whoever prays twelve Rak'ahs in a day, a house will be built for him in Paradise.' And it was narrated from Ata from Aisha that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to shorten [prayer] and complete it when he traveled. But people narrate it from Ata as Mursal."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
836 - My father told me, saying: Sulayman bin Harb told us, saying: Shu'bah told us, saying: I asked Ayyub about the saliva of a donkey, and he did not see any harm in it.
837 - My father told me, saying: Sulayman bin Harb told us, saying: Hammad bin Zaid told us, saying: Ayyub might narrate a Hadith and become tender-hearted, so he would turn away and blow his nose, saying: "How severe is this cold (Coryza)!" Ayyub said: "If I knew that my family needed a bundle of herbs, I would not have sat with you."
838 - My father told me, saying: Sulayman bin Harb told us, and he was asked about Ayyub: Whose Mawla (client) was he? He said: To Anazah.
839 - My father told me, saying: Sulayman bin Harb told us, saying: Hammad bin Zaid told us: It was said to Ayyub: "Is Hadith more abundant today or before today?" He said: "Speech today is more abundant, and Hadith before today was more abundant."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
840 - My father told me, saying: Sulayman bin Harb told us, saying: Hammad told us: A man said to Ayyub: "Ikrimah used to be accused?" He remained silent, then said: "As for me, I did not use to accuse him."
841 - My father told us, saying: Sulayman bin Harb told us, saying: Hammad bin Zaid told us: Ayyub ordered me to cut a shirt for him. He said: "Make it hit the top of the foot, and make the opening of its sleeve a span."
842 - My father told me, saying: Sulayman bin Harb told us, saying: Hammad bin Zaid told us: A man said to Ayyub: "Indeed, Amr bin Ubayd narrated from Al-Hasan that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: 'If you see Mu'awiyah on the pulpit, kill him.'" He said: "Amr bin Ubayd lied."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
843 - My father told us, saying: Sulayman told us, saying: Hammad bin Zaid told us: It was said to Ayyub that Amr narrated from Al-Hasan that he said: "The drunkard is not flogged for Nabidh (date-wine)." He said: "He lied. I heard Al-Hasan say: 'The drunkard is flogged for Nabidh.'" Abu Abdur-Rahman said: My father dictated these Hadiths to us shortly after the death of Sulayman.
844 - I heard my father say: We wrote from Sulayman while Ibn 'Uyaynah was alive.
845 - My father told me, saying: I heard Sufyan bin 'Uyaynah say: We did not use to call him by the Kunya Abu Al-Zinad; we used to call him by the Kunya Abu Abdur-Rahman. He was a scribe for Abdul-Hamid bin Abdur-Rahman bin Zaid bin Al-Khattab.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
846 - My father told me, saying: Husayn bin Muhammad told us, saying: Abu Uways told us, saying: Muhammad bin Ishaq told me: Jabir bin Abdullah witnessed Badr riding behind his father, so the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, did not allot a share to him.
847 - I heard my father say: Sufyan Al-Thawri asked Hammad bin Salamah, saying: "O Abu Salamah, did you hear from Salamah bin Kuhayl?" He said: "He was a smart Sheikh."
848 - My father told me, saying: Yahya bin Adam told us, saying: Abu Bakr told us from Asim that a man said to Zirr bin Hubaysh: "O Abu Maryam."
849 - I asked my father about a man praying on the skin of a sheep. He said: There is no harm in it if it is tanned.
850 - My father told me, saying: Hushaym told us from Isma'il bin Abi Khalid, who said: I saw Al-Aswad bin Yazid praying on the skin of a sheep.
851 - My father said: Nafi' bin Umar is more beloved to me than Abdul-Jabbar bin Al-Ward, and he is more correct in Hadith.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
852 - I asked my father about Matar Al-Warraq. He said: Yahya bin Sa'id used to liken Matar Al-Warraq to Ibn Abi Layla, meaning in poor memory.
853 - I asked my father: Which is more trustworthy, Sulayman bin Buraydah or Abdullah? He said: Sulayman is more trustworthy and better. My father said: Waki' said: They consider Sulayman to be the more correct of the two in Hadith, meaning the two sons of Buraydah.
854 - I heard Dawud bin Amr say: I witnessed the funeral of Nafi' bin Umar Al-Jumahi in Mecca. He said: I heard Ibn 'Uyaynah say: "He left no one like him after him." My father said to him: In which year? He said: In the year sixty-nine [169 AH].
855 - My father said: 'Amir bin Salih Al-Zubayri is trustworthy (*Thiqa*); he was not a liar.
856 - My father was asked about Zaid bin Aslam, and he said: Trustworthy (*Thiqa*).
857 - And I asked him about Abdul-Malik bin Abi Sulayman, and he said: Trustworthy (*Thiqa*).
858 - And I asked him about Abu Hurrah, and he said: Trustworthy (*Thiqa*).

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
859 - And I asked him about Zakariya bin Abi Za'idah, and he said: Trustworthy (*Thiqa*), how close he is to Isma'il bin Abi Khalid.
860 - I asked my father about Al-Harith Al-Ghanawi. He said: Abu Awanah narrated from him; I hope there is no harm in him.
861 - I asked him about Awf Al-A'rabi, and he said: Trustworthy (*Thiqa*), righteous in Hadith (*Salih Al-Hadith*).

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
862 - I asked him about Muhammad bin Abdur-Rahman bin Abi Layla, and he said: Disturbed in Hadith (*Mudtarib Al-Hadith*). My father said: The Fiqh of Ibn Abi Layla is more beloved to us than his Hadith; his Hadith has disturbance.
863 - I asked him about Hisham bin Hassan, and he said: Righteous (*Salih*). And Hisham bin Hassan is more beloved to me than Ash'ath.
864 - I asked my father about Abu Aqil Al-Dawraqi, and he said: His name is Bashir bin Uqbah, trustworthy (*Thiqa*).
865 - I asked him about Ubaydullah bin Abi Bakr bin Anas, he said: Trustworthy (*Thiqa*).
866 - I asked him about Talhah bin Amr, and he said: He is nothing, abandoned in Hadith (*Matruk Al-Hadith*).

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
867 - I asked him about Al-Rabi' bin Sabih, and he said: There is no harm in him, a righteous man. Ahmad bin Ibrahim Al-Dawraqi told us, saying: Hajjaj told us, saying: I asked Shu'bah about Al-Rabi' bin Sabih and Mubarak. He said: Mubarak is more beloved to me than him.
868 - I asked him about Al-Awwam bin Hawshab, and he said: Trustworthy (*Thiqa*).
869 - I asked him about Mutarrif bin Tarif Al-Harithi, and he said: Trustworthy (*Thiqa*).
870 - I asked him about Abu Qais Abdur-Rahman bin Tharwan, and he said: He is so-and-so (middling). Al-A'mash, Shu'bah, and Sufyan narrated from him, but he differs in [some] Hadiths.
871 - I asked him about Mandal bin Ali, and he said: Weak (*Da'if*). I said to him: Habban, his brother? He said: No, he is better than him—meaning Mandal. And he once said: How close they are [to each other].
872 - I asked him about Aban bin Abi Ayyash, and he said: Abandoned in Hadith (*Matruk Al-Hadith*). People abandoned his Hadith a long time ago.
873 - I asked him about Abdul-Karim bin Abi Al-Mukhariq, and he said: Weak (*Da'if*).
874 - I asked him about Usamah bin Zaid. He said: Yahya bin Sa'id abandoned his Hadith towards the end.
875 - I asked him about Abu Ma'shar Najih Al-Madani. He said: Truthful (*Saduq*), but he does not establish the chain of narration (*Isnad*).
876 - I asked him about Mansur bin Abdur-Rahman Al-Ghudani. He said: Righteous (*Salih*). Shu'bah narrated from him.
877 - I asked him about Abbas bin Dharih, and he said: Righteous (*Salih*).

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
878 - I asked him about Ali bin Mushir, and he said: His Hadith resembles the Hadith of the People of Hadith.
879 - I asked him about Bayan bin Bishr, and he said: Trustworthy (*Thiqa*).
880 - I asked him about Ziyad bin Sa'd, and he said: Trustworthy (*Thiqa*).
881 - I asked him about Mujalid, and he said: So-and-so—and he shook his hand—but he adds to the chain of narration.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
882 - I asked him about Ata bin Al-Sa'ib, and he said: Righteous (*Salih*) [is the one] who heard from him, meaning a long time ago. But he changed [memory declined], for he is not that [strong anymore]; he raises [Hadiths] to Ibn Abbas.
883 - I asked him about Ali bin Mubarak, and he said: Trustworthy (*Thiqa*).
884 - I asked him about Umar bin Dharr, and he said: [People] narrated from him, and he was a Murji'.
885 - And I asked him about Matar, and he said: How close he is to Ibn Abi Layla. Then he said: Especially regarding Ata.
886 - I asked him about Muhammad bin Salim Abu Sahl, and he said: He is almost abandoned (*Shibh Al-Matruk*).

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
887 - I asked him about Ash'ath bin Sawwar, and he said: He is better than Muhammad bin Salim, but despite that, he is weak, meaning Ash'ath.
888 - I asked him about Isma'il bin Salim, and he said: Trustworthy, trustworthy (*Thiqa Thiqa*).
889 - I asked him about Ubaydah, Muhammad bin Salim, and Juwaybir, and he said: How close some of them are to others, meaning in weakness.
890 - I asked him about Sayyar Abu Al-Hakam, and he said: Trustworthy (*Thiqa*).
891 - I asked him about Ash'ath bin Abdul-Malik Al-Humrani, and he said: He is righteous (*Salih*).
892 - I asked him about Dawud bin Abi Hind, and he said: Can someone like Dawud be asked about?
893 - I asked him about Abdullah bin Subrah, and he said: Righteous (*Salih*), Hushaym narrated from him.
894 - I asked him about Habib bin Abi Habib, and he said: He is such-and-such; Ibn Mahdi used to narrate from him.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
895 - I asked him about Kathir bin Shanzir, and he said: Righteous (*Salih*). Then he said: People narrated from him and tolerated him.
896 - I asked him about Yahya bin Atiq, and he said: Trustworthy (*Thiqa*).
897 - I asked him about Ghaylan bin Jarir, and he said: Trustworthy (*Thiqa*).
898 - I asked him about Shu'ayb bin Al-Habhab, and he said: Trustworthy (*Thiqa*).
899 - I asked him about Abu Khushaynah, and he said: Righteous (*Salih*).
900 - I asked him about Marwan Abu Lubabah, and he said: Hammad bin Zaid narrated from him.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
901 - I asked him about Muhannad bin Ali, and he said: Righteous (*Salih*). Shu'bah narrated from him.
902 - I asked him about Ali bin Abi Al-Aliyah. He said: Hammad bin Zaid narrated from him.
903 - I asked him about Wasil, the Mawla of Abu Uyaynah, and he said: Trustworthy (*Thiqa*).
904 - I asked him about Yazid bin Hazim, the brother of Jarir bin Hazim, and he said: Trustworthy (*Thiqa*).

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
905 - I asked him about Abu Abdullah Al-Shaqri, and he said: His name is Salamah bin Tammam. He is not strong in Hadith.
906 - I asked him about Al-Zubayr bin Al-Khirrit, and he said: Trustworthy (*Thiqa*).
907 - I asked him about Amr bin Haram, and he said: Trustworthy (*Thiqa*).
908 - And I asked him about Abu Ishaq Al-Kufi, from whom Hushaym narrated, and he said: He is Kufan.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
909 - I asked him about Umar bin Abi Salamah, and he said: Righteous (*Salih*), God willing. He said: Yahya bin Sa'id used to prefer Muhammad bin Amr over Umar.
910 - I asked him about Yunus bin Khabbab, and he said: He had malicious views. I said to him: How is he in Hadith? He said: Abbad narrated to us from him.
911 - I asked him about Ibn Shubrumah, and he said: Trustworthy (*Thiqa*).
912 - I asked him about Harun bin Ri'ab, and he said: Trustworthy (*Thiqa*).
913 - I asked him about Burd bin Sinan, and he said: Righteous in Hadith (*Salih Al-Hadith*).
914 - I asked him about Aflah, and he said: Righteous (*Salih*).

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
915 - I asked him about Abdul-Hamid, the companion of Al-Ziyadi, and he said: He is Abdul-Hamid bin Kardid, and he is trustworthy (*Thiqa*).
916 - I asked my father about Al-Nu'man bin Rashid, and he said: He narrated denounced (*Manakir*) Hadiths.
917 - I asked him about Hafs bin Sulayman Al-Minqari, and he said: He is righteous (*Salih*).
918 - I asked him about Asim bin Bahdalah, and he said: Trustworthy (*Thiqa*), a righteous man, a good, trustworthy person. And Al-A'mash is more memorizing (*Ahfaz*) than him.
919 - I asked him about Abu Harun Al-Abdi, and he said: He is nothing.
920 - I asked him about Habib bin Al-Shahid, and he said: Trustworthy (*Thiqa*).

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 921 - My father told me, he said: Umar bin Ali Al-Muqaddami told us, he said: Hajjaj said: Fadalah bin Ubayd was among those who pledged allegiance under the Tree. 922 - I heard my father say: Ibn Abi Adi possesses dignity and a good appearance, and he is more beloved to me than Azhar Al-Samman. Azhar would perhaps narrate a Hadith then say: 'I did not narrate it.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 923 - My father told me, he said: Muhammad bin Wahb Abu Yusuf, from the Abna' (Persians settled in Yemen), told us in the year one hundred and ninety-eight, he said: I am ninety-one years old. He said: I witnessed the funeral of Wahb bin Munabbih when I was a boy, and I saw people crowding over it intensely, such that people were repelling them with whips—or with a whip. 924 - My father told me, he said: Muhammad bin Wahb told us, he said: I saw Ibn Munabbih carried until his bier was placed on the edge of the grave, and over his bier was a Hibarah garment (Yemeni striped cloak).

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 925 - I heard my father say: Some of our companions told us—and he said once: A man told us—he said: I was with Yahya bin Sa'id Al-Qattan and Abd Al-Rahman bin Mahdi in Mecca in the Sacred Mosque. He said: A man came to Yahya bin Sa'id and said: 'This is Ibn Abi Za'idah, Yahya bin Zakariya.' He said: So Yahya leaped towards him to greet him. Abd Al-Rahman said to him: 'Sit down.' He said: So he sat down. My father said: It was as if he wanted Ibn Abi Za'idah to come to Yahya. 926 - I heard my father say: Qabus bin Abi Zibyan came to Ibn Abi Layla and testified before him regarding a case he had. Ibn Abi Layla hastened against him (or was harsh with him). He said: So he [Qabus?] hit him. 927 - My father said: Ibn Mahdi said: 'Al-Qasim bin Al-Fadl Al-Huddani is among our trustworthy Sheikhs.' My father said: My greatest knowledge is that I heard from him in Baghdad. 928 - It was said to my father: 'Did you see Bishr bin Al-Mufaddal dye his hair?' He said: 'Yes. And Ibn Mahdi came to us in Baghdad when he was forty-five or forty-six, and he had dyed his hair.' 929 - I heard him say: Yazid bin Abd Al-Rahman Abu Khalid Al-Dalani was a short Sheikh, a Murji'.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 930 - My father told me, he said: Husayn bin Hasan Al-Ashqar told us, he said: Zuhayr told us, he said: I heard Abu Ishaq say: I used to sit frequently with Rafi' bin Khadij, and I used to sit frequently with Ibn Umar. 931 - I heard my father mention from Abd Al-Rahman bin Mahdi, he said: I said to Hushaym: 'How is it that you have so many narrations from Al-Awwam bin Hawshab?' He said: 'He was among the last of our Sheikhs to remain, so I scrutinized him.' 932 - My father said: Ayyub Abu Al-Ala' Al-Qassab died long ago. Abu Al-Ala' Al-Qassab died before Al-Awwam bin Hawshab. He said: Al-Awwam is more trustworthy than Abu Al-Ala' and has more Hadith. Al-Awwam is trustworthy, though there is no harm in Abu Al-Ala', and Abu Al-Ala' was their Mufti in Wasit. 933 - My father told me, he said: Rawh bin Ubadah Al-Qaysi told us, he said: Habib bin Hajar told us, he said: Thabit Al-Bunani told us, he said: I heard Adi bin Hatim say: 'Soon it will be difficult for a man to pay the Zakat of his wealth or the charity of his wealth.' Thabit said: I met him in Kufa, meaning Adi bin Hatim.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 934 - My father told us, he said: Hushaym told us, from Mughirah, from Ibrahim, he said: Alqamah was a man of Sunnah. 935 - My father told me, he said: Asbat bin Abi Amr told us, he said: Abd Al-Malik bin Umayr told us, he said: The first to place the two pieces of wood that are on the pulpit (Minbar) was Ubaydullah bin Ziyad. 936 - My father told me, he said: Abu Qatan told us, he said: I said to Ibn Awn: 'Did you see saffron-dyed clothes (Mu'asfar) on Ibrahim?' He said: 'Yes, if Allah wills; not intense nor polished (Siqal).' Then Ibn Awn said: Muhammad informed us that he saw it in some of the houses of the wives of the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him—meaning the Mu'asfar. 937 - My father told me, he said: Abu Asim told us, he said: Abu Awanah informed us, from Al-Hakam, from Ibrahim, from Al-Aswad that Umar said: 'Whoever owns a relative or a Mahram relative, then he (the slave) is free.' My father said: I said to Abu Asim: 'Is the doubt from you (plural) or from him?' He said: 'I do not know.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 938 - Abu Abd Al-Rahman said: I heard my father say: Harami bin Umarah invited us in Basra. Yahya ate a meal like that, then went out and could not walk. I said to him: 'Enter the mosque.' So he entered a mosque and lay down, then said: Yahya bin Khalid Al-Barmaki said: 'If one of you eats, let him lie down, for it digests it.' 939 - My father told me, he said: Abu Asim told us, he said: Abu Awanah told us, from Al-Hakam, from Asim bin Damrah, from Ali, he said: 'If he sits the amount of the Tashahhud, his prayer is complete.' He said: Abu Asim said to me: 'Did you force Abu Awanah on these two Hadiths?'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 940 - I heard my father say: Waki' contradicted Ibn Mahdi in about sixty Hadiths from the Hadith of Sufyan. I mentioned this to Abd Al-Rahman bin Mahdi, so Abd Al-Rahman used to narrate it from me. Then I heard my father say after that: 'They are more than sixty, and more than sixty, and more than sixty.' Abu Abd Al-Rahman said: Abd Al-Rahman bin Mahdi was, in my father's view, more correct than Waki', meaning specifically in the Hadith of Sufyan. 941 - I heard my father say: Yahya bin Sa'id Al-Qattan came to Mu'tamir bin Sulayman visiting him (when sick). When Yahya wanted to stand up, he said to Mu'tamir: 'May Allah look after you.' 942 - I heard my father say: Shu'bah abandoned Al-Minhal intentionally. 943 - I heard him say: Abu Bishr is more beloved to me than Al-Minhal bin Amr. I said: 'More beloved to you than Al-Minhal?' He said: 'Yes, greatly, except that Al-Minhal is older, and Abu Bishr is more trustworthy.' 944 - I heard my father mention Sa'id bin Sulayman, he said: He was a man of Tashif (misreading) as much as you wish.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 945 - I heard my father say: Imran bin Muslim Al-Ju'fi is trustworthy, and as a trustworthy person should be. I said to him: 'Trustworthy?' He said: 'Yes.' 946 - My father told me, he said: Abu Usamah told us, from Al-A'mash, he said: Ibrahim was a moneychanger (critic/expert) in Hadith. I would bring him the Hadith. He said: So he would write from what I took from Abu Salih from Abu Hurayrah. He said: They used to leave things from the Hadiths of Abu Hurayrah. 947 - My father told me, he said: Abu Mu'awiyah told us, he said: Hajjaj bin Artah used to say to us: 'Beware of the people of books (notebooks), for one of them does not cease turning Amr into Umar and similar things.' 948 - My father told me, he said: Abu Mu'awiyah told us, he said: Asim—meaning Al-Ahwal—said: A man was brought to me who had cursed Uthman, so I struck him ten lashes. He said: Then he returned (to cursing) when I struck him, so I struck him another ten. He did not cease cursing him until I struck him seventy lashes. 949 - My father told me, he said: I heard Waki' say: We caught up with Ibn Abi Layla administering Ta'zir (discretionary punishment) of seventy (lashes).

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 950 - I heard my father mention from Yahya bin Sa'id Al-Qattan, he said: It was as if Thawr, when he narrated a Hadith to me from a man I did not know, I would say: 'Are you older or is he?' If he said: 'He is older than me,' I wrote it. And if he said: 'Younger than me,' I did not write it. 951 - My father told me, he said: Affan told us, from Shu'bah, he said: Khulayd bin Ja'far informed me, and he was among the most truthful of people and the most intensely pious of them. 952 - My father told me, he said: Abdullah bin Idris told us, he said: Shu'bah informed us, from Amr bin Murrah, from Abd Al-Rahman bin Abi Layla, from Al-Bara' that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, performed Qunut in the Fajr and in the Maghrib. I mentioned that to Ibrahim, so he said: 'Was he like the companions of Abdullah? He was only a companion of Emirs.' He said: So I abandoned the Qunut. He said: Then the people of our mosque spoke regarding that, so I returned to the Qunut. He said: Then Ibrahim met me and said: 'As for this one, he is a man who has been overcome regarding his prayer.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 953 - My father told me, he said: Muhammad bin Abdullah bin Al-Zubayr Abu Ahmad Al-Zubayri told us, he said: Sufyan told us, from Amr bin Murrah, he said: I narrated a Hadith to Ibrahim from a man, so he said: 'That is a companion of Emirs.' 954 - I asked my father about Khilas from Ali: Did he hear anything from him? He said: Some of them say he heard from him. Khilas was in the police force (Shurtah) of Ali. 955 - My father told me, he said: Muhammad bin Bakr Al-Bursani told us, he said: Abu Ubaydah Imran bin Hudayr told us. 956 - My father told me, he said: Rawh told us, he said: Shu'bah told us, he said: Abu Juhayfah was with Ali on the Day of the Camel over the people of Medina.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 957 - I heard my father mention the Hadith of Ibn Awn from Ghadirah Al-Anbari. He said: Only Ibn Awn narrated it. This is not Ghadirah whom Asim bin Hilal narrates from. Ibn Awn said: I met Ghadirah at Al-Yansu'ah... [text unclear/corrupt: 'wa da'a fi al-badiyah' - perhaps 'mawdi' fi al-badiyah' - a place in the desert?]. 958 - My father told me, he said: Rawh told us, he said: Shu'bah told us, he said: I discussed with Al-Hakam who witnessed Siffin from the people of Badr. He established among them Khuzaymah bin Thabit. And Shu'bah used to deny that Abu Al-Haytham bin Al-Tayyihan witnessed Siffin.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 959 - My father told me, he said: Rawh told us, he said: Hammad bin Zayd told us, from Al-Zubayr bin Khirrit, he said: It was said to Abu Labid Al-Jahdami—and his name was Lumazah, thus said my father in the Hadith—and he had reached [the time of] Al-Jamal (the Battle of the Camel). 960 - I heard my father say: Iyas bin Mu'awiyah was more praiseworthy (Ahmad) to them in judiciary than Al-Hasan. Then Al-Hasan was removed from the judiciary, and Iyas was employed after him, so he was more praiseworthy to them than Al-Hasan.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 961 - My father said: I heard Abd Al-Razzaq say: My father said: Wahb bin Munabbih was appointed to the judiciary, and he was not praised. Abd Al-Razzaq said: So I mentioned that to Ma'mar, and he said: Al-Hasan was appointed to the judiciary of Basra, and he was not praised. 962 - I heard my father say: Abu Al-Ya'fur the Younger is Buka'i; his name is Abd Al-Rahman bin Ubayd bin Nistas. And Abu Al-Ya'fur Al-Abdi—my father told me, he said: Muhammad bin Bishr told us, he said: I saw Abu Al-Ya'fur, and his name was Waqid. And Ibn Bishr said once: Waqdan. 963 - My father said: I heard Abu Bakr bin Ayyash say: Listen to him; I heard Habib bin Abi Thabit. 964 - It was mentioned to my father that Ibn Uyaynah said: A letter was thrown to me: 'If you narrate it, we will kill you'—meaning the Hadith of Ammar Al-Duhni regarding Banu Najiyah. My father said: It is said that Ibrahim bin Ar'arah wrote that letter to Sufyan bin Uyaynah.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 965 - My father said: Abu Sa'id Al-Haddad said to me: Ali bin Asim said: Qurrah bin Khalid told us—and he was among the broken/wealthy (?) people of Basra (Makasir - meaning unclear, perhaps 'wealthy' from Kasr/Gain or 'broken' from illness/age). 966 - My father told me, he said: Ali bin Asim told us, he said: Abu Rayhanah Abdullah bin Matar informed me. 967 - My father told me, he said: Mu'tamir told us, from his father, from Hanash. And Ali bin Asim from Abu Ali Al-Rahabi. And thus said Khalid Al-Tahhan. And he is weak in Hadith, meaning Hanash. 968 - My father said: Khalid Al-Tahhan was trustworthy, a righteous man; he had righteousness in his religion. It reached me that he bought himself from Allah three times. I asked my father about Khalid Al-Tahhan and Hushaym. He said: Khalid is more beloved to us; Khalid did not involve himself with the ruler in anything.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 969 - My father said: Muhammad bin Talhah is trustworthy, except that he hardly used to say in any of his Hadith 'He told us.' And Talhah died ten years before Zubayd. 970 - My father told me, he said: Ubaydullah bin Musa told us, he said: Mubarak bin Hassan told us, from Ata', he said: 'The mask (Qina') is the emblem of the Prophets.' 971 - I asked my father about Zakariya bin Abi Za'idah and Umar bin Abi Za'idah. He said: They are brothers. Umar is older than Zakariya bin Abi Za'idah. Umar narrated from Qays bin Abi Hazim, Al-Sha'bi, Al-Hasan, and Mudrik bin Umarah. Zakariya only narrates from Al-Sha'bi, Abu Ishaq, and Atiyyah. Umar is older in age and heard from Qays. Zakariya is more beloved to me than Umar, although there is no harm in Umar. And Umar used to hold the view of Qadar.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 972 - My father said: Hushaym used to... I think he went to Aleppo and heard from Kawthar bin Hakim in Aleppo, and he is nothing. 973 - My father told me, he said: I heard Ibn Idris—perhaps he spoke about Fiqh—saying: 'I, by Allah, heard Malik'—meaning Ibn Anas. I heard my father mention Ibn Idris, so he said: 'He was unique (Nasij Wahdih).' I heard my father, and he mentioned the Hadith of Ibn Idris from his father from Simak from Alqamah bin Wa'il from Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah: 'The Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, sent me to Najran.' My father said: I heard Yahya bin Ma'in asking Ibn Idris about it, so he narrated it to us.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 974 - I heard Al-Qawariri say: I and Affan went to Abd Al-Warith. He said: 'What do you want?' Affan said to him: 'Bring out the Hadith of Ibn Juhadah.' So he dictated it from his book: Muhammad bin Juhadah told us, he said: Wa'il bin Alqamah told me, from his father Wa'il bin Hujr. He said: So Affan said to him: 'How can this be? Hammam narrated it to us but did not say it like this.' He said: So he struck the ground with the book and said: 'I bring out my book to you, and you say: You erred!'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 975 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us, from Mughirah, from Al-Sha'bi, he said: When he arrived, he would say: 'Give it here, narrate to me; give it here, narrate to me'—meaning to Mughirah. 976 - I said to my father: Is Abd Al-Warith more reliable to you than Ibn Ulayyah? He said: 'I do not say this, except that Abd Al-Warith has more narrations from Abu Al-Tayyah, Yazid Al-Rishk, and Ali bin Zayd. And Abd Al-Warith heard from Sa'id bin Jamhan, and Ibn Ulayyah did not hear anything from him.' My father said: And Hammam used to say to them: 'Do not pray in the mosque of Abd Al-Warith Al-Tannuri, for he has taken it out onto the road—or from the road.' I said: 'Who said this?' He said: 'Affan.' 977 - I heard my father say: Hammad bin Zayd is more beloved to us than Abd Al-Warith. Hammad bin Zayd is among the Imams of the Muslims, from the people of religion and Islam. 978 - I heard my father say: When Sa'id bin Abi Arubah arrived in Kufa, he said: 'He pounded you with a mortar, the pounding of pepper'—meaning the intensity of memorization. 979 - I heard my father say: I stuck to Hushaym for four or five years; I did not ask him about anything out of awe for him, except twice: a question about the Witr, and this which I said to him from Ash'ath. My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us, he said: Ash'ath informed us. My father said: I said to him, I did, 'O Abu Mu'awiyah, who is Ash'ath?' He said: 'Ibn Abd Al-Malik, from Al-Hasan, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, said: There is no retaliation (Qawad) except with iron.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 980 - I asked my father, I said: Who has the most narrations from Yunus? He said: Hushaym has the most narrations from Yunus among people. Some people used to say Wuhib.
