It reached me from Hushaym that he said: 'I used to ask Yunus, and Wuhib would come and attend my questioning.' My father said: Hushaym has the most narrations from Yunus among people.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 981 - I said to my father: Al-Jurayri from Abu Al-Ward; who is this? He said: This is Abu Al-Ward bin Thumamah. Al-Jurayri narrated good Hadiths from him. I do not know any name for him other than this. 982 - I said to my father: Al-Jurayri from Abu Al-Ward from Abu Muhammad Al-Hadrami; who is Abu Muhammad Al-Hadrami? He said: 'I do not know.' 983 - I said to my father: Al-Jurayri from Abu Nadrah from Sumayr bin Nahar; who is Sumayr bin Nahar? He said: 'I do not know him.' 984 - I said to my father: Sayyar from Abu Subrah; who is this Abu Subrah? He said: 'Jabir narrated from him, from Al-Hasan bin Musafir, from Abu Subrah.'

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
985 - I said to my father: Yunus bin Ubayd from Ruzayq bin Karim Al-Sulami from Ibn Umar, that he was asked: "What is permitted for the fasting person regarding his wife?" He said: "He does not kiss, nor touch, nor engage in intimacy (*Yarfuth*). Make your fast chaste." My father said: Yunus bin Ubayd and Sa'id Al-Jurayri narrated it from him.
986 - I said to my father: Mughirah from Simak bin Salamah. Who is this Simak? He said: Mughirah narrated from him, and I think Jarir narrated from a sheikh of his from him.
987 - My father said: Abu Al-Salil's name is Durayb bin Nuqayr.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
988 - I heard my father say: Ghaylan bin Abdullah, the Mawla of Quraysh, whom Hushaym narrated to us from—Shu'bah narrated from him, and he is more beloved to me than Suhayl bin Dhakwan. Suhayl, Abbad and Hushaym narrated from him. Abbad bin Al-Awwam said: "We used to accuse him of lying"—meaning Suhayl. Abbad said: I said to him: "Describe Aisha to me." He said: "She was dark-complexioned (*Adma*)." My father said: And it used to be said that Aisha was fair-skinned/white (*Shaqra Bayda*).
989 - My father told me, saying: Abu Usamah told us from Wuhaib bin Khalid from Khalid Al-Hadhdha', who said: I heard Muhammad bin Sirin say: "There were four who were believed regarding what they narrated: Abu Al-Aliyah, Al-Hasan, Humayd bin Hilal, and another man whom he named."
990 - My father told me, saying: Abu Usamah told us, saying: Mufaddal told me from Mughirah, who said: "Nothing corrupted the Hadith of the people of Kufa except Abu Ishaq and Al-A'mash." I heard Al-Sha'bi say: "Al-Harith told me, and I bear witness that he is one of the liars."
991 - I heard my father mention Abu Mu'awiyah Al-Darir, and he said: "By Allah, he was a memorizer (*Hafiz*) of the Quran."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
992 - I heard my father say: Shu'bah's brother was imprisoned, so he [Shu'bah] came to Abu Ja'far regarding the affair of his brother. Sufyan said: "Here is Shu'bah, he has come to them." This reached Shu'bah, so he said: "He did not imprison his brother." He said: So he ordered something [a gift] for him, but he did not take it—meaning Shu'bah—until he died.
993 - I asked my father about Fitr bin Khalifah. He said: "Trustworthy, righteous in Hadith; his Hadith is the Hadith of an intelligent man, except that he has Shi'ism."
994 - My father told me, saying: Abu Usamah told us from Isma'il bin Abi Khalid from Isa, a neighbor of Masruq, who said: Masruq said: "Were it not for a certain matter, I would have established a mourning gathering for Aisha."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
995 - I heard my father say: I said to Abu Asim—meaning Al-Dahhak bin Makhlad—"Why do you not resemble your companions, [like] Ibn Awn?" And that was because he used to sit with Hilal, the proponent of Opinion (*Ra'y*).
996 - My father told me, saying: Hammad bin Mus'adah Abu Sa'id told us from Ibn Awn, who said: I asked Al-Sha'bi about Alqamah and Al-Aswad. He said: "Al-Aswad was a frequent pilgrim/active (*Hajjajan*), and Alqamah was slow (*Bati'an*) but would catch up to the fast one."
997 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us, saying: Abu Ishaq told me from Silah bin Zufar. Sufyan said: And he—meaning Abu Ishaq—told me: "I heard this Hadith seventy years ago." He said: "I was with Abdullah [Ibn Mas'ud] when a man came to him on a piebald horse..."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
998 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us from Abu Ishaq from Tamam bin Abbas, who said: "Ali was the most strongly attached of us to the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and the first of us to join him."
999 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us from Abu Ishaq, who said: "They used to see wealth/abundance as an aid to religion/debt." It was said to Sufyan: "Did Sufyan Al-Thawri mention it?" He said: "Yes."
1000 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us, saying: Awn bin Abdullah said to Abu Ishaq: "What is left of you?" He said: "I pray [recite] Al-Baqarah in one Rak'ah." He said: "Your evil has gone, and your good remains."
1001 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us, saying: Abu Ishaq asked me to recite, so I recited. He said: "The companions of Abdullah used to recite with deviation/inclination (*Yulhidun*)."
1002 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us, saying: Abu Ishaq said: "If I wake up at night, I do not let my eye rest (*Lam Uqil 'Ayni*)."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
1003 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us, saying: Muthabbit told us from Abu Ishaq, who said: "Alqamah was among the Rabbaniyyin (learned scholars of divinity)."
1004 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us, saying: I entered upon him, and behold, he was in a Turkish dome/tent with a mosque at its door, and he was in the mosque. I said: "How are you, O Abu Ishaq?" He said: "Like one who has been struck by paralysis; neither a hand nor a leg is of use to me." I said to him: "Did you hear, O Abu Ishaq, from Al-Harith?" Yusuf said to me: "He has seen Ali, so how could he not hear from Al-Harith?" I said: "O Abu Ishaq, did you see Ali?" He said: "Yes."
1005 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us, saying: A companion of ours told me, saying: He—meaning Abu Ishaq—said to us: "Does a man buy a Taylasan (hooded shawl) when he has not performed Hajj?"

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
1006 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us, saying: I asked him about a Hadith, and he said: "Silah told me seventy years ago." Sufyan said: "And he told me this more than seventy years ago."
1007 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us: Our Sheikhs, Al-Sha'bi and Abu Ishaq, gathered. Al-Sha'bi said to him: "You are better than me, O Abu Ishaq." He said: "No, by Allah, I am not better than you; rather, you are better than me and older than me."
1008 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan said: "Masruq remained after Alqamah, and no one was preferred over him."
1009 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan bin Uyaynah told us, saying: I saw Abu Al-Sawda', an old man. I said: "Where is the house of this Sheikh?" They said: "In Banu Nahd." I said: "He is our neighbor." Ibn Hubayrah said: "Expel the people of the Diwan (registry), and whoever does not go out, erase him." So he went out that night and was lost.
1010 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us from a Sheikh from Banu Nahd whose Kunya was Abu Al-Sawda', who heard Abu Mijlaz say: Umar said: "I do not care in what state I wake up, whether upon what I like or upon what I dislike. That is because I do not know if the good is in what I like or in what I dislike."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
1011 - My father told me, saying: Ali bin Abdullah told us, saying: Sufyan told us from Hafs bin Abdur-Rahman bin the brother of Muhammad bin Suqah from Abu Al-Sawda' from Abu Mijlaz. He said: "He was a little old man (*Shuwayyib*), there was no harm in him"—meaning Hafs bin Abdur-Rahman.
1012 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us from Abu Abdul-Malik—meaning Aslam. Sufyan said: "Husayn Al-Ju'fi narrated to me from him, so I asked him."
1013 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us, saying: Mujammi' Al-Taymi said: "I do not seek to ask Allah for Hajj." He was asked: "Why?" He said: "Because it is not obligatory upon me, and I do not want to enter into an obligation that is not upon me."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
1014 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us, saying: Hilal Al-Wazzan told us, saying: Our old Sheikh told us. Sufyan said: "I heard it from him twice."
1015 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us from a man who said: Amir bin Abdullah bin Al-Zubayr said: "I have not asked Allah for a need for a year after my father's death except for him (my father)." And Amir said: "He bought his self from Allah six times."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
1016 - My father said: It was said to Sufyan: "Abdullah?" He said: "In the year twenty at the Middle Jamrah." My father said: It was asked: "Who is this Sheikh?" He said—and with him was a group—they said: "This is Amir bin Abdullah bin Al-Zubayr."
1017 - I heard my father say: It reached me that Amir bin Abdullah bin Al-Zubayr went out one night and a supplication came to him, so he kept praying until morning with his hands raised.
1018 - My father told me, saying: It was said to Sufyan: "Where did you see him?"—meaning Muharib. He said: "In the Zawiyah"—meaning judging. "When these people came, Ibn Abi Layla sat with the people of wine."
1019 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan said: "My grandmother went out with Muhammad bin Muzahim, the brother of Al-Dahhak." My father told me, saying: Sufyan's grandmother was mentioned to him, so he said: "She said—meaning on the day Al-Husayn was killed—'The meat turned rotten (*Kadda*) and the Wars (dye plant) turned black.'"

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
1020 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us from Anas bin Sa'd. I said to my father: "Who is Anas bin Sa'd?" He said: "Hushaym narrated from him via Mughirah from Anas bin Sa'd with another Hadith."
1021 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us, saying: Amr bin Qays said: "I never raised my head ever without seeing him praying on his roof"—meaning Musa bin Abi Aisha.
1022 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us, saying: "I entered upon him—meaning Abu Al-Juwayriyah—and he began not establishing it as I wanted—meaning the Hadith of the lost item (*Al-Luqata*)."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
1023 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us, saying: Abu Ya'fur Al-Abdi—a Kufan of ours, and Sufyan once said: An Abdi, a client of theirs—told us, saying: I heard an Emir who was over Mecca when Al-Hajjaj left it. Sufyan said: In the year seventy-three. Sufyan said: He did not know who that Emir was, so I informed him that it was Ibn Abdul-Harith—meaning Nafi', a man from Khuza'ah.
1024 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us, saying: Abu Ya'fur said to me: "There is no Abdi man left in Kufa older than me."
1025 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us, saying: Shu'bah Al-Kufi, a Sheikh from the people of Kufa, told us. Abu Abdur-Rahman said: Sufyan Al-Thawri has narrated one Hadith from him. He said: Shu'bah bin Dinar.
1026 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us, saying: Khalid bin Salamah, a Sheikh from Quraysh, told us from Al-Sha'bi from Masruq, who said: "Loving Abu Bakr and Umar and knowing their virtue is from the Sunnah." My father said: And Sufyan did not hear from Khalid bin Salamah except this Hadith. My father said: Khalid bin Salamah is called 'The Stutterer' (*Al-Fa'fa'*).

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
1027 - My father told me, saying: I heard Sufyan say: Umarah bin Al-Qa'qa', the nephew of Ibn Shubrumah, and Abdullah bin Isa, the nephew of Muhammad bin Abdur-Rahman bin Abi Layla—they used to say that both of them were better than their uncles. So Ibn Shubrumah said to Umarah: "Work on something in Al-Hirah, for Umar made a good peace treaty over it."
1028 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us from Al-Shaybani, who said: I entered the mosque with Al-Sha'bi, and he said: "Look if you see any of our companions so we may sit with him; look if you see Abu Husayn."
1029 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us, saying: Ibn Al-Farazdaq Labtah told me: I said to him while he was circumambulating the House: "Did your father meet Al-Husayn?" He said: "Yes, by Allah."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
1030 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us, saying: Ibn Al-Farazdaq Labtah told me—he had an appearance/status; Aban bin Taghlib had heard from him, so we asked him about him.
1031 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us, saying: Ibn Shubrumah said regarding the Hadith of Hudhayfah "Abu Sarihah" as if he thought it was Ibn Al-Yaman. So we said to him that it is Ibn Asid.
1032 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us from Ali bin Zaid bin Jud'an: They discussed which verse of poetry [was best]. A man said the saying of Abu Talib: "He derived a name for him from His own name to honor him; so the Owner of the Throne is Mahmud, and this is Muhammad."
1033 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us, saying: Amr bin Ubayd said to Ibn Jud'an—as if he wanted to please him—so he said: "My father, I am so-and-so, the host of the hiding place of Al-Hasan [Al-Basri] with you." Sufyan said: And Al-Hasan was hiding with him.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
1034 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us, saying: Al-Hasan used to say: "No one like him lived in Basra"—meaning Imran bin Husayn.
1035 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us from Abdul-Karim Abu Umayyah from Hassan bin Bilal Al-Muzani. Sufyan said: He did not hear the Hadith of Ammar regarding combing the beard from Hassan.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text: 1036 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us from Abdul-Karim Abu Umayyah from Miqsam from Ibn Abbas regarding: "If he approaches his wife while she is menstruating." It was said to Sufyan: "O Abu Muhammad, is this raised (*Marfu'*) [to the Prophet]?" He refused to raise it and said: "I know him best"—meaning Abu Umayyah.

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
1037 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us, saying: Abu Umayyah used to be asked by a person: "Who is this?" He would say: "Your teacher Ibrahim Al-Nakha'i, and your master Ibn Mas'ud."
1038 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us, saying: Mis'ar said: "Abdul-Karim—meaning Abu Umayyah—came to us, so we surrounded him. He began to say: 'Do not set me up [as a leader/idol] (*La Tansibuni*)'."
1039 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us from Al-Fadl bin Isa Al-Raqashi. My father said: He is the nephew of Yazid Al-Raqashi.
1040 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us, saying: A Sheikh was here from the companions of Al-Hasan, Habib bin Al-Muhajir.
1041 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us, saying: Ibn Al-Asamm informed us, saying: "The diviner (*Arraf*) of Yamama stayed with us in Raqqa. He used to be visited, and he would look into his matter and say: It is such, such, and such."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
1042 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us, saying: I said to Sadaqah bin Yasar: "Some people claim that you are Kharijites." He said: "I was one of them, then Allah cured me." Sufyan said: And he was from the people of Al-Jazirah.
1043 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us, saying: Abu Umayyah used to come on Friday stepping over [people], saying: "May Allah have mercy on he who does not cause harm."
1044 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us, saying: Mujahid said: "We came to teach him, but we did not leave until we learned from him"—meaning Umar bin Abdul-Aziz.
1045 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us, saying: A delegation came to him—meaning Umar bin Abdul-Aziz—from the people of Kufa: Ibn Dharr, Yazid Al-Faqir, Musa bin Abi Kathir Abu Al-Sabah, Al-Salt bin Bahram, Hubayrah Al-Dabbi, and Dithar Al-Nahdi. Abu Al-Sabah was the loudest of the people. Sufyan said: They volunteered. Umar said: "Give them their travel expenses for returning." They said: "We will not diminish you [take from you]; we only came for the sake of reward (*Hisbah*); we will not diminish you."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
1046 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us from Ibn Dharr—meaning Umar—who said: He said: We did not ask him about Qadar—meaning Umar bin Abdul-Aziz. He said: "If Allah wanted not to be disobeyed, He would not have created Iblis." Then he said: "Is there not in the Book of Allah a verse that has clarified that: 'So indeed, you and what you worship, You cannot tempt [anyone] away from Him, Except he who is to [enter and] burn in the Hellfire.'" I said: "On what did you see him sitting?" He said: "On a cushion thrown down and two rugs. He said: 'Let me rest, for I have affairs and concerns.'"
1047 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us, saying: And the first thing that was narrated from him: Sulayman's work-horse was brought to him, but he refused and rode his mule and returned. And he said: "There is no one from the Ummah of Muhammad except that he has a right upon me, in its east and its west."
1048 - My father told me, saying: Sufyan told us, saying: I said to Abdul-Aziz bin Umar bin Abdul-Aziz: "What was the last speech of your father at death?" He said: "We were only boys, and our Mawla—meaning he would bring them to him—and we were greeting him like Muslims. I asked him: 'How old did he reach?' He said: 'He did not reach forty.' I said: 'I did not think but that he had reached fifty.' He said: 'He did not reach it.' So I increased it until I became shy. I said: 'I thought he reached about fifty.' He said: So Abdul-Aziz recited: 'Or do they envy people for what Allah has given them of His bounty? But we had already given the family of Abraham the Scripture and wisdom and conferred upon them a great kingdom.'" Sufyan said: It was said to him regarding his children, so he said: "I did not prevent them a right that was theirs, nor..."—then Sufyan said something I did not understand—"They are but a people who obeyed Allah, so He did not waste them. As for a people..."—then Sufyan said something I did not understand, meaning disobeyed Allah—"By Allah, for me to remain until I spend this wealth in His paths is more beloved to me than to die and leave it to my children and then not be asked about it."

book_title: Al-'Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal (The Defects and Knowledge of Men)
text:
1049 - Abdullah told us, saying: Al-Hasan bin Abdul-Aziz Al-Jarawi told me, saying: Damrah wrote to us and to Abu Hafs mentioning from Al-Awza'i, who said: "Umar bin Abdul-Aziz cried until he cried blood."
1050 - I heard my father mention from Isma'il bin Ulayyah that he used to criticize Abu Awanah. He said: "I saw Harun Al-A'war writing for him."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 1051 - And I heard my father mention from Sayyar, from Ja'far, he said: Hawshab took my hand and said: 'O Abu Sulayman, soon you will not see a guide, soon you will not see a comforter.' 1052 - I heard my father say: Abu Na'amah Al-Sa'di; Hammad bin Salamah narrated from him. He died long ago. And Abu Na'amah Al-Adawi; Waki' and Rawh heard from him. He is older in age than Abu Na'amah Al-Sa'di. Abu Na'amah Al-Adawi is very old in age. 1053 - My father said: Al-Shafi'i was one of the most eloquent of people. I said to him: 'Did he have [much] age?' He said: 'He was not that old.' I said: 'Mus'ab Al-Zubayri said he is older than me by four or five years.' He said: 'Such he was; he was not that old.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 1054 - My father said: Al-Shafi'i said: 'I read to Malik, and my recitation pleased him.' My father said: 'Because he was eloquent.' 1055 - My father said: Al-Shafi'i said to us: 'You are more knowledgeable about Hadith and Men than I am. So if a Hadith is authentic, inform me—whether it be Kufan, Basran, or Syrian—so that I may adopt it if it is authentic.' 1056 - I said to my father: Sulayman bin Atiq, did he hear from Jabir? He said: 'He heard from Abdullah bin Al-Zubayr.' 1057 - I said to my father: Is Abd Al-Rahman bin Ma'qil the brother of Abdullah bin Ma'qil? He said: 'Yes.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 1058 - I asked my father about the Hadith of Hushaym, from Husayn, from Amr bin Murrah, from Alqamah bin Wa'il, from his father, from the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, regarding raising [the hands]. He said: Shu'bah narrated it from Amr bin Murrah, from Abu Al-Bakhtari, from Abd Al-Rahman Al-Yahsubi, from Wa'il, from the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him. Husayn contradicted Shu'bah. He said: Shu'bah is more reliable in Amr bin Murrah than Husayn. The saying is the saying of Shu'bah. From where would Shu'bah get 'Abu Al-Bakhtari from Abd Al-Rahman Al-Yahsubi from Wa'il' [if not from Amr]? 1059 - I said to my father: Who is Abdullah bin Shaddad Al-A'raj? He said: Madini (from Medina). Hammad bin Salamah and Al-Thawri narrated from him. He is the one from whom Hammad narrates: From Abdullah bin Shaddad from Abu Udhrah from Aisha.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 1060 - I asked my father, I said: Shahm, who is he? He said: I have not heard anyone narrate from him other than Al-Thawri. Al-Thawri narrated from several whom no one else narrated from: Mustaghfir Al-Bajali is one of them, and Halwath Abu Al-Rabi', and Abd Al-Rahman bin Alqam is also one of them, and he is Meccan. My father told me, he said: Ibn Mahdi and Waki' told us, he said: Sufyan told us, from Ibn Alqamah. And the other said: From Ibn Alqam. 1061 - My father said: Abu Al-Bakhtari's name is Sa'id bin Abi Imran. And Habib bin Abi Thabit is Habib bin Qays. 1062 - My father said: Muslim bin Jundub was a storyteller (Qass) in Medina. 1063 - I heard my father say regarding the Hadith of Ibn Mas'ud 'Yastami'u Sawadi' (listening to my Sawad): He said: 'It is the secret (speech).'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 1064 - My father told me, he said: Surayj bin Al-Nu'man told us, he said: Hashraj told us, he said: I said to Sa'id bin Jamhan: 'Where did you meet Safinah?' He said: 'In Batn Nakhlah during the time of Al-Hajjaj.' 1065 - My father was asked about Abu Qatadah Al-Harrani. He said: There is no harm in him; he resembles the People of Asceticism and Goodness, except that perhaps he made mistakes. It was said to him: 'Indeed, some people speak against him.' He said: 'There is no harm in him.' I said: 'They say he did not distinguish between Sufyan and Yahya bin Abi Anisah.' He said: 'Perhaps he became confused (mixed up). As for him, he was intelligent.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 1066 - My father told me, he said: Hajjaj told us, from Shu'bah, he said: I heard Abu Ja'far, the Muezzin of Al-Uryan in the Mosque of Banu Hilal, narrating. Shu'bah said: I do not memorize from him other than this Hadith alone, from Muslim Abu Al-Muthanna, the Muezzin of the Jami' Mosque, from Ibn Umar regarding the Adhan. 1067 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, from Abu Khalid, from Al-Muthanna or Ibn Abi Al-Muthanna, from Ibn Umar regarding the Adhan. 1068 - My father told me, he said: Muhammad bin Yazid told us, from Isma'il, from Al-Muthanna, from Ibn Umar, the like of it. 1069 - My father told me, he said: Muhammad bin Yazid told us, from Hajjaj, from Abu Al-Muthanna, from Ibn Umar, the like of it.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 1070 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Al-Thawri told us, from Abu Ja'far the Muezzin, from Abu Sulayman, from Abu Mahdhurah regarding the Adhan. 1071 - My father told me, he said: Abd Al-Rahman told us, from Sufyan, from Abu Ja'far—Abd Al-Rahman said: He is not Al-Farra'—from Abu Salman, from Abu Mahdhurah regarding the Adhan. 1072 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il bin Ulayyah told us, from Ibn Abi Arubah, from Qatadah, he said: Sulayman bin Yasar said: The hand is not cut except for five (dirhams?). 1073 - My father told me, he said: Yazid bin Harun told us, from Hajjaj, from Qatadah, from Sulayman bin Yasar, he said: The hand is not cut except for five.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 1074 - My father told me, he said: Abu Qatan told us, he said: Hisham told us, he said: Qatadah told us, from Sulayman bin Yasar, he said: The hand is not cut except for five. 1075 - My father told me, he said: Yunus told us, he said: Abu Awanah told us, from Qatadah, from Sulayman bin Yasar, he said: The hand is not cut except for five. 1076 - My father told me, he said: Abd Al-Wahhab told us, he said: Sa'id informed us, from Qatadah, from Sulayman bin Yasar, he said: The hand is not cut except for five. 1077 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym bin Bashir told us, he said: Mansur—meaning Ibn Zadhan—informed us, from Qatadah, from Sulayman bin Yasar, from Umar bin Al-Khattab, he said: The hand is not cut except for five. 1078 - My father told me [sic], Abu Sa'id Mawla of Banu Hashim told us, he said: Hammam bin Yahya told us, he said: I heard Qatadah narrating from Abdullah Al-Danaj, from Sulayman bin Yasar, he said: The hand is not cut except for five. Then Abdullah Al-Danaj passed by in the mosque, so it was said: 'This is Abdullah Al-Danaj.' So I stood up to him and asked him, so he narrated to me from Sulayman bin Yasar, he said: The hand is not cut except for five. 1079 - My father told me, he said: Abu Bakr bin Ayyash told us in Kufa, he said: Mansur told us, from Mujahid, from Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib, he said: Umar said: The hand is not cut except for five.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 1080 - My father told me, he said: Asbat told us, he said: Al-A'mash told us, from Isma'il, from Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib, from Umar, he said: The hand is not cut except for five—meaning dirhams. 1081 - I heard my father mention Al-Shafi'i, so he said: He did not benefit from us more than we benefited from him. 1082 - Abu Abd Al-Rahman said: And everything in the books of Al-Shafi'i 'A trustworthy person told me' from Hushaym and others, it is my father. 1083 - Abdullah told us, he said: Ali bin Hakim told us, he said: I heard Abu Al-Ahwos say: I heard Sufyan say: 'Would that I had limited myself to the Quran.' 1084 - My father said: Abd Al-Rahman used to say when he dictated to us: 'Sufyan told us,' and when he read: 'Sufyan.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 1085 - My father told me, he said: Sufyan told us, he said: Al-Majishun said: When Al-Walid removed him—meaning Umar bin Abd Al-Aziz—we traveled with him to Al-Walid. We said to him: 'When you arrive upon him, do not let him see that he has diminished you.' He said: So he said: 'I have no need for anything other than the decree of Allah.' 1086 - Abdullah told us, he said: Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaybah told us, he said: Waki' told us, from Al-Mu'alla bin Burjan, from Al-Azraq bin Qays, he said: I saw Ibn Umar picking his beard. 1087 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, from Al-Mu'alla bin Jabir, from Al-Azraq, similar to it. 1088 - My father told me, he said: Abu Ubaydah Al-Haddad told us, from Al-Mu'alla bin Jabir Al-Laqiti, another Hadith. 1089 - Abdullah said: I went out to Kufa in the year two hundred and thirty. When I arrived, I began presenting to my father the Hadiths of Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaybah from Sharik. He said regarding them: 'Beautiful Ghara'ib (rare Hadiths); if he were here, we would have heard them from him.' 1090 - I presented to my father Hadiths I heard from Jubarah Al-Kufi. He said regarding some of them: 'They are fabricated' or 'They are lies.' Among them: From Hammad Al-Abahh, from Al-Zuhri, from Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib, from Abu Hurayrah, from the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him: 'This Ummah will act for a period according to the Book of Allah, then for a period according to the Sunnah of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, then for a period according to opinion (Ra'y).' He denied it strongly. And from Hammad Al-Abahh, from Al-Hakam, from Ibn Jubayr, from Ibn Abbas, from the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him: 'The prayer of the sitting person is like half the prayer of the standing person.' He denied it. And a Hadith from Hammad bin Zayd from Ishaq bin Suwayd; he denied them.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 1091 - I heard my father say: These are the men whom Mis'ar narrated from among the people of Kufa and others, and Shu'bah did not hear from them: Umayr bin Sa'id, Abd Al-Rahman bin Al-Aswad, Abu Bakr bin Amr bin Utbah, Ubaydullah bin Al-Qibtiyyah, Bukayr bin Al-Akhnas, Wabrah bin Abd Al-Rahman, Thabit bin Ubayd, Al-Qasim bin Abd Al-Rahman, Al-Walid bin Abi Malik, Abu Matar, Tha'labah Abu Bahr, Abdullah bin Wasil, Abd Al-Malik bin Nawfal, Yazid Al-Faqir, Atiyyah Al-Awfi, Musa bin Abdullah bin Yazid, Uthman bin Muslim bin Hurmuz, and Al-Hajjaj Mawla of Banu Tha'labah from Qutbah bin Malik the uncle of Ziyad bin Ilaqah. And Imran bin Umayr—Shu'bah saw him but did not hear from him. And Abd Al-Malik bin Iyas Al-Shaybani, Al-Walid bin Sari', and Jawab Al-Taymi—Sufyan saw him but did not hear anything from him. My father told me, he said: Abu Nu'aym told me, he said: I heard Sufyan say: 'I passed by Jawab, but I did not present myself to him.' And Ata' bin Abi Rabah, Awn bin Abdullah bin Utbah, Abu Bakr bin Umarah bin Ruwaybah, Al-Nudayr bin Qays, and Al-Huwayrith bin Nimmar.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 1092 - And these are those whom Shu'bah narrated from and Sufyan did not hear from them: Al-Minhal bin Amr, Talhah bin Musarrif, Al-Hakam bin Utaybah, Abu Umar Yahya bin Ubayd, A'idh bin Nasib, Ali bin Mudrik, Al-Walid bin Al-Ayzar, Abd Al-Malik bin Maysarah, Abdullah bin Abi Al-Majalid, Simak Al-Hanafi, Yazid bin Al-Bara' bin Azib, Adi bin Thabit, Hayyan Al-Bariqi, Uqbah bin Hurayth, Abdullah bin Abdullah bin Jabr, Al-Hurr bin Al-Sayyah, Abu Al-Mukhtar Al-Asadi—he heard from Ibn Abi Awfa, Za'idah bin Umayr, Al-Ala' bin Badr, Ali Abu Al-Asad, Abu Al-Safar, Mahall bin Khalifah, Yahya bin Al-Husayn, Sa'id bin Abi Burdah, Yazid bin Abi Maryam, Abu Al-Haytham—and he is not the owner of the Qasab (reeds), Isma'il bin Raja', Nu'aym bin Abi Hind, Yusayr bin Al-Rabi' bin Amilah, Haytham bin Habib Al-Sayrafi, Hamzah Al-A'war Abu Umarah bin Hamzah, Hajjaj Al-Muharibi, Abu Bakr bin Hafs, Bashir bin Thabit Al-Ansari, Majza'ah bin Zahir, Muyassar bin Imran bin Umayr, Rabi' bin Al-Rukayn bin Al-Rabi', Ja'dah from the children of Umm Hani, Asim bin Amr Al-Bajali, and Ubayd bin Al-Hasan. 1093 - My father told me, he said: Abu Amir Abd Al-Malik bin Amr told us, from Shu'bah, he said: I saw Muhammad bin Al-Muntashir, Habib bin Salim, Al-Hasan bin Abi Al-Hasan Al-Basri, Qatadah bin Di'amah, Muhammad bin Ziyad, Ammar bin Abi Ammar, Marwan Al-Asfar, Thabit Al-Bunani, Abu Imran Al-Jawni, Uqayl bin Talhah, Ata' bin Abi Maymunah, Muhammad bin Abdullah bin Abi Ya'qub, Abu Shamr Al-Duba'i, Muslim

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: Al-Qurri, Maymun Abu Abdullah, Budayl bin Maysarah, Abu Al-Tayyah, Abu Dhibyan Khalifah bin Ka'b, Abd Al-Aziz bin Suhayb, Yazid bin Zadhi the uncle of Yazid bin Harun, Abu Isra'il—he heard from him in the house of Qatadah, Ya'la bin Muslim, Abu Sufyan Talhah bin Nafi', Mansur bin Zadhan, Abu Aqil Hashim bin Bilal the judge of Wasit, Abu Jamrah Al-Duba'i, Sayyar bin Salamah, Ubaydullah bin Abi Bakr bin Anas, Habib bin Al-Shahid, Shu'ayb bin Al-Habhab, Anas bin Sirin, Shamsah, Al-Azraq bin Qays, Tamim bin Huways, Hisham bin Zayd bin Anas, Musa bin Anas, Humayd bin Hilal, Abu Nawfal bin Abi Aqrab, Khulayd bin Ja'far, Ghaylan bin Jarir, Yazid Al-Rishk, Mu'awiyah bin Qurrah, Iyas bin Mu'awiyah, Wasil Mawla of Abu Uyaynah, Abu Harun Al-Ghanawi, Khalid bin Abi Al-Salt, Habib bin Al-Zubayr, Amr bin Abi Hakim, Abu Raja' Muhammad bin Sayf, Ishaq bin Suwayd, Abu Quza'ah Suwayd bin Hujayr, Ghalib Al-Tammar, Aws bin Thabit, Abu Al-Mu'alla Al-Attar, Salih bin Abi Sulayman, Qasim bin Abi Ayyub Al-A'raj, Iyad Abu Khalid, Al-Nu'man bin Salim, Jabr bin Habib, Khubayb bin Abd Al-Rahman Al-Ansari, Habib bin Zayd Al-Ansari, Dawud bin Farahij, Sa'id Al-Maqburi, and Abu Bakr bin Amr bin Hazm. And Rawh said from Shu'bah from Ibn Abi Bakr that his father used to hasten (Nafr) on the third day. And Abd Al-Rahman bin Mahdi claimed that he—meaning Shu'bah—heard it from Abu Bakr bin Hazm (37b). And Muhammad bin Abd Al-Rahman bin Sa'd bin Zurarah, Abu Ziyad Al-Tahhan, Abu Al-Dahhak, Ata' Al-Khurasani, and Humayd bin

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: Nafi', Al-Qasim bin Abi Bazzah, Muslim bin Yannaq, Ubaydullah bin Abi Yazid, Abu Ja'far Al-Khatmi, Al-Ala' bin Abd Al-Rahman, Yazid bin Khumayr, Sulayman bin Abd Al-Rahman, Abu Al-Fayd Al-Shami, Abu Al-Judi, Abu Abdullah Al-Shami who heard Al-Nu'man bin Bashir, Abu Abdullah Al-Asqalani, Abd Al-Rahman bin Al-Adda' who heard Abu Umamah, Ibrahim bin Maymun, Bakr bin Wa'il bin Dawud, Yahya bin Yazid Al-Hana'i, Abbas Al-Jurayri, Al-Qasim bin Mihran who narrated from Abu Rafi', Abd Al-Hamid bin Kardid the companion of Al-Ziyadi, Al-Awwam bin Murajim Al-Qaysi, Ali bin Al-Hakam Al-Bunani, Amir Al-Ahwal, Musa Al-Sablani, Abu Salamah who heard Al-Sha'bi, Abu Shu'ayb who heard Tawus, Salamah bin Alqamah, Al-Jallas—my father said: It is only Abu Al-Jallas Uqbah bin Sayyar, but Shu'bah says it like this—and Hudhayfah Abu Al-Yaman, Sulayman Al-Attar, Abdullah bin Hani' the nephew of Mutarrif, Mansur Al-Ghudani, Abu Maslamah Sa'id bin Yazid, Abd Al-Khaliq bin Salamah, Uthman bin Abi Rawwad the brother of Abd Al-Aziz, Abu Umaymah Aban bin Taghlib, Abu Al-Nadr a Sheikh of his, Abu Rayhanah Abdullah bin Matar, Muhannad Al-Ataki, Abu Sadaqah Al-Ajli, Sawadah Al-Qushayri, Ghalib Al-Qattan, Humayd Al-Awza'i, Yazid Abu Khalid—and he is not Al-Dalani—Mas'ud bin Ali Al-Shaybani, Abu Al-Azhar Salih bin Dirham, Umarah bin Abdullah bin Yasar Al-Absi, Shihab Abu Ja'far, Ibrahim bin Muhammad bin Hatib, Ayyash Al-Kulaybi, Waddah who heard Jabir bin Zayd, Muhammad bin Murrah, and Abu Alqamah—my father told me, he said: Muhammad bin Ja'far told us, he said: Shu'bah told us, he said: I heard Abu Alqamah say: I asked Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib about the Mu'adhah (amulet), so he said: If it is in a reed (tube), or in leather, or in silver, there is no harm. And Ziyad bin Mikhraq, Abu Sadaqah Mawla of Anas, Nu'man Al-Kaskari, Ubaydullah bin Imran, Hamzah Al-Dabbi, Al-Mughirah bin Malik, Habib Al-Tamimi, Abu Hamzah their neighbor, Mas'ud their neighbor, Usamah their neighbor, Al-Hasan bin Muslim Al-Hudhali, Muhammad bin Dhakwan, Attab Mawla of Hurmuz, Sharqi, Abu Sharqi, Mushash, Jarad Al-Dabbi, Asim a relative of Ibrahim, Asim Mawla of Quraybah, Uqbah bin Abi Thubayt Al-Rasi, Tawbah Al-Hilali, Nasr from Ata', Sufyan bin Husayn, Husayn Abu Sufyan bin Husayn, Matar Al-Warraq, Hatim bin Abi Saghirah, Abd Al-Salam Mawla of Quraysh, Al-Ja'd Abu Uthman, Abdullah bin Subayh, Silm from Ibn Abi Al-Hudhayl—and he is not Silm bin Abd Al-Rahman—Abd Al-Hamid bin Wasil, Al-Awwam bin Hawshab, Abd Al-Wahid Al-Haliki, Umar bin Sulayman from the descendants of Umar bin Al-Khattab, Sayyar bin Abi Sayyar—and he is Sayyar Abu Al-Hakam, and it is said Ibn Wardan—Salih bin Muslim Al-Ajli, Shubayl Al-Duba'i, Yahya bin Abi Ishaq, Umarah bin Abi Hafsah, Abu Awanah, Hushaym, and Ibn Ulayyah.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 1094 - I heard my father say: These are those whom Sufyan narrated from, and Shu'bah did not narrate from them. He heard from Sa'id bin Ashwa', Nusayr bin Dhu'luq, and Ma'n bin Abd Al-Rahman. My father used to deny the Hadith of Shababah from Shu'bah from Ma'n: 'He used to make Nabidh for Abdullah in an earthenware jar.' And Abdullah bin Al-Rabi' bin Khuthaym, Rabi' bin Abi Rashid, Jami' bin Abi Rashid, Abd Al-Rahman bin Alqam Al-Makki, Zayd bin Talhah Al-Madini, Abdullah bin Muhammad bin Aqil, Abdullah bin Jabir, Mustaghfir Al-Bajali, Al-Hasan bin Amr Al-Fuqaymi, Al-Ala' bin Al-Musayyib, Abu Bakr Marzuq, Abu Al-Hudhayl Ghalib, and Qays bin Yusayr

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: Ibn Amr, Mas'ud bin Malik—my father said: I think Shu'bah narrated from him—Ubayd bin Abi Mayyah—my father said: He is Abu Amr Muhammad—Ya'la bin Ubayd, Isa bin Abi Izzah, Azhar Al-Attar, Ya'qub Al-Ahlafi—and he is Al-Ajli—Sa'id bin Abd Al-Rahman Al-Zubaydi, Ata' bin Abi Marwan, Hurays Al-Bajali, Abd Al-Karim Al-Jazari, Abu Rawq Atiyyah bin Al-Harith, Waqa' bin Iyas, Salamah bin Nubayt, Al-Mukhtar bin Fulful, Salim Abu Al-Nadr, Al-Agharr bin Al-Sabah Al-Minqari, Salim bin Ajlan Al-Aftas, Harun bin Antarah, Bukayr bin Atiq, Abu Hafs Umar Al-Ansari, Isa bin Al-Mughirah, Ishaq bin Al-Mughirah, Ishaq bin Abi Bananah, Yusuf bin Ya'qub the judge of Sana'a, Abu Al-Za'ra' Amr bin Amr, Aslam Al-Minqari, Al-Nu'man bin Qays Al-Muradi, Al-Ja'd bin Dhakwan Mawla of Shurayh, Abu Al-Rabi' Halwath Al-Thawri, Hilal bin Khabbab, Abu Al-Sawda' Amr bin Amir, Abu Bakr Al-Zubaydi from Asim bin Sharib, Abu Fazarah, Abu Hilal Al-Ta'i, Yahya bin Hayyan, and Hammam Al-Taymi—my father told me, he said: Abd Al-Rahman bin Mahdi told us, from Sufyan, he said: Hammam Al-Taymi told me—and he had met Yazid bin Sharik—he said: When Ibrahim Al-Taymi told stories, his father expelled him from his house and said: 'What is this that you have innovated?' And Salamah bin Al-Minhal, Abdullah bin Abi Mahdhurah, Abd Al-Hamid bin Rafi' Al-Makki, Rabi'ah Al-Ra'y, Sumayy, Zayd bin Aslam, Muhammad bin Suqah, Khalid bin Abi Karimah, Fulayt Al-Amiri, Abu Sinan Sa'id bin Sinan, Abd Al-Rahman Al-Asamm, Khalid bin Dinar, Umar bin Abd Al-Rahman, Hayyan the owner of rugs (Anmat)—Shu'bah narrated from Mansur from Hayyan—Khalid bin Zayd, Dawud bin Qays Al-Farra', Abd Al-Malik bin Abi Bashir, and Ibrahim bin Abd Al-A'la—my father said: I do not think Shu'bah heard anything from him—and Habib a Sheikh of Sufyan; he is not Ibn Abi Thabit nor Ibn Abi Amrah.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: And Mujammi' Al-Taymi Mujammi' bin Sam'an, Al-Awza'i, Ibn Abi Dhi'b, Muhammad bin Sa'id from the people of Ta'if, Zakariya from the people of Rayy, Abdullah bin Al-Hasan bin Hasan bin Ali bin Abi Talib, Abu Yunus Al-Qawi—his name is Al-Hasan bin Yazid—Adam Mawla of Khalid—and he is Abu Yahya bin Adam—Ya'qub bin Mujammi' bin Jariyah, Abu Musa from Wahb bin Munabbih, Abdullah bin Sharik, Abu Al-Wazi' an old Sheikh, Abu Amir Al-Hamdani, Wasil bin Sulaym, Al-Zubayr bin Adi, Hakim bin Daylam, Ayyash Al-Amiri, Sinan Abu Habib, Al-Hazhaz bin Mayzan, Bashir Abu Isma'il, Jahsh bin Ziyad, Bakr bin Qays, Thawr bin Yazid Al-Shami, Hisham bin Abdullah bin Kinanah, Ya'la bin Al-Nu'man, and Uthman bin Hakim. 1095 - My father said: Abu Al-Rabab Al-Qushayri's name is Mutarrif bin Malik. 1096 - I heard my father say: Abdullah bin Mutarrif bin Al-Shikhkhir's Kunya is Abu Jazi. And Abu Al-Zinba' is Sadaqah bin Salih. And Abu Al-Zahiriyyah is Hudayr bin Kurayb. Atiyyah bin Qays Al-Kala'i is Abu Yahya.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 1097 - My father told me, he said: Harun bin Isma'il bin Al-Nu'man bin Abdullah bin Ka'b Abu Musa told us, he said: Ka'b bin Malik bin Abi Ka'b bin Al-Qayn bin Sawad bin Ghanm bin Ali Al-Sulami had children: Abdullah bin Ka'b, Abd Al-Rahman bin Ka'b, Fadalah bin Ka'b, Ubaydullah bin Ka'b, and Wahb bin Ka'b. Abdullah had children: Al-Nu'man bin Abdullah, Kharijah bin Abdullah, Abd Al-Rahman bin Abdullah, Amr bin Abdullah, and Ma'qil bin Abdullah. And Abd Al-Rahman bin Ka'b had children: Bashir bin Abd Al-Rahman bin Ka'b, and Ka'b bin Abd Al-Rahman—he did not have any children other than these two and their offspring. And Hamad bin Abd Al-Rahman bin Ka'b had offspring. The Kunya of Ka'b in the Jahiliyyah was Abu Bashir, and the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, gave him the Kunya Abu Abdullah. Malik did not have a child other than Ka'b that we know of, unless there was one who had no offspring. Abdullah bin Ka'b was the eldest of his father's children and his executor (Wasi). Abdullah bin Ka'b died among the last of his father Ka'b's children to die, and his Kunya was Abu Abd Al-Rahman.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 1098 - And Hassan bin Thabit was from Banu Al-Najjar. And Abdullah bin Rawahah was from Banu Al-Najjar. Hassan's Kunya was Abu Al-Husam, and his Kunya was Abu Al-Walid, but it was as if he disliked it. And Abu Lubabah bin Abd Al-Mundhir was from Banu Amr bin Awf. Murarah bin Al-Rabi' was Waqifi from Banu Waqif. Mu'adh bin Jabal bin Udayy bin Salamah Al-Sulami was Abu Abd Al-Rahman. And Abu Talhah Zayd bin Sahl was from Banu Al-Najjar. And Anas bin Malik was from Banu Al-Najjar. And Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri was from Banu Salim belonging to Al-Khazraj.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Narrators)
text: 1099 - My father told me, he said: Ishaq bin Isa—meaning Al-Tabba'—told me, he said: Abdullah—meaning Ibn Zayd bin Aslam—told me, he said: My father told me, from Ibn Umar, he said: 'Two dead things and two bloods have been made lawful for us: Of the dead things, the locust and the fish/whale; and of the bloods, the spleen and the liver.' Ishaq said: I heard Abd Al-Rahman bin Zayd bin Aslam narrating it from his brother Usamah bin Zayd, from his father, from Ibn Umar. Then I heard him narrating it from his father, from Ibn Umar, from the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1100 - My father told me, he said Ishaq bin Isa told us, he said Hammad bin Salamah told us, on the authority of Ali bin Zaid, on the authority of Sa'id bin al-Musayyib, he said: Isa bin Maryam (Jesus son of Mary) was raised up while he was thirty-three years old, and Mu'adh bin Jabal died while he was thirty-three years old.
1101 - My father told me, he said Ishaq bin Isa told us, he said Makhlad bin Husayn told me, on the authority of Hisham, on the authority of Hafsa, she said: Abu al-Aliyah would sometimes visit us and stay in our upper room for a month without returning to his family.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1102 - My father told me, he said Ishaq bin Isa told us, he said: I never heard him—meaning Malik bin Anas—say anything but "Ibn Shihab," while we say "Al-Zuhri."
1103 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, he said Ash'ath informed us. I said: "O Abu Mu'awiyah, who is Ash'ath?" He said: "Ibn Abd al-Malik."
1104 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Sa'id told us, on the authority of Sufyan, on the authority of Abu al-Rabi' 'Halwath'.
1105 - My father told me, he said I heard Sufyan bin Uyainah say: Yahya bin Sa'id—meaning the Ansari—said to me: "What is the knowledge of the people of Mecca regarding the 'Araya' (a type of sale)?" I said: "Ata informed them that he heard it from Jabir."
1106 - My father said: Abdullah bin Salamah, his Kunyah (surname) is Abu al-Aliyah. I do not know of anyone who narrated from him other than Amr bin Murrah and Abu Ishaq al-Hamdani.
1107 - I heard my father say: Yazid al-Raqashi is above (better than) Aban bin Abi Ayyash.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1108 - My father said: When Waki' narrated from Sufyan, from Muslim al-A'war, he would say "Sufyan, from a man," and sometimes he said "Sufyan, from Abu Abdullah, from Mujahid," and he is Muslim. I said: "Why does he not name him?" He said: "He weakens him."
1109 - My father said: Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi abandoned the hadith of Abu al-Yaqzan Uthman bin Umayr. My father said: Abu al-Yaqzan went out in the rebellion with Ibrahim bin Abdullah bin Hasan. My father said: The defeat was in the year one hundred and forty-five.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1110 - My father said: Whoever heard from Sa'id bin Abi Arubah before the defeat, his hearing is good, and whoever heard after the defeat, my father used to weaken them. I said to him: "Did Sa'id become confused (mentally)?" He said: "Yes." Then my father said: "Whoever heard from him in Kufa, like Muhammad bin Bishr and Abdah, it is good." Then he said: "Sa'id came to Kufa twice before the defeat."
1111 - My father told me, on the authority of Abu Bakr bin Ayyash, he said: I said to Jamil bin Zaid: "Are these hadiths the hadiths of Ibn Umar?" He said: "I did not hear anything from Ibn Umar. Rather, they told me 'Write the hadiths of Ibn Umar', so I came to Medina and wrote them."
1112 - My father said: Abu Bakr bin Ayyash said: Al-Ahwas bin Hakim narrated a hadith, so I said to him: "From the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him?" He said: "Is not all hadith from the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him?"
1113 - My father said: Yazid bin Khumayr, his Kunyah is Abu Umar.
1114 - My father told me, he said I heard Yahya bin Sa'id say: Hisham bin Urwah died after the defeat.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1115 - I heard my father say: Ubayd bin Nadilah, his Kunyah is Abu Mu'awiyah. And Abu Ma'bad, the Mawla (client) of Ibn Abbas, his name is Nafidh. And Abu Hariz, his name is Abdullah bin Husayn; his hadith is Munkar (objectionable), and he was the judge of Sijistan.
1116 - My father said: Zaid bin Thabit, his Kunyah is Abu Sa'id. My father said in another hadith: It is said Abu Kharijah. And Qabisah bin Dhu'ayb is Abu Sa'id.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1117 - My father told me, he said Rawh told us, he said Shu'bah told us, he said: Thabit al-Bunani used to recite the Quran in one day and night and would fast perpetually.
1118 - My father told me, he said Abdullah bin Idris told us, he said: I said to Malik bin Anas: "We had Alqamah and Al-Aswad." So he said: "The matter was overturned among you like this," and he flipped his palm onto its back, referring to Abu Hanifa.
1119 - My father told me, he said Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi said: I followed Muhammad bin al-Nadr al-Harithi to Wasit to learn from his manners and from—meaning—his intellect, but he would not speak to me. So they said to me: "If you want him to speak to you, do something he disapproves of." So when I entered the ship, I put my foot in the water—as if he was splashing the water with his foot and not washing it with his hand—so he said: "What is the matter with you doing this?" I said: "So-and-so told us from so-and-so, and so-and-so told us from so-and-so." My father said: Abd al-Rahman said: "I never saw his like in righteousness"—meaning Muhammad bin al-Nadr al-Harithi.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1120 - My father told me, he said Waki' told us, he said Ali bin Salih told us, on the authority of Uthman al-Thaqafi al-A'sha Abu al-Mughirah, on the authority of Malik bin Juwayn al-Hadrami, on the authority of Ali, he said: Consuming the orphan's wealth is among the major sins.
1121 - My father said: Abu al-Jahhaf is Dawud bin Abi Awf. I said: "Is he trustworthy (Thiqah)?" He said: "Trustworthy."
1122 - My father told me, on the authority of Hammad al-Khayyat, he said: Ibn Abi Dhi'b used to resemble Sa'id bin al-Musayyib.
1123 - My father said: Muhammad bin Sirin heard from Abu Hurairah, Ibn Umar, and Anas bin Malik, and he heard from Imran bin Husayn, but he did not hear anything from Ibn Abbas; for all of it he says: "I was informed on the authority of Ibn Abbas."
1124 - My father said: Abdullah bin Shubrumah is Abu Shubrumah.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1125 - My father told me, he said Muhammad bin Abi Adi told us, on the authority of Ibn Awn, he said: I mentioned it to Muhammad, so he said: "From his mother?" I said: "Yes." He said: "Indeed, she used to mix with her and enter upon her"—meaning the hadith of Al-Hasan from his mother, from Umm Salamah regarding Ammar: "The transgressing party will kill him."
1126 - My father told me, he said Ismail bin Ulayyah told us, he said: Our companions used to dislike the Tafsir (interpretation) of Qatadah.
1127 - My father said: Ibn Awn remained after Ayyub for about twenty years.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1128 - My father said: Yahya bin Sa'id al-Qattan was knowledgeable in inheritance laws. I said: "Was he a Faqih (jurist)?" He said: "He was good in Fiqh."
1129 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Sa'id told us, on the authority of Al-A'mash, he said Amr bin Murrah told us, on the authority of Abu Ubaidah, Yahya said: "I heard Abu Musa"—then he abandoned it later and said: Abu Musa said: "For a sitting that I sit with Abdullah (bin Mas'ud) is more trustworthy to myself than the work of a year."
1130 - My father said: And Ya'la said, on the authority of Al-A'mash, on the authority of Abu Ishaq, on the authority of Abu Ubaidah, similar to it.
1131 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Sa'id told us, he said Sufyan told us, he said Sulaiman told us, on the authority of Umarah, on the authority of Huraith bin Zuhair, he said: He came—meaning Abdullah—to Abu Darda, so he said: "Has he left the like of himself behind?"
1132 - My father said: Sulaiman bin al-Mughirah is more established in (narrating from) Humaid than Ayyub.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1133 - My father told me, he said Abu Usamah told us, he said Uthman bin Ghiyath informed us, on the authority of Abu al-Salil, he said: A man from the Companions of the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, came to us, and people would gather around him. So when they became numerous, he climbed onto the roof of a house and spoke to them from there.
1134 - My father told me, he said Amr bin Mujamma' told us, he said Yunus bin Khabbab Abu Hamzah told us.
1135 - My father told me, he said Maslamah bin al-Salt al-Shaibani told us, he said I heard Umarah bin Abi Hafsah Abu Rawh.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1136 - I heard my father say: Waki' died in the year one hundred and ninety-seven, in the beginning of it or at the end of Dhu al-Hijjah of the year ninety-six. And Ibn Uyainah died after him in the year ninety-eight in Rajab; news of his death reached us while we were with Abd al-Razzaq. And Ibn Mahdi and Yahya bin Sa'id died in that same year.
1137 - My father said: And Gundar used to fast one day and break fast one day.
1138 - My father said: Matar al-Warraq is weak in hadith regarding (narrations from) Ata.
1139 - My father told me, he said Abu Nu'aym told us, he said: Amr bin Huraith died in the year eighty-five.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1140 - My father told me, he said Muhammad bin Mus'ab told us, he said I heard Abu Asim—a man whom my father had sent with me—ask Al-Awza'i, saying: "O Abu Amr, which of the people was the most knowledgeable?" He said: "Al-Hasan went away with the sermons, and Ata went away with the rituals (Manasik)."
1141 - My father told me, he said Muhammad bin Mus'ab told us, he said I heard Al-Awza'i say: Ata was a black man with mixed features. We used to be afraid to ask him when we came to him until he touched his sideburns or turned around or cleared his throat. He said: "Then we would draw near to him and ask him."
1142 - Abdullah told us, he said I heard Yahya bin Ma'in say: Muhammad bin Mus'ab was not from the people of hadith; he was heedless. My father narrated from him: Al-Ashhab, from Abu Raja, from Imran bin Husayn, that he disliked selling weapons during Fitna (civil strife), and this is actually the speech of Abu Raja.
1143 - My father said: Al-Haitham bin Jamil wrote to me asking that I write to him with 'The Conquests of Sham', so I wrote to him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text: 1144 - My father told me, he said: I said to Al-Haitham in Tarsus: "In which year did Harun die?" [He said:] "The year ninety-three." And he had heard from Zuhair. So I said to him: "Did Zuhair hear from Ali bin al-Aqmar?" He said: "No." My father said: He was among the people of hadith in Baghdad—he, Abu Kamil, and Abu Salamah al-Khuza'i. Al-Haitham was the best memorizer of the three, and Abu Kamil was more precise in hadith than him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1145 - My father told me, he said Mu'ammal told us, he said Hammad bin Zaid told us, he said: I used to ask Yunus in the gathering of Ayyub, and he would gesture with his hand like this—meaning "Silence"—and he would place his hand over his mouth.
1146 - I asked my father about Ash'ath bin Abd al-Malik al-Humrani al-Basri. He said: "There is no harm in him; Bishr bin al-Mufaddal, Yahya, and Mu'adh narrated from him." My father said: Shu'bah said: "Yunus used to take these hadiths from Ash'ath." I said to my father: "Which of them is more established to you, he or Ash'ath bin Sawar?" He said: "Ash'ath bin Sawar is weak in hadith; Al-Humrani is above him." And Yahya bin Sa'id said: "Ash'ath al-Humrani did not dictate to us; we only memorized from him." And Khalid bin al-Harith said: "We used to sit with Ash'ath al-Humrani and he would say 'And he used to say, and he used to say'—meaning Al-Hasan." My father said: It has reached me that he was one of the most self-respecting souls among people.
1147 - My father told me, he said Hajjaj told us, he said Shu'bah said: Sulaiman told me—and Sulaiman was more beloved to me in hadith than Asim—regarding "Indeed one of us talks to himself about something he would dislike to speak of." He said: "That is pure faith." I said to Shu'bah: "Did Sulaiman mention Abu Hurairah?" He said: "No, and you should not mind."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1148 - My father told us, he said Hajjaj told us, he said Shu'bah informed us, on the authority of Al-Mughirah, he said: I heard Al-Sha'bi saying: "Al-Harith told me, and I testify that he was one of the liars."
1149 - My father told us, he said Talq bin Ghannam told us, he said: Ali bin Mudrik died in the year one hundred and twenty, and Ma'bad bin Khalid died during the governorship of Khalid, and Khalid became governor in the year six and was removed in the year twenty.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1150 - My father told me, he said Abu al-Jahm Abd al-Quddus bin Bakr bin Khunais told us, on the authority of Muhammad bin al-Nadr al-Harithi, he said: It used to be said that the beginning of knowledge is silence for it, then listening to it, then memorizing it, then acting upon it, then spreading it.
1151 - My father told me, he said Ismail bin Ulayyah told us, he said: I saw Ayyub, and he used to lead his companions in prayer; he would perform voluntary prayers between the Tarawih prayers, and he would pray in the niche (Mihrab), and he would perform Qunut when sixteen nights had passed.
1152 - My father told me, he said Hammad bin Mas'adah told us, on the authority of Shu'bah, he said: Do not leave your share of "I think" (verification).

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1153 - My father told me, he said Hammad bin Mas'adah told us, on the authority of Ibn Awn, he said: Umair—meaning Ibn Ishaq—would sometimes want to tell me a hadith while I was with him, but he would deem me too young.
1154 - My father told me, he said Al-Dahhak bin Makhlad told us, on the authority of Ibn Jurayj, he said: We used to gather around Ata, fifty of us, and none of them remains—meaning anyone.
1155 - My father told me, he said Abu Ahmad al-Zubairi told us, he said Sharik told us, on the authority of Abu Ishaq, on the authority of Hubshi bin Junadah, he said: I said to Abu Ishaq: "Where did you hear it from him?" He said: "He stopped by us on a horse of his in a gathering in the graveyard of Al-Sabi'."
1156 - My father told me, he said Abu Ahmad al-Zubairi told us, he said Fitr told us, on the authority of Abu Ishaq, he said: Urwah bin Abi al-Ja'd stopped by us on a horse of his.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1157 - My father told me, he said Ali bin Hafs told us, he said Shu'bah informed us, on the authority of Abu Jamrah, he said: I heard Zahdam bin Mudarrib—and he came to me on a horse for a need—so he said: Imran bin Husayn told me...
1158 - My father told me, he said Abd al-Razzaq told us, he said Ma'mar said: There is no merchandise on earth that goes to waste (unsold) for its owner more severely than knowledge.
1159 - Ibrahim bin Dinar told me, he said Abu Asim told us, he said I heard Hammad bin Salamah say: Hadith is my merchandise; I place it wherever I wish.
1160 - My father told me, he said Abd al-Razzaq told us, on the authority of Ma'mar, he said: Qatadah said: Blessings do not become abundant upon a people except that their enemies become abundant.
1161 - My father told me, he said Ali bin Hafs told us, he said Shu'bah informed us, on the authority of Mujalid bin Sa'id, he said: I heard Al-Sha'bi say to Ismail bin Abi Khalid: "Why do you ask about this? Do you not have an estate/farm?" He said: "I ask just as I have asked." He said: "I wish I had not asked about anything of this." I said to my father: "What did he ask him about?" He said: "About something of knowledge."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1162 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Adam told us in Mecca while Ibn Uyainah was alive, he said Abu Bakr bin Ayyash told us, on the authority of Asim, on the authority of Abu Razin, he said: If Al-Hajjaj is on guidance, then indeed I am in clear error.
1163 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Adam told us, he said Abu Bakr—meaning Ibn Ayyash—told us, on the authority of Asim, he said: A man said to Abu Wa'il: "Indeed a people say that Allah enters the believers into the Fire." He said: "By your life, indeed it (Hell) has a filling other than the believers."
1164 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Adam told us, he said Abu Bakr—meaning Ibn Ayyash—told us, on the authority of Asim, he said: I saw Abu Wa'il when a woman would come to him asking for a fatwa, he would say: "Go to Abu Razin and ask him, and inform me what he replies to you." And sometimes I heard him say: "Go to Ibrahim and ask him, then come to me and inform me what he replies to you."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1165 - My father told me, he said I heard Abu Abd al-Rahman al-Muqri say: Ibn Awn and Ibn Jurayj died in the year fifty (150 AH). "And I never loved anyone like my love for Ibn Awn."
1166 - My father told me, he said Abu Sa'id Mawla of Bani Hashim told us, he said Rabi'ah bin Kulthum bin Jabr told us, on the authority of his father, he said: The companions of Muslim bin Yasar said: Muslim used to sit at this pillar, so he said: "Indeed, Ma'bad speaks with the saying of the Christians"—referring to Ma'bad al-Juhani.
1167 - My father told me, he said Abu Sa'id Mawla of Bani Hashim told us, he said Shu'bah told us, he said: The letter of Umar bin Abd al-Aziz was read to us, to the people of Al-Sawad, that they should gather (for Friday prayer).
1168 - Shaiban bin Abi Shaiban told us, he said Khalid bin Taliq told us, on the authority of Shu'bah, similar to it.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1169 - My father told me, he said: Yahya b. Adam told us, he said: Sufyan al-Thawri told us, he said: Salim al-Makki—meaning al-Khayyat, and he was pleasing [in character/narration]—told us, he said: I heard al-Hasan say: 'One struck by lightning is waited upon for three days.' Sufyan said: 'He is not buried [immediately].'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1170 - My father told me, he said: Yahya b. Adam told us, he said: Abu Zubayd told us from Ajlah from al-Sha'bi, who said: 'There is no charity (Sadaqah) on summer crops.' 1171 - My father told me, he said: Yahya b. Adam told us, he said: Abu Zubayd told us from Ajlah from Abu Ishaq from Asim b. Damrah from Ali: The like of it. 1172 - My father told me, he said: Abd al-Rahman b. Mahdi told us from Qays from Abu Ishaq from a man from Ali: 'There is no Zakat on vegetables (Khadir), herbs (Baql), cucumbers, or apples.' My father said: And Qays and Ma'mar narrated it from Abu Ishaq. My father said: Abd al-Rahman abandoned the hadith of Qays and Jabir al-Ju'fi afterwards.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1173 - My father told me, he said: Abd al-Rahman b. Mahdi told us, he said: I heard Sufyan regarding the hadith of Abu Ishaq about vegetables (Khadir), he said: 'This is not from the hadith of Abu Ishaq.' 1174 - My father told me, he said: Yahya b. Adam told us from Mufaddal b. Muhalhal from al-Hasan b. Ubaydullah from Umarah b. Umayr from al-Aswad, he said: 'Abdullah used to teach the people the Tashahhud just as he taught them a Surah from the Qur'an.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1175 - My father told me, he said: Yahya b. Adam told us, he said: Abu Bakr b. Ayyash told us from Abu Ishaq, he said: 'We were neighbors with Asim b. Damrah for thirty years, and I never heard him narrate a hadith except from Ali.' 1176 - My father told me, he said: Yahya b. Adam told us, he said: Isra'il told us from Zuhayr b. Malik (my father said: he is Abu al-Wazi') from Asim b. Damrah, who said: 'The completion of the bowing (Ruku') is to say: O Allah, to You I bowed, to You I humbled, to You I submitted, in You I believed, and upon You I relied.' 1177 - My father told me, he said: Ishaq b. Yusuf al-Azraq told us from Sharik from Zuhayr b. Malik al-Nahdi (Zuhayr said that) he heard Asim b. Damrah say (Zuhayr said: I do not think he narrated it except from Ali), he said: 'The prostration of a man in prayer is to keep his arms away from his sides and not spread his forearms [on the ground], and the prostration of a woman is to keep her thighs together against her belly and join them.' 1178 - I heard my father say: Salim b. Abi Hafsah, his kunya is Abu Yunus. Al-Thawri narrated from him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1179 - My father told me, he said: Yahya b. Sa'id told us from Abu Yunus Hasan b. Yazid. My father said: I said to Yahya, 'The one called al-Tawwaf?' He said, 'Yes.' My father said: He is Abu Yunus al-Qawi. 1180 - I heard my father say: Yahya b. Sa'id would not equate anyone with Sufyan; he gave him precedence. And Yahya said: 'I have not seen anyone better than Shu'bah.' 1181 - I said to my father: 'Who have you seen in this affair—meaning Hadith?' He said: 'I have not seen the like of Yahya b. Sa'id.' I said: 'Then Hushaym?' He said: 'Hushaym is a Shaykh; I have not seen the like of Yahya.' My father used to greatly respect his status in Hadith and knowledge. I said to him: 'Was he a Faqih (jurist)?' He said: 'Good Fiqh.' I said: 'Then Abd al-Rahman?' He said: 'We have not seen the like of Yahya'—meaning in all his states.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1182 - My father told me, he said: Yahya b. Sa'id told us from Shu'bah from Mu'arrif from Zakariyya from al-Sha'bi regarding a man into whose leather sock a pebble entered, so he took it off. He said: 'He performs Wudu.' I asked my father about this Zakariyya. He said: 'I think he is Zakariyya b. Abi al-Atik, and I do not think he is Ibn Abi Za'idah.' I said: 'Who is this Mu'arrif?' He said: 'I do not know who Mu'arrif is.' I think he said: 'And I do not think he is Mu'arrif b. Wasil.' 1183 - My father told me, he said: Yahya b. Sa'id told us from Sufyan b. Uyaynah from al-A'mash, he said: 'We struggled with Ibrahim to make him lean back [while sick], but he refused.' 1184 - My father told me, he said: Yahya b. Sa'id told us from Sa'id—meaning Ibn Abi Arubah—he said: Ash'ath told me, he said: My father told me that he saw Abu Musa come out of the lavatory and wipe over his cap (Qalansuwah). I asked my father about this Ash'ath. So he narrated to us from Ibn Abi Adi from Sa'id from Ash'ath b. Aslam al-Ijli. Abu Abd al-Rahman said: This is the grandfather of Abu al-Ash'ath Ahmad b. al-Miqdam.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1185 - My father told us, he said: Yahya b. Sa'id told us from Sufyan, he said: Hammad told me from Abu Salih from Shurayh from Umar: 'A dirham for a dirham; the excess between them is Riba.' I asked my father about Abu Salih. He said: 'It is not Dhakwan Abu Salih, and I do not know who he is.' I said to him: 'Do you think he is Sumay'?' He said: 'I do not know.' 1186 - My father told me, he said: Yahya b. Sa'id told us from al-Taymi from Abu Salih from Abu Hurayrah: 'The middle prayer (al-Salat al-Wusta) is the Asr prayer.' My father said: 'It is not Abu Salih al-Samman nor Badham. This is a Basran; I think he is Mizan—meaning his name is Mizan Abu Salih.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1187 - My father said: Yahya rejected it from Shu'bah, meaning the two hadiths of Aisha that the Prophet (peace be upon him) used to wash with the like of this—meaning a large vessel ('Uss)—'I estimated it to be eight pints, or nine, or ten.' This is in the hadith of Musa al-Juhani from Mujahid. 1188 - My father told me, he said: Yahya b. Sa'id told us from Musa b. Abd Allah al-Juhani, he said: A man asked Abd al-Rahman b. Abi Layla while I was listening, saying: 'O Abu Isa...'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1189 - My father told me, he said: Yahya b. Sa'id told us from Sufyan from Isma'il b. Kathir Abu Hashim from Mujahid regarding His saying: {If they desire reconciliation, Allah will cause success between them}. He said: 'They are the two arbiters; it is not the man and the woman {If they desire reconciliation, Allah will cause success between them}.' My father said: I said to Waki' regarding this hadith: 'Who is Abu Hashim?' He remained silent as if he did not know whether he was al-Rummani or al-Makki. My father said: And both of them narrate from Mujahid. 1190 - I heard my father say: Sahbal, his name is Abdullah b. Muhammad b. Abi Yahya. There is no harm in him. Ibrahim b. Muhammad b. Abi Yahya is his brother, and his father is Muhammad b. Abi Yahya. Yahya b. Sa'id narrated to us from him about twenty [hadiths]; he narrated to us from him and from Anis.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1191 - My father said: Abu al-Mughirah al-Khassaf. Isra'il named him Habib b. al-Mughirah, and Sharik said: 'Shu'bah guided us to him.' 1192 - I heard him say: Al-Mu'alla b. Hilal al-Tahhan, a Kufan. My father said: 'A liar.' Ibn Uyaynah said: 'If al-Mu'alla narrates from Ibn Abi Najih the one we saw, how deserving he is to have his neck struck.' 1193 - I heard my father say: Abu Bakr b. Abi Sabrah used to fabricate hadith. Then he said: Hajjaj said: Abu Bakr al-Sabri said to me: 'I have seventy thousand hadiths on the lawful and unlawful.' My father said: 'And his hadith is nothing; he used to lie and fabricate hadith.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1194 - I heard my father say: Arta'ah b. al-Mundhir, his kunya is Abu Adi. Safwan b. Amr is Abu Amr. Damrah b. Habib is Abu Utbah. Khalid b. Ma'dan is Abu Abdullah. Amr b. al-Aswad al-Ansi is Abu Iyad. Yahya b. Abi Kathir is Abu Nasr. Humayd b. Hilal is Abu Nasr. Makhul al-Shami is Abu Abdullah. 1195 - I heard my father say: Ibn Abi Dhi'b and Malik used to attend the gatherings of the princes (Amirs). Ibn Abi Dhi'b would speak, commanding them and forbidding them, while Malik remained silent. My father said: 'Ibn Abi Dhi'b is better than Malik and more virtuous.' Hammad al-Khayyat said: 'Ibn Abi Dhi'b used to be compared to Sa'id b. al-Musayyib in his virtue.' They said to Malik b. Anas: 'Sufyan al-Thawri gives fatwas.' He said: 'Does he do so?' Then they said [the same] to Ibn Abi Dhi'b, and he said: 'What is wrong with him? What is wrong with him? I have not seen an Easterner (Mashriqi) better than him'—meaning Sufyan. Ibn Abi Dhi'b was a friend of Sufyan. The people of Madinah call us 'Easterner'. I heard him say: Ibn Abi Dhi'b's name is Muhammad b. Abd al-Rahman b. al-Mughirah b. Abi Dhi'b, and he was one who spoke the truth. I said: 'How is the hearing of those who heard from him?' He said: 'He did not dictate to them; they only memorized [from his speech]. So whoever memorized, memorized. Except that Hajjaj said: I heard from Ibn Abi Dhi'b, then I presented it [the written record] to him.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1196 - My father said: Abu Mu'awiyah said: 'When al-A'mash died, Sufyan met me and began casting [questions] at me, saying: Do you memorize this? about fifteen hadiths.' My father said: And Abu Mu'awiyah said: 'When we stood up from al-A'mash's presence, I used to dictate them to them.' My father said: 'Like al-Ahdab and Ya'la.' Jarir al-Razi said: 'We used to patch them together at al-A'mash's; this one would write from that one, and that one from this one.' 1197 - I heard my father say: Mahdi b. Maymun, Salam b. Miskin, Abu al-Ashhab, and Hawshab b. Aqil are all trustworthy. However, Mahdi is more beloved to me; he is the sweetest of them to the heart—meaning Mahdi—except that Salam used to hold the view of Qadar. Hawshab b. Aqil b. Mahdi, Yahya b. Salam narrated to us from him and narrated from him. In their view, he is among the trustworthy. Ibn Mahdi and Waki' narrated from him. I said: 'Is Salam above Abu al-Ashhab?' He said: 'No.' Then he said: 'How close they are.' He said: 'And Jarir b. Hazim is also trustworthy, except that he is not with [on the same level as] these.' Jarir's kunya is Abu al-Nadr. Sa'id—meaning Ibn Abi Arubah—his kunya is Abu al-Nadr. Yahya al-Jabir's kunya is Abu al-Harith. Amr b. Qays—meaning al-Mula'i—is Abu Abdullah; I heard it from Ibn Abi Ghaniyah. 1198 - My father said: Ibn Sirin heard from Abu Hurayrah in Madinah.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1199 - My father said: It reached me from Hushaym that he said: When Mansur b. al-Mu'tamir died, Husayn saw me while I was gloomy or sad. He said: 'What is wrong with you?' I said: 'The death of Mansur was mentioned.' He said: 'I remember the night he was born.' My father said: Husayn b. Abd al-Rahman is older than Mansur. 1200 - My father said: Sa'd b. Sa'id, the brother of Yahya b. Sa'id al-Ansari, is weak in Hadith. Abd Rabbih b. Sa'id is the brother of Yahya b. Sa'id; both are trustworthy. As for Abd Rabbih—(approval)—he is trustworthy. 1201 - My father said: Abu Razin Mas'ud b. Malik, from whom Isma'il b. Sami', al-A'mash, Asim, and Isma'il b. Abi Khalid narrated, prayed behind Ali b. Abi Talib. My father said: He was a righteous man; he is Abu Razin al-Asadi. My father said: Shu'bah used to deny that he heard anything from Abdullah b. Mas'ud. 1202 - My father said: Sulayman al-Shaybani said: 'I left Kufah for a trip while Ibrahim was not mentioned and not narrating. Then I returned, and he had narrated, then he died. So I sat with Hammad and others and carried [knowledge] from them—meaning from Ibrahim.' My father said: Al-Shaybani is old; he heard from Ibn Abi Awfa.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1203 - My father said: Ghudayf b. al-Harith is Abu Asma'. And Abu Bahriyyah is Abdullah b. Qays al-Taraghumi. 1204 - My father said: Aqil b. Abi Talib is Abu Yazid. Umar b. Abd Allah b. Ya'la b. Murrah is weak in Hadith. 1205 - My father said: The people who narrated most from Ibn Awn are Sulaym b. Akhdar and Azhar al-Samman. 1206 - My father told me, he said: Affan told us: Ibn Awn was asked, 'Who are your companions?' He said: 'Sulaym Sulaym, and Azhar Azhar.' 1207 - I heard my father say: We went out with Waki' to al-Anbar. A man said to him: 'O Abu Sufyan, they write: Sufyan told us, Sufyan told us.' He said: 'Do I not say to them: Sufyan told us?'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1208 - My father said: Dharr did not hear from Abd al-Rahman b. Abza; he heard from Sa'id b. Abd al-Rahman b. Abza. 1209 - My father said: Abu Sufyan al-Sa'di, Abu Mu'awiyah narrated from him; he is nothing; one does not write from him. And Sufyan al-Thawri said: 'Abu Bistam—meaning Shu'bah—narrates from Dawud al-Awdi,' in astonishment at him. Shu'bah had carried [narrations] from Dawud long ago. 1210 - My father said: Shu'bah erred in the name of Khalid b. Alqamah, so he said:

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 'Malik b. Arfatah.' He also erred regarding Salm b. Abd al-Rahman, saying 'Abdullah b. Yazid' in the hadith regarding the white-footedness (Shikal) of horses; he flipped his name. Shu'bah also erred in the name of Abu al-Thawrayn, calling him 'Abu al-Sawwar,' but he is Abu al-Thawrayn. I said to my father: 'Who is this Abu al-Thawrayn?' He said: 'A famous man from the people of Makkah; his name is Muhammad b. Abd al-Rahman from Quraysh.' I said to my father: 'Abd al-Rahman b. Mahdi claimed that Shu'bah did not err in his kunya, saying: He is al-Sawwar.' My father said: 'Abd al-Rahman does not know'—or a phrase like it. In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: And among what I did not find a mark of hearing upon, and it is an Ijazah (license) for me, Abdullah b. Ahmad informed us, saying: 1211 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il b. Abd al-Karim b. Ma'qil b. Munabbih told us, he said: Abd al-Samad told me that he heard Wahb say: 'Five thousand and six hundred years of the world have passed. I know every era of it and what kings and prophets were in it.' We said to Wahb: 'How long is the world?' He said: 'Six thousand years.' 1212 - I heard my father say: Yahya b. Sa'id said: 'I did not write anything from Sufyan except what he said: He told me, or: He told us, except for two hadiths.' Then my father said: Yahya b. Sa'id told us from Sufyan from Simak from Ikrimah, and Mughirah from Ibrahim: {If they are from a people who are enemies to you, yet he is a believer}. They said: 'It is the man who becomes Muslim in the Abode of War and is killed; there is no blood money for him, [only] expiation.' My father said: These are the two hadiths that Yahya claimed he did not hear Sufyan say 'He told us' or 'He told me' in them.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1213 - My father said: Habib b. Abi Amrah (approval) is trustworthy; his kunya is Abu Abdullah, and he was a butcher. Ayyub—who is Ibn Abi Miskin, Abu al-Ala—was a righteous, trustworthy man, and he was a butcher. And Talhah the Butcher, I do not see any harm in him. 1214 - Abu Abd al-Rahman said: My father dyed [his hair/beard] when he was sixty-three. His uncle said to him: 'You have hastened, O Abu Abdullah.' He said: 'This is the age of the Prophet (peace be upon him).' 1215 - Abu Abd al-Rahman said: And I dyed when I was sixty-three. 1216 - My father said: 'I saw the people in the Congregational Mosque,' as if he mentioned the scarcity of dyeing. Abu Abd al-Rahman said: So he dyed. 1217 - Abu Abd al-Rahman said: My father, may Allah have mercy on him, was born in the year sixty-four. The first he sought Hadith was in the year seventy-nine, in the year in which Malik and Hammad b. Zayd died.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1218 - My father said: I used to ask Yahya b. Sa'id about the hadiths of Isma'il b. Abi Khalid from Amir from Shurayh and others. In my book, it was: Isma'il said: Amir told us from Shurayh, Amir told us from Shurayh. Yahya began saying: 'Isma'il from Amir.' So I said: 'In my book it is: Amir told us, Amir told us.' Yahya said to me: 'They are sound, if it was...' meaning what Isma'il did not hear from Amir, he informed him of it. 1219 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il b. Ulayyah told us, he said: Yahya Abu Hammam told me. He said: Meaning Abu Hammam b. Yahya. 1220 - My father told me, he said: Mu'ammal told us, he said: Wuhayb b. Khalid Abu Bakr told us, he said: I sat with Ibn Tawus. He said: 'Where are you from?' We said: 'From the people of Basra.' He said: 'Perhaps you are from these Qadariyyah?' He said: We said: 'We are companions of Ayyub.' He said: 'May Allah have mercy on Ayyub; he was not a Qadari.' I said to him: 'What did your father say regarding the Qadariyyah?' He said: 'He used to say: It is a matter; whoever speaks about it is asked about it, and whoever does not speak about it is not asked about it. What do you want with it?' 1221 - I asked my father about Abdullah b. Miswar. He said: 'This Abdullah b. Miswar is from the descendants of Ja'far b. Abi Talib. Amr b. Murrah, Khalid b. Abi Karimah, and Abd al-Malik b. Abi Bashir narrated from him.' And Jarir said from Raqabah: 'Ibn Miswar used to fabricate hadith and lie.' My father said: 'And I have abandoned his hadith. Abd al-Rahman b. Mahdi would not narrate to us from him. He is Abu Ja'far al-Mada'ini, and he is Ibn Miswar.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1222 - My father said: Abu Sinan Sa'id b. Sinan is not strong in Hadith. Al-Thawri and Zayd b. al-Hubab narrated from him. He is the one who narrated from Thabit from al-Dahhak. This Abu Sinan used to go to al-Dahhak with Thabit; Thabit would witness [the session], and sometimes Abu Sinan would be absent. So Abu Sinan would take them later from Thabit from al-Dahhak. My father said: And Abu Sinan did hear from al-Dahhak and narrated from him. My father said: This Thabit, I think he is called Ibn Jaban or Khaqan, or as he said. My father said: And Abu Sinan Dirar b. Murrah is trustworthy. 1223 - I heard him say: Zirr b. Hubaysh read [the Qur'an] to Ali, and Abu Abd al-Rahman read to Abdullah b. Mas'ud.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1224 - Who dyed [their hair/beard] among the Hadith scholars: I heard my father say: I saw Yahya bin Sa'id dyeing, and I saw Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi dyeing in the year eighty-five; he had dyed that day while he was fifty years old. I also saw him dyeing when he was forty-five. Hushaym used to dye. I saw Mu'adh bin Mu'adh dyeing, and Ibn Abi Adi dyeing.
