I saw Ismail bin Ibrahim dyeing; he came to us from Basra while he was dyeing, and sometimes he narrated to us having dyed.
1225 - My father said: I saw Abd al-Wahhab al-Thaqafi dyeing, and Rawh dyeing. I saw Yazid bin Harun dyeing. Abu Mu'awiyah dyed with a good, deep red dye. Hafs bin Ghiyath used to dye. Ibn Idris used a light dye. Abbad bin al-Awwam used a dye leaning towards black. Jarir used to dye. Ibn Numayr used to dye. Ibn Fudayl used to dye. Gundar used to dye. Al-Bursani used to dye. I said: "Abd al-Razzaq dyes?" He said: "Yes." I said to him: "Abbad bin Abbad?" He said: "He dyes as well." I said to him: "Ibn Abi Za'idah?" He said: "He dyes with a good dye." Al-Walid bin Muslim used a light dye; he had a black head [of hair].

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1226 - Abu Abd al-Rahman said: My father dyed when he was sixty-three, and Abu Abd al-Rahman [referring to himself] dyed when he was sixty-three.
1227 - My father said: Hammad bin Mas'adah dyes. I said to him: "Mu'tamar?" He said: "He used to dye, and he had a small Jummah (hair reaching the shoulders)." Marhum al-Attar dyes. Muhammad bin Yazid and Yazid bin Harun both dye. Ishaq al-Azraq [dyed] once.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text: I saw him dye with a light dye. I said to him: "Hajjaj?" He said: "He dyes with a good dye." I said to him: "Ibrahim bin Sa'd?" He said: "I do not know; he was dark-skinned and black, but Sa'd and Ya'qub used to dye." Abu Dawud used to dye. Abu al-Nadr used to dye. Abd al-Razzaq dyes, but his brother does not dye. Abu Usamah did not use to dye; I saw him once having dyed with an inferior dye. Abu Nu'aym used a light dye. Muhammad bin Salamah, I do not think he used to dye. Muhammad and Ya'la, the sons of Ubaid, used to dye. Umar bin Ubaid, I do not think [he dyed] except with a light dye. Abu Qatan used a light dye. Asbat dyes. Abu al-Mughirah, Ali bin Ayyash, Abu al-Yaman, Isam bin Khalid, and Bishr bin Shu'ayb all dye.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
Al-Muqri Abd al-Rahman bin Yazid used to dye. Yahya bin Abi Bukayr used to dye. Atham bin Ali used to dye. Marwan bin Mu'awiyah used to dye something like that. Marwan bin Shuja' used to dye. Shuja' bin al-Walid Abu Badr used to dye. Humaid al-Ru'asi used to dye. Yahya bin Hammad used to dye; he sometimes narrated to us having dyed. I said to him: "Abu al-Walid?" He said: "I saw him with Yahya bin Sa'id and his head and beard were black, then I saw him afterwards having some small white hairs." Ibrahim bin Khalid dyes. Mu'ammal dyes. I said to him: "These whom you mentioned as dyeing, did you see them?" He said: "Yes."
1228 - I asked my father about Asim bin Ali, and he said: His hadith was presented to me, and I saw authentic hadith. My father narrated two hadiths from him, and he narrated hadiths from Hasan bin Ali bin Asim. My father said: Hasan bin Ali bin Asim was more intelligent than his father and his brother.
1229 - I asked my father about Azhar bin al-Qasim. He said: A Basran who settled in Mecca and used to sell winter clothes (Shatwi). Abu Muslim and I used to visit him. Then he said: How few are those who wrote from him other than us. Then he said: I asked Abd al-Samad bin Abd al-Warith about him, and he recognized him. Abd al-Samad said: I wrote from his grandfather—or a grandfather of Azhar.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1230 - I heard my father say: Abu al-Mughirah told us, he said Safwan told us, he said Abu Ghunaym Sa'id bin Hudayr al-Hadrami told me.
1231 - I asked my father, I said: Yahya bin Sa'id used to narrate from Hammam. He said: Affan claimed, he said: Yahya used to ask me about the hadith of Hammam when Mu'adh bin Hisham arrived, so he would ask me: "How did Hammam say it?" My father said: And that is because he agreed with Hisham in [some] hadiths. My father said: Yahya used to see that he was not like Sa'id [bin Abi Arubah]. And I heard Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi say: Hammam, in my view, is like Sa'id bin Abi Arubah in truthfulness. I heard my father mention Hammam once, and he said: Yahya used to disapprove of Hammam adding to the Isnad (chain of narrators)—meaning, when Mu'adh arrived, he agreed with him on some of those hadiths belonging to Hisham.
1232 - I asked my father about Yahya bin Salih al-Himissi al-Wuhazi. He said: I saw him at the funeral of Abu al-Mughirah. My father began to describe him. My father said: A person from the people of hadith informed me, saying: Yahya bin Salih said: "If only the people of hadith would leave ten hadiths"—meaning those hadiths regarding the Vision (Ru'yah of Allah). My father said: It is as if he leaned towards the opinion of Jahm.
1233 - I heard him say: Abbas al-Jariri is a Shaykh, Trustworthy, Trustworthy (Thiqah Thiqah).

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1234 - My father told me, he said Hajjaj told us, he said Abu Ma'shar told me, he said Abu Hazim Salamah bin Dinar told me.
1235 - My father told me, he said Hammad al-Khayyat told us, Abu Mawdud said Abd al-Aziz bin Abi Sulayman told us. My father said: Abu Mawdud is a trustworthy Shaykh.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1236 - My father told me, he said Hajjaj told us, on the authority of Sharik, on the authority of Asim bin Kulayb, on the authority of Muhammad bin Ka'b, he said: I heard Ali bin Abi Talib. My father said: This is a delusion (Wahm). Muhammad bin Ka'b narrates from Abdullah bin Shaddad from Ali, and from Shabath bin Rib'i from Ali. I did not see my father validate that Muhammad bin Ka'b heard from Ali.
1237 - My father told me, he said Yazid bin Harun told us, on the authority of Shu'bah, on the authority of Ash'ath bin Sulaym, on the authority of Amr bin Maymun, on the authority of Abu Hurairah, on the authority of the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, he said: "Whoever would love to find the taste of faith, let him love a person, loving him only for the sake of Allah." My father said: So I said to Yazid: "What is the name of Abu Balj?" He said: "Yahya bin Abi Sulaym." Then Yazid said: "I heard it from Shu'bah in Baghdad, and I was among the last of the people [in the gathering], and I have been in doubt about it since I heard it." So Yazid retracted it and said: "Write it 'from a man'." My father said: Yazid bin Harun made a mistake in it.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1238 - My father told me, he said Muhammad bin Ja'far Gundar told us, he said Shu'bah told us, on the authority of Abu Balj, on the authority of Amr bin Maymun, on the authority of Abu Hurairah, on the authority of the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, he said: "Whoever would love to find the taste of faith, let him love a person, loving him only for the sake of Allah."
1239 - I heard my father say: Muhammad bin Ja'far told us, he said Shu'bah told us, he said I heard Yahya bin Abi Sulaym. My father said: He is Abu Balj. My father said: Shu'bah mentioned his lineage in another hadith.
1240 - I heard my father say: Yazid bin Harun said: I saw Abu Balj—meaning Yahya bin Abi Sulaym—I believe he saw him in Wasit.
1241 - I heard my father say: Shu'bah said: Qatadah did not hear anything from Abu Rafi'. My father said: He introduced Khilas between him and Abu Rafi'. And Al-Hasan. My father said: And Qatadah heard from Khilas. Shu'bah said on the authority of Qatadah: "I heard Khilas." And Aban said on the authority of Qatadah: "Khilas told us." And Hammam said on the authority of Qatadah: "Khilas told me."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1242 - I heard my father say: Abu Asim narrated to them on the authority of Sufyan, on the authority of Ibn Abi Utbah. He misread (Sahhaf); he wanted to say Ibn Abi Ghunyah, but he said Ibn Abi Utbah.
1243 - My father told me, he said Ubaydah bin Humaid told us, he said Hilal bin Humaid bin Abi Ma'bad told me, he said: When Ramadan drew near, Umar would say: "Do not advance the month." My father said: Abu Ma'bad is Abdullah bin Ukaym.
1244 - I heard my father say: Shurayh bin Ubaid is Abu al-Salt. And Hawshab bin Sayf is Abu Rawh. And Abdullah bin Busr is Abu Safwan. And Muhammad bin Ziyad al-Alhani is Abu Sufyan. My father said: Abu al-Mughirah narrated these to us on the authority of Safwan bin Amr.
1245 - I said to my father: "How is Ali bin al-Mubarak?" He said: "Trustworthy (Thiqah)." I said: "How is his hearing from Yahya bin Abi Kathir?" He said: "He had books; some of them he heard, and some of them were presented [to the Shaykh]." Then my father said: Yahya narrated to us from him, he said Yahya bin Abi Kathir told me. Then he said: Ali bin al-Mubarak said: "Yahya bin Sa'id came to me, Yahya bin Sa'id came to me." My father said: I have not seen anyone who narrates more from him than Waki'.
1246 - I heard my father mention Al-Hawdi, so he said: That was the Shaykh who used to verify.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1247 - I mentioned to my father the hadith of Hammad bin Zaid, on the authority of Ayyub, on the authority of Nafi', on the authority of Ibn Umar, that Umar kissed the Stone. He said: Ismail told us, on the authority of Ayyub, he said: I was informed that Umar kissed the Stone.
1248 - My father told me, he said Surayj bin al-Nu'man told us, he said Abdullah bin Nafi' informed me, he said: Malik—meaning Ibn Anas—used to say: Faith is speech and action. And he says: The Quran is the speech of Allah. And he says concerning the one who says the Quran is created: He is to be beaten painfully and imprisoned until he repents. And Malik said: Allah is in Heaven, and His knowledge is in every place; nothing is devoid of it.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1249 - I heard my father say: Yahya bin Sa'id would not narrate anything from Qatadah, from Khilas, from Ali. But he would narrate from Qatadah, from Khilas, from other than Ali. It was as if he was cautious about the hadith of Khilas from Ali specifically—meaning he says: They are not authentic, or he did not hear from him.
1250 - My father said: Ishaq bin Hazim is a trustworthy Shaykh.
1251 - I asked my father about Bishr bin Mansur. He said: Trustworthy, Trustworthy (Thiqah Thiqah). Ibn Mahdi was impressed by him. He was a righteous man. Ibn Mahdi narrated from him.
1252 - My father told me, he said Bahz told us, he said Hammam said: So I mentioned that to Abu al-Tayyah—meaning the hadith of Abu al-Khalil on the authority of Abdullah bin al-Harith, on the authority of Hakim bin Hizam, on the authority of the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him: "The two parties in a sale have the choice as long as they have not separated." So Abu al-Tayyah said: "I was with Abu al-Khalil when Abdullah bin al-Harith narrated this hadith to him."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1253 - I heard my father say: Waki' said: We found it with Abu Awanah, on the authority of Sulayman bin Abi al-Atik, on the authority of Abu Ma'shar, on the authority of Ibrahim: "He disliked the booklets (Kurrasat)." My father said: When Waki' narrated from the likes of Abu Awanah, Hammad bin Zaid, and Hammad bin Salamah, he would say: "We found it with Abu Awanah," "We found it with Hammad bin Zaid," belittling them.
1254 - I heard my father say: Isa al-Hannat is not anything (worthless) [He said it] twice. I said to him: "Do you consider him like Al-Sariy bin Ismail?" He said: "No, Al-Sariy is better in my view and more beloved to us than Isa." I began to present the hadiths of Isa al-Hannat to him, and he said: "You have stumbled upon Isa with intercession."
1255 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Adam told us, he said Hammad bin Yunus said to me: "If you wish for Isa al-Hannat to narrate to me everything that the people of Medina do, he would narrate it to me." I said to my father: "Who is this Hammad bin Yunus?" He said: "He is a clever person." Then he said: "He is Kufan."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1256 - I heard my father say: Aswad bin Salim came to Abbad bin al-Awwam and read hadiths to him while we were present. Among them was the hadith of Abu Bakr bin Ahmar, on the authority of Abdullah bin Buraydah, on the authority of his father, that a man from Al-Azd came to the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, and said: "I have the inheritance of a man from Al-Azd..." and he narrated the story. I said to my father: "Why did he read to him?" He said: "Abbad had refrained from narrating."
1257 - I heard my father mention on the authority of Abbad bin al-Awwam, he said: "Our brother Hushaym made a mistake in the hadith of Husayn on the authority of Amr bin Abd al-Malik bin al-Huwayrith." My father said: Abbad made a mistake, and Hushaym was correct.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1258 - My father said: Hushaym told us, Husayn informed us, on the authority of Abd al-Malik bin Amr bin al-Huwayrith, he said: I was told that the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, used to place his right hand over the left in prayer, and he used to touch his beard while praying.
1259 - My father told me, he said Muhammad bin Ja'far Gundar told us, he said Shu'bah told us, on the authority of Husayn, on the authority of Abd al-Malik bin the brother of Amr bin Huraith, that the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, would sometimes touch his beard while praying.
1260 - My father told me, he said Affan told us, he said Yahya—meaning Ibn Sa'id—told us, he said: I used to ask Hamid about something from the fatwas of Al-Hasan, and he would say: "I have forgotten it."
1261 - My father told me, he said: A companion of ours called Abu Ya'qub, the Mawla of Abu Ubaidullah, told me: Abbad bin al-Awwam used to say: "Abu al-Hudhayl said, and Abu al-Hudhayl said." Husayn bin Abd al-Rahman [is Abu al-Hudhayl].
1262 - I heard my father say: Dawud bin Yazid al-Awdi, the uncle of Ibn Idris, is weak in hadith.
1263 - I heard my father mention Umar bin Ayyub, so he said: He came to us from Mosul; there is no harm in him.
1264 - I heard him say: Abd al-Malik bin Abi Sulayman was among the Hafiz (preservers of hadith).

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1265 - I heard him say: Abbad bin al-Awwam, Mu'tamar bin Sulayman, Ibn Abi Arubah, Yazid bin Zuray', and Yahya bin Sa'id narrated from Umar bin Amir; he caught [met] him. I think he [Yahya] did not approve of him. Abbad is the one who narrated most from him among people.
1266 - I asked my father about Wuhaib bin Khalid. He said: Bakh (Excellent)! He is from the people of hadith; there is no harm in him. Yahya bin Sa'id used to choose Ismail bin Ulayyah, and Abd al-Rahman used to choose Wuhaib.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1267 - I heard my father say: Dawud bin Abdullah al-Awdi is Kufan; Abu Awanah and Zuhair Abu Khaythamah narrated from him. Bakh (Excellent), Trustworthy. He is old [among the early ones]. He narrated from Hamid bin Abd al-Rahman. He is other than Dawud the uncle of Ibn Idris.
1268 - I heard my father say: Makhul al-Azdi is Basran. And Makhul al-Shami is the elder, a captive. I heard him say: Makhul al-Shami, his Kunya is Abu Abdullah.
1269 - I heard my father say: What validates Al-Hakam from Miqsam are four hadiths: The hadith of Witr, that the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, used to perform Witr. The hadith of the intention of divorce, from Miqsam from Ibn Abbas regarding the intention of divorce. And regarding intercourse [during menses/Ihram]. And from Miqsam from Ibn Abbas that Umar performed Qunut in Fajr—that is the hadith of Qunut. And also from Miqsam, his opinion regarding a Muhrim (pilgrim) who hunted game, saying: The penalty is upon him; if he does not have livestock, the penalty is Dirhams, then the Dirhams are evaluated into food. I said: "What about what he narrated other than this?" He said: "Allah knows best. They say it is a book." I see Hajjaj narrated from him, from Miqsam, from Ibn Abbas about fifty hadiths. And Ibn Abi Layla makes mistakes in hadiths from the hadiths of Al-Hakam. And I heard my father say once: Shu'bah said: These four that Al-Hakam validates are hearing [directly] from Miqsam.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1270 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Sa'id told us, he said: I asked Shu'bah: "How many did you hear from Abu Ma'shar?" He said: "Four cut off [chains]"—meaning Mursal narrations.
1271 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Sa'id told us, he said: Shu'bah used to weaken the hadith of Abu Bishr from Mujahid, and he said: The hadith of the bird is the hadith of Al-Minhal.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1272 - My father told me, he said Yahya told us, on the authority of Ismail, on the authority of Amir, he said: I have not seen a man more knowledgeable regarding a companion than Abdullah.
1273 - I heard my father say: Yazid bin Abi Habib did not hear anything from Al-Zuhri Ibn Shihab. Rather, Al-Zuhri wrote to him, and he narrates from a man from him; he did not hear anything from Al-Zuhri. And he said once: Yazid bin Abi Habib from Al-Zuhri is a book (writing), except what he named [as an intermediary] between him and Al-Zuhri. I said to him: "Did Ibn Abi Dhi'b hear from Al-Zuhri?" He said: "Yes, he heard from him." I said: "They say he did not hear from Al-Zuhri." He said: "He did hear from Al-Zuhri. Yahya bin Sa'id narrated to us from Ibn Abi Dhi'b, he said 'Al-Zuhri told me'," and he mentioned more than one hadith in which [he said] "Al-Zuhri told me," and in them also "I asked Al-Zuhri."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1274 - I said to my father: "Did Malik bin Anas arrive upon [visit] Abu Ja'far?" He said: "No, rather Ibn Abi Dhi'b arrived upon Abu Ja'far. Malik did not arrive upon Abu Ja'far."
1275 - I heard him say: They said to Ibn Abi Dhi'b: "Indeed Malik says 'The two parties in a sale do not have the choice'." So Ibn Abi Dhi'b said: "This is a narration trodden upon [ignored/opposed to practice] in Medina." My father said: And Malik used to say "The two parties in a sale do not have the choice." I heard my father say: Ibn Abi Dhi'b said: "Malik should be asked to repent; if he repents [good], otherwise his neck should be struck."
1276 - I heard my father say: Safwan bin Umayyah is Abu Wahb.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1277 - I heard my father say: Ibn Mahdi asked about these two hadiths, saying: "Who heard them from Hushaym?" I said: "I did. Hushaym told us, he said Husayn informed us, on the authority of Ibrahim, that he used to dislike plucking hair [grey hair]." My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, he said Mughirah informed us on the authority of Al-Sha'bi, and Yunus on the authority of Al-Hasan, that they both disliked plucking grey hair. My father said: So Ibn Mahdi said to me: "It is exactly like that, it is exactly like that."
1278 - My father told me, on the authority of Abd al-Razzaq, that Ma'mar's Kunya is Abu Urwah.
1279 - I heard my father say: Salih bin Hassan, or Ibn Abi Hassan, is Medinan; he narrated from Muhammad bin Ka'b. He is nothing (worthless).
1280 - I said to him: "Did Abu Bakr bin Abi Musa hear from his father?" He said: "Why would he not hear?"

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1281 - I heard him say: Abu Mu'awiyah said: 'When we stood up from Al-A'mash's presence, I used to dictate them to them.' My father said: 'Like Al-Ahdab and Ya'la.' My father said: 'Abu Mu'awiyah is among the most retentive of Al-A'mash's companions.' I said to him: 'Like Sufyan?' He said: 'No, Sufyan is in another class, although Abu Mu'awiyah makes mistakes in some of the hadiths of Al-A'mash.' And Jarir Al-Razi claimed, saying: 'We used to patch them together at Al-A'mash's; this one would write from that one, and that one from this one.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1282 - My father said: Abbad b. Al-Awwam was a man of dignity, good appearance, and good intellect. He is more dignified than Ibn Abi Za'idah. 1283 - He said: And Ibn Abi Ghaniyah was trustworthy, a Shaykh who possessed dignity; I might have seen him wearing a patched shirt. 1284 - Abdullah told us, he said: Amr Al-Naqid told us, he said: I heard Abbad b. Al-Awwam say: 'Ibn Abi Najih told us a hadith'—and he mentioned it—then he said: 'These people told us [otherwise]; if you hear me narrate a hadith from Ibn Abi Najih other than this one, then know that I am a liar.' 1285 - My father said: Ayyub used to say: 'Abu Al-Zubayr told us, and Abu Al-Zubayr, Abu Al-Zubayr.' I said to my father: 'As if he was weakening him?' He said: 'Yes.' 1286 - My father said: Abbad b. Al-Awwam heard only one hadith from Ibn Abi Najih, and he heard one hadith from Wasil, the Mawla of Abu Uyaynah. 1287 - My father said: Mansur b. Zadhan was among the most devout of people. Habib b. Al-Shahid, Shu'bah, Hushaym, and Abu Awanah narrated from him. The one who narrated most from him was Hushaym. Mansur was devout and a man of prayer. Hushaym used to pray with him; when he finished the prayer, he would ask him about a thing or a word. My father said: Mansur claimed, saying: 'We asked Al-Hasan about what is between the two covers of the Mushaf.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1288 - I heard my father say: Affan said: Abu Jazi—and his name is Nasr b. Tarif—came to Jarir b. Hazim to intercede for a man Jarir was speaking to. Jarir said: 'Qatadah told us from Anas, he said: The pommel of the sword of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) was of silver.' He said: So Abu Jazi said: 'He lied. By Allah, Qatadah did not tell us [that] except from Sa'id b. Abi Al-Hasan.' My father said: And it is as Abu Jazi said, and Jarir erred. 1289 - I heard him say: Jarir Al-Razi was not sharp in Hadith. I said to him: 'Did Jarir narrate anything from Ash'ath b. Sawar?' He said: 'Yes, the hadith of Ash'ath and Asim Al-Ahwal became confused to him until Bahz b. Asad came to him.' He said: 'So he [Bahz] said to him: This is the hadith of Asim, and this is the hadith of Ash'ath.' He said: 'So he recognized them and narrated them to the people.' 1290 - My father told me, he said: Yahya b. Sa'id told me from Ali...

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: ...b. Al-Mubarak, he said: Yahya b. Abi Kathir told me that Umar b. Mu'attib informed him that Abu Hasan, the Mawla of Banu Nawfal, informed him that he asked Ibn Abbas for a verdict regarding a slave who has a slave woman [as a wife] under him, and he divorces her twice, then they are both freed. Is it proper for him to propose to her? He said: 'Yes, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) decreed that.' I heard my father say: Ibn Al-Mubarak said to Ma'mar: 'O Abu Urwah, who is this Abu Hasan? He has surely carried a huge rock [meaning a heavy/difficult narration].' My father said: Abu Hasan is the Mawla of Abdullah b. Al-Harith b. Nawfal; Al-Zuhri and Umar b. Mu'attib narrated from him. I said to my father: 'Who is this Umar b. Mu'attib?' He said: 'Muhammad b. Abi Yahya narrated from him.' I said to him: 'I mean Umar b. Mu'attib, is he trustworthy?' He said: 'I do not know.' My father said: Hisham Al-Dastawa'i did not hear this hadith from Yahya b. Abi Kathir. He said: 'Yahya wrote to me.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1291 - My father said: Uthman Al-Batti Abu Amr, there is no harm in him. Al-Dahhak b. Muzahim was a teacher, and he did not take a wage for teaching. 1292 - My father said: Shu'bah said regarding the hadith of Abd Al-Malik b. Abi Sulayman from Ata from Jabir from the Prophet (peace be upon him) regarding pre-emption (Shuf'ah): 'The like of this is delayed and destroyed.' 1293 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il b. Ibrahim told us from Ayyub, he said: Ibn Abi Mulaykah mentioned visiting graves and vessels. I said: 'O Abu Bakr, who told you?' He said: 'Abu Al-Zinad told me from some of the Kufans.' My father said: And this hadith is narrated by Ruh from Bistam b. Muslim from Ibn Abi Mulaykah from Aisha from the Prophet (peace be upon him) regarding visiting graves and vessels, and it is a mistake. The hadith is only the hadith of Ayyub from Ibn Abi Mulaykah from Abu Al-Zinad from some of the Kufans. I said to him: 'How is Bistam?' He said: 'There is no harm in him; he is Salih Al-Hadith (good in hadith).' 1294 - I heard my father say: The son of Isma'il b. Ulayyah spoke to his father about listening to Ibn Al-Shadhakuni narrate to him. So he began asking him about opinion (Ra'y)—the opinions of men—Ibn Awn from Muhammad. And Ibn Ulayyah used to like good hadith that had a chain of transmission (Isnad), and Isma'il did not like the opinion of men. So Isma'il said to his son: 'Didn't you say this is a man of Hadith?'—as if he did not like it when he began asking him about opinion.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1295 - My father said: Salim b. Abi Hafsah, his kunya is Abu Yunus. He was a Shi'i who held a [sectarian] view. I do not think there is any harm in him—meaning in Hadith. Al-Thawri narrated from him, and he has few hadiths. 1296 - I asked him about Bishr b. Rafi'. He said: 'He is the Najrani; he is nothing; he is weak in Hadith. Abd Al-Razzaq and Safwan b. Isa narrated from him.' 1297 - My father said: Amir b. Abdah, his kunya is Abu Iyas, from Bajilah. Al-Musayyib b. Rafi' narrated from him. 1298 - My father said: And Al-Harith b. Suwayd is Abu Aisha, and Masruq is Abu Aisha. 1299 - My father said: Imran b. Hittan held the view of the Kharijites. Muhammad b. Sirin narrated from him. 1300 - My father said: Abu Al-Tayyah is established and trustworthy (Thabt Thiqah). 1301 - My father said: Al-Hajjaj Al-Aswad is a righteous man. 1302 - My father said: Abu Amir Al-Khazzaz is Salih Al-Hadith. His name is Salih b. Rustam. 1303 - And my father said: Abu Salamah did not hear anything from Abu Musa Al-Ash'ari.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1304 - My father said: Abd Al-Rahman b. Malik b. Mighwal is nothing. We tore up his hadith ages ago. I memorized two or three hadiths from him. And I had written from my father from him the hadith of Abu Husayn: 'We escorted Al-Aswad.' Abu Abd Al-Rahman said: I heard it from my father in discussion.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1305 - I heard my father say: Ya'qub b. Al-Walid was from the people of Medina, and he was among the great liars. He narrates from Abu Hazim from Sahl b. Sa'd that the Prophet (peace be upon him) used to eat melon with fresh dates. 1306 - I heard my father mention Attiyah Al-Awfi, so he said: 'He is weak in Hadith.' My father said: 'It reached me that Attiyah used to go to Al-Kalbi and take Tafsir from him. He would give him the kunya Abu Sa'id, so he would say: Abu Sa'id said. And Hushaym used to weaken the hadith of Attiyah.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1307 - My father told me, he said: Abu Ahmad Al-Zubayri told us, he said: I heard Sufyan Al-Thawri say: I heard Al-Kalbi say: 'Attiyah gave me the kunya Abu Sa'id.' 1308 - I heard my father say: Mandal and Hibban; Hibban is more correct in hadith than Mandal.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1309 - My father told me, he said: Zayd b. Al-Hubab told us, he said: Sufyan Al-Thawri said: 'If I said that I narrate to you [exactly] as I heard, I would have lied.' 1310 - I heard my father say: Ali b. Mushir had a brother called Abd Al-Rahman b. Mushir. He said: When the students of Hadith came to Ali, Abd Al-Rahman would come out to them and narrate to them. So Ali would come out while he was narrating to them, and say: 'O split-face, they only came to me; they did not come to you.' My father said: It reached me that Abu Yusuf appointed Abd Al-Rahman b. Mushir as a judge. He said: So he went out praising himself before Harun [Al-Rashid]. 1311 - I heard him say: Jami' b. Abi Rashid is a trustworthy Shaykh.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1312 - I asked him about Abd Al-Malik b. A'yan. He said: 'He used to be a Shi'i, and Sufyan narrated from him. And his brother Humran b. A'yan used to be a Shi'i.' 1313 - I heard him say: Sadaqah b. Abd Allah Al-Samin is the Levantine (Shami) from whom Al-Walid b. Muslim narrated; he is Abu Mu'awiyah. He is nothing; he is weak in Hadith; his hadiths are rejected (Manakir); his hadith is not worth anything. And Sadaqah b. Khalid, from whom Abu Mushir and Al-Hakam b. Musa narrated, this Sadaqah is trustworthy; there is no harm in him; this one is trustworthy. And Sadaqah b. Yazid used to be in the region of Jerusalem; his hadith is weak hadith; he narrates from Hammad b. Abi Sulayman, and he is weak. And Sadaqah b. Yasar is among the trustworthy; Shu'bah narrated from him; he is trustworthy. 1314 - I heard my father say: Al-A'mash said: 'If not for Hadith, there would be a jar of fish sauce (Sahnath) on my neck.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1315 - My father said: I heard one session from Ali b. Hashim b. Al-Barid, and Abu Al-Awwam was dictating to him (or reading back to him), and we could hear the voice of Ali b. Hashim, and the mosque was packed, but I did not see him—meaning Ali b. Hashim. 1316 - My father said: Abd Al-Rahman b. Harmalah is Abu Harmalah. And Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib is Abu Muhammad. And Hajjaj b. Abi Uthman (approval): Trustworthy. Al-Hajjaj b. Hassan Al-Qaysi: There is no harm in him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1317 - I asked him about Al-Hajjaj b. Abi Zaynab Al-Wasiti. He said: 'His kunya is Abu Yusuf Al-Sayqal. I fear that he is weak in Hadith. Hushaym and Muhammad b. Yazid narrated from him.' And Al-Hajjaj b. Dinar: There is no harm in him; Shu'bah narrated from him. And Hajjaj claimed from Shu'bah from Hajjaj b. Dinar Al-Battikhi. 1318 - My father said: Hajjaj Al-Ahwal, there is no harm in him. He narrated from Sa'id b. Abi Arubah from Qatadah from Anas: 'Whoever forgets a prayer...' He said: And Isma'il narrated to us from him from Hammad. And Yazid b. Zurai' narrated from him; there is no harm in him. I asked him about Hajjaj Al-Aswad Al-Qasamli. He said: 'A righteous man. Hammad b. Salamah narrated from him. I do not see any harm [in him].' 1319 - I heard him say: Abdullah b. Unays, his kunya is Abu Yahya.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1320 - I asked him about His saying, Glorious and Exalted: {Those who believe in the Unseen}. He said: 'Qatadah said: What is after death regarding the Reckoning, Paradise, and Hell.' I asked him about His saying: {A guidance for the Muttaqin (pious)}. He said: 'Qatadah said: Allah made it a guidance and light for those who believe in it—meaning the Qur'an.' I asked him about {Certainty}. He said: 'He knows that the Prayer is truth, believing in these things—meaning like Prayer and Fasting.' I asked him about His saying: {Allah only accepts from the Muttaqin}. He said: 'He who fears [Allah regarding] things and does not fall into what is not lawful for him.' 1321 - I heard my father say another time: Al-Hajjaj b. Abi Al-Hajjaj is Hajjaj Al-Ahwal Al-Bahili. 1322 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: He said: Abu Al-Mughirah Al-Khawlani told us, he said: Safwan told us, he said: Ayfa' b. Abd told me: 'Revelation came down to the Prophet (peace be upon him) when he was forty-three years old. He kept it secret for ten years and made it public for ten years, then he passed away when he was sixty-three.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1323 - I found in my father's book: The kunya of Muslim b. Akyas is Abu Hasbah; Safwan b. Amr narrated from him. And the kunya of Abd Al-Rahman b. Fadalah, from whom Safwan b. Amr narrated, is Abu Dharr. 1324 - I found in my father's book: Abu Al-Mughirah said: Abu Muslim—meaning Al-Jalili—was a Jew, then he accepted Islam after the Prophet (peace be upon him). 1325 - My father said: Shu'bah did not narrate anything from Abu Na'amah Al-Adawi. 1326 - I heard my father say: Suraqah b. Malik, Abu Ishaq—meaning Al-Sabi'i—did not hear from him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1327 - I presented to my father the hadith of Ubaydullah b. Musa from Sufyan from Hakim b. Al-Daylam from Abu Burdah from his father, who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) stood among us with four [statements], saying: 'Verily Allah does not sleep.' My father said: 'This is the hadith of Al-A'mash from Amr b. Murrah from Abu Ubaydah from Abu Musa. This is the wording of the hadith of Amr b. Murrah. I think he inserted for Ubaydullah b. Musa the chain of [one] hadith into the chain of [another] hadith.' 1328 - I asked my father about the hadith of Mughirah from Ziyad b. Husayn. He said: 'He is Abu Jahmah.' 1329 - I heard my father say: Abu Qatadah Al-Adawi is not the Companion of the Prophet (peace be upon him).

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1330 - I asked my father about the hadith of Hasan b. Salih from Harun Abu Muhammad from Muqatil b. Hayyan. My father said: 'This is not Harun b. Sa'd from whom Sharik narrated. This Harun Abu Muhammad is another man.' 1331 - I narrated to my father a hadith that Uthman b. Abi Shaybah narrated to us, saying: Abu Khalid Al-Ahmar told us from Thawr b. Yazid from Abu Al-Zubayr from Jabir from the Prophet (peace be upon him): 'Greeting of a man with one finger, pointing with it, is the action of the Jews.' My father said: 'This is a rejected (Munkar) hadith.' He denounced it strongly.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1332 - And I narrated to my father a hadith that Uthman b. Abi Shaybah narrated to us, saying: Jarir told us from Muhammad b. Salim from Abu Ishaq from Asim b. Damrah from Ali from the Prophet (peace be upon him): 'In what is watered by the sky, there is the tithe (Ushr), and what is watered by the bucket (Gharb) and the waterwheel (Daliyah), then half of the tithe.' My father said: 'This is a hadith I consider fabricated (Mawdu').' He rejected it from the hadith of Muhammad b. Salim.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1333 - And I presented to my father a hadith that Uthman told us from Jarir from Shaybah b. Na'amah from Fatimah bint Husayn from Fatimah the Elder from the Prophet (peace be upon him) regarding the male agnates (Asabah); and the hadith of Jarir from Al-Thawri from Ibn Aqil from Jabir that the Prophet (peace be upon him) witnessed an Eid of the polytheists. He denounced them strongly, and several hadiths of this manner, he denounced them strongly. And he said: 'These are fabricated hadiths, or it is as if they are fabricated.' And he said: 'His brother—meaning Abdullah b. Abi Shaybah—used to desire/seek out some of these [strange] hadiths.' Then he said: 'We ask Allah for safety in religion and the world.' And he said: 'We see him imagining these hadiths. We ask Allah for safety. O Allah, save [us], save [us].' 1334 - I heard my father say: Isa b. Yunus performed Hajj in the year eighty-three [183 AH], in the year in which Hushaym died. My father said: And I went out to Kufa in that year, but I fell ill and returned. Isa arrived in Kufa days after that, and I did not hear from him. And Isa did not perform Hajj after that year, and he lived for years after that. 1335 - I asked my father: 'Who is more correct in Hadith, Isa or his father Yunus?' He said: 'No, Isa is more correct in Hadith.' It was said to him: 'Isa or his brother Isra'il?' He said: 'How close they are! And in the hadith of Isra'il there is variation from Abu Ishaq; I reckon that is from Abu Ishaq.' I heard my father mention from Mu'afi or others that he used to prefer Ibn Numayr over Isa b. Yunus.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1336 - My father told me, he said: Muhammad b. Mus'ab Al-Qarqasani told us, he said: Abu Amr Al-Sabi'i told us. My father said: He is Isa b. Yunus. 1337 - My father told me, he said: I heard Ishaq b. Rahwayh narrating from Isa b. Yunus, he said: 'If I wanted Abu Bakr b. Abi Maryam to combine for me so-and-so, so-and-so, and so-and-so, he would have done so'—meaning if he says: from Rashid b. Sa'd, Damrah, and Habib b. Ubayd, he would have done so. 1338 - I heard my father say: The first year I performed Hajj was the year eighty-seven [187 AH]. I was walking. And entry into Medina was not decreed [for me]—meaning that year. I had with me portions [of hadith] of Abu Alqamah Al-Farwi, but it was not decreed that I hear anything from him. I heard my father say: And in that year, the year eighty-seven, I performed Hajj, and Fudayl b. Iyad died shortly after that. 1339 - I heard my father say: The first arrival I made in Basra was the year eighty-six [186 AH].

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1340 - I asked him about a hadith narrated by Muhammad b. Musaffa al-Shami from Al-Walid b. Muslim from Al-Awza'i from Ata from Ibn Abbas that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Verily, Allah has overlooked for my Ummah what they are forced to do, mistake, and forgetfulness.' And [narrated] from Al-Walid from Malik from Nafi' from Ibn Umar, the like of it. He denounced it strongly and said: 'It is not narrated regarding this except from Al-Hasan from the Prophet (peace be upon him).'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1341 - I asked my father, I said: Mansur b. al-Mu'tamir [narrates] from Abu Salih. Who is Abu Salih? He said: 'Badham, the companion of Al-Kalbi, and he is the Mawla (freed slave) of Umm Hani.' My father said: 'Mansur did not narrate anything from Abu Salih Dhakwan that I know of.' 1342 - My father said: 'Umm Hani's name is Fakhitah.' 1343 - I heard my father say: 'Anbasah is sounder in hadith than Abu Ja'far al-Razi. Ibn al-Mubarak narrated from Anbasah b. Sa'id.' 1344 - I heard my father say: 'Muhammad b. Sirin regarding Abu Hurayrah: I do not put anyone ahead of him.' I said: 'Then Abu Salih Dhakwan?' He said: 'Muhammad b. Sirin—meaning he is above him. Abu Salih has more hadith. Muhammad: I do not put anyone ahead of him.' I said: 'Then Sa'id b. al-Musayyib?' He said: 'They are sufficient for you. And Sa'id is greater in my heart than Abu Salamah.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1345 - My father said: 'Abd al-Rahman, the owner of the Siqayah (water-giving).' My father told me, he said: Muhammad b. Ja'far told us, he said: Awf told us from Abd al-Rahman, the Mawla of Umm Burthan, the owner of the Siqayah at Al-Mirbad. My father said: And Hawdhah narrated it to us, he said: Awf told us from Abd al-Rahman the Mawla of Ibn Burthan. My father said: 'He is the one from whom Qatadah narrated: The Mawla of Ibn Burthan.' My father said: 'And he is Abd al-Rahman b. Adam.' 1346 - I heard my father mention from Abu Ja'far al-Suwaydi from Ma'mar al-Raqqi, who said: 'I heard from Zaid b. Habban before he became corrupt or changed.' 1347 - I heard my father say: 'I heard two hadiths from Ibrahim b. Aqil.' 1348 - I heard my father say: 'Ibrahim b. Aqil b. Ma'qil b. Munabbih and Isma'il b. Abd al-Karim b. Ma'qil b. Munabbih.' 1349 - My father told me, he said: Muhammad b. Ja'far told us, he said: Awf told us from Khalid b. Bab—meaning Khalid al-Raba'i. My father said: 'And Ruh said: From Awf from Khalid al-Raba'i.' 1350 - I heard my father say: 'Ibn Jurayj has two Kunyas: Abu Khalid and Abu al-Walid.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1351 - I asked my father about Umar b. Qays. He said: 'He is the one called Sandal.' He said: 'His hadith is worth nothing; his hadiths are false (Bawatil).' My father said: 'Umar b. Qays is the one called Sandal.' My father said: 'Ibn Uyaynah said: Zarzar guided me to Sandal.' 1352 - My father said: 'Malik and Sandal met in the presence of one of the Amirs or someone else. Malik asked about an issue, so Sandal said: Abu Abdullah—meaning Malik—sometimes errs and sometimes does not get it right.' So Malik said: 'Such are people.' My father said: 'And Sandal had boldness in him.' My father said: 'So Malik thought that Sandal only said to him: Abu Abdullah sometimes errs and sometimes gets it right'—or as my father said. My father said: 'Sandal is Umar b. Qays, the brother of Hamid b. Qays al-A'raj, the reciter of the people of Mecca.' My father said: 'Hamid al-A'raj, his Kunya is Abu Safwan.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1353 - I heard my father say, and he mentioned Al-Qasim Abu Abd al-Rahman, so he said: 'Some people said: These denounced (Manakir) hadiths which Ja'far b. Zubayr, Bishr b. Numayr, and Matrah narrate from him...' My father said: 'Ali b. Yazid is from the people of Damascus; Matrah narrated from him. But they say these are from Al-Qasim [himself]; in the hadith of Al-Qasim there are denounced things among what trustworthy people narrate from him. They say: It is from Al-Qasim.' 1354 - I heard my father say: 'Hibban is sounder in hadith than Mandal.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1355 - I heard him mention Muhammad b. Ibrahim al-Taymi al-Madini, and he said: 'In his hadith there is something; he narrates denounced (Manakir) or objectionable hadiths, and Allah knows best.' 1356 - I heard him say: 'Ziyad b. Sa'd, Abu Mu'awiyah heard from him in Mecca.' 1357 - And my father said: Hajjaj said: 'I used to ask Shu'bah about the hadith of Qatadah in Basra, and Waki' would witness me.' My father said: It was said to Hajjaj al-A'war: 'Verily Waki' says that he saw you with Ibn Jurayj.' He said: 'That was in the days of Al-Hashimiyyah.' I said: 'As if he denied it?' He said: 'Yes.' 1358 - I heard him being asked about Amr al-Naqid and Al-Ma'iti. It was said to him: 'How is he in your view?' He said: 'Amr'—as if he meant he was more beloved to him. And I heard him another time saying: 'Amr used to seek truthfulness.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1359 - I heard my father say: 'Hafs b. Ghiyath used to weaken Abu Sahl Muhammad b. Salim, and he used to say: These are only the books of his brother, and he would weaken him.' 1360 - And I heard him mention Abbas al-Warraq, so he said: 'He was with us in Kufa, and he heard the generality of Abu Mu'awiyah's hadith—meaning the hadith of Al-A'mash.' My father said: 'And Muhammad al-Makhrami came to us in Kufa, as a young boy, hearing from Waki'.' 1361 - I heard him say: 'The hadiths of Abdullah b. al-Mu'ammal are denounced (Manakir).' 1362 - I heard him say: 'Yazid b. Abi Salih Abu Habib heard Anas.' Waki' said: 'He was a tanner, and he had a good appearance. He has four hadiths—meaning Yazid b. Abi Salih.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
Section: Hadith Defects and Questions. Book: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal). Author: Abu Abd Allah Ahmad bin Muhammad bin Hanbal bin Hilal bin Asad al-Shaybani (d. 241 AH). Investigator: Wasi Allah bin Muhammad Abbas. Publisher: Dar Al-Khani, Riyadh. Edition: Second, 1422 AH - 201 [sic] AD. Number of Parts: 3 [Book numbering corresponds to the printed version]. Date of publication in Shamela: 8 Dhu al-Hijjah 1431.

Part Three of the Book: The Defects and Knowledge of Men

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1362 - My father told me, he said: Hasan b. Musa told us, he said: Abu Hilal told us, he said: Qatadah told us that Zaid b. Thabit left gold and silver that was broken with axes. 1362 - He said: Abu Ma'mar told me, he said: Abd al-Hamid al-Himmani told us from Al-A'mash from Jami' b. Shaddad from Al-Hasan b. Muslim that a man in Sham, it reached Umar that he favored [some of] his brothers, so he ordered ten thousand for him. 1362 - He said: Surayj b. Yunus told us, he said: Sufyan b. Uyaynah told us, he said: 'When Ubaydullah arrived in Kufa and saw the People of Hadith, he said: If Umar had caught me and you, he would have beaten us painfully.' 1362 - He said: Abu Ma'mar told me from Sufyan, he said: 'Abu Sinan al-Shaybani saw Sufyan al-Thawri with a group around him in the Sacred Mosque while he was narrating. He said: Who are these? [They said:] Sufyan al-Thawri is narrating. He said: If I had authority over him, I would have prolonged his imprisonment and beaten his back painfully.' 1362 - He said: Isma'il Abu Ma'mar told me, he said: Hafs b. Abd al-Rahman al-Balkhi told us from Muhammad b. Ishaq from Muhammad b. Ibrahim al-Taymi, who said: 'My mother used to gift dirhams for seeking knowledge.' In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1363 - I heard my father say: 'The meaning of the hadith of Abu Hurayrah from the Prophet (peace be upon him): There is no competition (stakes) except in Khuff (camel hoof), Nasl (arrowhead), or Hafir (hoof). Hafir is horses, Nasl is arrows, and Khuff is camels.' 1364 - My father said: 'Hisham b. al-Ghaz b. Rabi'ah al-Jarashi is Salih al-Hadith (good in hadith).' 1365 - My father said regarding the hadith of Shu'bah from Al-Nu'man b. Salim from Ibn Aws from his grandfather that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) prayed in his sandals and performed Istiwkaf three times. My father said: 'Meaning he performed ablution (Wudu) three times.' 1366 - My father said: Waki' told us regarding the hadith of Sufyan from Nusayr from Abu Ya'la from Ibn al-Hanafiyyah: 'There is nothing of the shroud for the deceased; it is only an honor for the living.' He [Waki'] told us [first] from Al-Rabi' b. Khuthaym, then he retracted and said: 'From Ibn al-Hanafiyyah.' And Waki' said regarding the hadith of Sufyan from Mansur from Mujahid that Umar, when he heard the camel-driver (Hadi), said: 'Do not expose/allude to the mention of women.' Yahya b. Sa'id and Bishr b. al-Sari said that Ibn Umar and Ibn Yaman also opposed him—meaning Waki'—they said: 'Ibn Umar.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1366 - I asked him about the hadith of Ta'mah al-Ja'fari from Umar b. Bayan al-Taghlibi from Urwah b. al-Mughirah from his father from the Prophet (peace be upon him): 'Whoever sells wine, let him butcher swine.' I said: 'Who is Umar b. Bayan?' He said: 'I do not know him.' 1367 - I said to my father: Hammad b. Zaid [narrated] from Hafs from Al-Hasan: 'The woman with irregular bleeding (Mustahadah) gets divorced according to the menstrual periods (Aqra').' My father said: 'And that is what I say too.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1368 - I heard him say: Mis'ar narrated it—Waki' narrated it from him—from Habib b. Abi Thabit from Ata from Ibn Abbas: 'If he wakes up fasting voluntarily then breaks the fast, he makes up a day in its place.' My father said: 'Ibn Mahdi refused to narrate this from Sufyan because he narrates from Ibn Abbas the opposite of it. There is no harm in it; Ibn Abbas says in it: They opposed Habib in this.' 1369 - My father said regarding the hadith of Sufyan from Nusayr from Amr b. Rashid that a man bought a she-camel from a man while it was sick, and the seller excluded its skin. Then it recovered, so he desired it, and he disputed with him before Umar. So he sent them to Ali, who said: 'Evaluate it [the skin's value], then the purchase is his.' My father said: 'And I hold this view.' My father said: 'Amr b. Rashid, Hilal b. Yasaf narrated from him, from this Amr b. Rashid.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1370 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Sufyan used to deny the hadith of Ibrahim from Hammam—meaning the hadith of Sufyan from Al-A'mash from Umarah from Abu Ammar from Hudhayfah: 'A time will come upon the people wherein no one will be saved except one who supplicates with the supplication of the drowning.'—meaning he denies the hadith of Hammam, saying: 'It is only this hadith of Umarah.' 1371 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Abu al-Ubaydayn al-Amiri told us. 1372 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us the hadith of Sufyan from Al-Mughirah b. al-Nu'man from Hani' b. Hiram, he said: 'A man found a man with his wife and killed him. So he wrote regarding it to Umar...' Waki' said: 'Ibn Hiram.' And Yahya b. Adam said the same. And Ibn Mahdi said: 'Ibn Hizam.' Abu Abd al-Rahman said: 'It is actually Ibn Hiram.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1373 - He said: Waki' narrated the hadith of Bashir Abu Isma'il from Sayyar Abu al-Hakam from Tariq b. Shihab from Abdullah from the Prophet (peace be upon him): 'Whoever is afflicted by poverty...' And others besides Waki' said: 'Sayyar Abu Hamzah.' My father said: 'And Bashir Abu Isma'il did not hear from Sayyar Abu al-Hakam; it is only Sayyar Abu Hamzah, and not Abu al-Hakam.' 1374 - My father said: 'Abd al-Jabbar—meaning Ibn Abbas al-Shibami—did not hear anything from Al-Sha'bi.' Abu Abd al-Rahman said: 'Shibam is a clan of Hamdan.' 1375 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us from Hasan from Abd al-Jabbar al-Hamdani from Al-Sha'bi: 'If he takes off the Khuff (leather socks), he takes off the Wudu [state].' My father said: 'This is the hadith of Shu'bah from Mu'arrif from Zakariyya from Al-Sha'bi.' My father said: 'I consider him to be Zakariyya b. Abi al-Atik.' 1376 - My father said: 'Al-Sa'ib b. Hubaysh is a Shami (Levantine), a Kala'i.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1377 - My father told me, he said Waki' told us, on the authority of Sharik, on the authority of Abdullah bin Ism. Waki' said: Israel bin Ismah. Waki' said: And they said he is Ibn Ism.
1378 - My father told me, he said Waki' told us, on the authority of Miskin Abu Hurairah al-Taymi. Waki' said: And he was reliable (Thabt).
1379 - My father told me, he said Waki' told us, he said Ismail told us, on the authority of Al-Sha'bi, on the authority of Al-Hazhaz bin Mayzan. Waki' said: My father said: I heard it from Al-Hazhaz. And Abd al-Rahman said: Sufyan told us, he said Al-Hazhaz told us, on the authority of a man from his people, the hadith of the option (Al-Khiyar).
1380 - I heard my father say: Talhah bin Yahya is more beloved to me than Burayd bin Abi Burdah. Burayd narrates objectionable hadiths (Manakir). And Talhah narrated the hadith of "A sparrow from the sparrows of Paradise." My father told me, he said Ibn Fudayl told us, on the authority of Al-Ala or Habib bin Abi Amrah. My father said: I do not think he heard it from anyone except Talhah—meaning Ibn Fudayl.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1381 - My father told me, he said Waki' told us, he said Sufyan told us, on the authority of Ibn Jurayj, on the authority of Ata, that the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, disliked taking more from the woman seeking Khul' (divorce) than what he gave her. My father told me, he said Waki' told us, he said: I asked Ibn Jurayj about it, but he denied it and did not know it.
1382 - My father told me, he said Waki' told us, on the authority of Sufyan, on the authority of Ayyub, on the authority of Kathir Mawla Samurah. This is what Waki' said. My father said: Rather, it is Abd al-Rahman bin Samurah.
1383 - My father said: Gundar said: I stuck with Shu'bah for twenty years.
1384 - My father told me, he said Waki' told us, he said Sharik said: Salih bin Muslim is a Bakri (from the tribe of Bakr).

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1385 - My father told me, he said Waki' told us, he said Shu'bah told us, on the authority of Qatadah, on the authority of Waqi' bin Sahban, on the authority of Tarif bin Yazid or Yazid bin Tarif, he said: We were with Abu Musa on the bank of the Tigris. Waki' said once: Waqi' bin Sahba. So I said to him: "Waqi' bin Sahba or Sahban?" He said: "Sahban." My father said: Waqi' is Basran; he narrated from Asir bin Jabir. And Asir is Basran; Abu Nadrah, Humaid bin Hilal, and Waqi' bin Sahban narrated from him.
1386 - My father told me, he said Waki' said: Al-Nahhas bin Qaham Abu al-Khattab told us, on the authority of Shaddad Abu Ammar al-Shami. My father said: Al-Awza'i and Ikrimah bin Ammar narrated from him. And Al-Nahhas bin Qaham [narrated] from Shaddad Abu Ammar.
1387 - My father said: And Waki' said in the hadith of Sufyan, on the authority of Abu Hashim, on the authority of Jahm bin Dinar, on the authority of Ibrahim. My father said: He is Abu Hashim al-Rummani.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1388 - My father said: And Waki' said, on the authority of Sharik, on the authority of Hilal bin Abdullah. And he said once: Hilal bin Humaid.
1389 - My father said: And Waki' told us in the hadith of Salam bin Miskin, on the authority of Uqail bin Talhah, on the authority of Abu Juzi. This is what Waki' said: "Juzi." My father said: It is only "Juri."
1390 - My father said: They say that Abu Ishaq heard this hadith from Abu Farwah: The hadith of Sa'id bin Iyas who married a woman from Bani Shamkh, then he saw her mother and she pleased him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1391 - My father said: Ata al-Kaikharani is Al-Kaikharali, Ata bin Ya'qub. And Dinar Abu Umar is the one from whom Waki' narrated; Ali bin Hashim and Abu Usamah [also] narrated from him.
1392 - My father said: Waki' said: Mu'adh bin al-Ala Abu Ghassan is the brother of Abu Amr bin al-Ala.
1393 - My father said: Waki' said: Abu Ka'b is Abd Rabbih bin Ubaid.
1394 - I heard my father say: Abdullah bin Abdullah al-Razi; Al-A'mash, Al-Hakam, Fitr, and Ibn Abi Layla narrated from him. My father said: I heard it from Muhammad bin Muqatil al-Marwazi, he said Abbad bin al-Awwam informed us, he said Hajjaj told us, on the authority of Abdullah bin Abdullah, and he was trustworthy (Thiqah), and Al-Hakam used to take from him.
1395 - I heard my father say: Ja'far bin Abi Thawr; Simak bin Harb, Uthman bin Abdullah bin Mawhab, and Ash'ath bin Abi al-Sha'tha narrated from him. His grandfather is Jabir bin Samurah from his mother's side.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1396 - I said to my father: "Sufyan, on the authority of Abu Musa, [said] I heard Al-Sha'bi: 'The Emigrants (Muhajirun) used to dislike for a town-dweller to sell for a desert-dweller'." My father said: "I do not know who this Abu Musa is from whom Sufyan narrated."
1397 - My father said: Waki' said: Warqa bin Umar is Abu Bishr.
1398 - My father told me, he said Waki' told us, Abu Hisham al-Ahwal told us. My father said: This is the brother of A'idh bin Habib.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1399 - My father said: Ubayd bin Zaid, the Mawla (client) of Salamah bin al-Akwa. Ibrahim bin Ismail bin Mujamma' narrated from him, on the authority of Ubayd bin Zaid.
1400 - I said to my father: "Sufyan, from Uthman bin al-Harith, from Abu al-Wazi'." My father said: "He is Uthman, the son of Al-Sha'bi's daughter; he narrated from Abu al-Waddak."
1401 - I asked my father: "Who narrated from Umarah bin Umayr?" He said: "Ibrahim al-Nakha'i, Al-Hakam bin Utaybah, Al-A'mash, Al-Salt bin Bahram, and Jami' bin Shaddad narrated from him."
1402 - I asked my father, I said: "Sufyan, from Abu Hashim, from Abu al-Bakhtari: 'It was said to Shurayh: Indeed you have introduced something new in your judgment. He said: Indeed they introduced new things, so we introduced new things'." My father said: "I do not know who he is, and he is not Abu Hashim al-Rummani." Abu Abd al-Rahman said: Shurayh used to ask about the witnesses publicly, then it reached him that they were deceiving him in that, so he asked about them secretly. So they said: "Indeed you have introduced something new in your judgment." He said: "You introduced new things, so we introduced new things."
1403 - I asked my father about Khalid bin Makhlad, so he said: "He has objectionable hadiths (Manakir)."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1404 - And I asked my father about Zaid bin Rafi'. He said: "A man from the people of Al-Jazira, trustworthy (Thiqah). Ma'mar and Al-Mas'udi narrated from him." I said: "Did he hear from Abu Ubaidah?" He said: "Yes."
1405 - My father said: Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi said regarding the hadith of Ibrahim bin Sa'd, on the authority of Al-Zuhri, on the authority of Ibn Ka'b bin Malik, that Umar sent an army and admonished them. Abd al-Rahman said: " 'Asrafa' (He exceeded) against them"—saying it as if he was threatening them in his admonition. So I said to Abd al-Rahman: "Indeed Abu Kamil said 'Ashrafa' (He supervised/looked over)." So Abd al-Rahman said to me: "Ask Bahz." So I asked him, and Bahz said: " 'Ashrafa' over them." So I informed Abd al-Rahman of it—meaning that he seemed satisfied with the statement of Bahz. My father said: And Ma'mar narrated it as Mursal.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1406 - I asked my father about Al-Ala bin Abd al-Rahman and Suhail bin Abi Salih. He seemed to place Al-Ala above Suhail, and he said: "I have not heard anyone mention Al-Ala with evil." I said: "Is Abu Salih above the father of Al-Ala—meaning Abd al-Rahman bin Ya'qub?" He said: "Abu Salih is among the majestic people and the most trustworthy of them, and from the companions of Abu Hurairah. And he witnessed 'The House' (Al-Dar)—meaning with Uthman."
1407 - I asked my father about Muhammad bin Ajlan and Musa bin Uqbah, "Which of them is more pleasing to you?" He said: "Both are trustworthy (Thiqah), and how close they are! Ibn Uyainah used to praise Muhammad bin Ajlan."
1408 - I heard my father say: Musa bin Uqbah, Muhammad bin Uqbah, and Ibrahim bin Uqbah are all brothers. I said to him: "Is Musa bin Uqbah the most majestic of them?" He said: "How close some of them are to others! And Malik bin Anas and Bishr bin al-Mufaddal narrated from Muhammad bin Uqbah." He said: "And Musa bin Uqbah died earlier than Muhammad bin Ajlan."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1409 - I asked him about a Shaykh from whom Jarir bin Hazim narrated, called Al-Miqdam Abu Farwah. He said: "I do not know who he is."
1410 - My father said: Yazid bin Ziyad bin Abi al-Ja'd is a trustworthy Shaykh.
1411 - I asked my father about Sadaqah al-Dimashqi. He said: "He is Sadaqah 'The Fat' (Al-Samin). Whatever of his hadith is Marfu' (elevated to the Prophet) is Munkar (objectionable), and whatever of his hadith is Mursal from Makhul is easier. He is very weak. He is Sadaqah bin Abdullah al-Samin. But Sadaqah bin Khalid is Trustworthy, Trustworthy, Firm (Thiqah Thiqah Thabt), more established than Al-Walid bin Muslim, and he is Salih al-Hadith (good in hadith)."
1412 - And I asked him about a Shaykh from whom Waki' narrated, called Abu Sulaiman al-Muktib. He said: "I do not know who he is."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1413 - And my father said regarding the hadith of Sufyan, from Hammad, from Ibrahim, from Al-Aswad that he used to say "Indrayim" (a specific term/pronunciation). My father said: In the dictation of Al-Yaman: Sufyan, from Jabir, from Hammad; Sufyan did not hear it from Hammad.
1414 - And my father said regarding the hadith of Zaid bin Wahb, from Abd al-Rahman bin Abd Rabb al-Ka'bah: Al-Sha'bi and Zaid bin Wahb narrated from him.
1415 - My father said: Abu Nu'aym said regarding the hadith of Sufyan, from Al-Suddi, from Ikrimah: "And present to them an example: the people of the city, when the messengers came to it" [Ya-Sin: 13]. He said: "It is Antioch." Abu Nu'aym narrated to us from Al-Shaibani from Ikrimah. So I said to him: "It is actually Al-Suddi." So he took out his book, a scroll, and indeed it was from Al-Suddi.
1416 - My father said: Ibn Mahdi said regarding [the narration of] Sufyan, from Malik bin Mighwal, from Abu Husayn, from Al-Sha'bi regarding this hadith—meaning the hadith of Waki', from Sufyan, from Abu Husayn, from Al-Sha'bi regarding the castrated animal being sacrificed: "What it gains in fat and meat is more than what decreases from it."
1417 - I heard my father say regarding the hadith of Waki', from Sufyan, from Abu Sahl, from Ibn al-Musayyib: "The caller (Mu'adhdhin) has not called the Adhan for thirty years except that I was in the mosque." My father said: This Abu Sahl is Uthman bin Hakim.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1418 - My father said: It reached me from Yahya bin Sa'id that he said: Ibn Ajlan was not certain about the hadith of Sa'id al-Maqburi from his father from Abu Hurairah, so he left it (the father) out. He used to say: Sa'id al-Maqburi from Abu Hurairah, omitting his father.
1419 - My father said: Waki' said regarding the hadith of Sufyan from Abu Umar al-Bazzar—Waki' said: And he was trustworthy (Thiqah)—from Muslim al-Batin.
1420 - I heard my father say: Waki' said: They say that Sulaiman is the more authentic of the two in hadith—meaning Ibn Buraydah. My father said: Abdullah bin Buraydah, the one from whom Husain bin Waqid narrated—how objectionable are his narrations! And Abu al-Munib also; they say it is as if they (the errors) come from these people.
1421 - I said to my father: The hadith of Waki', from Sufyan, from Maymun, from Tawus: "Truthfulness suffices in supplication just as salt suffices in food." I said: "Who is this Maymun?" He said: "I see he is a Shaykh from the people of Yemen whom I do not know."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1422 - I mentioned to my father the hadith of Mis'ar, from Amr bin Murrah, from Abd al-Rahman bin Abi Layla: A man was sitting with Ka'b bin Ujrah, and he mentioned Abdullah bin Ubayy, so Ka'b remained silent. Then the man came to Umar... My father said: This hadith is not with Shu'bah.
1423 - I heard him say: Waki' said: We used to memorize them with Sufyan, then we would count them.
1424 - I said to my father: Abu Ishaq from Khalid bin al-Mudarrib. He said: "How likely it is that he is the brother of Harithah bin Mudarrib."
1425 - I asked my father about Ali bin Atiq. He said: "Mis'ar narrated from him, and Sufyan [narrated] from Ali bin Atiq from Abu Burdah."
1426 - I heard my father say: Hujr bin Anbas; Salamah bin Kuhayl, Musa bin Qais, and Al-Mughirah bin Abi al-Hurr narrated from him.
1427 - My father said regarding the hadith of Waki', from Sufyan, from Al-Ala bin al-Musayyib, from a man, from Abu Sa'id al-Khudri: Allah, Blessed and Exalted is He, says: "Indeed a man for whom I have expanded his provision..." And Abd al-Razzaq said: From Sufyan, from Al-Ala, from his father.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1428 - My father said: Usamah bin Zaid narrated objectionable hadiths (Manakir) from Nafi'. I said to him: "Indeed Usamah is Hasan al-Hadith (good in hadith)." He said: "If you scrutinize his hadith, you will recognize the objectionable nature in them."
1429 - My father said: Umarah bin Zadhan is a trustworthy (Thiqah) Shaykh; there is no harm in him.
1430 - My father said: Salamah bin Wardan is Munkar al-Hadith (his hadith is objectionable).
1431 - My father said: Waki' said: Ziyad bin Khaythamah, the uncle of Zuhair, told me. My father said: And he is not his uncle.
1432 - My father said: And Waki' said: Ibn al-Asbahani is a Mawla (client) of Jadilah Qais.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1433 - I heard my father say: If Al-Jurayri had not narrated anything except this hadith, it would have been [sufficient]—meaning the hadith of Abu al-Ward, from Al-Lajlaj, from Mu'adh, from the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him: He heard a man saying: "O Allah, indeed I ask you for the completion of the favor..."
1434 - I heard my father say: Jawab, from Abu Qilabah, from Al-Hasan. I think he is Abu Qilabah Abdullah bin Zaid al-Jarmi.
1435 - My father said: The meaning of the hadith of Aisha "Laqisat Nafsi" means "My soul has become wretched/malicious (Khabuthat)." My father said: It means nausea/queasiness (Al-Ghashayan).
1436 - I said to my father: Waki' said: Husayn bin Habib told me, from Harb bin Abi Harb, from Shurayh. He said: "I do not know who he is."
1437 - I said to my father: Waki' said: Abu Yunus told us, he heard Al-Hasan. My father said: "This is Mubarak bin Hassan Abu Yunus."
1438 - My father said regarding the hadith of Waki', from Sufyan, from Nusayr, from Mundhir, from Ibn al-Hanafiyyah: "The deal (Al-Safqah), whoever fights it is destroyed." I do not see it as a hadith of Nusayr; I do not see it as anything other than a hadith of Sa'id bin Masruq.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1439 - I said to my father: Waki', from Sharik, from Qarazah Abu Abdullah, from Sa'id bin Jubayr. He said: "He is a Shaykh of his."
1440 - I heard my father say: Waki' said: Sufyan said: Mukhariq bin Khalifah. This is what he said—meaning Sufyan al-Thawri.
1441 - My father said: I saw a man in Mecca from the people of Harran called Ata bin Muhammad. He had heard from Ja'far bin Burqan, and he was a righteous man, a man of prayer. He used to buy his provisions on the road and would not buy anything in Mecca, saying: "Do not raise prices for them."
1442 - A man from the people of Basra, among those who used to narrate, was mentioned in the presence of my father. So I said: "He is a Waqifi (one who suspends judgment on the creation of the Quran); he suspends judgment, and the people of hadith have abandoned him and do not come to him." So he said: "May Allah distance him."
1443 - My father said: Abu Qatan said: Shu'bah said: Sufyan did not hear this—meaning from Salamah bin Kuhayl—the hadith of "The Sa'ibah (freed slave without clientage) places his wealth wherever he wishes." My father said: Waki' also narrated it to us from Shu'bah.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1444 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Sa'id told us, he said Shu'bah said: Sulaiman al-Taimi and Ibn Awn came to me to console me over [the death of] my mother. So Al-Taimi said: "Abu Nadrah told us." So Ibn Awn said: "Did you see Abu Nadrah?" Al-Taimi said: "So what?" Or "So did I not see him?"
1445 - I heard my father mention, he said: Al-Layth bin Sa'd said: I saw Abu al-Khayr.
1446 - My father said: I heard from Amr bin Asim in Baghdad the hadith of Jundab, from Hudhaifah, from the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him: "It is not befitting for a believer to humiliate himself," but I did not write it until he left—meaning from Baghdad. I said to him: "Did you hear from him: 'Harb bin Surayj, from Abu Ja'far, from his father, from his grandfather, from Ali, from the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, regarding Intercession'?" He said: "I did not hear this from him, neither in Baghdad nor in Basra, and I never heard this at all." I said: "Indeed a man claims that you said to him: 'I only memorized it from him, but I did not write it'." So he said: "I did not hear it from him, so how can I narrate it? Perhaps this man heard it from someone other than me [who heard it from Amr]. I did not hear it, so [you should] memorize it and write it from him and narrate it. Perhaps this man heard it from someone other than me. And I did not hear this hadith from anyone, nor from Amr bin Asim."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1447 - My father said: Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi said: I reached the people while they were "upon the camel"—meaning they did not speak, meaning nor did they argue.
1448 - My father said: Abu Khaythamah said: Yahya bin Sa'id and Mu'adh bin Mu'adh rejected the hadith of Habib bin al-Shahid, from Maymun bin Mahran, from Ibn Abbas, that the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, was cupped while he was a Muhrim (in pilgrim sanctity) and fasting. My father said: They rejected it upon Al-Ansari Muhammad bin Abdullah.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1449 - My father said: Umar bin Bashir is Salih al-Hadith (good in hadith). Abu al-Nadr Hashim bin al-Qasim, Ibn Abi Za'idah, and Waki' narrated from him.
1450 - My father said: Sa'd bin Amr bin Sulaym al-Zuraqi is a trustworthy (Thiqah) Shaykh. Malik and Ubaydullah bin Umar narrated from him.
1451 - I said to my father: "Al-Mundhir bin Tha'labah from Abu Uthman al-Ansari?" He said: "He is the one from whom Mutarrif narrated."
1452 - I said to my father: "Waki' said: Yazid bin Abdullah Mawla al-Sahba told me." He said: "I do not know him."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1453 - I heard my father say: The hadith which Waki' narrated from Ibn Abi Dhi'b, from Salih Mawla al-Taw'amah, from Ibn Abbas, from the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, regarding combining Dhuhr and Asr [prayers]. My father said: It is only the hadith of Dawud bin Qais; it is not from the hadith of Ibn Abi Dhi'b.
1454 - I heard my father say: Ishaq bin Najih al-Malti is among the most lying of people. He narrates from Al-Batti, from Ibn Sirin, according to the opinion of Abu Hanifa.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1455 - I heard him say: Muhammad b. Yahya b. Sa'id Al-Qattan said: 'If a person were to follow every concession (Rukhsah) in Hadith, he would become a transgressor (Fasiq) thereby.' 1456 - I heard him say: 'Hisham b. Al-Kalbi, who narrates from him? He is only a man of night-tales and genealogy. I did not think that anyone narrates from him.' 1457 - I asked him about Rawwad Abu Isam. He said: 'There is no harm in him; [he is] a man of Sunnah, except that he narrated objectionable hadiths (Manakir) from Sufyan.' 1458 - I said to him: 'A Shaykh from whom Abu Isam narrated, called Bukayr Al-Damghani, who narrates from Ibn Sirin?' He said: 'I do not know him.' Abu Abd Al-Rahman said: I asked some of the people of Damghan about this Bukayr, and he said: 'He was a devout worshiper who cut himself off from people.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1459 - I heard my father say: 'Hushaym did not hear anything from Asim b. Kulayb, nor from Al-Hasan b. Ubaydullah, yet he narrated from them. And he narrated from Al-Umari the Younger, but did not hear from him. And he narrated from Abu Khaldah, but did not hear from him. He narrated to us from him, then he was asked about him and he denied it.' 1460 - I asked my father about Abu Ismah, from whom Shu'bah narrated, from Al-A'mash, from Ubayd b. Hasan, from Ibn Abi Awfa. He said: 'He is not Abu Ismah, the companion of Nu'aym b. Hammad. And Shu'bah narrated from Abu Ismah, from a man, from Ibn Al-Musayyib regarding amulets.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1461 - I asked him: 'Which is more beloved to you: Hushaym or Khalid?' He said: 'He is, in my view, sounder in his person'—meaning Khalid. 'Khalid did not become involved with the ruler.' 1462 - I asked him: 'Which is more beloved to you: Yazid b. Harun or Muhammad b. Yazid?' He said: 'Yazid b. Harun.' 1463 - My father said: I was informed that Ibn Jurayj said to Waki'—when Waki' began asking him—so he said to him: 'O boy, you have come to knowledge early.' 1464 - My father said: I said to Waki': 'O Abu Sufyan, in the hadith of Sufyan from Abu Hashim from Mujahid: {Send an arbitrator from his family}, who is Abu Hashim?' He remained silent. My father said: 'And he is Isma'il b. Kathir'—meaning Al-Makki.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1465 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us from Zakariyya from Amir that Umm Umar Al-Hadramiyyah was with her husband [while she was] *Muzahiq* (a tribadist). And Abu Nu'aym said: *Muzakhiq*. [My father said:] I do not see it as anything but a misspelling. 1466 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Shu'bah told us from Al-Hakam from Ibn Abbas regarding a man who placed his wife's affair in her hand [gave her the right to divorce], so she said: 'I have divorced you three times.' Ibn Abbas said: 'May Allah make her *Naw'* (star/luck) miss the mark! Why did she not divorce herself?' My father said: And Abu Qatan said—and he misspoke—he said: 'May Allah make her *Fuh* (mouth) wrong.' 1467 - My father said: Khalid Al-Nili is Khalid b. Dinar. My father said: [He is] a trustworthy Shaykh. 1468 - I heard my father say: 'There was no harm in Muhammad b. Yazid Al-Wasiti; his books are sound. His origin is Syrian. He narrated from Al-Nu'man b. Al-Mundhir and Dawud b. Amr. And Muhammad b. Yazid is more established than Ishaq Al-Azraq. Al-Azraq made many mistakes from Sufyan. Al-Azraq was a Hafiz (memorizer), except that he used to make mistakes.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1469 - My father said: Ibn Mahdi reported from Hushaym, saying: 'I said to him: O Abu Mu'awiyah, how much you narrate from Al-Awwam! He said: He was among the last of our Shaykhs to remain, so I scrutinized him [thoroughly].' 1470 - I asked my father about Ayyub Abu Al-Ala. He said: 'There is no harm in him. Yazid b. Harun did not take him lightly.' I think he said: 'He did not memorize the chain of transmission (Isnad), and he died long ago; he died before Al-Awwam b. Hawshab.' 1471 - My father told me, he said: Ibn Uyaynah told us from Abdah from Abu Wa'il, he said: 'Often Masruq and I went to Al-Subay asking him about it'—meaning the hadith: 'I assumed Ihram for Hajj and Umrah [together].' 1472 - My father was asked about Hatim b. Abi Saghirah, and he said: 'Trustworthy.' 1473 - My father was asked about Usamah b. Zayd Al-Laythi, so he said: 'He is below [the standard],' and he moved his hand.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1474 - My father was asked about Ziyad b. Fayyad [narrating] from Maysarah: 'Who is this Maysarah?' He said: 'I do not know him.' It was said: 'Is he the companion of Ali, from whom Ata b. Al-Sa'ib narrated from Maysarah from Ali?' He said: 'No.' 1475 - Abdullah told us, he said: Muhammad b. Abbad told us, he said: Sufyan told us from Mis'ar from Ziyad b. Fayyad from Maysarah, he said: 'It used to be said: Take Suhur, even if only with gulps of water.' Sufyan said: I said to Mis'ar: 'O Abu Salamah, who is Maysarah?' He said: He remained silent, then said: 'Perhaps he is the one about whom the poet says: If we cut off kinship from Quraysh / Then which bowman shoots arrows at Maysarah?'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1476 - My father was asked about Muhammad b. Hilal Al-Madani. He said: 'There is no harm in him.' It was said: '[What about] his father?' He said: 'I do not know him.' 1477 - He was asked about Abbas Al-Jurayri, so he said: 'Trustworthy, trustworthy.' 1478 - My father was asked about Ma'mar: 'Did he hear from Yahya b. Sa'id?' He said: 'I do not think so. However, Ibn Muhammad b. Abbad b. Ja'far was with them, so I think he heard it from him. And Rabah used to narrate from him.' 1479 - My father was asked about Thumamah b. Abdullah b. Anas, so he said: 'Trustworthy.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1480 - My father was asked about Mubarak and Al-Rabi' b. Sabih. He said: 'How close they are [to each other]. Mubarak and Hisham both sat with Al-Hasan for ten years. And Mubarak used to practice Tadlis (concealing the source).' 1481 - My father was asked about the hadith of Qatadah from Anas regarding neighborhood (Al-Jiwar). He said: 'Isa b. Yunus erred in it.' 1482 - Jarir b. Hazim was a man of Sunnah. Yahya b. Sa'id did not take Hammam lightly. 1483 - My father was asked about Hariz and Safwan b. Amr. He said: 'Hariz is more beloved to me and more impressive to me than Safwan, and there is no harm in Safwan.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1484 - My father was asked about Hariz and Abu Bakr b. Abi Maryam. He said: 'Abu Bakr is weak; he used to combine [chains saying] so-and-so and so-and-so. And Isa did not approve of him.' 1485 - My father was asked about Attaf b. Khalid. He said: 'There is no harm in him; [he is] from the people of Medina.' Abu Salamah Al-Khuza'i reported about Abd Al-Rahman b. Mahdi that he went with him to him, but Ibn Mahdi did not approve of him—meaning Attaf. My father said: 'And there is no harm in him'—meaning Attaf. 1486 - My father was asked about Yahya b. Hamzah and Attaf. He said: 'How close they are! Attaf, there is no harm in him.' 1487 - I said to my father: 'Did Malik b. Mighwal narrate from Al-Zuhri?' He said: 'Yes.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1488 - My father was asked: 'Did Umarah b. Abi Hafsah narrate from Al-Zuhri?' He said: 'Harami narrated to us from Al-Hasan b. Abi Ja'far from Umarah from Al-Zuhri a hadith.' 1489 - I asked my father about Abu Rafi', the Mawla of Umar b. Al-Khattab. He said: 'Al-Hasan, Bakr Al-Muzani, Khilas b. Amr, Thabit Al-Bunani, Marwan Al-Asfar, Ata b. Abi Maymunah, Ali b. Zayd, and Yahya Al-Bakka narrated from him. The young and the old narrated from him.' I said to my father: 'In the hadith of Bakr from Abu Rafi' [he says]: My mistress Layla bint Al-Ajma' swore. Do you see that this Abu Rafi' is other than Abu Rafi' the Mawla of Umar?' He said: 'I reckon that Layla bint Al-Ajma' has a connection between her and Umar, and he is, in my view, one person, if Allah wills.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1490 - I asked my father about a Basran Shaykh called Abbad b. Juwayriyah. He said: 'A liar, a fabricator. I came to him with Ali—meaning Ibn Al-Madini—and Ibrahim b. Ar'arah. We said to him: Bring out for us the book of Al-Awza'i. And lo, in it were the questions of Abu Ishaq Al-Fazari: I asked Al-Awza'i. But lo, he had made them from Al-Zuhri and inverted them. And he said: Khasif—meaning from Al-Zuhri—the like of it. We said: Al-Awza'i from Khasif? He said: This is Khasif the Elder. So we abandoned him, and he was a liar.' 1491 - My father said: I met Abu Ishaq Al-Aqra' in Makkah, and we mentioned Ibn Mahdi. It was as if he began to lower his status or make light of him. So I spoke harshly to him and said: 'Who are *you*?' and I gave him a piece of my mind.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
