text: 1492 - And I presented to Ibn Mahdi the hadiths of Al-Haytham b. Abd Al-Ghaffar Al-Ta'i from Hammam and others. He said: 'This [man] fabricates Hadith.' And I asked Al-Aqra', and he mentioned the like of it or similar to it. My father said: 'And Al-Aqra' was one of the People of Hadith.' 1493 - I heard my father say: Abu Dawud Al-Tayalisi narrated to us from Mu'adh b. Hisham the hadith of his father from Qatadah from Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib: 'The Companions of the Prophet (peace be upon him) used to trade by sea to the Romans; among them were Talhah b. Ubaydullah and Sa'id b. Zayd.' My father said: 'I thought that he [Mu'adh] had died, then we met him after that, and we wrote from him in Makkah and we wrote from him in Yemen.' 1494 - My father was asked while I was listening about Salam b. Miskin and Salam b. Abi Muti'. He said: 'Both are trustworthy, except that Salam b. Miskin has more hadith. Salam b. Abi Muti' was a man of Sunnah, and Abd Al-Rahman b. Mahdi used to narrate from him.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1495 - My father was asked while I was listening about Qurrah and Abu Khaldah. He said: 'Qurrah is above him.' It was said to my father: 'With whom is Qurrah [ranked]?' He said: 'He is below Habib b. Al-Shahid.' It was said to him: 'Qurrah and Al-Qasim b. Al-Fadl?' He said: 'How close he is to him.' Abd Al-Rahman b. Mahdi said: 'Al-Qasim b. Al-Fadl Al-Huddani is among our trustworthy Shaykhs.' 1496 - It was said to my father while I was listening: 'Imran b. Hudayr and Abu Khaldah?' He said: 'Imran is above him.' 1497 - It was said to my father while I was listening: 'Haywah b. Shurayh and Amr b. Al-Harith?' He said: 'Both'—as if he made them equal. 1498 - My father told me, he said: Sufyan told us, he said: 'Abu Harun Musa b. Abi Isa told us.' My father said: 'Meaning the brother of Isa Al-Hannat.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1499 - I said to my father: 'It reached me that Ibn Al-Himmani narrated from Sharik from Hisham b. Urwah from his father from Aisha that the Prophet (peace be upon him) liked looking at pigeons. They disapproved of it from him, so he retracted its elevation (Raf') and said: From Aisha, mursal.' My father said: 'This is a lie. We only knew Husayn b. Ulwan by this. And they say: He only fabricated it upon Hisham.' I said to him: 'Some of the people of Hadith claimed that Abu Zakariyya Al-Saylahini narrated it from Sharik.' He said: 'He lied against Al-Saylahini. Al-Saylahini does not narrate the like of this. This hadith is false.' 1500 - I asked him about Buraydah b. Sufyan: 'How is his hadith?' He said: 'He has a calamity that is narrated from him.' 1501 - I asked him about Al-Mughirah b. Ziyad. He said: 'Weak in Hadith; he has rejected (Munkar) hadiths.' 1502 - I asked him about Ammar b. Abi Ammar. He said: 'Trustworthy, trustworthy.' 1503 - I asked him about Amir Al-Ahwal. He said: 'There is something in his hadith.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1504 - I asked him about Ubaydullah b. Abi Ziyad. He said: 'There is no harm in him.' 1505 - He was asked about Kawthar b. Hakim. He said: 'His hadith is not worth anything.' 1506 - He was asked about Sadaqah b. Abd Allah Al-Dimashqi. He said: 'He is nothing.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1507 - He was asked about Ubaydah b. Humayd and Al-Bukka'i. He said: 'Ubaydah is more beloved to me and sounder in hadith than him.' My father said: 'Al-Bukka'i used to narrate the hadith of Mansur from Habib b. Abi Thabit from Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib regarding the blood money of a Jew and a Christian, but it is only from Thabit Al-Haddad. He erred.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1508 - I heard my father say: 'Abd Al-Rahman b. Abd Allah Al-Umari, his hadith is not worth anything. We tore up his hadith. I heard from him, then we abandoned him.' 1509 - I heard Abdullah b. Muhammad b. Ishaq Al-Adhrami ask my father about Dawud b. Ata. He said: 'One does not narrate from him.' I heard him say: 'He is nothing, Dawud; I have seen him.' 1510 - He was asked about Sufyan b. Waki' ten days or less before he died: 'Should one write from him?' He said: 'Yes, I know nothing but good.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1511 - He was asked: 'Did Al-Hasan hear from Suraqah?' He said: 'No, this is Ali b. Zayd'—meaning who narrates it. It was as if he was not convinced by him. 1512 - He was asked about Isma'il b. Umayyah and Ibn Khuthaym. He said: 'Isma'il is more beloved to us than Ibn Khuthaym.' 1513 - He was asked about Uqbah—meaning Al-Asam. He said: 'Al-Bara' b. Abd Allah Al-Ghanawi is more beloved to me than him. And Yazid b. Ibrahim is trustworthy, greater than these.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1514 - My father said: Ibn Mahdi said: I heard Sufyan say: 'Abd Al-A'la from Ibn Al-Hanafiyyah; we think that it is a book.' Ibrahim b. Abd Al-A'la is trustworthy. My father said: Shu'bah narrated from Ibn Abd Al-A'la, and Hushaym heard from Ali b. Abd Al-A'la. 1515 - My father was asked about Abu Sahl [narrating] from Ikrimah. He said: 'He is Uthman b. Hakim; there is no doubt about it.' 1516 - He was asked about Isma'il b. Sami' from Malik b. Umayr from Walan. It was said: 'Is he Walan from whom Al-Nadr b. Shumayl narrated the hadith of Abu Bakr?' He said: 'I do not think so.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1517 - He was asked about Umar b. Amir. He said: 'Yahya b. Sa'id did not find him agreeable. Mu'tamar and Abbad b. Al-Awwam narrated to us from him, and Sa'id b. Abi Arubah narrated from him.' 1518 - He was asked about Ibn Al-Munkadir: 'Did he hear from Anas?' He said: 'Yes.' It was said to him: 'And he narrated from Al-Raqashi from Anas?' He said: 'Yes.' 1519 - He was asked about the hadith of Jarir: 'A city will be built...' He said: 'No trustworthy person narrated it.' It was mentioned to him that Abd Al-Aziz b. Aban narrated it from Al-Thawri. He said: 'I abandoned him when he narrated the hadith of the appointed times (Al-Mawaqit).'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1520 - He was asked about Abu al-Zubair and Abu Sufyan. He said: Abu al-Zubair, it is as if there is something in the heart regarding him [more doubt]. As for Abu Sufyan, Abu Bishr and other people narrated from him.
1521 - He was asked about Abu Rawq. He said: There is no harm in him.
1522 - He was asked about Abu Khalaf, from his daughter Al-Himyariyyah, from whom Sharik narrated. He said: I do not know him.
1523 - My father said: Sharik used to weaken Abu Yahya al-Qattat. And Zuhair used to say: Abu Yahya al-Kunnasi.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1524 - He was asked about the hadith of Wallad. He said: It is said Wallad, Walid, and Bakkar; the hadith of Salamah from Mus'ab bin Sa'd, who said: Sa'd said: "What a wretched old man I would be if I sold wine (Khamr)."
1525 - And he was asked about Amr bin Abi Amr. He said: He heard from Anas; there is no harm in him.
1526 - He was asked about Salamah bin Kuhayl from Abu Yazid. He said: Another one has narrated from him.
1527 - And he was asked about the hadith of Abu Husayn: "I entered with my uncle upon Ibn Abbas." He said: Thus said Abu Bakr bin Ayyash, seeing that he was mistaken. Others narrated it—I think Al-Thawri—saying: From Sa'id bin Jubayr: "I entered with my uncle upon Ibn Abbas."
1528 - I heard my father mention Habib, who used to read for them to Malik bin Anas. He said: He is not trustworthy. A man came to us—I think he said from Khurasan—who had written a book from Habib, on the authority of the nephew of Ibn Shihab, from his uncle, from Salim and Al-Qasim. Suddenly, they were the hadiths of Ibn Lahi'ah from Khalid bin Abi Imran from Al-Qasim and Salim. My father said: He transferred/attributed them to the nephew of Ibn Shihab from his uncle. My father said: Habib used to transfer hadith [to false chains], and my father did not consider him trustworthy nor did he approve of him. He said: Habib used to transfer hadith and lie. He spoke of him with evil and bad terms.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1529 - My father said: I heard Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi say: Hisham al-Dastawa'i said: "If I were to testify to the striking of Qatadah's neck, it would be permissible in Hadith"—as if he had verified him [thoroughly].
1530 - I heard my father say: Ibn Ulayyah says: From Al-Taimi from Abu Mariyah. He said: And Qatadah says: Abu Marayah.
1531 - I heard him say: Salim bin Abi al-Ja'd, Ubayd bin Abi al-Ja'd, and Ziyad bin Abi al-Ja'd; all of these are brothers, and they are from [the tribe of] Ashja'.
1532 - My father told me, on the authority of Abu Imran al-Warkani, he said: I passed by Hushaym, so I said: "O Abu Mu'awiyah, the Companions of the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, entered Ihram at Al-Mawrid." So Hushaym said: "This is the hadith of the liars." My father said: Salamah al-Ahmar used to narrate it from Hammad, from Ibrahim, that the Companions of the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, entered Ihram at Al-Mawrid. My father said: And Salamah al-Ahmar is nothing [worthless].

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text: 1533 - I said to my father: Ya'qub bin Ismail bin Sabih mentioned that Abu Qatadah al-Harrani used to lie, and he made this a very serious matter. He said: These people—meaning the people of Harran—are prejudiced against him. Abu Qatadah used to seek truthfulness; perhaps I saw him doubt regarding a thing. And he praised him and mentioned him with good. I said to him: They claimed—meaning Ya'qub and others—that he handed them a book of Mis'ar belonging to Abu Nu'aym or someone else, and he read to them until he reached a place in the book where Abu Nu'aym (or someone else) had a doubt, so he threw the book. He said: I have seen him, and he resembles the people of Hadith or resembles the people [of piety]. He denied this [accusation] and rejected it. Then he said: Perhaps the Shaykh grew old and became confused. When we saw him, he resembled the people [of virtue]; I only knew him to seek truthfulness. Then he said: Abu Qatadah went out to Al-Awza'i. When he was on part of the road, he met a group who had returned from Al-Awza'i. Abu Qatadah said to them: "Audition (Sama') or Presentation (Ard)?" They said to him: "You will surely know." I think it was Miskin or someone else who said this to Abu Qatadah. My father said: When he narrated to us, he would say about a man: "He said to a man," until he mentioned the letter 'Zai'—out of his extreme piety, he would say [this] when he mentioned the 'Zai'. And my father said: I think Abu Qatadah used to practice Tadlis, and Allah knows best.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1534 - I heard my father say: Indeed, Abu Thawr al-Haddani's name is Habib bin Abi Mulaykah; Abu al-Bakhtari al-Ta'i narrated from him.
1535 - And I asked him about Ibn Abi Dhi'b hearing from Al-Zuhri. I said to him: "Did he present to Al-Zuhri, or was it presented while he was present?" He said: "He asked him questions." And he mentioned about five or six [instances] where he says: "I asked Al-Zuhri, I asked Al-Zuhri." My father said: Yahya bin Sa'id told us, on the authority of Ibn Abi Dhi'b, he said: "I asked Al-Zuhri," and he mentioned about five or six.
1536 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Sa'id told us, on the authority of Ibn Abi Dhi'b, he said Al-Zuhri told us, on the authority of Al-Qasim, on the authority of Aslam, on the authority of Umar, and he mentioned the hadith of wine (Khamr): "Whatever he does not know that they intended [to make into wine], he spoils/plugs it."
1537 - My father said: I heard Hushaym saying: "Supplicate to Allah for our brother Abbad bin al-Awwam."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1538 - I heard him say: A man used to come to us from Basra called Al-Haitham bin Abd al-Ghaffar al-Ta'i. He would narrate to us from Hammam, from Qatadah—his opinion. And from a man called Al-Rabi' bin Habib, from Dhimam, from Jabir bin Zaid. And from Raja' bin Abi Salamah—hadiths. And from Sa'id bin Abd al-Aziz. We were impressed by him. Then he narrated something to us that I found objectionable and doubted. Later I met him, and he said to me: "That hadith, leave it or abandon it." Then I came to Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi and presented some of his hadith to him. He said: "This man is a liar"—or he said: "Not trustworthy." My father said: I met Al-Aqra' in Mecca and mentioned to him some of these hadiths. He said: "This is the hadith of Al-Barri from Qatadah"—meaning the hadiths of Hammam which he flipped. He said: So I tore up his hadith and we abandoned him afterwards.
[Duplicate Serial Number in Source text] - I heard him say: A man came to us having a book from the nephew of Ibn Shihab, from his uncle, from Al-Qasim and Salim. I began to look into it, and suddenly they were the questions of Khalid—meaning Ibn Abi Imran—from Al-Qasim and Salim. So I said to the man: "From whom did you hear this?" He said: "From Habib, who used to read to the people for Malik." I said: "Leave it or tear it up; this man is a liar." It turned out he had transferred and flipped it to the nephew of Ibn Shihab from his uncle. My father said: They are only the questions of Khalid bin Abi Imran from Al-Qasim and Salim.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1539 - I heard my father say: Abd al-Salam bin Harb was mentioned to Ibn al-Mubarak, and he said: "My leg does not carry me to him." And Ismail bin Ulayyah was mentioned to him, and Ibn al-Mubarak said: "The necessity of the Muslims for him has reached a great extent."
1540 - I heard my father say: Bishr bin al-Sari spoke about something in Mecca, so Ibn al-Harith—meaning Hamzah bin al-Harith—and Al-Humaidi attacked him. He was truly humiliated in Mecca, to the point that he came and sat with us due to the humiliation that befell him.
1541 - Abdullah told us, he said Ahmad bin Ibrahim al-Dawraqi told us, he said Affan told us, he said: I heard Hammad bin Salamah say: "We used to liken the characteristics of Ibn Ulayyah to the characteristics of Yunus bin Ubaid."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1542 - My father told me, I heard Sufyan bin Uyainah say: Zaid bin Ali came to Kufa during the time of Yusuf at the end of the year one hundred and twenty-one. We came to Mecca, and when the people performed Hajj, Zaid was killed in the beginning of Safar—meaning the year one hundred and twenty-two. And Yusuf came to us in the year twenty in Jumada. Yusuf had ten thousand from the people of Sham with him; the likes of them had not been seen. They did not stay but two days until they killed Zaid, and the people of Kufa were entered into the mosque. He said: "Until we see what we will do with these people." He said: So they shouted a shout and said: "The people of Sham are with our families!" He said: So he was terrified by that. He said: So his killers came to us here in Mecca. He said: Habib bin Abi al-Ashras came to us and said: "Indeed Zaid has been killed."
1543 - My father said: Sufyan said: Abu Bakr was the first to collect the Quran and to give inheritance based on Kalalah. And Mujalid, from Al-Sha'bi, from Sa'sa'ah bin Suhan, was read to Sufyan.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1544 - And I heard my father say: I heard Sufyan say: There were no two men in Kufa, when Ibrahim passed away, who entered more into this [giving] Fatwa than Al-Hakam and Hammad.
1545 - I asked my father, I said to him: "Abd al-Razzaq used to be Shi'a and was excessive in Tashayyu' (Shi'ism)?" He said: "As for me, I did not hear anything from him regarding this, but he was a man who was impressed by the news of people or stories." Sufyan bin Waki' told me, he said I heard my father mention Abd al-Razzaq, and he said: "He resembles the men of the people of Iraq."
1546 - Salamah bin Shabib told me, he said I heard Abd al-Razzaq say: "By Allah, my chest has never been open to preferring Ali over Abu Bakr and Umar. May Allah have mercy on Abu Bakr, may Allah have mercy on Umar, may Allah have mercy on Uthman, and may Allah have mercy on Ali. And whoever does not love them, then he is not a believer. Indeed, the most trustworthy of my deeds is my love for them."
1547 - And my father told me, he said Sufyan told us, he said: Ash'ath Aghbar performed Hajj from Kufa multiple times, assuming Ihram from there.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1548 - And he informed me who heard Abu Ishaq say: "Indeed, he is from the remnants." Sufyan said: "And who was like him in his recitation of the Quran and his prayer?"—meaning Ata bin al-Sa'ib.
1549 - I heard my father say: I heard Sufyan say: The Kufans said: "He went out during the 'Ashr' (the ten days)"—meaning Al-Husain bin Ali.
1550 - My father told me, he said Sufyan told us, he said: Al-Hasan used to say: "We did not see anyone better than him"—meaning Uthman bin Abi al-A'as.
1551 - My father told me, he said Sufyan told us, he said: Ibn Umar was twenty years old on the day the Messenger of Allah, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, entered the Kaaba.
1552 - My father told me, he said Sufyan told us, on the authority of Mis'ar, he said: I said to Habib: "Are these more knowledgeable or those?" He said: "Those"—meaning the people of Hijaz.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1553 - My father told me, he said Sufyan told us, on the authority of Mis'ar, on the authority of Muharib, he said: We accompanied Al-Qasim, and he surpassed us in three things: Generosity of the soul, length of silence... and my father forgot the third.
1554 - My father told me, he said Sufyan told us, on the authority of Mis'ar, on the authority of Habib bin Abi Thabit, on the authority of Tawus, he said: I never saw anyone oppose Ibn Abbas except that he would leave him having affirmed him (accepted his view).
1555 - My father told me, he said Sufyan said: I told Mis'ar the hadith of Abu al-Zinad: "A man should not pray in a single garment with nothing of it upon his shoulder." So he said: "How knowledgeable Hammad was!" He said: Hammad, from Ibrahim: "They used to dislike baring the shoulders."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text: 1556 - My father said: Sufyan said: Shu'bah said to me: "I do not narrate a hadith better than this"—meaning the hadith of Ali: "The Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, was not prevented from reading the Quran by anything unless he was Junub (sexually impure)."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1557 - My father told me, he said Sufyan told us, on the authority of Utbah. My father said: And he mentioned that Abu al-Umais is not Utbah al-Laqqat. I heard from some of the Medinans, on the authority of Ibn al-Zubair, he said: His name is Abdullah bin Uthman—meaning Abu Bakr.
1558 - And it was read to Sufyan: "And regarding him was revealed: {As for he who gives and fears Allah, and believes in the best reward}" [Al-Layl: 5-6].
1559 - My father told me, he said Sufyan told us, on the authority of Umar bin Sa'id, on the authority of his father, he said: I came to Shaqiq bin Salamah while I was a man [adult], so he said: "From whom are you?" I said: "From Bani Thawr." He said: "Many a friend I had from Bani Thawr." So I thought he meant him [my father?]. I said: "Are you older or Rabi'?" He said: "I am older in birth, but he was greater than me in intellect."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1560 - My father told me, he said Sufyan told us, he said: They told me from Ibrahim bin Muhajir—but I did not ask him until he died—he heard from Ziyad bin Hudayr: "I was the first to take tithes, and I did not take tithes from a Muslim nor a covenanted person (Mu'ahid)."
1561 - My father told me, he said Sufyan told us, he said: It was mentioned on the authority of Adam bin Ali. He said: And I saw him, but I did not hear from him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1562 - My father told me, he said Sufyan told us, on the authority of a man from the people of Kufa: Amir was asked when death approached him: They said: "What do you command us?" He said: "I am not a scholar, nor am I leaving a scholar behind; and indeed Abu Husayn is a righteous man."
1563 - My father told me, he said Ibn Uyainah told us, he said a man told us that Abd al-Razzaq heard from Ma'mar, from Zaid bin Aslam, from Ali bin Husain, who said: "Whatever water splashes onto the Junub (impure person), it is pure."
1564 - Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaibah told us, he said Ibn al-Mubarak told us, on the authority of Ma'mar, on the authority of Zaid bin Aslam, on the authority of Ali bin Husain, similar to it.
1565 - My father told me, he said Sufyan bin Uyainah told us, on the authority of Yunus—meaning Ibn Abi Ishaq—he said: I heard Al-Sha'bi say: "If you were to feed me mouthfuls of Khabis (sweetmeat), I would have gotten bored. Yet there is no gathering more beloved to me than his, and when I sit upon his carpet/rug, it is more beloved to me than his [the sweetmeat's]." Sufyan said: Qabisah was from the students of Zaid—meaning Ibn Thabit; he narrated the laws of inheritance (Fara'id) from him.
1566 - I heard my father say: I heard Sufyan say: They used to ask her about sales—meaning Amrah.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1567 - My father told me, he said: It was said to Sufyan another time: "Yahya bin Sa'id used to say..." So he said: "They used to ask her about sales"—meaning Amrah.
1568 - My father said: It reached me from Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi that he said: The limit of a man's knowledge is to look into the opinion of Abu Hanifa—he says: incapacity regarding knowledge.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1569 - I heard my father say regarding the hadith of Al-A'mash, from Ibrahim, from the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, regarding laughter in prayer. Waki' said: Al-A'mash said: "I think Ibrahim mentioned it." And Ibn Mahdi said: Sufyan said: "Al-A'mash did not hear the hadith of Ibrahim regarding laughter." My father said: We heard that Ibrahim heard it from Abu Hashim al-Rummani. My father said: And Ibn Abi Dhi'b narrated it from Al-Zuhri, from the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, as Mursal.
1570 - My father said: And they mentioned that Al-Zuhri said: "Sulaiman bin Arqam told me." He said: And Sulaiman is worth nothing; hadith is not narrated from him.
1571 - I asked my father about Salamah bin Kuhayl and Habib bin Abi Thabit: "Which of them is more beloved to you and more established in hadith?" He said: "Salamah bin Kuhayl is more established in hadith than Habib bin Abi Thabit."
1572 - My father told me, he said Ishaq bin Isa al-Tabba' told us, he said: The books of Ibn Lahi'ah were burned in the year sixty-nine. He said: And I met him in the year sixty-four—meaning Ibn Lahi'ah. Ishaq said: And Ibn Lahi'ah died in the year seventy-four or seventy-three.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1573 - My father told me, he said: And Ibn Ulayyah said: I said to Ibn Awn: "Indeed Hisham al-Dastawa'i..." and I mentioned his righteousness and virtue, and mentioned him with good, "except that he holds something of [the doctrine of] Qadar (free will)." So Ibn Awn turned his face away from me when I mentioned Qadar.
1574 - I heard my father say: They say that Ibn Ulayyah heard from Layth bin Abi Sulaim in Basra while he was young.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1575 - I heard my father say: Hajjaj al-A'war heard the Tafsir from Ibn Jurayj in Al-Hashimiyyah—which is before Kufa—via audition (Sama'). He heard both Tafsirs entirely. Hajjaj said: "Long hadiths I heard from him via audition, and the rest via presentation ('Ard), and other hadiths as well."
1576 - I heard my father mention Jamil bin Zaid, he said: Abu Bakr bin Ayyash said: I said to Jamil bin Zaid: "Are these hadiths the hadiths of Ibn Umar?" He said: "I did not hear from Ibn Umar. Rather, they told me: 'When you arrive in Medina, write the hadiths of Ibn Umar.' He said: So I arrived and wrote them."
1577 - Sa'dan bin Yazid al-Bazzaz told me, he said Abu Salih al-Farra told me, he said I heard Yusuf bin Asbat say: A man said to Sufyan al-Thawri: "It has reached us that you hate Uthman." He was horrified and said: "No, by Allah, nor Mu'awiyah."
1578 - Some of our companions told us, he said Ahmad bin Nasr al-Khuza'i told me, he said I asked Al-Nadr bin Shumail about the hadith of Huraith bin al-Sa'ib. He said: "Between the obedient (Muti') and the one turning away (Mudbir)/disobedient (Asi)."
1579 - I asked him about Bukayr bin Amir. He said: He is not strong in hadith.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1580 - I heard my father say: Shu'bah heard from Al-A'mash and from Abu Ishaq before Sufyan, and he heard from them earlier, during the lifetime of Al-Hakam bin Utaybah.
1581 - My father told me, he said Ishaq al-Tabba' told us, he said: I asked Malik bin Anas about what some of the people of Medina are lenient about regarding singing. He said: "Only the immoral (Fussaq) do that among us."
1582 - My father told me, he said Ishaq bin al-Tabba' told us, he said: I asked Malik bin Anas, I said: "Has it reached you that Ibn Umar said to Nafi': 'Do not lie against me as Ikrimah lied against Ibn Abbas'?" He said: "No, but it has reached me that Sa'id bin al-Musayyib said that to Burd, his Mawla."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1583 - My father told me, he said: Ibrahim bin Sa'd told us, he said: Most of my knowledge is that Ibrahim mentioned it from his father, he said: Sa'id bin al-Musayyib said to a Mawla of his called Burd: 'Do not lie about me just as Ikrimah lies about Ibn Abbas.' 1584 - My father said: Ya'qub told us the same from his father, from his father, from Ibn al-Musayyib, the like of it, and he did not doubt it.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1585 - My father told me, he said: Ishaq bin al-Tabba' told us, he said: I saw Malik bin Anas criticizing argumentation and debating in religion. He said: 'Is it that every time a man is more argumentative than another, we should reject what Jibril brought to the Prophet (peace be upon him)?' 1586 - My father told me, he said: Ishaq bin Isa al-Tabba' told us, he said: Malik bin Anas told me, he said: I met Ibn Shihab one day at the place of funerals while he was on a mule of his. I asked him about a hadith that was long, and he narrated it to me. He said: I held the bridle of his mule, but I did not memorize it. I said: 'O Abu Bakr, repeat it to me.' He refused. I said: 'Did you not use to love for hadith to be repeated to you?' So he repeated it to me, and I memorized it. 1587 - My father told me, he said: Ishaq al-Tabba' told us, he said: I heard Malik bin Anas criticizing haste in matters one day, then he said: 'Ibn Umar learned Al-Baqarah in eight years.' 1588 - My father told me, he said: Ishaq bin Isa al-Tabba' told us, he said: I saw Malik bin Anas not dyeing [his hair]. I asked him about his abandoning of dyeing. He said: 'It reached me that Ali used to not dye.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1589 - My father told me, he said: Ishaq bin Isa al-Tabba' told us, he said: I saw Malik bin Anas with a full mustache; his mustache had two tails. I asked him about that, and he said: Zaid bin Aslam told me from Amir bin Abdullah bin al-Zubayr from his father that Umar bin al-Khattab, when a matter distressed him, would twist his mustache and blow. So he gave me a verdict based on the hadith. 1590 - My father said: I saw Abdah bin Sulaiman al-Kilabi with a boy dictating hadith to him from his tablets. When he finished, he said to him: 'Read it.' He did not do well. So he said to him: 'Erase it.' Then he dictated to him until he mastered reading it. My father praised him well and mentioned him with good.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1591 - My father said: Mutarrif and Firas do not have Isnad (chains of transmission). Ibn Abi Khalid has more Isnad than them. Firas is only [narrating from] Al-Sha'bi and Attiyah, and Mutarrif also does not have Isnad. 1592 - My father said: Ismail bin Abi Khalid is the highest of Al-Sha'bi's companions, and he narrates from ten of Al-Sha'bi's companions about Al-Sha'bi, such as Bayan, Firas, and others. 1593 - And my father was asked about Zakariyya bin Abi Za'idah and Firas. He said: Zakariyya bin Abi Za'idah narrates from Firas, but Zakariyya and Ibn Abi al-Safar... It was said to him: 'Ibn Abi al-Safar and Firas?' He said: Both are trustworthy (Thiqah). And Zakariyya is good in hadith (Salih al-Hadith), trustworthy. 1594 - And he was asked about Thawr al-Dili. He said: Malik bin Anas narrated from him; he is good in hadith. [He was asked about] Thawr bin Yazid. He said: He used to hold the view of Al-Qadar, [but] he is trustworthy in hadith.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1595 - He was asked about Abu Ma'shar and Ibrahim bin Muhajir. He said: Abu Ma'shar is more esteemed in my heart than Ibrahim bin Muhajir. 1596 - I heard him say regarding the hadith of Abu Mu'awiyah from Al-A'mash from Sulaiman bin Maysarah from Tariq bin Shihab from Salman, who said: 'A man entered Paradise because of a fly (*Dhubab*).' Abu Mu'awiyah said: Al-A'mash said *Dabab*, meaning that Salman had a speech impediment (foreign accent) in his tongue.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1597 - I asked my father about singing. He said: Abdullah said: 'Singing grows hypocrisy in the heart just as water grows herbs and crops.' 1598 - Abu Abd al-Rahman said: My father dyed [his hair] when he was sixty-three. 1599 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us from Musa bin Qays al-Hadrami from Hujr bin Anbas regarding His saying, Glorious and Exalted: {Muka'an wa Tasdiyah}. He said: *Al-Muka'* is clapping, *Al-Tasdiyah* is whistling.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1600 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Adam told us, he said: Musa bin Qays told us from Hujr bin Anbas, he said: *Al-Muka'* is whistling, and *Al-Tasdiyah* is placing his hand over his mouth. 1601 - My father told me, he said: Abu Nu'aym told us, he said: Musa bin Qays told us from Hujr bin Anbas, and he had witnessed the [Battle of the] Camel with Ali, he said: *Al-Muka'* is whistling. My father said: Waki' erred in it; Yahya bin Adam and Abu Nu'aym were correct. 1602 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us from Salamah from Al-Dahhak, he said: *Al-Muka'* is clapping and *Al-Tasdiyah* is whistling. 1603 - My father told us, he said: Abu Nu'aym told us, he said: Salamah bin Nabit told us from his father, and he had seen the Prophet (peace be upon him), he said: *Al-Muka'* is whistling. My father said: Waki' erred and Abu Nu'aym was correct.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1604 - My father told me, he said: I heard Waki' mention Salamah bin Nabit, and he said: Abu Firas Salamah bin Nabit told us, and he was trustworthy (Thiqah). 1605 - My father told me, he said: I heard Waki' say regarding a hadith he mentioned: 'How is this, O Abdullah bin Abi Shaybah?' As if he wanted to ask him or verify it. 1606 - I heard my father mention Musa bin Qays al-Hadrami, and he said: I know nothing but good. 1607 - My father told me, he said: Mu'awiyah bin Hisham told us, he said: Sufyan told us from Mansur from Mujahid and Ibrahim that they disliked blood [killing], meaning during Fitnah (tribulation). 1608 - My father told me, he said: Mu'awiyah bin Hisham told us from Sufyan from Ismail bin Abi Khalid that Shuraih married off Masruq without him proposing (Khutbah). 1609 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Adam told us, he said: Hammad bin Zaid told us from Yahya bin Atiq from Muhammad bin Sirin, he said: I used to meet Ubaydah at the outskirts, so I would ask him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1610 - My father told me, he said: Muhammad bin al-Sabah told us, he said: Sinan bin Harun told us from Al-Sha'bi, he said: I saw Umm al-Hasan coming to the mosque on Friday and praying. 1611 - My father told me, he said: Sulaiman bin Harb told us, he said: Hammad bin Zaid told us, he said: It was said to Ayyub: 'Did you see Jabir bin Zaid?' He said: 'Yes, I saw him; he was intelligent, intelligent, intelligent.' 1612 - I heard my father say: A Sheikh from the people of Nishapur came to us, and I heard him narrating from Muqatil bin Hayyan from Al-Hasan from Jabir: 'I saw the Prophet (peace be upon him) perform ablution and run his fingers through his beard as if they were the teeth of a comb.' Then my father said: I do not think this Sheikh was anything [reliable]; he weakened him greatly. Abdullah said: Some Sheikhs told us this; he said: Asram al-Naysaburi told us, and he mentioned this hadith.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1613 - My father told me, he said: Affan told us, he said: Mubarak bin Fadalah told us, he said: I heard Al-Hasan say: Abdullah bin Qudamah told me from Al-Sa'di, and Al-Sa'di was a truthful man. 1614 - My father told me, he said: Abu Nu'aym told us, he said: Al-A'mash told us, he said: Mas'ud Abu Razin told us. 1615 - My father said: I heard from Abbad bin Abbad, and Zuhair Abu Khaythamah did not hear from him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1616 - I asked my father about Al-Hasan bin al-Khallal, the one called Al-Hulwani. He said: I do not know him seeking hadith, and I did not see him seeking hadith. I said: He mentioned that he was adhering to Yazid bin Harun. He said: I do not know him, except that he came to me here to greet me. And my father did not praise him. Then he said: Things reach me about him that I dislike. And I did not see him taking him lightly. And my father said another time when he mentioned him: The people of the frontier (Al-Thaghr) are not pleased with him, or words to this effect. 1617 - I asked him about Thabit al-Makki. He said: I do not know anyone who narrated from him other than Amr bin Dinar. 1618 - I asked him about Kulthum bin Ubaidullah. He said: I do not know him. 1619 - I asked him about Jundub bin al-Hajjaj. He said: Yusuf bin Sa'd narrated from him. 1620 - I heard him say: Nafi' bin Sarjis, I know nothing but good; Ibn Khuthaym narrated from him. 1621 - I asked him about Jamil bin Murrah. He said: This is a Basran Sheikh; I know nothing but good.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1622 - My father told me, he said: Abd al-Samad told us, he said: Imran al-Qattan told us, he said: Ammar bin Abi Ammar, the Mawla of Banu Hashim, told us, he said: I saw Abu Qatadah wearing silk/wool blend (Khazz).

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1623 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Adam told us, he said: Hasan bin Salih told us from Musa bin Abi Aisha, he said: I saw Ibn al-Zubayr standing in prayer having aligned his feet. 1624 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Adam told us, he said: Ibn Idris told us, he said: I heard Al-A'mash reading {Fayushitakum} [20:61] raising the Ya'. So I mentioned it to Aban bin Taghlib, and he said: Al-A'mash used to not read it except {Fayushitakum}, but the grammarians asked him so they turned him away from it. He said: So I mentioned that to Al-A'mash, and he said: I heard Yahya bin Wathab reading it {Fayushitakum} raising the Ya', but Aban read to Talhah bin Musarrif after me, so it got confused for him. 1625 - My father told me, he said: Ishaq bin Isa told us, he said: I narrated to Hammad bin Zaid the hadith of Jarir bin Hazim from Thabit from Anas, who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'If prayer is established, do not stand until you see me.' He denied it and said: He only heard it from Hajjaj al-Sawwaf from Yahya from Abdullah bin Abi Qatadah from his father in the sitting of Thabit, so he thought that he heard it—meaning from Thabit.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1626 - I heard my father say: Abu al-Rabi' al-Samman used to narrate this hadith from Abu Bishr. Shu'bah said to him—he denied it from him and said: 'This is nothing.' And he denied it from him. So Hushaym said to him: 'I heard it myself from Abu Bishr.' He said: 'This is only the hadith of Al-Minhal bin Amr from Sa'id bin Jubayr from Ibn Umar.' So when Hushaym narrated it, he fell silent. 1627 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym narrated it to us, he said: Abu Bishr informed us from Sa'id bin Jubayr, he said: I went out with Ibn Umar from his house, and we passed by some youths of Quraysh who had set up a bird and were shooting at it, and they had set for the owner of the bird every arrow of theirs that missed. He said: When they saw Ibn Umar, they dispersed. So Ibn Umar said: 'Who did this? May Allah curse the one who did this. Verily, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) cursed the one who takes something with a soul as a target.' 1628 - I asked my father about Ja'far bin Yazid. He said: I do not know him. 1629 - I asked him about Ja'far bin Iyad. He said: I do not recall him. 1630 - I asked him about Ja'far bin Atiyyah. He said: I do not know him. 1631 - I asked him about Ja'far bin Nahar al-Abdi. He said: I have an idea of him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1632 - I asked him about Ja'far bin Uthman. He said: I do not know him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1633 - Muhammad bin Abd al-Aziz bin Abi Rizmah told us from Muhammad bin Nasr from Ibn al-Mubarak, he said: 'The assumption of Aktham is like the certainty of others.' Abu Abd al-Rahman said: When Yahya bin Aktham heard from Ibn al-Mubarak, he was young. His father made a feast and invited the people, then he said: 'Bear witness that this one heard from Ibn al-Mubarak while he was young.' 1634 - My father told me, he said: Abu Damrah Anas bin Iyad al-Madini told us, he said: Rabi'ah bin Abi Abd al-Rahman told me, he said: 'I saw Sheikhs in Madinah having braids/locks, wearing dyed garments and rose-colored [clothes], carrying staffs in their hands, and having traces of henna on their hands in the fashion of youths, but the religion of one of them was further than the Pleiades if his religion was sought.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1635 - My father told me, he said: Abu Damrah told us, he said: Abu Hazim said: 'Religion will remain strong as long as these desires do not fall into the rulers (Sultans), for they are the ones who defend the people. If it falls into them, then who will defend them?' 1636 - I asked my father about Uqbah bin Abi Aisha. He said: I do not recall—meaning knowing him. 1637 - And I asked him about Uqbah bin Abd al-Ghafir. He said: Basran; Qatadah narrated from him. 1638 - I said to him: Uqbah bin Wassaj? He said: Basran; Qatadah narrated from him. 1639 - I asked him about Uqbah bin Yasar. He said: I do not know him. 1640 - I asked him about Uqbah bin Nafi'. He said: I do not recall knowing him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1641 - And I asked him about Uqbah bin Abi Jasrah. He said: The Basrans narrate from him; Sufyan al-Thawri narrated from him. 1642 - I asked him about Uqbah bin Fakih. He said: I do not know. 1643 - I asked him about Uqbah al-Asadi. He said: He narrates from Abu Wa'il. I said: Is he trustworthy? He said: I do not know how much he narrates from this one. Then he said: Sufyan al-Thawri narrated from him. 1644 - I asked him about Uqbah bin Zabyan. He said: I do not recall him—meaning knowing him. 1645 - I asked him about Uqbah bin Abd al-Rahman. He said: I do not know. 1646 - I asked him about Uqbah bin Ziyad. He said: I do not recall knowing him. 1647 - I asked him about Umar bin Kaysan al-San'ani. He said: They narrate from him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1648 - I asked him about Umar bin Humayd. He said: I do not know. 1649 - I asked him about Umar bin Atiyyah. He said: I do not know him. 1650 - I asked him about Umar bin Yazid al-Abdi. He said: I do not know him. 1651 - I asked him about Umar bin Nu'aym. He said: I do not recall him. 1652 - I asked him about Umar bin Dinar al-Asadi. He said: I do not know him. 1653 - I heard him say: The beard of Sufyan bin Uyaynah was somewhat long.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1654 - I said to him: Do you know Umarah bin Ubaid bin Tu'aymah? He said: I do not know him. 1655 - I asked him about Umarah al-Khurasani. He said: I do not recall knowing him. 1656 - I asked him about Salih bin Musa al-Talhi. He said: I do not know—as if he did not approve of him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1657 - I asked him about Abu al-Muhayya Yahya bin Ya'la. He said: "He is Kufan," and remained silent about him. Then he said: "I do not know"—meaning how his hadith is.
1658 - I heard him say: Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaibah is truthful and trustworthy (Saduq Thiqah).
1659 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Adam told us, he said Abu Shihab told us, on the authority of Al-A'mash, on the authority of Ibrahim, he said: He used not to consider anything equal to the saying of Amr and Abdullah if they agreed. If they disagreed, the saying of Abdullah was more pleasing to him because it was more subtle.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1660 - I heard my father say: Ibn al-Ashja'i gave us some of his father's books, so we copied from the book of Al-Ashja'i, on the authority of Sufyan, on the authority of Wasil, on the authority of the daughter of Al-Ma'rur, on the authority of Al-Ma'rur, who said: I heard Umar say: "Whoever calls to a leadership without consultation of the Muslims, then strike his neck."
1661 - My father told me, he said Affan told us, he said Abu Hilal told us, on the authority of Matar regarding the saying of Allah Almighty {Cursed be the conjecturers} [Adh-Dhariyat: 10]. He said: "The people of fabrication and lies."
1662 - I asked him about Salem bin Abi Asim al-Thaqafi. He said: "I do not know him."
1663 - I asked him about Salem bin Rashid Abu Jami' al-Hujaimi. He said: "Abd al-Samad narrated to us from him."
1664 - I asked him about Salem bin Shaddad al-Abdi. He said: "I do not know him."
1665 - I asked him about Salem bin Mikhraq. He said: "I do not recall knowing him."
1666 - I asked him about Mughirah bin Yazid. He said: "I do not know him."
1667 - I asked him about Muslim bin Sam'an. He said: "He has been narrated from."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1668 - I asked him about Yunus bin Mismar. He said: "Who narrates from him?" As if he did not know him. I said to him: "How is his hadith?" He said: "I do not know."
1669 - I asked him about Ayyub bin Musa. He said: "Trustworthy (Thiqah)."
1670 - I asked him about Uthman al-Shahham. He said: "There is no harm in him."
1671 - My father said: Qurrah bin Khalid, his Kunyah is Abu Khalid, is a trustworthy Sheikh.
1672 - I asked him about Muhammad bin Abi Uyainah. He said: "He is narrated from."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text: 1673 - My father said: Shu'bah used to deny that Mujahid heard from Aisha. And Yahya bin Sa'id said regarding the hadith of Musa al-Juhani from Mujahid "Aisha came out to us" or "Aisha told me," Yahya bin Sa'id said: I narrated it to Shu'bah, and he denied that Mujahid heard from Aisha.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1674 - My father told me, he said Ishaq bin Ibrahim al-Razi told us, he said Salamah bin al-Fadl told us, he said Muhammad bin Ishaq told me, he said: I saw Abu Salamah bin Abd al-Rahman taking a boy by the hand from the school, taking him to the house to dictate hadith to him so he could write it for him.
1675 - And I asked him about Wasil Mawla Abi Uyainah. He said: "Trustworthy."
1676 - I asked him about Abd al-Hamid bin al-Hasan al-Hilali. He said: "I do not know him."
1677 - I asked him about Hammad bin Waqid al-Saffar. He said: "I do not know him."
1678 - I asked him about Asbat bin Nasr. He said: "I did not write anything of his hadith from anyone, and I did not see him [my father] acknowledge him." Then he said: "Waki' and Abu Nu'aym narrate from the Sheikhs of Kufa, but I did not see them narrate from him."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1679 - I asked him about Muhammad bin Jahadah. He said: "Trustworthy. Shu'bah and Abd al-Warith narrated from him. Abd al-Warith narrated the most from him. And Hammam narrates from him."
1680 - I heard him say: "There was a righteous man who only passed in hadith due to his righteousness because he made many mistakes." I said to him: "Who is he?" He said: "Zaid bin al-Hubab."
1681 - I heard my father say: A Sheikh from whom Abbas bin al-Fadl narrates, called Sulaiman Abu Muhammad—and he is al-Qafla'i—narrates from Al-Hasan and Muhammad regarding Quranic readings. He said: "I only see him as weak in hadith." My father said: "They claimed he used to come to Hammad bin Salamah and say 'Hammad, Qais bin Sa'd told us from Ata', so he would write it, then say 'I heard it from Ata'." My father said: "He had heard from Ata, but I see him as nothing [worthless]."
1682 - I heard my father say: Aban al-Attar is more established than Imran al-Qattan.
1683 - I heard my father say: Ismail bin Umar would sometimes pray until his feet swelled.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1684 - I asked my father about Yahya bin Abi Kathir, whose son is he? He said: "He was named to me, but I forgot."
1685 - I said to him: Abu Salamah bin Abd al-Rahman, what is his name? He said: "I do not know."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1686 - I heard my father say: "I used to wish, or I desired, to hear ten thousand [hadiths] from Abd al-Rahman before I heard from him—meaning anything." Then he said: "What we wrote from Abd al-Rahman, along with what I presented to him from the hadith of Malik, amounts to ten thousand or more."
1687 - My father told me, he said Ibn Abi Ghaniyah told us, on the authority of his father, on the authority of Al-Hakam, that the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, ruled for compensation (Fidyah) for a slap.
1688 - My father told me, he said Abu Qatan Amr bin al-Haitham told us, he said: I read to Malik: Aisha bint Sa'd, that they had a tub into which water was poured, and her father and the people of the house would perform ablution from it.
1689 - My father told me, he said Hajjaj bin Muhammad told us, he said: I saw Yahya bin Sa'id—meaning al-Ansari—judging in his house and judging in the mosque. And I saw Ibn Abi Layla judging in the mosque. And I saw Uthman bin Umar—meaning al-Taimi—judging in his house. My father said: This one was a judge in Basra, and Sawwar used to judge in his house.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1690 - My father told me, he said Hajjaj told us, he said Abu Isra'il informed me, he said: I saw Al-Sha'bi judging at the Elephant Gate (Bab al-Fil).
1691 - My father told me, he said Hajjaj told us, he said I asked Ibn Shubrumah, I said to him: "How do you perform Takbir on Friday when we do not hear the Imam narrate the Takbir?" He said: "Estimate the Takbir of the Imam."
1692 - I asked my father about Abu Zaid al-Harawi. He said: "A trustworthy Sheikh, there is no harm in him. I did not write anything from him," and he began to express regret over [missing] him.
1693 - I heard him say: Shu'bah heard one hadith from Yazid bin al-Bara bin Azib.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1694 - I heard my father say: These are the questions of Ubaidullah al-Qawariri to Hushaym, joined [chains]: Mughirah from Ibrahim, Yunus from Al-Hasan, and Abd al-Malik from Ata. He had some influence with Hushaym, so he would ask him.
1695 - My father told me, he said Muhammad bin Abi Bakr al-Muqaddami wrote to me mentioning from Sa'id bin Amir, from Salam bin Abi Muti': {And make us Muslims [submitting] to You} [Al-Baqarah: 128]. He said: "They were Muslims, but they asked for steadfastness in the religion." Abu Abd al-Rahman said: I came to Basra and asked Muhammad bin Abi Bakr about it, so he narrated it to me. And I narrated it to Uthman al-Muqaddami bin Abi Bakr, and he said: "I did not hear it from my father," so I dictated it to him.
1696 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, on the authority of Ibn Awn, on the authority of Ibn Sirin, that he disliked saying "the most of something."
1697 - My father told me, he said Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi told me, on the authority of Hammad bin Salamah, on the authority of Qatadah, on the authority of Umm al-Hudhail, on the authority of Aisha, she said: "We did not consider yellowish or brownish discharge after purification as anything." My father said: It is actually Qatadah, from Hafsa, from Umm Atiyyah.
1698 - My father said: Husayn is older than Mansur.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1699 - My father told me, he said Al-Aswad bin Amir told us, he said Sufyan al-Thawri told us, on the authority of Asim, on the authority of Umm al-Hudhail—my father said she is Hafsa bint Sirin—on the authority of Anas, he said: "Kohl is odd-numbered."
1700 - I heard him say: Abu Shaibah, from whom Abbad bin al-Awwam narrated to us, I do not know who he is. I do not know anyone who narrated from him other than Abbad.
1701 - My father told me, he said Abbad bin al-Awwam told us, he said Abu Shaibah informed us, on the authority of Ikrimah, he said: Ibn Abbas used to sleep between two slave girls.
1702 - I heard him say: Zaid bin Hubab is trustworthy, there is no harm in him.
1703 - I said to him: Hajjaj al-Hamdani. He said: "I do not recall knowing him."
1704 - I asked him about Al-Hajjaj bin Zaid. He said: "I do not know him."
1705 - I heard my father say: Ubaid bin Nadilah, his Kunyah is Abu Mu'awiyah.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1706 - I heard my father say: There was a lisp in Abu Yusuf, so he would narrate to us saying: "Mutarrif bin Tarif al-Harithi told us," but as he was lisped [it sounded like]: "Mutayyif bin Tayif al-Hayithi."
1707 - I heard my father say: The People of Opinion (Ahl al-Ra'y), hadith is not narrated from them.
1708 - I heard my father say: Muhammad bin Fudayl bin Iyad related, he said: A severe famine befell us in Kufa, and I was hungry that day. Ibn al-Mubarak came and entered Kufa, so I went to him. When he saw [me], he said: "How is Abu Ali?" Then he came to the house. He said: He saw nothing in the house. He said: So he went and sent clothes and two thousand Dirhams. He said: So Fudayl used them to move to Mecca.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1709 - My father used to see no harm in writing from these Sheikhs and approved of them. And he narrated to us from some of them; among them were Al-Haitham bin Kharijah, Muhammad bin al-Sabah, Al-Hakam bin Musa, Yahya bin Ayyub, Surayj, Muhammad bin Bakkar, Amr al-Naqid, and Muhriz bin Awn.
1710 - I read to my father and he acknowledged it: Abu Sa'id Mawla Bani Hashim said, Isra'il told us, on the authority of Ishaq, on the authority of Sa'id bin Jubayr, he said: It was said to Ibn Abbas: "Like whom were you [in age] on the day the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, passed away?" He said: "I was circumcised on that day."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1711 - I heard my father say regarding the hadith of Abu Bishr, from Sa'id bin Jubayr, from Ibn Abbas: "The Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, passed away while I was a boy of ten years, having read the Muhkam." My father said: "To me, this is a flimsy (wahi) hadith." I think he said "weak."
1712 - I asked him about the hadith of Ibn Idris, from his father, from Abu Ishaq, from Sa'id bin Jubayr, from Ibn Abbas: "The Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, passed away while I was circumcised (Khatin)." My father said: "We have always heard that this is a flimsy hadith."
1713 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, he said Abu Bishr informed us, on the authority of Sa'id bin Jubayr, on the authority of Ibn Abbas, he said: "I collected the Muhkam during the time of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, and the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, passed away while I was a boy of ten years (Hijjas)." He said: I said: "What is the Muhkam?" He said: "The Mufassal." Yahya bin Aktham dictated to them at the camp: "So he said 'a boy of ten'." My father said: "No, a boy of fifteen."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1714 - I read to my father and he acknowledged it: Abu Sa'id Mawla Bani Hashim said, Shu'bah told us, he said Abu Ishaq told us, on the authority of Sa'id bin Jubayr, he said: The Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, passed away and Ibn Abbas was a boy of fifteen years.
1715 - I heard my father say: The hadith of Shu'bah seems to agree with the hadith of Al-Zuhri, from Ubaidullah, from Ibn Abbas: "I came on a female donkey and I had neared puberty." My father said: Abd al-Rahman narrated it to us, from Malik, from Al-Zuhri, from Ubaidullah, from Ibn Abbas. My father said: And Ya'qub narrated it to us, from the nephew of Al-Zuhri, from his uncle, he said: "I neared puberty."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text: 1716 - I saw my father choosing the hadith of Al-Zuhri and liking it, and he said: It agrees with the hadith of Shu'bah from Abu Ishaq. My father said: Ibn Abbas says "I spent the night with the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him," and he narrates these hadiths from him: "I heard the Prophet," "I heard the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1717 - Abu Abd al-Rahman said: I counted what Ibn Abbas said: "I heard the Prophet," and "I saw the Prophet," and "I spent the night with the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him," and they are eighty or seventy-something.
1718 - My father told me, he said Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi told us, he said Malik told us, on the authority of Al-Zuhri, on the authority of Ubaidullah, on the authority of Ibn Abbas, he said: "I came while the Messenger of Allah, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, was praying at Mina, and I was on a donkey. I left it in front of the row and entered the prayer. I had neared puberty, and he did not criticize that."
1719 - My father told me, he said: I read this hadith to Abd al-Rahman: He said: "I came riding on a female donkey, and that day I had neared puberty, while the Messenger of Allah, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, was leading the people in prayer. I passed in front of some of the row, then I got down and sent the female donkey away, and I entered the row, and he did not disapprove of that from anyone."
1720 - My father told me, he said Waki' told us, he said Shu'bah told us, on the authority of Abu Bishr, on the authority of Sa'id bin Jubayr, on the authority of Ibn Abbas, he said: "The Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, passed away and I was a boy of ten years, circumcised, having read the Muhkam of the Quran."
1721 - My father told me, he said Abd al-Razzaq told us, he said Ma'mar and Abd al-A'la told us, on the authority of Ma'mar, on the authority of Al-Zuhri, on the authority of Ubaidullah bin Abdullah bin Utbah, on the authority of Ibn Abbas, he said: "I came to the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, during the Farewell Pilgrimage—or he said on the Day of the Opening [of Mecca]—and Al-Fadl and I were riding pillion on a female donkey. We cut through the row and got down from it, then we entered the row, and the female donkey passed in front of them, and it did not interrupt their prayer." Abd al-A'la said: "I was riding pillion behind Al-Fadl on a female donkey, and we came while the Prophet of Allah, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, was leading the people in prayer at Mina."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1722 - My father told me, he said Sulaiman bin Dawud told us, he said Shu'bah told us, on the authority of Abu Ishaq, he said I heard Sa'id bin Jubayr narrating from Ibn Abbas, he said: "The Messenger of Allah, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, passed away and I was a boy of fifteen years."
1723 - My father told me, he said Ya'qub told us, he said my father told us, on the authority of Muhammad bin Ishaq, he said Al-Hajjaj bin Artah told me, on the authority of Ata bin Abi Rabah, he said: I heard Abdullah bin Abbas say: "The Messenger of Allah, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, passed away while I was circumcised (Khatin)."
1724 - I heard my father say regarding the hadith of Hajjaj bin Artah, on the authority of Amr bin Shu'aib, on the authority of his father, on the authority of his grandfather, he said: A man came to the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, and said: "O Messenger of Allah, a man is absent and cannot find water, can he have intercourse with his wife?" He said: "Yes." My father said: "This is the hadith of Muthanna bin al-Sabbah." It is as if he denied it being from the hadith of Hajjaj.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1725 - Abd al-A'la bin Hammad al-Narsi told me, he said Hammad bin Salamah told us, he said: Hisham bin Hassan claimed on the authority of Muhammad bin Sirin that a man bought a sheep that eats flies, so he took the dispute to Shurayh. Shurayh said: "The fodder is free, and the milk is permissible." I asked my father about this hadith, and he said: "This is the hadith of Al-Mas'udi from Al-Qasim. I do not know it from the hadith of Hisham nor from the hadith of Muhammad from Shurayh." It was as if he denied it.
1726 - My father told me, he said I heard Waki' say: "I forbade Abu Usamah from borrowing people's books."
1727 - My father told me, he said Abd al-Rahman told us, he said: I said—meaning to Sufyan—the saying of Mujahid—meaning regarding this garment dyed with wars and saffron, if it is washed and its color goes—he said: "There is no harm in entering Ihram in it." He said: "From Habib bin Hassan." It was as if he weakened him—meaning Habib bin Hassan.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1728 - My father told me, he said Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi told us, he said: I asked Sufyan about the hadith of Hushaym, from Khalid bin Salamah, from Muhammad bin Amr bin al-Harith, that Uthman led the people in prayer while he was Junub (impure), so he repeated [the prayer] but did not order them to repeat. He said: "I heard it from Khalid bin Salamah, but I do not bring it as I wish [with certainty]."
1729 - Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaibah told us, he said Sufyan bin Uyainah told us, on the authority of Asim al-Ahwal, he said: We brought a book to Ibn Sirin, and he said: "It will not spend the night with me."
1730 - My father told me, he said Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi told us, he said Shu'bah told us, on the authority of Al-Hakam, that Ibn Umar swore regarding a slave of his to divorce his wife, but he refused, so he expiated his oath. Shu'bah said: "I think it reached him—meaning Al-Hakam—from Aban bin Abi Ayyash."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1731 - My father told me, he said: Abu Dawud told us, he said: Al-Hakam b. Atiyyah told us, he said: I asked Al-Hasan about the dog being in the house. He said: Abdullah b. Mughaffal told me from the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him). 1732 - My father told me, he said: Abu Dawud told us, he said: Abu Amir told us from Al-Hasan, he said: We used to enter upon Uthman b. Abi Al-As, and he had a house. 1733 - I heard my father say: Abu Al-Azhar, his name is Salih b. Dirham. I know nothing but good [about him]. Yahya b. Sa'id narrated from him. 1734 - My father told me, he said: Yahya b. Adam told us, he said: Sufyan Al-Thawri told us from Abu Ishaq from Abdullah b. Yazid Al-Ansari, and he had caught [met] the Prophet (peace be upon him).

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1735 - My father told me, he said: Abu Kamil and Al-Hasan b. Musa told us, they said: Zuhayr told us, he said: Abu Ishaq told us that Abdullah b. Yazid Al-Ansari had seen the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him). 1736 - My father told me, he said: Abd al-Rahman b. Mahdi told us, he said: Sufyan told us from Alqamah b. Marthad from Sulayman b. Buraydah from his father, he said: When the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) appointed a commander over an army or expedition, he advised him regarding his specific self to fear Allah, and good for the Muslims who were with him. Then he said: 'Fight in the name of Allah, in the path of Allah, fight those who disbelieve in Allah...' and he mentioned the hadith at length. 1737 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Sufyan told us from Alqamah b. Marthad from Sulayman b. Buraydah from his father, he said: The Prophet (peace be upon him) was... and he mentioned similar to it. Alqamah said: I mentioned it to Muqatil b. Hayyan, so he said: Muslim b. Jahdam told me from Al-Nu'man b. Muqarrin Al-Muzani from the Prophet (peace be upon him) the like of it. My father said: And Hammad b. Salamah said from Aqil b. Talhah from Muslim b. Haysam. My father said: And that is the correct [name], Haysam—meaning in this hadith.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1738 - I heard my father say: Abu Ahmad Al-Zubayri told us, he said: Rizam b. Sa'id told us. My father said: He is trustworthy (Thiqah). How close [to sound] his hadith is. Waki' narrated from him. 1739 - My father told me, he said: Affan told us, he said: Khalifah b. Ghalib told me—[he is] trustworthy, thus said Affan—he said: I asked Aisha bint Sa'd about the Duha prayer. She said: Sa'd used to pray Duha as eight Rak'ahs.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1740 - My father told me, he said: Ibn Mahdi told us from Ibn Abi Hazim, he said: When Umar b. Abd al-Aziz arrived in Sham, he was informed about the book of Zayd regarding blood money (Diyat), so he ordered it and it was burnt. 1741 - My father told me, he said: Yahya b. Adam told us, he said: Hasan b. Ayyash told us from Isma'il b. Abi Khalid, he said: I heard Abu Razin reading {And mention in the Book Moses. Indeed, he was *Mukhlusan*} (chosen) with the Fat'hah on the Lam. 1742 - My father told me, he said: Yahya b. Adam told us, he said: Ibn Al-Mubarak told us from Ibn Jurayj, he said: I heard Mujahid reading in some parts of the Qur'an *Al-Mukhlasin* with the Fat'hah on the Lam. 1743 - I heard my father mention Qurad Abu Nuh, so he said: He was intelligent, among the men [of knowledge], intelligent.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1744 - My father told me, he said: Sakan b. Nafi' Al-Bahili told us, he said: Salih—who is Ibn Abi Al-Akhdar—told us from Al-Zuhri, he said: Urwah said: Abd al-Rahman b. Abd al-Qari informed me—and he was one of Umar's workers, and he used to work for him along with Abdullah b. Al-Arqam over the treasury of the Muslims. 1745 - My father told me, he said: Hasan b. Musa—meaning Al-Ashyab—told us, he said: Shu'bah told us from Amr b. Murrah, he said: I asked Abu Ubaydah: 'Was your father with the Prophet (peace be upon him) on the Night of the Jinn?' He said: 'No, that did not happen.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1746 - My father told me, he said: Hammad b. Mas'adah told us, he said: I saw Sa'd—meaning Ibn Ishaq—on a dark night, having come to the Mosque of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) while on a donkey. 1747 - My father told me, he said: Hammad b. Mas'adah told us from Ibn Awn from Abu Burdah from his father: That he narrated a hadith one day. He said: So I stood up to write it. He asked me, so I informed him. He said: 'Did you write [it] from me?' I said: 'Yes.' He said: 'Bring it to me.' He said: So he erased it. 1748 - My father told me, he said: Arim told us, he said: Mu'tamar told us, he said: My father said: I saw upon Anas b. Malik a burnous made of yellow silk/wool blend (Khazz).

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1749 - My father told me, he said: Ibn Mahdi told us from Ibn Mubarak from Hajjaj from Abd al-Malik b. Umayr, he said: I heard Al-Mughirah b. Shu'bah say: 'No *Gharar* (deception/uncertainty) in Islam.' Abu Abd al-Rahman said: And Yahya b. Adam said: 'No *Gharal* (uncircumcision) in Islam.' 1750 - I heard my father say: I heard that Za'idah said to Zuhayr—or Zuhayr said to Za'idah—and he narrated the hadith of Abu Miskin from Huzayl from Abdullah: 'A man will surely gnaw what is between his fingers' or 'The Fire will surely gnaw them.' One of them said to the other: 'What is wrong with it?' or... 1751 - My father told me, he said: Affan told us, he said: Mu'adh b. Al-Safir told us, he said: My father told me, he said: Daghfal said—my father said: He is the one Al-Hasan narrates from, the very learned scholar in knowledge—: 'There are three characteristics: A bane, a disgrace, and a hardship. Its bane is that you store it and do not narrate it or spread it. Its disgrace is that you narrate it to one who does not retain it or act upon it. And its hardship is that one lies in it.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1752 - My father told me, he said: Khalid b. Khidash told me, he said: Hammad b. Zaid told us from Jarir b. Hazim from Muhammad b. Sirin: That he mentioned Sulayman b. Abd al-Malik and said: 'May Allah have mercy on Sulayman; he opened with good and sealed with good by [appointing] Umar b. Abd al-Aziz.' 1753 - My father told me, he said: Affan told us, he said: Hammad b. Salamah told us from Ali b. Zayd: That some youths from Quraysh proposed to the daughter of Suhayl b. Amr, and Al-Hasan b. Ali proposed to her. She consulted Abu Hurayrah, and he was a friend to her. Abu Hurayrah said: 'I have seen the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) kiss his mouth, so if you are able to kiss where he kissed, then kiss.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1754 - My father told me, he said: Abu Ahmad Al-Zubayri Muhammad b. Abdullah b. Al-Zubayr told us, he said: Sufyan Al-Thawri told us from Hisham b. Urwah from Urwah from Aisha, he said: Safiyyah was among the chosen spoil (Al-Safiy). 1755 - My father told me, he said: Muhammad b. Ja'far told us, he said: Shu'bah told us from Alqamah b. Marthad, he said: I heard Salim b. Razin narrating from Salim b. Abdullah b. Umar from Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib from Ibn Umar from the Prophet (peace be upon him) regarding a man who has a woman (wife), then divorces her, then a man marries her and divorces her before he enters upon her: Is she lawful for the first? He said: 'No, until he tastes the little honey.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1756 - My father told me, he said: Ibn Mahdi told us from Sufyan from Alqamah from Razin Al-Ahmari from Ibn Umar: That the Prophet (peace be upon him) was asked about a man who divorced his wife three times, then a man married her, closed the door, lowered the curtain, and removed the veil, then divorced her before entering upon her; is she lawful for her first husband? He said: 'No, until he tastes her little honey.' 1757 - My father told me, he said: Abu Ahmad told us, he said: Sufyan told us from Alqamah b. Marthad from Sulayman b. Razin from Ibn Umar: similar to it. 1758 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us from Sufyan from Alqamah from Razin b. Sulayman Al-Ahmari from Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib, he said: 'There is no harm in *Salam* (advance payment) regarding food with a known measure for a known term, and there is no harm in *Salam* regarding clothes with a known length for a known term.' And from Razin from Sa'id: 'Do not hasten [payment] for him so he lowers [the price] for you, nor delay for him so he increases [the price] upon you.' My father said: Waki' narrated it once from Sulayman b. Razin. Abu Abd al-Rahman said: Abu Khaythamah narrated it from Waki' from Sufyan from Alqamah, except that Abu Sayyar corrected him. So I asked my father (may Allah have mercy on him) and he said: 'Waki' did say once Sulayman b. Razin, and he said Razin b. Sulayman. This one did not err, and that one did not err.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1759 - My father told me, he said: Humayd Al-Ru'asi told us from Hasan, he said: When Ibn Abi Layla judged regarding something, he did not care after that if he revealed/publicized it. Hasan said: And Mughirah came to me asking me about something from the saying of Ibn Abi Layla—and he was in a dispute with his brother—but he did not inform him. 1760 - My father said: The kunya of Awf b. Malik is Abu Abd al-Rahman. My father told me, he said: Abd al-Rahman b. Mahdi told us from Mu'awiyah—meaning Ibn Salih—from Abd al-Rahman b. Jubayr b. Nufayr from his father from Awf b. Malik, he said: It was said to him: 'O Abu Abd al-Rahman.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1761 - I heard my father say: Among the Companions of the Prophet (peace be upon him) whose kunya is Abu Abd al-Rahman: Abdullah b. Mas'ud is Abu Abd al-Rahman. Mu'adh b. Jabal is Abu Abd al-Rahman. Abdullah b. Umar is Abu Abd al-Rahman. Abdullah b. Amr is Abu Abd al-Rahman—and they also say Abu Muhammad. Mu'awiyah b. Abi Sufyan is Abu Abd al-Rahman. Safinah is Abu Abd al-Rahman. And Fayruz b. Al-Daylami is Abu Abd al-Rahman.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1762 - My father told me, he said: Muhammad b. Al-Hasan b. Atash Al-Abnawi Abu Abdullah told us, he said: Sulayman b. Wahb Al-Abnawi from our Sheikhs told us, he said: Al-Nu'man b. Buzurj told us, he said: Qays said to Fayruz: 'How are you, O Abu Abd al-Rahman?' He said: Abu Abd al-Rahman, Ali used to err regarding him; he used to say Ibn Atas. So they used to say: A Sheikh who saw him [said] he erred in it. 1763 - My father said: Khabbab b. Al-Aratt is Abu Abdullah. In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: Abdullah b. Ahmad informed us, he gave license (Ijazah) and my strongest thought is that I heard it [directly]. 1764 - My father told me, he said: Sufyan told us from Mis'ar from Qays b. Muslim from Tariq b. Shihab, he said: A remnant of the Companions of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) visited Khabbab [in sickness] and greeted him, so they said: 'Rejoice, O Abu Abdullah.' 1764 - My father told me, he said: Abd al-Samad told us, he said: Imran Al-Qattan told us, he said: Al-Hasan told us from Al-Aswad b. Sari'—and he was among the first to preach in this mosque, and he was called Hammad Rabbah (Praiser of his Lord). When the Fitnah occurred, he went to Fars until he died there. He said to them: 'If I see something objectionable (Munkar), I am not a companion to you.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1765 - My father told me, he said: Aswad b. Amir told us, he said: I heard Sharik say: Zubayd, Abu Ishaq, Mansur, Ata, and Layth were in the 'Ata (state stipend). And Husayn. And Sufyan had indeed assumed duties, and I saw him with a sword that he had brought to repair its ornament/hilt... My father said: This was in the days of Banu Umayyah. 1766 - My father told me, he said: Humayd Al-Ru'asi told us from Hasan from Ash'ath, he said: I used to ask Ibn Sirin, and he would say: I do not care if you ask me about what I do not know or about what I know. 1767 - My father said: Abu Tamim Al-Jayshani is Abdullah b. Malik. 1768 - My father told me, he said: Harun b. Ma'ruf told us, he said: Abu Abd al-Rahman Al-Muqri told us, he said: Ibn Lahi'ah told us, he said: Ibn Hubayrah told me, he said: I heard Abu Tamim Abdullah b. Malik Al-Jayshani say: Mu'adh b. Jabal taught me the Qur'an when the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) sent him to Yemen.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1769 - My father told me: Abu Abd al-Rahman Al-Muqri told us, he said: Sa'id—meaning Ibn Abi Ayyub—told us, he said: Yazid b. Abi Habib told me, he said: I heard Abu Al-Khayr say: I saw Abu Tamim Al-Jayshani Abdullah b. Malik. 1770 - My father told me, he said: Bakr b. Isa told us, he said: Thabit b. Zayd Abu Zayd told us from Asim Al-Ahwal that he said: Abdullah b. Sarjis indeed saw the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him). My father said: People say Thabit b. Yazid, and that is the correct one, Abu Zayd. Except Bakr b. Isa and Mu'tamar b. Sulayman, for they said: Thabit b. Zayd Abu Zayd. 1771 - My father told me, he said: Affan told us, he said: Isma'il b. Ibrahim—meaning Ibn Ulayyah—told us, he said: Yunus told us, he said: Sa'id b. Abi Al-Hasan said one day: 'I am the most eloquent of people.' He said: So Al-Hasan said: 'You? If you are able to catch one word against me.' He said: 'Then I catch this one against you.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1772 - My father told me, he said: Affan told us, he said: Wuhaib told us, he said: Dawud told us from Amir, he said: The shrewd men (Duhat) of this Ummah are four: Mu'awiyah, Amr b. Al-As, Mughirah b. Shu'bah, and Ziyad. 1773 - My father told me, he said: Hasan b. Musa told us, he said: Zuhayr told us, he said: Abu Ishaq told us from Salamah b. Kuhayl from Hujayyah from the Sheikh. Zuhayr said: And the Sheikh, in my opinion, implies that he said: The cow [sacrifice] is on behalf of seven from the household.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1774 - My father told me, he said: Hasan b. Musa Al-Ashyab told us, he said: Zuhayr told us, he said: Abu Ishaq told us, he said: Harithah b. Wahb Al-Khuza'i told me—and his mother was under [married to] Umar, so she gave birth to Ubaydullah b. Umar. 1775 - My father told me, he said: Husayn b. Muhammad told us, he said: Jarir b. Hazim told us from Ayyub, he said: We used to come to Ikrimah, and he would swear by Allah that he would not narrate to us. We would never be more hopeful of him regarding hadith than at that moment. A man said to him: 'Did you not swear by Allah?' He said: 'How do you know? The expiation of my oath is to narrate to you.' 1776 - My father told me, he said: Aswad b. Amir told us, he said: Sharik told us from Al-A'mash, he said: Ibrahim said to me: 'Take the inheritance laws (Fara'id) of Abdullah.' He said: So I took them. He said: Then he said: 'Take the inheritance laws of Ali.' He said: So I took them. He said: 'Take the inheritance laws of Zayd.' I said: 'It is enough for me.' He said: 'Take the inheritance laws of Zayd and leave whatever is besides Zayd.' He said: And we used to know the love of the one who loved by narration from him, and the hatred of the one who hated by abandoning narration from him. He said: And Ibrahim did not narrate anything from so-and-so.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1777 - My father told me, he said: Abu Al-Nadr told us, he said: Shu'bah told us, he said: Habib b. Abi Thabit informed me, he said: I heard Abu Al-Abbas, a man from the people of Mecca—and he was a poet, and he was not accused regarding hadith. My father said: His name is Al-Sa'ib b. Farrukh, and he is Abu Al-Ala b. Abi Al-Abbas. 1778 - My father told me, he said: Abu Ubaydah Al-Haddad told us from Bakr Al-A'naq from a man, he said: I came to Al-Sha'bi and he was swinging back and forth. He said: 'It is good for back pain.' 1779 - My father told me, he said: Abu Ubaydah Al-Haddad told us from Hammam from Farqad, he said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said—meaning: 'The most lying of people are the dyers and the goldsmiths.' 1780 - I heard my father say: Isma'il b. Aban Al-Warraq is trustworthy.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1781 - My father told me, he said: Abd al-Wahhab b. Hammam, the brother of Abd al-Razzaq, told us, he said: I heard Ikrimah b. Ammar say: Abu Zumayl Simak b. Yazid told us, he said: Ibn Abbas told us...

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1782 - My father told me, he said Abd al-Wahhab bin Hammam told us, he said I heard Ibn Jurayj say: I used to ask Ata about everything that pleased me. But when I asked him about Al-Baqarah and Al-Imran—or about Al-Baqarah—he said: "Excuse me from this, excuse me from this."
1783 - I heard my father say: Hammad bin Salamah is the most established of people regarding Thabit al-Bunani.
1784 - My father told me, he said Khalid bin Khidash told us, he said Ibn Wahb said to me—and he saw me not writing the hadith of Ibn Lahi'ah: "I am not like others regarding Ibn Lahi'ah, so write them [from me]." And he said to me: "His hadith from Uqbah bin Amir that the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, said: 'If the Quran were in a hide, the fire would not touch it'—Ibn Lahi'ah never raised it [to the Prophet] for us in the beginning of his life."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1785 - My father told me, he said Abu al-Mughirah the Storyteller told us, he said Ismail told us, from Qais, he said: I saw Abu Bakr al-Siddiq holding the tip of his tongue while saying: "Ha! Indeed, this has led me to the watering places [of destruction]."
1786 - My father told me, he said Abd al-Quddus bin Bakr told us, he said Hajjaj informed us, from Hammad, he said: "The scholar will be covered on the Day of Resurrection by something like clouds. It will be placed in his scale. He will say: 'What is this?' It will be said: 'The knowledge that you taught.'" My father said: Abd al-Quddus narrated it to us from a man whom he named, from Hammad.
