1787 - My father told me, he said Rawh told us, he said Ibn Abi Dhi'b told us, from his brother Al-Harith bin Abd al-Rahman, from his father Abd al-Rahman bin al-Mughirah bin Abi Dhi'b, from his father, he said: Umar bin al-Khattab saw me while I was walking, so he said: "The walk of his father! By the One in Whose Hand is my soul, the walk of Abu Dhi'b." He said: So he attacked me with the whip, but I outran him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1788 - My father told me, he said Abu Sa'id Mawla Bani Hashim told us, he said Bishr bin Kathir al-Usaydi told us. My father said: This one is Trustworthy, Trustworthy (Thiqah Thiqah).
1789 - I heard my father say: Abu al-Mutawakkil al-Naji's name is Ali bin Dawud.
1790 - My father told me, he said Muhammad bin Abi Adi Abu Amr told us—and he was a grave/steady man among men—from Ibn Awn, from Umair bin Ishaq, he said: We were sitting with Abu Sufyan, and Ziyad came out from Ibn Affan. He [Abu Sufyan] said: "Woe to his mother! A man—if only he had a tribe to belong to."
1791 - My father told me, he said Abu Ubaidah al-Haddad Abd al-Wahid told us, he said Abd al-Malik bin Ma'n told us, from Jabr bin Habib: That two men informed Al-Ahnaf that the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, had supplicated for him. He said: So he prostrated.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text: 1792 - My father told me, he said Abdullah bin Yazid al-Muqri told us, he said Kahmas bin al-Hasan Abu al-Hasan told us. His maternal uncles were Qais, and he was from [the tribe of] Al-Namir bin Qasit, and he was settled among Bani Qais.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1793 - My father told me, he said Sulaiman bin Harb told us, he said Hammad bin Zaid told us, he said Al-Mu'alla bin Ziyad told us, he said Murrah bin Dabbab told me, he said: I passed by Uqbah bin Abd al-Ghafir when the people were defeated, and he was fallen in the trench, wounded. He called out to me: "O Abu al-Mu'addal! O Abu al-Mu'addal!"
1794 - My father told me, he said: I asked Abd al-Razzaq about Yunus bin Sulaym. He said: "He is better than Amr Bi-Raqq (Amr with thinness/weakness)." And I heard my father another time say: "He is above Amr Bi-Raqq." My father said: And he is Amr bin Abdullah; Ma'mar narrated from him.
1795 - My father told me, he said Ishaq bin Isa al-Tabba' told us, he said Abdullah bin Zaid bin Aslam told us, from his father, from a man from the people of Sham, that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, said: "Three things do not break the fast of the fasting person: Vomiting, wet dreams, and cupping." My father used to weaken Abd al-Rahman bin Zaid bin Aslam, and that is because he narrated this hadith from his father, from Ata bin Yasar, from Abu Sa'id, from the Prophet...

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text: ...may Allah send peace and blessings upon him. My father said: Abdullah bin Zaid is trustworthy. He said: And Abd al-Rahman also narrated another objectionable hadith from him: "Two dead things and two bloods have been made lawful for us."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1796 - My father told me, he said Affan told us, he said Abd al-Wahid bin Ziyad told us, he said Yunus bin Ubaid told me, from his mother, she said: I saw Abu Safiyyah, a man from the Companions of the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him. She said: And he was our neighbor here. She said: When morning came, he would glorify Allah using pebbles.
1797 - My father told me, he said Abu al-Nadr told us, he said Muhammad bin Talhah told us, from Zubaid, he said: If one of them used the Kunyah Abu al-Qasim, we would nickname him Abu al-Qasim (The Divider/Breaker).
1798 - My father told me, he said Abd al-Razzaq told us, he said my father informed me, he said Mina' informed me, he said: I took [memorized] Al-Baqarah and Al-Imran from the mouth of Abu Hurairah. And I performed Hajj with Aisha; I would stop when she stopped and travel when she traveled. And I had a wet dream when Uthman bin Affan was pledged allegiance to.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1799 - My father told me, he said Hajjaj bin Muhammad told us, he said Shu'bah said: I found days ago in a book I have, from Mansur, from Mujahid, he said: "The Messenger of Allah, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, was not cupped while he was in Ihram." Shu'bah said: "I do not know how I wrote it, and I do not remember hearing it."
1800 - My father told me, he said Hajjaj told us, he said Shu'bah told me, from Mansur, from Hayyan, from Suwayd bin Ghafalah, from Ali, that he was asked about a woman who died leaving her husband and her mother. He gave the husband the half and the mother the third, then he returned the remainder to her mother. Shu'bah said: "I had heard it from Hayyan and narrated it to Sufyan. Sufyan went to Mansur and narrated it to him. Then I forgot it, so I asked Mansur about it, and he informed me of it. So I memorized it from Mansur, but I do not think Mansur heard it from Hayyan." My father said: He is called Hayyan, the owner of carpets (Sahib al-Anmat).

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1801 - My father told me, he said Hajjaj told us, he said Shu'bah informed us, from Mansur, from a man, from Abu Zabyan, from Abdullah bin Amr, that he used to dislike praying in the bathhouse. Shu'bah said: "The man whom Mansur narrated from is Habib—meaning Ibn Abi al-Ashras. I know that just as I know that you have not killed ten people today."
1802 - My father told me, he said Abu al-Nadr told us, he said Muhammad—meaning Ibn Talhah—told us, he said: Talhah and Zubaid used to dye [their hair/beards] with yellow.
1803 - My father told me, he said Ubaidullah bin Thawr told us, he said my mother told me, from Al-Ayna' bint Abi al-Halal. Ubaidullah said: And Dunayyah bint Abi al-Halal told us that Abu al-Halal died on the day he died while he was one hundred and twenty years old.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1804 - My father told me, he said Ubaidullah bin Thawr told us, he said Dunayyah bint Abi al-Halal told us, she said: Al-Muhallab bin Abi Sufrah sent a slave girl to Abu al-Halal to see if there was any strength remaining in the old man. So he deflowered her, and he was on that day one hundred and ten years old. Dunayyah, his daughter, said: So I went out, and I was a girl of ten years, behind his funeral procession, letting my hair down on a camel saddle.
1805 - My father told me, he said Ubaidullah bin Thawr told us, he said my mother told me, she said: I saw Shumaysah bint Aziz bin Ghafir al-Wasqiyyah—Ubaidullah said: A clan from us, meaning Al-Atik—wearing two anklets, and she was a very old woman.
1806 - My father told me, he said Ubaidullah bin Thawr bin Awn bin Abi al-Halal told us, he said Al-Halal bin Thawr—meaning his brother—told me, from Abd al-Majid bin Wahb, from Abu al-Halal Rabi'ah bin Zurarah.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1807 - My father told me, he said Ya'qub bin Ibrahim told us, he said my father told us, from Ibn Ishaq, he said: Al-Muttalib bin Abdullah bin Qais bin Makhramah bin al-Muttalib bin Abd Manaf told me, from his father, from his grandfather Qais bin Makhramah, he said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, and I were born in the Year of the Elephant; we were peers—meaning born at the same time.
1808 - I heard my father say: I came to Hushaym, and behold, Hajjaj bin Muhammad and Ishaq bin al-Tabba' were with him. So he narrated to us the hadith of Mu'aththir bin Afazah, the hadith of Dhul-Qarnayn, the hadith of Al-Fadl bin Atiyyah, and the hadith of Abu al-Jahm. And Yahya bin Ma'in was there with us. I said to him: "Did you know Yahya in those days?" He said: "Yes. And Abu Khaythamah also wrote for me in the presence of Hushaym." I think he mentioned a gathering.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1809 - I heard my father say: Abdullah bin Hurmuz, from whom Al-Thawri narrates, is weak in hadith; he is nothing.
1810 - My father told me, he said Abu Dawud told us, he said Shu'bah told us, from Furat—meaning Al-Qazzaz—he said: I heard a Mawla of Umm Salamah say: "Umm Salamah named me Mikhwad, and I was tall."
1811 - I heard my father say: Ibn Abi Adi used to resemble the [pious] people, and he was a grave/steady man among men.
1812 - I heard my father say: Abu al-Muhazzim is Yazid bin Sufyan.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1813 - I heard my father say: Hushaym did not hear anything from Al-Qasim al-A'raj; he only heard them from Asbagh al-Warraq.
1814 - I heard my father say: Qais bin Muslim and Alqamah bin Marthad were Murji'ites. I said to my father: "What about Amr bin Murrah?" He said: "[He was a] Murji'ite."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1815 - I heard my father say: "I have completed seventy-seven [years] and entered into seventy-eight." Then he suffered a fever that very night and died on the tenth day, on Friday. May Allah have mercy on him.
1816 - My father told me, he said Abu Dawud told us, he said Shu'bah informed us, he said Qais bin Muslim informed me, he said I heard Tariq bin Shihab narrating from Abdullah: "A man may surely go out of his house having his religion with him, then he meets a man from whom he needs something, so he says: 'You are this, you are that,' praising him. And perhaps he does not obtain anything of his need, so he returns and Allah is angry with him, so he returns having nothing of his religion with him." My father told me, he said Abu Dawud told us, he said Shu'bah said: "I was happy with him when I asked him about this hadith, and he used to hold the opinion of the Murji'ah, yet he narrated it to me."
1817 - My father told me, he said Abu Dawud told us, he said Shu'bah told us, from Al-A'mash, he said: Umarah said to me: "Does Ibrahim sit and issue fatwas and narrate?" He said: I mentioned that to Ibrahim, and he said: "We sit, and if we are asked about something we know, we give a fatwa."
1819 - My father told me, he said Abu Dawud told us, he said Shu'bah informed us, from Amr bin Murrah, he said I heard Murrah. Shu'bah said: Amr bin Murrah said on that day: "Zubaid did not memorize what Murrah narrated to us except from Rabi' bin Khuthaym regarding the saying of Allah Almighty: {And gives wealth, in spite of love for it}. He said: You give it while you are healthy and stingy, hoping for riches and fearing poverty."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text: 1820 - My father told me, he said Abu Dawud told us, he said Shu'bah informed us, he said: I used to hear Simak say: "The two sons of Umm Hani narrated to me." He said: So I came to the better and more virtuous of the two and asked him, and he was called Ja'dah.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1821 - My father told me, he said Abu Dawud told us, he said Shu'bah informed us, from Amr bin Murrah, he said: When Sa'id bin Jubayr said "Abdullah said," it was Ibn Abbas; and when he said "Ibn Umar [said]," it was Ibn Umar.
1822 - My father told me, he said Abu Dawud told us, he said Shu'bah informed us, from Amr bin Murrah, he said I heard Abu Ubaidah say: Masruq sent for me, so I came to him, and he read Ta-Ha to me. Then he said: "I did not send for you except for this."
1823 - My father told me, he said Abu Dawud told us, from Shu'bah, he said: Hammad used to say to me: "You are one of us except for a drop"—meaning in Irja'.
1824 - My father told me, he said Abu Dawud told us, he said Shu'bah informed us, from Amr bin Murrah, he said: Abdullah bin Salamah had grown old, so he used to narrate to us, and you would recognize [some] and reject [some].
1825 - My father told me, he said Abu Dawud told us, he said Shu'bah informed us, he said: I asked Amr bin Murrah about Uwais al-Qarni: "Do you know him among you?" He said: "No."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1826 - My father told me, he said Abu Dawud told us, he said: Thabit bin Aslam—and it is in my book from Sulaiman bin al-Mughirah: Thabit bin Aslam.
1827 - My father told me, he said Abu Dawud told us, he said Shu'bah informed us, from Abu Ishaq, he said I heard Abu Salamah say: "Ibn Umar died while he was like Umar on the day he was killed." Abdullah said: Meaning in virtue.
1828 - I heard my father say: I said to Dawud bin Yahya bin Yaman: "Do you memorize this? Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi narrated to us, from Sufyan, from Qais bin Muslim, from Ata regarding the one who breaks his wudu after raising his head from prostration in the end of his prayer?" He said: "If he has recited the Tashahhud." Dawud said: "No." My father said: Dawud was among the most knowledgeable of people regarding the hadith of Sufyan, and he was a righteous man.
1829 - My father said: Muhammad bin Muslim al-Ta'ifi, how weak his hadith is! And my father weakened him greatly.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1830 - I said to my father: "Did Ziyad bin Sa'd hear from Ibn Hadir?" He said: "Yes." I said to my father: "Did Ibn Hadir hear from Ibn Abbas?" He said: "Yes."
1831 - My father told me, he said Sufyan bin Uyainah told us, he said Yahya bin Sa'id told us, from Amr bin Yahya, seventy-four years ago. Then I asked him shortly after that—and Yahya was older than him. Sufyan said: "I heard three hadiths from him." My father said: The hadith "The entire earth is a place of prayer except the bathhouse and the graveyard," Sufyan said: "I did not hear it from him."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1832 - My father told me, he said Sufyan told us, he said Ibn Abi Sa'sa'ah Abdullah bin Abd al-Rahman told me. This is what Sufyan said. My father said: Ibn Abi Sa'sa'ah's name is Abd al-Rahman bin Abdullah bin Abd al-Rahman bin Abi Sa'sa'ah. Sufyan said: Ibn Abi Sa'sa'ah is a Sheikh from the Ansar.
1833 - My father told me, he said Sufyan told us, he said: I did not memorize from Ibn Urwah Uthman anything except one [hadith]. And Hisham said to me: "He reports it from me."
1834 - My father told me, he said Sufyan told us, from Muhammad bin Abd al-Rahman bin As'ad bin Zurarah, the nephew of Amrah. Sufyan said: "I heard it from him before Al-Zuhri came." Sufyan said: "I sat with him when I was fifteen years old. He came here and stayed, and I did not comprehend hadith well [yet]. Umar bin Abd al-Aziz had appointed him over Al-Yamamah, and he possessed virtue."
1835 - I asked my father about Yusuf bin Ya'qub. He said: "Al-Thawri narrated from him." Then he said: Muhammad bin al-Hasan bin Atash told us, he said Yusuf bin Ya'qub bin Ibrahim bin Sa'id bin Dadawayh told me. Muhammad bin al-Hasan bin Atash said: "He acted as a judge over us"—meaning Yusuf bin Ya'qub.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1836 - My father told me, he said: Ibn Mahdi told us from Hammad b. Salamah from Hajjaj b. Artah from Abu Bakr b. Abi al-Jahm that the people of Kufa ordered him to ask Qabisah b. Dhu'ayb about the child of the Mukatabah (slave with a contract of manumission) regarding the Tadbir (manumission after death) and about things he named. Ibn Mahdi said: I asked Sufyan about it, and he said: 'I heard it from Abu Bakr, but I cannot reproduce it as I wish.' 1837 - My father told me, and I read it to Abu al-Aswad b. Amir, he said: Al-Hasan—meaning Ibn Salih—told us from Ayyub from Mujahid that he prostrated a prostration, then did not prostrate the other until he died. My father said: 'In my view, this is not Ayyub al-Sakhtiyani; I think he is Ayyub b. A'idh or someone else.' 1838 - My father told me, he said: Ibn Mahdi told us, he said: Sufyan told us from Habib, he said: 'I saw Sa'id b. Jubayr kissing a son of his who was a [grown] man.' Abd al-Rahman said: I said to him: 'Habib b. Abi Thabit?' He said: 'No.' I said: 'Habib b. Abi Amrah?' He said: 'No.' I said: 'Then who is Habib?' He said: 'A Sheikh of ours.' My father said: 'I think he is Habib b. Abi al-Ashras.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1839 - My father told me, he said: Ibn Mahdi told us, he said: Sufyan told us from Al-Hasan b. Yazid, and he is Abu Yunus. And Ibn Mahdi said another time: 'Al-Tawwaf.' My father said: 'Because of his frequent Tawaf around the House.' And Yahya b. Sa'id said: 'Abu Yunus al-Qawi.' 1840 - My father told me, he said: Abd al-Rahman b. Mahdi told us from Sufyan from Adam, the Mawla of Khalid. My father said: 'He is the father of Yahya b. Adam.' 1841 - My father told me, he said: Sufyan b. Uyaynah told us, he said: Ibn al-Munkadir told us, he heard Sa'id b. Abd al-Rahman b. Yarbu' reporting from Jubayr b. al-Huwayrith: 'I saw Abu Bakr standing at Quzah.' My father said: They said to Sufyan that Munkadir says 'from his father from Jabir', so he said: 'Where would I get this [chain]? It is Sa'id b. Abd al-Rahman b. Yarbu' from Jubayr b. al-Huwayrith: I saw Abu Bakr.' My father said: 'It is actually Abd al-Rahman b. Sa'id b. Yarbu'.' 1842 - My father told me, he said: Sufyan told us, he said: Amr b. Dinar told us from Ibn al-Munkadir. I asked him—meaning Ibn al-Munkadir—he said: 'No man should be alone with a woman.' People said: 'The people of al-Awfad perished.' Sufyan said: 'Al-Awfad are the people of the Suffah.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1843 - My father told me, he said: Sufyan told us, he said: Umar b. Qays—meaning Sandal—said: 'He does not narrate it to you that he does not mention it'—meaning the hadith of Abd al-Rahman b. al-Qasim regarding the kiss. Sufyan said: I said to Abd al-Rahman b. al-Qasim: 'Did you hear your father narrate from Aisha that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) used to kiss her while he was fasting?' He fell silent for a while, then said: 'Yes.' 1844 - My father told me, he said: Sufyan told us from Abdullah b. Abi Bakr: 'They were together, so I asked this one and that one, and Abdullah was more retentive of hadith'—meaning than Muhammad b. Abi Bakr. Sufyan said: 'And he held the position of judge'—meaning Muhammad. 1845 - My father told me, he said: Sufyan told us, he said: Sulayman b. Suhaym told me. Sufyan said: 'I did not memorize from him other than it: The hadith of the curtain (Sitara).' 1846 - My father told me, he said: Sufyan told us from Asim b. Ubaydullah from Abdullah b. Amir from his father—I do not know who he is—: 'I saw him using the Siwak more than I can count.' Sufyan said: 'I do not know if I heard it or not; some of the Sheikhs used to fear him'—meaning Asim b. Ubaydullah.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1847 - He said: I heard my father say: 'Ibn Abi Labid used to hold the view of Qadar. Sufyan heard from Ibn Abi Labid in Kufa, and his origin is Madinan.' 1848 - My father told me, he said: Sufyan told us, he said: Muhammad b. Ajlan told us, and he was trustworthy. 1849 - My father told me, he said: Sufyan told us from Ibn Ajlan from Iyad b. Abd Allah b. Sa'd b. Abi Sarh, he heard Abu Sa'id narrating from the Prophet (peace be upon him): 'The world is green and sweet... and whatever the spring grows kills by bloating (Habatan).' And Yazid b. Harun said from Hisham from Hilal: 'Khabatan', and he erred. It is only 'Habatan'. Sufyan said: 'Al-A'mash used to ask me about the hadith of Iyad, the hadith of Ibn Ajlan'—meaning this hadith.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1850 - My father told me, he said: Sufyan told us, he said: Yahya said: 'I narrated the hadith of Amrah to Al-Qasim, and he said: By Allah, she brought you the hadith exactly as it is'—meaning regarding the Hajj of the Prophet (peace be upon him). 1851 - I heard my father say: 'Abu Ubayd, the doorkeeper of Sulayman b. Abd al-Malik. Malik narrated from him and praised him.' My father said: 'Ibn Ajlan narrated from him.' 1852 - My father told me, he said: Sufyan told us from Wa'il. Sufyan said: 'Wa'il did not sit with Al-Zuhri, but his son sat with Al-Zuhri.' 1853 - My father told me, he said: Sufyan told us, he said: Ja'far al-Ahmar told me from Ibrahim b. Muhammad b. al-Muntashir. Sufyan said: 'And he was among the best we saw'—meaning Ibrahim.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1854 - My father told me, he said: Sufyan told us, he said: Amr b. Dinar told us from Abd al-Aziz b. Rufay'. So I came to him in Kufa and asked him, I said: 'Amr narrated it to us from you.' 1855 - I said to my father: 'Shaddad b. Ma'qil, is he the brother of Abdullah b. Ma'qil?' He said: 'I do not think so.' 1856 - I asked my father about Al-Harith b. Al-Jarud. He said: 'A judge in Mosul. Abu Awanah, Umar b. Ayyub, and Mu'afi b. Imran narrated from him.' 1857 - I heard my father say: 'Kawthar b. Hakim, his hadiths are false; he is nothing.' 1858 - I heard my father say: 'Shu'bah erred in the hadith of Salm b. Abd al-Rahman from Abu Zur'ah: Name yourselves with my name... and he disliked ambiguity (Shikal). He said: Abdullah b. Yazid al-Nakha'i.' My father said: 'It is only Salm b. Abd al-Rahman.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1859 - I heard my father say: 'Shu'bah erred in the hadith of Ali b. Zayd from Yusuf b. Mahran. He said Yusuf b. Mahak, and it is a mistake; it is only Ibn Mahran.' 1860 - My father told me, he said: Ghundar Muhammad b. Ja'far told us, he said: Shu'bah told us, he said: I heard a Mawla of Quraysh say: I heard from Ibn Umar being asked about the two ears. He said: 'They are part of the head.' My father said: Hushaym said: 'He is Ghaylan b. Abdullah, the Mawla of Quraysh.' 1861 - My father said regarding the hadith of Shu'bah from Al-Mughirah b. Muslim from Al-Sha'bi. My father said: 'He is the one called Al-Azraq, and he is not Al-Sarraj.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1862 - My father said: 'Abu al-Safar, his name is Sa'id b. Ahmad al-Thawri, Thawr Hamdan.' My father said: 'What I memorized from Waki' is Sa'id b. Ahmad. And there was haste in Waki's speech.' He said: 'Abbas al-Warraq claimed he heard him say Sa'id b. Yuhmad.' He said: 'And I do not see it as anything but the correct one.' 1863 - My father told me, he said: Muhammad b. Ja'far Ghundar told us, he said: Shu'bah told us from Amr b. Abi Hakim Abu Sa'id, he said: I heard Ikrimah say: 'Juice is drunk as long as it does not foam/boil.' I heard my father say: 'Amr b. Abi Hakim is the one Hushaym narrates from. And the one Hammad b. Salamah narrates from via Khalid al-Hadhdha' from Amr b. Kurdi is Amr b. Abi Hakim.' 1864 - My father said: 'I do not know that Khalid—meaning al-Hadhdha'—heard from any of the Kufans older than Abu al-Duha. He narrated from Al-Sha'bi, but I do not think he heard from him.' 1865 - My father said: 'Ibn al-Thalab; it is only Ibn al-Talab (or Ibn al-Tullab). But Shu'bah had something in his speech, and perhaps Ghundar did not understand him.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1866 - My father said: 'Khalid al-Hadhdha' from Abu Hunaydah. The name of Abu Hunaydah is Al-Bara' b. Nawfal.' My father said: 'Abu Hunaydah is the one from whom Abu Na'amah narrates the hadith of Walan, the hadith of Al-Nadr b. Shumayl.' He said: 'And Khalid al-Hadhdha' narrated the hadith of Abu Hadir from him.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1867 - I heard my father say: 'Thus said Ghundar, and I think Shu'bah erred in his name in the hadith of Shu'bah from Muhammad b. Ishaq from Umar b. Asim b. Qatadah from Mahmud from Rafi' from the Prophet (peace be upon him): Perform the Fajr prayer when it is light. My father said: It is only Asim b. Umar b. Qatadah.' 1868 - My father told me, he said: Ghundar told us, he said: Shu'bah told us from Abu Bishr from Sa'id b. Jubayr, he said: Umar said to Zaid b. Thabit: 'A son of a son of mine died, so divide his inheritance.' Umar said: 'Sha'ath? (Disheveled?) I was not Musha'ith.' Thus said Ghundar: 'I knew it was for me to the exclusion of them.' Shu'bah said: 'Meaning to divide his inheritance between him and his brothers.' My father said: 'And Waki' said from Shu'bah with his Isnad. And he said: Sha'b (division). He opposed Ghundar, and it is the correct one, meaning Sha'b.' 1869 - My father told me, he said: Muhammad b. Ja'far told us, he said: Shu'bah told us, he said: I heard Al-Ash'ath Al-Athram. My father said—meaning Ibn Sawar—he said: I heard Al-Sha'bi narrating from Masruq or from some companions of Abdullah from Abdullah that he said: 'The Sunnah regarding women'—meaning divorce and the waiting period. Shu'bah said: 'And that was before Al-Ash'ath Al-Athram became confused.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1870 - My father told me, he said: Ghundar told us, he said: Shu'bah told us from Hisham b. Urwah, he said: My father told me from 'Al-Mali from Al-Mali'. Thus said Ghundar. My father said: He means by his saying 'Al-Mali from Al-Mali': Abu Ayyub from Ubayy b. Ka'b from the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) that he said regarding the man who comes to his wife then does not ejaculate: 'He washes his penis and performs ablution.' He said: Meaning 'Al-Mali from Al-Mali' is Trustworthy from Trustworthy. 1871 - I asked my father about the hadith of Shu'bah from Abu al-Azhar from Juhaynah. He said: 'Abu al-Azhar's name is Salih b. Dirham.' 1872 - My father told me, he said: Ghundar told us, he said: Shu'bah told us from Mus'ab from Al-Sha'bi, he said: 'The divorce of boys is nothing.' I asked my father about Mus'ab. He said: 'He is not Mus'ab b. Sulaym.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1873 - My father told me, he said: Ghundar told us, he said: Shu'bah told us from Jabir from Al-Sha'bi from Masruq, he said: 'Six of the Prophet's companions (peace be upon him) used to give fatwas to the people and they would take their fatwas. If they stated an opinion, they would end up at the opinion of: Umar, Abdullah b. Mas'ud, Ali, Zaid b. Thabit, Ubayy b. Ka'b, and Abu Musa. And three of them used to leave their opinion for the opinion of three: Abdullah left his opinion for the opinion of Umar, Abu Musa left his opinion for the opinion of Ali, and Zaid left his opinion for the opinion of Ubayy.' 1874 - I heard my father say: 'We mentioned in the presence of Waki' b. al-Jarrah the hadiths of Ya'la b. Ata from Waki' b. Hudus. I said: Five hadiths are narrated from him. He began mentioning that. My father said: He did not hear them; these are known hadiths he did not hear.' 1875 - I heard my father say: 'Sa'd b. Ibrahim is fifty times more established (Athbat) than Umar b. Abi Salamah.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1876 - My father told me, he said: Ghundar told us, he said: Shu'bah told us from Amr b. Murrah, he said: I heard Abu Wa'il narrating from Al-Harith b. Hubaysh Al-Asadi, he said: 'Sa'id b. Al-As sent me with gifts to Kufa and favored Ali. I came to him and said: Your brother's son sends you greetings...' and he mentioned the hadith. He said: 'By Allah, if I possessed it, I would shake it out like the butcher shakes the soil of the *Wadhamah* (tripe/meat board).' My father said: Yahya b. Abi Bukayr said: 'The soil and the *Wadhamah*.' My father said: 'It is said it is only *Al-Wadham al-Taribah* (the dusty meat boards).' 1877 - My father told me, he said: Ghundar told us, he said: Shu'bah told us from Amr b. Murrah from Abu Burdah: I heard Al-Agharr narrating from Ibn Umar. 1878 - My father said: 'And Yahya b. Sa'id said: I heard him narrating [from] Ibn Umar, and that is the correct one.' 1879 - My father said: 'Al-Hakam did not hear anything from Alqamah.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1880 - My father told me, he said: It was said to Ghundar: Did Shu'bah use to elevate it (make it Marfu')? He said: He used to see that it was Marfu', but he was afraid of it—meaning the hadith of Shu'bah from Al-Hakam from Al-Qasim b. Mukhaymirah from Shurayh b. Hani from Ali regarding wiping (over socks). 1881 - My father said: 'And Ghundar did not hear from Hajjaj—meaning Ibn Artah—except one hadith.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1882 - I asked my father: 'I said Simak from Abu al-Rabi'?' My father said: 'I think he is the one from whom Alqamah b. Marthad narrates, this Abu al-Rabi'.' I said to my father: 'What is his name?' He said: 'I do not know.' 1883 - I asked my father about the hadith of Shu'bah from Al-Hasan b. Muslim Al-Hudhali, he said: I asked Makhul, he said: Shu'bah narrated from him; I do not know him. 1884 - I asked my father about the hadith of Shu'bah from Abu al-Tayyah, he said: I heard Abu al-Ja'd from Abu Umamah: The Prophet (peace be upon him) came out to a storyteller. My father said: 'I do not know who this Abu al-Ja'd is.' 1885 - I asked him about the hadith of Shu'bah from Yazid b. Khumayr, he said: I heard Salim b. Abi al-Ja'd. My father said: 'Yazid heard it from him, from Salim in Sham, and Salim had narrated from Ma'dan. Salim went to Sham.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1886 - My father said regarding the hadith of Shu'bah from Ibrahim b. Muhajir from Kulayb Al-Jarmi. My father said: Asim from his father: 'Kulayb Al-Jarmi is the one from whom Ibrahim b. Muhajir narrated.' 1887 - My father told me, he said: Ghundar told us, he said: Shu'bah told us from Abu Husayn from Yahya b. Wathab from Masruq from Abdullah, he said: 'If a man says to his wife: Succeed in your own affair, or Your affair is yours, or I have gifted her to her family and they accepted her, then it is one irrevocable divorce.' Abu Maryam said to him: 'Did Yahya b. Wathab tell you that Masruq told him that Abdullah told him?' He said: 'Yes.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1888 - My father told me, he said: Ghundar told us, he said: Shu'bah told us from Hammad from Ibrahim, he said: 'There is no retaliation (Qisas) between slaves.' My father said: 'This is not among what Shu'bah heard from Hammad. In our copy from Ghundar from Shu'bah from Abd al-Khaliq or Al-Haytham... he did not say: Shu'bah told us from Hammad.' 1889 - I asked him about the hadith of Shu'bah from Abd al-Malik b. Maysarah from Hawt from Abdullah: 'The ear of the Dajjal's donkey will shade seventy thousand.' My father said: 'He did hear this from Abdullah'—meaning Hawt. In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. 1890 - Abu Abd al-Rahman Abdullah b. Ahmad b. Hanbal told us: I asked him about the hadith of Shu'bah from Sulayman Al-Attar. He said: 'He has a son called Silah b. Sulayman Al-Attar; I heard one hadith from him.' 1891 - I said to him: 'Shu'bah from Abu Shubrumah?' My father said: 'He is Abdullah b. Shubrumah.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1892 - I asked him about the hadith of Shu'bah from the nephew of Mutarrif. He said: 'Someone other than Ghundar said: Abdullah b. Hani, nephew of Mutarrif.' 1893 - I asked him about the hadith of Shu'bah from Uthman b. Abi Rawwad. My father said: 'He is the brother of Abd al-Aziz b. Abi Rawwad.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1894 - I asked him about the hadith of Shu'bah from Hamzah Al-A'war from Al-Sha'bi regarding Eid Takbir. My father said: 'Hamzah Al-A'war is Abu Umarah b. Hamzah, and this is the one called Dar Umarah b. Hamzah.' 1895 - I asked him about a hadith from Abu Al-Nadr, he said: I heard Hamlah b. Abd al-Rahman. My father said: 'This is not Abu Al-Nadr from whom Malik and Ibn Uyaynah narrate. This is a Levantine man from AkK.' 1896 - I asked him about the hadith of Shu'bah from Ibrahim b. Muhammad b. Al-Muntashir from his father from Abayah b. Raddad who heard Umar: 'No prayer without the Opening of the Book (Fatihah).' My father said: 'He is Abayah b. Rif'i.' 1897 - I heard him say: 'Abu Farwah Al-Hamdani, his name is Urwah Al-Hamdani.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1898 - I heard my father say: 'Abu Farwah Al-Nahdi, his name is Muslim b. Salim, the one who narrates from Ibn Abi Layla.' 1899 - I heard my father say—and I mentioned to him the hadith of Muhammad b. Al-Qasim Al-Asadi, he said: Sa'id b. Ubayd Al-Ta'i told us from Ali b. Rabi'ah Al-Walibi from Ali, he said: And I do not know it except from the Prophet (peace be upon him): 'If blood boils in one of you, let him shed it even with a broadhead arrow.' And Abu Ma'mar narrated the hadith to me. I heard my father say: 'Muhammad b. Al-Qasim lies; [he brings] fabricated hadiths; he is nothing.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1900 - I heard my father say: Amr bin Aws, Al-Nu'man bin Salim narrated from him, and he is the one from whom Amr bin Dinar narrated.
1901 - My father told me, he said Husain bin Muhammad told us, he said Shu'bah told us, on the authority of Abu Dhibyan Khalifah bin Ka'b, a man from Banu Tamim from the people of Basra.
1902 - I heard my father say: Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi said—and Rib'i bin Ulayyah came to him—so he said: "Of our Sheikhs, [only] this one and Sa'id bin Amir remain."
1903 - My father told me, he said Yazid bin Harun told us, he said Shu'bah told us, on the authority of Abu Bukayr, on the authority of Ziyad bin Hudayr, he said: "I have not seen anyone use the Siwak more while fasting than Umar." My father said: It is actually Abu Nahik, but Shu'bah erred in it and said Abu Bukayr.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1904 - My father told me, he said Miskin told us, on the authority of Shu'bah, he said: Mansur wrote to me informing me of a hadith. He said: So I met him and said, "Shall I narrate it on your authority?" He said: "Yes, if I wrote to you, then I have narrated to you." And regarding Ayyub al-Sakhtiyani, [he said] the same.
1905 - My father told me, he said Silm bin Qutaibah told us, he said Shu'bah told us, on the authority of Ali bin Zaid, on the authority of Abu Uthman al-Nahdi, he said: I witnessed Umar when the death announcement of Al-Nu'man bin Muqarrin came to him; he placed his hand on his head and began to weep.
1906 - I heard my father say: Ishaq bin Abi Bakr is Trustworthy, Trustworthy (Thiqah Thiqah). Hammad al-Khayyat narrated to us from him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1907 - My father said: I heard it from Hammad al-Khayyat, he said: Makhramah bin Bukayr brought out some books and said: "These are the books of my father; I did not hear anything from my father." My father told me, he said Hammad al-Khayyat told us, he said Abdullah—he is Al-Umari—claimed that Al-Qasim and Salim, one of them died in the year six and the other in the year five and one hundred (105 and 106 AH). He said: I see [think] Salim was in the year five.
1908 - My father told me, he said Hammad al-Khayyat told us, he said: I heard Sheikhs in Mecca claiming that Mujahid died in the year three and one hundred (103 AH). He said: And Ata died in the year fifteen and one hundred (115 AH). Hammad said: And Sa'id bin al-Musayyib died in the year ninety-five.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1909 - My father told me, he said Sulaiman bin Harb told us, he said Hammad bin Zaid told us, he said Hisham told us, on the authority of Muhammad, he said: I asked Ubaidah about what invalidates ablution (Wudu). He said: "A Hadath (impurity) and harming a Muslim." He said: So I mentioned that to Ayyub and Yahya bin Atiq, and they denied his saying "harming a Muslim." He said: And Ibn Awn told us, on the authority of Muhammad, he said: I asked Ubaidah about what invalidates ablution. He said: "The Hadath."
1910 - My father told me, he said Sulaiman bin Harb told us, he said Hammad told us, he said Hisham told us, on the authority of Muhammad, on the authority of Abu Hurairah, regarding the hadith of Dhu al-Yadayn: That he said regarding the two prostrations for forgetfulness: "He said Takbir, then he said Takbir, then he said Takbir." He [Hammad] said: I heard Ayyub say: "He said Takbir one time." And I heard Yahya bin Atiq and Ibn Awn say: "He said Takbir one time."
1911 - I heard my father say: Abu Nu'aym told us, he said: Mis'ar bin Kidam bin Zuhair bin Ubaidah bin al-Harith al-Hilali told us.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1912 - My father told me, he said Husain bin Muhammad told us, he said Shu'bah told us, on the authority of Adi bin Thabit, he said: I heard Abdullah bin Yazid—and he is his grandfather, the father of his mother—meaning Al-Ansari Al-Khatmi.
1913 - My father said regarding the hadith of Shu'bah, from Qatadah, from Zurarah bin Awfa, from Abu al-Hakam, from Abdullah bin Amr: "Do not kill frogs." My father said: Abu al-Hakam is Abd al-Rahman bin Abi Nu'm.
1914 - My father told me, he said Gundar and Abd al-Malik al-Juddi told us, they said Shu'bah told us, on the authority of Al-Mughirah, on the authority of Simak bin Salamah, he said: The first one to be greeted with the title of Emirate was Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah.
1915 - I heard my father say: Everything that we heard from Gundar from the original copy of his book, he read it to us, except for one hadith from Abd al-Rahman bin al-Qasim—a long one from the hadith of Shu'bah regarding the pledge of allegiance to Abu Bakr.
1916 - My father said regarding the hadith of Shu'bah, from Mansur bin al-Mu'tamir, from Jabir bin Zaid regarding the Muhrim (pilgrim in Ihram): If his feet become cracked, he may treat them with olive oil and ghee. My father said: Mansur bin al-Mu'tamir heard it from Jabir bin Zaid. My father said: And Al-Thawri said on the authority of Mansur: "I heard Jabir bin Zaid," similar to it.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1917 - My father said regarding the hadith of Shu'bah, from Abu Uthman: "I bought a male goat..." And Al-Thawri said: Shawdhab Abu Mu'adh, from Al-Bara, and he was his Mawla.
1918 - My father said regarding the hadith of Shu'bah, from Ibn Abi Najih, from Muhammad bin Ismail—this is how Gundar said it—he said: Whoever saw [it] on Sa'd and Talhah told me—and he mentioned six or seven of the Companions of the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him—[wearing] gold rings. My father said: This is a mistake; it is only Ismail bin Muhammad.
1919 - My father said: And Shu'bah did not hear from Talhah bin Musarrif except for one hadith: "Whoever grants a donation..."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1920 - My father said regarding the hadith of Shu'bah, from Abu Aqil, from Sabiq bin Najiyah. My father said: This is a Levantine (Shami) man, his name is Hashim bin Bilal, and he was the judge of Wasit.
1921 - My father told me, he said Hashim Abu al-Nadr told us, he said Ikrimah bin Ammar told us, he said: I saw Al-Hadrami bin Lahiq killing a scorpion during prayer. My father said: Is this Al-Hadrami from whom Yahya bin Abi Kathir narrated? I said to him: Mu'tamar from his father, from Al-Hadrami. He said: This is another man. And Mu'tamar claimed, he said: "I saw him, and he was a storyteller." And I think my father said: The one from whom Yahya bin Abi Kathir narrated is old, or the older of the two.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1922 - And he said regarding the hadith of Asbagh bin Zaid, from Abu Bishr. My father said: He is not Ja'far bin Iyas; this is a Levantine man who narrated from Abu al-Zahiriyyah.
1923 - My father said: Abd al-A'la bin Abd al-A'la holds the view of Qadar (free will).
1924 - My father said: And Waki' said: Abu Ubaidah—meaning Al-Haddad—used to guide us to the Sheikhs.
1925 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Adam told us, he said Zuhair told us, on the authority of Abu Ishaq, on the authority of Abu al-Aliyah—and he is Abdullah bin Salamah. This is what Yahya bin Adam said.
1926 - My father said: I said to Abu Asim al-Nabil Al-Dahhak bin Makhlad—and I saw him coming on Friday and sitting in the circle of the People of Opinion (Ashab al-Ra'y) near Hilal al-Ra'y—so I said to him one day: "What is the matter with you that you are not like the companions of Ibn Awn and your companions? What do you have to do with Opinion (Ra'y)? What is the matter with you that you are not like your companions in this?" So he remained silent and did not say anything.
1927 - I heard my father mention Abu Asim, and he said: He used to seek truthfulness.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1928 - My father told me, he said Gundar told us, he said Shu'bah told us, on the authority of Yahya al-Taimi—meaning Abu Hayyan—on the authority of Abd al-Rahman, he said: When Al-Rabi' bin Khuthaym was greeted, he would say: "And upon you." My father said: Meaning Abd al-Rahman al-Rahhal.
1929 - My father told me, he said Gundar told us, he said Shu'bah told us, on the authority of Abu Ishaq, he said I heard Al-Bara say: The Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, was moving soil with us on the Day of the Parties (Al-Ahzab), and the soil had covered the whiteness of his belly. And Affan said: "His armpit," which is a mistake; he erred in it. It is only "the whiteness of his belly."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1930 - I heard my father mention Al-Harith bin Suwayd, and he exalted his status and mentioned him with good. He said: "There is no one in Kufa with a better Isnad (chain of transmission) than him." And he mentioned the hadith of Ibrahim al-Taimi, from Al-Harith bin Suwayd, from Ali, that the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, forbade the Dubba' (gourd) and Al-Muzaffat (pitch-coated vessels).
1931 - I heard my father say: Gundar wrote from Shu'bah during the lifetime of Al-A'mash. And Gundar said: "I stuck with Shu'bah for twenty years."
1932 - My father told me, he said Gundar told us, he said Shu'bah told us, on the authority of Sulaiman—meaning Al-A'mash—on the authority of Salih bin Khabbab, on the authority of Husain bin Samurah, on the authority of Salman, that he said: "There is nothing more deserving of a long imprisonment than a tongue." My father said: Abu Mu'awiyah said: On the authority of Al-A'mash, on the authority of Salih bin Khabbab al-Kayshami, on the authority of Husain bin Uqbah. My father said: Shu'bah erred in it; it is only as Abu Mu'awiyah said: Husain bin Uqbah.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1933 - I heard my father say: I went out from Yahya bin Sa'id in Basra to Yazid bin Harun. He asked about me, so it was said: "He is with Yazid bin Harun." He said: "What are you doing with Yazid bin Harun?"
1934 - My father told me, he said Gundar told us, he said Shu'bah told us, on the authority of Amr bin Dinar, he said I heard Tawus narrating from Ibn Abbas that he said concerning one who fainted [or had intercourse] before circumventing the House on the Day of Sacrifice: "He owes a camel (Badanah)." He said: So I narrated it to Ayyub. He said to Amr bin Dinar: "From whom is it?" Amr said: "I heard Tawus narrating from Ibn Abbas." Ayyub said to him: "From Ibn Abbas?" Amr said: "I heard Tawus," and he omitted Ibn Abbas.
1935 - My father told me, he said Gundar told us, he said Shu'bah told us, on the authority of Amr bin Dinar, on the authority of Abu al-Sawwar, he says: I asked Ibn Umar about fasting a day—meaning Arafah—and he forbade it. My father said: And Ibn Uyainah said: On the authority of Amr, on the authority of Abu al-Thawrayn. Shu'bah made a mistake.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1936 - My father told me, he said Gundar told us, he said Shu'bah told us, he said I heard Yunus bin Ubaid say: I heard Yunus bin Jubayr say: I heard a man asking Ibn Umar about having vowed to fast every Monday. My father said: It is only Ziyad bin Jubayr, but he [Shu'bah/Gundar] erred and said Yunus bin Jubayr. Abu Abd al-Rahman said: I do not know if Shu'bah erred in it or Gundar.
1937 - I heard my father say: Amir al-Ahwal is not strong; he is weak in hadith.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1938 - My father told me, he said Gundar told us, he said Shu'bah told us, he said I heard Yahya bin Abi Ishaq say: I asked Sa'id bin al-Musayyib about fasting the day of Arafah. He said: "Ibn Umar used to fast it." I said: "Tell me about yourself, other than Ibn Umar used to fast it." He said: "Ibn Umar is sufficient for you as a Sheikh." My father said: He erred; indeed, what is known from Ibn Umar is that he used to not fast it. My father said: Abd al-A'la narrated it to us from Yahya bin Abi Ishaq, and Yahya [al-Qattan] from Shu'bah, both from Yahya bin Abi Ishaq, from Sa'id: That Ibn Umar used to not fast the day of Arafah.
1939 - I heard my father say: Hafs bin Ghiyath possessed intellect, dignity, and a [good] appearance; he would hardly speak until he was asked.
1940 - My father told me, he said Hafs bin Ghiyath said: I heard him—meaning Al-A'mash—say: "You rarely tell me something except that I have already heard it, but the time has become long [since I heard it]."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1941 - I heard my father say regarding the hadith of Hafs, from Al-Shaibani, from Abdullah bin Utbah: He was asked about a woman who married while she had a suckling child. He said: "She should not breastfeed him even if he dies." My father said: This is among what Hafs did not hear from Al-Shaibani; he used to practice Tadlis (concealing the source) in it, there is no doubt about it. My father told me the hadith; he heard it from Hafs.
1942 - My father told me, he said Hafs bin Ghiyath told us, he said Asim told us, on the authority of Abu Uthman: I said to him [Asim]: "Indeed you narrate the hadith to us, and sometimes you have narrated it to us"—meaning incomplete. He said: "Stick to the first hearing."
1943 - I heard my father say: This Abu Tu'mah is a Levantine; Abd al-Aziz bin Umar narrated from him, and Ibn Jabir and Ibn Lahi'ah narrated from him.
1944 - I heard my father say: I heard from Sahl bin Yusuf; he dictated to me from his book in the year eighty-six in Rajab. My father said: That was the first year I entered Basra. And I heard from him after that also in the second year, the year ninety. And I did not hear anything from him after the year ninety; I see that he had died.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1945 - My father told me, he said Sahl bin Yusuf told us, he said Abu Khalid Thawr bin Yazid informed us. My father told me, he said Sahl bin Yusuf told us, on the authority of Mutarrif bin Ma'qil al-Shaqri. My father said: And he was trustworthy (Thiqah) and more.
1946 - My father told me, he said Abdullah bin Yazid told us, he said I heard Musa bin Ali say: I heard my father say: I was behind my teacher, and I heard him weeping. So I said: "What is the matter with you?" He said: "The Commander of the Faithful, Uthman, has been killed."
1947 - My father told me, he said Abdullah bin Yazid told us, he said I heard Musa bin Ali say: I heard my father say: My father took me to Mu'awiyah to pledge allegiance to him. So he pledged allegiance to him, then Mu'awiyah handed me his hand, so I pledged allegiance to him.
1948 - I heard my father say: Uthman bin Ghiyath is Trustworthy, Firm, Firm in hadith (Thiqah Thabt Thabt), except that he was a Murji'.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text: 1949 - Abdullah informed us by license (Ijazah) regarding this story only, he said: I heard my father say: Amr bin Dinar heard six things from Ibn Abbas: "It is Hil and Bil"—meaning Zamzam [is lawful and free for use]—this is a hearing (Sama'). And: "I saw Ibn Abbas performing Tawaf after Asr." And he heard Ibn Abbas saying Takbir on the Day of Return (from Mina). And he heard Ibn Abbas being told: "Indeed Mu'awiyah forbids Mut'ah"—this was narrated by Ibn Uyainah. And Hammad bin Zaid narrated from Amr: "I saw Ibn Abbas crowding at the Corner (Rukn) after Asr." He said: And Abu Hilal narrated, he said Amr or Utbah told us, on the authority of Amr bin Dinar, he said: "I have never seen a gathering more gathering of every good than the gathering of Ibn Abbas, for Halal, Haram, and the interpretation of the Quran." My father said: Hasan al-Ashyab narrated it to us from Abu Hilal. And I heard my father say: "Hil and Bil" means Lawful, made lawful.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1950 - My father told me, he said Abu Bakr bin Ayyash told us, on the authority of Asim, on the authority of Zirr, he said: I heard Al-Abbas mention Zamzam, so he said: "It is Hil and Bil (Lawful and permissible); I do not make it lawful for one bathing [to remove impurity]."
1951 - My father told me, he said Mu'tamar bin Sulayman told us, on the authority of his father, on the authority of Al-Mughirah, on the authority of Ibrahim, on the authority of Alqamah: "Prolong the repetition of Hadith so it does not fade."
1952 - My father told me, he said I heard Ibrahim bin Sa'd say: My father informed us, on the authority of his father, he said: Uthman saw a man at Dhul-Hulaifah who had oiled [his hair] before entering Ihram. He said: "Wash your head with mud."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1953 - My father told me, he said Uthman bin Uthman told us, he said Al-Batti informed us, he said: When Hammad spoke from his own opinion, he was correct; but when he said "Ibrahim said," he erred.
1954 - I heard my father say: Kadih is a righteous, virtuous, good, upright man.
1955 - I heard my father say: Musa bin Abd al-Hamid Abu Imran was a neighbor of ours, having a good appearance. We wrote from him before we wrote from Ya'qub bin Ibrahim.
1956 - My father told me, he said Husain bin al-Hasan Abu Abdullah told us, he said Zuhair told us, he said I heard Abu Ishaq say: I used to sit frequently with Rafi' bin Khadij, and I used to sit frequently with Ibn Umar.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1957 - My father told me, he said Husain bin Hasan told us, he said Zuhair told us, on the authority of Abu Ishaq, he said: I heard Al-Aswad bin Yazid while he was teaching boys reading in the mosque.
1958 - I heard my father say: Bishr bin al-Mufaddal did not hear from Ibn Tawus except for one hadith: "Beware of a house called the bathhouse."
1959 - I heard my father say: Hammad bin Salamah said "Waki' bin Hudus." My father said: We heard it from Hushaym saying "Udus." My father said: This is how Shu'bah said it. My father said: And I took it from the book of Al-Ashja'i, on the authority of Sufyan, he said: "Waki' bin Hudus," and that is the correct [name].
1960 - I heard my father say: Umar bin Hassan al-Burjumi, I do not see any harm in him; Abu Mu'awiyah narrates from him.
1961 - My father said: Muhammad bin Qais al-Asadi is trustworthy (Thiqah).

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
1962 - My father told us, he said Abu Dawud told us, on the authority of Mu'adh bin Hisham. My father said: Mu'adh bin Hisham told us, on the authority of his father, on the authority of Qatadah, on the authority of Sa'id bin al-Musayyib: The Companions of the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, used to trade by sea; among them were Talhah and Sa'id bin Zaid.
1963 - My father told me, he said Mu'adh bin Hisham bin Abi Abdullah told us. Mu'adh said: And he is Sanbar.
1964 - My father told me, he said Ubaid bin Abi Qurrah told us, he said I heard Malik bin Anas say: "{We raise in degrees whom We will}" [Al-An'am: 83]. He said: "By knowledge." I said to him: "Who told you?" He said: "Zaid bin Aslam claimed that."
1965 - My father told me, he said Ubaid bin Abi Qurrah told me, he said I heard Malik—meaning Ibn Anas—say: A man came to Al-Qasim and said: "Are you more knowledgeable or Salim?" He said: "This is Salim, so ask him." And he would not inform you of anything except what he encompassed in knowledge.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1966 - My father told me, he said: Abd al-Wahhab b. Hammam, the brother of Abd al-Razzaq, told us, he said: I heard my father mentioning, he said: I saw Nafi' and Salim sitting. He said: I saw Nafi' speaking and Salim was silent. 1967 - My father told me, he said: Abd al-Wahhab b. Hammam told us, he said: Ma'mar told us from Ayyub, he said: I saw Nafi' and Salim sitting, and I saw Salim speaking and Nafi' was silent. Abdullah said: This is the correct one. 1968 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Salamah b. Nabit told us, he said: I saw men from the Companions of the Prophet (peace be upon him) dyeing [their hair/beards] with Wars (a yellow plant). 1969 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Hisham b. Urwah told us, he said: I saw Jabir b. Abd Allah and Ibn Umar, and each one of them had a Jummah (hair reaching the shoulders). 1970 - My father told me, he said: Husayn b. al-Hasan told us, he said: Ya'qub informed us from Ja'far from Sa'id from Ibn Abbas, he said: Al-Samiri was a non-Arab/infidel (Ilj) from the people of Kirman. 1971 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us from Sharik from Ata b. al-Sa'ib, he said: My mother used to order me to provide for Ibrahim. 1972 - My father told me, he said: Yahya b. Sa'id told us from Shu'bah from Al-Hakam, he said: We asked Ibrahim twice.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1973 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Sharik told us from Ata b. al-Sa'ib, he said: My mother used to make *Bishbarajat* (a type of pastry/food), so I would invite Ibrahim and his companions, and they would eat. 1974 - My father told me, he said: Ibrahim b. Marzuq told us, he said: I saw Al-Hasan wearing a black turban, and [I saw] Sa'idi letting the turban hang down behind him. 1975 - My father told me, he said: Ibrahim b. Marzuq told us, he said: I saw Musa b. Anas wearing a cloak (*Mutraf*) of silk/wool blend (*Khazz*). He said: And I saw Musa b. Anas in this mosque of ours; when the Mu'adhin called the Adhan for Maghrib, he stood up and prayed two rak'ahs before Maghrib. 1976 - My father told me, he said: Ibrahim b. Marzuq told us, he said: I saw Thumamah b. Abdullah b. Anas judging right here in the mosque. He said: And I saw Iyas—meaning Ibn Mu'awiyah—giving fatwas in the street. 1977 - I heard my father say: Husayn b. Hasan, the companion of Ibn Awn, is a righteous Shaykh, of good appearance. 1978 - I heard my father say: Shurayh b. Siraj al-Jarmi Abu Bishr is a large/imposing Shaykh, he has hair (or status), trustworthy.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1979 - My father told me, he said: Ghassan b. Mudar Abu Mudar told us—a trustworthy, trustworthy Shaykh—he said: Sa'id b. Yazid told us, he said: I heard Ikrimah say: 'What is wrong with you that you do not ask me? Are you not...?' 1980 - My father told me, he said: Ghassan told us, he said: Sa'id b. Yazid told us from Abu Nadrah from Jabir b. Abd Allah, he said: When Umar took charge of the Caliphate, he assigned the stipends, established the registers (Diwans), and appointed monitors (*Urafa*). He said: Jabir said: And he appointed me as a monitor over my companions.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1981 - My father told me, he said: Ghassan told us, he said: Sa'id b. Yazid told us that Abu Nadrah was the monitor of his people. He said: And Abu al-Sawwar al-Adawi was a monitor. 1982 - My father told me, he said: Muhammad b. Sawa told us, he said: Kathir b. Qinbar told us. My father said: And Ali b. Asim said: 'Kathir b. Qumayr'; he erred in it. 1983 - My father told me, he said: Uthman b. Uthman told us, he said: I heard Al-Batti say: It used to be said: We have never seen a man whose guidance/manner more resembles Alqamah than Al-Nakha'i, nor have we seen a man whose guidance more resembles Ibn Mas'ud than Alqamah, nor was there a man whose guidance more resembles the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) than Ibn Mas'ud. My father said: Uthman b. Uthman is a righteous man, trustworthy among the trustworthy.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1984 - My father told me, he said: Yahya b. Abi Bukayr told us, he said: Shu'bah told us, he said: Mansur—meaning Ibn al-Mu'tamir—read to us: {And those for whom you are not providers} [Al-Hijr: 20]; he said: The wild animals. 1985 - My father told me, he said: Hammad b. Khalid al-Khayyat told us, he said: Abu Isra'il told us from Al-Hakam, he said: There was speech [a dispute] between Al-Hajjaj and a companion of his, so he did not do more than give the Salam [greeting]. That was Habib b. Abi Thabit. 1986 - My father told me, he said: Yahya b. Adam told us, he said: Isra'il told us from Abu Ishaq, he said: Aisha said: 'There is no man in Iraq more honored to me than Al-Aswad b. Yazid.' 1987 - My father told me, he said: Abu Bakr b. Ayyash told us, he said: Mughirah said: Ibrahim, may Allah have mercy on him, said: 'He left no one like himself behind him'—meaning Sa'id b. Jubayr.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1988 - My father told me, he said: Abu Bakr b. Ayyash told us from Abu Ishaq, he said: When Mu'awiyah arrived, he presented the people [for stipends] according to the gifts/status of their fathers. He reached me and gave me three hundred dirhams. 1989 - My father told me, he said: Abu Bakr said: How little Abu Ishaq heard from Al-Harith; [only] three hadiths. 1990 - My father told me, he said: Abu Yahya Ishaq b. Sulayman al-Razi told us, he said: I heard Abu Sinan mentioning from Abu Ishaq, he said: I saw people from the Companions of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him)—among them Ibn Umar, Usamah b. Zaid, Zaid b. Arqam, and Al-Bara' b. Azib—wearing their waist-wraps (Izars) halfway up their calves. 1991 - My father told me, he said: Sayyar b. Hatim Abu Salamah told us, he said: Ja'far told us, he said: I heard Abu Imran al-Jawni say: I saw upon Imran b. Husayn a cloak (*Mutraf*) of silk/wool blend (*Khazz*).

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1992 - My father told me, he said: Yahya b. Adam told us, he said: Malik b. Mighwal told us, he said: I heard Talhah b. Musarrif say: 'I have not seen anyone more impressive to me than Ibrahim and Khaythamah.' 1993 - My father told me, he said: Yahya b. Adam told us, he said: Malik b. Mighwal told us from Abu al-Safar from Murrah, he said: 'No Hamdani woman has given birth to the like of Masruq.' 1994 - My father told me, he said: Yahya b. Adam told us, he said: Abu Bakr—meaning Ibn Abd Allah al-Nahshali—told us from Abd al-Aziz b. Rufay', he said: I saw Aisha wearing a rose-colored chemise (*Dir'*) while she was in a state of Ihram. 1995 - My father told me, he said: Yahya b. al-Sakan told us, he said: Shu'bah informed us, he said: Qatadah informed us, he said: I asked Abu al-Tufayl about something, so he said: 'For every situation, there is a saying.' I heard my father say: Yahya b. al-Sakan is the partner of Abu al-Walid al-Tayalisi in Hadith.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 1996 - My father told me, he said: Yazid b. Harun told us, he said: Abu Sahl the Mawla of the family of Talhah—Hilal b. Abd al-Rahman—informed us, Yazid said: The brother of Ibrahim b. Abd al-Rahman. He said: I saw Musa b. Talhah riding a leopard-skin saddle. 1997 - My father told me, he said: Yazid told us: My father had a leopard-skin saddle that he rode upon. 1998 - My father told me, he said: Yazid said: And I saw my father sitting on a lion skin. 1999 - My father told me, he said: Mu'tamar told us from Kahmas from a man from Al-Sha'bi, he said: If I met this ram—meaning Al-Hasan—I would forbid him from his saying 'The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said, The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said.' He said: I accompanied Ibn Umar for six months and I did not hear him say 'The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said' except in one hadith.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2000 - My father told me, he said: Mu'tamar told us from his father, he said: Al-Hasan saw his mother eating leeks (*Kurrath*), so he said: 'O mother, fear this foul tree.' She said: 'You are an old man, you have aged.' He said: 'O mother, am I older or you?' 2001 - My father told me, he said: Sulayman b. Harb told us, he said: Hammad b. Zaid told us from Ghaylan b. Jarir, he said: I came to Kufa and stayed with Abu Burdah. I stood up at night to pray. He said: So he heard me saying: 'O Allah, have mercy on my estrangement.' So he called out to me: 'Verily, you are not a stranger, but rather a beloved close one.' 2002 - My father told me, he said: Sulayman b. Harb told us, he said: Hammad b. Zaid told us, he said: Ayyub gave me a book from the books of Abu Qilabah. In it was a letter from Umar to his worker: 'I have sent Ghadirah b. Samurah to you with the scrolls. If he arrives to you on such-and-such day, give him two hundred dirhams. And if he arrives to you after that, do not give him anything.' He said: So he arrived after that, and he did not give him anything.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2003 - My father told me, he said: Yahya b. Yaman told us, he said: I heard Sufyan forbidding *al-Dadhi* (a grain wine) and forbidding the pharmacists from selling it. 2004 - My father told me, he said: Ibn Numayr told us from Umar b. Dharr, he said: Whenever Al-Sha'bi met me, he would say: 'This one and his father are of my Shias (party/supporters).' 2005 - My father told me, he said: Yahya b. Adam told us, he said: Abu Bakr told us from Asim: That a man heard Zirr b. Hubaysh calling the Adhan, so he said: 'O Abu Maryam!' 2006 - My father told me, he said: Yahya b. Adam told us, he said: Sharik told us from Abu Sakhrah, he said: I saw Hammad writing in the presence of Ibrahim and saying: 'I do not desire the world.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2007 - My father told me, he said: Mu'adh b. Mu'adh told us: I saw upon Ibn Awn a burnous made of fine wool. One of our companions said to him: 'What is this burnous, O Abu Awn?' He said: 'This is a burnous that belonged to Ibn Umar. Anas b. Sirin clothed him with it, then it was sold in the inheritance of Anas, so I bought it.' 2008 - My father said regarding the hadith of Waki' from Sufyan from Abd al-Wahid from Isma'il b. Raja'. My father said: 'A Sheikh; Abd al-Wahid has something [knowledge] in inheritance laws (*Fara'id*).' 2009 - My father told me, he said: Abu Nu'aym told us, he said: I heard Al-A'mash say: They used to read to Yahya b. Wathab while I was sitting. When he died, they surrounded me. My father said regarding the hadith of Abu Nu'aym from Sufyan from Abu Musa from Wahb b. Munabbih from Ibn Abbas from the Prophet (peace be upon him): 'Whoever dwells in the desert becomes rough.' My father said: 'He is not Isra'il; this Abu Musa is a Yemeni who narrates from Wahb b. Munabbih.' 2010 - My father told me, he said: Abu Hajar al-Qass told us from Abu Kabran al-Hasan b. Uqbah.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2011 - My father told me, he said: Abu Nu'aym told us, he said: Yazid b. Kaysan told us. My father said: He is not the companion of Abu Hazim who narrates those hadiths from him from Abu Hurayrah. He said: I heard Tawus.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2012 - I heard my father say: Yahya b. Sa'id said: I did not find anything objectionable from Ubaydullah b. Umar except one hadith; the hadith of Nafi' from Ibn Umar from the Prophet (peace be upon him): 'A woman should not travel a journey of three [days] except with a Mahram.' My father said: And Abd al-Razzaq narrated it to us from Al-Umari (Abdullah) from Nafi' from Ibn Umar, and he did not elevate it (did not attribute it directly to the Prophet). 2013 - I heard my father say—and he mentioned Abu Sa'id, the Mawla of Banu Hashim—so he praised him and said: He was scrupulous/careful in Hadith.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2014 - My father said: And I heard Ibrahim b. Sa'd say: By Allah, I never saw a drunk person in Madinah at all until I left it. 2015 - My father told me, he said: I heard Ibrahim b. Sa'd swearing by Allah that Ibn Sim'an used to lie. 2016 - My father told me, he said: Bahz told us, he said: Sulayman b. al-Mughirah told us, he said: Humayd b. Hilal told us, he said: Nasr b. Asim al-Laythi told us, he said: I came to Al-Yashkuri among a group from Banu Layth. He mentioned a long hadith. He said: So I heard him say: Hudhayfah told me: 'The people used to ask the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) about good, and I used to ask him about evil.' My father said: And this Al-Yashkuri is Subay' b. Khalid. 2017 - My father told me, he said: Ghundar Muhammad b. Ja'far told us, he said: Shu'bah told us from Abu al-Tayyah, he said: I heard Sakhr narrating from Subay'ah, so he mentioned the hadith.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2018 - Shu'bah said: And Abu Bishr told me in an Isnad of his from Hudhayfah from the Prophet (peace be upon him): I said: 'O Messenger of Allah, what is a truce on smoke/corruption (*Dakhan*)?' He said: 'Hearts that do not return to what they were.' 2019 - My father told me, he said: Abd al-Samad told us, he said: My father told me, he said: Abu al-Tayyah told us, he said: Sakhr b. Badr al-Ijli told me from Subay' b. Khalid, so he mentioned the hadith. 2020 - My father told me, he said: Yunus told us, he said: Hammad told us from Abu al-Tayyah from Sakhr from Subay' b. Khalid al-Duba'i. 2021 - My father told me, he said: Bahz told us, he said: Abu Awanah told us, he said: Qatadah told us from Nasr b. Asim from Subay' b. Khalid—he is Al-Yashkuri—he said: I came to Kufa at the time Tustar was conquered... so he mentioned the hadith. 2022 - My father told me, he said: Abd al-Razzaq told us, he said: Ma'mar informed us from Qatadah from Nasr b. Asim al-Laythi from Ibn Khalid al-Yashkuri, he said: I went out when Tustar was conquered... so he mentioned the hadith. I heard my father say: The correct [name] is Subay' b. Khalid al-Yashkuri. 2023 - I heard him say: Adham b. Tarif is trustworthy, trustworthy. And Hawshab b. Aqil is trustworthy.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2024 - My father told me, he said: Bishr b. al-Mufaddal told us, he said: Abd al-Rahman—meaning Ibn Ishaq—told us from Abd al-Rahman b. Mu'awiyah. My father said: He is Abu al-Huwayrith. 2025 - My father told me, he said: Bishr b. al-Mufaddal told us, he said: I came to Muhammad b. al-Munkadir while he was sitting among people. When he wanted to leave, he said: 'Do you permit [me]?' 2026 - My father said: They claimed that he is weak in Hadith: Abbad b. Kathir al-Shami. 2027 - My father said: Ghalib al-Qattan is trustworthy, trustworthy.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2028 - Abdullah told us, he said: I heard Abu Ma'mar say: A man narrated a hadith to Sufyan from Abbad b. Kathir. He said: So Sufyan struck his hand on his thigh and began saying to him: 'Silence about Abbad! Silence about Abbad!' He said: 2029 - He said: And I heard Ibn Khallad—or it was written to me with it—he said: It was said to Yahya b. Sa'id: 'From whom did you learn this speech [criticism] about people?' He said: 'And we used to think it was from Shu'bah.' He said: 'From Sufyan b. Uyaynah.' 2030 - I said to my father: Regarding the hadith of Qatadah from Abd Allah b. al-Harith that Abu Halimah performed Qunut in the latter half of Ramadan: Who is this Abd Allah b. al-Harith? He said: 'I do not know who this Abd Allah b. al-Harith is.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2031 - I said to my father: Regarding the hadith of Qatadah from Azrah b. Tamim from Abu Hurayrah from the Prophet (peace be upon him): 'If one of you prays two rak'ahs of the Fajr prayer...' Who is this Azrah? My father said: This is not Azrah who narrated from Al-Sha'bi and Sa'id b. Jubayr; this is Azrah b. Tamim—meaning another man. 2032 - I heard my father say: A trustworthy, trustworthy Shaykh: Musa b. Ali. Thus said Ibn Mahdi: 'Ali'. 2033 - I heard my father say: Dawud al-Awdi, the companion of Abu Awanah, is trustworthy, among the trustworthy. 2034 - I heard my father say: Hushaym died when he was seventy-nine years old.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2035 - I heard my father say: Mahdi b. Maymun is trustworthy, trustworthy. I heard my father say: Yahya narrated to us from him, and Abd al-Rahman [did too]. 2036 - My father was asked while I was present about Salim al-Aftas and Abd al-Karim al-Jazari. He said: 'How close they are! And how sound the hadith of Salim is. Abd al-Karim is a man of Sunnah, while Salim was a Murji'.' 2037 - My father was asked while I was present about Zaid b. Jubayr and Adam b. Ali. He said: 'Zaid b. Jubayr is more impressive to me. Shu'bah narrated from him.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2038 - My father was asked about Asim b. Ubaydullah and Abdullah b. Muhammad b. Aqil. He said: 'How close they are!' And Ibn Uyaynah used to say: 'The Sheikhs used to avoid the hadith of Asim b. Ubaydullah.' 2039 - He was asked about a hadith narrated by Yusuf al-Qattan from Ubaydullah b. Musa from Ibn Uyaynah from Al-Zuhri from Ubaydullah b. Abd Allah from Ibn Abbas: That a man was passionately in love with a woman, so he went to have intercourse with her, but [his member] became with him like a tassel (*Hudbah* - limp), so {And establish prayer at the two ends of the day} was revealed. He said: 'I do not regard this as anything but a liar or a lie.' And he denounced it strongly. 2040 - I heard my father say: Abd Allah b. Sidan is called Al-Matrudi. 2041 - My father told me, he said: Abu Nu'aym told us, he said: Yunus b. Abi Ishaq told us from Abu Ishaq, he said: I and Al-Aswad b. Yazid were in the police force (*Shurtah*) with Amr b. Hurayth during the nights of Mus'ab.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2042 - My father told me, he said Abu Nu'aym told us, he said Yunus told us, he said Sahl bin Ubaid bin Amr al-Kharifi told me in the year ninety-one.
2043 - My father told me, he said Abu al-Mundhir told us, he said Ibn Uyainah told us in Kufa in the year one hundred and fifty-four.
2044 - My father told me, he said Musa bin Dawud told us, he said Muhammad bin Jabir told us, he said: Umair bin Sa'id passed by in the mosque, and there was a short, dark-skinned, cross-eyed old man. It was said to me: "This is Umair bin Sa'id." So I got up, went to him, asked him, and he narrated to me.
2045 - My father told me, he said Abu Abd al-Rahman Shadhan told us, he said Abu Bakr told us, on the authority of Amr bin Maymun, he said: Abu Qilabah came to Umar bin Abd al-Aziz, so he said to him: "Narrate, O Abu Qilabah." He said: "By Allah, I surely dislike much of the speech (Hadith) and much of the silence."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2046 - My father told me, he said Ali bin Thabit told us, he said Abu al-Anbas told me—my father said he is Amr bin Marwan—he said: Shaqiq used not to dye [his hair/beard] with anything. He said: And the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, was sent while I was a beardless youth, and it was not decreed for me to meet him.
2047 - My father told me, he said Mus'ab bin Salam told us, he said Al-Zibriqan told us, on the authority of Abu Wa'il, he said: I remember being a boy of ten years, herding sheep for my family in the desert when the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, was sent.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2048 - I heard my father say: Bishr bin al-Mufaddal did not hear from Ibn Tawus aught but this Hadith: "Beware of a house called the Hammam (bathhouse)."
2049 - My father told me, he said Sufyan told us, he said Abu Ya'fur al-Abdi—a Kufan of ours—told me, he said: I heard an Emir who was over Mecca when Al-Hajjaj departed from it... Sufyan said: In the year seventy-three. Sufyan said: He did not know who that Emir was, so I informed him that it was Ibn Abd al-Harith, a man from Khuza'ah—meaning Nafi'. My father said: Sufyan said: Abu Ya'fur said to me: "There is no Abdi (from Banu Abd al-Qais) man remaining in Kufa older than me."
2050 - My father told me, he said Zaid bin al-Hubab told us, he said Husain bin Waqid told me, he said Yazid al-Nahwi told me, on the authority of Ikrimah regarding His (Allah's) saying, Mighty and Majestic: {And there came from the farthest end of the city a man} [Ya-Sin: 20]. He said: "He was a carpenter."
2051 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, he said: If I did not hear it from Al-Zuhri, then Sufyan bin Husain told me... and he mentioned the Hadith of Al-Atirah. My father said: Sufyan narrated it to us from Al-Zuhri.
2052 - My father told me, he said Mu'tamar told us, on the authority of Iyas, he said: I saw Abu Nadrah kiss the cheek of Al-Hasan.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2053 - My father told me, he said Sulaiman bin Harb told us, he said Salam bin Miskin told us, he said Imran bin Abdullah bin Talhah al-Khuza'i told us, on the authority of Sa'id bin al-Musayyib, he said: I witnessed Ali and Uthman, and there was an incitement from Satan between them. Neither left anything unsaid to the other except that he said it. Then he [Sa'id] said: "If you wish for me to recount to you what they said, I will do so." Then they did not leave until they reconciled and each asked forgiveness for the other.
2054 - My father told me, he said Sulaiman told us, he said Umarah bin Mihran told us, he said Abu Nadrah told us, on the authority of Abu Sa'id al-Khudri, he said: As for the beginning of the story, I do not remember it. But I did not pray Dhuhr until the two of them entered, one holding the hand of the other, as if they were brothers from the same mother and father—meaning Uthman and Ali.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2055 - My father told me, he said I heard Sufyan say: We did not use the Kunyah Abu al-Zinad for him; we used to call him Abu Abd al-Rahman. He was a scribe for Abd al-Hamid bin Abd al-Rahman bin Zaid bin al-Khattab.
2056 - My father told me, he said Abd al-Razzaq told me, he said Ibn Jurayj told us, he said Sufyan bin Sa'id told me, on the authority of Malik bin Anas, on the authority of Yazid bin Abdullah bin Qusait, on the authority of Ibn al-Musayyib, that Umar and Uthman judged regarding the *Maltat*—which is the *Simhaq* (a head wound reaching the membrane)—as half of a *Muwaddihah* (a wound exposing the bone). Abd al-Razzaq said: Then Sufyan came to us and narrated it to us from Malik, from Ibn Qusait, from Sa'id bin al-Musayyib, from Umar and Uthman, similar to it. So I met Malik and said to him: "Indeed, Sufyan narrated to us from you, from Yazid bin Abdullah bin Qusait, from Ibn al-Musayyib, from Umar and Uthman, that they judged regarding the *Maltat* as half of a *Muwaddihah*, so narrate it to me." He said: "No, I will not narrate it today. It is truth, I have narrated it." Then he smiled, then said: "It has reached me that he narrates it from me, but I will not narrate it today." So Muslim bin Khalid said to him: "I adjure you to narrate it to him," and he was beside him. So he said to him: "Do not adjure. If I were to narrate it to anyone today, I would narrate it to him." I said: "Then why do you not narrate it to me?" He said: "The practice is not according to it among us." And he said: "Indeed, our companion is not considered like that among us"—meaning Yazid bin Abdullah bin Qusait. Abdullah said: My father dictated it to me.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2057 - My father told me, he said Waki' told us, he said: Ammar bin Saif was with me, and he mentioned from Ibn Abi Layla, from Al-Sha'bi, he said: "There is no seeking refuge (Isti'adhah) upon the one behind the Imam." Waki' said: "We used to think he was mistaken."
2058 - I heard my father say: Umarah bin Zadhan is trustworthy, and Salamah bin Wardan is Munkar al-Hadith (his Hadith is objectionable).
2059 - I read to my father: Waki' said: Abdullah bin Shaddad is Kinani.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2060 - My father told me, he said Abu al-Yaman told us, he said Shu'aib informed us, on the authority of Al-Zuhri, and he said Sahl bin Sa'd al-Ansari—and he had seen the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, and heard from him—he mentioned that he was fifteen years old on the day the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, passed away.
2061 - My father told me, he said Affan told us, he said Abd al-Wahid bin Ziyad told us, he said Sa'id bin Abd al-Rahman told us. I asked my father: "Who is this Sa'id bin Abd al-Rahman?" He said: "Sufyan al-Thawri and Hukkam narrated from him; he is Sa'id bin Abd al-Rahman al-Zubaidi."
2062 - My father told me, he said Muhammad bin Bakr told us, he said Ibn Jurayj told us, he said Ibn Shihab said: So Sahl bin Sa'd said—and he had reached fifteen years when the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, passed away, and he heard from him.
2063 - My father told me, he said Uthman bin Umar told us, he said Yunus informed us, on the authority of Al-Zuhri: So Sahl al-Ansari said—and he had reached the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, while he was fifteen years old in his time.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2064 - My father told me, he said Ali bin Ishaq told us, he said Abdullah bin al-Mubarak informed us, he said Yunus informed me, on the authority of Al-Zuhri, on the authority of Sahl bin Sa'd al-Ansari: And he had reached the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, while he was fifteen years old in his time.
2065 - My father told me, he said Abd al-Razzaq told us, he said Sufyan informed us, on the authority of Abu Salamah, on the authority of Al-Rabi' bin Anas. I asked my father: "Who is this Abu Salamah?" He said: "This Abu Salamah is Al-Mughirah bin Muslim, the brother of Abd al-Aziz bin Muslim al-Qasmali."
