2066 - My father told me, he said Muhammad bin Ja'far told us, he said Shu'bah told us, on the authority of Abu Abdullah Mawla Juhaynah, he said I heard Mus'ab bin Sa'd. My father said: Abu Abdullah Mawla Juhaynah is Musa al-Juhani.
2067 - My father told me, he said Qutaibah bin Sa'id told us, he said Hatim bin Ismail told us, on the authority of Muhammad bin Yusuf, on the authority of Al-Sa'ib bin Yazid, he said: My father performed Hajj with the Messenger of Allah, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, in the Farewell Pilgrimage while I was a boy of seven years.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2068 - My father told me, he said Ismail bin Ibrahim told us, he said Yunus informed us, on the authority of Al-Hasan, that Aqil bin Abi Talib was addressed as "O Abu Yazid."
2069 - My father told me, he said Affan told us, he said Hammad bin Salamah told us, he said Abu al-Husain told me. My father said: He is Khalid bin Dhakwan; Bishr bin al-Mufaddal narrated to us from him.
2070 - My father told me, he said Affan told us, he said Abu al-Ashhab told us, he said Khulaid al-Asri told us. Abu Juzi said: "Where did you meet Khulaid?" He said: "I do not know."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2071 - My father told me, he said Abd al-A'la told us, on the authority of Ma'mar, on the authority of Al-Zuhri, on the authority of Kharijah bin Zaid bin Thabit, on the authority of Zaid bin Thabit, that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, said: "Perform ablution from what fire has changed (cooked)."
2072 - My father told me, he said Abd al-Razzaq told us, he said: I read in the book of Ma'mar, on the authority of Al-Zuhri, on the authority of Abd al-Malik bin Abi Bakr, on the authority of Kharijah, on the authority of Zaid, on the authority of the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, regarding ablution from what fire has changed.
2073 - My father told me, he said Yazid bin Harun told us, he said Khalid bin Rabah Abu al-Fadl informed us.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2074 - My father told me, he said Sufyan told us, on the authority of Abu Hazim, on the authority of Sahl, he said: It was from the tamarisk of Al-Ghabah—meaning the pulpit (Minbar) of the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him.
2075 - I heard Amr al-Naqid say: Ibn Uyainah used to say to me during the Hajj season: "Come closer to me and raise your voice so the people can hear us."
2076 - My father told me, he said Ya'qub told us, he said my father told us, on the authority of Ibn Ishaq, he said: Abu Hazim al-Afzar, the Mawla of Al-Aswad bin Sufyan al-Makhzumi, told me. My father said: Abu Hazim al-Madini, the one who speaks about asceticism, is this one; his name is Salamah bin Dinar.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text: 2077 - My father told me, he said Musa bin Dawud told us, he said Ibn Lahi'ah told us, on the authority of Khalid bin Abi Imran, on the authority of Hanash al-San'ani, on the authority of Ibn Abbas, he said: The Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, was born on a Monday, was commissioned as a Prophet on a Monday, left Mecca migrating to Medina on a Monday, arrived in Medina on a Monday, lifted the Stone on a Monday, and passed away on a Monday.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2078 - My father told me, he said Affan told us, he said Hammad told us, he said Ammar bin Abi Ammar informed us, on the authority of Ibn Abbas, he said: The Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, stayed in Mecca for fifteen years: seven years seeing the light and hearing the voice, and eight years receiving revelation. And he stayed in Medina for ten years.
2079 - I read to my father: Waki' said, Sufyan told us, on the authority of Abd al-Karim al-Jazari, on the authority of a man, on the authority of Ibn Umar, he said: "The apostate is asked to repent for three [days]." I read to my father: Ibn Mahdi said, Sufyan said regarding the Hadith of the apostate: "He is Abu Umayyah, Sufyan narrated it to me." My father said: We copied it from the book of Al-Ashja'i—meaning what Ibn al-Ashja'i gave them from his father's books—on the authority of Sufyan, on the authority of Abd al-Karim al-Basri. My father said: He is Abu Umayyah, similar to this Hadith.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2080 - I read to my father: Abu Nu'aym said, Sufyan told us, on the authority of Ibrahim bin Uqbah, on the authority of Sa'id bin al-Musayyib, he said: "If it enters his stomach, it prohibits (marriage), and I do not say as Ibn Abbas said." I read to my father: Ibn Mahdi said, I asked Sufyan about the Hadith of Ibrahim—meaning Ibn Uqbah—regarding breastfeeding, meaning this Hadith, and he said: "I did not hear it; Ma'mar narrated it to me from him."
2081 - And I heard my father say: Mu'adh bin Mu'adh erred in the Hadith of Ikrimah bin Ammar from Damdam bin Jaws al-Hazzani—this is what Mu'adh said. My father said: Mu'adh erred; it is al-Haffani.
2082 - My father told me, he said Ismail bin Ibrahim told us, he said Ayyub informed us, on the authority of Muhammad, he said: I met Abu Ghallab Yunus bin Jubayr al-Bahili, and he was reliable.
2083 - My father told me, he said Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi told us, he said I heard Sufyan say regarding a man who marries a Magian woman or a woman in her waiting period: "From Jabir from Hammad." And I heard him say regarding injuries less than the *Muwaddihah*: "From Jabir from Hammad." And I heard him say: "The Jewish woman and the slave girl are not granted Muhsan status": "From Jabir from Hammad."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2084 - And Sufyan said regarding the Hadith of the apostate: Abd al-Karim said: "He is Abu Umayyah, Sufyan narrated it to me."
2085 - My father told me, he said Muhammad bin Ja'far told us, he said Shu'bah told us, on the authority of Furat, he said I heard Abu Hazim say: I sat with Abu Hurairah for five years.
2086 - My father told me, he said Al-Fadl bin Dukain told us, he said Yunus—meaning Ibn Abi Ishaq—told us, on the authority of Hilal bin Khabbab Abu al-Ala.
2087 - My father told me, he said Abu al-Mughirah told us, he said: I said to Abu Bakr: "You narrate to us from Habib bin Ubaid attributing it to Awf bin Malik al-Ashja'i?" He said: He said: "I heard Habib say: I met eighty-odd men from the Companions." And I asked Abu Bakr: "I see Humaid bin Uqbah as an old man, and you narrate from him from Abu Darda?" He said: "He told me that everything he narrated to me from Abu Darda, he heard it from Abu Darda."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2088 - My father told me, he said Sufyan told us, on the authority of Al-Zuhri, he heard it from Anas: "The Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, arrived while I was ten, and died while I was twenty. My mothers used to urge me to serve him." And Sufyan said once: "Al-Zuhri said: Anas informed us."
2089 - My father told me, he said Abd al-Razzaq told us, he said Ubaidullah bin Umar informed us, on the authority of Nafi', he said: Umar bin Abd al-Aziz asked me about something—which he named—so I said: "I asked Al-Mughirah bin Hakim about it." So Umar bin Abd al-Aziz said: "He is just and trustworthy."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2090 - My father told me, he said Abd al-Razzaq told us, he said Ibn Jurayj informed us, he said: The name of the sword of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, was Dhu al-Fiqar, and the name of his armor was Dhat al-Fudul—or al-Fusul (Abd al-Razzaq doubted). Ibn Jurayj said: His sword was decorated with silver. Ibn Jurayj said: Muhammad bin Murrah informed me of that.
2091 - My father told me, he said Abd al-Razzaq told us, he said Ibn Jurayj informed us, he said: I was informed from Anas bin Malik that he said: The pommel cap of the sword of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, was of silver.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2092 - My father told me, he said Abd al-Razzaq told us, he said Ibn Jurayj informed us, he said Ja'far bin Muhammad informed me, on the authority of his father, that the name of the sword of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, was Dhu al-Fiqar.
2093 - My father told me, he said Abd al-Razzaq told us, he said Ibn Jurayj informed us, he said Ja'far bin Muhammad informed me, he said: I saw the sword of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him; its hilt was of silver, its chape was of silver, and between that were rings of silver. He said: And it is with these people now—meaning the family of Abbas.
2094 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, he said some of our companions told us that the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, selected on the Day of Badr the sword of Munabbih bin al-Hajjaj, which was called Dhu al-Fiqar.
2095 - My father told me, he said Ibrahim bin Ishaq told us, he said Abdullah bin Mubarak told us, he said Al-Hakam bin Hisham told me, he said: I asked about him in Mecca, and they said: "You are asking about a man who accuses himself [of deficiency]." He said: Al-Fudail bin Ghazwan told me, he said Mu al-Khurasani told me while we were circumambulating the House, he said: "We fought the Turks..."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2096 - My father told me, he said Muhammad bin Bakr al-Bursani told us, he said Ubaidullah bin Abi Ziyad al-Qaddah Abu al-Husain informed me, he said Mujahid told us.
2097 - My father told me, he said Aswad bin Amir told us, he said Huraym informed us, he said Ibn Ishaq told me, on the authority of Abd al-Rahman bin al-Qasim, on the authority of his father, on the authority of Aisha, she said: The Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, passed away on Monday and was buried on the night of Wednesday.
2098 - My father told me, he said Abu Sa'id Mawla Bani Hashim told us, he said Abbad bin Rashid told us, he said Al-Hasan told us, he said: My father told us at that time, while we were in Medina.
2099 - My father told me, he said Yazid bin Harun told us, he said Abu Utbah Bakr al-A'naq informed us.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text: 2100 - I found in my father's book: Abu Mu'awiyah al-Ghallabi told us, he said Mu'adh—meaning Ibn Mu'adh—told us, he said Qurrah bin Khalid told me, he said: We had a woman in the tribe whose soul was taken up [in sleep/coma], so she remained for seven [days] not returning, except that they found a vein pulsing in her jugular. He said: Then she returned. Ja'far bin al-Zubair had died in those days. So she said: "What happened to Ja'far bin al-Zubair?" He said: "He died in these days." She said: "I saw him in the lowest heaven, and the angels were giving each other glad tidings about him. I recognized him in his shrouds, and they were saying: 'The doer of good has come, the doer of good has come.'" So Qurrah said to me: "Go and hear it from her." I said: "What would I do hearing it from her when you have narrated it to me?" He said: Ja'far bin al-Zubair was a man of raids/campaigns when he was a young man, but when he aged and grew old, he strove hard in worship.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2101 - I found in my father's book: Abu Mu'awiyah al-Ghallabi told us, he said: A man from Quraysh told me, he said: Iyas b. Mu'awiyah said: 'It does not please me that I tell a lie which Allah would forgive me for and for which I would be given ten thousand dirhams, while my father Mu'awiyah b. Qurrah knows about it.' 2102 - My father told me, he said: Mu'awiyah b. Amr told us, he said: Abu Ishaq—meaning Al-Fazari—told us from Muhammad b. Abi Hafsah from Al-Zuhri from Ubaydullah b. Abd Allah from Ibn Abbas, he said: 'The Conquest [of Mecca] was when thirteen [nights] had passed of Ramadan.' 2103 - I heard my father say: Ibn Awn did not hear from Ikrimah except this: Mu'adh b. Mu'adh told us, he said: Ibn Awn informed us, he said: I asked Ikrimah, the Mawla of Ibn Abbas, regarding His saying, Mighty and Majestic: {O you who have believed, do not ask about things which, if they are shown to you, will distress you} [Al-Ma'idah: 101]. 2104 - I heard my father mention Mu'adh, and he said: 'He was a rock due to the intensity of his intellect; he was very intelligent.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2105 - My father told me, he said: Mu'adh told us, he said: Ibn Awn told us from Muslim, a Mawla of Abd al-Qays, he said: Shu'bah used to say 'Sari'. 2106 - My father told me, he said: Mu'adh told us, he said: Al-Aghdaf Amr b. al-Walid told us, he said: I said to Abbad b. Mansur: 'Who told you that Ubayy b. Ka'b rejected Ibn Mas'ud regarding his hadith about Qadar (Divine Decree)?' He said: 'A man I do not know told me it.' I said: 'Then I know him.' He said: 'Who is he?' I said: 'Satan.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2107 - My father told me, he said: Mu'tamar b. Sulayman b. Tarkhan al-Taymi Abu Muhammad told us from Burd, he said: The servant girl used to come to Abdah b. Abi Lubabah with papyrus, and he would say: 'We do not write in the *Astarah* (scrolls)'—meaning Hadith. 2108 - My father told me, he said: Mu'tamar b. Sulayman told us from Burd, he said: They used to gather around Ata during the seasons [of Hajj], and Sulayman b. Musa was the one who would ask on their behalf. 2109 - My father told me, he said: Ibrahim b. Khalid told us, he said: Umar b. Abd al-Rahman told me from Wahb, he said: 'When death approached Dawud, he appointed Sulayman as successor. He said: And Sulayman reigned for forty years.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2110 - My father told me, he said: Yunus told us, he said: Hammad—meaning Ibn Salamah—told us from Amr b. Dinar, he said: 'I saw the image of Isa b. Maryam and Maryam in the Ka'bah, and I saw the head of the ram in the Ka'bah.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2111 - My father told me, he said: Yusuf b. Ya'qub told us—and my father said: I have not seen anyone in Iraq older than Yusuf b. Abi Salamah al-Majishun Abu Salamah—he said: 'I was born during the reign of Sulayman b. Abd al-Malik, and a stipend was assigned to me while I was young, like the fighters. When Umar b. Abd al-Aziz took charge, the registry (Diwan) was presented to him. He passed by my name and said: How well I know the birth of this boy! This is a young one and not of those eligible for stipends. So he counted me as a dependent child.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2112 - My father told me, he said: Abd al-Razzaq told us from Ma'mar, he said: Simak b. al-Fadl said to me: 'Come, let us count every bore (heavy/dull person) in Sana'a, O Abu Urwah.' I said: 'Whom have you counted?' He said: So he mentioned a man. And Salamah said Abd al-Razzaq said the same and mentioned Muhammad b. Majan. 2113 - My father told me, he said: Ibrahim b. Khalid told us, he said: My uncle Umar b. Ubayd told me from Simak b. al-Fadl, he said: I heard Wahb b. Munabbih say: 'There is no person among people whom I wish on a [given] day that his character was mine, and verily I inspect my own character and find nothing in it that pleases me.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2114 - My father told me, he said: Attab b. Ziyad told us, he said: Abdullah—meaning Ibn al-Mubarak—told me from Abu Mus'ab, the companion of Al-Sha'bi, he said: I mentioned to Al-A'mash the hadith of Abu Janab from Ibn Abbas regarding Zakat. He said: 'Do you know what Allah mentioned?' I said: 'I do not know.' He said: 'Allah commanded...' 2115 - I asked my father about a Shaykh whom my father narrated to us from, called Ali b. Abi Isra'il, who narrated from Abu Ishaq al-Fazari. He said: 'A trustworthy Shaykh.' 2116 - My father told me, he said: Ibrahim b. Habib b. al-Shahid Abu Ishaq al-Azdi al-Ataki told us, he said: My father told us from Ikrimah, he said: 'A mound in Yemen was dug up, and lo, there was a grave in it, and lo, in it was a writing: The grave of Hubbi and Radwa, daughters of Tubba', they died not associating anything with Allah.' 2117 - My father told me, he said: Umayyah b. Khalid told us, Hammad b. Zaid said: I heard him—and he mentioned from a man from Muhammad [Ibn Sirin]—he said: I said to the Mawla of Ibn Abbas—meaning Ikrimah—'Tell me about the first thing revealed of the Qur'an,' or 'Tell me how the Qur'an was revealed.' He did not tell me, so I knew that he did not know.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2118 - My father told me, he said: Hisham b. Lahiq al-Mada'ini told us, he said: Asim told us from Abdullah b. Sarjis, he said: 'I saw the Seal [of Prophethood] on the cartilage of the shoulder of the Prophet (peace be upon him) like warts.' 2119 - My father told me, he said: I was informed from Abu Ismail al-Mu'addib from Asim from Abu Uthman al-Nahdi, Abd al-Rahman b. Mull. 2120 - My father told me, he said: Bakr b. Isa told us, he said: Abu Awanah told us from Asim from Abu Uthman—meaning Al-Nahdi—he said: 'I performed Hajj to Yaghuth in the Jahiliyyah, worshipped Dhu al-Khalasah, and circled the idols. And I have believed in the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him).' He said: I said: 'Did you see Abu Bakr?' He said: 'No.' He said: I said: 'Did you see Umar?' He said: 'I saw Umar; I came to him when he was appointed Caliph.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2121 - My father told me, he said: Ibn Mahdi told us from Abu Awanah and Bakr b. Isa, he said: Abu Awanah told us from Asim al-Ahwal from Abu Uthman from Salman, he said: 'The interval (*Fatrah*) between Isa and Muhammad, may Allah's peace be upon them both, was six hundred years.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: (Part Four of the book Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal by Abu Abd Allah Ahmad b. Muhammad b. Hanbal, may Allah have mercy on him).

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. Abdullah b. Ahmad b. Muhammad b. Hanbal told us, he said: 2122 - My father told us, he said: Bakr b. Isa al-Rasibi Abu Bishr told us, he said: Abu Awanah told us, he said: Abu Malik al-Ashja'i told us, he said: I heard my father—and I asked him—he said: 'Our dye with the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) was Wars and Saffron.' 2123 - My father told me, he said: Abu Mu'awiyah told us, he said: Hisham told us: 'I asked him about what was mentioned regarding the affair of Al-Hasan concerning Qadar (Divine Decree). He said: They lied. They only caught the Sheikh off guard with a word and then attributed it against him.' 2124 - Ubaydullah b. Umar al-Qawariri told me, he said: Hammad b. Zaid told us from Ibn Awn, he said: Raja' b. Haywah said to me: 'What is this that has reached us about Al-Hasan regarding Qadar?' He said: I said: 'Verily, they lie against Al-Hasan often. Verily, they lie against Al-Hasan often.' Hammad said: 'May Allah have mercy on Abu Awn, he has indeed exonerated him.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2125 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us, he said: Umar b. Abi Za'idah informed us from Al-Sha'bi, he said: 'Abu Bakr was a poet, Umar was a poet, and Ali used to compose poetry and was the most poetic of them.' 2126 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us, he said: Mughirah informed us from Abu Wa'il, he said: 'The collector [of Zakat] of the Prophet (peace be upon him) came to us. He said: He used to take one she-camel for every fifty camels. He said: So I brought him a ram and said: Take the charity of this one. He said: There is no charity [due/accepted] in this.' 2127 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us from Sayyar from Abu Wa'il, he said: 'Neither a sexually impure person (Junub) nor a menstruating woman should recite the Qur'an.' My father said: 'Hushaym did not hear it from Sayyar.' 2128 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us from Abu Abd al-Rahman from Qatadah, he said: I mentioned that to Sa'id b. al-Musayyib, so he said: '[The hermaphrodite] inherits from the place of urination.' I said: 'What if it comes out from both of them together?' He said: 'From whichever of them it comes out first.' I asked my father: 'Who is this Abu Abd al-Rahman?' He said: 'I think he is Sa'id b. Bashir.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2129 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us from Khalid from Ibn Sirin, and Mughirah from Ibrahim, and Abu Ishaq from Al-Sha'bi, that they said regarding three people who killed a man: 'He said to his guardian that he may take the blood money from whomever he wishes and pardon whomever he wishes.' I heard my father say: 'Hushaym did not hear from any one of them. It is narrated from the hadith of Mughirah, but it is from another hadith other than Mughirah; it is actually from the hadith of Jabir al-Ju'fi.' 2130 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us, he said: Ismail b. Salim informed us, he said: I heard Al-Sha'bi say: 'The night of the seventeenth of Ramadan is the Night of Criterion (*Al-Furqan*), the day the two armies met.' 2131 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us from Abu Balj, he said: Muhammad b. Hatib said to us: 'Where do you think I was born?' We said: 'In Sham and Iraq, in such-and-such place.' He said: 'I was born in Abyssinia.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2132 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us from Mughirah from Ibrahim, he said: 'Ali is more beloved to me than Uthman, and that I should fall from the sky is more beloved to me than that I should disparage him'—meaning Uthman. I heard my father say: 'Hushaym did not hear it from Mughirah.' 2133 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us from Sayyar from Abu Wa'il, he said: Abdullah b. Mas'ud said: 'I wish that Allah had forgiven me and that I was not known by any lineage.' I heard my father say: 'Hushaym did not hear it from Sayyar.' 2134 - Abu Abd al-Rahman said: Some of our companions told me, he said: Hushaym said: 'I sought Hadith for twenty years, and I sat with the people and discussed with them for twenty years. So if I say to you "He told us" (*Haddathana*) and "He informed us" (*Akhbarana*), then hold onto it tightly with your hands.' 2135 - Abu Abd Allah informed us by license (*Ijazah*), he said: My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us from Mughirah from Ibrahim, he said: 'The blood money (*Aql*) is upon the people of the registry (*Diwan*).' 2136 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us from Mughirah, he said: 'Talq used to soften [food for] his mother.' I heard my father say: 'Hushaym did not hear these two from Mughirah.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2137 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us, he said: Ya'la b. Ata informed us from Abdullah b. Nafi'. My father said: 'It is actually Abdullah b. Yasar Abu Hammam, but Hushaym said this.' 2138 - I heard my father say: Hushaym told us, he said: Mansur—meaning Ibn Zadhan—informed us from Nafi' that a woman accompanied a group on a journey. I heard my father say: 'Mansur did not hear anything from Nafi'.' 2139 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us from Mughirah from Simak—meaning Ibn Salamah—he said: 'I saw Ibn Umar and Ibn Abbas sitting cross-legged in prayer.' I heard my father say: 'Hushaym did not hear it from Mughirah.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2140 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us from Mughirah from Ibrahim, he said: 'Ablution with swamp water (*Al-Tarq*) is more beloved to me than dry ablution (*Tayammum*).' I heard my father say: 'Hushaym did not hear it from Mughirah, and Mughirah narrated it from Hammad.' 2141 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us, he said: Abu Bishr informed us, he said: I said to Abu Sufyan: 'Why do I not see you narrating from Jabir just as Sulayman al-Yashkuri narrates?' He said: 'Verily Sulayman used to write, and I did not write.' I heard my father say: 'Hushaym narrated to us some hadiths in the house of his son Sa'id, in his home, and this hadith was among them.' 2142 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us from Juwaybir from Dahhak from Ali, he said: 'The dowry cannot be less than ten [dirhams].' I heard my father say: 'Hushaym did not hear it from Juwaybir.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2143 - I heard my father say: Hushaym told us from Abu Bishr from Ata: I said to Ibn Abbas: 'Shall I ask permission to enter upon my mother and my sister?' He said: 'Ask permission.' I heard my father say: 'Hushaym did not hear it from Abu Bishr.' 2144 - My father told me, he said: I heard Hushaym say: 'Shirk is one religion (*Millah*).' It was said to him: 'Shu'bah from whom?' He said: 'From Hammad.' 2145 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us, he said: Mujahid claimed from Al-Sha'bi, he said: 'Ziyad used to spend the winter in Basra and take Shuraih with him, and spend the summer in Kufa.' 2146 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us, he said: Iyas b. Mu'awiyah used to make many grammatical errors. So Sufyan b. Husayn, our companion, said to him: 'If only you looked into this Arabic [grammar].' He said: 'So I would perhaps prompt him with a letter or a thing.' He said: 'Then I met him and he said: You have constricted my speech; I have no need for it.' 2147 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us, he said: And Ismail b. Abi Khalid had met the Companions of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him), but he made terrible grammatical errors. He said: He used to say: 'So-and-so told me from *Abuh* [instead of *Abihi*].' 2148 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us from Khalid b. Salamah al-Makhzumi, he said: 'I saw Ibrahim al-Nakha'i, and I saw a man who made grammatical errors.' I heard my father say: 'Hushaym did not hear it from Khalid b. Salamah.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2149 - I heard my father say: 'These two hadiths Hushaym heard from Jabir al-Ju'fi, and everything he narrated from Jabir is *Mudallas* (concealed source) except these two.' My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us, he said: Jabir al-Ju'fi informed us from Abu Ja'far from Ibn Abbas: That the Prophet (peace be upon him) passed by a boiling pot, so he took a bone (with meat) or a shoulder from it and ate it, then prayed and did not perform ablution. 2150 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us from Jabir—my father said: And it is among what he heard from him—from Al-Hasan b. Musafir from Abu Sabrah al-Nakha'i, he said: When Umar arrived in Sham, he was brought food. When he finished, he was brought a linen cloth—or he said a Saburi cloth—and they said: 'Wipe your hand with it.' He said: 'If this suffices a man of the Muslims...' and he refused to wipe his hand with it. He said: 'When the prayer time came, he prayed and did not perform ablution.' 2151 - Abu Abd al-Rahman said: My father said: 'Hushaym died when I was twenty years old. I used to memorize from his hadith what I heard from him and what I did not hear.' So I said to him: 'How did you memorize what you did not hear?' He said: 'I used to hear our companions discussing them.' 2152 - And I heard my father say: Hushaym would say one day 'He told us' (*Haddathana*) and 'He informed us' (*Akhbarana*), then he would recall that he did not hear [it directly], so he would say: 'O Sabah, tell them to widen the road so the boy and the woman can pass.' Then he would say: 'So-and-so from Yunus, and So-and-so from Mughirah.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2153 - I heard my father say: Hushaym told us, from Abu Hashim, from Abu Mijlaz, from Qais bin Abbad, from Abu Sa'id al-Khudri, who said: If a man performs ablution and says 'Glory be to You, O Allah, and with Your praise' (Subhanaka Allahumma wa bihamdika). My father said: Hushaym did not hear it from Abu Hashim.
2154 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, on the authority of Khulaid bin Ja'far, on the authority of Abu Iyas, that Uthman bin Affan said regarding transferred debts if they are lost (unpaid): 'There is no loss upon the property of a Muslim.' I heard my father say: And Hushaym did not hear anything from Khulaid.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2155 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, on the authority of Al-A'mash, on the authority of Abu Wa'il, on the authority of Abdullah, he said: We did not perform ablution from what was trodden on. I heard my father say: Hushaym did not hear this from Al-A'mash, nor did Al-A'mash hear it from Abu Wa'il.
2156 - I heard my father say: Hushaym told us, Ismail bin Salim told us that the letter of Umar bin Abd al-Aziz came to them while they were in Herat regarding charity he ordered.
2157 - I heard my father say: Hajjaj told us, on the authority of Yazid bin Imran. I asked my father about Yazid bin Imran, and he said: I do not know him.
2158 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, on the authority of Atiyyah Abu Wahb, he said: When we came to Al-Hasan, he would say: 'May Allah greet you with peace and settle us and you in the Abode of Peace.' I asked my father about this Atiyyah, and he said: He is a Sheikh of theirs, from Wasit; Yazid—meaning Ibn Harun—narrated from him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2159 - My father told me, he said Abd al-Razzaq told us, on the authority of Imran—and he is Abu al-Hudhail—he said I heard Wahb say: Job (Ayyub) was afflicted with the trial for seven years, Joseph (Yusuf) stayed in prison for seven years, and Nebuchadnezzar was punished around beasts for seven years.
2160 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, Al-Khasib bin Zaid al-Tamimi informed us, he said Al-Hasan told us. I asked my father about Al-Khasib, and he said: Trustworthy (Thiqah).
2161 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, on the authority of Sayyar, on the authority of Abd al-Rahman bin Tharwan, on the authority of Shuraih: 'He has indeed left a doubt/worry in the hearts of the pious regarding it'—meaning regarding the man who starts with divorce before the oath. I heard my father say: Hushaym did not hear it from Sayyar.
2162 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, on the authority of Mughirah, on the authority of Ibrahim, he said: The first to accept Islam was Abu Bakr. I heard my father say: Hushaym did not hear it from Mughirah.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2163 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, on the authority of Mughirah, on the authority of Al-Harith al-Ukli, that he used to say: If a man arrives at the funeral and the Imam has already said Takbir, he should not say Takbir until the Imam says Takbir. I heard my father say: Hushaym did not hear it from Mughirah.
2164 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, on the authority of Abu Bishr, on the authority of Abu Nadrah, on the authority of Abu Sa'id, that he used to say: 'Discuss Hadith, for Hadith incites one another.' I heard my father say: And Hushaym did not hear it from Abu Bishr; this is the Hadith of Shu'bah.
2165 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, on the authority of Hajjaj, on the authority of Ata, that he disliked locusts killed by the cold (Al-Sarr). I heard my father say: Hushaym did not hear it from Hajjaj.
2166 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, on the authority of Zadhan Abu Mansur, he said: I saw the head of Al-Husain bin Ali when Ibn Ziyad brought it, and it was dyed black. I heard my father say: Hushaym did not hear it from Zadhan.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2167 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, he said Mughirah informed us, on the authority of Ibrahim, that Alqamah used the Kunyah Abu Shibl, though he had no children.
2168 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, on the authority of Mansur, on the authority of Al-Hasan regarding [exchanging] broken glass for whole glass, where the broken is more [in weight/quantity]. He saw no harm in that if it was hand to hand, but Ibn Sirin disliked that. I heard my father say: Hushaym did not hear it from Mansur.
2169 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, on the authority of Mujalid, on the authority of Al-Sha'bi, that Umar bin al-Khattab advised regarding his governors not to dismiss them for a year. He said: And they kept Al-Ash'ari for four years. I heard my father say: I think Hushaym heard it from Haitham bin Adi.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2170 - I heard my father say: Hushaym told us, he said Uthman Abu Amr al-Basri, who is called Al-Batti, told us.
2171 - I heard my father say: Hushaym told us, on the authority of Ya'la bin Ata, on the authority of Abdullah bin Sufyan al-Thaqafi, on the authority of his father, that a man said: O Messenger of Allah—and Hushaym said: I said: O Messenger of Allah—command me with a command in Islam about which I will ask no one after you. My father said: Hushaym did not hear it from Ya'la bin Ata.
2172 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, on the authority of Mujalid, on the authority of Al-Sha'bi, he said: They agreed not to write 'In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful' in front of poetry. I heard my father say: Hushaym did not hear it from Mujalid.
2173 - I heard my father say: Hushaym told us, he said Hisham bin Yusuf told us, he said I heard Abdullah bin Busr, a Levantine (Shami); Hisham bin Yusuf said: I heard Abdullah bin Busr.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2174 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, on the authority of Yunus, on the authority of Amr bin Sa'id, he said: Sadaqat al-Fitr was mentioned before Al-Sha'bi days after Shawwal had begun, so he said: 'I haven't paid it yet.' I heard my father say: Hushaym did not hear it from Yunus.
2175 - Abdullah told me: Amr al-Naqid told us, he said Sufyan bin Uyainah told us, on the authority of Amr bin Dinar, that Ibn al-Zubair would not leave anything but that he opposed them—meaning Banu Umayyah—in it. He said: So I said, 'O Abu Muhammad, did you hear it from Amr?' He said: He said: 'Look at him, he doesn't take it easily; Al-Ala from Amr bin Dinar.' He said: So I said, 'O Abu Muhammad, did you hear it from Al-Ala?' He said: He said: 'Look, he doesn't take it easily; Al-Ala from Silm bin Qutaibah from Amr bin Dinar.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2176 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, on the authority of Mughirah, on the authority of Ibrahim, and Laith, on the authority of Mujahid, that they both disliked a man tying a string on his ring to remember something by it. I heard my father say: He did not hear it from either of them.
2177 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, on the authority of Amr bin Dinar, on the authority of Jabir bin Zaid, he said: I asked the Sea—meaning Ibn Abbas—about the meat of domestic donkeys. He said: He recited this verse: {Say, "I do not find within that which was revealed to me [anything] forbidden..."} to the end of the verse [Al-An'am: 145]. I heard my father say: Hushaym did not hear it from Amr.
2178 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, on the authority of Sayyar, on the authority of Al-Sha'bi, that he left the bathhouse and didn't wash his feet. It was mentioned to him regarding that, so he said: 'Which man is looked at [more than me]?' I heard my father say: Hushaym did not hear it from Sayyar.
2179 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, he said Ibn Awn informed us, he said: I was with Ibn Sirin and he wanted [to go to] the mosque. A man met him and said: 'Where do you want [to go]?' He said: He didn't tell him.
2180 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, he said Al-Awwam informed us, on the authority of Mujahid, he said: 'If people differ on something, look at what Umar did and take it.'
2181 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, on the authority of Sayyar, on the authority of Al-Sha'bi, similar to that.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2182 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, he said Abu Hurrah informed us, on the authority of Al-Hasan, he said: I saw women from the women of Medina praying in [garments] dyed with woad (Wasmah).
2183 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, he said Husayn informed us, on the authority of Al-Sha'bi, he said: I asked Ibn Umar about dyeing with woad, but he didn't know it. He said: I said: 'With Henna and Katam.' He said: 'That is the dye of the people of Tihamah.'
2184 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, he said Juwaibir informed us, on the authority of Al-Dahhak, on the authority of Abdullah bin Mas'ud, he said: We used not to write anything of the Hadith during the time of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, except the Tashahhud and Istikharah.
2185 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, on the authority of Ziyad Abu Umar, on the authority of Salih Abu al-Khalil, that the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, ordered the cutting of swings (Marajih). I heard my father say: Hushaym did not hear anything from Ziyad Abu Umar.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2186 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, on the authority of Yunus, on the authority of Al-Hasan and Ibn Sirin, that they both disliked selling weapons during tribulations (Fitan). I heard my father say: Hushaym did not hear it from Yunus.
2187 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, he said Ibn Awn informed us, he said: We entered upon Al-Hasan and he brought out a book to us from Samurah; and in it was: 'A morning drink (Sabuh) or an evening drink (Ghabuq) suffices in necessity.'
2188 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, he said Al-Kalbi informed us that Mary gave birth to Jesus at nine months.
2189 - I heard my father say: Hushaym told us, on the authority of Ali bin Zaid, on the authority of Ayyub al-Lakhmi, on the authority of Ibn Umar, that a slave girl fell to his lot on the day of Jalula, as if her neck were a silver pitcher. He said: I couldn't wait, so I stood up to her and kissed her while the people were looking. I heard my father say: Hushaym did not hear it from Ali bin Zaid.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2190 - I heard Al-Qawariri say: Waki' wrote to Hushaym: 'It has reached me that you spoil your hadith with this Tadlis that you do.' So he wrote to him: 'In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. Your two teachers used to do it: Al-A'mash and Sufyan.'
2191 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, he said Al-Kalbi informed us, on the authority of Abu Salih, on the authority of Ibn Abbas, that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, assigned two shares for the horse and one share for the man on the day of Khaybar.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2192 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, he said: And Ubaidullah bin Umar from Nafi' from Ibn Umar from the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, similar to that. I heard my father say: Hushaym did not hear it from Ubaidullah.
2193 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, he said Hajjaj informed us, on the authority of Ata, he said: I saw Aisha wearing a rose-colored garment while she was in Ihram.
2194 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, on the authority of Abu Hamzah, he said: I saw Ibn Abbas dyeing [his hair] with red.
2195 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, he said Ismail informed us, on the authority of Qais bin Abu Hazim, on the authority of Shubayl bin Awf, he said: It was said to Umar bin al-Khattab that Mudrik bin Awf sold his soul [martyred himself] on the day of Nahawand.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2196 - My father told me, he said Yazid—meaning Ibn Harun—told us, he said Ismail informed us, on the authority of Qais, on the authority of Mudrik bin Awf, that he was sitting with Umar. They mentioned to Umar the affair of Al-Nu'man bin al-Muqarrin, and so-and-so, and so-and-so, and others whom we do not know. So he said: 'But Allah knows them, and a man who sold his soul for Allah.' Mudrik bin Awf said: 'That, by Allah, is my maternal uncle, O Commander of the Faithful.'
2197 - My father told me, he said Waki' told us, he said Ismail told us, on the authority of Qais, he said: They mentioned in the presence of Umar a man who sold his soul. Mudrik bin Awf al-Ahmasi said: 'O Commander of the Faithful, [he is] my maternal uncle. People claim that he threw himself into destruction.' He said: 'Those people lied; rather, he is of those who bought the Hereafter with the world.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2198 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, on the authority of Ibn Abi Layla, on the authority of Ata, he said: I came to Aisha with Ubaid bin Umair. He said: Ubaid asked her about the saying of Allah Almighty {Allah will not impose blame upon you for what is meaningless in your oaths}. Aisha said: 'It is a man saying "No, by Allah" and "Yes, by Allah" as long as he does not intend it in his heart.'
2199 - I heard my father say: Hushaym told us, he said Husayn informed us, on the authority of Al-Sha'bi, he said Adi bin Hatim told us, he said: When this verse was revealed {And eat and drink...}.
2200 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, he said Abu Bishr claimed, on the authority of Sa'id bin Jubayr regarding the saying of Allah Almighty {Indeed, We offered the Trust...} the verse. My father said: Hushaym did not hear it from Abu Bishr.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2201 - I heard my father say: Hushaym did not hear the hadith of Mughirah from Ibrahim regarding His saying {By whom you ask one another}; Hushaym did not hear it from Mughirah.
2202 - I heard my father say: Hushaym did not hear from Al-Zuhri the hadith of Ali bin Husain, from Amr bin Uthman, from Usamah bin Zaid, from the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him: 'People of two different religions do not inherit from each other.' My father said: Yet Hushaym narrated it to us.
2203 - I heard my father say: Hushaym did not hear from Al-Zuhri the hadith of Salim, from his father, from the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, that he used to raise his hands when he said Takbir.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2204 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, on the authority of Mughirah, on the authority of Ibrahim, he said: They used to like for a young man to have a youthful passion (Sabwah). I heard my father say: It has no basis.
2205 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, he said Yunus informed us from Al-Hasan, and Ismail bin Abi Khalid from Al-Sha'bi, and Al-Mughirah from Ibrahim, that they said regarding the blood money for accidental killing: 'In fifths regarding what is less than a life.' I heard my father say: Yahya bin Sa'id said regarding this hadith of Ismail: Ismail did not hear it from Al-Sha'bi.
2206 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, he said Ibn Awn informed us, he said: Ibn Sirin and Al-Qasim bin Muhammad used to narrate exactly as they heard. He said: And Al-Hasan and Al-Sha'bi used to narrate the meaning.
2207 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, he said: I was informed by one who heard Al-Hakam being asked about paying in advance (Salaf) in Fulus (copper coins), and he saw no harm in it. I heard my father say: This is Abu Shaibah Ibrahim bin Uthman.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2208 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, on the authority of Laith, on the authority of Mujahid, and Mughirah, on the authority of Ibrahim, that they both disliked the guardian of the deceased walking with his funeral procession close to his bed without a cloak (Rida). I heard my father say: Hushaym did not hear it from Laith nor from Mughirah.
2209 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, on the authority of Hajjaj, on the authority of Al-Hakam regarding one who bequeaths to the children of so-and-so, and there is a pregnancy among them: Should the pregnancy be given if born?
2210 - My father told us, he said Hushaym told us, on the authority of Al-Hajjaj, on the authority of Al-Hakam, on the authority of Ibrahim, that he said regarding a man who gets a nosebleed while in the mosque: He said: 'He leaves, performs ablution, and does not build upon his prayer except in that mosque.' I heard my father say: One of these two hadiths Hushaym did not hear from Al-Hajjaj. Abu Abd al-Rahman said: And I think it is the hadith of Hajjaj from Al-Hakam from Ibrahim.
2211 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, on the authority of Abu Bishr, on the authority of Sa'id bin Jubayr, he said: He saw a woman circumambulating counting her rounds with pebbles she put in her palm. Whenever she completed a round, he said: He threw them from her palm. I heard my father say: My father [Hushaym?] did not hear it from Hushaym.
2212 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, on the authority of Mughirah, on the authority of Abu Razin, he said: There is no harm in dodder (Kushuth). I heard my father say: Hushaym did not hear it from Mughirah.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2213 - I heard my father say: Hushaym did not hear this word from Ya'la bin Ata in the hadith of Jabir bin Yazid bin Al-Aswad, from his father, that the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, led them in the morning prayer and then turned away (Inharafa).
2214 - My father told me, on the authority of Hushaym, he said Abu Hamzah informed us, he said: I witnessed the death of Ibn Abbas in Ta'if. He said: Muhammad bin Al-Hanafiyyah took charge of him.
2215 - My father told me, he said I heard Hushaym say: We used only to say 'What is the saying of Al-Hasan regarding such and such'—meaning he would say 'Such and such'—meaning Yunus.
2216 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, on the authority of Mujalid, on the authority of Al-Sha'bi, he said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, used to greet the people when he ascended the pulpit.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text: 2217 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, on the authority of Mujalid, on the authority of Al-Sha'bi, he said: They agreed not to write 'In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful' in front of poetry. I heard my father say: Hushaym did not hear both of them from Mujalid—'In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful'. Abdullah bin Ahmad informed us by license, he said:

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2218 - I asked my father about a Sheikh Hushaym narrated from called Shabib bin Hawshab, he said: I asked Al-Qasim bin Muhammad what weapon a Muhrim can carry. He said: I do not know who he is, or I do not know him.
2219 - I heard my father say regarding the hadith of Hushaym, from Abu Bishr, from Sa'id bin Jubayr, from Ibn Abbas, that the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, was asked about the offspring of polytheists. My father said: Hushaym did not hear it from Abu Bishr.
2220 - My father told me, he said Hushaym told us, on the authority of Yunus, on the authority of Al-Hasan, he said regarding the inheritance of the apostate: 'It is for his family.' I heard my father say: Hushaym did not hear it from Yunus; this is the hadith of Yazid bin Zurai'.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2221 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us, he said: Ibn Awn informed us, he said: I mentioned to Ibn Sirin the saying of Ibrahim regarding the one from whom retaliation (*Qisas*) is sought, that he used to say: 'His blood money, if he dies, is upon the *'Aqilah* (male kin) of the one seeking retaliation.' He denied that and said: 'My father said: Consider the hadith.' He said: Then he narrated this hadith, the hadith of Ya'la. 2222 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us: Yunus also narrated it to us from Ibn Sirin similar to the hadith of Ya'la—meaning the hadith of Ya'la b. Umayyah: That a man bit the hand of another man, so the man pulled his hand away and some of the teeth of the biter fell out. They took their dispute to the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him)—and he mentioned the hadith—and he invalidated the blood money for his teeth. 2223 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us, he said: Ibn Awn and Ubaydah told us from Ibrahim that he used to say: 'The amount of the wound is lifted from the *'Aqilah* of the one seeking retaliation, and they guarantee whatever is beyond that.' 2224 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us from some of his companions from Matar al-Warraq from Al-Hasan from Al-Ahnaf b. Qays that Umar and Ali used to say: 'There is no blood money for him; it was a right that was his, so he took it.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2225 - Abu Abd al-Rahman said: Abu al-Rabi' al-Zahrani narrated it to us, he said: Hushaym told us, he said: Sa'id b. Abi Arubah told us from Matar from Al-Hasan from Al-Ahnaf b. Qays from Umar and Ali regarding a freeman who kills a slave. They said: 'His value is whatever it reaches.' I mentioned this to my father, and he denied that this is from the hadith of Sa'id b. Abi Arubah, and he said: 'We see that this is from the hadith of Abu Jazi.' 2226 - I mentioned to my father a hadith that Abu al-Rabi' al-Zahrani narrated to us, he said: Hushaym told us from Ubaydullah b. Abi Bakr from Anas that the Prophet (peace be upon him) used to break his fast on dates. He denied it being from the hadith of Hushaym from Ubaydullah. My father said: 'Hushaym only used to narrate it from Muhammad b. Ishaq from Hafs b. Ubaydullah b. Anas from Anas.' My father said: 'And Ali b. Asim is the one who narrated it to us from Ubaydullah b. Abi Bakr.' 2227 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us, he said: Khalid al-Hadhdha' informed us from Abu Qilabah from Abd al-Rahman b. Muhayriz, he said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'If you ask Allah, ask Him with the palms of your hands, and do not ask Him with the backs of them.' I heard my father say: Abd al-Rahman b. Abd Allah b. Muhayriz, the younger ones narrated from him, [like] Isma'il b. Ayyash. Abu Qilabah only narrates from *Abd Allah* b. Muhayriz, but thus said Khalid.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2228 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us, he said: Muhammad b. Qays told us from a Mawla of Quraysh from Al-Sha'bi, he said: 'It is not from *Muru'ah* (chivalry) to look into the mirror of the cupper.' I heard my father say: 'A strange (*Gharib*) hadith.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2229 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us, he said: Either Mughirah or Al-Hasan b. Ubaydullah from Ibrahim: He did not see any harm in shaking hands with a woman who has passed the age [of childbearing] from behind a cloth. I heard my father say: 'Hushaym did not hear it from Mughirah nor from Al-Hasan b. Ubaydullah.' 2230 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us from Mujalid from Al-Sha'bi that Ali and Umar used to not diminish/take anything from the *Fay'* (spoils acquired without fighting). I heard my father say: 'Hushaym did not hear it from Mujalid.' 2231 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us, he said: Some of our companions claimed from Qatadah from Anas that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'The lifespan of my Ummah is between fifty to sixty, and few of them reach seventy.' 2232 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us, he said: Some people of Madinah claimed—mentioning Safwan b. Sulaym and others—that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Verily Allah loves the sons of eighty (years old).'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2233 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us from Ayyub Abu al-Ala from Ata that he was asked about a sailor who is on a ship containing his family and his oven. He said: 'He prays four [rak'ahs].' I heard my father say: 'Hushaym did not hear it from Abu al-Ala. This is the hadith of Abu Shihab—meaning al-Hannat—Abu Shihab used to narrate it.' 2234 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us from Abu Bishr from Abu Nadrah from Abu Sa'id, he said: 'Discuss hadith, for verily hadith incites one another.' I heard my father say: 'Hushaym did not hear it from Abu Bishr'—meaning this hadith. 2235 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us from Isma'il b. Abi Khalid from Al-Sha'bi, he said: 'I do not know of anything a man leaves behind better for him than a little wealth by which his child is independent of people.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2236 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us from Layth Abu al-Musharrafi from Abu Ma'shar from Ibrahim that the Prophet (peace be upon him) used to handle his own pubic area with his hand when applying depilatory. I heard my father say: 'Hushaym did not hear anything from Layth Abu al-Musharrafi.' 2237 - Abu Bakr b. Abi Shaybah told us, he said: Sharik and Hushaym told us: Layth Abu al-Musharrafi said from Abu Ma'shar from Ibrahim, the like of it. 2238 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us from Musa al-Juhani from Al-Sha'bi, he said: 'There is no maintenance (*Nafaqah*) for a disobedient woman.' I heard my father say: 'Hushaym did not hear anything from Musa al-Juhani.' 2239 - My father told me, he said: Yahya b. Sa'id told us from Sufyan, he said: Tariq told me from Al-Sha'bi, he said: 'There is no maintenance for a disobedient woman.' My father said: It was said to Yahya that people narrate it from Musa al-Juhani. He said: 'If it were from Musa, it would be more beloved to me.' I said to my father: Abu Kurayb narrated it to us; he heard it from Al-Ashja'i from Sufyan from Musa al-Juhani and Tariq from Al-Sha'bi, he said: 'There is no maintenance for a disobedient woman.' My father liked this hadith. 2240 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us from Ya'la b. Ata from Amr b. al-Sharid from his father, he said: 'There was a leprous man in the delegation of Thaqif, so the Prophet (peace be upon him) sent to him: Go back, for we have accepted your allegiance.' I heard my father say: 'Hushaym heard it from Ya'la from a man from the family of Al-Sharid, and if he did not mention the news [explicitly], he said: From Amr b. al-Sharid.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2241 - Abu Bakr b. Abi Shaybah told us, he said: Sharik and Hushaym told us from Ya'la b. Ata from Amr b. al-Sharid from his father from the Prophet (peace be upon him), similar to it. 2242 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us, he said: Yahya b. Sa'id informed us from Muhammad b. Ibrahim b. al-Harith al-Taymi that the Prophet (peace be upon him) entered upon Aisha while she was playing with dolls/girls, and she had girls [dolls] with her. He said to her: 'What is this, O Aisha?' She said: 'These are the horses of Solomon.' He said: So he began laughing at her statement. I heard my father say: 'Strange (*Gharib*). We did not hear it from anyone other than Hushaym from Yahya b. Sa'id.' 2243 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us from Al-Taymi from Abu al-Duha, and [from] Al-Hasan b. Ubaydullah from Abu al-Duha: That a man came to Ibn Abbas and said: 'I ate Sahur, then when I doubted, I stopped.' Ibn Abbas said to him: 'Eat what you doubt until you do not doubt.' I heard my father say: 'Hushaym did not hear anything from Al-Taymi nor from Al-Hasan b. Ubaydullah'—meaning Hushaym did not hear anything from him [regarding this].

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2244 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us from Mughirah from Ibrahim that he said regarding the foundling (*Laqit*): 'His inheritance is like the status of lost property (*Luqatah*).' I heard my father say: 'Hushaym did not hear it from Mughirah.' 2245 - I heard my father say: 'Hushaym did not hear anything from Abu Sinan—meaning Dirar b. Murrah al-Shaybani. And my father narrated to us, he said: Hushaym told us from Abu Sinan something insignificant.' 2246 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us: Hajjaj mentioned—Ata claimed—he claimed that he did not see any harm in the sexually impure (*Junub*) and the menstruating woman washing the deceased. I heard my father say: 'Hushaym did not hear it from Hajjaj.' 2247 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us from Khalid from Ikrimah, he said: 'There was playfulness/humor in the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him).' I heard my father say: 'Hushaym did not hear it from Khalid b. Salamah.' 2248 - I heard my father say: 'Hushaym did not hear anything from Bayan.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2249 - I heard my father say: 'Hushaym did not hear from Muhammad b. Juhadah except this one hadith.' My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us from Muhammad b. Juhadah—my father said he heard it from him—from Al-Harith from Ibrahim: 'That he used to see no harm in the sick and the elderly man leaning during prayer, and he disliked it for others.' 2250 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us, he said: Abu Balj informed us from Amr b. Maymun from Abd Allah b. Amr that he said: 'The *Huqb* is eighty years.' 2251 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us from Yunus and Mubarak from Al-Hasan, he said: 'Utayy al-Sa'di informed me, he said: I saw Ubayy b. Ka'b with white hair and beard; he did not dye. 2252 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us from Yunus from Al-Hasan that he disliked marrying the slave girls of the People of the Book. I heard my father say: 'Hushaym did not hear it from Yunus.' 2253 - I heard my father say: 'Mansur b. Zadhan did not hear anything from Nafi'.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2254 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us, he said: A companion of ours informed us from Mughirah from Ibrahim that he used to say regarding the [pages of the] Mushaf when they wear out: 'They should be buried and not burnt.' I heard my father say: 'This is from the hadith of a Sheikh we wrote from called Ibrahim b. Atiyyah.' 2255 - I heard my father say: 'Hushaym did not hear anything from Abd Allah al-Umari, yet he narrated to us from him the hadith: The twilight (*Shafaq*) is the redness.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2256 - I heard my father say: 'He narrated to us the hadith of Pre-emption (*Shuf'ah*), the hadith of Abd al-Malik from Ata from Jabir from the Prophet (peace be upon him), and he said: This is a rejected (*Munkar*) hadith.' 2257 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us from Al-Shaybani from Al-Sha'bi that he used to permit the marriage of the sick person during his illness, and permit his buying and selling. I heard my father say: 'Hushaym did not hear it from Al-Shaybani.' 2258 - I asked my father, I said: Abu al-Amays from Abu al-Rabi' al-Ansari, he said: 'I was with Abd al-Rahman b. Abi Layla.' Who is this Abu al-Rabi'? He said: 'I do not know.' 2259 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Quraysh b. Hayyan al-Ijli told us from Abu Wasil, he said: 'I met Abu Ayyub al-Ansari'—and Waki' did not say 'al-Ansari' one time. My father said: 'Waki' erred in it. It is actually Abu Ayyub al-Ataki, whom Qatadah narrated from.' 2260 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Sufyan told us from Abu al-Nadr from Abu Anas that Uthman performed ablution three times, three times. My father said: 'It is actually from Busr b. Sa'id.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2261 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us from Hajjaj from Ata regarding people sharing a sacrificial camel: 'Do they name themselves when slaughtering it?' He said: 'The intention suffices them for that.' I heard my father say: 'Hushaym did not hear it from Hajjaj.' 2262 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us from Yazid b. Abi Ziyad from a man who told him from Ibn Abbas that he ate while reclining. I heard my father say: 'Hushaym did not hear it from Yazid b. Abi Ziyad.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2263 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us from Yunus from Al-Hasan, and Mughirah from Ibrahim, and Sayyar from Al-Sha'bi, that they asked about a man who is asked 'Do you have a wife?' and he says 'No' while he has a wife. They said: 'It is a lie.' I heard my father say: 'Hushaym did not hear it from Sayyar'—meaning this hadith. 2264 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us from Ata b. al-Sa'ib from Sa'id b. Jubayr that he used to say: 'He prays two rak'ahs if he is able, otherwise one rak'ah, and if he is not able, let him make Takbir'—meaning if there is close combat/sword fighting (*Musayafah*). I heard my father say: 'Hushaym did not hear it from Ata b. al-Sa'ib.' 2265 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us, he said: Mansur informed us from Abu Isra'il. My father said: 'He is the one whom Shu'bah narrated from'—meaning Abu Isra'il. 2266 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us from Ali b. Zayd from Sa'id b. al-Musayyib, he said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'The head of reason after faith in Allah is treating people with kindness/diplomacy (*Mudara'ah*).' I heard my father say: 'Hushaym did not hear it from Ali b. Zayd.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2267 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us, he said: Abu Abd Allah al-Bakri informed us. I asked my father, and he said: 'I do not know who this Abu Abd Allah al-Bakri is.' 2268 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us from Mughirah from Ibrahim, he said: 'There is no charity (*Sadaqah*) on *Raba'ib* sheep (raised at home/not grazing).' I heard my father say: 'Hushaym did not hear it from Mughirah'—meaning this hadith. 2269 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym told us, he said: Abu Na'amah al-Dabbi informed us. My father said: 'This means, if Allah wills, Shaybah b. Na'amah.' 2270 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Ali b. Ali—meaning Ibn Rifa'ah—told us. Waki' said: 'And he was trustworthy.' 2271 - I heard my father say: 'Fitr heard from Sa'd b. Ubaydah the hadith of Al-Bara' from the Prophet (peace be upon him): When you go to your bed...' 2272 - I heard my father say: 'Abu Mujahid's name is Sa'd al-Ta'i.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2273 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us from Abu al-Mu'tamar—meaning Al-Hiri, his name is Yazid b. Tahman—from Ibn Sirin, he said: 'Mu'awiyah was not accused regarding Hadith from the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him).' 2274 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Sharik told us from Abu Wabrah Al-Rabi' b. Abd al-Rahman, he said: 'I asked Ibrahim...' 2275 - I heard my father say: 'Khalid al-Nili is Khalid b. Dinar, a trustworthy Sheikh.' 2276 - My father told me, he said: Muhammad told us, he said: Shu'bah told us from Abu Bakr b. Jahm. Thus said Ghundar. My father said: 'It is actually Ibn Abi al-Jahm.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2277 - I heard my father say: 'Haytham—meaning Al-Sayrafi whom Shu'bah narrated from—is Haytham b. Habib.' My father said: 'He is the grandfather of Muhammad b. al-Haytham the reciter.' 2278 - I heard my father say: 'Abd al-Rahman b. Ishaq al-Kufi is abandoned in Hadith (*Matruk al-Hadith*)—meaning the one whom Ibn Idris and Ibn Fudayl narrate from.' 2279 - I said to my father: 'Abu Ishaq al-Sabi'i from Al-Ash'ath, the owner of coffins?' My father said: 'He is Al-Ash'ath b. Sawar; he is called Ash'ath the Carpenter (*Al-Najjar*), meaning he carves coffins.' (Beginning of Part Seven) In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. Abdullah b. Ahmad informed us by license, he said: 2280 - My father told me, he said: Abd al-Rahman b. Mahdi told us from Sufyan from Habib—meaning Ibn Abi Thabit—from Maymun b. Abi Shabib from Al-Mughirah b. Shu'bah from the Prophet (peace be upon him), he said: 'Whoever narrates a hadith seeing that it is a lie, then he is one of the liars.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2281 - My father told me, he said: Abd al-Rahman b. Mahdi told us from Mu'awiyah—meaning Ibn Salih—from Rabi'ah b. Yazid, he said: I heard Wathilah b. al-Asqa' say: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) say: 'Verily, the greatest of fabrications are three: That a man fabricates against his two eyes, saying "I saw" while he did not see; or fabricates against his parents so he is attributed to other than his father; or says "He said to me" while he did not hear from me.' 2282 - My father told me, he said: Zaid b. al-Hubab told us, he said: Mu'awiyah b. Salih told me, he said: Rabi'ah b. Yazid al-Dimashqi told me, he said: I heard Wathilah b. al-Asqa' say: I heard the Prophet (peace be upon him) say: 'The greatest of fabrications are three: That one fabricates against his eyes, saying "I have seen" while he did not see; or fabricates against his parents so he is attributed to other than his father; or says "I have heard" while he did not hear.' 2283 - I heard my father say: 'Abu Abd al-Rahman al-Hubuli is Abd Allah b. Yazid.' 2284 - My father told me, he said: Muhammad b. Ja'far told us, he said: Shu'bah told us from Yazid b. Khumayr, he said: I heard Abd Allah b. Abi Musa say: Mudrik—or Ibn Mudrik—sent me to Aisha. I said: 'How should I ask permission to enter upon her?' He said: 'Say: Peace be upon you, O Prophet, and the mercy of Allah and His blessings. Peace be upon us and upon the righteous servants of Allah. Peace be upon the Mothers of the Believers—or the Wives of the Prophet—Peace be upon you.' So I entered upon her. I heard my father say: 'Yazid b. Khumayr is good in Hadith (*Salih al-Hadith*).' My father said: 'Abd Allah b. Abi Musa is a mistake; Shu'bah erred. It is Abd Allah b. Abi Qays.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2285 - My father told me, he said: Abd al-Rahman b. Mahdi told us from Sufyan from Abu Sinan—meaning Dirar b. Murrah—he said: I heard Abd Allah b. al-Harith say: 'The Zibaniyah (Angels of Hell), their heads are in the sky and their legs are on the earth.' I asked my father, and he said: 'This is Abd Allah b. al-Harith al-Muktib, and he is the teacher. Amr b. Murrah narrated from him.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2286 - My father told me, he said: Abd al-Rahman b. Mahdi told us from Sufyan from Abu Sinan from Abd Allah b. Abi al-Hudhayl from Abu Amr, he said: 'The *Sa'ihun* are the fasters who perpetuate fasting.' I asked my father. He said: 'He is not Abu Amr al-Shaybani; he is Abu Amr al-Abdi.' 2287 - I heard my father say regarding the hadith of Al-Thawri from Abu Sinan, he said: 'I saw Sahl Abu al-Asad.' My father said: '[He is] Sahl Abu al-Aswad al-Qarari.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2288 - My father told me, he said: Abd al-Rahman b. Mahdi told us, he said: Thabit b. Yazid told me. Thus said Abd al-Rahman. My father said: Others besides Abd al-Rahman said Thabit b. Zaid. And Thabit b. Yazid Abu Zaid is the correct one. 2289 - I heard my father say: 'Ishaq b. al-Mughirah is the one called Ishaq b. Sharfa, trustworthy.' 2290 - I heard my father say: 'Aban b. Abi Hazim is Aban b. Abd Allah al-Bajali, good in Hadith (*Salih al-Hadith*).' 2291 - I heard my father say: Abu Ja'far al-Hadhdha' told us, he said: I said to Sufyan b. Uyaynah: 'This one speaks regarding Qadar'—meaning Ibrahim b. Abi Yahya. He said: 'Inform the people of his innovation and ask your Lord for safety.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2292 - My father told me, he said Waki' told us, he said Jarir bin Hazim told us, on the authority of Al-Miqdam Abu Farwah, he said: A neighbor of mine told me that Shuraih judged in favor of a Christian regarding pre-emption (Shuf'ah).
2293 - My father told me, he said Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi told us, on the authority of Jarir bin Hazim, he said I heard Abu Farwah say: A neighbor of mine informed me that he entered into a dispute with a Christian before Shuraih regarding pre-emption, and he judged the pre-emption in favor of the Christian. I asked my father: "Does a Christian or a Jew have the right of pre-emption?" He said: "No." I said: "What about a Magian (Zoroastrian)?" He said: "That is even more remote."
2294 - My father told me, he said Affan told us, he said: I mentioned to Al-Aghdaf—meaning the hadith of Jarir from Abu Farwah—so he said: He told me on the authority of Al-Hasan bin Umarah from Abu Farwah. Affan said: Jarir told us: "I heard Abu Farwah."
2295 - My father told me, he said Mu'adh bin Mu'adh told us, he said: Al-Aghdaf is Amr bin al-Walid.
2296 - My father told me, he said Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi told us, on the authority of Sufyan, on the authority of Muhammad bin al-Munkadir, on the authority of Jabir, he said: The Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, came to visit me (when sick), riding neither a mule nor a nag.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2297 - I heard my father say: Yazid bin Harun came to visit me—I think he said during an ailment in his eye—and when he wanted to leave, his head hit the door (frame). Yazid was a tall man.
2298 - My father told me, he said Abd al-Rahman told us, he said: I asked Sufyan about the hadith of Amr bin Murrah, on the authority of Abu Ubaidah regarding Witr for the people of the Quran (Reciters). He said: "I did not hear it"—meaning from Amr bin Murrah.
2299 - My father told me, he said Abd al-Rahman told us, he said: And he—meaning Sufyan—was asked about the hadith of Amr bin Murrah: "It was hard on Abdullah to speak after the break of dawn." He said: "A man told me from Amr bin Murrah."
2300 - Abdullah bin Umar Abu Abd al-Rahman al-Qurashi told me, he said Abu Nu'aym Al-Fadl bin Dukain told me, he said I heard Sufyan al-Thawri say: If Jabir says to you "He told me" (Haddathani), or "I heard" (Sami'tu), or "I asked" (Sa'altu), then that is [valid]. But if he says "He said" (Qala), [then be cautious].
2301 - Abdullah bin Umar told me, he said Abu Nu'aym told me, he said I heard Al-Hasan bin Thabit come and say to Sufyan bin Sa'id: "Inform him of a hadith." He said: "Who mentioned it?" He said: "Qais." He said: So Sufyan said: "Qais al-Asadi Abu Muhammad?" He said: "Yes, yes," and he twisted his head at the mention of him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2302 - Abdullah bin Umar told me, on the authority of Abu Nu'aym, he said I heard Talq, the son of Sharik's uncle, narrating from Sharik—while we were in his hallway when Qais bin al-Rabi' died: "May Allah have mercy on Abu Muhammad. Indeed, Qais held a [high] status in Islam."
2303 - My father told me, he said Muhammad bin Ubaid al-Tanafisi told us, he said I heard Al-Thawri say: "Muhammad bin Suqah al-Mardi (the Approved) told us."
2304 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Adam told us, he said Sufyan told us, he said Salim al-Khayyat—and he was approved (Mardi)—told us, he said I heard Al-Hasan say: "Wait three days for the one struck by lightning (before burial)." Sufyan said: "He is not buried [immediately]."
2305 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Adam told us, he said Abu Zubaid told us, on the authority of Ajlah, on the authority of Al-Sha'bi, he said: There is no Zakat (alms) on summer crops (vegetables).
2306 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Adam told us, he said Abu Zubaid told us, he said Ajlah told us, on the authority of Abu Ishaq, on the authority of Asim bin Damrah, on the authority of Ali, similar to it.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2307 - My father told me, he said Ibn Mahdi told us, he said: I asked Sufyan about this hadith of Abu Ishaq. He said: "This is not from the hadith of Abu Ishaq"—meaning "There is no Zakat on vegetables," which is this hadith.
2308 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Adam told us, he said Sufyan told us—and he mentioned the Tashahhud, the Tashahhud of Abdullah—he said: Abu Ishaq told it to us from Abu al-Ahwas, from Abdullah, from the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him; and Mansur, Al-A'mash, and Hammad [narrated] from Abu Wa'il, from Abdullah, from the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, similar to it.
2309 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Adam told us, he said Abu Bakr bin Ayyash told us, on the authority of Abu Ishaq, he said: We were neighbors with Asim bin Damrah for thirty years, and I never heard him narrate a hadith except from Ali.
2310 - My father told me, he said Sufyan bin Uyainah told us, he said: One who witnessed Dabiq told us. Sufyan said: And Dabiq was where people would gather to go on raids. Sulayman was there where the people gathered. He said: So Sulayman died at Dabiq; death came to him at Dabiq and he died there. He had no son, only brothers. And Raja'—meaning Ibn Haywah, his advisor and consultant—went out to the people and informed them of his death. He ascended the pulpit and said: "The Commander of the Faithful has written a document and made a covenant; will you hear and obey?" The people said: "Yes." Hisham said: "We will hear and obey if the succession is for a man from Banu Abd al-Malik." Sufyan said: Meaning if it is someone else, then no. He said: The people pulled him until he fell to the ground. The people said: "We hear and obey." Raja' said: "Stand up, O Umar," and he was near the pulpit. Umar said: "By Allah, this is a matter I never asked Allah for, neither in secret nor in public." Sufyan said: And Umar was before the [year] one hundred. He ruled for two years and something, and died in the year one hundred and one.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2311 - My father told me, he said Sufyan said: Umar bin Abd al-Aziz died when he died, and he only increased in virtue year after year.
2312 - My father told me, he said Sufyan told us, he said: A man said to Umar bin Abd al-Aziz: "May Allah reward you with good on behalf of Islam." He replied: "No, rather may Allah reward Islam with good on my behalf."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2313 - My father told me, he said Sufyan told us, on the authority of Abu Dharr, he said: Rabi' bin Abi Rashid met me and took me aside, then he said to me: "O Abu Dharr, whoever asks Allah for His pleasure has asked Allah for something immense."
2314 - My father told me, he said Sufyan said: They used to say that Qais bin Muslim did not raise his head to the sky for such and such time out of glorification/reverence for Allah.
2315 - My father told me, he said I heard Ibn Uyainah say: They used to narrate it—meaning the Tashahhud—from Abdullah. Sufyan said: And I did not hear it from them.
2316 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Sa'id told us, on the authority of Abu Yunus Hasan bin Yazid. My father said: I said to Yahya: "The one who is called Al-Tawwaf (The one who circumambulates much)?" He said: "Yes." My father said: He is Abu Yunus Al-Qawi (The Strong).
2317 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Sa'id told us, he said I heard Mujalid say: I saw Al-Sha'bi dictating to a man three scrolls regarding Zakat (Alms). Abu Abd al-Rahman said: And Abu Bakr bin Khallad told us, he said I heard Yahya bin Sa'id, on the authority of Mujalid, he said: I saw Al-Sha'bi dictating to a man three scrolls regarding Zakat and Inheritance Laws (Fara'id).

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2318 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Adam told us, he said I heard Hasan al-Zayyat say to Sufyan: "They narrate from Rabi' bin Khuthaym that he fainted [from fear of Allah]." He said: "And who narrates this? It was only that Storyteller who used to narrate it. I met him and said: 'From whom do you narrate this?' denouncing him."
2319 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Sa'id told us, on the authority of Imran Abu Bakr. My father said: This is Imran al-Qasir (The Short), and he is Imran bin Muslim, trustworthy.
2320 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Sa'id told us, he said: Al-A'mash died in the year forty-eight (148 AH).
2321 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Sa'id told us, he said: Ismail—meaning Ibn Abi Khalid—died in the year forty-five (145 AH). And I think Abd al-Malik died in it (that year). And Hisham bin Hassan died in the year forty-seven (147 AH). And Muhammad bin Abi Ismail died in the year forty-two (142 AH).

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2322 - I heard my father say: Marhum al-Attar came to Mu'tamar, so Marhum narrated a hadith, and Mu'tamar began listening to him.
2323 - I heard my father say: How authentic is the hadith of Habib al-Mu'allim and how close it is! Trustworthy.
2324 - I heard my father say: Muthanna bin al-Sabbah, his hadith is worth nothing; he is confused in hadith.
2325 - I heard my father say: Silm bin Abi al-Dhayyal is trustworthy, Salih al-Hadith (good in hadith). I have not heard anyone narrate from him other than Mu'tamar; they claimed he went on a naval raid with him, so he heard from him.
2326 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Sa'id told us, he said Shu'bah told us, on the authority of Al-Hakam, on the authority of Umarah, on the authority of his mother, on the authority of Aisha, on the authority of the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, he said: "A man's child is from his earnings, from his best earnings, so eat from their wealth in enjoyment."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2327 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Sa'id told us, he said: Ibn Abi Arubah used to narrate it from Matar, from Al-Hakam, from Ibn Umar. I think he heard Umarah and thought it was Ibn Umar—meaning regarding this hadith.
2328 - My father told me, he said Mu'tamar told us, on the authority of Al-Nu'man bin Abi Shaibah al-Jundi, he said: My father and I went to Tawus. He said: "Welcome, O Abu Shaibah."
