2329 - My father told me, he said Abd al-A'la bin Abd al-A'la Abu Muhammad al-Sami and Abu Hammam told us. Then my father said: He had two Kunyas.
2330 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Sa'id told us, on the authority of Al-A'mash, he said Ibrahim told us that Alqamah said to Al-Aswad: "O Abu Amr." He said: "Labbayk (At your service)." He said: "Labbay yadayk (At your service/hands)."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2331 - My father said: Abu al-Zinad had two Kunyas: Abu Abd al-Rahman and Abu al-Zinad. My father told me, he said I heard Sufyan bin Abi Uyainah say: We did not use the Kunyah Abu al-Zinad for him; we used to use the Kunyah Abu Abd al-Rahman. He was a client of Abd al-Hamid bin Abd al-Rahman.
2332 - I heard my father say: Al-Hasan bin Ali al-Hizzani is a trustworthy Sheikh; Yahya bin Sa'id narrated from him.
2333 - I heard my father say: Ibn Jurayj heard hadiths from Maymun bin Mihran.
2334 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Sa'id told us, he said Sufyan said: Alqamah is the uncle of Al-Aswad. My father said: And Al-Aswad is the maternal uncle of Ibrahim. My father said: Yahya said: Ibrahim died while he was fifty-odd years old. My father told me, he said Yahya bin Sa'id told us, he said: Ibrahim was not with Ibn al-Ash'ath (in the revolt).

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2335 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Sa'id told us, on the authority of Shu'bah, on the authority of Abu Qais, he said: I asked Alqamah and Ibrahim about "Rikab Hazawwar" (strong young camels/mounts). Abu Abd al-Rahman said: And he is Alqamah bin Qais and Al-Aswad bin Yazid bin Qais.
2336 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Sa'id told us, he said Abd al-Aziz bin Sayyah told us, he said Abu Rashid told us, he said: We were in Kufa during the time of Ali, and the people were grazing their riding camels (Mana'ih) on the outskirts of Kufa... and he narrated the story.
2337 - I heard my father say: Waki' told us, on the authority of Abd al-Aziz bin Siyah. Waki' said: Mu'alla al-Tahhan brought out the book of Ghailan bin Jami', and this hadith was in it from Abd al-Aziz bin Siyan.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2338 - I said to my father: "Did Hasan bin Muslim die before Tawus?" He said: "Yes." I said: "Then how did Ibn Jurayj become a narrator from Hasan while he is not a narrator from Tawus?" He said: "Tawus was in Yemen."
2339 - I heard my father say: Yahya bin Sa'id was distressed on the day I left Basra—meaning he was saddened by his departure from him. He said: And Yahya bin Sa'id asked about me while I was in Wasit staying with Yazid bin Harun. They said: "He is in Wasit." He said: "What is he doing in Wasit?" They said: "With Yazid bin Harun." He said: "And what is he doing with Yazid bin Harun?" Or as my father said.
2340 - I heard my father mention from some of the people of Hadith, he said I heard Mu'adh bin Mu'adh say: "By Allah, I never saw him at Al-Ash'ath's"—meaning Muhammad bin Abdullah al-Ansari. Al-Qawariri said: When Mu'adh bin Mu'adh was dismissed (from judgeship), Yahya bin Sa'id said: "Someone like Mu'adh is dismissed and Al-Ansari is appointed?! Mu'adh is dismissed and someone like Al-Ansari is appointed?!"
2341 - I heard my father say: Mu'adh and Bishr bin al-Mufaddal used to pray in one mosque. Bishr would never leave until Mu'adh left; so when Mu'adh left, Bishr left, out of respect for him, as he was older than him.
2342 - I heard my father say: There was difficulty/strictness in Nafi', the Mawla of Ibn Umar, regarding Hadith.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2343 - My father told me, he said Abu Nu'aym told us, he said Yunus bin Abi Ishaq told us, he said Sahl bin Ubaid bin Amr al-Kharifi told me in the year ninety-one.
2344 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Sa'id told us, he said: And Hisham bin Urwah said: "He used to enter upon my wife"—meaning Muhammad bin Ishaq and his wife Fatimah bint al-Mundhir.
2345 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Sa'id told us, he said Kahmas said to me: "We denied him"—meaning Al-Jurayri—"during the days of the plague." Shu'bah said: "No one from Bakr bin Wa'il or from Banu Tamim accompanied the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him." My father said: And how would he know when he said: "No one from Bakr bin Wa'il or from Banu Tamim accompanied the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him?"
2346 - My father told me, he said Sufyan told us, he said I heard Sa'd bin Ibrahim say to Ibn Shihab—and Abu al-Ahwas narrated from him—he said: "I have not seen the Sheikh who is at such-and-such place describing him."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2347 - My father told me, he said Abd al-Razzaq told us, he said Ma'mar informed us, he said: It was said to Al-Zuhri: "Is Qatadah more knowledgeable in your opinion or Makhul?" He said: "No, rather Qatadah. Makhul only had a little thing."
2348 - My father told me, he said Waki' told us, he said Sufyan told us, on the authority of Qais bin Muslim Abu Amr al-Jadali, on the authority of Tariq bin Shihab, and he mentioned the hadith of the delegation of Buzakhah.
2349 - My father told me, he said Waki' told us, on the authority of Shu'bah, he said: Ya'la bin Ata said to me: "Come so I can dictate to you how much you differ (go back and forth)." He said: "So I went back and forth until my head was scorched in the sun."
2350 - My father told me, he said Ismail bin Ulayyah told us, he said Umarah Abu Sa'id the Worshipper told us. My father said: He is Al-Ma'wali. My father said: It has reached me that he worshipped Allah until he became skin and bone.
2351 - I heard my father say: Maymun Abu Abdullah is Fasl (weak/low quality).
2352 - I said to my father: "Who is below Shu'bah?" He said: "Yahya, and he is the one Auf narrates from."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2353 - My father told me, he said: It has reached me that Sufyan al-Thawri said to Hammad bin Salamah: "O Abu Salamah, did you write from Salamah bin Kuhayl? Was he a clever Sheikh?" He said: "Yes."
2354 - My father told me, he said Affan told us, he said Abd al-Warith told us, he said Abu Qabisah Sukain bin Yazid told me.
2355 - My father told me, he said Ibn Uyainah told us, on the authority of Amr bin Yahya bin Qamtah, and he was among the best of the people of Mecca.
2356 - My father told me, he said Yunus told us, he said Hammad bin Zaid told us, on the authority of Amr bin Malik, he said I heard Abu al-Jawza' say: I was a neighbor to Ibn Abbas for twelve years, and there is no verse in the Quran except that I asked him about it.
2357 - My father told me, he said Zaid bin al-Hubab told us, he said Sufyan al-Thawri told us, on the authority of Ata bin al-Sa'ib, he said: Sa'id bin Jubayr said to me: "Are you not amazed that I stay from Friday to Friday and no one asks me"—meaning about anything.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2358 - My father said: Yahya al-Qattan said: Dawud bin Farahij is Madini (from Medina). My father said: And Muhammad bin Mutarrif Abu Ghassan narrated from him.
2359 - My father told me, he said Abu al-Qasim bin Abi al-Zinad told us, on the authority of his brother Abd al-Rahman, on the authority of his father, he said: Umar bin Abd al-Aziz said: "A sitting with the blind one, Ubaidullah bin Abdullah bin Utbah bin Mas'ud, is more beloved to me than a thousand dinars."
2360 - My father told me, he said Uthman bin Umar told us, he said I heard Yunus say: No one narrated more from Al-Zuhri than Uqail.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2361 - Abu Abd al-Rahman said: Abu Musa al-Ansari told us, he said Al-Walid bin Muslim told us, he said I heard Al-Awza'i prefer Al-Zubaidi over everyone who heard from Al-Zuhri.
2362 - I heard my father mention from some of his companions, he said: Abdullah bin Wahb al-Masri came to Sufyan bin Uyainah, so he said to him: "Your sister's son—or your brother's son—who presented the hadiths to you yesterday, I narrate them from you." My father said: It reached me that he did not include anything of those in his compilation.
2363 - My father told me, he said I heard Musa bin Dawud say: I heard Sufyan al-Thawri saying in the year one hundred and fifty-eight, saying: "Abu Ishaq died thirty years ago. And Abu Ishaq sometimes said 'Silah told us' sixty years ago." He said: And I heard Sufyan say: "This year I am sixty-one years old."
2364 - My father told me, he said Waki' told us, he said: I heard Al-A'mash in the year forty-five (145 AH) when the news of Muhammad came when he revolted—meaning Muhammad bin Abdullah bin al-Hasan. Waki' said: Hisham bin Urwah was with us in Kufa.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2365 - My father told me, he said Mus'ab bin Salam told us, he said Al-Zibriqan told us, on the authority of Abu Wa'il, he said: I remember being a boy of ten years in Jahiliyyah, herding sheep for my family in the desert when the Prophet, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, was sent.
2366 - My father told me, he said Ismail bin Umar told us, he said Yunus bin Abi Ishaq told us, on the authority of Najiyah Abu Khafaf al-Anazi in the year ninety, he said: "O Abu Ishaq, you argue with Abdullah and Ammar regarding Tayammum."
2367 - My father told me, he said Abd al-Razzaq told us, he said Ma'mar said: Ayyub said: Abd al-Karim—meaning Abu Umayyah—asked me about a hadith of Ikrimah, so I told him. Then he said: "Ikrimah told me." Ma'mar said: And Hammad asked me about our jurists, so I mentioned them. He said: "You have left the most knowledgeable of them"—meaning Abd al-Karim Abu Umayyah. My father said: And he used to agree with him on Irja'.
2368 - My father told me, he said Thabit bin al-Walid bin Abdullah bin Jami' told us, he said my father told me, he said Abu al-Tufail said to me: I caught eight years of the life of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, and I was born in the year of Uhud.
2369 - My father told me, he said Waki' told us, he said Mis'ar told us, on the authority of Abd al-Malik bin Maisarah Abu Zaid al-Hilali.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2370 - My father told me, he said I heard Waki' say: Sufyan said Mukhariq bin Khalifah. And others said: Mukhariq bin Abdullah. My father said: I heard Waki' say it.
2371 - I heard my father say: Abu al-Hakam al-Bajali is Abd al-Rahman bin Abi Nu'm.
2372 - I asked my father about Al-Hadrami from whom Sulayman al-Taimi narrated. He said: He was a storyteller. Mu'tamar claimed, saying: "I saw him." My father said: I do not know anyone who narrated from him other than Sulayman al-Taimi.
2373 - My father told me, he said Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi told us, he said I heard Malik bin Anas say: "Timing (Al-Waqt) is an innovation"—meaning regarding wiping over socks (Khuffain).
2374 - I heard my father say: Muhammad bin al-Murtafi' is a trustworthy Sheikh; Ibn Jurayj and Ibn Uyainah narrated from him.
2375 - I heard my father say: Al-Dahhak bin Muzahim is trustworthy and trusted.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of the Men (Narrators)
text:
2376 - My father told me, he said Yazid bin Harun told us, he said Ibn Abi Dhi'b informed us, on the authority of Al-Zuhri, he said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah send peace and blessings upon him, used to go out on the Day of Fitr saying Takbir from the time he left his house until he came to the prayer place. When he finished the prayer, he cut off the Takbir. He said: As for Al-Adha, he used to say Takbir from the Dhuhr prayer on the Day of Arafah until the Dhuhr prayer of the last of the Days of Tashriq. My father said: This is a Munkar (objectionable) hadith. Then he said: Shu'bah entered upon Ibn Abi Dhi'b and forbade him from narrating it, and he said: "Do not narrate this," and Shu'bah rejected it.
2377 - I heard my father say: Silm bin Abd al-Rahman, I have known nothing but good [about him].
2378 - I heard my father say: Abdullah bin Yazid, from whom Sufyan narrated, is trustworthy; he is a Sahbani man and is from Nakha'.
2379 - I asked my father about Al-Salt bin Bahram. He said: There is no harm in him.
2380 - I asked my father about Al-Salt bin Dinar. He said: People abandoned his hadith; he is Matruk (abandoned). And he forbade me from writing anything of hadith from Al-Salt bin Dinar. And Sufyan al-Thawri used the Kunyah Abu Shu'aib [for him].
2381 - I asked my father about Ma'qil bin Ubaidullah. He said: Salih al-Hadith (good in hadith).

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2382 - My father said: Abu al-Juwayriyah al-Jarmi is trustworthy. And he said: Abu al-Huwayrith, his name is Abd al-Rahman b. Mu'awiyah; Sufyan and Shu'bah narrated from him. I said: Bishr b. Umar claimed that he asked Malik b. Anas about Abu al-Huwayrith, and he said: 'He is not trustworthy.' My father denied this and said: 'No, Shu'bah narrated from him.' I said to my father: Bishr b. Umar claimed that he asked Malik b. Anas about Salih, the Mawla of al-Taw'amah, and he said: 'He is not trustworthy.' My father said: Malik caught Salih when he had become confused or when he was old. I know no harm in him for one who heard from him early on, and the elders of the people of Madinah narrated from him. 2383 - I said to my father: 'Who was the first to compile books?' He said: 'Ibn Jurayj and Ibn Abi Arubah'—meaning and the like. And Ibn Jurayj said: 'No one compiled knowledge like my compilation.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2384 - I heard my father say: Ibn Jurayj came to Abu Ja'far and said to him: 'Verily, I have collected the hadith of your grandfather Abd Allah b. Abbas, and no one has collected it like my collection'—or something similar. He said: But he did not give him anything, so he attached him to Sulayman b. Mujalid, a man who used to be with Abu Ja'far. My father said: Hajjaj was a tutor for Sulayman b. Mujalid. As for Sulayman b. Mujalid, he treated Ibn Jurayj well—meaning he gave to him and honored him. So Ibn Jurayj said to him: 'I do not know how to repay you, but take these books of mine and copy them; for some of them are by hearing (Sama') and some by presentation (Ard).' My father said: Ibn Hajjaj told me from his father, he said: A man from the people of Kufa used to come to us. He said: So he would say to us: 'Give it to him; let him read it to you.' My father said: Hajjaj said: 'Except the Tafsir, for it was not with Ibn Jurayj, so he dictated it to us'—meaning the Tafsir. 2385 - I asked my father about Al-Hasan b. al-Husayn. He said: Ibn Mahdi narrated to us from him, and his son was a judge over Basra, Ubaydullah b. al-Hasan. Ibn Mahdi used to say: 'Ubaydullah b. al-Hasan said.' My father said: Ubaydullah b. al-Hasan b. Husayn b. Abi al-Hurr, from whom Al-Khashkhash al-Anbari narrated. 2386 - My father said: Wahb b. Jarir was a man of Sunnah.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2387 - I heard my father say: Abd al-Rahman b. Mahdi said: 'There are people here narrating from Shu'bah whom I have not seen.' I said to him: 'Whom does he mean by this?' He said: 'Wahb b. Jarir.' My father said: Wahb was not seen with Shu'bah, but he was a man of Sunnah. They claimed he narrated from Shu'bah about four thousand hadiths. Affan said: 'These are the hadiths of Al-Rasasi.' I said to my father: 'Who is this Al-Rasasi?' He said: 'A person in Basra called Al-Rasasi, and he had heard much hadith from Shu'bah.' Abu Abd al-Rahman said: This Al-Rasasi is Abd al-Rahman b. Ziyad; he ended up in Egypt. My father said: Wahb b. Jarir said: 'My father wrote for me to Shu'bah, so I used to come and ask him.' 2388 - My father said: Abu Hurrah is trustworthy, and Abu al-Ashhab is truthful (Saduq). 2389 - I heard my father say: Al-Dahhak b. Muzahim was a teacher. Abd Allah b. al-Harith was a teacher; Amr b. Murrah narrated more than one hadith from him. And Ubayd the Teacher (Al-Mukib) is Ubayd b. Mahran. And Al-Mukib (Husayn) is a teacher, and Husayn al-Mukib is a teacher, and Habib the Teacher (Al-Mu'allim).

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2390 - I said to my father: Sa'id b. Jumhan, is this an unknown man? He said: No, more than one person narrated from him: Hammad b. Salamah, Hammad b. Zaid, Al-Awwam b. Hawshab, and Hashraj b. Nubatah. 2391 - I heard my father say: Rifa'ah b. Shaddad's Kunya is Abu Asim. 2392 - I heard my father say: Wahb b. Jabir al-Khaywani, Abu Ishaq narrated from him. 2393 - I heard my father say: I heard that rarely does a man take a book and look into it except that he benefits something from it. 2394 - I heard my father say: The first time we arrived in Kufa was the year eighty-three [183 AH], the year Hushaym died in Sha'ban. We went out to Kufa in Shawwal, I and Amr al-A'rabi, and we were walking. Al-Muttalib b. Ziyad, Sa'id b. Khuthaym, and [other] Sheikhs were there. Waki' used to lean against the Qiblah wall, but later he did not lean. He said: 'What did Hushaym have regarding a man strangling another man until he kills him?' We said: 'He had nothing on that.' So Waki' said: 'Sufyan told us from Abu Hashim from Ibrahim, and Isra'il from Jabir from Amir regarding a man strangling another man...' and he narrated the hadith.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2395 - My father told me, he said: Abd al-Razzaq told us from Ma'mar, he said: A man said to Ibn Sirin: 'I saw in a dream a pigeon swallowing a pearl, and it came out of it larger than when it entered. And I saw another pigeon swallowing a pearl, and it came out of it smaller than when it entered. And I saw another pigeon swallowing a pearl, and it came out exactly as it entered.' Ibn Sirin said: 'As for the pigeon that swallowed the pearl and it came out larger than when it entered, that is Al-Hasan; he hears the hadith and improves it with his eloquence. As for the one that came out smaller than when it entered, that is Muhammad b. Sirin; he hears the hadith and doubts it, so he decreases from it. And as for the one that came out as it entered, that is Qatadah; he is the most preserving of people.' 2396 - I heard my father say: They wrote a lot from Abu Awanah: Yahya b. Hammad and Hisham b. Abd al-Malik, except that Yahya b. Hammad narrated more from him. I said to him: 'Was Hisham established (Thabt)?' He said: 'In the hadith of Shu'bah.' And he said: 'Hisham was correct in some of the hadith of Abu Awanah.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2397 - I heard my father say: We did not hear anyone say 'Hisham told us, he said: Qatadah told us' except Yahya b. Sa'id and Isma'il b. Ibrahim. As for Isma'il, he says: 'Hisham told us, he said: Hammad told us.' And Yahya says: 'Hisham told us, he said: Qatadah told us.' 2398 - My father said: Abu Hamzah Abd Allah b. Jabir, Abu Hamzah al-Sukkari, and Abu Hamzah Harun b. al-Mughirah are from the people of Rayy. 2399 - I heard my father say: Al-Fayyad b. Ghazwan, this is a trustworthy Sheikh; Nu'aym b. Maysarah narrated from him. 2400 - My father told me, he said: Muhammad b. Humayd told us, he said: Jarir told us from Hunayf b. Rustam the Mu'adhin. Whose son is he? He said: Jarir did not lineage him for us. 2401 - My father told me, he said: Muhammad b. Humayd told us, he said: Nu'aym told us from Abd Allah b. Hakim b. Jubayr, he said: 'I and my father buried three people, and Ibrahim was with us, at night.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2402 - I said to my father: 'Did Hajjaj b. Muhammad become confused?' He said: 'Yes, he became confused towards the end, in the last part of his life.' 2403 - My father said: 'We were in Basra while Ar'arah was alive, but we were not able to write anything from him.' 2404 - I heard my father say: Hajjaj said from Jarir b. Hazim, he said: 'I saw Abdullah b. Kathir, and he was eloquent with the Qur'an.' 2405 - Abu Abd al-Rahman said: I asked Yahya b. Ma'in about Hunayf the Mu'adhin: 'Whose son is he?' He said: 'Jarir did not lineage him for us.' 2406 - I asked my father about Kathir b. Zaid. He said: 'I do not see any harm in him.' 2407 - My father said: Thawr b. Yazid al-Shami and Al-Awza'i performed Hajj in the year one hundred and five, so people heard from them during the seasons.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2408 - I heard my father say: Al-Layth b. Sa'd heard from Bukayr b. al-Ashajj about thirty hadiths. I said: 'They report from Abu al-Walid that he heard Al-Layth say: I did not hear anything from Bukayr.' He denied it and said: 'Al-Layth says: Bukayr b. Abd Allah told me.' 2409 - Abu Abd al-Rahman said: My father forbade me to write from a man whom Abbas al-Ansari narrates from regarding Quranic readings, called Ismah from Al-A'mash. And he forbade me to write anything from Kharijah b. Mus'ab. 2410 - I heard my father say: Aban b. Yazid al-Attar is more established than Imran al-Qattan. 2411 - My father told me, he said: Ghundar Muhammad b. Ja'far told us, he said: Hammam told us from Qatadah from Sa'id b. al-Musayyib that Ali said: 'The Sunnah regarding women'—meaning regarding divorce and the waiting period. Muhammad said: I said to Hammam: 'No one other than you narrates it from Sa'id.' He said: 'I do not doubt it and I do not waver.' 2412 - I heard my father say: I did not reject anything from the hadith of Abbas al-Ansari except one hadith: From Sa'id from Qatadah from Ikrimah or Jabir b. Zaid from Ibn Abbas from Ka'b, he said: He said to me: 'O Ibn Abbas, a man from your descendants will rule...' and he narrated the hadith. My father said: What he narrated from Yunus, Khalid, Dawud, and Shu'bah is correct. I do not see any harm in his hadith except this hadith, the hadith of Sa'id; it is, in my view, a baseless lie. My father said: And he was one of Sa'id's companions.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2413 - I heard my father say: Abu Abd Allah al-Shaqari, his name is Salamah b. Tammam. Hammad b. Zaid narrated from him. Isma'il b. Ulayyah heard one hadith from him. And Sharik narrated from him. He is not strong in Hadith, although people have narrated from him. 2414 - I heard my father say: Abu al-Nadr said: Abu Dawud—meaning Al-Tayalisi—spoke to Shu'bah for me, so he narrated to him. Or perhaps my father said: Abu al-Nadr said: Abu Dawud interceded for me with Shu'bah. 2415 - I asked my father about Amr b. Marzuq. He said: 'He was a man of good, he was a warrior (Ghazza').' Then he said: 'Affan said: Amr b. Marzuq was a companion of Abu Dawud Al-Tayalisi; he used to seek Hadith with him.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2416 - I heard my father say: Hajjaj b. Minhal, I do not see any harm in him. He was a man of Sunnah; Allah raised him through good. 2417 - My father told me, he said: Abd al-Wahhab told us, he said: Hisham told us from Qatadah from Sa'id b. al-Musayyib that Umar b. al-Khattab used to give inheritance to maternal brothers from the blood money. 2418 - My father said: It was said to Abd al-Rahman b. Mahdi that Mu'adh b. Hisham says: 'In my father's book from Qatadah, mursal.' So Abd al-Rahman said: 'Hisham, if he did not memorize a hadith [correctly] twice...' 2419 - I heard my father say: Hushaym heard from Awf but did not write them down until he came to Wasit, then he wrote them. 2420 - I heard my father say: Hushaym came to Al-A'mash with a piece of paper containing about thirty hadiths. He said: So he asked him about them, and he narrated to him. He said: When he stood up, they asked him for it—meaning the students of Hadith. He said: So he gave the paper to them and left. He said: So they said to him: 'Will you not take it?' He said: 'I have memorized them.' Or words to this effect. 2421 - My father said: Alqamah b. Marthad only narrates from Sulayman b. Buraydah; he did not narrate anything from Abdullah b. Buraydah. And he denied that Alqamah heard anything from Abdullah b. Buraydah; he only narrated from Sulayman b. Buraydah.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2422 - I heard my father say: Alqamah b. Marthad is trustworthy, established in Hadith. I said to him: 'More established than Abu Hashim?' He said: 'Alqamah is established in Hadith.' In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. Abu Abd al-Rahman narrated to us, reading to us, he said: 2423 - I said to my father: 'These hadiths regarding which you say: I read to Abd al-Rahman from Malik; did he hear them or present them?' He said: 'Abd al-Rahman said: As for the Book of Prayer, I read it to Malik. Abd al-Rahman said: And the rest of the books were read to Malik while I was looking in my book.' He said: 'I read the Book of Prayer, the Book of Divorce, and the Book of Hajj to Abd al-Rahman. As for Prayer, Abd al-Rahman read it to Malik. And the rest of the books were read to Malik while Abd al-Rahman was present for them.' 2424 - I heard my father say: Al-Musayyib b. Rafi' did not hear anything from Abd Allah b. Mas'ud; he only narrates from Alqamah and from Amir b. Abdah. 2425 - I heard my father say: And the hadith of Yahya b. Sa'id was about three thousand hadiths.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2426 - My father said: I used to read to Abd al-Rahman, just him and me alone, with no one else with me in his house. And sometimes I would read to him while he had dyed [his beard] with henna. 2427 - My father said: It reached me from Salam b. Abi Muti' that he used to say: 'How I pity him for what is in him! I pity him.' 2428 - My father told me, he said: Affan told us, he said: Hammad b. Zaid told us, he said: Ibn Awn told us from Muhammad, he said: 'By my life, I have indeed become famous.' 2429 - My father told me, he said: I heard Ibn Uyaynah say: 'Al-Atam are palaces, and Al-Sayasi are fortresses.' 2430 - And my father told me, he said: Yazid b. Harun told us, he said: Shu'bah informed us from Sulayman b. Abd al-Rahman from Ubayd b. Fayruz Abu al-Dahhak al-Shaybani from Al-Bara', the hadith of sacrifices.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2431 - My father told me, he said: Abd al-Razzaq told us, he said: Sufyan al-Thawri told us that whenever he mentioned Amr b. Qays al-Mula'i, he would praise him highly. 2432 - My father told me, he said: I heard Hushaym say: 'Pray to Allah for our brother Abbad b. al-Awwam.' I reckon he was sick. 2433 - He said: I said to Abd al-Rahman: 'Shall I read the hadith of Malik to you?' He said: 'What I heard, I read to you (or you read to me), and what I read and was read to Malik, you read it to me.' He said: So I read it to him. He said: So he narrated to me what he heard, and I read to him what was read to him and he read to Malik. 2434 - I heard my father mention that Al-Zubayr b. Adi's Kunya is Abu Adi. 2435 - I heard my father mention that Abd al-Rahman narrated to them from Sufyan or Shayban from Jabir, then he abandoned it later. And Yahya abandoned the hadith of Jabir. 2436 - My father told me, he said: Amr b. Mujammi' al-Kindi told us, he said: Abu Hamzah Yunus b. Khabbab told us.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2437 - My father told me, he said: Husayn b. al-Walid al-Naysaburi told us, he said: Sufyan al-Thawri told us from Ayyub, he said: 'They used to perform Hajj to meet [scholars].' 2438 - My father told me, he said: Sufyan b. Uyaynah told us, he said: Amr and Abu al-Zubayr did not use to dye [their hair]. And Ibn Abi Najih and Al-A'mash did not use to dye. And Abu Husayn had white head and beard. 2439 - I heard my father say: Sufyan b. Uyaynah was born in the year one hundred and seven, and he died in the year one hundred and ninety-eight. His death reached us while we were in Yemen. He died at the age of ninety-one. 2440 - My father told me, he said: Abd al-Razzaq told us, he said: Sufyan al-Thawri said: 'The name of the Negus (Najashi) is As'hamah, and in Arabic it means Atiyyah (Gift).' 2441 - I heard my father say: In the year we separated and went to Abd al-Razzaq, he said: I heard Sufyan being asked about hadiths he had forgotten, which he used to memorize before that. He said: So he began saying: 'Say them'—meaning present them to me. He said: So he argued with this verse: {So that if one of the two errs, the second of the two may remind the other}.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2442 - My father told me, he said: Affan told us, he said: Hammad b. Zaid told us, he said: Yahya b. Atiq said to Ayyub: 'Do you find something we used to find? We used to disdain the jurists of the people when we saw them with Al-Hasan.' 2443 - My father told me, he said: It was said to Ibn Ulayyah regarding this hadith, so he said: 'Khalid used to narrate it, but no attention was paid to it.' Ibn Ulayyah weakened his affair—meaning the hadith of Khalid from Abu Qilabah from Abu Asma' from Thawban from the Prophet (peace be upon him) regarding the flags. 2444 - My father told me, he said: Khalid b. Khidash told us, he said: Hammad b. Zaid told me, he said: Shu'ayb b. al-Habhab died in the year thirty [130 AH] from *Al-Humayra'* (Measles/Red spot disease), something like pimples. And Ayyub died in the year thirty-one [131 AH] in Ramadan. And Al-Hasan died on the first day of Rajab in the year ten [110 AH], and I prayed over him. And Muhammad b. Sirin died on the ninth of Shawwal in the year ten [110 AH]. And Hammad said to me: 'I remember something when I was four years old, and that was in the year one hundred and two. Some people from the people of Sham arrived and stayed with us, and I remember that they adorned me with a sword.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2445 - I heard my father say: Habib b. Abi Thabit is Habib b. Qays b. Dinar. I heard Yahya b. Nu'aym say: He is Habib b. Hindi. 2446 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il b. Ulayyah told us, he said: Khalid informed us, he said: Abu Qilabah mentioned Abd Allah b. Shaqiq and said: 'What a man! If only he had not become a Bedouin'—meaning started [living like one]. 2447 - My father told me, he said: Walan al-Adawi is Walan b. Qirfah.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2448 - And my father told me, he said: Hawdhah told us from Awf: A man mentioned from Ammar Abu Abd Allah, the Mawla of Banu Hashim, and he is Ammar b. Abi Ammar. 2449 - My father told me, he said: The Kunya of Hamid al-A'raj is Abu Safwan; he is Hamid b. Qays. And Abd Allah b. Abi al-Hudhayl is Abu al-Mughirah. And Al-Harith b. Suwayd is Abu Aisha. And Masruq is Abu Aisha. And Usayd b. Hudayr is Abu Atik. 2450 - My father told me, he said: Abbad b. al-Awwam told us from Sa'id from Ya'la b. Hakim from Tawus, Ata, and Ikrimah. Abbad mentioned a hadith about which he had no doubt. So Abu Ya'qub, the Mawla of Abu Ubaydullah, said to him: 'O Abu Sahl, Isma'il b. Ulayyah doubted regarding Ata.' He said: 'Hah! Tell him to put the pen away from his ear.' So they said to Isma'il: 'Abbad said such-and-such.' So Ibn Ulayyah said: 'I do not know it, I do not know it.' My father said: And Ibn Ulayyah was a scribe for some of them; I think he mentioned Sawwar.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2451 - My father told me, he said: Abbad told us from Asim from Al-Fudayl b. Yazid. So Abu al-Yasa' said to him: 'O Abu Sahl, it is only Al-Fudayl b. Zaid.' Abbad said: 'Who says this?' And he did not retract. My father said: It is indeed Al-Fudayl b. Zaid. 2452 - My father told me, he said: Affan told us, he said: Abu al-Ashhab told us, he said: Khulayd al-Asri told us from Al-Ahnaf b. Qays. He said: Abu Jazi said to him: 'Where did you hear from Khulayd?' He said: 'I do not know.' 2453 - I heard my father mention that Shaddad b. Aws's Kunya is Abu Ya'la. And Sa'd b. Mu'adh is Abu Amr. And As'as b. Salamah is Abu Safrah. And Asim al-Jahdari is Abu Mujashshir. And Abd al-Karim al-Jazari is Abu Sa'id.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2454 - My father told me, he said: Hajjaj told us, he said: Shu'bah said: Rufay'—meaning Abu al-Aliyah—caught (met) Ali, but he did not hear from him. 2455 - My father told me, he said: Yahya b. Sa'id told us, he said: Shu'bah abandoned the hadith of Al-Hakam regarding the Junub (sexually impure person): 'If he wants to eat, he should perform ablution.' 2456 - My father told me, he said: Ishaq b. Isa al-Tabba' told us from Ibn Uyaynah, he said: I said to Sufyan al-Thawri: 'Perhaps what drives you to give fatwas is that you see someone who is not qualified for fatwa giving fatwas, so you give fatwas.' My father said: He means Abu Hanifah. 2457 - My father told me, he said: I heard Sufyan b. Uyaynah say: Sufyan al-Thawri said to me: 'Will you not tell Mis'ar that I am on the Hilaliyyah (view)?'—meaning regarding Irja'. And Abu Nu'aym said: Mis'ar said: 'I doubt everything except my faith.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2458 - My father told me, he said: Ibn Uyaynah said: I saw Al-Thawri in a dream, and he said to me: 'Minimize your acquaintance with people.' 2459 - I heard my father mention, he said: Salih b. Kaysan said: 'Al-Zuhri said: I loosened your tongue.' And he mentioned another word. So Al-Zuhri said to him: 'I taught you the Sunnahs.' My father said: Salih was a man of poetry and strange words (Gharib). 2460 - I heard my father mention that Abu Ma'bad, the Mawla of Ibn Abbas, his name is Nafidh. And Zaid b. Thabit, his Kunya is Abu Sa'id. And Qabisah b. Dhu'ayb is Abu Sa'id as well. 2461 - My father told me, he said: Ibn Mahdi said: 'I have not seen the like of him in righteousness'—meaning Muhammad b. al-Nadr al-Harithi. 2462 - My father told me, he said: Husayn b. Hasan told us, he said: Sharik informed us from Ayyash b. Amr—meaning Al-Amiri. 2463 - My father told me, he said: Husayn told us, he said: Sharik informed us from Musa—meaning Musa al-Saghir.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2464 - My father told me, he said: Qutaybah bin Sa'id told us, he said: Malik bin Anas told us, he said: I saw Nafi', Sa'id bin Abi Hind, and Musa—meaning Ibn Maysarah—sitting in the mosque until the day rose high, then they would stand up, and none of them would speak to his companion.
2465 - My father told me, he said: Sa'id bin Abi Arubah did not hear from Al-Hakam bin Abi Utaybah, nor from Hammad, nor from Amr bin Dinar, nor from Hisham bin Urwah, nor from Isma'il bin Abi Khalid, nor from Ubayd Allah bin Umar, nor from Abu Bishr, nor from Zaid bin Aslam, nor from Abu Al-Zinad. My father said: Yet he narrated from all of these, but he did not hear anything from them.
2466 - My father told me, on the authority of Ibn Idris, he said: Shu'bah said to me: Your father used to benefit me.
2467 - My father told me, he said: They narrated about Ibn Idris that he said: Al-Bukka'i indeed heard the Maghazi (campaigns) from Ibn Ishaq.
2468 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Sa'id used to disapprove of Hammam for adding to the chain of narration (Isnad).

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2469 - My father said: Yahya told us the Hadith of Iyad bin Himar from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, regarding the Divine Decree (Al-Qadar) from Hisham. He said: And Yahya told us, he said: Shu'bah told us, from Qatadah, he said: I heard Mutarrif regarding this Hadith—meaning the Hadith of Al-Qadar.
2470 - My father said: Hammam said, from Qatadah, from Al-Ala' bin Ziyad, and Yazid—the brother of Mutarrif—and Uqbah, and another man whom Hammam forgot, from Mutarrif, from Iyad, from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace—meaning the Hadith of Al-Qadar.
2471 - My father told me, he said: Husayn bin Hasan told us, he said: Sharik informed us, he said: Abu Ja'far Al-Farra' informed me, he said: Al-A'mash used to listen to Abu Ishaq and come and write it down in my house. He said: And Al-A'mash said to me: Come, look into a book I have.
2472 - My father told me, he said: Hajjaj told us, he said: I heard Sharik mentioning the Murji'ah, and he said: They are the most malicious people; the Rafidah are sufficient in malice, but the Murji'ah lie against Allah.
2473 - My father told us, from Affan, he said: I and Bahz went out to Kufa, so Bahz said to me: Let us go to Abu Maryam. I said: No.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2474 - I heard my father say: When Ubaydah narrated to us from Abu Maryam, the people would clamor, saying: They do not want him. My father said: Then Ubaydah abandoned him afterwards.
2475 - My father said: We mentioned Uqayl bin Khalid and Ibrahim bin Sa'd in the presence of Yahya bin Sa'id, and he began to act as if he weakened them. He kept saying: Uqayl and Ibrahim bin Sa'd? Uqayl and Ibrahim? As if he was weakening them. My father said: And what does this avail Yahya? These are trustworthy men (Thiqat); Yahya did not test them.
2476 - I heard my father say: Nuf Al-Bakali's kunya (nickname) is Abu Yazid; Raja' bin Haywah is Abu Al-Miqdam; Yazid bin Maysarah is Abu Yusuf; Rafi' Al-Ta'i's kunya is Abu Hasan, and he is Rafi' bin Abi Rafi', and he is Rafi' bin Umayrah; Habirah bin Yarim bin Abd; and Dawud bin Abi Hind is Abu Bakr.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2477 - My father told me, he said: Abu Ahmad—who is Al-Zubayri—told us, he said: Abdullah bin Habib bin Abi Thabit told us, he said: I heard Al-Sha'bi when it was said to him that Isma'il Al-Suddi had been given a share of knowledge of the Qur'an. He said: Indeed, Isma'il has been given a share of ignorance of the Qur'an.
2478 - My father told me, he said: Abd Al-Samad told us, he said: Hazm told us, he said: I heard Al-Hasan narrate a Hadith, so Abdullah bin Buraydah said to him: Who informed you of this, O Abu Sa'id? He said: The daughter of Uthman bin Abi Al-As. He said: She is trustworthy, by Allah.
2479 - My father told me, he said: Husayn bin Hasan—meaning Al-Ashqar—told us, he said: Sharik told us, from Abu Rabi'ah Al-Ayadi, he said: And I saw Mis'ar listening to him.
2480 - My father told me, he said: Husayn—meaning Al-Ashqar—told us, he said: Zuhayr informed us, he said: I heard Abu Ishaq say: I used to sit frequently with Rafi' bin Khadij, and I used to sit frequently with Ibn Umar.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2481 - My father told me, he said: Husayn told us, he said: I heard Zuhayr say: I ended up at Mansur's and Ubaydah's—meaning Ibn Hamid—and his companions in a corner. I said: What is this? He said: This is a book containing eight hundred [narrations] we heard from Mansur.
2482 - My father told me, he said: Husayn told us, he said: I heard Qays and Ja'far Al-Ahmar both saying: Listen from Al-Azraq—meaning Ubaydah. And Qasim bin Ma'n said to us: You ask me about something when Ubaydah is among you?
2483 - I heard my father say: It was said to Jarir bin Abd Al-Hamid that Abd Al-Aziz bin Aban says: You did not hear anything from Mansur. He said: So he says what? He said: [He says] You presented, or it was presented for you, to Mansur. He said: So he raised his hands praying to Allah against him. He said: I think he was answered.
2484 - My father told me, he said: Zaid bin Al-Hubab told us, he said: Isma'il bin Ya'la Al-Thaqafi informed me, he said: I attended the funeral of Salim bin Abdullah in the year one hundred and seven.
2485 - My father told me, he said: Zaid bin Hubab told us, he said: Ibrahim bin Nafi' said: Tawus died in the year one hundred and six.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2486 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Sa'id told us, from Thabit bin Yazid Al-Awdi. My father said: Hafs or Ibn Idris said that this Thabit bin Yazid Al-Awdi was nothing.
2487 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Sa'id told us, from Hisham bin Urwah, he said: My father informed me, from Hajjaj bin Hajjaj, from his father: I said, O Messenger of Allah, what removes from me the obligation/burden (Madhammah) of breastfeeding? He said: A Ghurrah: a male slave or a female slave. I asked my father: What is the Madhammah of breastfeeding? He said: It means that he gives to the one who breastfeeds his child a male slave or a female slave, so he would have removed the obligation of breastfeeding.
2488 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Sa'id told us, from Isma'il—meaning Ibn Abi Khalid—he said: Amir told us, he said: The first one to pledge allegiance to the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, under the tree was Abu Sinan bin Wahb Al-Asadi. He said: On what do we pledge allegiance? He said: On what is in your soul. He said: So the people pledged allegiance to him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2489 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Sa'id told us, from Isma'il, he said: I said to Amir: It was revealed to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, while he was forty years old, then it was revealed to him for twenty [years]: ten in Mecca and ten in Medina. So what is the matter of the three [years]? He said: I was informed that Israfil appeared to him for three years.
2490 - My father said: 'Hill wa Bill' means: lawfully allowed.
2491 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Sa'id told us, from Yahya bin Sa'id Al-Ansari, he said: Aisha, may the mercy of Allah be upon her, used to grant concessions regarding the belt for the Muhrim. Yahya said: So I said to Yahya: Who told you? He said: Her nephew, Al-Qasim.
2492 - My father said: Mutarrif the Worshipper, Yahya heard from him, and Abbas Al-Ansari narrated from him regarding the Recitations (Qira'at) from Ibn Kathir, and he is Mutarrif Abu Bakr.
2493 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Sa'id told us, from Umar bin Mazyad, he said: I prayed with Sawwar bin Shabib. And Waki' said: Umar bin Munabbih Al-Sa'di; this same Hadith.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2494 - My father told me, he said: Abd Al-Rahman bin Mahdi said: Yahya bin Sa'id is knowledgeable about the Hadith of Sa'id bin Abi Arubah.
2495 - My father said: Zakariyya bin Abi Za'idah is trustworthy, sweet in Hadith, a trustworthy Sheikh.
2496 - My father said: Al-Rabi' bin Muslim is a trustworthy Sheikh.
2497 - My father told me, he said: Yahya told us, from Al-Rabi' bin Muslim. My father said: Fitr was trustworthy in Yahya's view, but he was an extreme Khashabi (Shia).
2498 - My father said: Hajjaj bin Hassan is trustworthy.
2499 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Sa'id told us, from Sinan, from Abu Ishaq, from Al-Sa'ib bin Malik, that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, prayed during an eclipse two rak'ahs in two rak'ahs. My father said: Al-Sa'ib bin Malik is Abu Ata' bin Al-Sa'ib.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2500 - My father told me, he said: Yazid bin Abd Rabbih told us, he said: I heard Baqiyyah say: I came to Mecca performing Hajj in the year one hundred and thirty-nine, and Isma'il bin Umayyah had died one day before I arrived.
2501 - My father told me, he said: Yazid bin Abd Rabbih told us, he said: I heard Baqiyyah say: Bahir bin Sa'd told me, he said: I never saw anyone who was more honoring of knowledge than Khalid bin Ma'dan; his knowledge was in a Mushaf (volume).
2502 - My father told me, he said: Abu Al-Mughirah told us, he said: Hariz told us, he said: Sulaym bin Amir told me, he said: Jubayr bin Nufayr said: I faced Islam from its beginning, and I have not ceased to see among the people the righteous and the wicked.
2503 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Sa'id told us, from Ziyad bin Lahiq, from Tamimah bint Salamah. Yahya said: The Sheikh is Kufan; I saw him with Umar bin Dhar.
2504 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Sa'id told us, from Sulayman—meaning Al-Taymi—from Abu Uthman, from Salman, he said: The sun will draw near... and he narrated the Hadith ...and as for the disbelievers—or he said the others—it will boil them, and as for their bellies, they will say: 'Ghiq, Ghiq'. My father said: It reached me that Shu'bah used to say from Al-Taymi: 'Aw, Aw', but it is only 'Ghiq, Ghiq'. My father said: And Shu'bah had a lisp, so I do not know if he misread this letter or if it was from his lisp.
2505 - My father told me, he said: Ali bin Mujahid, Abu Mujahid Al-Kabuli, from the people of Rayy, told us.
2506 - My father told me, he said: Al-Harith bin Murrah bin Mujja'ah Al-Yamami, Abu Murrah Al-Hanafi, told us.
2507 - My father told me, he said: Umar bin Hafs, Abu Hafs Al-Ma'iti, told us.
2508 - My father said: Isa bin Dinar, there is no harm in him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2509 - I asked my father about Al-Walid bin Sari', so he said: He is a freed slave (Mawla) of Amr bin Hurayth. I said to him: There is no harm in him? He said: Isma'il bin Abi Khalid narrated from him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2510 - I asked him about Musawir Al-Warraq, he said: Waki', Ibn Abi Za'idah, and Ibn Uyainah narrated from him, and Musawir used to recite poetry. I said to him: How is he? He said: I do not see any harm in his Hadith.
2511 - I asked him about Ibrahim bin Al-Muhajir, he said: There is no harm in him; he is so-so.
2512 - I asked him about Isma'il bin Ibrahim bin Al-Muhajir, he said: His father is stronger in Hadith than him.
2513 - I asked him about Abd Al-Jabbar bin Al-Abbas, he said: He is the one who is called Al-Shibami, a man from the people of Kufa; I hope there is no harm in him. Waki' and Abu Nu'aym narrated to us from him, and he used to be a Shi'a.
2514 - My father told me, he said: Abu Al-Mughirah told us, he said: Safwan told us, from Shuraih bin Ubayd Al-Hadrami, that when death approached Abu Malik Al-Ash'ari, he said: O gathering of Ash'aris, let those of you present inform those who are absent: Indeed, I heard the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, saying: Sweetness of the world is bitterness of the Hereafter, and bitterness of the world is sweetness of the Hereafter.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2515 - I heard him say: Shu'bah stayed with Al-Hakam bin Utaybah for eighteen months until he sold the beams of his house.
2516 - I heard him say: Mu'tamir used to perform ablution (Wudu) from what fire has touched. He used to follow the Hadith of Anas and the Hadith of Abu Talha that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to perform ablution from what fire has touched, and the Hadith of Zaid bin Thabit—which he narrated from his father from Zaid bin Thabit as Mursal—and the Hadith of Abu Hurairah. My father said: Al-Awza'i did not perform ablution from what fire has touched, and Sa'id bin Abd Al-Aziz Al-Tanukhi used to perform ablution from what fire has touched. Abu Abd Al-Rahman said: And my father did not perform ablution from what fire has touched.
2517 - I heard him say: Yazid bin Zuray' said: Shu'bah told us, from Sulayman Al-A'mash, and by Allah, he was a Kharrabi Saba'i; by Allah, were it not that Shu'bah narrated from him, I would never have narrated a Hadith from him.
2518 - My father told me, he said: Sayyar bin Hatim, Abu Salamah Al-Anazi, told us, he said: Ja'far told us, he said: Malik bin Dinar told us, he said: I asked Sa'id bin Jubayr, I said: O Abu Abdullah...
2519 - I heard my father say: The news of Hammad bin Zaid's death came to us in the year seventy-nine at the door of Hushaym, and Hushaym was dictating the Book of Funerals to us, so they said: Hammad bin Zaid died. And the news of Yazid bin Zuray's death came to us in the year eighty-two, a year before the death of Hushaym. And Hushaym died in the year eighty-three in Sha'ban, and he was seventy-nine years old at that time. Hushaym was older than Sufyan bin Uyainah. Hushaym was born in the year one hundred and four, and Ibn Uyainah in the year one hundred and seven. Abu Abd Al-Rahman said: And Ibrahim bin Sa'd was born in the year one hundred and eight.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2520 - I heard my father say: Abdullah bin Abi Al-Hudhayl's kunya is Abu Al-Mughirah, and Silah bin Zufar is Abu Al-Ala.
2521 - I heard him say: Ubayd Al-Rahman bin Fadalah is a trustworthy Sheikh, and he is Abu Umayyah. My father said: He is the brother of Mubarak bin Fadalah.
2522 - I heard him say: Ibn Awn said: Isma'il Al-Suddi and Habib bin Abi Thabit told us, and both of them were one-eyed.
2523 - I asked my father: Did Qatadah hear from Khilas? He said: Yes.
2524 - My father told me, he said: Bahz told us, he said: Hammam told us, he said: Qatadah was asked about a man who prayed one rak'ah of the Fajr prayer then the sun rose. He said: Khilas told me, from Abu Rafi', that Abu Hurairah told him that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: He should complete his prayer. I heard my father say: Khilas is trustworthy.
2525 - My father said: Yahya bin Sa'id used to say: If I am contradicted, I like Affan to agree with me.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2526 - I asked him about Mansur bin Abd Al-Rahman Al-Ghudani, so he said: He is the paralyzed/lame one. And he said: He is trustworthy. Isma'il bin Ulayyah and Shu'bah narrated from him, except that he differed in some Hadiths; but he is trustworthy, there is no harm in him.
2527 - I heard my father say: I used to see Affan with Yahya bin Sa'id, having with him a clipping of the Hadith of Ibn Jurayj—doubts—asking Yahya about them. And I saw Hisham bin Abd Al-Malik with him, and Yahya used to honor him. But Bahz did not come to him—meaning he did not come to Yahya—and Bahz used to be visited by people and narrate to them. And Bahz was more praiseworthy to them than Affan.
2528 - My father said: We entered one day, I and a son of Muhammad bin Al-Hasan, upon Abu Bishr Isma'il bin Ulayyah. We heard a session of the Hadith of Layth. And I saw his book—meaning the book of Ibn Ulayyah—an excellent book, the book of Hisham Al-Dastawa'i, and in it was: Hisham told us, he said: Hammad told us, he said: Ibrahim told us. He said: And his book was excellent.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2529 - My father said: We stuck to Isma'il after Hushaym died for ten years, every day; we did not miss [a day] unless there was a need. My father said: Isma'il saw me one day when I had entered upon him with an intercessor, with a man from the Ansar. He spoke a word, and a man from the Hadith scholars—I think it was Abu Muslim or someone else—said to him: This is one of our companions—meaning from those who stick to the door.
2530 - My father told me, he said: Shababah told us, he said: Abu Al-Tayyib informed me, he said: I saw Ikrimah coming from Samarkand on a donkey, under him were saddlebags, and with him was a young boy. It was said to me that the governor of Samarkand gave him this as a reward, and gave him this boy as a reward. And I heard Ikrimah in Khurasan, and it was said to him: O Abu Abdullah, what brought you to these lands? He said: Need. I asked my father about this Abu Al-Tayyib, so he said: I see he is a trustworthy Sheikh, and Ibn Al-Mubarak narrated from a man from him.
2531 - My father told me, he said: Hisham bin Lahiq told us; his kunya is Abu Uthman Al-Mada'ini.
2532 - I said to my father: Indeed, Sufyan bin Uyainah narrated from Al-Zuhri, from Urwah, from Aisha, she said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: No wealth benefited me as the wealth of Abu Bakr benefited me. He denied it and said: Who narrated it? I said: Yahya bin Ma'in narrated it to us from Sufyan, from Al-Zuhri, from Urwah, from Aisha. Yahya said: So a man said to Sufyan: Who mentioned it? He said: Wa'il. My father said: We think Wa'il did not hear from Al-Zuhri; rather, Wa'il narrated from his son. And my father denied it most strongly and said: This is a mistake. Then he said: Abd Al-Razzaq told us, from Ma'mar, from Al-Zuhri, from Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib, he said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said... and he mentioned the Hadith.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2533 - I heard my father say: Yahya bin Ma'in used to dictate/repeat (yastamli) for Umar bin Harun, so he would say: O Abu Hafs! And Ibn Jurayj from Ata... and he would raise his voice. My father narrated it and raised his voice and made his voice loud.
2534 - I heard him say: Za'idah bin Qudamah is Abu Al-Salt. I think he said: And between him and Al-Mukhtar bin Abi Ubayd there is a relation/cause.
2535 - My father told me, he said: Shababah bin Sawwar told us, he said: Abu Malik Al-Nakha'i informed me. My father said: His name is Abd Al-Malik bin Husayn.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2536 - I heard my father say: I saw Sulaym the Reciter (Al-Muqri) in Kufa in the mosque of Ya'la bin Ubayd. I said to him: Did you hear anything from him? He said: No, he used to be read to. And I saw a boy in front of him kneeling on his knees reading with precision (Tahqiq) and articulation of Hamzah.
2537 - My father told me, he said: Attab bin Ziyad told us, he said: Abdullah—meaning Ibn Al-Mubarak—passed by Muhammad bin Jabir while he was narrating in Mecca in the year sixty-eight, and we were there. He said: Narrate, O Sheikh, from your books. He said: Who is this? It was said: Ibn Al-Mubarak. So he sent his books to him. And Abd Al-Rahman bin Mahdi used to ask him about the Hadith of Hammad while Abdullah remained silent.
2538 - I heard him say: Sa'id bin Abd Al-Aziz is above Safwan bin Amr. I said to him: Above Safwan? He said: Yes. I said: Then Hariz bin Uthman Al-Rahbi? He said: Sa'id is above him. I said to him: Is he above Safwan—meaning Hariz? He said: Yes, Hariz is above Safwan. I said: Then Al-Awza'i? He said: All of these are trustworthy. And Ibn Jabir is with them—meaning Abd Al-Rahman bin Yazid bin Jabir.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2539 - I asked him about Abu Isra'il Al-Mula'i, so he said: He is so-so. I said: What is his matter? He said: He opposed the people in some Hadiths, and he is somewhat [weak] according to him. Then he said: Sufyan Al-Thawri narrated from him in Yemen; he dictated that Hadith to them. I said: What is it? He said: Al-Fudayl bin Amr narrated from Sa'id bin Jubayr, from Ibn Abbas—or from Al-Fadl—from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace: 'Whoever intends Hajj, let him learn/hasten'. My father said: Waki' narrated to us from him, and Abu Nu'aym; he is an old Sheikh, older than Sufyan and Shu'bah; he heard from Atiyyah and Talhah. Abu Isra'il witnessed the funeral of Al-Sha'bi. My father said: His name is Isma'il bin Abi Ishaq. I said: Indeed, some who spoke said he is weak. He said: No, he differed in some Hadiths.
2540 - My father said: Shu'bah is older than Sufyan by ten years.
2541 - I heard him say: Habib bin Al-Shahid is more stable (athbat) than Hamid Al-Tawil; Habib is firm, trustworthy. I said to him: More stable than Hamid? He said: Yes.
2542 - I asked him about Hisham and Hammam, he said: Glory be to Allah (Subhan Allah)! Hisham is more stable. And Shu'bah said: Hisham is more of a memorizer than me regarding Qatadah. Shu'bah used to seek help from Hisham; he would say: Hisham said.
2543 - I asked him about Mutarrif bin Tarif, so he said: Trustworthy, Mutarrif. I said to him: Which of the companions of Al-A'mash is most stable? He said: Sufyan Al-Thawri is the most beloved of them to me. I said to him: Then who? He said: Abu Mu'awiyah in quantity and knowledge—meaning knowledgeable about Al-A'mash. I said to him: Which of the companions of Al-Zuhri is most stable? He said: Every one of them has a defect (illnah), except that Yunus and Uqayl convey the wordings, and Shu'ayb bin Abi Hamzah. But they are not like Ma'mar; Ma'mar approaches them in the Isnad. I said: Then Malik? He said: Malik is the most stable in everything. But these have quantity; how much does Malik have? Three hundred Hadiths or something like that. And Ibn Uyainah has around three hundred Hadiths. Then he said: These are the ones who narrated a lot from Al-Zuhri: Yunus, Uqayl, and Ma'mar. I said to him: Shu'ayb? He said: Shu'ayb is little [in narrations]. These have more Hadith from Al-Zuhri. I said: Then Salih bin Kaysan, his narration from Al-Zuhri? He said: Salih is older than Al-Zuhri; Salih saw Ibn Umar. I said: So these are the companions of Al-Zuhri. I said: The most stable of them is Malik? He said: Yes, Malik is the most stable of them. But these are the ones who split open the knowledge of Al-Zuhri: Yunus, Uqayl, and Ma'mar. I said to him: So after Malik, who do you see? He said: Ibn Uyainah. I said to him: Al-Muwaqqiri, wonders come from him. He said: That one is nothing. My father said: Al-Zuhri was a homely, short man; he did not have that nobility; he was not handsome. Al-Zuhri is Muhammad bin Muslim bin Ubayd Allah bin Shihab.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2543 - I heard my father say: I was with Ali bin Al-Madini, and we mentioned the most stable of those who narrate from Al-Zuhri. Ali said: Sufyan bin Uyainah. And I said: Malik bin Anas. And I said: Malik has fewer errors from Al-Zuhri, while Ibn Uyainah makes mistakes in about twenty Hadiths from Al-Zuhri, in Hadith such-and-such and Hadith such-and-such. I mentioned eighteen Hadiths of them. And I said: Bring what Malik erred in. So he brought two or three Hadiths. So I went back and looked into what Ibn Uyainah erred in, and behold, they were more than twenty Hadiths.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2544 - I heard him say: When Ibn Jurayj arrived in Basra, Mu'adh bin Mu'adh stood up and stirred up trouble, saying: We will not write except by dictation. I said: So did he write by dictation? He said: Yes, they wrote by dictation. My father said: Mu'adh only heard a little in Basra by listening (Sama').
2545 - I said to him: Is Hisham bin Yusuf above Abd Al-Razzaq? He said: He is older than Abd Al-Razzaq, and he used to write for them in the presence of Sufyan Al-Thawri. But Hisham was a man as Allah willed him to be.
2546 - I heard my father say: I heard some of our companions say once—Yahya bin Ma'in said: Abd Al-Razzaq wrote for me to Hisham bin Yusuf, saying: You are going to a man who, were he not the authority/sultan, he would not have changed his Hadith. And Yahya said: We stayed at Hisham's door for fifty days; he would not narrate a Hadith to us. We would go with him to the Amir's door. My father said: I heard it from Abd Al-Razzaq, he said: He—meaning Yahya—came to him, he said: So he slaughtered a sheep for him, and did with him [good], and did. My father said: Hisham is meaner than that—to slaughter a sheep for them.
2547 - My father said: Hammam Al-Barbari appointed Hisham bin Yusuf to the judiciary, and Hammam was an evil man.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2548 - Abu Abd al-Rahman said: I think my father only adopted the prohibition of Nabidh from Ibrahim b. Sa'd and from Ibn Idris. 2549 - My father told me, he said: Shu'ayb b. Harb Abu Salih told us, he said: I heard Malik b. Anas mentioning Al-Thawri and saying: 'He has differed from me in not drinking Nabidh.' 2550 - My father told me, he said: I heard Ibrahim b. Sa'd al-Zuhri say: I asked Sufyan al-Thawri—or he was asked—about Nabidh. He said: 'Eat dates and drink water, it will become Nabidh in your stomach.' 2551 - My father told me, he said: I heard Ibrahim b. Sa'd say: 'By Allah, I never saw a drunk person in Madinah until I left it.' 2552 - I heard my father say: If a man drinks it based on interpretation (Ta'wil) and does not get intoxicated, I pray behind him. But if he gets intoxicated, I do not pray behind him. I said: 'Why?' He said: 'Because he does not purify himself from urine or other things.' 2553 - I said to him: Is it true that Hushaym and Malik b. Mighwal drank intoxicants? He said: 'How would you know what they drank? Perhaps they did not drink intoxicants.' 2554 - Abu al-Jahhaf, his name is Dawud b. Abi Awf. I said to him: Is he trustworthy? He said: 'Yes, righteous (Salih).' 2555 - I heard him say: Abd al-Rahman b. Harmalah is Abu Harmalah.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2556 - I heard him say: Isma'il b. Muslim al-Makki, what he narrated from Al-Hasan regarding Quranic readings [is fine]. But when it comes to the connected narrations (Musnad), like the hadith of Amr b. Dinar, he connects from him rejected (Manakir) hadiths; I do not consider him to be anything. He used to weaken him. And he connects from Al-Hasan from Samurah rejected hadiths. 2557 - Mu'adh b. Mu'adh b. Nasr b. Hassan al-Anbari. And Ubaydullah b. al-Hasan, the judge of Basra, he is Ibn Husayn b. Abi al-Hurr. Ibn Mahdi used to say: 'Ubaydullah b. al-Hasan said.' 2558 - I said to him: Which is more beloved to you: Abd al-Wahhab al-Khaffaf or Abd al-Wahhab al-Thaqafi? He said: 'No, Al-Thaqafi is more beloved to me.' And I heard Affan say: I used to write from Abd al-Wahhab al-Thaqafi. One day he said to me: 'From whom do you narrate most from Ibn Awn?' I said to him: 'From Sulaym b. Akhdar.' He said: 'Bring me your book.' I said: 'You are right here.' He said: 'So I left him.' My father said: Affan narrated a story from Khalid b. al-Harith regarding Abd al-Wahhab al-Thaqafi. 2559 - I asked him about Abd al-Rahman b. Ishaq al-Madini, whom Ibn Ulayyah, Bishr b. al-Mufaddal, Yazid b. Zurai', and Khalid al-Tahhan narrated from. He said: 'He is good in hadith (Salih al-Hadith). Sometimes Isma'il said: Abbad b. Ishaq told us.' My father said: 'He is Abbad b. Ishaq and he is Abd al-Rahman b. Ishaq; he is one person who had two names: Abbad and Abd al-Rahman.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2560 - I asked my father about Abd al-Rahman b. Ishaq al-Kufi. He said: This one is called Abu Shaybah, and he is a Wasiti. Ibn Idris, Abu Mu'awiyah, and Ibn Fudayl used to narrate from him. He is the one who narrates from Al-Nu'man b. Sa'd from Al-Mughirah b. Shu'bah from the Prophet (peace be upon him) rejected (Manakir) hadiths. He is not that strong in Hadith. The Madinan Abd al-Rahman, who is Abbad, is more impressive to me than this Wasiti. 2561 - I heard my father say: Al-Khaffaf used to read the Tafsir to them in the presence of Sa'id. He said: Abd Allah b. Salamah—meaning Al-Aftas—would say: 'O Abd al-Wahhab, delightful! Delightful!' My father said: Ibn Salamah went out to Kufa with Yahya. 2562 - My father said: I said to Isma'il b. Ulayyah: 'When did you hear from Sa'id?' He said: 'Before the plague and after the plague.' We said to him: 'Before the defeat (Hazimah) or after the defeat?' He said: 'Before the defeat and after the defeat.' Then he said: 'I do not know, I do not know'—as if he doubted what he heard after the defeat—'Except that I used to come to him, I and some companions of mine, and he would dictate to us. And he would not do that with everyone.' My father said: It reached me that Sa'id did not take the companions of Ayyub lightly. So when he narrated to them, he would say: 'Qatadah mentioned, so-and-so mentioned.' My father said: Isma'il said: 'And Sa'id did not use to say: Qatadah told us.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2563 - My father said: We were with Wahb b. Jarir, and Muhammad b. Sa'id al-Tirmidhi was there. They asked him to recite [Quran], but he said: 'I will not recite unless Ahmad orders me.' He said: So I did not do so. Abu Abd al-Rahman said: I said to Muhammad b. Sa'id: 'Why didn't you recite?' He said: 'I feared my recitation would not please him, and it would be a blemish upon me.' 2564 - I asked my father about reciting with melodies (*Alhan*). He disliked it and said: 'No, unless the man's nature is like the recitation of Abu Musa, rapid recitation (*Hadr*).' 2565 - My father told me, he said: Abu Ya'qub, the Mawla of Abu Ubaydullah, told me: I asked Isma'il about Al-Jurayri. He said: 'I said: Did he become confused?' He said: 'The Sheikh had only become weak/soft.' And I only know he said: 'Seven years before his death.' 2566 - My father said: Yahya b. Sa'id had a good opinion of Abd al-Wahhab al-Khaffaf and knew him from long ago. 2567 - I heard my father say: Suwayd b. Amr al-Kalbi narrated to us, and he was of good appearance. And Abbad b. al-Awwam was of good appearance. And Muhammad b. Sawa was of good appearance.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2568 - I heard him say: When Al-Khaffaf wanted to narrate to them the hadith of Hisham al-Dastawa'i, he gave me his book and said to me: 'Look into it.' So I looked into it and crossed out some hadiths from it. Then he narrated to them, and his hadith was sound. 2569 - My father said: I heard Abd al-Wahhab al-Khaffaf say: 'Ruh borrowed from me the book of Ibn Abi Dhi'b and did not return it to me.' My father said: I mentioned that to Ruh, and he said: 'Yes indeed, I sent it with his brother or with his brother's son.' 2570 - I heard him say: Yazid b. Zurai' was the sweet basil (*Rayhanah*) of Basra. 2571 - My father said: Yahya b. Sa'id was knowledgeable about the hadith of Sa'id b. Abi Arubah. Yazid b. Zurai' used to narrate saying: 'Khalid told us.' So they would say to him: 'O Abu Mu'awiyah, Khalid the servant?'—mocking him, meaning the youths of Basra. So he would say: 'I narrate from Khalid the servant? Khalid al-Hadhdha' Abu Manazil told us.' 2572 - I heard him say: Yahya b. Sa'id used to set a time limit regarding those who heard from Sa'id b. Abi Arubah: 'Before the defeat (*Hazimah*), his hearing is good.' The defeat was in the year one hundred and forty-five. My father said: 'This is the defeat of Ibrahim b. Abd Allah b. al-Hasan who rebelled against Abu Ja'far.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2573 - My father told me, he said: Abbad b. al-Awwam told us from Aban b. Taghlib from Al-Hakam from Mujahid that he read: *Fa-al-Haqqu Minni wa-al-Haqqa Aqul* ('The Truth is from Me, and the Truth I say') [Sad: 84]. He said: This was his reading and his interpretation. Abbad said: And Harun al-A'war claimed—and he was an expert in this field—Abbad said: And we all heard from him that he read: *Fa-al-Haqqu Ana wa-al-Haqqa Aqul* ('I am the Truth, and the Truth I say'). My father said: Abbad was of good appearance. 2574 - My father said: Abu Qatan said—and he was established (*Thabt*)—: 'I never lent my book to anyone.' 2575 - I heard my father say: Abu Yusuf the Judge and Malik b. Anas met in the presence of Harun [al-Rashid]. Abu Yusuf asked Malik a question, but he did not answer him. So Abu Yusuf said to Harun: 'O Commander of the Faithful, tell him to answer me.' Malik turned to him and said: 'How badly your family taught you manners!' 2576 - My father said: Muhammad b. Sawa is sweeter to the scholars of Hadith than Al-Khaffaf, except that Al-Khaffaf heard earlier. 2577 - I asked my father about Junayd b. al-Ala b. Abi Dahrah. I said: 'How is his hadith?' He said: 'I see no harm in him; Abu Usamah narrated from him.' 2578 - I heard him say: Abd al-Malik b. Marwan used to be counted among the jurists. 2579 - My father said: Yazid b. al-Qasim is Yazid al-Rishk.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2580 - My father said: Asim b. Sa'id al-Hudhali, from whom Qatadah narrated. My father said: Abd al-Rahman b. Mahdi said: Yahya b. Sa'id mentioned this Asim b. Sa'id, so Yahya said: 'That is...'—meaning as if he was attacking Hammam—'that I have inserted between Qatadah and Sa'id.' My father said: So Abd al-Rahman began to laugh. 2581 - I heard my father say: Yazid b. Zurai' used to memorize the categories/books of Sa'id b. Abi Arubah. 2582 - I heard him say: I saw Abbad b. Abbad b. Habib b. al-Muhallab enter upon Harun wearing black, and he appointed him over some affairs. And he said another time: I saw black [clothing] on Abbad.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2583 - I heard him say: Husayn b. Hasan, one of the companions of Ibn Awn, is among those counted as trustworthy and reliable. Ibn Mahdi guided them to him. He used to memorize from Ibn Awn and was of good appearance. I knew him to be trustworthy; we wrote hadiths from him. 2584 - I asked him about Yazid b. Abd Allah b. Qusayt and Ibn Harmalah. He said: 'How close they are!' 2585 - My father said: I heard Abbad b. Abbad—and he dictated it to us—from Awf from Abu Raja' from Samurah from the Prophet (peace be upon him) in a long story. He said: 'So the rock rolled (*Yatadahdah*) here.' My father said: Abbad was eloquent. My father was amazed by Abbad's precision with this word and his saying 'here'. 2586 - He said: My father mentioned Ibn Abi Ghaniyah and Abd al-Aziz b. Abi Bakr—or one of them—and said: 'He was of good appearance.' I said to him: 'What is good appearance?' He said: 'Sometimes I would see him wearing a patched shirt.' 2587 - My father told me, he said: Aswad b. Amir told us, he said: Shu'bah told us from Al-Batti from Ibrahim—he said: And he did not hear it from him—he said: Ibrahim disliked that it be said 'Mosque of Banu So-and-so'.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2588 - I heard my father say: Marwan al-Fazari was among the Hafiz (memorizers); he was a Hafiz as if it was right before his eyes. He was a Hafiz, a Hafiz. Yet if you saw him, you would say he is simple-minded. 2589 - I heard my father say: Warqa' is Abu Bishr, Ibn Ulayyah is Abu Bishr, and Ja'far b. Iyas is Abu Bishr. 2590 - My father said: Al-Artabani, I see no harm in him—meaning Abd Allah b. Hafs. Nasr b. Ali named him for us, saying: Abd Allah b. Hafs al-Artabani told us. 2591 - I said to my father: Ja'far al-Ahmar, is he trustworthy? He said: 'He is good in hadith (*Salih al-Hadith*).' 2592 - I heard my father say: The name of Al-Ajlah al-Kindi is Yahya b. Abd Allah b. Mu'awiyah, Abu Hujayyah al-Kindi.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2593 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il b. Ibrahim told us from Ayyub, he said: They asked Ikrimah about something, so he said: 'They were from the Nabateans, from your people.' 2594 - I heard him say: Bukayr b. Ma'ruf Abu Mu'adh, the judge of Nishapur, I see no harm in him. 2595 - I heard Muhammad b. Yahya b. Sa'id al-Qattan say: When Mu'adh b. Mu'adh was appointed judge of Basra, he refused to accept the testimony of the Qadariyyah. He said: So my father and Khalid b. al-Harith spoke to him and said to him: 'You know the people of this city.' He said: So it was as if he became lenient afterwards. 2596 - My father told us, he said: Mu'tamar told us, he said: I heard my father mention Khalid al-Hadhdha', he said: 'What harm would it have done him if he had done as Tawus did? He used to sit; if something was brought to him, he took it, otherwise he remained silent.' 2597 - My father told me, he said: Sahl b. Hassan—and he is Ibn Abi Khudwayh, a companion of mine—told us, he said: Abu Qilabah said: 'My two friends from the people of Basra are a tanner and a cobbler.' My father said: The cobbler is Khalid, and the tanner is Ayyub al-Sakhtiyani. 2598 - My father told me, he said: Ghassan b. al-Rabi' told us, he said: Abu Isra'il told us from Talhah b. Musarrif, he said: We used to frequent Yahya b. Wathab to read to him, and Al-A'mash was silent, no one read to him. When Yahya b. Wathab died, we searched our companions, and lo, Al-A'mash was the one to teach us reading.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2599 - My father told me, he said: Abd al-Razzaq told us, he said: I was born in the year one hundred and twenty-six. He said: We had presented (our reading) at first. A stranger would come and we would listen to something until we heard. Abd Allah b. al-Mubarak used to read the Tafsir to him—meaning to Ma'mar—and Ma'mar would read to him. 2600 - Abdullah told us, he said: Abu Bakr b. Khallad told us, he said: Yahya b. Sa'id told us from Sufyan al-Thawri, he said: I saw Ayyub buying sandals in Mecca, and he began bargaining. 2601 - I heard my father say: Abu al-Zinba', his name is Sadaqah b. Salih. And Abu al-Zahiriyyah is Hudayr b. Kurayb. 2602 - I asked about Rabi' b. Habib. He said: Ubaydullah b. Musa narrated rejected (Manakir) hadiths from him. I said: 'What about his brother A'idh b. Habib?' He said: 'That one, there is no harm in him; we heard from A'idh.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2603 - My father said: Al-Harith b. Sulayman al-Fazari, there was no harm in him; his hadith falls down—meaning Mursal. 2604 - My father told me, he said: Al-Harith b. Sulayman told us, he said: I saw Ata b. al-Sa'ib with white head and beard. 2605 - My father told me, he said: Khalaf b. al-Walid told us, he said: Abu Ma'shar told us from Harithah b. Abi al-Rijal, he said: I entered with Al-Qasim b. Muhammad upon Amrah bint Abd al-Rahman, and she was the grandmother of Al-Harith, the mother of his father. Al-Qasim said to her: 'O Umm Muhammad...' 2606 - I heard my father say in the year two hundred and twenty-nine: I wrote from Ali b. Thabit fifty years ago. Ali b. Thabit said: I used to feed Musa b. Ubaydah sweetmeat (*Khabis*), and he would narrate to me. 2607 - I heard him say: I have not seen anyone better in hadith from Shu'bah than Affan. He says: 'Abu Ishaq informed us,' 'Al-Hakam informed me,' 'Qatadah informed me,' and 'Amr b. Murrah informed me.' I said to him: 'Not even Yahya b. Sa'id?' He said: 'Not even Yahya b. Sa'id.' Sometimes Abu al-Ahwas would say to me: 'Is he more established than Abd al-Rahman b. Mahdi?'—meaning in the hadith of Shu'bah. So I would say to him: 'Yes.' He said: So that would please him. Yahya b. Sa'id said: 'I love that if I am opposed, Affan agrees with me.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2608 - I heard my father say: We stayed with Ibn Ulayyah after the death of Hushaym for ten years, except when he was absent in some place. Hushaym died in the year eighty-three [183 AH], and Isma'il died in the year ninety-three [193 AH]. We also wrote from him during the life of Hushaym. 2609 - I heard him say: Isma'il's book from Ibn Awn contained about four hundred hadiths, and he memorized hadiths from Ibn Awn that were not in his book. And Isma'il had about nine hundred hadiths from Yunus b. Ubayd, and he memorized hadiths from Ayyub that were not in his book. 2610 - My father said: There was a man in Sham from the companions of Al-Awza'i called Ibn Abi al-Ishrin; he was trustworthy. Abu Mushir used to approve of him and approve of Hiql. 2611 - I asked him, I said to him: Which is more beloved to you: Sharik from Abu Ishaq from Al-Bahi, or Za'idah from Al-Suddi from Al-Bahi? He said: Za'idah from Al-Suddi from Al-Bahi is more beloved to me. Za'idah, when he narrated a hadith, was precise in it, whereas Sharik did not care how he narrated. I said to him: Which is more beloved to you: Al-Suddi or Abu Ishaq? He said: Abu Ishaq is a trustworthy, righteous man, but those who carried from him at the end [of his life]...

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2612 - I came to Abbad b. al-Awwam while he was narrating, and I did not have tablets to write on nor anything to write with, so that session was lost to me. Among what he said, I think I memorized from Harun b. Antarah that Zadhan used to wear woolen wraps (*Aksiyah*). 2613 - I asked him about Abu al-Jahhaf. I said: Is he not trustworthy? My father said: 'Yes indeed. His name is Dawud b. Abi Awf.' 2614 - My father said: We wrote from Abu Nu'aym in the year one hundred and eighty-five. 2615 - I heard him say: Yahya b. Abi Amr al-Shaybani (approval) is trustworthy, trustworthy. 2616 - I heard him say: Atiyyah b. Qays al-Kala'i's Kunya is Abu Yahya. 2617 - I heard him say: Salih, the Mawla of al-Taw'amah, is Salih b. Nabhan. And al-Taw'amah is the daughter of Umayyah b. Khalaf.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2618 - My father told me, he said: Ibn Uyaynah told us, he said: Abu Hurayrah said: 'You ask me while Amr b. Aws is among you?' 2619 - My father told me, he said: Yahya b. Sa'id told me, he said: Sufyan al-Thawri died in the year sixty-one [161 AH] at its beginning, and Shu'bah died in the year sixty [160 AH] while he was seventy-five. 2620 - My father told me, he said: Abd al-Samad told us, he said: Abu Hilal told us, he said: Abd Allah b. Sabih told us from Ibn Sirin, he said: 'Samurah was, as far as I know, of great trustworthiness, truthful in speech, loving Islam and its people.' 2621 - My father said: Abu Hashim al-Rummani, his name is Yahya. And Abd al-Karim al-Jazari is trustworthy, trustworthy, among the trustworthy. 2622 - And I heard him say: Abd Allah b. al-Mubarak came to Al-A'mash. I do not know what Abd Allah said to him, so Al-A'mash said: 'This Turk' or 'This Khurasani,' 'except that he swore not to narrate to a group while he is among them.' He said: So it was as if Abd Allah felt restrained or pious about making him break his oath. I said to him: 'Did not Abd Allah hear from Al-A'mash?' He said: 'Yes, but not much.' 2623 - My father told me, he said: Yahya b. Sa'id told us from Sufyan from Abu al-Rabi' Halwath.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2624 - I asked him about Damrah b. Rabi'ah. He said: 'Among the trustworthy, reliable ones. A righteous man, good in Hadith (*Salih al-Hadith*). There was no man in Sham like him.' I said to him: 'Which is more beloved to you: him or Baqiyyah?' He said: 'No, Damrah is more beloved to us. Baqiyyah did not care from whom he narrated.' 2625 - I mentioned to him the hadith of Ibn Ulayyah from Ayyub, he said: 'I was informed from Sa'id b. Jubayr, he said: Ibn Abbas said: Verily the first one to stride (*Sa'a*) between Safa and Marwah was the mother of Isma'il'—the story regarding the building of the House. He said: Isma'il from Ayyub: 'I was informed from Sa'id.' And Ma'mar narrates it from Ayyub from Sa'id, he did not say 'I was informed'. And Abu Awanah narrates it from Abu Bishr from Sa'id b.
