Jubayr. My father said: 'I think that Ayyub took it from Abu Bishr from Sa'id, because Ibn Ulayyah said from Ayyub: I was informed from Sa'id.' 2626 - I heard my father say: 'Isl b. Sufyan is not strong in Hadith in my view.' 2627 - My father told me, he said: I heard Sufyan b. Uyaynah say: Yahya b. Sa'id—meaning Al-Ansari—said to me: 'What do the people of Mecca know about *Al-Araya* (agricultural contracts)?' I said: 'Ata informed them; he heard it from Jabir.' 2628 - I heard him say: Yazid al-Raqashi is above Aban b. Abi Ayyash.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2629 - I heard him say one day: Hushaym narrated to us the hadith of Abu al-Jahm from Al-Zuhri from Abu Salamah. Hajjaj b. Muhammad and Ishaq b. al-Tabba' were with him. Ishaq b. al-Tabba' asked Hushaym that day about the hadith of Dhu al-Qarnayn, the hadith of Al-Fadl b. Atiyyah, so he narrated it to us that day. And he also narrated to us that day the hadith of Al-Awwam from Jabalah b. Suhaym from Mu'aththir b. Afazah from Ibn Mas'ud. I saw Hajjaj writing, and he began to fall behind (not catch up). He was writing on papyrus. Then he stood up after the session and corrected what he had missed by asking Hushaym about it. 2630 - My father said: Yahya b. Sa'id said: 'I have not seen anyone better in hadith than Shu'bah.' 2631 - I heard him say: Abd Allah b. Salamah's Kunya is Abu al-Aliyah. I do not know anyone who narrated from him other than Amr b. Murrah and Abu Ishaq al-Hamdani. And his Kunya is Abu al-Aliyah—meaning Abd Allah b. Salamah. 2632 - I heard him say regarding the hadith of Abu Ishaq from Abd Allah b. Abi Basir from his father from Ubayy from the Prophet (peace be upon him) regarding the story of prayer: Sufyan and Shu'bah say 'From Abu Ishaq from Abd Allah b. Abi Basir'—they did not say 'from his father'—and he mentioned it. And Zuhayr and others say 'From Abu Ishaq from Abd Allah b. Abi Basir from his father from Ubayy b. Ka'b'—and he mentioned the hadith. 2633 - And I heard him say: Habib b. Abi Thabit; they say he is Habib b. Qays.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2634 - My father told us, he said: Affan told us, he said: Shu'bah told us, he said: Khulayd b. Ja'far informed me, and he was among the most truthful of people and the most God-fearing. 2635 - I heard him say: Khalifah b. Ghalib is more trustworthy than Khalid b. Abd al-Rahman al-Sulami. Abd al-Samad narrated to us from this Khalifah. 2636 - My father said: Yazid b. Khumayr's Kunya is Abu Umar. 2637 - I mentioned to my father the hadith of Abu Mu'awiyah from Hisham from his father from Zaynab bint Abi Salamah from Umm Salamah that the Prophet (peace be upon him) ordered her to join him (*Tuwafiyahu*) on the Day of Sacrifice for the Fajr prayer in Mecca. My father said: I mentioned that to Yahya b. Sa'id, so he said: Hisham said: 'My father informed me, mursal.' And he said 'Tuwafi' (join/meet), because Abu Mu'awiyah said 'Tuwafiyahu' (join *him*) and erred in it. So Yahya said to me: 'Ask Abd al-Rahman.' So I asked him, and he narrated to me from Sufyan from Hisham from his father, mursal, and he said 'Tuwafi', like what Yahya said from Hisham. And Ibn Uyaynah [said] like Yahya and Abd al-Rahman. And Waki' erred in it; he said: 'Tuwafi bi-Mina' (join in Mina). He erred regarding 'in Mina' because the hadith said 'Join on the Day of Sacrifice', so Waki' said 'in Mina' and erred in it. 2638 - My father said: Abbad b. Rashid is trustworthy, trustworthy.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2639 - I heard him say: A Sheikh called Mubashshir b. Ubayd used to be in Homs, and his origin is Kufan. I think Baqiyyah and Abu al-Mughirah narrated from him. His hadiths are fabricated hadiths; a lie. 2640 - My father said: Abbad b. Maysarah al-Minqari and Abbad b. Rashid; Ibn Mahdi narrated from both of them. And Abbad b. Rashid is more established in hadith than Abbad b. Maysarah al-Minqari. 2641 - I said to him: Was Abu al-Walid established (*Thabt*)? He said: 'No, his book was not pointed or voweled, but he is precise in the hadith of Shu'bah.' And he said once: 'He mastered the hadith of Shu'bah.' 2642 - My father said: Regarding the hadith of Abu Awanah, he erred or misspoke. We corrected him, and he returned to what we said to him. 2643 - I asked my father about Abu Nasr. He said: This is a Sheikh whom Sufyan al-Thawri, Ibn Uyaynah, and Ibn Fudayl narrated from. His name is Abd Allah b. Abd al-Rahman, and he is an old Sheikh. I said: 'How is his hadith?' He said: 'What hadith does he have? A man is only known by the abundance of his hadith.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2644 - My father mentioned the hadith of Al-Muharibi from Asim from Abu Uthman, the hadith of Jarir: 'A city will be built between Tigris and Dujayl.' He said: Al-Muharibi was a sitting companion of Sayf b. Muhammad, the nephew of Sufyan, and Sayf was a liar. So I think Al-Muharibi heard it from him. It was said to him: 'Abd al-Aziz b. Aban narrated it from Sufyan.' He said: 'Everyone who narrates it is a liar'—meaning from Sufyan. I said to him: 'Luwayn narrated it to us from Muhammad b. Jabir.' He said: 'Muhammad used to insert into his book—or it would be inserted into his book'—meaning hadith. And he said: 'This hadith is not authentic,' or he said: 'A lie.' 2645 - Yahya b. Ma'in told us, he said: Yahya b. Abi Bukayr told us from Ammar b. Sayf the hadith of Asim from Abu Uthman from Jarir: 'A city will be built between Tigris and Dujayl.' When he finished it, Yahya said: 'This is fabricated,' or he said: 'A lie.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2646 - My father used to narrate to us from Amr b. Ubayd, and sometimes he would say 'a man' without naming him, then he abandoned him after that and would not narrate from him. 2647 - My father told me, he said: I heard Muhammad b. Abd Allah b. Numayr from Abd Allah b. Idris from Shu'bah, he said: Al-Hakam died in the year fourteen [114 AH]. Ibn Idris said: And I was born in the year fifteen [115 AH]. Abd Allah said: And I myself heard it from Muhammad b. Abd Allah b. Numayr. 2648 - I heard my father say: Abd al-Malik b. Harun b. Antarah is weak in Hadith. 2649 - I heard him say: Harun b. al-Mughirah al-Razi, there is no harm in him. 2650 - My father told me, he said: Abd al-Razzaq told us from Ma'mar, he said: I asked Al-Zuhri about a hadith he narrates from Urwah from Aisha. He said: 'Uff! Leave them and leave their hadith.' 2651 - I heard my father say: When the news of Jarir's death reached us, I and Yahya b. Ma'in went to Ubaydah b. Humayd. He dictated to us from his copy: Abu al-Za'ra', Thuwayr—I think—and Mukhariq, and Al-Aswad b. Qays, and similar Sheikhs. Then people crowded around him until they overwhelmed us, and the crowding increased until we could not reach him—or as my father said.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2652 - I heard my father say: Abu Hariz, his name is Abd Allah b. Husayn. His hadith is rejected (*Munkar*). Mu'tamar narrated from Fudayl from Abu Hariz rejected hadiths. Abu Hariz was a judge in Sijistan. 2653 - Isma'il b. Ibrahim used to dislike being called 'Ibn Ulayyah'. 2654 - And Waki' wrote—my father said: I think his children wrote on their father's behalf to Isma'il to narrate to Waki's children. So Isma'il b. Ulayyah wrote to me, and it was as if he disliked that. 2655 - My father told me, he said: Al-Walid b. Muslim told us from Al-Awza'i and Sa'id b. Abd al-Aziz from Al-Zuhri from Qabisah b. Dhu'ayb from Amr b. al-As, he said: 'The waiting period (*Iddah*) of the *Umm Walad* (slave mother) is the waiting period of a free woman.' 2656 - My father told me, he said: Al-Walid told us from Sa'id b. Abd al-Aziz from Sulayman b. Musa from Raja' b. Haywah from Qabisah b. Dhu'ayb from Amr b. al-As, he said: 'The waiting period of the *Umm Walad* is the waiting period of a free woman.' My father said: I said to Al-Walid: 'Who narrated it to you?' He said: 'Sa'id.' My father said: 'This is a rejected (*Munkar*) hadith.' 2657 - My father said: Sulaym b. Akhdar is among the people of trustworthiness and truthfulness.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2658 - I heard my father say: Abd Allah b. Idris said: I said to Malik b. Anas: 'We had Alqamah and Al-Aswad.' He said: 'You had among you the one who turned the matter like this'—meaning Abu Hanifah—and he turned the palm of his hand over its back. 2659 - My father told me, he said: Hajjaj b. Muhammad told us, he said: I heard Sufyan al-Thawri say: May Allah have mercy on Abu Hazim, he said: 'People today are satisfied with knowledge and have abandoned action.' 2660 - My father said: It reached me that Anas b. Malik said to Thabit: 'How much your eyes resemble the eyes of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him)!' So he kept weeping until his eyes became bleary. 2661 - My father said: I heard Sufyan b. Uyaynah say: 'Whoever sows good reaps envy/joy (*Ghibtah*), and whoever sows evil reaps regret. Do you commit evil deeds and hope to be rewarded with good deeds? Indeed, just as grapes are gathered from thorns [implying the impossible].' 2662 - My father told me, he said: Affan told us, he said: Awn b. Mu'ammar told me, he said: Al-Khidr said to Musa: 'Desist from obstinacy, do not walk without need, do not laugh without wonder, do not reproach sinners for their sins, and weep over your own sin, O Son of Imran.' My father said: Awn b. al-Mu'ammar, this is a Sheikh, good in Hadith (*Salih al-Hadith*).

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2663 - My father told me, he said: Mu'ammal told us, he said: Hammad b. Zaid told us, he said: I heard Ubaydullah b. Umar say: 'I met men in Madinah and saw them magnifying speech regarding Tafsir (Quranic exegesis), and they stood in awe of Al-Qasim, Salim, and Nafi'.' 2664 - I heard my father say: Abu Mu'awiyah al-Darir is inconsistent (*Mudtarib*) in hadith other than that of Al-A'mash; he does not memorize them well. 2665 - My father said: Hasan b. Salih is more established (*Athbat*) in Hadith than Sharik b. Abd Allah. 2666 - My father told me, he said: Hajjaj told us, he said: I asked Shu'bah, and he said: 'Everyone I narrate from, except a few, were in the *'Ata* (state stipend).' Sa'd b. Ubaydah was with the people when Al-Husayn was killed. And Al-Hasan, Ibn Sirin, Abu Ishaq, Zubayd, and others were in the *'Ata*. And Zubayd was among those who attended the mosque when Zaid was killed. Yusuf ordered: 'Whoever of the people of the registry (*Diwan*) does not attend the mosque, I will do such-and-such to him.' So they attended, and among them was Zubayd. Mis'ar did not attend, and he was in the *'Ata*. 2667 - My father told me, he said: Mu'awiyah b. Hisham told us, he said: Sufyan told us from Ubayd al-Mukib from Abu al-Tufayl Amir b. Wathilah from Salman, he said: 'I am from Jayy.' 2668 - My father said: And Yahya b. Sa'id al-Qattan heard from Malik b. Anas during the lifetime of Hisham b. Urwah. Most of it was reports: 'Ibn Shihab told us,' 'Nafi' told us.' Yahya b. Sa'id said: Malik used to say to me: 'What does Hisham b. Urwah narrate to you?' 2669 - My father said: Dawud b. Abi Hind is trustworthy, trustworthy. 2670 - My father said: Ali b. Mushir is more beloved to me than Abu Mu'awiyah al-Darir in Hadith. 2671 - I asked him about Abd al-Rahman b. Qays al-Za'farani. He said: 'He was nothing; he is nothing.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2672 - My father told me, he said: Affan told us, he said: Hammad b. Zaid told us from Ibn Awn that Muhammad said: 'If I wished to weigh what I eat...' 2673 - My father told me, he said: Yahya b. Adam told us, he said: Hammad b. Zaid told us from Yahya b. Atiq from Muhammad b. Sirin, he said: 'I used to meet Ubaydah at the outskirts (*Atraf*), so I would ask him.' 2674 - My father told me, he said: Yahya b. Adam told us, he said: Abu Bakr b. Ayyash said: Perhaps Al-A'mash and Mughirah would differ before me regarding inheritance shares (*Faridah*). So I would inform Mughirah of what Al-A'mash said, and he would say: 'We only learned this from him.' He said: So perhaps I would return to Al-A'mash and inform him of Mughirah's statement. He said: So perhaps he would return to Mughirah's opinion.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2675 - My father told me, he said: Yahya b. Adam told us, he said: Abu Isra'il al-Mula'i told us from Ata b. al-Sa'ib from Abu al-Ahwas from Abd Allah, he said: 'Discuss Hadith, for its life is discussion.' 2676 - My father told us, he said: Sulayman b. Harb told us, he said: Hammad b. Zaid told us, he said: It was said to Ayyub: 'Did you see Jabir b. Zaid?' He said: 'Yes, I saw him; he was intelligent, intelligent.' He said: Ayyub mentioned Jabir b. Zaid one day and began marveling at his jurisprudence (*Fiqh*). 2677 - My father said: I saw Yazid b. Yusuf Abu Yusuf al-Shami, and he had seen Hassan b. Atiyyah. My father said: I saw him wearing a yellow lower garment (*Izar*), and I did not write anything from him. 2678 - My father told me, he said: Abu Nu'aym told us, he said: Al-A'mash told us, he said: Mas'ud Abu Razin told us from Rabi' b. Khuthaym. 2679 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Sufyan told us from Isma'il b. Sami' from Muslim al-Batin from Abu Wa'il, he said: 'I frequented Salman b. Rabi'ah when he arrived for forty mornings; no disputant came to him during them.' Waki' said: 'And he was the first judge sent to Kufa.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2680 - I said to him: 'Is Abu Mu'awiyah above Shu'bah—meaning in the hadith of Al-A'mash?' He said: 'Abu Mu'awiyah is in quantity (*Kathrah*) and knowledge (*Ilm*)—meaning his knowledge of Al-A'mash. Shu'bah is a man of Hadith who conveys the wordings and reports. Abu Mu'awiyah [uses] "from, from" (*An, An*), and Abu Mu'awiyah errs regarding Al-A'mash.' I said to him: 'After Abu Mu'awiyah, is Shu'bah more established?' He said: 'Shu'bah is more established (*Athbat*) in everything.' 2681 - My father told me, he said: Ibn al-Sammak told us, he said: I saw Sufyan al-Thawri drinking from a silver-plated vessel. 2682 - My father told me, he said: I heard Sufyan b. Uyaynah say: *Wa An'ama* (and blessed/honored). He said: Meaning *Wa Ahlan* (and welcome). He said: Meaning in the hadith of the Prophet (peace be upon him): 'Verily Abu Bakr and Umar are among them, *wa an'ama*.' 2683 - My father told me from Yahya b. Sa'id al-Qattan, he said: I arrived in Mecca in the year one hundred and forty-four, and Isma'il b. Umayyah and Abd Allah b. Uthman b. Khuthaym had died. He said: And Hajjaj b. Artah came to us in that year. He said: And I saw Al-Awza'i and Thawr in the year fifty [150 AH]. My father said: I said to Yunus, the truthful one, Hammad b. Salamah: 'From whom did he benefit in the last part of his life?' He said: 'From Sa'id al-Jurayri'—meaning he narrates from him. My father said: Yunus came to us once and brought out [the names of] Sheikhs, and he used to track down Sheikhs. My father said: I saw Yunus, the truthful one, with Ibrahim b. Sa'd—I think my father said—and he began discussing with him or extracting from him—or as my father said.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2684 - Abu Abd al-Rahman told us, he said: Abu Bakr b. Khallad al-Bahili told me, he said: Yahya b. Sa'id told me from Sufyan al-Thawri, he said: 'I saw Ayyub al-Sakhtiyani buying sandals in Mecca. He said: And he began bargaining.' 2685 - I asked my father about Abu Hisham Dalawayh. He said: 'I know him.' Then he said: 'He used to accompany a righteous man who prayed much, called Imran.' 2686 - I heard my father say: Sa'id b. Abi Sadaqah is trustworthy, trustworthy. 2687 - I heard my father say: Yahya b. Atiq is trustworthy. 2688 - I heard my father say: Kathir b. Shanzir is good in Hadith (*Salih al-Hadith*). 2689 - I heard my father say: Kulthum b. Jabr is trustworthy.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2690 - Abu Abd al-Rahman told us, he said: Khalaf b. Hisham al-Bazzar told us, he said: Hammad—meaning Ibn Zaid—told us from Isa al-Sarraj, he said: Attiyah asked Al-Hasan about leopard skins. He said: 'They are only tanned with ash and salt.' He said: 'That is their tanning.' I asked my father about Isa al-Sarraj, and it was as if he did not know him. He said: 'Ibn Ulayyah narrated this hadith to us from Sahl al-Sarraj—meaning him—and he denied that it was from Isa. He said: It is only Sahl.' 2691 - I heard my father say: Layth b. Abi Sulaym is inconsistent (*Mudtarib*) in Hadith, but people narrated from him. 2692 - I heard my father say: Yahya b. Ubaydullah is not trustworthy. 2693 - I asked my father about the hadith of Jarir al-Razi from Abu Abd al-Rahman, he said: When Ibrahim al-Sa'igh was asked 'From whom are you?', he said: 'My mother is a Mawlah of Hamdan, and my father is a man from the people of Fars, and I am a Mawla of Allah and His Messenger.' My father said: Abu Abd al-Rahman, I think he is Ibn al-Mubarak.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2694 - I asked my father about the hadith of Ibn Uyaynah, he said: Malik b. Anas al-Madini told me from Al-Zuhri from Abu Abd al-Rahman from Zaid b. Thabit, he was asked and said: 'She is not lawful for him except through the door by which she became forbidden to him'—meaning regarding the slave girl who is under a freeman, he divorces her one divorce, then two divorces, then he buys her. And Amr al-Naqid narrated the hadith to me, he said: Sufyan told us. My father said: 'If Abu Abd al-Rahman is not Sulayman b. Yasar, then I do not know who he is.' 2695 - I asked my father about Abu Nasr. He said: 'Trustworthy, trustworthy. Ibn Fudayl narrated to me from him'—meaning Abd Allah b. Abd al-Rahman. 2696 - I heard my father say: Mubashshir b. Ubayd is nothing; he fabricates Hadith. 2697 - I heard my father say: Muhammad b. Sa'id, whom Abu Ja'far killed for heresy (*Zandaqah*), his hadith is fabricated hadith. 2698 - I heard my father say: Hafs b. Sulayman—meaning Abu Umar the Reader—is abandoned in Hadith (*Matruk al-Hadith*). 2699 - I heard my father say: Zafir is trustworthy, trustworthy; I saw him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2700 - I narrated to my father the hadith of Hassan b. Ibrahim al-Kirmani from Asim b. Sulayman from Abd Allah b. al-Hasan from his mother Fatimah bint Husayn b. Ali from her mother Fatimah bint Rasul Allah (peace be upon him) that the Prophet (peace be upon him), when he entered the mosque, would say: 'Peace be upon you, O Prophet, and the mercy of Allah. O Allah, forgive me my sins and open for me the doors of Your mercy.' My father said: 'This is not from the hadith of Asim al-Ahwal; this is from the hadith of Layth b. Abi Sulaym.' 2701 - I narrated to my father the hadith of Hassan b. Ibrahim from Abd al-Malik al-Kufi, he said: I heard Al-Ala, he said: I heard Makhul narrating from Abu Umamah and Wathilah, they said: 'When the Prophet (peace be upon him) stood in prayer, he did not turn right or left, and he cast his gaze at the place of his prostration.' He denounced it strongly and said: 'Strike it out.' 2702 - I asked my father about the hadith of Marwan al-Fazari from Ibrahim b. Abi Hisn from Maghra' or from another man from Sa'id b. Jubayr. My father said: Ibrahim b. Abi Hisn is Abu Ishaq al-Fazari. 2703 - I asked my father about the hadith of Abu Bakr b. Ayyash from Isa b. Sulaym. He said: 'I do not know him.' 2704 - I asked my father about Uthman b. Waqid. He said: 'He is Umari; I see no harm in him.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2705 - I asked my father about Al-Khadr b. Muhammad al-Harrani, whom Amr al-Naqid narrated from. He said: 'Al-Khadr is trustworthy.' 2706 - I heard my father say: Jundub b. Sufyan is Jundub b. Abd Allah al-Alaqi; a clan of Bajilah. 2707 - I heard my father say: Abu Zaid al-Harawi is trustworthy.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2708 - I heard my father say: Muhammad b. Abd al-Wahhab—meaning Al-Fami Al-Qannad—is trustworthy; there was no harm in him. 2709 - Abu Abd al-Rahman said: Some of the Kufans told us, he said: Hafs b. Ghiyath told us from Ibn Jurayj from Ata from Ibn Abbas from the Prophet (peace be upon him): 'Cover the faces of your dead, and do not resemble the Jews.' I narrated this to my father, and he denounced it and said: 'Hafs erred in this and elevated it (Marfu'). It was narrated to me from Hajjaj al-A'war from Ibn Jurayj from Ata, Mursal.' 2710 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Muhammad b. Idris al-Shafi'i told me, he said: Sharik narrated the hadith of Mujahid from Ayman b. Umm Ayman, the brother of Usamah through his mother. We said: 'You have no knowledge of our companions. Ayman, the brother of Usamah, was killed with the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) on the Day of Hunayn before Mujahid was born, and he did not remain after the Prophet (peace be upon him) to narrate from him.' 2711 - Abd Allah b. Umar b. Muhammad b. Aban b. Salih al-Qurashi told me, he said: Abu Mu'awiyah told us, he said: I heard Al-A'mash say: Ash'ath b. Sawar met me and asked me about a hadith. I said: 'No, not even half a hadith! Are you not the one who narrates from Jabir—meaning Al-Ju'fi?'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2712 - Abd Allah b. Umar told me, he said: I heard Sharik b. Abd Allah say: I heard Abu Ishaq say: 'I saw Ali with white head and beard.' 2713 - Abd Allah—meaning Ibn Umar—told me, he said: I heard Abu Bakr b. Ayyash say: He said: I heard Abu Ishaq say: 'I prayed Jumu'ah with Ali b. Abi Talib.' Abu Bakr said: I said: 'What time?' He said: 'In the heat of noon (*Hajirah*), exactly when the sun passed its zenith.' 2714 - Some of our companions told us, he said: I heard Arim b. al-Fadl say—and he mentioned Daljah b. Qays—so he said: 'Do you know why he was named Daljah? They went out to Mecca at dawn, so they traveled by night (*Adlaju*), and his mother was pregnant with him, so she gave birth, and he was named Daljah.' 2715 - Abd Allah b. Umar Abu Abd al-Rahman al-Qurashi told me, he said: I heard Hafs b. Ghiyath say: Al-Hasan b. al-Hurr gathered them. Among those he invited that day were Ata b. al-Sa'ib, Al-A'mash, and Layth in a group. So Al-Hasan b. al-Hurr said to them: 'Do you not see what fitnah the people are in? I have gathered you to write a book that those after us may read.' The people fell silent. So Al-A'mash said: 'A man controlled his tongue, guarded himself, and knew what was in his heart. It used to be said that if a gathering is prolonged, Satan has an opportunity in it. Bring your food, bring it close.' So he called for the tray, and they did not write a book.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2716 - Abd Allah b. Umar told me, he said: I heard Husayn al-Ju'fi say: 'I saw Ibn Abi Husayn wearing his ring on his left hand. And I saw Jabir al-Ju'fi.' 2717 - Abd Allah b. Umar told me, he said: Abu Usamah told us, he said: Isma'il b. Abi Khalid told us, he said: 'I saw Ibn Abi Awfa having two braids, and he used to dye with henna. And I saw Anas having his beard dyed with Wars.' 2718 - Abd Allah b. Umar told me, he said: Hafs b. Ghiyath told us from Al-A'mash, he said: 'I saw Abu Bakr b. Abd al-Rahman b. al-Harith b. Hisham, an old man with a large belly, dyeing his beard yellow.' 2719 - Abd Allah b. Umar told me, he said: Mu'awiyah b. Hisham told us, he said: Sufyan told us from Awf al-A'rabi from Abu Uthman, he said: I heard Salman say: 'I am from Ramhormoz.' 2720 - Abd Allah b. Ahmad told us, he said: My father told me, he said: Isma'il b. Ibrahim—meaning Ibn Ulayyah—told us, he said: Ayyub informed us from Ikrimah b. Khalid from Abu Bakr b. Abd al-Rahman b. al-Harith, he said: 'I am the most knowledgeable of people about this hadith. It reached Marwan that Abu Hurayrah was narrating from the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) that he said: "Whoever is overtaken by dawn while he is Junub (sexually impure), let him not fast that day." So he sent to Aisha to ask her about that. She went with him and he asked her. She said: "The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) used to wake up Junub without a wet dream, then he would fast." So he returned to Marwan and told him. He said: "Go to Abu Hurayrah and tell him." He said: "He is my neighbor, and I dislike to confront him with what he dislikes." He said: "I command you to tell him." He said: So I met him and said: "O Abu Hurayrah, by Allah, I used to dislike confronting you with what you dislike, but the Amir commanded me..." He said: So he told him. He said: "Al-Fadl told it to me."'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2721 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il b. Ulayyah told us from Ayyub, he said: A man would narrate a hadith to Muhammad [Ibn Sirin], and he would not turn to him with much attention. He said: So he would say: 'By Allah, I do not accuse you, nor do I accuse that one, but I accuse the one between you two.' My father said: Ibn Ulayyah narrated this hadith to us at the door of Hushaym. 2722 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il b. Ulayyah told us, he said: Ayyub told us, he said: Abu Qilabah bequeathed his books to me, so I brought them from Sham, and I paid a little over ten dirhams for their transport. 2723 - My father told me, he said: Ibn Ulayyah told us from Ayyub, he said: 'I reached Basra when no Muslim was selling Mushafs there.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2724 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il told us, he said: Ayyub told us, he said: I asked Ikrimah about a verse while we were in Madinah. He said: 'It was revealed at the foot of that mountain'—and he pointed to Sal'. 2725 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il b. Ulayyah told us, he said: Ayyub told us from Ibrahim b. Maysarah from Mujahid, he said: 'I prayed the Fajr prayer with Maslamah b. Mukhallad. He recited Al-Baqarah and did not drop an Alif or a Waw.' 2726 - My father told me, he said: Ibn Ulayyah told us, he said: Ibn Awn told us, he said: 'We buried Ibrahim at night while we were afraid.' 2727 - My father told me, he said: Ibn Ulayyah told us, he said: Al-Taymi told us from Tawus: We were with Ibn Abbas, and Sa'id b. Jubayr was writing. One of them said to him: 'They are writing.' He said: 'They are writing?' And he was better natured than me, so he stood up. 2728 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il b. Ibrahim b. Ulayyah told us, he said: Abd al-Aziz b. Qurayr informed me, he said: I think Muhammad b. Sirin told us that Aflah, the Mawla of Abu Ayyub, had a palfrey or a horse, so he sold it. Abu Ayyub said to him: 'Why did the one who bought it buy it?' He said: 'He desires its beauty.' He said: 'What made him more entitled to beauty than you?'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2729 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il b. Ulayyah told us, he said: Al-Hasan used to dye his beard yellow. Ibn Sirin used to dye with henna. Ibn Awn, Yunus, and Ayyub used to dye with henna, but Ibn Awn was the best of them in dyeing. Ibn Sirin used to go out to the market in the summer in an Izar (lower garment) and a Rida' (upper garment). And Ibn Awn used to go out in an Izar and Rida' that he had colored. 2730 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il b. Ulayyah told us from Ibn Awn: 'I think—or I see—that these books will have an outcome, an evil outcome.' 2731 - My father told me, he said: Ibn Ulayyah told us, he said: 'They only disliked books because those before you adopted books and were pleased with them, so they disliked being occupied by them away from the Qur'an.' 2732 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il b. Ulayyah told us, he said: Habib b. al-Shahid informed us from Abd Allah b. Abi Mulaykah, he said: Ibn al-Zubayr said to Abd Allah b. Ja'far: 'O Abu Ja'far...' 2733 - My father told me, he said: Ibn Ulayyah told us, he said: Abd al-Rahman b. Ishaq told us from his father, he said: I saw Nafi' b. Jubayr at Al-Araj wearing a safflower-dyed wrap (*Milhafah*) while he was in Ihram. My uncle said to him: 'O Abu Muhammad...'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2734 - My father told me, he said: Sufyan b. Uyaynah told us, he said: Abu Umayyah used to come on Friday and step over [people], saying: 'May Allah have mercy on whoever is not harmed.' 2735 - My father told me, he said: Ibn Ulayyah Isma'il told us, he said: Shaddad b. Sa'id told me, he said: Jabir b. Amr al-Rasibi told me, he said: I heard Abu Barzah al-Aslami say: 'I killed Abd al-Uzza b. Khatal while he was clinging to the covering of the Ka'bah.' 2736 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il b. Ulayyah told us, he said: Ayyub told me from Muhammad, he said: 'I see them lying about Ali, because Ubaydah told me that Ali said to Shuraih: I dislike disagreement.' 2737 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il b. Ibrahim told us, he said: Ayyub informed us from Ibn Abi Mulaykah, he said: He said to me: 'Are you not amazed? Al-Qasim told me from Aisha that she said: I assumed Ihram for Hajj'—my father said: meaning with the Prophet (peace be upon him)—'and Urwah told me from her that she said: I assumed Ihram for Umrah. Are you not amazed?' 2738 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il told us, he said: Ayyub informed us, he said: I was with Mujahid, and a man from the people of Kufa was with him. Tarif asked him, saying: 'What do you say about monkey meat?' So he disliked it. Abu Abd al-Rahman said: In my view, this is more likely from the hadith of Layth than from the hadith of Ayyub.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2739 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il told us, he said: Ayyub informed us, he said: Al-Hasan said: 'Are you not amazed at Sa'id b. Jubayr? He entered asking me about fighting Al-Hajjaj, and with him were some of the leaders from the companions of Ibn al-Ash'ath.' 2740 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il told us, he said: Ayyub informed us from Ibn Sirin from Aflah, the Mawla of Abu Ayyub, he said: I was with Abd Allah b. Salam, and he began following those leaders who marched to Uthman, saying: 'Do not kill the Commander of the Faithful, and seek his favor.' 2741 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il told us: Our companions said that Muhammad—meaning Ibn Sirin—used to dislike saying 'Ka'b al-Habr' (Ka'b the Rabbi), and he would say 'Ka'b the Muslim'. 2742 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Al-Mas'udi told us from Muhammad b. al-Muntashir: 'Masruq was his uncle.' 2743 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il told us, he said: Ayyub told us from Ibn Sirin from Kathir b. Aflah, he said: 'The last session in which we sat with Zaid b. Thabit was a session in which we recited poetry to one another.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2744 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il told us from Ayyub, he said: I asked Sa'id b. Jubayr about a hadith after he stood up. He said: 'Not every time I am milked do I give drink' (i.e., not every time I am asked do I answer). 2745 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il told us, he said: Ayyub and Salamah b. Alqamah informed us from Ibn Sirin, he said: I was informed that Salim, the Mawla of Abu Hudhayfah, was manumitted by a woman from the Ansar, then she said to him: 'Go and ally yourself with whomever you wish.' So he allied himself with Abu Hudhayfah. 2746 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il told us, he said: Ibn Awn informed us, he said: Al-Hasan, Ibrahim, and Al-Sha'bi used to narrate a hadith sometimes like this and sometimes like that. He said: I mentioned that to Ibn Sirin, and he said: 'Verily, if they had narrated it as they heard it, it would have been better for them.' 2747 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il told us, he said: Sa'id al-Jurayri told us from Abu Nadrah, he said: When one of the Companions of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said regarding something: 'It is not so,' they would say to him: 'It is not as you said, may Allah forgive you.' 2748 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il told us from Habib b. al-Shahid, he said: We were with Ibn Sirin on the day Al-Hasan died. His son said to him: 'Will you not prepare for this funeral?' He remained silent, then returned and said: 'Not everything I manage of my affairs do I inform the people about. Al-Nadr b. Anas died, and he was among the most cherished of the people of Basra to me, yet I did not attend his funeral.' Then he said: 'May Allah have mercy on Al-Hasan.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2749 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il told us, he said: Sa'id al-Jurayri informed us from Abu Nadrah, he said: I said to Abu Sa'id: 'You narrate to us amazing hadiths, and we fear that we might add or subtract, so if only you would write them for us.' He said: 'We will never write for you, nor will we make it a Qur'an. Memorize from us as we memorized.' 2750 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il told us, he said: Yunus informed us, he said: When Sa'id b. Abi al-Hasan died, Al-Hasan grieved for him intensely. 2751 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il told us, he said: Yunus informed us, he said: Al-Hasan said: When Utbah b. Mas'ud died, Abd Allah b. Mas'ud grieved for him, so he was spoken to regarding that. 2752 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il told us, he said: Muhammad used to dislike writing—meaning knowledge. 2753 - I heard my father say: Abbad b. al-Awwam told us from Muhammad b. Ishaq b. Yasar from Imran b. Abi Anas that a man had a hunting dog for which he had been offered twenty camels. He proposed to a woman, and a man from her people proposed along with him. She said: 'I will not marry you unless [you give me] your dog.' So he married her and drove the dog to her. The other man attacked the dog and killed it. They took their dispute to Uthman b. Affan, and he fined him twenty camels. I heard my father say: 'This is false (*Batil*); the Prophet (peace be upon him) forbade the price of a dog.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2754 - Abu Ali b. al-Sawwaf said: And Ahmad b. Sahl al-Ushnani told us, he said: Abu Zakariyya Yahya b. al-Mubarak told us, he said: Abbad b. al-Awwam told us from Muhammad b. Ishaq from Imran b. Abi Anas that a man had a hunting dog for which he was offered twenty camels. He was proposing to a woman, and she said: 'I will not marry you except for this dog of yours.' A cousin of hers was also proposing to her. He said: So he married her for the dog and drove the dog to her. He said: The other man attacked the dog and killed it. This was raised to Uthman, and he fined him twenty camels. 2755 - Abd Allah told us, he said: I heard my father say: Abbad b. al-Awwam told us from Asim al-Ahwal, he said: I was walking with Al-Fudayl b. Yazid al-Raqashi. He said: And he had recited the Qur'an during the time of Umar. My father said: Thus said Abbad. Abu al-Yasa' corrected him, but he refused. My father said: It is actually Fudayl b. Zaid. 2756 - My father told me, he said: Abbad b. al-Awwam told us, he said: A Sheikh told me from Al-Zuhri, he said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'An excellent thing is a gift before a need.' My father said: They say it is Sulayman b. Arqam. My father said: And Sulayman's hadith is not worth anything. 2757 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us from Sufyan, he said: I asked Al-Suddi about {They recognize the favor of Allah, then they deny it} [Al-Nahl: 83]. He said: Muhammad, peace be upon him. 2758 - I heard my father say: Waki' told us, he said: Yazid b. Ibrahim Abu Sa'id told us. 2759 - I heard my father say: Waki' told us, he said: Mughirah b. Ziyad Abu Hashim told me.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2760 - I heard my father say: Waki' told us, he said: Mudarris b. Abd Allah Abu al-Sahba' al-Wabishi told us. 2761 - I heard my father say: Waki' told us from Sufyan from Ziyad al-Musaffar Abu Uthman. 2762 - I heard my father say: Waki' told us, he said: Mis'ar told us from Abd al-Malik b. Maysarah Abu Zaid al-Hilali. 2763 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Sufyan said: Mansur told us from Ziyad. So I came to Ziyad al-Musaffar. 2764 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Abu Linah Nadr b. Abi Maryam told us.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2765 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Sufyan told us from a man from Abu al-Jawza' from Ibn Abbas: {And We have certainly known those who precede among you} [Al-Hijr: 24]. Waki' said: We think he is Aban b. Abi Ayyash. 2766 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Abu Uthman Qutaybah b. Qudamah al-Ru'asi told me. 2767 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Sufyan told us from Mansur from Abu Salih from Ibn Abbas regarding the saying of Allah, Mighty and Majestic: {And spend in the way of Allah and do not throw [yourselves] with your [own] hands into destruction} [Al-Baqarah: 195]: 'Spend even if it is a broadhead arrow (*mishqas*).' I heard my father say: Mansur did not hear from Abu Salih except this one hadith. 2768 - I heard my father say: Waki' told us from Sufyan from Abu Miskin. Waki' said: His name is Al-Hurr. 2769 - My father narrated it to me, he said: Waki' told us from Sufyan from Adam b. Sulayman, Mawla of Khalid b. Khalid. I heard my father say: Adam b. Sulayman is the father of Yahya b. Adam.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2770 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Abd al-Malik b. Abd al-Rahman al-Dhamari al-Abnawi told us, he said: Sinan b. Jarir al-Ansi told us—and he was among the best of Muslims—he said: I heard Umayr b. Hani' al-Ansi. 2771 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Ibrahim b. Khalid the Mu'adhin Abu Muhammad al-Qurashi told us, he said: Umar b. Abd al-Rahman b. Muhrab told me—he is called Ibn Duriyyah; his paternal aunt is the Mawlah of Al-Akhnas b. Shariq, an ally of Quraysh. 2772 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Ghawth b. Jabir b. Ghaylan b. Munabbih told us. Abu Muhammad—meaning Ghawth—said: Wahb had two sons among those who married and reached maturity: Abd Allah and Abd al-Rahman. They were four brothers: The eldest was Wahb, then Ma'qil Abu Aqil, Hammam, and Ghaylan, who was the youngest and the grandfather of Abu Muhammad. He had eight daughters. Urwah wanted him for the judgeship, so he judged for him. He is Wahb b. Munabbih b. Kamil b. Sayaj, and he is Al-Aswar or Al-Iswar. Abu Muhammad said: Wahb died in the year one hundred and fourteen. And the Abyssinians stayed for seventy-one [years], as they claimed, enslaving Himyar. 2773 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Ibrahim b. Khalid the Mu'adhin told us in Ramadan of the year one hundred and ninety-eight, he said: Umayyah b. Shibl informed me, he said: It reached me that Safwan b. Mu'attal had vowed to strike Hassan b. Thabit with a sword. He did not fulfill that until he died. When Hassan died, he walked to him while he was on his bier until he struck him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2774 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Ibrahim b. Khalid told us, he said: Umar b. Ubayd informed me, he said: We went out to Aden in the year one hundred and thirteen in Dhu al-Qi'dah, while people were preparing for Hajj. Abd Allah b. Wahb was with us. The news of Wahb's death reached us while we were in Aden. Umar said: Falah b. Ata informed me that Wahb died in Dhu al-Hijjah of the year one hundred and thirteen. Umar said: Abd al-Samad b. Ma'qil said to me: He—meaning Wahb—died in Muharram at the beginning of the year one hundred and fourteen. Ibrahim said: And Umar b. Abd al-Rahman b. Duriyyah informed me. Ibrahim said: So we entered to visit Rahhal the storyteller, and he had a white head and beard. Umar said to me: 'It is as if you are looking at the whiteness of Wahb's head and beard.' Wahb used to not dye his gray hair. Abu Abd al-Rahman said: Between my birth and the death of Wahb is one hundred years. 2775 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Ibrahim b. Khalid told us, he said: Rabah told us from Abd al-Rahman b. Zaid b. Aslam from Ata b. Yasar from a man of the Muslims among those who used to read the Scriptures, he said: 'Sijjin is the seventh earth.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2776 - I found in my father's book: Ibrahim b. Khalid told us, he said: Rabah told us, he said: I said to Ma'mar: 'Did the Prophet (peace be upon him) die while sitting?' He said: 'Yes.' 2777 - My father told me, he said: Ibrahim b. Khalid al-San'ani, the Mu'adhin of Sana'a—and he praised him well—told us, he said: Rabah told us, he said: Abu Abd al-Rahman—meaning Abd Allah b. al-Mubarak—told me from Abd al-Rahman b. Yazid from Al-Awza'i from Abdah b. Abi Lubabah, he said: 'I tasted the water of the sea on the night of the twenty-seventh, and I found it fresh.' 2778 - My father told me, he said: Mu'adh b. Hisham al-Dastawa'i told us, he said: My father told me from Amr b. Malik from Abu al-Jawza' from Ibn Abbas, he said: 'I have memorized Laylat al-Qadr four times from above a roof facing the sun: it rises having no rays.' For the twenty-third, for the remaining seven. 2779 - My father told me, he said: Mu'adh b. Hisham told us, he said: My father told me from Amr b. Malik from Abu al-Jawza' from Ibn Abbas: {And seek what Allah has ordained for you} [Al-Baqarah: 187]. He said: 'He says: Seek Laylat al-Qadr.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2780 - My father told me, he said: Yahya b. Sa'id told us from Ibn Jurayj, he said: Ubaydullah b. Abi Yazid told me from Ibn Abbas, he said: 'He used to sprinkle water on his family on the night of the twenty-third.' 2781 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Al-A'mash told us from Abu Zabyan. My father said: Waki' said: He is Husayn b. Jundub. 2782 - I heard my father say: Waki' told us, he said: Ayman b. Nabil Abu Imran al-Makki told us. 2783 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Sufyan told us from Salamah b. Kuhayl from Abu al-Mughirah. Waki' said: And he is Ali b. Rabi'ah. 2784 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Sa'id b. Ubayd told us from Ali b. Rabi'ah Abu al-Mughirah. 2785 - I heard my father say: The one whom Sufyan narrated from, Abu al-Jahm, he is called Subayh.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2786 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Abu Bakr Yunus b. Bukayr told us, he said: Muhammad b. Ishaq b. Yasar al-Qurashi informed us from Makhul, he said: 'I toured all the lands seeking knowledge; I did not meet a man more knowledgeable than Sa'id b. al-Musayyib.' 2787 - I heard my father say: Waki' told us, he said: A Sheikh who was established (*Thabt*) told us: Ziyad b. Abi Muslim. And he said once: Abu Umar al-Qurra' Ziyad b. Abi Muslim. 2788 - I heard my father say: Ibrahim b. al-Fadl is not strong in Hadith; Ibrahim is weak in Hadith. 2789 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Abu Makin b. Aban, the brother of Al-Hakam b. Aban, told us. 2790 - I heard my father say: Abu Makin is Nuh b. Rabi'ah. My father said: And he is not the brother of Al-Hakam b. Aban. 2791 - I heard my father say: Uthman b. Abi Hind is Kufan, a trustworthy Sheikh.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2792 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us from Sufyan from Khalid al-Hadhdha' from Ibn Sirin: 'There is no harm in drinking theriac (*Tiryaq*).' I heard my father say: 'This is a mistake. Muhammad [Ibn Sirin] used to dislike it. What is known from Khalid from Muhammad is that he disliked it. Waki' erred in it.' 2793 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Abu Salamah Uthman al-Shahham told us. 2794 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us from Sufyan from Abu Raja' from Makhul. I asked my father about Abu Raja'. He said: 'His name is Muhriz.' 2795 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us from Sufyan from a man from the people of Khurasan from Ikrimah regarding a man who bequeathed a share (*Sahm*) of his wealth to a man. He said: 'This is unknown (*Majhul*), not worth anything.' I asked my father about this man. He said: 'They say he is Ibn al-Mubarak.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2796 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Mis'ar told us from Abu al-Ala al-Abdi. I asked my father, and he said: Abu al-Ala is Hilal b. Khabbab. 2797 - I said to my father: Sufyan from Abu Abd Allah from Fudayl b. Amr? My father said: Abu Abd Allah is Idris al-Awdi. 2798 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us from Fudayl b. Amr. 2799 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us from Mis'ar and Sufyan from Imran b. Muslim b. Riyah. My father said: He is not Al-Ju'fi; this is another man. 2800 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: My father told us from Abu Ishaq from Al-Bara', he said: 'The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) fought in fifteen battles.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2801 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Salamah b. Nabit told us, he said: I saw men from the Companions of the Prophet (peace be upon him). 2802 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us from Umar b. al-Aswad from a woman of his family. My father said: Waki' did not hear anything from Uthman b. al-Aswad; this Umar b. al-Aswad is a Sheikh of Waki'. 2803 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us from Malik b. Anas from Ubaydullah b. Abi Bakr al-Thaqafi from Anas: We went out early with the Prophet (peace be upon him) on this day. The one chanting Talbiyah would chant, and the one saying Takbir would say Takbir, and neither would criticize the other. My father told me, he said: Ibn Mahdi told us from Malik from Muhammad b. Abi Bakr al-Thaqafi. My father said: And Waki' erred in this; it is only Muhammad b. Abi Bakr al-Thaqafi. 2804 - I heard my father say: Ammar b. Abi Ammar is trustworthy, among the trustworthy.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2805 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Umarah b. Zadhan told us from Makhul al-Azdi, he said: 'I departed (*Afadtu*) with Ibn Umar.' My father said: This is Makhul al-Azdi, a Basran, and he is not Makhul al-Shami. 2806 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us from Sufyan from Ibn Jurayj from a man from Ibn Abbas: 'If he forgets, he throws [pebbles] when he remembers.' I heard my father say: This man is Ata al-Khurasani. 2807 - I heard my father say: Isa b. Abi Izzah is a trustworthy Sheikh. 2808 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Sufyan told us from Abu Ya'fur al-Sulami from his father from Shuraih. My father said: This Abu Ya'fur's name is Abd al-Rahman b. Ubayd b. Nistas. 2809 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Adi b. Abd al-Rahman al-Ta'i told us. My father said: This Adi b. Abd al-Rahman is Abu al-Haytham b. Adi, from Sa'id al-Tahi from Mutarrif. My father said: Sa'id al-Tahi is Abu Maslamah.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2810 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us from Sufyan from Mansur from Abu Ali. My father said: Waki' said: He is Ubayd b. Ali. 2811 - I heard my father say: Muhammad b. Abi Humayd, his hadiths are rejected (*Manakir*). 2812 - I heard my father say: Abu al-Abbas the poet, his name is Al-Sa'ib b. Farrukh. My father said: And he is Abu al-Ala b. Abi al-Abbas. 2813 - I heard my father say: Abu Asim al-Thaqafi is a trustworthy Sheikh. 2814 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Al-Umari told us from Nafi' from Ibn Umar, he said: 'I was presented to the Prophet (peace be upon him) on the Day of Uhud while I was fourteen years old, and he did not allow me. And I was presented to him on the Day of the Trench while I was fifteen, and he allowed me.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2815 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Muhammad b. Muslim told us from Ibrahim b. Maysarah, he said: 'Al-Rida—meaning Tawus—told me.' 2816 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il b. Ulayyah told us from Ibn Awn from Amr b. Sa'id from Humayd b. Abd al-Rahman, he said: Ibn Mas'ud said: 'I used not to be screened from secrets (*Najwa*), nor from such and such, nor from such and such.' Ibn Awn said: So he forgot one; I [also] forgot one. 2817 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il b. Ulayyah told us from Ibn Awn from Umayr b. Ishaq, he said: 'Those whom I met of the Companions of the Prophet (peace be upon him) were more than those who preceded me.' 2818 - I heard my father say: Isma'il—meaning Ibn Ulayyah—told us, he said: Sa'id al-Jurayri told us from Abu A'idh Sayf al-Sa'di—and he praised him well—from Yazid b. al-Bara' b. Azib, he said: 'He was an Amir in Oman, and he was like the best of Amirs.' 2819 - My father told me, he said: Ibn Ulayyah told us, he said: Yunus told us from Al-Hasan, he said: Abu al-Sahba' Silah b. Ashyam said.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2820 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il told us, he said: Uyaynah b. Abd al-Rahman told us from his father that Abu Bakrah met Al-Mughirah one day in the open area (*Rahbah*) while he was masked. He said: 'Where do you want [to go]?' He said: 'I want a need.' He said: 'Verily, the Amir is visited and does not visit.' 2821 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il told us from Uyaynah b. Abd al-Rahman from his father, he said: 'The oath of Uthman b. Abi al-As was "By my life" (*La-Amri*).' 2822 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il told us, he said: Ruh b. al-Qasim informed us from Ibrahim b. Maysarah, he said: Aisha said: 'No character trait was more hateful to the Companions of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) than lying. And the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) did not know of anything of it in anyone but that he would withdraw from him inwardly until he knew that he had repented.' 2823 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il told us, he said: Ayyub informed us from Ibn Abi Mulaykah, he said: Aisha said: 'The Prophet (peace be upon him) died in my house, on my day, and between my chest and throat.' 2824 - I heard my father say: Ibn Ulayyah did not hear from Malik b. Dinar except one hadith, nor from Abu al-Tayyah except one hadith.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2825 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il told us, he said: Ayyub told us from Abu Qilabah that the Prophet (peace be upon him) prayed a prayer. When he turned away, he said: 'Do you recite in your prayer while the Imam is reciting?' They said: 'Yes.' He said: 'Do not do so.' 2826 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il told us, he said: Khalid informed us from Abu Qilabah similar to the hadith of Ayyub. Khalid said: I said to Abu Qilabah: 'Who told you this hadith?' He said: 'Muhammad b. Abi Aisha, a Mawla of Banu Umayyah, who went out with the family of Marwan when they were expelled from Madinah.' 2827 - My father told me, he said: Abd al-Razzaq told us, he said: Ma'mar told us from Al-Zuhri in his hadith from Urwah: 'Then the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) was ordered to fight. So they met at Badr on Friday, seven or nine'—Abd al-Razzaq doubted—'nights having passed of Ramadan. The Companions of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) that day were three hundred and ten and some men, and the polytheists were between one thousand and nine hundred. Allah defeated the polytheists that day; more than seventy of them were killed, and the like of that were captured.' 2828 - My father told me, he said: Abd al-Razzaq told us, he said: Muhammad b. Rashid told us, he said: Ja'far b. Amr b. Umayyah told me, he said: Fatimah entered upon Abu Bakr and said: 'The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) informed me that I would be the first of his family to join him.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2829 - My father told me, he said: Abd al-Razzaq told us, he said: Ma'mar informed us from Ibn Khuthaym from Abu al-Zubayr from Jabir, he said: 'The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) stayed in Mecca for ten years.' My father said: Abd al-Razzaq said: 'I have not seen anyone more pious in Hadith than Muhammad b. Rashid.' 2830 - I heard my father say: Uthman b. Sa'id—meaning Ibn Kathir b. Dinar—is trustworthy. 2831 - I asked my father about Muhammad b. Abbad al-Makki. He said: 'To me, his hadith is the hadith of the truthful people, and I hope there is no harm in him.' And I heard him once mentioning him, saying: 'It falls into my heart that he is truthful (Saduq).'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 2832 - My father told me, he said: I was told from Salih b. Umar from Al-A'mash from Shamir b. Atiyyah, he said: 'There were people in Rayy who used to punish (*Yu'aqqibun*) [or take turns] and say: Umar and Ali told us.' 2833 - My father told me, he said: Yahya b. Adam told us, he said: Zuhayr told us, he said: I heard Al-A'mash say: 'If Zaid b. Wahb narrated a hadith to you, it would not harm you not to hear it from the one who narrated it from him.' 2834 - My father told me, he said: Hasan b. Musa told us, he said: Zuhayr told us, he said: I heard Al-A'mash say: 'If you heard a hadith from Zaid b. Wahb, it is as if you heard it from the one who narrated it from him.' 2835 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Al-A'mash told us from Abu Ishaq from Al-Bara', he said: 'Not everything we narrate to you from the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) did we hear [directly] from the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him), but we heard it and our companions narrated to us, but we do not lie.' 2836 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us from Al-A'mash from Dhakwan or Ibn Dhakwan, he said: 'The jurists of the people of Madinah were four: Sa'id b. al-Musayyib, Urwah, Qabisah b. Dhu'ayb, and Abd al-Malik b. Marwan.' 2837 - My father told me, he said: Ali b. Bahr told us, he said: Isa b. Yunus told us, he said: Al-A'mash told us, he said: Abd Allah b. Dhakwan Abu al-Zinad came to us, so we asked him about the jurists of the people of Madinah. He said: 'There were four in it: Sa'id b. al-Musayyib, Abu Salamah b. Abd al-Rahman, Urwah b. al-Zubayr, and Abd al-Malik b. Marwan.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2838 - My father told me, he said: Abu Mu'awiyah told us, he said: Al-A'mash told us, from Al-Minhal, from Qays bin Sakan, he said: He entered the mosque of Kufa and began looking at its corners, then he said: This mosque has become barren.
2839 - My father told me, he said: Muhammad bin Ubayd told us, he said: Al-A'mash told us, from Abu Sufyan, from Jabir, he said: I was the provider of water (Maniha) for my companions on the Day of Badr.
2840 - My father told me, he said: Abdullah bin Al-Walid Al-Adani told us, he said: Sufyan told us, from Al-A'mash, from Abu Al-Duha, from Masruq, that when he narrated from Aisha, he would say: 'The Truthful One, daughter of the Truthful One, the beloved of the Beloved of Allah, the Exonerated One, told me, so I did not belie her.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2841 - My father told me, he said: Ibn Numair told us, he said: Al-A'mash informed us, from Muslim bin Subayh, he said: Al-A'mash said: I think it is from Al-Bara' bin Azib, he said: Ibrahim, the son of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, died while he was sixteen months old. So the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, ordered that he be buried in Al-Baqi', and he said: 'Indeed, he has a wet nurse in Paradise.'
2842 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Al-A'mash told us, from Abu Al-Duha, from Masruq, that he was asked: Was Aisha good at inheritance laws (Al-Fara'id)? He said: By the One besides whom there is no god, I have seen the senior companions of Muhammad, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, asking her about inheritance laws.
2843 - My father told me, he said: Abu Usamah Hammad bin Usamah told us, from Isma'il bin Abi Khalid, from Isa, the neighbor of Masruq, he said: Masruq said: Were it not for certain matters, I would have held a mourning gathering for Aisha.
2844 - I read to my father: Muhammad bin Ubayd, from Harun Al-Barbari, from Abdullah bin Ubayd bin Umayr, he said: A man came to Ubayd bin Umayr and asked him: How did you see the people's grief over Aisha? He said: By Allah, I did not see them grieve over her all that much. He said: So Ubayd said: Only those for whom Aisha was [a mother figure] grieve for Aisha; indeed, may Allah be pleased with her.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2845 - My father told me, he said: Abu Mu'awiyah told us, he said: Al-A'mash told us, from Ibrahim, he said: Umar and Abdullah used to assign housing and financial support (Nafaqah) to the woman divorced irrevocably (three times). He said: And whenever the hadith of Fatima bint Qais—that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, ordered her to observe her waiting period (Iddah) in other than her husband's house—was mentioned to Umar, he said: We would not permit in our religion the testimony of a woman. I heard my father say: Ibn Mahdi said: This is from the weak hadith of Al-A'mash.
2846 - My father told me, he said: Ubayd Allah—meaning Ibn Musa—told us, he said: I heard Al-A'mash say: We used to come to Shaqiq, and come to this one, and come to that one, and we did not consider that Ibrahim had anything [of significance].
2847 - My father told me, he said: Abd Al-Samad told us, he said: Sawadah—meaning Ibn Hayyan—told us, from Mu'awiyah bin Qurrah, he said: I lived to see three from my household, all of whom had accompanied the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. Abdullah informed us by license (Ijazah), he said:
2848 - I heard my father say: Ubaydah bin Hamid is sound (Salih) in hadith from Mansur.
2849 - I heard my father say: How close Al-Ajlah is to Fitr bin Khalifah.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2850 - I heard my father say regarding the hadith of Ibn Numair, from Sufyan, he said: Yunus told us, from Al-Hasan, from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace: 'If you see Mu'awiyah on this pulpit of mine preaching...' My father said: It is not from the hadith of Yunus.
2851 - I read to my father, and he acknowledged it: Ibn Numair, from Sharik, from Mansur, he said: I said to Ibrahim: Did Alqamah witness Siffin with Ali? He said: Yes, and his sword was stained [with blood].
2852 - I heard my father say regarding the hadith of Yahya bin Sa'id Al-Ansari, from Ubayd Allah bin Zahr Al-Damri, that he heard Abu Sa'id Al-Ru'ayni narrating that Abdullah bin Malik informed him that Uqbah bin Amir informed him. My father said: Abdullah bin Malik is Abu Tamim Al-Jayshani.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2853 - My father told me, he said: Ishaq bin Ibrahim Al-Razi told us, he said: Salamah bin Al-Fadl Al-Ansari told us, he said: Muhammad bin Ishaq told me, from Yazid bin Abi Habib, from Marthad bin Abdullah Al-Yazani, from Abdullah bin Zurayr Al-Ghafiqi, from Ali bin Abi Talib, that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to ride a donkey named 'Ufayr'.
2854 - I heard my father say: Ali bin Thabit bin Abi Zaid Al-Ansari is trustworthy. Sa'id bin Abi Arubah and Hammad bin Zaid narrated from him. He is the brother of Azrah bin Thabit. His brother is also Muhammad bin Thabit; Ibn Al-Mubarak narrated from him, and he is not Muhammad bin Thabit Al-Abdi.
2855 - I read to my father: Muhammad bin Ja'far said: Sa'id told us, from Asim Al-Ahwal, from Al-Sha'bi, from Qamir bint Amr, the wife of Masruq. I heard my father say: Sa'id heard from Asim Al-Ahwal and from Asim bin Abi Al-Nujud.
2856 - I read to my father: Ghundar, from Sa'id, from Abu Ma'shar, from Al-Nakha'i, that he used to dislike that, and he would say: If he knows that he will not find water, he should not touch her—meaning his wife. I heard my father say: Yazid bin Harun narrated this hadith to us, from Sa'id bin Abi Arubah, from Abu Ma'shar, from Ibrahim, from Ibn Mas'ud. But Abu Ahmad Al-Basri—who is called Al-Abwabi—said: Yazid bin Zuray' narrated it to us, and he did not say 'from Ibn Mas'ud'; so Yazid omitted Ibn Mas'ud. My father said: And more than one of them narrated it to us, [including] Yahya bin Sa'id, Abd Al-A'la, and Ghundar, and none of them mentioned Ibn Mas'ud. And Al-Khaffaf said: Sa'id said—and I only know that he attributed it back—to Ibn Mas'ud.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2857 - Abu Ma'mar told me, he said: Abdullah bin Numair told us, he said: I heard Al-A'mash say: I narrated hadiths out of wonderment, then it reached me that some people took them as religion; I would not return to any of them.
2858 - I heard my father say regarding the hadith of Sa'id bin Abi Arubah, from Abu Muhammad, from Ata, from Abu Hurairah: 'In all prayers, recitation is done.' My father said: Abu Muhammad is Habib bin Al-Shahid.
2859 - I heard my father say regarding the hadith of Sa'id, from Ja'far, from Abu Uthman. My father said: This is Ja'far bin Maymun.
2860 - I heard my father say: Sa'id did not hear anything from Zaid bin Aslam.
2861 - I asked my father about the hadith of Sa'id, from Salim Al-Saffar: 'I entered upon Abu Qilabah...' Who is this Salim? He said: I do not know him.
2862 - I found in my father's book in his own handwriting: Abdah bin Sulayman Al-Kilabi died in the year eighty-seven [187 AH], and Waki' went out to Abadan in the year eighty-eight [188 AH].

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2863 - My father told me, he said: Muttalib bin Ziyad, Abu Muhammad Ibn Al-Suddi, told us, he said: Among the Jinn are Shia, Qadariyyah, and Murji'ah.
2864 - My father told me, he said: Muttalib bin Ziyad told us, he said: Layth told us, he said: I used to go early to Ata, only to find that Abdullah bin Al-Hasan had preceded me to him.
2865 - My father told me, he said: Muttalib bin Ziyad told us, he said: Muhammad bin Aban told us, he said: Al-Hasan bin Ali said to his sons and his brother's sons: Learn! For you are the young ones of a people today, and you will be the elders of them tomorrow. So whoever among you cannot memorize, let him write.
2866 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym bin Abi Sasan Abu Ali told us, he said: Umay bin Rabi'ah told us, he said: We performed Hajj in the year one hundred, and we met Al-Hasan, Ata, and Tawus.
2867 - My father told me, he said: Muttalib bin Ziyad told us, from Abdullah bin Isa, he said: I met Zaid bin Ali and narrated hadiths to him, and he wrote them down from me on small tablets he had.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2868 - My father told me, he said: I heard Isma'il bin Ibrahim say: Sa'id would hardly ever dictate. I and some companions of mine used to come to him, so he would dictate to us. It was said to him that Yazid bin Zuray' says: 'Sa'id told us, he said: Abu Ma'shar told us, and Qatadah told us.' He said: He would only say: 'So-and-so mentioned' or something like that.
2869 - My father told me, he said: I said to Ibn Abi Adi: O Abu Amr, did Sa'id dictate to you? He said: If we wanted him to dictate to us, he would dictate.
2870 - And I read to my father: Ibn Abi Adi, from Dawud, from Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib: regarding the forbidden [act/woman], [it requires] the expiation of an oath. And I heard my father say: Yahya bin Sa'id Al-Ansari narrated it from Dawud. Abdullah informed us, he said: I heard my father narrate from Yahya bin Sa'id Al-Umawi, from Yahya bin Sa'id Al-Ansari, from Dawud.
2871 - I read to my father: Ibn Abi Adi, from Dawud, from Abu Uthman, from Salman: 'Allah has one hundred mercies; every mercy encompasses what is between the heavens and the earth.' I heard my father say: Mu'adh narrated it to us, from Al-Taymi, from Abu Uthman, from Salman; Mu'adh did not raise it [to the Prophet], but Yahya raised it. Abu Abd Al-Rahman said: And he raised it for a group after my father. My father told me, he said: Yahya narrated it to us from Al-Taymi. And Affan, from Mu'tamir, also raised it. And Abbad bin Abbad said, from Asim, from Abu Uthman, from Salman, he said: I read in the Torah...
2872 - And I read to my father: Abu Al-Husayn Zaid bin Al-Hubab said: Al-Dahhak bin Uthman told me: In the year fifty-one, I went out with Sufyan.
2873 - I read to my father, and he acknowledged it: Zaid bin Al-Hubab told us, he said: Muhammad bin Salih Al-Madani informed me—and once he said Al-Tammar—he said: Abd Al-Rahman bin Sulayman bin Khabbab told me, he said: Al-Qasim bin Muhammad died at Qudaid.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2874 - I read to my father: Zaid bin Al-Hubab said: Zaid bin Al-Sa'ib Abu Al-Sa'ib informed me. I found in my father's book in his own handwriting: The name of Abu Al-Aswad is Zalim bin Amr.
2875 - I read to my father: Zaid bin Al-Hubab said: Yahya bin Ayyub told us, he said: Ja'far bin Rabi'ah Al-Qurashi told me, from Imran bin Abi Anas, from Abu Al-Tufayl. I asked my father about Abu Al-Tufayl, he said: He is Abdullah bin Amir Al-Aslami.
2876 - I read to my father: Zaid bin Al-Hubab said: Abu Al-Samh Al-Masri told me, he said: Abu Qabil told me. My father said: This is not Darraj. This Abu Al-Samh is a Sheikh of Zaid; he is not that one—meaning Darraj.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2877 - I read to my father: Zaid bin Al-Hubab said: Raja' bin Abi Salamah Al-Filastini, Abu Al-Miqdam, told me.
2878 - I read to my father: Zaid bin Al-Hubab said: Abd Al-Wahid bin Musa, Abu Mu'awiyah Al-Filastini, the freed slave of Abu Rayhanah, told me.
2879 - I read to my father: Zaid said: Abu Mu'awiyah informed me, he said: My father informed me that Abu Rayhanah freed his father.
2880 - I read to my father: Abu Badr said: I prayed over the funeral of Ibn Abjar, I and Sufyan Al-Thawri. A brother of his stepped forward [to lead the prayer] who had something in his opinion [sectarian bias], so he prayed over him—and he had something in his opinion—so he said Takbir over him five times. When he finished the fourth, Sufyan said Taslim, so he turned to me and then said: What do they intend with this? He follows him in the fifth if Allah wills. I heard my father say: Muhammad bin Abi Adi, Abu Amr, told us; he was steady/grave among men; how similar he was to the Sheikhs! He possessed some of the character traits of Ibn Ulayyah.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: (Part Five of the Book of Defects and Knowledge of Men)

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
It was read to Abu Ali bin Al-Sawwaf on Monday, five nights into Sha'ban, year three [hundred and something]. In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. Abdullah bin Ahmad bin Muhammad bin Hanbal informed us by license, he said:
2881 - I heard my father say: Muhammad bin Abi Adi Abu Amr told us; he was steady/grave among men; how similar he was to the Sheikhs! He possessed some of the character traits of Ibn Ulayyah. My father said: And Ibn Ulayyah would hardly ever laugh, and Ibn Abi Adi would hardly ever laugh.
2882 - I read to my father: Ibn Abi Adi, from Sulayman—meaning Al-Taymi—from Abu Mijlaz, he said: I prayed with Ibn Umar... and he mentioned a long hadith. He said: Then he prayed the morning prayer while there was no star in the sky that I could recognize unless he showed it to me or I was shown it. And he recited Ya-Sin. But Isma'il bin Ulayyah said: And he recited 'Abasa (He Frowned) [Surah 80], and that is the correct one.
2883 - I read to my father: Ibn Abi Adi, from Sulayman, from Abu Uthman, from Qabisah bin Mukhariq and Wahb bin Amr, they said: When 'And warn your closest kindred' was revealed to the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace... My father said: Thus said Ibn Abi Adi: 'Wahb bin Amr', but it is only Zuhayr bin Amr.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2884 - I read to my father: Ibn Abi Adi, from Sulayman—meaning Al-Taymi—from Abu Tamimah, from Daljah bin Qays. I heard my father say: This is Abu Tamimah Al-Sulli, and he is not Al-Hujaymi.
2885 - I heard my father say another time: Ibn Abi Adi is more beloved to me than Azhar; he is more resembling the people of religion and more correct in hadith. I read to Abu Ubaydah: He said: Abu Miskin told me, he said: Ubaydah, name him for me. So they said: He is Hurr, his name [is Hurr], and he is a freed slave of Nakha'.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2886 - I heard my father say: Abd Al-Aziz—meaning Ibn Hakim—is better/more sound than Thuwair—meaning Ibn Abi Fakhitah.
2887 - I read to my father: Muhammad bin Abi Adi, from Sa'id, from Abu Ma'shar, from Al-Nakha'i, from Al-Aswad, from Aisha, she said: I used to scrape it from the garment of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace—meaning dried semen. I heard my father say: Abd Al-A'la said, from Sa'id, from Abu Ma'shar, from Al-Nakha'i, from Al-Aswad or Abd Al-Rahman bin Yazid. And Ghundar said: From Al-Aswad. And Al-A'mash, Mansur, and Al-Hakam narrated it from Ibrahim, from Hammam.
2888 - I read to my father: Ibn Abi Adi, from Sa'id, from Qatadah, from Abu Al-Ahwas, from Abdullah, that the Prophet of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: 'The prayer is a gathering (Salat Al-Jami').' I heard my father say: Shu'bah narrated it from Qatadah, from Uqbah bin Wassaj. And Hammam said: From Muwarriq. My father said: And Affan said: It reached me that Abu Al-Awwam—meaning Imran Al-Qattan—agreed with Hammam on [referencing] Muwarriq.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2889 - I heard my father say: Sa'id—meaning Ibn Abi Arubah—heard two hadiths from Abu Al-Aliyah Al-Bara'. That is the hadith that he saw Ibn Abbas perform Witr then pray two rak'ahs, and 'I asked Ibn Umar about recitation in Zuhr and Asr.'
2890 - I read to my father: Ibn Abi Adi, from Ibn Awn, from Muhammad: The Caliphs used to perform ablution at every prayer in a basin in the mosque. Ibn Abi Adi said: I found it written with me.
2891 - I read to my father: Abdah bin Sulayman Al-Kilabi said: Sa'id told us, from Matar, from Ata, from Ibn Umar, he said: The waiting period (Iddah) of a slave girl if she is divorced is two menstrual cycles; if she does not menstruate, then it is a month and a half. I read to my father: Abdah said: Sa'id told us, from Qatadah, from Al-Hasan, from Ali, the like of it.
2892 - I heard my father say: This is a mistake. It is only Sa'id from Habib, from Ata, from Umar. And [it is] Habib, from Al-Hasan and Ali. In the books, it is like this—meaning the books of Sa'id bin Abi Arubah.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2893 - I heard my father say: Al-Miqdam bin Shuraih bin Hani is trustworthy. My father said regarding the hadith of Ibn Umar, from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, that he was asked about water and what visits it (yanubuhu) of animals; Ibn Al-Mubarak said: 'And what returns to it (yathubuhu)', and he [the narrator] misspelled it.
2894 - My father said regarding the hadith of Qatadah, from Azrah, from Sa'id bin Jubayr: My father said: He is Azrah the One-Eyed. And he said: Wiqa'—meaning Ibn Iyas—'I saw him frequenting Sa'id bin Jubayr with the Tafsir, changing/correcting it in an inkwell.' My father said: Abd Al-Rahman bin Mahdi narrated it to us, from Abd Al-Wahid bin Ziyad, from Wiqa', he said: I saw Azrah frequenting Sa'id bin Jubayr with the Tafsir, changing/correcting in an inkwell.
2895 - I read to my father: Abdah bin Sulayman said: Sa'id told us, from Qatadah, from Al-Hasan and Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib, they said: The shroud is [paid] from the entire wealth/estate. I heard my father say: I narrated it to Ibn Al-Shadhakuni—meaning before he changed—and he denied it. My father said: Ghundar narrated it from Al-Hasan alone, and Al-Khaffaf from both of them.
2896 - I asked my father about Abu Al-Muhallim, a Sheikh whom Abdah narrated from, from Al-Sha'bi. He said: I do not know him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2897 - I read to my father: Abdah said: And Sa'id told us, from Abu Ma'shar, from Ibrahim, regarding a man who accused his wife of adultery then one of them died before they could engage in mutual imprecation (Li'an). He said: The inheritance is permissible (Ja'iz) between them. Thus Abdah said 'Ja'iz' (permissible). My father said: It is only 'Jari' (running/applicable).
2898 - I heard my father say: Al-Salt bin Bahram is trustworthy.
2899 - I asked my father about a Sheikh called Abdullah bin Abi Al-Sakan who narrated from Al-Hakam bin Al-A'raj, saying: Al-Hakam bin Abdullah bin Ishaq Al-A'raj told me, from Ibn Abbas, two hadiths which Muhammad bin Maymun Abu Al-Nadr Al-Za'farani narrated from him. My father said: I do not know this Abdullah.
2900 - I heard my father say: When Sulayman Al-Shadhakuni was mentioned in the presence of Yahya bin Sa'id, he said: That failure/loser.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2901 - My father told me, he said: Muhammad bin Maymun Abu Al-Nadr Al-Za'farani told us in the year one hundred and eighty-three from his book, he said: Abd Al-Aziz bin Umar bin Abd Al-Aziz told us, from Abdullah bin Mawhib, from Tamim Al-Dari, he said: I do not know but that he met him. I said: O Messenger of Allah, do you see if a man from the people of disbelief submits (becomes Muslim) at the hands of a man from the Muslims, what is the Sunnah regarding him? He said: He is the most entitled of people to him in his life and his death.
2902 - I heard my father say: Yahya bin Hamzah said, from Abd Al-Aziz bin Umar, from Ibn Mawhib, from Qabisah, from Tamim.
2903 - I heard my father say: Muhammad bin Maymun told us, from Isma'il bin Abi Khalid, he said: Abu Isa Yahya bin Rafi' told us, my father told me, he said: Muhammad bin Maymun told us, he said: Ja'far told me, from his father, that the chape of the Prophet's sword, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and its pommel and its rings were of silver, and everything in it was silver.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2904 - My father told me, he said: Muhammad bin Maymun told us, he said: Abd Al-Wahhab bin Al-Hasan Al-Tamimi told me, from Shaiban, the client of Al-Dahhak. I asked my father about Abd Al-Wahhab, so he said: His hadiths are objectionable (Manakir) hadiths; I know him.
2905 - I read to my father: Yahya bin Yaman, from Sufyan, from Qais bin Muslim, from Ibrahim: {And let them not display their adornment except what is apparent of it} [An-Nur: 31] is the hand and the face. I heard my father say: It is a mistake; it is from Alqamah bin Marthad, from Ibrahim.
2906 - I asked my father about Kathir bin Mudrik Al-Ashja'i, he said: Abu Malik Al-Ashja'i narrated from him—meaning, and Mansur.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2907 - I read to my father: Abu Yahya Al-Himmani said: Abd Al-Rahman bin Amin Abu Al-Ala told us.
2908 - I read to my father: Abu Yahya said: Salamah bin Nabit told us, he said: My father, my grandfather, and my uncle were with the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace.
2909 - Muhammad bin Abi Bakr Al-Muqaddami told me, he said: Sa'id bin Amir told us, he said: Whenever Shu'bah mentioned Ibn Awn, he would say: May Allah have mercy on Ibn Awn, may Allah have mercy on Ibn Awn, he was the best of people in companionship.
2910 - Muhammad bin Abdullah bin Numair told me, he said: I heard Abu Khalid Al-Ahmar say: I heard Al-A'mash say: I heard one thousand hadiths from Abu Salih. Ibrahim bin Abi Al-Layth—who is Ibrahim bin Nasr—told me, from Al-Ashja'i, he said: I heard a man ask Sharik about Jabir Al-Ju'fi, so he said: What is wrong with him? He is the just, the pleasing. What is wrong with him? He is the just, the pleasing. And he extended his voice with it.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2911 - Wahb bin Baqiyyah told us, he said: Hammad bin Zaid told us, he said: I prompted Salamah bin Alqamah with a hadith, so he said: If it pleases you that your companion lies, then prompt him.
2912 - He told me, he said: Muhammad bin Abi Bakr told us, he said: Hammad bin Zaid told us, from his father, he said: I heard Anas bin Malik saying: Indeed, goodness has keys, and indeed Thabit is one of the keys of goodness.
2913 - Muhammad bin Abi Bakr told me, he said: I heard my uncle Umar bin Ali say: I saw Abdullah bin Al-Mubarak in this mosque of ours near the minaret saying to Ja'far bin Sulayman: Did you see Ayyub? He said: Yes. He said: And did you see Ibn Awn? He said: Yes. He said: And did you see Yunus? He said: Yes. He said: Then how come you did not sit with them and you sat with Awf? By Allah, Awf was not content with one innovation until there were two innovations in him: he was a Qadari and he was a Shi'i.
2914 - Abu Al-Rabi' Al-Zahrani told me, he said: Muhammad bin Abdullah Al-Ansari told us, he said: I saw Dawud bin Abi Hind hitting Awf Al-A'rabi and saying: Woe to you, O Qadari! Woe to you, O Qadari!
2915 - Abu Yusuf Al-Hiri told me, he said: I heard Yusuf bin Asbat say: My father was a Qadari and my uncle—or my maternal uncle—was a Rafidi. So this one would invite me to Al-Qadar (belief in free will against predestination) and this one would invite me to Al-Rafd (extreme Shi'ism). This one was Kufan and this one was Basran.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2916 - Muhammad bin Abi Bakr Al-Muqaddami told us, he said: Abu Ma'shar Al-Bara told us, he said: I heard Abu Muslih Nasr bin Abi Al-Ahwas.
