2917 - Abu Khaythamah told me, he said: Yazid bin Harun was with Sufyan bin Uyainah and I was with him. Yazid said: Al-Majishun told us from Sumay the hadith of 'The Umrah to the Umrah [is an expiation]'. So Sufyan said: Sumay narrated it to me [directly].
2918 - Abu Khaythamah told me, he said: I said to Yazid bin Harun: Indeed, Ibn Abi Arubah or another man did not hear from So-and-so. He said: You have indeed scrutinized.
2919 - Masruq bin Al-Marzuban told me, from Sharik, he said: Abu Al-Juwayriyah's name is Hattan bin Khaffaf.
2920 - Amr bin Muhammad Al-Naqid told me, he said: Abu Uyainah told us, he said: Amr bin Dinar used to narrate by meaning, and Ibrahim bin Maysarah used to narrate exactly as he heard. And Amr was a jurist (Faqih).
2921 - Amr told me, he said: Ibn Uyainah told us, he said: I heard Abu Husayn say: I used to be such that men feared me, but I remained until children started poking me in my back—and once he said: in the waist/side.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2922 - Abu Bahr Al-Basri told us, he said: Hammad bin Salamah died in the year sixty-seven, and he was seventy-five years old.
2923 - My father said: Hammad bin Salamah died in Dhu al-Hijjah in the year sixty-seven, he and Abd Al-Aziz Al-Qasmali.
2924 - Abu Ma'mar told me, he said: Abdullah bin Idris told us, from Shu'bah, he said: I asked him about Amr bin Murrah and Mansur. He said: Amr was the more silent of the two men.
2925 - Amr Al-Naqid told me, he said: Abdullah bin Idris told us, he said: I saw Shu'bah in a dream before I met him, and I was eager to meet him. So I met him and asked him, saying: O Abu Bistam, what is your issue with Aban bin Abi Ayyash? For Mahdi bin Maymun informed me from Silm Al-Alawi that he saw Aban bin Abi Ayyash writing in the presence of Anas. He said: Silm? That is the one who used to see the crescent moon two days before the people saw it.
2926 - Someone who heard Abdullah bin Dawud told me, he said: I heard Sufyan Al-Thawri say: Our jurists are Ibn Abi Laila and Ibn Shubrumah.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2927 - Ya'qub bin Al-Dawraqi told me, he said: Abdullah bin Dawud told us, from Sulayman bin Safari, he said: I said to Mansur bin Al-Mu'tamir: Who is the most learned of the people of Kufa? He said: Its judge, Ibn Abi Laila.
2928 - Amr bin Muhammad Al-Naqid told me, he said: Ibn Idris told us, from Ibn Awn, he said: I saw Hammad asking Ibrahim in a note. Ibrahim Al-Nakha'i said to him: He forbade this. He said: It is only excerpts/fragments.
2929 - Muhammad bin Abdullah bin Numair Al-Hamdani told me, he said: Qabisah told us, from Qutbah, he said: A man said to Al-A'mash when he narrated the hadith of Abd Al-Rahman bin Yazid from Abdullah: I was concealing that Sufyan narrates it from you from Wahb bin Rabi'ah. He said: Al-A'mash muttered to them for a while, then said: It is as Sufyan said.
2930 - Muhammad bin Abdullah bin Numair told me, he said: I heard Abu Khalid Al-Ahmar say: Al-A'mash said: My eye only became bleary because Satan urinated in my ear.
2931 - Muhammad bin Abi Bakr Al-Muqaddami told us, he said: Sa'id bin Amir told us, he said: I heard Shu'bah say: I came to Ayyub while I was wearing a cap (kummah). He said: For how much did you get your cap? I said: For five daniqs. He said: I have two caps for five daniqs.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2932 - Al-Muqaddami told me, he said: I said to Khalid bin Shawdhab: Why do you not narrate from Al-Hasan as Yunus narrates from him? He said: Yunus sat with Al-Hasan more than I sat with him. Bring me the book of Yunus so I may read it to you. He said: So I did not return to him afterwards—or I did not go to him after this. This is the meaning of his speech or as he said.
2933 - Ubayd Allah bin Umar Al-Qawariri told me, he said: Abdullah bin Dawud told us, from Abu Awanah, he said: Whenever I saw Al-A'mash, I pitied him.
2934 - Someone who heard Abu Khalid Al-Ahmar told me, from Shu'bah, he said: Ibn Awn said to me: O Abu Bistam, what drives these people who lie in Hadith to lie? He said: They want to aggrandize themselves by it.
2935 - Abu Abdullah Al-Basri told me, he said: Sulayman bin Harb told us, from Salamah bin Abayah, he said: I asked Shu'bah about Al-Sari bin Yahya, and he said: That is the most trustworthy of people—or from the most trustworthy of people.
2936 - Abu Abdullah told me, from Sulayman bin Harb, from Salamah bin Abayah, he said: Shu'bah said to me: Let us go to Al-Sari bin Yahya. So we came to him and he fed us Faludhaj (a sweet dish).
2937 - Shaiban and Fitr bin Hammad told me, both said: Mahdi bin Maymun told us, from Muhammad bin Abdullah bin Ya'qub, he said: Abu Salamah bin Abd Al-Rahman came to us during the governorship of Bishr bin Marwan. He said: He was a handsome man; his face was like a Heraclius dinar.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2938 - Abu Amir bin Barrad Al-Ash'ari told me, he said: I heard my father mention from Mujalid, from Al-Sha'bi, he said: I never saw a man in whose eyes Allah Almighty was greater than Abu Burdah.
2939 - Abu Amir bin Barrad Al-Ash'ari told me, he said: Ibn Idris told us, he said: I said to Isra'il: When did Abu Ishaq die? He said: Year one hundred and twenty-nine. And Al-Sha'bi was older than him by two years.
2940 - Abu Amir bin Barrad told me, he said: Ibn Idris told us that some of the children of Abu Ishaq informed him that Abu Ishaq died in the year one hundred and twenty-seven.
2941 - Abdullah bin Umar bin Aban told me, he said: Husayn Al-Ju'fi told us, from Dawud bin Ulbah, he said: I never saw an Arab nor a Mawla (freedman) better than Mutarrif bin Tarif.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2942 - Abu Sa'id Al-Ashaj told me, he said: Ahmad bin Bashir told us, he said: Mis'ar told us, he said: I heard Abd Al-Malik bin Maysarah while we were at the funeral of Amr bin Murrah, saying: I indeed reckon him to be the best of the people of the earth.
2943 - Abu Sa'id told me, he said: Abu Khalid Al-Ahmar told us, from Ibn Abi Arubah, he said: I saw the back of Ikrimah's neck.
2944 - Abu Sa'id told me, he said: Abu Khalid Al-Ahmar told us, from Shu'bah, he said: I said to Ayyub: Did you narrate a thousand [hadiths] from Al-Hasan? He said: Yes, and a thousand, and a thousand.
2945 - Abu Sa'id and Abu Ma'mar told me, from Ibn Idris, from Al-Shaibani, from Abd Al-Malik bin Iyas, he said: We said to Ibrahim: Who should we ask after you? He said: Hammad.
2946 - I heard Ishaq bin Mansur Al-Kawsaj say: Abu Abdullah Al-Qarraz's name is Dinar.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2947 - Abu Ma'mar told me, he said: Ibn Uyainah told us, he said: I saw Shu'bah in the desert of Abd Al-Qays. He said: I want Al-Aswad bin Qais to remind him, or I want to verify hadiths with him.
2948 - Al-Haytham bin Kharijah told me, he said: Jarir told us, from Mughirah, he said: Ibrahim and Khaythamah did not witness [the battle of] Al-Jamajim.
2949 - Abu Ma'mar told me, he said: Ibn Uyainah told us, from Aban bin Taghlib, from Salamah bin Kuhayl, he said: I saw Abu Al-Bukhturi—meaning Al-Ta'i—beheaded at Al-Jamajim.
2950 - Abu Ma'mar told me, he said: Ibn Uyainah told us, he said: If you saw Ibrahim bin Maysarah, you would know that he does not lie.
2951 - Al-Haytham bin Kharijah and Abu Ma'mar told me, they said: Jarir told us, from Wasil bin Sulaym. Al-Haytham said: From Abd Al-Malik bin Sa'id. And Abu Ma'mar said: From Abdullah bin Sa'id bin Jubayr, he said: Sa'id bin Jubayr, may Allah have mercy on him, was killed when he was forty-nine—meaning years old.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2952 - Abu Ma'mar told me, he said: My brother Abu Al-Hudhayl told us, from Sufyan bin Uyainah, from Ayyub, he said: Umar bin Abd Al-Aziz was mentioned in the presence of Urwah, and it was as if he did not praise him between himself and him. He said: He is a righteous man, and I love the righteous.
2953 - My father told me, he said: Ibn Uyainah told it to us, and he mentioned something similar.
2954 - Abu Ma'mar told me, from Sufyan, he said: I saw Thabit Al-A'raj.
2955 - Hasan bin Abd Al-Aziz Al-Jarawi told me, he said: Damrah wrote to us mentioning from Al-Awza'i, he said: Umar bin Abd Al-Aziz wept until he wept blood.
2956 - Ali bin Hakim Al-Awdi and Abu Ma'mar told me, they said: Sharik informed us, from Abu Hamzah, that some of the Jurists (Fuqaha) came to the owner of an orchard and gave him one of them—meaning a dirham or something—on the condition that they enter, eat, and look. Among them was Salamah bin Kuhayl.
2957 - Abu Ma'mar told me, he said: Sufyan told us, from Al-A'mash, he said: Zaid bin Wahb told us, from Abdullah. Then he said: There was a veil between us and the warriors of Badr.
2958 - Abu Ma'mar told me, he said: Sufyan told us, from Mis'ar, from Sa'd bin Ibrahim, he said: The people of Egypt narrate from Uqbah bin Amir just as the people of Kufa narrate from Abdullah.
2959 - Ibrahim bin Ziyad Sabalan told us, he said: Sufyan told us, from Abu Musa, from Al-Hasan, he said: Umar said: The year is three hundred and fifty-four days. Abu Ishaq Sabalan said: So I narrated it to Husayn Al-Ju'fi, and he said: Abu Musa told us, from Al-Hasan, he said: Umar said: The year is three hundred and sixty days. He refuted Sufyan's statement and said: He did not memorize it.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2960 - Harun bin Ma'ruf told me, he said: Sufyan told us this, from Ammar Al-Duhni, he said: The Nabataeans ruled for eight hundred years, and the Persians for four hundred years.
2961 - Dawud bin Rashid told me, he said: Muhammad bin Rabi'ah told us, he said: Abu Al-Khasib Nufa'ah bin Muslim Al-Ju'fi told us.
2962 - Musa bin Abi Dawud Abu Imran Al-Khurasani told us, he said: Al-Nadr bin Shumayl told us, he said: Awf Al-A'rabi was older than Qatadah by two years.
2963 - Abu Al-Ahwas Muhammad bin Hayyan told us, he said: Ishaq bin Yusuf Al-Azraq told us that Warqa bin Umar is Abu Bishr, his kunya.
2964 - Abu Al-Ahwas told me, he said: Yazid bin Harun told us, he said: Sa'id bin Ubayd Al-Ta'i, Abu Al-Hudhayl, informed us.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2965 - Harun bin Ma'ruf told us, he said: Sufyan told us this from Abu Al-Zubayr, he said: Ata used to put me forward to them in the presence of Jabir as I was the best memorizer of Hadith among them.
2966 - Ibrahim bin Ziyad Sabalan told us, he said: Husayn Al-Ju'fi told us, he said: Abu Musa informed us, from Al-Hasan, from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, he said: Indeed, this son of mine is a master (Sayyid)—meaning Al-Hasan bin Ali—and perhaps Allah will reconcile through him two parties of the Muslims.
2967 - Abu Ishaq said: So I said to him: Indeed, Sufyan says: 'From Abu Bakrah.' He said: No, by Allah, he did not memorize it. And I was the one who introduced Sufyan to Abu Musa, and he was staying in this house.
2968 - Ubayd Allah Al-Qawariri told me, he said: Yahya bin Sa'id told us, he said: When Isma'il bin Abi Khalid died and I was in Kufa, while I was sitting waiting for his funeral procession to come out, Sufyan bin Sa'id came and sat next to me before the funeral came out. He said to me: O Yahya, take from me, I will narrate to you ten hadiths from him which you have not heard any of. So he narrated to me ten hadiths, none of which I had heard from him.
2969 - Sufyan told me, he said: Isma'il bin Abi Khalid told us, he said: Qais used to pray for rain (Istisqa) after the prayer.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2970 - Ubayd Allah Al-Qawariri told me, he said: Yahya bin Sa'id said: Abd Al-Rahman bin Mahdi hearing from Sufyan from Al-A'mash is not more beloved to me than what I heard myself from Al-A'mash. A man said to Yahya: O Abu Sa'id, but So-and-so—and he mentioned a man—says that Abd Al-Rahman was poor in reception/taking (bad at recording), he used to listen to the Sheikh while the book was in his sleeve. Yahya became angry, then Yahya said: Abd Al-Rahman hearing while asleep is more beloved to me than that man dictating to me.
2971 - Ubayd Allah told me, he said: Yahya bin Sa'id said: I do not fear anything for Sufyan bin Sa'id in the Hereafter except his love for Hadith.
2972 - Harun bin Ma'ruf told me, he said: Ibn Uyainah told us, he said: I said to Mis'ar: Who have you seen who is most precise in Hadith? He said: I never saw the likes of Al-Qasim and Amr bin Dinar—meaning Al-Qasim bin Abd Al-Rahman.
2973 - Abu Ma'mar told me, he said: Jarir told us, from Isma'il bin Abi Khalid, he said: Ibrahim, Al-Sha'bi, and Abu Al-Duha used to sit and discuss. If they disagreed on something, they would look to Ibrahim the look of a man seeking information about the people regarding something.
2974 - Harun told me, he said: Sufyan told us, from Amr, he said: We gathered in a session and a man called Nasr bin Asim spoke. Ibn Shihab said: Indeed, this one uproots the Arabic language completely.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2975 - Abu Musa Al-Harawi told me, he said: Sufyan informed us, he said: Qasim Al-Rahhal informed us in the year one hundred and twenty, he said: I heard Anas bin Malik.
2976 - Someone who heard Hushaym told me that his grandfather Al-Qasim and Al-Hajjaj Abu Shu'bah were partners in building the Green Palace of Al-Hajjaj.
2977 - Abu Ma'mar told me, from Hushaym, from Zakariyya bin Abi Za'idah, from Al-Sha'bi, he said: I said to Abu Salamah: Who is the most learned of the people of Medina? He said: A man between you and the wall—meaning himself.
2978 - Abu Ma'mar told me, he said: Sufyan bin Uyainah told us, he said: We were sitting with Muqatil bin Sulayman, so a man said: It reached me that you did not hear from Al-Dahhak. Muqatil said: Yes I did; sometimes the door was closed upon me and him. A man next to him said to him: Perhaps the city gate.
2979 - Al-Qawariri told me, he said: Sulaym bin Akhdar told us, he said: Ibn Awn informed us, he said: I asked Umair bin Ishaq one day about a hadith, so he started and narrated it to me, then he considered me too young/insignificant, so he cut it off.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2980 - Ubayd Allah told me, he said: Hammad bin Zaid told us, he said: Ata bin Al-Sa'ib came to us in Basra, so Ayyub said to us: Go to him and ask him about the hadith of Tasbih.
2981 - Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaibah told me, he said: Shababah bin Sawwar told us, he said: Shu'bah told us, from Al-Haytham, he said: Asim bin Damrah saw some people following a man, so he said: Indeed, it is a trial (Fitnah) for the followed and a humiliation for the follower.
2982 - My father told me, he said: Hajjaj told us, from Shu'bah, the like of it. He said: They were following Sa'id bin Jubayr.
2983 - Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaibah told me, he said: Sufyan bin Uyainah told us, from Asim, he said: Ibn Sirin would not let anyone walk with him.
2984 - Abu Bakr told me, he said: Sufyan told us, from Asim, he said: If more than four people sat with Abu Al-Aliyah, he would stand up.
2985 - Sa'id bin Yahya Al-Qurashi told me, he said: I heard my uncle Muhammad bin Sa'id say: Sa'id bin Aban—meaning his father—took me to Habib bin Abi Thabit, him and Al-A'mash. Sa'id threw a pillow and said to Al-A'mash: 'To the ground, O little A'mash... The slave is not raised above his nature... As long as there remains a noble one in its belly...'
2986 - Abu Ma'mar told me, he said: Sufyan told us, from Mis'ar, from Sa'd bin Ibrahim, he said: No one should narrate from the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, except the trustworthy ones.
2987 - Abu Ma'mar told me, he said: Sufyan bin Uyainah told us, he said: Amr bin Dinar told us, he said: I heard Mujalid in the year seventy at the steps of Zamzam, the year of Mus'ab bin Al-Zubayr's Hajj, narrating from Amr bin Aws and Jabir bin Zaid.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2988 - Ubayd Allah Al-Qawariri told me, he said: I heard Yahya bin Sa'id say: I have not seen lying in anyone more than in those who are ascribed to goodness.
2989 - Someone who heard Affan told me, from Muhammad bin Yahya bin Sa'id, from his father, he said: I have not seen the righteous lying more than they do in Hadith.
2990 - Abu Abd Al-Rahman said: And I met Muhammad bin Yahya in Basra and asked him, so he said: I heard my father say: I have not seen lying in anyone more than in those who are ascribed to goodness.
2991 - Ubayd Allah bin Umar told me, he said: Yahya bin Sa'id said to me: Shu'bah said to me: Anyone from whom I hear a hadith, I am a slave to him.
2992 - Ubayd Allah told me, he said: Abd Al-Rahman bin Mahdi told us, he said: I heard Shu'bah say to Yahya: You, O Yahya, are tougher on the men (narrators) than Abdullah bin Uthman—meaning Shu'bah's companion.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2993 - Abu Ma'mar told me, he said: Hushaym told us, he said: Mansur bin Zadhan informed us, from Ibn Sirin, he said: I realized four thousand in Kufa seeking knowledge; Ibrahim was not among them.
2994 - Abu Ma'mar told me, he said: Sufyan told us, from Mis'ar, from Amr bin Murrah, from Al-Sha'bi, he said: Al-Rabi' bin Khuthaym told me, and he was one of the mines of truthfulness.
2995 - Abu Ma'mar told me, he said: Sufyan told us, from Isma'il bin Umayyah, from Makhul, he said: Most of what I narrate to you is from Amir Al-Sha'bi and Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib.
2996 - Ahmad bin Ibrahim Al-Dawraqi told me, he said: Ibrahim bin Abd Al-Rahman bin Mahdi told me, from his father, he said: Trust him [the Hadith scholar] with one hundred thousand, but do not trust him with a hadith—meaning the companion of Hadith.
2997 - Ahmad told me, he said: I heard Abu Dawud say: We came to Ziyad bin Maymun, and I heard him say: I ask forgiveness from Allah; I fabricated these hadiths.
2998 - Nasr bin Ali told me, he said: Ibn Uyainah told us, from Ali bin Zaid, he said: Umar bin Abd Al-Aziz desired a session with Ubayd Allah bin Abdullah for a badrah (a purse of 10,000 dirhams), and he said: The knowledge I would gain from him is not greater than what I have gained from all people.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
2999 - Sabalan Ibrahim told me, he said: Abdullah bin Dawud informed us, he said: Al-A'mash told us, from Muslim, from Masruq, he said: Abdullah told us—and if Abdullah did not tell us, who would tell us?
3000 - Abu Bakr bin Khallad Al-Bahili told me, he said: I heard Yahya bin Sa'id say: Isma'il—and he is Ibn Abi Khalid—told us, he said: Abu Salih was a scribe/teacher; I never asked him about anything but that he explained it to me.
3001 - Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaibah told me, he said: Zaid bin Al-Hubab told us, from Shu'bah, from Umarah bin Abi Hafsah, from Abu Mijlaz, from Qais bin Abbad, he said: I went out to Medina seeking knowledge and honor.
3002 - Ahmad bin Janab told us, he said: Isa bin Yunus told us, he said: Shu'bah told us, from Umarah—meaning Ibn Abi Hafsah—from Musa bin Anas, from Qais bin Abbad, and he mentioned it.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3003 - Abu Bakr told me, he said Sufyan told us, from Ayyub bin A'idh, from Al-Sha'bi who said: I have not known anyone among the people who was more seeking of knowledge in any of the horizons than Masruq. 3004 - Abu Ma'mar told me, from Ibn Uyainah, from Mis'ar, he said: Muharib bin Dithar said to Alqamah bin Marthad: 'Why do the people keep returning to you?' He said: 'They come to me in the morning asking me,' and he lowered his head. 3005 - Sablan told me, he said Abdullah bin Dawud told us, he said Al-A'mash informed us, from Shaqiq, he said: The companions of Ibn Mas'ud used to count Yazid bin Mu'awiyah Al-Nakha'i among the best of Abdullah's companions. 3006 - Abu Ma'mar told me, he said Abu Bakr bin Ayyash told us, from Mughirah, he said: The Hadith of Ali was not taken except from the companions of Abdullah. 3007 - Shaiban told me, he said Jarir bin Hazim Al-Ataki told us, he said Abu Ishaq told us, from Abdurrahman bin Yazid, he said: Aisha said: 'There is no one in Iraq more honored to me than Al-Aswad bin Yazid.' 3008 - Abu Ma'mar told me, he said Sufyan told me: 'If you saw Mutarrif bin Tarif, you would know that he does not lie.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3009 - Muhammad bin Al-Faraj, the client of Bani Hashim, told me, he said Abu Qatan told us, he said Al-Mundhir bin Tha'labah told us, and he was good. 3010 - Ubaydullah Al-Qawariri told me, he said Abdurrahman bin Mahdi said to me: We were with Shu'bah and Gundar was with us. Shu'bah narrated a Hadith, so Gundar said: 'Like this?' and stretched his neck listening. Shu'bah said to him: 'I detest you! You have heard my entire Hadith, yet look at how he looks!' 3011 - Al-Qawariri told me, he said Waki' said to me—and he mentioned Ibn Dawud: 'May Allah grant wellness to Abu Abdurrahman, he was not satisfied until he repeated and repeated.' 3012 - Muhammad bin Abbad told me, he said Sufyan told us, he said Abdul-Malik bin A'yan told us, and he was a Rafidi. 3013 - Abu Bahr Al-Basri Abdul-Wahid bin Ghiyath told me, he said I heard Umar bin Khaqan Al-Ahtam say to Abu Awanah: 'O Abu Awanah, I have never seen the likes of Ibn Awn, ever.' He remained silent for a while, then said: 'No.' 3014 - He told me who heard Ibn Dawud say: 'I have not seen the likes of these three: Al-A'mash, Sufyan, and Abu Ishaq Al-Fazari.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3015 - Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaibah told me, he said Ismail bin Ayyash told us, from Hisham bin Urwah, he said: My father said: 'Did you write?' I said yes. He said: 'Did you compare (verify)?' I said no. He said: 'You did not write.' 3016 - Abu Ma'mar told me, from Ibn Uyainah, he said: I saw Asim Al-Ahwal coming to Ismail bin Abi Khalid asking him to verify the Hadith of Barwa' bint Washiq. 3017 - Amr, meaning Ibn Muhammad Al-Naqid, told me, he said Sufyan told us, he said: I saw Asim Al-Ahwal coming to Ismail bin Abi Khalid asking him to verify the Hadith of Al-Sha'bi. 3018 - Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaibah told me, he said Abu Dawud Al-Tayalisi told us, from Shu'bah, he said: I was walking with Al-Hakam, and we saw Abu Ma'shar. Al-Hakam said: 'This man, something reached him that I supposedly said about him. No, by Allah besides Whom there is no deity, I did not say it.' When Abu Ma'shar came, Al-Hakam apologized to him. Abu Ma'shar said: 'I swore to Shu'bah that I did not say what reached you about me.' 3019 - Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaibah told me, he said Ibn Idris told us, from his uncle, from Al-Sha'bi, he heard him say: 'Ibrahim came to me apologizing for something bitter that reached me about him.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3020 - Abu Umar told me, he said Abu Usamah told me, he said: I was with Sufyan, and Za'idah narrated to him from Shu'bah, from Salamah bin Kuhayl, from Sa'id bin Jubayr: {And those in the heavens and the earth fell unconscious except whom Allah wills}, he said: 'They are the martyrs.' Sufyan said to him: 'Indeed you are trustworthy, and indeed you narrate to us from a trustworthy person, but my heart does not accept that this is from the Hadith of Salamah.' So he called for a book (letter) and wrote from Sufyan bin Sa'id to Shu'bah. The letter came from Shu'bah to Sufyan: 'I did not narrate this from Salamah, but 'Umarah bin Abi Hafsah told me, from Hajar Al-Hajari, from Sa'id bin Jubayr.' 3021 - Abu Ma'mar told us, he said Jarir told us, from Hamzah Al-Zayyat, he said: 'It used to be said: Do not trust a reciter (Qari) with a scroll, nor a Bedouin with a rope.' 3022 - Abu Ma'mar told me, he said Abu Usamah told us, from Malik bin Mighwal, from Ismail bin Abi Khalid, he said: Al-Sha'bi said: 'Indeed, among the most beloved of you to me are those who remind me,' meaning his Hadith. 3023 - Abu Ma'mar told me, he said Jarir told us, from Mughirah, he said: Ikrimah was narrating to Sulayman bin Abdul-Malik about Abdul-Muttalib and the digging of Zamzam. Sulayman said to him: 'How excellent is your narration, were it not that you boast over us.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3024 - Dawud bin Rashid told me, he said Afif bin Salim told us, from Abdullah bin Umar, he said: Ubaydullah bin Umar said to Khubayb bin Abdurrahman: 'O Abu Al-Harith.' 3025 - Muhammad bin Al-Faraj told me, he said Abu Qatan told us, he said: I heard a man narrating a Hadith to Shu'bah from Mis'ar from Abu Awn. Shu'bah said to him: 'From whom does he mean Abu Awn? From whom?' Meaning, as if he was stopping him (to clarify). 3026 - Amr Al-Naqid told me, he said Waki' told us, he said: Shu'bah said: '"So-and-so from So-and-so"—the like of it does not suffice.' Waki' said: And Sufyan Al-Thawri said: 'It suffices.' 3027 - Nasr bin Ali told me, he said Husayn bin Urwah told me, from Hammad bin Zaid, from Ayyub, he said: Ikrimah used to swear that he would not narrate to us, then he would narrate to us. We would speak to him about that, and he would say: 'This is the expiation for that.' 3028 - Uthman bin Talut told me, he said I heard Abdullah bin Dawud say: Al-A'mash said: 'People are tormented by you for twenty years while they do not know.' 3029 - Uthman bin Abi Shaibah told me, he said Ismail bin...

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: ...Aban Al-Warraq, from Al-Qasim bin Ma'n, from Mujalid, from Al-Sha'bi, he said: The first to take charge of the judiciary of the people of Kufa was Abdullah bin Mas'ud. Then Uthman bin Abi Shaibah dictated to me, saying: These are the judges of the people of Kufa: The first to judge in Kufa was Abdullah bin Mas'ud, then Ali, then Urwah Al-Bariqi, then Salman bin Rabi'ah, then Shurayh bin Al-Harith, then Abu Burdah bin Abi Musa, then Amir Al-Sha'bi, then Al-Qasim bin Abdurrahman, then Muharib bin Dithar, then Ibn Ashwa', then Isa bin Al-Musayyib Al-Bajali, then Husayn bin Hasan Al-Kindi, then Hajjaj bin Asim Al-Muharibi, then Ghaylan bin Jami'...

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: ...then Ibn Abi Layla, then Ubayd the grandson of Abu Layla, then Sharik bin Abdullah, then Al-Qasim bin Ma'n, then Nuh bin Darraj, then Hafs bin Ghiyath, then Hasan Al-Lu'lu'i, then Ismail bin Hammad, then Bakr bin Abdurrahman, then Ghassan—may Allah curse him. Thus said Uthman. Abu Abdurrahman said: Ghassan was a Jahmi.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3030 - Dawud bin Rashid told me, he said Al-Walid bin Muslim told us, he said Khalid bin Yazid bin Abi Malik told us, from his father: That Abu Darda used to judge over the people of Damascus, and when he was close to death, Mu'awiyah came to visit him and said to him: 'Who do you see for this matter after you?' He said: 'Fadalah bin Ubayd.' So when Abu Darda passed away, Mu'awiyah said to Fadalah: 'I have appointed you to the judiciary.' He tried to be excused from it, so Mu'awiyah said to him: 'By Allah, I did not favor you with it, but I shielded myself from the Fire with you, so shield yourself with it as much as you can.' 3031 - And other than Ibn Abi Malik said: So Fadalah was appointed, then after Fadalah, Abu Idris Al-Khawlani, then Zur'ah bin Thawb Al-Muqri, then Abdurrahman bin Al-Khashkhash Al-Udhri (for Umar bin Abdul-Aziz), then Numayr bin Aws Al-Ash'ari (for Hisham), then Yazid bin Abi Malik (for Hisham), then Al-Harith bin So-and-so Al-Ash'ari, then Salim bin Abdullah Al-Muharibi, then Muhammad bin Labid Al-Asadi, then Thumamah bin Yazid Al-Urdunni, then Al-Musawir Al-Khurasani (for Abu Ja'far), then Salamah bin Amr, then Yahya bin Hamzah Al-Hadrami, then Abdurrahman bin Yazid bin Abi Malik, then Yahya bin Hamzah for a second time, then Amr bin Abi Bakr.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3032 - Ibrahim bin Ziyad Sablan told me, he said Ibn Ulayyah informed us, he said Salam bin Abi Muti' informed us, he said: I heard Jabir Al-Ju'fi say: 'I have fifty thousand Hadiths that I have not narrated to anyone.' I met Ayyub and informed him, so he said: 'Jabir lied.' 3033 - Ubaydullah bin Umar Al-Qawariri told me, he said I heard Abu Bakr bin Ayyash say: Ammar Al-Duhni passed by me, so I called him. I said to him: 'O Ammar, come here.' He came, so I said to him: 'Did you hear anything from Sa'id bin Jubayr?' He said no. I said: 'Go.' 3034 - Ubaydullah bin Umar Al-Qawariri told me, he said Yahya bin Sa'id told me, from Al-Ash'ath, from Al-Hasan, he said: 'If anyone knew lying, it is Umar.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3035 - Ubaydullah bin Umar Al-Qawariri told me, he said Yahya bin Sa'id said to me: 'I have not heard anyone say anything about Al-Ash'ath until now.' 3036 - Harun bin Ma'ruf told me, he said Sufyan bin Uyainah told us, from Mis'ar, from Amr bin Murrah, he said: Abu Ubaydah said to me: Masruq said to me: 'Your father—meaning Ibn Mas'ud—informed me that a tree warned the Prophet, peace be upon him, about them—meaning on the Night of the Jinn.' 3037 - Rawh bin Abdul-Mu'min told us, he said I heard Yazid bin Zuray' bin Al-Taw'am say: 'I wrote the book of Muhammad bin Amr on paper, and most of it went away (faded). It is as the sayer said: He entrusted his knowledge to paper.' 3038 - Rawh bin Abdul-Mu'min told me, he said: Abdul-Wahid bin Ziyad died in the year one hundred and seventy-seven, and Hammad bin Zaid died a year or two after him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3039 - Rawh bin Abdul-Mu'min told me, he said: I heard Yazid bin Zurai' bin Yazid bin Al-Taw'am say: 'To fall from the sky is more beloved to me than to practice Tadlis (concealing defects in narrators).' 3040 - Rawh bin Abdul-Mu'min said: Abu Awanah died in the year seventy-six. 3041 - Nasr bin Ali told me, he said Abdullah bin Dawud told us, from Munkhal bin Hakim bin Bahz, from Ibn Awn, he said: Al-Hasan and Muhammad agreed that no one from the Companions of the Prophet, peace be upon him, settled in Basra like Abu Bakrah and Imran bin Husayn. 3042 - Hudbah told us, he said Yazid bin Zurai' told us, he said: My father slaughtered a horse in the neighborhood, and I saw its meat was yellow. 3043 - Muhammad bin Al-Faraj told me, he said Al-Hajjaj informed us, from Abu Ma'shar, he said: I heard the people of Medina say: Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib took seven or nine—Abu Abdurrahman [Abdullah] was unsure—that were given to him in the stipend (Diwan) during the time of Umar.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3044 - Ubaydullah bin Umar Al-Qawariri told me, he said Hammad bin Zaid told us, he said a man told me that Tawus said: 'This client of Ibn Badhan has made his ear a funnel for every scholar,' referring to Amr bin Dinar. 3045 - Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaibah told me, he said I heard Ibn Idris say: 'I wrote the Hadith of Abu Al-Hawra', and I feared I might misread it as "Abu Al-Jawza'", so I wrote beneath it "Hur 'In" (Houris).' 3046 - Abu Ma'mar told me, he said Sufyan told us, from Mis'ar, from Amr bin Murrah, he said: We were with Al-Zuhri while he was narrating, and Dharr Al-Hamdani was with him. Dharr started saying to the people: 'Memorize, memorize.' 3047 - Abu Ma'mar told me, he said Jarir told us, from Mughirah, he said: It was said to Ubaydullah bin Abdullah that Awn was narrating. He said: 'The Resurrection has begun.' 3048 - Abu Ma'mar told me, he said Abdullah bin Idris told us, from Al-A'mash, from Abu Salih, he said: Abu Hurairah used to narrate from the Prophet, peace be upon him, and so-and-so would narrate from Kisra (Chosroes). Once he said: 'And Yazid Al-Danaj narrates.' It was said to him regarding that, and he said: 'To lie against Kisra is more beloved to me than to lie against the Prophet, peace be upon him.' 3049 - Fadl told me, from Sahl, from Affan, from Wuhaib, he said: Sufyan Al-Thawri asked to benefit from me regarding Hisham. I said: 'As for Hisham, I will not benefit you, but if you want [narrations] from Ayyub...'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3050 - Harun bin Ma'ruf and Al-Qawariri told me, they said Sufyan told us, from Ma'mar, from Al-Zuhri, he said: Tawus told me, and if you saw him, you would know that he does not lie. 3051 - Harun bin Ma'ruf told me, he said Damrah told us, from Ibn Shawdhab, he said: I attended the funeral of Tawus in Mecca in the year one hundred and six. I heard them saying: 'May Allah have mercy on you, O Abu Abdurrahman, he performed Hajj forty times.' He said: And Salim died in the year one hundred and six. He said: Hisham visited him at the beginning and visited him after the Hajj, so Salim died and Hisham prayed over him. 3052 - Amr Al-Naqid told me that he heard Abbad bin Al-Awwam say: 'O people, if you hear me narrate from Ibn Abi Najih other than this Hadith, then know that I am a liar. Ibn Abi Najih told us...' and he mentioned one Hadith. 3053 - Ubaydullah bin Umar Al-Qawariri told me, he said Hammad bin Zaid told us, he said: I was behind my father, riding pillion on a donkey, in the funeral of Al-Hasan bin Abi Al-Hasan. 3054 - Ubaydullah bin Umar told me, he said Hushaym told us, he said: I saw Iyas bin Mu'awiyah, he did not dye his hair. 3055 - Uthman bin Talut told me, he said Musaddad told us, from Yahya bin Sa'id Al-Qattan, he said: Al-A'mash entered upon Ibn Hubayrah—or upon one of them—and he said to him: 'Narrate.' He replied: 'I am not a storyteller.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3056 - Harun bin Ma'ruf told me, he said Sufyan told us, from Mutarrif, he said Umayr bin Sa'id informed me, he said: 'Shall I not inform you about every governor who came to us until Mu'awiyah died? Sa'd came to us, then Umar removed him and appointed Ammar, then he removed Ammar and appointed Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah. Then Uthman sent Sa'd to us when he took charge. Then he sent Al-Walid bin Uqbah over Sa'd.' Sufyan said: Ismail bin Abi Khalid said: I heard Tariq say: When Al-Walid came to remove Sa'd, Sa'd said to him: 'By Allah, I do not know if I became foolish after [leaving] you or if you became wise after [leaving] me.' Sufyan said, from Mutarrif, from Umayr—meaning Ibn Sa'id Al-Nakha'i: 'Then Al-Walid was complained about, so he appointed Sa'id bin Al-As. Then the people of Kufa refused to let Sa'id enter and rejected him, and they were satisfied with Abu Musa. Uthman was killed while Abu Musa was over the people. Then Mu'awiyah appointed Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah over us, then removed Al-Mughirah and appointed Ziyad. Then Ziyad died, so he appointed Ibn Umm Al-Hakam. Then Ibn Umm Al-Hakam was removed when Ibn Saluba was killed.' 3057 - Sulayman said, Abdullah said: I think it was Al-A'mash, if not Al-A'mash then it was Sulayman bin Abi Al-Mughirah Al-Absi, he said: I heard Thabit bin Ubayd say: I saw Ibn Saluba, an old man with a white head and beard, saying: 'O assembly of Muslims, upon this I made a treaty with you and made a treaty with Umar.' The people said: 'Your covenant is gone, your covenant is gone.' They rushed the palace and locked the door against him. They said to him: 'If they catch you, they will kill you,' so he joined Mu'awiyah. Mutarrif said, from Umayr: Then he appointed Al-Dahhak bin Qays. Abdul-Malik—meaning Ibn Umayr—said: The people used to come to him every morning and evening. He said: 'Do these people have no need? Do these people have no job? By Allah, this matter came to me from Mu'awiyah while I was holding the tail of a bull, plowing with it in one of the mountain passes of the Levant (Sham).' Mutarrif said, from Umayr: Then Al-Dahhak was removed, and he sent Al-Nu'man bin Bashir to us, and Mu'awiyah died while he was over us.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3058 - Shuja' bin Makhlad told me, he said Abbad bin Al-Awwam told us, he said Abu Urwah Al-Hasan bin Ubaydullah informed me. 3059 - Ubaydullah bin Umar told me, he said I heard Hammad bin Zaid say: I heard Ayyub, Yahya bin Atiq, and Hisham discussing the Hadith of Muhammad. They mentioned a Hadith, and Ayyub said: 'It is like this.' Hisham and Yahya disagreed with him. They did not leave until they returned to Ayyub's memory. Ayyub wanted to humble himself, so he said: 'And what is memory? And what is this memory? Such and such memorizes.' Hammad said: A man whom I saw him laughing with.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3060 - Harun bin Ma'ruf told me, he said Damrah told us, from Ibn Shawdhab, he said: I attended a funeral in Basra and heard a man saying: 'Where are those who used to say: "If Ayyub Al-Sakhtiyani and Aban bin Abi Ayyash die, the religion will be upright"? They have died, so has the religion become upright?' 3061 - Ubaydullah bin Umar told us, he said Hammad bin Zaid told us, he said Maymun Al-Ghazal told us, he said: We were with Al-Hasan, and Ayyub came to him, greeted him, asked him questions, then left. When he was where he could not hear, Al-Hasan said to us: 'This is the master of the youths.' 3062 - Nasr bin Ali told me, he said Abdul-A'la bin Abdul-A'la told us, he said: Kulthum bin Jabr and Shu'ayb bin Al-Habhab died before the plague. 3063 - Dawud bin Rashid told me, he said Abu Al-Malih told us, he said: I heard Salih bin Mismar narrate a Hadith from Al-Hasan, raising it to Anas. And he narrated a Hadith from Al-Hasan. I said to him: 'Assign the chain (Isnad) to it.' He said: 'He (Al-Hasan) did not used to assign chains. I might have heard him say: Your Prophet narrated from your Lord, Mighty and Majestic.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3064 - I heard Hudbah bin Khalid say: I heard my brother Umayyah bin Khalid say: Yasar Abu Al-Hasan Al-Basri, the client of the Ansar, was from the people of Maysan. And Sirin, the client of Anas bin Malik, the father of Muhammad bin Sirin, was from the people of Jarjaraya. And Artaban, the grandfather of Ibn Awn, was from the people of Dastmaisan. 3065 - Muhammad bin Abi Bakr Al-Muqaddami told me, he said I heard Mu'adh bin Mu'adh, and Mu'tamir was mentioned in his presence. He said: 'He is not, in our opinion, below his father in virtue.' 3066 - Abdul-Wahid bin Ghiyath Abu Bahr told me that he heard Yazid bin Zurai' say: 'No one from our companions left a successor'—I think he mentioned Yunus—'except Al-Tamimi,' meaning Mu'tamir bin Sulayman. 3067 - Al-Haytham bin Kharijah told me, he said Muhammad bin Himyar told us, from Ibrahim bin Abi Ablah: That Uqbah bin Wassaj told him, from Anas bin Malik, that the Prophet, peace be upon him, arrived in Medina and there was no one among his companions with gray hair except Abu Bakr. He mentioned henna and katam.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3068 - Harun bin Ma'ruf told me, he said Damrah—meaning Ibn Rabi'ah—told us, from Ibn Shawdhab, from Matar Al-Warraq, he said: 'Some ten and a few clients (Mawali) witnessed Badr.' Then Matar said: 'They struck a good blow among them.' 3069 - Abbas Al-Narsi told us, he said Wuhaib told us, from Al-Ja'd Abu Uthman, he said: We were with Al-Hasan, and Ayyub came. Al-Hasan said: 'This is the master of the youths.' 3070 - Abu Ma'mar told me, he said Sufyan bin Uyainah informed us: That Khalid bin Abdullah ordered the jurists of Mecca to be thrown into prison: Ata, Amr bin Dinar, Talq bin Habib, and Suhayb the client of Ibn Amir. It was spoken regarding Ata that he should be released during the days of the Hajj season to issue fatwas to the people. When the people of Mecca saw him, they said 'Allahu Akbar'. People spoke regarding them, so they were released. When he heard the sound of iron (shackles), he said: 'What is this?' He said: 'Those are the group whom you ordered to be released.' 3071 - Abu Ma'mar told me, he said Sufyan told us, from Ibn Abi Najih, he said: There was no one in our land more knowledgeable than Amr bin Dinar. 3072 - Abu Ma'mar told me, he said Sufyan said: It was said to Ata: 'Who should we ask after you?' He said: 'Amr bin Dinar.' 3073 - Abu Ma'mar told me, he said Sufyan said: Muhammad bin Ali said: 'Indeed, part of what makes my arrival in Mecca beloved is my meeting with Amr bin Dinar.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3074 - Abu Ma'mar told me, he said Sufyan informed us, he said: It was said to Iyas bin Mu'awiyah: 'Who is the most knowledgeable of the people of Mecca?' He said: 'The one among them with the worst character, Amr bin Dinar.' 3075 - Ubaydullah bin Umar Al-Qawariri told me, he said Hammad bin Zaid told us, from Ayyub, he said: They mentioned Muhammad in the presence of Abu Qilabah. He said: 'And who among us can bear what Muhammad bears? He rides something like the edge of a spear.' 3076 - Ubaydullah bin Umar Al-Qawariri told me, he said Hammad told us, from Abu Khashinah: That Muhammad was mentioned in the presence of Abu Qilabah one day regarding something. He said: 'That is truly my brother.' 3077 - Ubaydullah told me, he said Hammad bin Zaid told us, he said Shu'ayb bin Al-Habhab told us, he said Al-Sha'bi said to us: 'Stick to that deaf one,' meaning Muhammad bin Sirin. 3078 - I was told from Hammad bin Zaid, he said Umm Hisham—meaning Ibn Hassan—told us, she said: 'I have never seen anyone more stingy (protective) of his religion than Muhammad bin Sirin.' 3079 - Harun bin Ma'ruf told us, he said Damrah told us, from Al-Sari bin Yahya, he said: Al-Hasan died in the year one hundred and ten, and Ibn Sirin died one hundred nights after Al-Hasan. 3080 - My father told me, he said Abu Bakr bin Ayyash told us, he said Abu Ishaq told us, from Abdurrahman bin Yazid Al-Nakha'i, he said: A woman was mentioned in the presence of Abdullah, and they said: 'She performs Ghusl, O Abu Abdurrahman, and performs Wudu.' He said: 'As for her, if she were with me (my wife), she would not do that.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3081 - I heard my father say: Yahya bin Sa'id used to deny this Hadith greatly. My father said: No one narrated it from Abu Ishaq other than Abu Bakr bin Ayyash; we think it is a mistake. This is actually narrated by Al-A'mash from Ibrahim from Alqamah. 3082 - My father told me, he said Abu Bakr bin Ayyash told us, he said Abu Ishaq told us, from Sa'd bin Iyas Al-Bajali, he said: I saw Abdullah expelling women from the mosque on Friday, saying: 'Go out, for this is not for you.' 3083 - I heard my father say: Sa'd bin Iyas is Abu Amr Al-Shaybani, but Abu Bakr said 'Al-Bajali,' as if he sees that he made a mistake. 3084 - My father told me, he said Abu Bakr bin Ayyash told us, he said I heard Abu Ishaq say: I have never seen a man who had a greater mark of prostration between his eyes than Abdullah bin Al-Zubayr. 3085 - My father told me, he said I heard Abu Bakr bin Ayyash say: Abu Ishaq heard barely three Hadiths from Al-Harith. 3086 - My father told me, he said Abu Bakr bin Ayyash told us, he said I heard Abu Ishaq from Abu Al-Ahwas, he said: Khawarijah went out, so he went out to them and they killed him—meaning Abu Al-Ahwas.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3087 - My father told me, he said Abu Bakr bin Ayyash told us, he said Abu Ishaq told us, from Abdurrahman bin Abi Layla, he said: I met people from the people of Badr among those who pledged allegiance under the Tree. 3088 - I asked my father about Bishr bin Numayr. He said: People abandoned his Hadith. 3089 - I asked my father about Ibn Abjar. He said: Bakh (Excellent), trustworthy. 3090 - I heard my father say: Amr bin Muhajir is trustworthy, and his brother Muhammad bin Muhajir is trustworthy. 3091 - I saw my father, when he entered the graveyards, he would remove his sandals. I said to him: 'To what (view) are you going?' He said: 'To the Hadith of Bashir bin Al-Khasasiyah.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3092 - I asked my father about Harun bin Antarah. He said: He is a trustworthy Sheikh. He is Harun bin Abi Waki', and Harun is nicknamed Abu Amr, and Al-Shaybani. 3093 - My father was asked about Muhammad bin Sawa' and Rawh regarding Sa'id bin Abi Arubah. He said: How close they are. 3094 - I asked my father about Abu Ya'fur Al-Abdi and Abu Ya'fur bin Ubayd bin Nistas. He said: Both are trustworthy. 3095 - My father told me, he said Muhammad bin Bishr Al-Abdi told us, he said: I saw Abu Ya'fur Al-Abdi. 3096 - My father told us, he said I heard Muhammad bin Bishr say: Abu Ya'fur's name is Waqid Waqdan. 3097 - My father said: I think Qatadah died in Wasit. 3098 - My father said: Khalid Al-Hadhdha' was in charge of the charities of Basra.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3099 - I heard my father say: Qutbah bin Abdul-Aziz is a trustworthy Sheikh, and Yazid bin Abdul-Aziz bin Siyah is like him in reliability, and Qutbah was a man who studied Fiqh. 3100 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Adam said: Abu Mu'awiyah used to sit with these two to memorize the Hadith of Al-A'mash, meaning Yazid bin Abdul-Aziz and Qutbah bin Abdul-Aziz. 3101 - I asked my father about Uthman bin Abi Al-Atikah. He said: This is a storyteller (Qass) man. 3102 - I asked my father about Usamah bin Zaid bin Aslam. He said: I fear he is not strong in Hadith. I said: And his brother Abdullah bin Zaid bin Aslam? He said: Trustworthy. 3103 - I asked my father about Abdurrahman bin Ibrahim, from whom Affan narrated. He said: I know nothing but good, his Hadiths are acceptable (Muqarib). 3104 - I asked my father about Ja'far bin Rabi'ah. He said: A trustworthy Sheikh, Al-Layth bin Sa'd narrated from him. 3105 - I asked my father about Ata bin Dinar. He said: Trustworthy, well-known. 3106 - I asked my father about Umarah bin Ghaziyyah. He said: Trustworthy. 3107 - My father said: And Abu Hashim Al-Rummani is trustworthy. 3108 - My father said: Imran bin Hudair, Bakh (excellent), trustworthy.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3109 - My father said: Abu Musa Al-Juhani is trustworthy. End of the license (Ijazah). In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. 3110 - Abu Abdurrahman Abdullah bin Ahmad told us, he said: I asked my father Ahmad bin Muhammad bin Hanbal about Salim Al-Aftas. He said: Trustworthy in Hadith, but he is a Murji'. 3111 - I asked my father about Harb bin Surayh. He said: There is no harm in him. 3112 - I asked my father about Al-Muthanna bin Sa'id Al-Qassam. He said: Trustworthy. 3113 - My father said: And Abu Sufyan Talhah bin Nafi', there is no harm in him. 3114 - My father said: Hammad Al-Abahh is upright in Hadith. 3115 - My father said: Al-Hasan bin Al-Sakan narrated from Al-A'mash, he is rejected in Hadith (Munkar al-Hadith). 3116 - My father said: Al-Qasim bin Ghusn narrates rejected Hadiths (Manakir).

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3117 - I asked him about Harun bin Sa'd. He said: People narrated from him, Sharik [did], and he is upright. I think he used to be a Shi'a. 3118 - I asked him about Abu Al-Sawda'. He said: He is Abu Al-Sawda' Al-Nahdi, and he is trustworthy. 3119 - I asked him about Al-Hakam bin Sinan. He said: I do not know. 3120 - Abdul-A'la Al-Tha'labi. He said: He is so-and-so. 3121 - I asked him about Muslim Al-A'war. He said: His Hadith is not written, he is weak in Hadith.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3122 - I asked him about Abdurrahman bin Muhammad bin Abi Al-Rijal. He said: Trustworthy. I said: His father Abu Al-Rijal? He said: Trustworthy, Malik narrated from him. 3123 - I asked him about Al-Muthanna Abu Ghaffar. He said: He is Al-Muthanna bin Sa'd, trustworthy. 3124 - Uthman bin Hakim is trustworthy. 3125 - I asked him about Musa bin Uqbah. He said: Trustworthy. 3126 - Suwayd bin Abdul-Aziz. He said: Matruk (abandoned) in Hadith.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3127 - And I asked him about Shu'ayb bin Ishaq. He said: I see no harm in him, but he sat with the People of Opinion (Ashab al-Ra'y), he used to sit with Abu Hanifah. 3128 - I asked him about Abd Rabbih bin Bariq Al-Hanafi. He said: He is the nephew of Simak Al-Hanafi, and there is no harm in him. 3129 - Khalid Al-Zayyat. He said: I see no harm in him. 3130 - Muharib bin Dithar is trustworthy. 3131 - Al-Qasim bin Abdullah bin Muhammad bin Aqil. He said: He is nothing. 3132 - Ali bin Mushir is upright in Hadith, truthful. 3133 - Attaf bin Khalid is upright in Hadith. 3134 - Dimam Al-Ma'afiri is upright in Hadith.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3135 - I presented to him Hadiths of Suwayd from Dimam. He said to me: Write them all, or he said track them, for he is upright, or he said trustworthy. 3136 - And Al-Qasim bin Abdullah bin Umar bin Hafs Al-Umari. He said: Uff, uff! He is nothing. 3137 - Marhum Al-Attar is trustworthy. 3138 - Ziyad bin Al-Rabi' is trustworthy. 3139 - Nuh bin Qais is trustworthy. 3140 - Muslim bin Khalid Al-Zanji. He said: He is so-and-so. Abdullah said: When my father says 'so-and-so,' he used to shake his hand. 3141 - Baqiyyah, if he narrates from the well-known ones like Bahir bin Sa'd and others [it is accepted].

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3142 - Hafs bin Maisarah, there is no harm in him. I said: They say he presented (his Hadith) to Zaid bin Aslam? He said: Are you not satisfied that he is trustworthy? 3143 - Marwan bin Mu'awiyah is trustworthy. 3144 - Yahya bin Abi Za'idah is trustworthy. 3145 - Rishdin bin Sa'd is so-and-so. 3146 - I asked him about Isa bin Yunus. He said: Isa is asked about?! 3147 - I said: Then his father Yunus? He said: So-and-so. 3148 - And Abu Al-Ahwas, there is no harm in him. 3149 - Al-Ashja'i said: Abu Al-Ahwas used to sit with Sufyan listening to his Hadith. He would say: 'Yes, I heard this,' or 'It reached me from him.' And he is trustworthy, he might make a mistake in something.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3150 - I asked him about Yahya bin Sulaim. He said: So-and-so. By Allah, his Hadith... meaning there is something in it. As if he did not praise him. Once he said: He had mastered the Hadith of Ibn Khuthaym, he had them in a book. We said to him: 'Give us your book.' He said: 'Give me a Mushaf (Quran) as a pledge.' We said: 'From where would we get a Mushaf while we are strangers?' 3151 - I said to him: Which is more trustworthy, Abu Qabil or Abu 'Ushanah? He said: Both are trustworthy. 3152 - Abu Al-Zubayr, there is no harm in him. 3153 - Muhammad bin Ziyad, the companion of Shu'bah and Hammad bin Salamah, is trustworthy. 3154 - I asked him about Abu Al-Muhazzim. He said: He is so-and-so, and Shu'bah narrated from him. 3155 - Abu Bakr bin Ayyash is trustworthy, and he might make mistakes.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3156 - Uthman bin Abi Zur'ah is Uthman Al-A'sha, and he is Uthman bin Al-Mughirah, and he is Abu Al-Mughirah Al-Thaqafi, and he is trustworthy (thiqah).
3157 - Al-Muttalib bin Ziyad is trustworthy.
3158 - Attab bin Bashir is so-so.
3159 - Muhammad bin Abi Humayd is not strong in Hadith.
3160 - Musa bin Wardan is an old Sheikh.
3161 - Ibn Harmalah is so-so.
3162 - Abd Al-Rahman bin Shurayh Abu Shurayh, there is no harm in him, he is trustworthy.
3163 - Khalid bin Yazid is trustworthy.
3164 - Abdullah bin Hubairah is trustworthy.
3165 - Ubaid Allah bin Abi Ja'far used to study jurisprudence; there is no harm in him.
3166 - I asked him about Ja'far bin Rabi'ah, he said: He was one of the companions of Hadith, a trustworthy Sheikh.
3167 - Bakr bin Mudar is trustworthy, there is no harm in him.
3168 - Mu'awiyah bin Ishaq is trustworthy.
3169 - Abu Hamzah Al-Asadi, the companion of Ibn Abbas, there is no harm in him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3170 - Muhammad bin Marwan, I caught him when he had become old.
3171 - Al-Ala bin Abd Al-Rahman is trustworthy.
3172 - Abu Hayyah, meaning Al-Wada'i, the companion of Ali, he said: He is a Sheikh.
3173 - Ishaq bin Yazid bin Talha, he said: This is a Sheikh who is abandoned (matruk) in Hadith.
3174 - Ibn Abi Al-Zinad is so-so.
3175 - Abu Al-Zinad, bakh (an expression of admiration), he is trustworthy.
3176 - Khalid bin Salamah Al-Makhzumi is trustworthy.
3177 - I heard him say: Nafi' Al-Sulami narrated from Anas; he is weak in Hadith.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3178 - My father said: Abdullah bin Yazid, the client of Al-Aswad bin Sufyan, and Abdullah bin Yazid bin Fantas Al-Hudhali, Ali bin Thabit and Ibn Abi Dhi'b narrated from him; both of them are trustworthy.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3179 - He said: Abd Al-Aziz bin Abi Rawad was a righteous man, and he was a Murji', and he is not in terms of reliability (thabt) like others.
3180 - Yazid bin Abi Ziyad, his hadith is not that [strong].
3181 - Qurrah bin Khalid Al-Sadusi is a trustworthy Sheikh.
3182 - Al-Nadr bin Arabi, I do not see any harm in him.
3183 - Abu Abbad Abdullah bin Sa'id Al-Maqburi, he said: He is not that [strong].
3184 - I said: Mu'tamir from Maysur? He said: I do not know Maysur.
3185 - I said: Maysur from Abu Al-Harith? He said: I think he is Muhammad bin Ziyad.
3186 - Ata, meaning Ibn Abi Marwan, is trustworthy.
3187 - Khasif is not strong in Hadith.
3188 - Ma'qil bin Ubaid Allah Al-Jazari is trustworthy.
3189 - Muhammad bin Ammar, he said: He is called Kashakish; I do not see any harm in him.
3190 - Ash'ath Al-Huddani, I do not see any harm in him.
3191 - Salih Al-Dahhan, there is no harm in him.
3192 - Habib bin Shihab, there is no harm in him.
3193 - Abdullah bin Sharik, I know of no harm in him.
3194 - Habbah Al-Urani, Salamah bin Kuhayl narrated from him, and he is counted among the companions of Ali.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3195 - I asked him about Isma'il bin Ja'far, he said: I know nothing but good. I said: Is he trustworthy? He said: Yes.
3196 - Abd Al-Aziz bin Rufay', he said: Trustworthy.
3197 - Al-Muwaqqiri, I do not think he is anything, meaning regarding trustworthiness, and I did not see him praise him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3198 - Husayn bin Qais, who is called Hanash, is abandoned in Hadith. He has one good hadith; Al-Taymi narrated it from him regarding the story of the sale or something like that which my father considered good.
3199 - My father was asked about Mansur bin Zadhan, he said: Bakh (excellent), trustworthy.
3200 - He was asked about Sayyar Abu Al-Hakam, so he said: He is Sayyar bin Abi Sayyar. Hushaym and Shu'bah narrated from him, and he is among their best. He is Sayyar—I think he said—Ibn Wardan.
3201 - I heard him say: Raqabah bin Masqalah is trustworthy.
3202 - He was asked about a man who tore his clothes [in grief], should he be offered condolences? He said: A right should not be abandoned because of a falsehood. It was said: Should his hand be taken? He said: Take it.
3203 - He was asked about Amr bin Abi Amr, so he said: There is no harm in him; Malik narrated from him.
3204 - Jami' bin Matar Al-Habati, he said: I do not see any harm in him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3205 - Abd Al-Khaliq bin Salamah, Shu'bah narrated from him, he is trustworthy, he narrated from Hammad. And Abd Al-Khaliq bin Salamah Al-Shaibani, this is what Isma'il bin Ulayyah said: Salamah. And Yazid bin Harun said: Ibn Salamah. He is trustworthy. Shu'bah narrated from both of them, and both of them are trustworthy.
3206 - I heard him say: Ya'la bin Hakim is trustworthy.
3207 - I heard my father say: Sulayman Al-Yashkuri was an old Sheikh who was killed in the strife (fitnah) of Ibn Al-Zubayr. It was said to him: Who narrated from him? He said: Qatadah, and he did not hear anything from him. And Abu Bishr narrated hadiths from him, and I do not think he heard anything from him. Then he said: They brought the scroll (Sahifah) of Sulayman Al-Yashkuri to Basra, so Qatadah memorized it. It was said to him: Did Amr bin Dinar hear from him? He said: Perhaps Amr caught him. My father said: And Al-Ja'd Abu Uthman narrated from him, so I said to him: Did he hear from him? He said: Al-Ja'd says 'Sulayman said, Sulayman said,' so I do not know if he heard from him or not.
3208 - He was asked about Wasil, the client of Abu Uyainah, so he said: Trustworthy.
3209 - He was asked about Shibak, he said: A trustworthy Sheikh.
3210 - He was asked about Abu Bakr bin Shu'ayb bin Habhab, he said: I know nothing but good.
3211 - He was asked about Yazid bin Ata, he said: There is no harm in him. Then he said: His hadith is acceptable (muqarib).
3212 - Abu Awan was a captive (Sabi).

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3213 - Ayyub bin Musa, there is no harm in him. And Isma'il bin Umayyah is more stable in Hadith than Ayyub bin Musa.
3214 - Abu Hamzah Maymun, the companion of Ibrahim, is abandoned in Hadith.
3215 - Simak bin Salamah is a righteous, trustworthy man.
3216 - Abu Hamzah Nasr bin Imran is trustworthy.
3217 - Harmalah bin Imran Al-Tujibi is trustworthy.
3218 - Mus'ab bin Thabit, he said: I see him as weak in Hadith.
3219 - Salih bin Muhammad bin Za'idah, I do not see any harm in him.
3220 - I asked him about the nephew of Al-Zuhri, so he said: He is good in Hadith (Salih Al-Hadith), if Allah wills.
3221 - I asked him about Yahya bin Isa Al-Ramli, I said: Is he trustworthy? He said: I do not know, I did not write anything from him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3222 - Yahya bin Ubaid Allah, he said: His hadiths are objectionable (manakir) hadiths; neither he nor his father is known. And Yahya bin Sa'id used to narrate from him.
3223 - And Abd Al-Hamid bin Ja'far, there is no harm in him. Then he said: Yahya bin Sa'id said: Sufyan used to weaken him.
3224 - Hashim bin Al-Barid, I do not see any harm in him.
3225 - Ali bin Hashim, there is no harm in him.
3226 - Abu Isma'il Al-Mu'addib, there is no harm in him.
3227 - Rishdin bin Kurayb, it is as if he weakened him.
3228 - Ummi Al-Sayrafi is trustworthy.
3229 - Shu'bah, the client of Ibn Abbas, I do not see any harm in him. Malik said: He did not resemble the Qurra' (religious scholars).
3230 - Makhramah bin Bukair is trustworthy, except that he did not hear anything from his father.
3231 - Ibrahim bin Uqbah is trustworthy.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3232 - Yazid bin Khusayfah, I know nothing but good.
3233 - Adi bin Thabit is trustworthy, except that he used to be a Shi'a.
3234 - Salih, the client of Al-Taw'amah, is good in Hadith.
3235 - Silm bin Abi Al-Dhayyal, how good his hadith is.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3236 - I heard my father say: Abdullah bin Muslim bin Hurmuz is nothing; he is weak in Hadith. Al-Thawri and Abdullah bin Numair narrated from him.
3237 - He was asked about Dahtham bin Qurran, he said: He was a Sheikh, there is no harm in him. Abu Bakr bin Ayyash narrated from him. Then he brought out a book from Yahya bin Abi Kathir, so his hadith was abandoned; he is abandoned in Hadith.
3238 - Umar bin Al-Walid Al-Shanni, there is no harm in him.
3239 - Abu Makin is trustworthy.
3240 - Al-Sari bin Yahya, there is no disagreement about him; he is among the trustworthy ones.
3241 - Al-Rabi' bin Habib, I do not see any harm in him.
3242 - Salih bin Muslim Al-Bakri, there is no harm in him. Then he said: Salih bin Muslim is trustworthy.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3243 - I asked him about the man who touches the pulpit of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and seeks blessing by touching it and kisses it, and does the same with the grave, or something like this, intending thereby to draw closer to Allah, the Exalted and Glorious. He said: There is no harm in that.
3244 - I asked my father about Salim Abu Al-Nadr and Sumay, so he said: Both of them are trustworthy.
3245 - He said: Hawshab bin Aqil Al-Abdi Al-Hajari, he said: A trustworthy Sheikh.
3246 - Juhayr bin Yazid, he said: He is trustworthy.
3247 - Al-Nu'man bin Rashid is unstable (mudtarib) in Hadith.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3248 - Muhammad bin Amr Al-Ansari used to be in Basra and Abadan, and Yahya bin Sa'id used to weaken him greatly.
3249 - I said to my father: Which of the companions of Ibrahim is most beloved to you? He said: Al-Hakam, then Mansur; how close they are.
3250 - I heard him say: They used to consider that the generality of Abu Ma'shar's hadith is only from Hammad.
3251 - My father said: Hilal bin Khabbab is a trustworthy Sheikh.
3252 - Sulayman bin Abi Al-Mughirah is a trustworthy Sheikh.
3253 - Muhammad bin Zaid bin Muhajir is a trustworthy Sheikh.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3254 - Yahya bin Abi Kathir, he said: He is more stable than people. He is only counted—meaning alongside Al-Zuhri and Yahya bin Sa'id. If Al-Zuhri contradicts him—and if Al-Zuhri contradicts him—then the saying is the saying of Yahya.
3255 - And he said: The hadiths of Ikrimah bin Ammar from Yahya bin Abi Kathir are weak, they are not authentic. I said to him: From Ikrimah or from Yahya? He said: No, only from Ikrimah. And he said in another place: The most precise hadith is that of Iyas bin Salamah—meaning Ikrimah.
3256 - Abdullah bin Salamah Al-Aftas, he said: People abandoned his hadith. He said: He used to sit with Azhar Al-Samman, so Azhar would narrate, and he would write on the ground 'Lie, Lie', and he was malicious of tongue.
3257 - Sa'id bin Ubaid Al-Ta'i, he said: Good in Hadith.
3258 - Abd Al-Malik bin Abi Kathir is a trustworthy Sheikh; there is no harm in him.
3259 - I asked him about Al-Mustamir bin Al-Rayyan, so he said: A trustworthy Sheikh.
3260 - My father said: I heard Abd Al-Rahman bin Mahdi say: Al-Qasim bin Al-Fadl Al-Harrani is one of our trustworthy Sheikhs.
3261 - I asked my father about Adam bin Ali and Jabalah bin Suhaym, which of them is more stable? He said: Jabalah.
3262 - Safwan bin Sulaym, he said: Trustworthy, one of the best of the righteous servants of Allah.
3263 - Ali bin Suwayd bin Manjuf, he said: I do not see any harm in him, and Yahya bin Sa'id narrated from him.
3264 - And I asked him about Amr bin Muslim, the companion of Tawus, he said: He is not that [strong].
3265 - Abu Jahdam Musa bin Salim, there is no harm in him. I said to him: Trustworthy? He said: Yes.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3266 - He was asked about Yazid bin Abdullah bin Qusait and Yahya bin Sa'id, so he said: Yahya equals Al-Zuhri.
3267 - I heard him say: Abu Bishr Ja'far bin Iyas, and he is Ja'far bin Abi Wahshiyah, there is no harm in him.
3268 - I heard my father say: Amir bin Abdullah bin Al-Zubayr is among the most trustworthy people; trustworthy.
3269 - And Isma'il bin Salim, bakh (excellent), trustworthy, trustworthy.
3270 - Dawud bin Amr, his hadith is acceptable hadith; Hushaym and Muhammad bin Yazid narrated from him.
3271 - Abd Al-Malik bin Abi Sulayman used to be counted among the Memorizers (Huffaz).
3272 - I heard my father say: The most stable of people regarding Ata are Amr bin Dinar and Ibn Jurayj.
3273 - Isma'il bin Zakariyya Al-Khalqani, his hadith is acceptable hadith.
3274 - Hammad bin Yahya Al-Abbah, he said: I do not see any harm in him.
3275 - Sa'id bin Mina is trustworthy; Ayyub narrated from him.
3276 - Sulaym bin Hayyan, he is trustworthy.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3277 - I asked my father about Shu'aib bin Abi Hamzah, how was his hearing from Al-Zuhri? I said: Was it not by presentation (Ar'd)? He said: No, his hadith resembles the hadith of dictation. I said: How is he? He said: Good (Salih). Then he said: The issue is with those who heard from Shu'aib; Shu'aib was a man strict in Hadith. I said: How was Abu Al-Yaman's hearing from him? He said: He used to say 'Shu'aib informed us.' I said: So his son's hearing? He said: He used to say 'My father told me.' I said: Baqiyyah's hearing? He said: A small amount. And Abu Qatadah and Al-Walid bin Muslim narrated something from him. Then I heard him say: When death approached Shu'aib bin Abi Hamzah, he gathered a group, [including] Baqiyyah and his son Bishr, and said: 'These are my books, narrate them from me.'
3278 - He was asked about Ayyub Al-Sakhtiyani, did he hear from Ata bin Yasar? He said: No.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3279 - I asked him if Ayyub heard from Abu Uthman Al-Nahdi, and I said to him that Khalaf Al-Bazzar says: From Hammad bin Zaid, from Ayyub, from Abu Uthman. So he said: He narrated two hadiths from him. And he said: Mu'ammal told us, from Hammad bin Zaid, from Ayyub, he said: Abu Uthman was a friend to me, but I did not memorize anything from him except two hadiths.
3280 - I asked him about Al-Nahhas bin Qahm, so he said: Al-Nahhas was a storyteller (Qass), and Yahya used to weaken his hadith.
3281 - I asked him about Uthman bin Ghiyath, so he said: There is no harm in him, and he was a Murji'. I said to him that Yahya bin Sa'id says: Bishr bin Harb is more beloved to me than Abu Harun Al-Abdi. He said: Yahya spoke the truth.
3282 - I asked him about Farqad Al-Sabakhi, so he shook his hand as if he did not approve of him.
3283 - I asked him about Mas'ud bin Ali, he said: There is no harm in him; Shu'bah narrated from him.
3284 - I asked him about Al-Awwam bin Hamzah, so he said: He has objectionable (manakir) hadiths; he narrated from Yahya.
3285 - I asked him about Al-Sari bin Yahya, so he said: Trustworthy.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3286 - I said to my father: Abdullah bin Abi Najih, from whom did his father hear among the companions of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace? He said: Perhaps from Abdullah bin Amr.
3287 - I asked him: Did Simak hear from Abdullah bin Khabbab? He said: No.
3288 - I asked him about Suhail and Al-A'mash regarding Abu Salih, so he said: Al-A'mash is more beloved to us.
3289 - I heard him say: Ibn Mahdi would not narrate anything from Isma'il from Abu Salih because of Abu Salih, but Yahya bin Sa'id used to narrate from him. And it was in my book from him, from Sufyan, from Al-Suddi, from Abu Salih, but he did not narrate it to us—meaning Abd Al-Rahman bin Mahdi.
3290 - I heard him say: Talha bin Yahya and Amr bin Uthman; Amr is more beloved to me than Talha, and Talha is good (Salih)—meaning in Hadith.
3291 - I heard him say: Abd Al-A'la bin Amir Al-Tha'labi from Ibn Al-Hanafiyyah is a book (kitab).
3292 - I asked him about Aban bin Sam'ah, so he said: Good (Salih). So I said to him: Did he not change at the end? He said: Yes.
3293 - I asked him about Uthman Al-Shahham, so he said: There is no harm in him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3294 - My father told me, he said: A man whom my father named informed us, he said: I heard Yahya bin Sa'id say: A man said to Umm Dawud Al-Wabishiyah: Did Shuraih dye his beard? She said: It was your mother who dyed. Meaning that Shuraih was beardless (kawsaj).
3295 - I said to my father: Shuraih, who appointed him to the judiciary? He said: The people of Kufa claim that Umar appointed him to the judiciary. He narrated from Muhammad bin Sirin and sat with him; and Abu Husayn sat with Shuraih; and Ibn Abi Khalid saw Shuraih; and Al-Hakam narrated from him. So I said to him: Indeed, Malik bin Anas says: Do you think Umar would appoint Shuraih as judge and leave Abdullah bin Mas'ud? My father said: This is the saying of the people of Medina.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3296 - I heard my father say: The companions of Ibn Abbas are six: Tawus, Mujahid, Sa'id bin Jubair, Ata, Jabir bin Zaid, and Ikrimah is the last of these.
3297 - I asked my father about Abu Jabir Al-Bayadi, so he said: He is Basran, I think—meaning Bishr bin Umar—he said: I asked Malik bin Anas about Abu Jabir Al-Bayadi, so he said: We accuse him of lying.
3298 - My father told me, he said: And I heard Yahya bin Sa'id say: I asked Malik bin Anas about Shu'bah, the client of Ibn Abbas, so he said: He did not resemble the Qurra' (religious scholars).
3299 - I asked him about Abu Shihab Al-Hannat, so he said: There is no harm in his hadith. So I said to him: Indeed, Yahya bin Sa'id says he is not a Hafiz. But he did not approve of that and did not accept it.
3300 - I asked him about Suhail bin Abi Salih and Muhammad bin Amr bin Alqamah, which of them is more beloved to you? He said: How close they are. Then he said: Suhail—meaning he is more beloved to me.
3301 - I asked him about Ubaid Allah bin Abi Ziyad Al-Qaddah, so he said: Good. So I said: Do you see him like Uthman bin Al-Aswad? He said: No, Uthman is higher.
3302 - I asked him about Saif bin Sulayman, so he said: Trustworthy.
3303 - I asked him about Abu Bakr, so he said: His name is Al-Zibriqan Al-Sarraj; trustworthy.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3304 - I asked him about Abdurrahman Al-Sarraj. He said: 'I know nothing but good. He is trustworthy.' Hisham Al-Dastuwa'i and Hammad bin Zaid narrated from him. 3305 - I asked him about Abdullah Al-Sarraj. He said: 'It is narrated from him.' 3306 - I asked him about Suhayl Al-Sarraj. He said: 'There was no harm in him.' 3307 - I asked him about Abdurrahman bin Ishaq Al-Madini. He said: 'There is no harm in him.' I said to him: 'Indeed, Yahya bin Sa'id says: "I asked about him in Medina and they did not praise him."' He remained silent. 3307 - b - I said to him: 'Jabalah bin Suhaym?' He said: 'Trustworthy.' 3308 - I asked him about Ismail bin Sami'. He said: 'Upright (Salih).'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3309 - I heard him say: 'Abdurrahman bin Mahdi had abandoned the Hadith of Abu Salih Badham. I had in my book [narrations] from Al-Suddi from Abu Salih, so he left them and did not narrate them to us from him. And Ibn Mahdi abandoned Jabir Al-Ju'fi towards the end.' 3310 - I asked him about Abdul-Mu'min bin Ubaydullah Al-Sadusi. He said: 'There is no harm in him.' 3311 - I heard him say: 'Thabit bin Umarah, there is no harm in him.' 3312 - I asked him about Al-Mukhtar bin Amr. He said: 'He is Basran, I see no harm in him, he narrates from Jabir bin Zaid.' 3313 - I asked him about Waqa' bin Iyas. He said: 'So-and-so.' Then he said: 'Yahya weakened him.' 3314 - I asked him about Musa Al-Saghir. He said: 'I see no harm in him.' 3315 - I asked him about Muhammad bin Yusuf. He said: 'This is an old Sheikh, called Al-A'raj. Yahya and Malik bin Anas narrated from him, and he is trustworthy.' 3316 - I asked him about Sadaqah bin Al-Muthanna. He said: 'An old Sheikh, trustworthy, upright.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3317 - I asked him about Muhammad bin Abi Yahya Al-Aslami. He said: 'Trustworthy. But his son, Ibrahim bin Muhammad bin Abi Yahya, the people abandoned his Hadith, and he was a Qadari.' 3318 - I asked him about Dirar bin Murrah. He said: 'Trustworthy, trustworthy.' 3319 - I heard my father mention from Mu'ammal, from Sufyan—meaning Al-Thawri—he said: 'Waqid, the client of Zaid bin Khalidah, and Abdul-Malik bin Abi Bashir are two Sheikhs of truthfulness.' 3320 - I asked him about Hafs bin Sulayman. He said: 'Shu'bah said: "Hafs used to borrow people's books."'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3321 - I asked him about Mukhtar bin Fulful. He said: 'I know no harm in him, I know nothing but good. Sufyan Al-Thawri, Hafs bin Ghiyath, and Ibn Idris narrated from him.' 3322 - I asked him about Muhammad bin Rashid. He said: 'Abu Al-Nadr and Abdul-Razzaq narrated from him, and he is the one called Al-Khuza'i. Waki' narrated from him, and he is trustworthy, there is no harm in him.' Abu Al-Nadr said: 'I was performing ablution for Shu'bah in Al-Rusafah when this Muhammad bin Rashid entered. Shu'bah said: "I did not write from him. He is indeed truthful (Saduq), but he is a Shi'i or a Qadari."' My father said: 'Ibn Al-Mubarak narrated from him. He is the one who narrates from Makhul and from Abdah bin Abi Lubabah. He is a Damascene who ended up in Basra.' 3323 - My father said: 'Muhammad bin Rashid narrated from Muhammad bin Ishaq, from Ibn Aqil and Sulayman bin Musa. And he narrated from Awf Al-A'rabi and Khalid Al-Hadhdha'.' 3324 - I said to him: 'How was your hearing from Hafs bin Ghiyath?' He said: 'Hearing from Hafs was difficult.' I said: 'Did he dictate to you?' He said: 'No.' I said: 'Notes (Ta'liq)?' He said: 'We only wrote notes.' Then he said: 'I heard Amr Al-Naqid asking Hafs for clarification, so Hafs said to him: "Be quiet, or else something will happen to you." And Hafs had a fine appearance.' 3325 - I asked him about Muhammad bin Qais who narrated from Ibn Umar. He said: 'Upright. I hope he is trustworthy. He is Al-Hamdani. Al-Thawri, Abu Awanah, and Sharik narrated from him.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3326 - I asked him about Muhammad bin Qais Al-Asadi. He said: 'Trustworthy, there is no doubt in him. He is more trustworthy than that companion of Ibn Umar. Ibn Uyainah narrated from him, and Waki' is the one who narrated the most from him.' 3327 - I asked my father about Muhammad bin Qais who narrated from Ali bin Rabi'ah, Muslim bin Subayh, and Muslim bin Atiyyah. He said: 'He is Al-Asadi, trustworthy.' 3328 - I asked my father about Muhammad bin Qais from whom Usamah bin Zaid, Abu Ma'shar, and Ibn Ajlan narrated. He said: 'He is the Medinan, ancient; I know nothing but good.' 3329 - I asked him about Muhammad bin Qais bin Makhramah. He said: 'Ibn Uyainah narrated from Ibn Muhaysin from Muhammad bin Qais bin Makhramah. He is from the people of Mecca, an ancient man. I hope he is trustworthy.' 3330 - I asked him about Muhammad bin Qais who narrated from Abu Musa from Ali. He said: 'This is Al-Hamdani, the companion of Ibn Umar.' 3331 - I asked him about Muhammad bin Qais who narrated from Ibrahim from Al-Aswad. He said: 'He is Al-Hamdani.' Then he said: 'I heard Hushaym narrating this Hadith of Al-Aswad, and he said: "This is a man from the people of Kufa," as if he weakened him.' And Hushaym said: 'No one narrated this Hadith except this man,' as if he weakened him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3332 - I asked him about Muhammad bin Qais who narrated from Al-Qasim bin Abdurrahman from Abu Musa. He said: 'This is Al-Asadi, trustworthy. He is the one who narrates from Ali bin Rabi'ah, Muslim bin Subayh, and Salam bin Atiyyah.' 3333 - I heard my father say: 'A man saw Ibn Mahdi walking quickly in Abadan, so he said: "O Abu Sa'id, where to?" He said: "I am rushing to Waki', he is narrating good Hadiths from Muhammad bin Qais Al-Asadi."' 3334 - I heard my father say: 'I saw Musa bin Abdullah bin Hasan, and he was a righteous man. He is a descendant of Al-Hasan bin Ali bin Abi Talib.' 3335 - I heard him say: 'Abdurrahman bin Abdullah bin Muhammad bin Abdurrahman bin Abi Bakr Al-Siddiq, I know nothing but good. He is the one called Abu Atiq.' I said: 'Who narrated from him?' He said: 'Abu Hazrah and Muhammad bin Ishaq.' 3336 - I heard him say: 'Umar bin Hamzah, his Hadiths are rejected Hadiths (Manakir). Abu Usamah and Marwan Al-Fazari narrated from him.' 3337 - Umar bin Muhammad bin Zaid bin Abdullah bin Umar is trustworthy. 3338 - Waqid bin Muhammad bin Zaid, the brother of Umar, is trustworthy. Shu'bah narrated from both of them.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3339 - I asked him about Al-Umari, Abdullah bin Umar bin Hafs bin Asim bin Umar bin Al-Khattab—and he is the brother of Ubaydullah bin Umar. He said: 'So-and-so,' and it was as if he [disliked his strength]. 3340 - I asked him about Al-Qasim bin Ma'n bin Abdurrahman bin Abdullah bin Mas'ud. He said: 'Trustworthy. Ibn Mahdi narrated from him. He was in charge of the judiciary of Kufa, and he did not take a wage for the judiciary. He was a man of intellect, poetry, and grammar, and he was mentioned with good.' 3341 - I asked him about Hisham bin Al-Ghaz bin Rabi'ah Al-Jurashi. He said: 'Upright.' 3342 - And I asked him about Hisham bin A'idh bin Nusayb. He said: 'Trustworthy, Yahya Al-Qattan narrated from him.' 3343 - Hisham bin Sa'd. He said: 'So-and-so.' Yahya did not narrate from him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3344 - I asked him about Hisham bin Abi Hisham, and he is Hisham bin Ziyad Abu Al-Miqdam. He said: 'Weak in Hadith.' 3345 - I asked him about Hisham Abu Kulayb. He said: 'Al-Thawri narrated from him, trustworthy.' 3346 - I asked him about Salim Al-Barrad. He said: 'An old Sheikh, Ata bin Al-Sa'ib and Ismail bin Abi Khalid narrated from him.' 3347 - Salim bin Ghaylan Al-Basri. He said: 'I see no harm in him.' 3348 - Salim Al-Makki. He said: 'I see no harm in him. Hajjaj bin Arta'ah narrated from him.' 3349 - Salim bin Ghaylan Al-Aftas. He said: 'Trustworthy.' 3350 - I asked him about Salim bin Sarj. He said: 'Usamah bin Zaid narrated from him.' 3351 - Salim bin Nuh. He said: 'I see no harm in him. I wrote one Hadith from him via Umar bin Amir, and he was a perfumer.' 3352 - Salim Al-Khayyat. He said: 'Trustworthy, Sufyan Al-Thawri narrated from him. He used to be in Mecca.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3353 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Adam told us, he said Sufyan—meaning Al-Thawri—told us, he said: Salim told us—and he was satisfactory—from Al-Hasan regarding the unconscious person (Mas'uq). He said: 'Wait for him for three [days].' Sufyan said: 'He is not buried.' 3354 - I asked him about Salim Al-Muradi. He said: 'The Kufans narrate from him.' 3355 - I asked him about Qais bin Kurkum.
