He said: 'Abu Ishaq narrated from him.' 3356 - I asked him about Qais Abu Sa'id Al-Raqashi. He said: 'Asim and Al-Tamimi narrated from him.' 3357 - I asked him about Qais bin Wahb. He said: 'A trustworthy Sheikh, Sharik narrated from him.' 3358 - It was said: 'The client of Khabbab?' He said: 'Abdul-Aziz bin Rufay' narrated from him.' 3359 - I asked him about Al-Mughirah bin Salman. He said: 'He is well-known.' 3360 - My father said: 'And Al-Mughirah bin Uthman bin Abd.' He said: 'Ibn Jurayj narrated from him.' 3361 - Al-Mughirah bin Ziyad. He said: 'Weak in Hadith, his Hadiths are rejected (Manakir).'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3362 - Al-Mughirah bin Habib. Bishr bin Al-Mufaddal and Ja'far bin Sulayman narrated from him, and he is the son-in-law of Malik bin Dinar. 3363 - Al-Mughirah bin Muslim Abu Salamah, and he is Al-Sarraj. He said: 'I see no harm in him. Sufyan Al-Thawri narrated from him, and he is the brother of Abdul-Aziz bin Muslim.' 3364 - I asked him about Al-Mughirah Al-Azraq. He said: 'Al-Thawri and Shu'bah narrated from him, and he is a Wasiti.' 3365 - I asked him about Al-Mughirah bin Abdurrahman Al-Hazami, a descendant of Hakim bin Hizam. He said: 'I see no harm in him. Ibn Mahdi narrated from him, and he had a book from Abu Al-Zinad.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3366 - I asked him about Al-Mughirah bin Abi Burdah. He said: 'Safwan bin Sulaym and Yahya bin Sa'id Al-Ansari narrated from him.' 3367 - I asked him about Al-Mughirah bin Abi Barzah. He said: 'Ali bin Zaid bin Jad'an narrated from him.' 3368 - Al-Mughirah bin Shubayl bin Awf. He said: 'Qais narrated from him, and Habib bin Abi Thabit narrated from him.' 3369 - Al-Mughirah bin Al-Muntashir. He said: 'Hajjaj bin Arta'ah narrated from him. I think he is the brother of Muhammad bin Al-Muntashir.' 3370 - Muslim bin Nadhir Al-Sa'di from the companions of Ali. He said: 'Ayyash Al-Amiri narrated from him.' 3371 - Muslim bin Nadhir Madhkur. He said: 'Kufan. The hunchback (Al-Ahdab) Muhammad bin Ubayd narrated from him.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3372 - Muslim bin Abi Muslim Al-Khayyat. He said: 'I see no harm in him. Ibn Uyainah and Ibn Abi Dhi'b narrated from him.' 3373 - Muslim bin Hubair. He said: 'Ya'la bin Ata narrated from him.' 3374 - Muslim bin Ayman. He said: 'It is narrated from him.' 3375 - Muslim bin Abi Imran Al-Batin. He said: 'He is nicknamed Abu Abdullah.' 3376 - Muslim bin Sa'id. He said: 'Al-Shaibani narrated from him, from Aban bin Salih from Muslim bin Sa'id.' And Abu Ya'fur said: 'From Muslim Abu Sa'id.' 3377 - Muslim Abu Al-Nadr, a Syrian. Shu'bah narrated from him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3378 - Muslim Al-Ahrad. He said: 'He is Al-A'raj.' Qatadah said: 'Muslim Al-A'raj,' and he is Abu Hassan Al-A'raj. 3379 - My father said: 'Muslim Abu Al-Alaniyah.' He said: 'Muhammad bin Sirin narrated from him. He is Basran.' 3380 - Abu Farwah Muslim bin Salim Al-Juhani. Al-Thawri, Shu'bah, Ibn Idris, and Ibn Uyainah narrated from him. He is the one who narrated from Abdurrahman bin Abi Layla. 3381 - My father said: 'And Abu Farwah Urwah bin Al-Harith Al-Hamdani, who narrated from Al-Sha'bi and Al-Qasim bin Muhammad. Ibn Mahdi did not distinguish between these two.' 3382 - Abu Hashim Al-Rummani, his name is Yahya bin Dinar. 3383 - And Abu Hashim Al-Makki, his name is Ismail bin Kathir. 3384 - And Abu Hashim Al-Mughirah bin Ziyad. All these three, Al-Thawri narrates from them. 3385 - And Al-Mughirah bin Miqsam Al-Dabbi is Abu Hisham.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3386 - Muslim bin Shu'bah. Waki' said: 'Muslim bin Baqiyyah,' Waki' made a mistake (misreading). And Rawh bin Shu'bah said... Then my father said: 'Bishr bin Al-Sari said: "La ilaha illa Allah! Here is his son right here!"' My father said: 'Rather, he is Muslim bin Shu'bah.' 3387 - Muslim bin Amr bin Abi Aqrab. He said: 'It is narrated from him.' 3388 - Muslim Al-Musabbih. He said: 'Amr bin Dinar narrated from him.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3389 - Muslim Al-Nahhat. He said: 'It is narrated from him. He is Kufan. Abu Mu'awiyah and Abdah narrated from him. I hope he is trustworthy.' Ibn Al-Shumayti claimed that he was a descendant of Muslim Al-Nahhat. 3390 - Muslim bin Sallam Al-Hanafi. 'It is narrated from him.' 3391 - Muslim bin Mishkam Abu Ubaydullah, and he is the scribe of Abu Al-Darda, a Syrian. 3392 - Iyas bin Daghfal. 'A trustworthy Sheikh.' 3393 - Iyas bin Abi Tamimah. 'A trustworthy Sheikh, the Basrans narrate from him.' 3394 - Iyas bin Abbas. 'They narrate from him; Al-A'mash narrated from him.' 3395 - Abu Maryam Al-Hanafi, his name is Iyas. Muhammad bin Sirin narrated from him. 3396 - Iyas bin Ja'far. Abu Sufyan bin Al-Ala narrated from him. 3397 - Al-Ash'ath bin Tharmalah. Al-Hakam bin Al-A'raj narrated from him. 3398 - Ash'ath bin Aslam Al-Ijli. Ibn Abi Arubah narrated from him. 3399 - Al-Ash'ath bin Abdurrahman Al-Jarmi. Hammad bin Salamah narrated from him. 3400 - Al-Ash'ath bin Abdul-Malik. 'I hope he is trustworthy.' 3401 - Al-Ash'ath bin Abdullah. Ma'mar narrated from him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3402 - Abu Al-Rabi' Al-Samman, his name is Ash'ath bin Sa'id. His Hadith is Hadith that is not that [good], it is inconsistent. Ibn Abi Arubah carried [narrations] from him. 3403 - Al-Ash'ath bin Talq Al-Nahdi. Ibn Uyainah narrated from him. 3404 - Al-Ash'ath bin Sulaym bin Aswad Al-Muharibi, trustworthy. 3405 - Al-Ash'ath bin Ishaq Al-Qummi. 'Upright'—meaning in Hadith. Jarir bin Abdul-Hamid narrated from him. 3406 - Al-Ash'ath bin Hassan Al-Khurasani. Ibn Al-Mubarak or Abu Tumailah narrated from him. 3407 - I heard him say: 'Wahb bin Kaysan is trustworthy.' 3408 - I heard him say: 'Wahb Abu Khalid. Abu Asim and Al-Thawri narrated from him, from Abu Sinan from this Wahb.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3409 - I heard him say: 'Sa'd bin Sinan, I abandoned his Hadith. He is also called Sinan bin Sa'd. His Hadith is inconsistent Hadith.' 3410 - And I heard him another time say: 'His Hadith resembles the Hadith of Al-Hasan, it does not resemble the Hadiths of Anas.' 3411 - I heard him say: 'Wahb bin Uqbah Al-Baka'i. Kufan, upright in Hadith.' 3412 - I heard him say: 'Wahb bin Uqbah Al-Ijli.' He said: 'I do not know.' 3413 - Wahb bin Jabir Al-Khaywani. He said: 'Abu Ishaq narrated from him.' 3414 - I asked him about Wahb bin Ismail Al-Asadi. He said: 'We wrote Hadiths from him.' I said to him: 'Do you hope he is upright in Hadith?' He said: 'I do not know.' I pressed him, so he said: 'He narrated rejected Hadiths (Manakir) from Waqa' bin Iyas after us.' 3415 - Wahb Al-Dhimari. Ata bin Yasar narrated from him. 3416 - Yunus bin Saif. Mu'awiyah bin Salih narrated from him. 3417 - Yunus bin Maysarah bin Halbas, Syrian. 3418 - Yunus bin Sa'd. He said: 'It is narrated from him.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3419 - I asked him about Yunus bin Abi Al-Furat. He said: 'Al-Bursani told us from him. I hope he is trustworthy, upright in Hadith.' 3420 - Yunus Al-Iskaf. He said: 'He died long ago.' I reviewed it with him, and he remained silent. 3421 - Yunus bin Yazid Al-Ayli. He said: 'People narrated from him.' And I heard him another time mention Yunus, and he said: 'Yahya bin Sa'id said: "I said to Ibn Al-Mubarak: 'Write for me a Hadith that my father named.'" Yahya thought that Ibn Al-Mubarak narrated it from Ma'mar from Al-Zuhri. Ibn Al-Mubarak said: "If you want it from Yunus—meaning I wrote it for you." Yahya said to him: "If it is from Yunus, I do not want it." So he left it.' It was as if Yahya did not like Yunus, and as if Ma'mar was more upright to him than Yunus.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3422 - He said: 'And I heard Yahya bin Sa'id, and we mentioned Uqayl bin Khalid and Ibrahim bin Sa'd in his presence. Yahya said to me: "O Abu Abdurrahman, Uqayl and Ibrahim bin Sa'd?!"' As if Yahya did not approve of them. My father said: 'And what does this benefit Yahya? These are trustworthy men; Yahya did not test them [personally].' 3423 - I asked him about Yunus Al-Jarmi. He said: 'A trustworthy Sheikh. Ibn Uyainah and Mu'tamir narrated to us from him, and Shu'bah narrated from him.' 3424 - Yunus bin Abi Ishaq. He said: 'His Hadith is inconsistent Hadith.' 3425 - I asked my father about Yunus bin Al-Harith Al-Ta'ifi, and he weakened him. 3426 - I asked him about Yunus bin Abdus-Samad bin Ma'qil. He said: 'We have written from him.' 3427 - I asked him about Ayyub bin Musa. He said: 'Trustworthy.' 3428 - And Ayyub bin Thabit. He said: 'Meccan, Ibn Mahdi narrated from him.' 3429 - Ayyub bin A'idh Al-Ta'i. Ibn Uyainah narrated from him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3430 - I heard my father say regarding the Friday prayer (Jumu'ah): 'If they are forty men, they perform the Friday prayer with the permission of the ruler. As'ad bin Zurarah led them in the Friday prayer, and it was the first Friday prayer performed in Islam, and they were forty.' 3431 - I heard him say: 'The Friday prayer is obligatory upon whoever hears the call (Adhan). And the call is heard from a Farsakh (approx. 3 miles). Sound travels at night, it is said, a Farsakh.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3432 - I heard him mention Ka'b Al-Ahbar, so he said: He is from the people of Homs; he accepted Islam during the reign of Umar, and he is from Himyar.
3433 - And Abu Idris Al-Khawlani, his name is A'idh Allah bin Abdullah.
3434 - And Abu Muslim Al-Khawlani, his name is Abdullah bin Thawb, from Himyar.
3435 - Yazid bin Shajarah is from the people of Sham; Mujahid narrated from him.
3436 - Alqamah bin Qays, his kunya is Abu Shibl, and he is the uncle of Al-Aswad bin Yazid.
3437 - Shuraih the Judge is Shuraih bin Al-Harith.
3438 - Masruq bin Abd Al-Rahman. Umar bin Abd Al-Rahman named him, and he said: Al-Ajda' is a devil.
3439 - Murrah bin Sharahil Al-Hamdani, and he is Murrah Al-Tayyib (The Good).
3440 - Al-Ahnaf bin Qays. It is said that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, mentioned him, but he did not meet him. He caught Umar and those after him.
3441 - I said to my father: Did Abu Al-Aliyah Al-Riyahi hear from Umar? He said: They say that.
3442 - Abu Al-Minhal, his name is Sayyar bin Salamah.
3443 - My father said: Yahya bin Ya'mar was a judge over Marw.
3444 - I heard him say: Al-Sha'bi is Amir bin Sharahil bin Abd bin Dhi Kibad Abu Amr.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3445 - I heard him say: Wahb bin Munabbih bin Kamil bin Sayj bin Dhi Kibad, and he was from the descendants of the Persians (Abna' Faris).
3446 - My father said: Anyone from the people of Yemen who has 'Dhu' [in their name] is a nobleman. It is said: So-and-so has Dhu, So-and-so has Dhu, and So-and-so has no Dhu.
3447 - He said: Abu Qilabah, his name is Abdullah bin Zaid Al-Jarmi.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3448 - I said to him: The Hadrami whom Al-Taymi narrated from? He said: I think he was a storyteller (Qass), and Al-Mu'tamir saw him.
3449 - I said to him: Abu Al-Mu'adhdhal? He said: His name is Atiyyah; Awf and Khalid Al-Hadhdha narrated from him.
3450 - I said to him: Maymun bin Musa Al-Mar'i? He said: I do not see any harm in him. He used to practice Tadlis (concealing sources) and would not say 'Al-Hasan told us'.
3451 - I heard him mention Muslim Al-Qurri. He said: Shu'bah narrated from him, and I do not see any harm in him.
3452 - Ibn Awn narrated from him, saying: Muslim Al-Abdi.
3453 - Salih bin Muslim, the one who narrated from Al-Sha'bi. He said: A trustworthy Sheikh. Yazid bin Zuray', Shu'bah, Khalid Al-Tahhan, and Yahya bin Sa'id narrated from him.
3454 - I heard him say: Maslamah bin Alqamah is a Sheikh weak in Hadith. He narrated objectionable (Manakir) hadiths from Dawud bin Abi Hind and attributed chains to them.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3455 - I said to him: The hadith of Ayyub from Ibn Abi Mulaykah from Ubayd bin Abi Maryam—who is this Ubayd? He said: A man from whom Ibn Abi Mulaykah narrated.
3456 - Umar bin Sa'id bin Abi Husayn. He said: Trustworthy, Meccan.
3457 - Ash'ath bin Jabir Al-Huddani. I know nothing but good.
3458 - I asked my father about Shabib bin Gharqadah. He said: Mansur narrated from him; trustworthy.
3459 - And Abdullah bin Abi Al-Safar is trustworthy.
3460 - I asked my father about Sa'id bin Jubair, did he hear from Adi bin Hatim? He said: He should have heard from him; Al-Sha'bi heard from him saying: 'Adi bin Hatim told us.'
3461 - I asked my father about Sa'id bin Zaid, the brother of Hammad bin Zaid. He said: There is no harm in him, but Yahya bin Sa'id did not find him agreeable.
3462 - I heard my father say: Ziyad Al-A'lam is trustworthy, trustworthy.
3463 - I heard my father say: Muhallab bin Abi Habibah is a trustworthy Sheikh; Yahya Al-Qattan narrated to us from him.
3464 - I heard my father say: Uthman Al-Shammam, there is no harm in him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3465 - I heard my father say: Qurrah bin Khalid Abu Khalid is a trustworthy Sheikh; Yahya bin Sa'id Al-Qattan narrated to us from him.
3466 - I heard my father mention from Affan bin Muslim, he said: Uthman Al-Batti said: Abu Ishaq told us from Mukrak bin Umarah. My father said: It is only Mudrik bin Umarah.
3467 - My father said: When Waki' came across a hadith of Aban bin Abi Ayyash, he would say 'a man', not naming him, deeming him weak.
3468 - I heard my father say: When Waki' came across a hadith of Juwaybir, he would say 'Sufyan from a man', not naming him, deeming him weak. Then he said: Waki' told us, he said: My father told me, from a man, from Sa'id bin Jubair, from Ibn Abbas. My father said: This is Muslim Al-A'war; Waki' intentionally would not name him.
3469 - I heard him say: Abu Hurrah, his name is Wasil bin Abd Al-Rahman, is trustworthy, and his brother Sa'id bin Abd Al-Rahman is also trustworthy.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3470 - Then my father said: When Waki' came across a hadith of Abdullah bin Ja'far Abu Ali Al-Madi, he would say: 'Pass over him.'
3471 - And when Waki' came across Al-Hasan bin Dinar, he would say: 'Pass.' And if he came across Al-Hasan bin Umarah, he would say: 'Pass'—meaning over him.
3472 - I heard my father say: When Waki' came across Hanzalah, he would say: 'He told us.'
3473 - Hanzalah bin Abi Sufyan, and he was trustworthy, trustworthy. And he would say: Salamah bin Nabit told us.
3474 - Abu Firas, and he was trustworthy, trustworthy.
3475 - My father told me, saying: Waki' told us, from Sufyan, from Abu Umar Al-Bazzar—and he was trustworthy, trustworthy—this is what Waki' said.
3476 - I heard my father say: Muslim Al-Batin bin Abi Imran Abu Abdullah. Ibn Awn would not say 'Al-Batin' (The Pot-bellied); he would say 'Abu Abdullah', as if he was being pious.
3477 - He said: Yahya bin Waththab heard from Alqamah.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3478 - I heard my father say: It reached me that Hammad bin Salamah said: I used to think that Thabit Al-Bunani did not memorize chains of transmission. I would say to him regarding the hadith of Ibn Abi Laila: 'How is the hadith of Anas regarding such and such?' He would say: 'No, Ibn Abi Laila told us.' And I would say to him: 'How is the hadith of so-and-so regarding such?' He would say: 'No, so-and-so told us.'
3479 - I asked him about Salamah bin Wahram. He said: Zam'ah narrated objectionable (Manakir) hadiths from him; I fear his hadith is weak hadith.
3480 - Salamah bin Abdullah bin Muhsin Al-Ansari: I do not know him.
3481 - Salamah bin Wardan: He said: Weak hadith.
3482 - Salamah bin Bakht: He said: From the people of Medina; I do not see any harm in his hadith. He narrated from Ikrimah.
3483 - I asked him about Salamah bin Alqamah. He said: Bakh (Excellent), trustworthy.
3484 - I asked him about Salamah bin Al-Muhabbiq. He said: Shu'bah and Sharik narrated from him.
3485 - Salamah bin Al-Hajjaj Abu Bishr. He said: Yahya bin Sa'id narrated to us from him.
3486 - I asked him about Salamah bin Salih Al-Ahmar. He said: He is nothing.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3487 - I heard my father mention from Abu Imran Al-Warkani, he said: I passed by Hushaym and said: 'The Companions of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, entered Ihram at Al-Mawrid.' He said: 'This is the hadith of the liars.' My father said: Salamah Al-Ahmar used to narrate it from Hammad from Ibrahim that the Companions of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, entered Ihram at Al-Mawrid.
3488 - My father said: Talha bin Amr Al-Nadri is from the Companions of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. Abu Harb bin Abi Al-Aswad narrated from him—I think so.
3489 - I heard my father say: Talha bin Yazid, the freedman of Qarazah bin Ka'b; Amr bin Murrah narrated from him.
3490 - I asked him about Talha bin Ubaid Allah bin Kurayz Al-Khuza'i, so he said: Trustworthy.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3491 - Talha Al-A'lam. He said: Al-Thawri narrated from him. I said: How is his hadith? He said: And how much hadith does he have? It is one hadith.
3492 - Talha bin Abd Al-Malik Al-Ayli. He said: Ubayd Allah bin Umar and Malik narrated from him.
3493 - Talha bin Al-Nadr. He said: Ibn Al-Mubarak and Zaid bin Al-Hubab narrated from him. He said: I do not see any harm in him.
3494 - Hudbah told us, he said: My brother Umayyah told us, from Talha bin Al-Nadr. Hudbah said: And he is my maternal uncle. He said: And I saw Ibn Sirin counting the verses in prayer.
3495 - Talha bin Yahya. He said: So-so. Yahya narrated from him.
3496 - Talha Al-Qannad. He said: Waki' narrated from him. Abu Abd Al-Rahman said: I say, it reached me that it is Talha bin Yazid Al-Qannad.
3497 - I asked him about Talha bin Amr Al-Hadrami. He said: Abandoned (Matruk).

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3498 - Talha bin Abdullah bin Awf. He said: Al-Zuhri narrated from him, and he is the nephew of Abd Al-Rahman bin Awf.
3499 - Qabisah bin Burmah Al-Asadi. He said: Wasil Al-Ahdab narrated from him; he is from the companions of Abdullah.
3500 - Talha bin Abi Sa'id. He said: Layth bin Sa'd and Ibn Al-Mubarak narrated from him; I do not see any harm in him.
3501 - He was asked about Habib—meaning Ibn Suhban—did he hear from Umar? He said: Yes.
3502 - He was asked about Habib bin Abi Al-Aliyah. He said: He narrated from Hushaym. Then he said: I do not know—meaning he has some hadiths; as if he weakened him.
3503 - Habib bin Al-Zubayr. He said: I know nothing but good.
3504 - Habib bin Abi Habib. He said: Ibn Mahdi narrated from him from Amr bin Haram.
3505 - Zam'ah bin Salih Al-Yamani. He said: Weak in Hadith. Waki' and Ibn Mahdi narrated from him.
3506 - Habib bin Al-Shahid. He said: One of the trustworthy, trusted ones.
3507 - Habib bin Salim. He said: Qatadah and Abu Bishr narrated from him.
3508 - Habib bin Sabi'ah. He said: Thabit Al-Bunani narrated from him.
3509 - I asked him about Habib, the freedman of Urwah. He said: Al-Zuhri narrated from him.
3510 - Habib bin Al-Muhajir. He said: He is narrated from.
3511 - Habib bin Shihab bin Mudlij Al-Anbari. He said: Yahya bin Sa'id narrated from him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3512 - Habib bin Abi Mulaykah. He said: His kunya is Abu Thawr Al-Huda'i; Abu Al-Bukhturi Al-Ta'i narrated from him.
3513 - Habib bin Abi Marzuq. I do not see any harm in him.
3514 - My father said: Abu Sa'id Al-Qitbani, his name is Ja'thal.
3515 - And Abu Tamim Al-Jayshani, his name is Abdullah bin Malik.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3516 - My father told me, he said: Abu Mu'awiyah told us, he said: Abdullah bin Abd Al-Rahman, a Sheikh who was in Bajilah, told us from Ibrahim, he said: The one performing Tayammum should only pray one prayer.
3517 - My father said: They claimed it is Al-Hasan bin Umarah. My father said: Al-Hasan bin Umarah lived in Bajilah; I see Abu Mu'awiyah changed his name.
3518 - I heard him say: Ya'qub bin Al-Walid Al-Madini Abu Yusuf, I wrote from him then we tore up his hadith a long time ago. He was among the liars and used to fabricate Hadith. He narrated from Abu Hazim, Hisham bin Urwah, and Ibn Abi Dhi'b. I heard my father say more than once: He was a liar who fabricated Hadith.
3519 - My father said: Ma'ruf bin Kharrabudh, I do not know how his hadith is.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3520 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il bin Ulayyah told us at Hushaym's door, from Ayyub, he said: A man would narrate a hadith to Muhammad, and he would say: Indeed, by Allah, I do not accuse you, nor do I accuse that one, but I accuse the one between you two.
3521 - My father said: I prayed behind Ibrahim bin Sa'd more than once, and he used to perform Taslim once. He said: And Ibrahim bin Sa'd saw me one day while I was writing on tablets, so he said: Are you writing?
3522 - My father told me, he said: I heard Ibrahim bin Sa'd narrating from Ibn Shihab, he said: Al-Ma'un in the dialect of Quraish is wealth. His son Sa'd said to him: Did you narrate from Sa'id—meaning Ibn Al-Musayyib? He refused and said: No. As if it was from the opinion of Ibn Shihab. My father said: And that is the correct view.
3523 - My father said: I was present with Ibrahim bin Sa'd when a man came to him from the city of Abu Ja'far, a Sheikh, and said: O Abu Ishaq, narrate to me. He said: How can I narrate to you while this [heat/trouble] is distressing me? My father said: I felt shy and got up.
3524 - My father said: Abdullah bin Shaddad bin Al-Had did not hear anything from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace.
3525 - My father told me, he said: Yazid bin Harun told us, from Abd Al-Malik bin Abi Sulayman, from Anas bin Sirin, he said: We entered upon Zaid bin Thabit.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3526 - My father said: Muhammad bin Sirin heard from Abu Hurairah, Ibn Umar, and Anas, but he did not hear anything from Ibn Abbas; for all of it, he says: 'I was informed from Ibn Abbas.' And he heard from Imran bin Husain. In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. Abdullah bin Ahmad informed us by license, he said:
3527 - My father told me, he said: Sayyar told us, he said: Ja'far told us, he said: Abbad bin Amr Al-Abdi told us, he said: I asked Al-Hasan, I said: O Abu Sa'id, what are the Hoor al-Ayn? He said: They are these old women of yours, the toothless ones; Allah, Blessed and Exalted, will recreate them into another creation. Buraid bin Abi Maryam Al-Saluli said to Al-Hasan: Who told you this hadith, O Abu Sa'id? So he rolled up the sleeve of his shirt and said: So-and-so bin So-and-so the Muhajir told me, and So-and-so bin So-and-so the Ansari told me, until he counted five from the Muhajirin and four from the Ansar.
3528 - My father said: Abu Al-Jald is Jaylan bin Farwah.
3529 - I heard my father say: Ziyad bin Abi Muslim—and he says Ibn Muslim—and he is Abu Umar Al-Qurra'; a righteous, trustworthy man.
3530 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Ziyad bin Abi Muslim Abu Umar told us, and he was trusted.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3531 - My father said: Abu Usamah said: Two righteous men from the people of Badr prayed against it—meaning the people of Kufa—Ali and Sa'd, may Allah be pleased with them both.
3532 - My father said: The people of Kufa prefer Ali over Uthman, except for two men: Talha bin Musarrif and Abdullah bin Idris. I said to him: Then Zubaid? He said: No, he used to love Ali—meaning prefer Ali over Uthman.
3533 - I heard him mention from Al-Ma'iti from Yahya bin Sa'id, he said: We used to accuse him of lying—meaning Ibrahim bin Abi Yahya. My father said: He was a Qadari, a Jahmi; every affliction was in Ibrahim bin Abi Yahya.
3534 - My father said: And Sahbal, his name is Abdullah bin Muhammad bin Abi Yahya, the brother of Ibrahim; there is no harm in him. And his father, Muhammad bin Abi Yahya, Yahya bin Sa'id narrated to us about twenty hadiths from him and from Anis bin Abi Yahya.
3535 - My father said: Abu Al-Mughirah Al-Khassaf; Isra'il called him Habib bin Al-Mughirah. Sharik said: Shu'bah guided us to him—meaning Abu Al-Mughirah Al-Khassaf.
3536 - My father said: Dithar bin Al-Harith Al-Nahdi Al-Qattan; Sharik and Sufyan narrated from him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3537 - My father told me, he said: Hushaym bin Abi Sasan told us, he said: Ummi bin Rabi'ah told me, and he is Ummi Al-Sayrafi.
3538 - My father said: Ummi is a trustworthy Sheikh.
3539 - My father said: Uthman bin Umair Abu Al-Yaqzan is Uthman bin Qays, and he is weak in Hadith.
3540 - I heard my father say: Al-Mu'alla bin Hilal Al-Tahhan Al-Kufi. My father said: A liar. Ibn Uyainah said: Even if Al-Mu'alla narrates this hadith from Ibn Abi Najih whom we saw, how deserving he is that his neck be struck.
3541 - I heard my father say: Abbad bin Abbad Al-Muhallabi said: I and Hammad bin Zaid came to Shu'bah and spoke to him regarding Aban bin Abi Ayyash. They said to him: O Abu Bistam, withhold from him. He met them after that, he said: So he said: I do not see that silence about him is permissible for me.
3542 - My father told me, he said: I heard Affan say: Jarir bin Hazim and Hammad bin Zaid met. Jarir bin Hazim began saying: 'I heard Muhammad, I heard Shuraih.' So Hammad began saying: 'O Abu Al-Nadr, from Muhammad, from Shuraih; from Muhammad, from Shuraih.'
3543 - My father said: I heard him say: Hammad bin Zaid was a freedman (Mawla) of Jarir bin Hazim from below.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3544 - My father told me, he said: Affan said: The first one to ruin Aban bin Abi Ayyash was Abu Awanah; he collected the hadith of Al-Hasan, most of it from Basra, and brought it to Aban. He said: So he read it to him.
3545 - My father said: Umar bin Hassan is Kufan; Abu Mu'awiyah narrated to us from him. I do not see any harm in him.
3546 - I heard him say: Sulayman bin Al-Mughirah is more stable in [narrating from] Hamid bin Hilal than Ayyub.
3547 - I heard him mention from Abd Al-Rahman bin Mahdi, he said: A man said to Sulayman bin Al-Mughirah: How did you hear these long hadiths from Hamid bin Hilal? He said: I waded through the mud for them. And once he said: I used to wade through the mud for them.
3548 - I heard my father say: Shu'bah bought a donkey for Sulayman bin Al-Mughirah so he could ride it.
3549 - My father said: Shu'bah was at the funeral of Imran bin Hudair, saying: May Allah have mercy on you; as far as I knew, you were truthful.
3550 - My father said: Al-Wadin bin Ata, there is no harm in him; he used to believe in Al-Qadar (Free Will).

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3551 - And Ibrahim bin Tahman is trustworthy in Hadith, and he is much stronger in hadith than Abu Ja'far Al-Razi; Ibn Mahdi narrated to us from him.
3552 - He said: Ibn Abi Najih used to believe in Al-Qadar; they corrupted him at the end. He used to sit with Amr bin Ubaid, so he corrupted him. And he was a Qadari. And Abu Mu'awiyah was a Murji'.
3553 - I heard him say: Thawr bin Zaid Al-Dili is Medinan; Malik narrated from him; he is good (Salih) in Hadith. And Thawr bin Yazid Al-Kala'i, Yahya bin Sa'id and Al-Walid bin Muslim narrated to us from him, and there is no harm in him. He used to believe in Al-Qadar; he was from the people of Homs, and they expelled him and banished him from there because he used to believe in Al-Qadar.
3554 - I heard him say: Abdullah bin Shubrumah is Abu Shubrumah.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3555 - I heard him say: Isma'il bin Ulayyah used to narrate to us from Ayyub, from Amr bin Dinar, from Jabir bin Zaid. He said: 'I think from Ibn Abbas.' Then he left the doubt later and did not say 'I think'. He said: 'From Ibn Abbas.' Then he narrated it without doubting in it, regarding the woman whose husband dies. He said: She observes the waiting period from the day he dies. My father said: So I said to Isma'il: O Abu Bishr, indeed Al-Thaqafi—Abd Al-Wahhab—says from Ayyub, from Amr bin Dinar, from a man, from Jabir bin Zaid. Isma'il said: 'Ayyub, from Amr, from a man, from Jabir bin Zaid?' And Isma'il moved his hand right and left and did not pay attention to it. My father said: And Hammad narrated it from Ayyub, from Ibn Abbas as Mursal. And Ma'mar said: From Ayyub, from Ikrimah, from Ibn Abbas—meaning this hadith.
3556 - My father told me, he said: Muhammad bin Abi Adi told us, he said: Khalid Al-Hadhdha mentioned that Ammar urinated standing on gravel.
3557 - I heard my father say: Shu'bah was a nation unto himself in this field—meaning in [knowledge of] the men (narrators), his insight into Hadith, his verification, and his scrutiny of the men.
3558 - My father said: Abu Mu'awiyah did not narrate from Aban bin Taghlib except one hadith: the hadith of Abdullah 'The servants, the in-laws' (Al-Hafadah Al-Akhtan).

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3559 - And my father said: Amr bin Al-Hajjaj—and some of them said Ibn Abi Al-Hajjaj—Ibn Ulayyah, Yahya, and Ibn Sawa' narrated to us from him, and I see him as a trustworthy Sheikh.
3560 - I heard him say: Ruh bin Al-Qasim; Ibn Ulayyah and Ibn Sawa' narrated to us from him, and he is trustworthy, but the younger ones narrated from him.
3561 - I heard him say: Isma'il bin Ulayyah said: Our companions used to dislike the Tafsir (exegesis) of Qatadah.
3562 - I heard my father say: Ibn Awn remained after Ayyub for about twenty years.
3563 - My father said: Yahya bin Sa'id Al-Qattan was knowledgeable in inheritance laws. I said to him: Was he a jurist (Faqih)? He said: Good in jurisprudence.
3564 - My father told me, he said: Abu Qatan told us, from Shu'bah, from Al-Awwam bin Murajim. Yahya bin Ma'in said to him: It is only Ibn Muzahim. Abu Qatan said: Upon him and upon him—or he said his clothes—are the charity for the poor if it is not Ibn Murajim. So Yahya said: Waki' narrated it to us and said: 'Ibn Muzahim.' So I said: Waki' narrated it to us and said: 'Ibn Murajim.' So Yahya fell silent. My father said: Yahya narrated to us from Shu'bah, from Al-Awwam bin Murajim, and that is the correct one. My father told me, he said: Muhammad bin Ja'far told us, he said: Shu'bah told us, from Al-Awwam Al-Qaysi. My father said: I think he fled from it, not saying Murajim nor Muzahim.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3565 - My father said: We were with Sulayman bin Harb and we mentioned wiping over the leather socks (Khuffayn). We mentioned Hadiths, and Sulayman bin Harb started saying: 'This is not probable,' and 'I do not know about this.' We said: 'What do you have?' He said: 'Khalid, from Abu Uthman, from Umar, he said: He wipes until he returns to his bed.' We said: 'Khalid did not hear anything from Abu Uthman; some people say that.' And he narrates from the Prophet, peace be upon him, that he set a time limit. And Khalid says 'from Abu Uthman'—as if he [Sulayman] did not accept that from him. 3566 - My father told me, he said Ahmad bin Abdul-Malik Al-Harrani told us, he said Zuhair told us, he said Abu Ishaq told us, he said: I heard Al-Sha'bi saying: 'Ismail bin Abi Khalid drinks knowledge like a drink.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3567 - My father said: I used to ask Yahya bin Sa'id about the Hadiths of Ismail bin Abi Khalid from Amir, from Shuraih and others. In Ismail's book, it said: 'Amir told us from Shuraih' and 'Amir told us from Shuraih.' But Yahya kept saying: 'Ismail from Amir.' I said: 'In my book it is: Amir told us, Amir told us.' Yahya said to me: 'They are authentic (Sahih). If there was anything [wrong], I would have informed you'—meaning, regarding what Ismail did not hear from Amir. 3568 - My father said: I heard Ismail bin Ulayyah more than once say: 'Yahya Abu Hammam told me'—meaning Abu Hammam bin Yahya. 3569 - I heard my father say: Abu Dawud Al-Nakha'i, his name is Sulayman bin Amr, was a liar. Sharik was asked about Abdullah from him, so he said: 'That is the liar of the Nakha'.' 3570 - And Abu Dawud once said: 'Yazid bin Abi Habib told us.' A man said to him: 'You heard it from him?' He said: 'O stupid one, do you think I said it without having prepared an answer for it? I met him at the door and the gates.' 3571 - My father said: Yazid bin Abi Habib was in Egypt. 3572 - My father told me, he said Hasan bin Ali bin Asim told us, he said Al-Awza'i informed us from Wasil from Abu Qilabah: He saw no harm in a man borrowing a loaf of bread.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3573 - My father said: Hasan bin Ali bin Asim was the wisest of his household, wiser than his brother and his father. He came once one day while we were at the door of Hushaym, so I stood up to him and asked him. 3574 - My father told me, he said Rizq bin Rizq, the nephew of Ukaydir of Dumah, told us, he said: Sulayman bin Ali prayed over the funeral of Yunus bin Ubayd and said Takbir over it four times. 3575 - He said: And I heard Al-Jurayri say: 'Whoever recites {Say, He is Allah, One} eighteen times, a house will be built for him in Paradise.' 3576 - My father told me, he said Ahmad bin Abdul-Malik told us, he said Zuhair told us, he said Abu Ishaq told us, he said: 'I do not think anyone asked about the sermon (Khutbah) of the prayer more than I asked. I asked Abu Al-Ahwas, Rabi' bin Khuthaym—I think—Masruq, and Ubaydah—I think.' He said: 'And I came to Al-Aswad bin Yazid and informed him of what Abu Al-Ahwas added to the sermon of the prayer...' and he mentioned the Hadith. 3577 - My father said: Ghassan bin Mudar was blind. 3578 - Muhammad bin Sawa' was blind. 3579 - I heard my father say: Mu'adh bin Mu'adh said: 'Abbad bin Mansur told us'—despite the Qadari (belief) in him. 3580 - I heard my father say: Abu Rawq did not hear anything from Masruq, and he denied it with strong denial.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3581 - My father said: I heard Abdurrahman bin Mahdi say to Yahya bin Ma'in: 'Your eyes have never seen the likes of him'—meaning Yahya bin Sa'id Al-Qattan. And Yahya bin Ma'in said in the presence of Abdurrahman bin Mahdi: 'Al-Suddi and Ibrahim bin Muhajir are weak.' So Ibn Mahdi became very angry and said: 'Glory be to Allah! What is this?' And he rejected what Yahya said. 3582 - My father said: It reached me about Abdurrahman that he said: 'Everyone whose Hadith I abandoned...' My father said: 'It reached me that Abdurrahman used to pray for him.' 3583 - I asked my father about Yahya bin Bishr who narrated from Ikrimah. He said: Ibn Al-Mubarak said: 'If Yahya bin Bishr narrates to you from a person, do not mind if you do not hear it from him.' I said: 'Who informed you of this from Ibn Al-Mubarak?' He said: 'Yahya bin Adam informed me.' 3584 - I asked my father about Abu Al-Mu'tamir Al-Hiri, Yazid bin Tahman. He said: 'There is no harm in his Hadith. Waki', Abdurrahman, and the people narrated from him.' 3585 - I heard him say: We were with Hafs bin Ghiyath Al-Nakha'i, and Abu Badr Shuja' bin Al-Walid was mentioned in his presence. I said to Hafs: 'He narrates from Mughirah and Ata bin Al-Sa'ib.' Hafs said to me: 'What does he narrate from Mughirah?' I said: 'He narrates from Mughirah such-and-such.' Hafs remained silent and did not say anything. Next to Hafs was a man from Kindah who used to sit with Hafs; he started attacking Abu Badr and speaking against him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3586 - My father told me, he said Mu'ammal bin Ismail told us, he said I heard Hammad bin Salamah say—and he mentioned Abu Hanifa—he said: 'Abu Hanifa received the traditions (Athar) and Sunnahs and repelled them with his opinion.' 3587 - My father told me, he said Mu'ammal told us, he said I heard Sufyan Al-Thawri say: 'Abu Hanifa was asked to repent twice.' 3588 - My father told me, he said I heard Sufyan bin Uyainah say: 'Abu Hanifa was asked to repent twice.' Abu Zaid—meaning Hammad bin Dalil, a man from the companions of Sufyan—said to Sufyan: 'For what?' Sufyan said: 'He spoke some words, so his companions saw fit to ask him to repent, and he repented.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3589 - Al-Hasan bin Abdul-Aziz Al-Jarawi Al-Judhami told me, he said I heard Abu Hafs Amr bin Abi Salamah Al-Tinnisi say: I heard Al-Awza'i say: 'No newborn was born in Islam more harmful to Islam than Abu Hanifa and Abu Muslim, the companion of...' 3590 - My father told me, he said Mu'ammal bin Ismail told us, he said Sufyan Al-Thawri told us, he said Abbad bin Kathir told me, he said: Amr bin Ubayd said to me: 'Ask Abu Hanifa about a man who says: "I know that the Kaaba is true and that it is the House of Allah, but I do not know if it is the one in Mecca or the one in Khurasan." Is he a believer?' He said: 'A believer.' He said to me: 'Ask him about a man who says: "I know that Muhammad, peace be upon him, is true and that he is the Messenger of Allah, but I do not know if he is the one who was in Medina or another Muhammad." Is he a believer?' He said: 'A believer.' 3591 - My father said: They asked him to repent, I think regarding this verse: {Exalted is your Lord, the Lord of might, above what they describe}, he said: 'It is created.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3592 - Abu Ma'mar told me, from Al-Walid bin Muslim, he said: Malik bin Anas said to me: 'Is Abu Hanifa mentioned in your land?' I said yes. He said: 'It is not fitting for your land to be inhabited.' 3593 - Mansur bin Abi Muzahim told us, he said I heard Sharik say: 'For there to be a wine seller in every quarter of Kufa is better than for there to be someone in it who speaks by the opinion of Abu Hanifa.' 3594 - Mansur said: And I heard Malik bin Anas, and Abu Hanifa was mentioned, so he said: 'He plotted against the religion.' 3595 - My father told me, he said Mu'ammal told us, he said Hammad bin Zaid told us, he said Muhammad bin Dhakwan told us—my father said: This is the maternal uncle of Hammad bin Zaid's children—he said: It was mentioned in the presence of Hammad bin Abi Sulayman that the Prophet, peace be upon him, freed two [slaves] and kept four as slaves, casting lots between them. Hammad said: 'This is the opinion of the Sheikh'—meaning Satan. Muhammad said: I said to him: 'The pen is lifted from three: from the insane person until he recovers...' He said: 'What do you mean by this?' He said: I said: 'You, what did you mean by that?' My father said: Hammad used to be afflicted by a swoon (Ghashyah), meaning epilepsy (Mawtah).

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3596 - My father told me, he said Mu'ammal told us, he said: Ibn Jurayj died in the year one hundred and fifty; he died before the Hajj came. He said: And Mu'ammal had heard from Ibn Jurayj. 3597 - My father told me, he said Mu'ammal told us, he said Hammad bin Zaid told us, he said Ayyub told us, he said I heard Al-Hasan say: 'I witnessed them on the day they threw pebbles at each other regarding the matter of Uthman, until I began to look and could not see the surface of the sky due to the dust. Then I heard the speech of a woman from one of the chambers. It was said to me: This is the Mother of the Believers. I heard her say: "Indeed your Prophet, peace be upon him, has disassociated himself from whoever divides his religion and becomes factions."' Abdullah said: Mu'ammal said 'Aisha,' but the correct one is Umm Salamah. 3598 - My father told me, he said Mu'ammal told us, he said Wuhaib bin Khalid Abu Bakr told us, he said: We sat with Ibn Tawus. He said: 'Where are you from?' We said: 'From the people of Basra.' He said: 'Perhaps you are from these Qadariyyah?' We said: 'We are the companions of Ayyub.' He said: 'May Allah have mercy on Ayyub, he was not a Qadari.' I said: 'What did your father use to say regarding Al-Qadar (predestination)?' He said: 'My father used to say: It is a matter where whoever speaks about it is asked about it, and whoever does not speak about it is not asked about it. What do you want with it?' 3599 - I heard my father say: Mutarrif bin Tarif did not hear anything from Al-Dahhak bin Muzahim; he inserted Khalid Al-Sijistani and Abu Ya'fur between himself and Al-Dahhak. I said to him: 'Abu Ya'fur Al-Abdi?' He said yes.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3600 - I heard my father say: Hajjaj bin Muhammad said to me: 'I wrote from Sharik around fifty Hadiths from Salim before the judiciary'—meaning before he took charge of the judiciary. 3601 - My father said: Muhammad bin Al-Fadl bin Atiyyah is nothing; his Hadith is the Hadith of the people of lies. 3602 - I heard my father say: People abandoned the Hadith of Ubaydah Al-Dabbi, and he is Ubaydah bin Mu'attib. He said: A man said to this Ubaydah: 'Is this the opinion of Ibrahim?' He said: 'No, rather I made an analogy based on his opinion.' 3603 - My father said: Uthman bin Umayr Abu Al-Yaqzan is Uthman bin Qais, and it is said Ibn Umayr. 3604 - I heard him say: Damrah bin Rabi'ah is a righteous, trustworthy man; there is no harm in him. His Hadith is the Hadith of the people of truth.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3605 - I heard him say: We wrote from Ghassan bin Ubayd Al-Mawsili. He came to us here and had heard from Sufyan, so I wrote some Hadiths from it. But I tore up his Hadith a while ago. He had only heard a small amount from Sufyan, but he (falsely) claimed to have heard the 'Jami' from Sufyan. 3606 - My father dictated to me from his books regarding Abu Hazim. He said: Abu Hazim Al-Ashja'i, his name is Salman, the client of Azzah, Kufan. Al-A'mash, Mansur, Sayyar, Yazid bin Kaysan, Talhah bin Musarrif, and Bashir Abu Ismail narrated from him. And Abu Hazim whose name is Nabtal. Ismail bin Abi Khalid narrated from him. I do not know anyone who narrated from him other than Ibn Abi Khalid. And Abu Hazim who speaks on asceticism (Zuhd) is Al-Madini Al-A'raj (the lame); his name is Salamah bin Dinar, he is called Al-Afzar, the client of Al-Aswad bin Sufyan. And Abu Hazim Al-Tammar, also Medinan. Muhammad bin Ibrahim narrated from him. I do not know what his name is, and I do not think anyone narrated from him other than Muhammad bin Ibrahim. And Abu Hazim Maysarah, Al-Thawri narrated from him. All of them are trustworthy—meaning those with the Kunyah Abu Hazim. 3607 - I heard him say: I gave Zuhair bin Harb the Kunyah Abu Khaythamah. We were with Abu Mu'awiyah, and Abu Khaythamah asked him to dictate to us. His Kunyah was Abu Muhammad or Abu Ahmad. Abu Mu'awiyah said to him: 'You have become famous (Mushahhar) today, O Abu Khaythamah.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3608 - I heard him say: Sakhr bin Juwayriyah is a trustworthy Sheikh. Ibn Mahdi and Yazid bin Harun narrated to us from him. Abdurrahman bin Mahdi said: 'When we gave Sakhr bin Juwayriyah [Hadith] to read to us, it did not match what he was reading to us, until we took the book of Gundar. So he would read to us based on what was in Gundar's book'—meaning that it was a correct book. 3609 - My father said: Only those who heard from Shu'bah heard from Sakhr. My father said: And Juwayriyah bin Asma', there is no [harm] in him—trustworthy. 3610 - My father said: I saw Sunayd with Hajjaj bin Muhammad while he was hearing the book 'Al-Jami' from him—meaning Ibn Jurayj's. In the book, it said: 'Ibn Jurayj said: I was informed from Yahya bin Sa'id,' and 'I was informed from Al-Zuhri,' and 'I was informed from Safwan bin Sulaym.' But Sunayd started saying to Hajjaj: 'Say: O Abu Muhammad, Ibn Jurayj from Al-Zuhri, and Ibn Jurayj from Yahya bin Sa'id, and Ibn Jurayj from Safwan bin Sulaym.' So he would say it like that to him. My father did not praise what he saw him doing with Hajjaj and blamed him for that. My father said: And some of these Hadiths that Ibn Jurayj used to send (Mursal) are fabricated Hadiths. Ibn Jurayj did not care from where he took it—meaning his saying 'I was informed' and 'It was narrated from So-and-so.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3611 - My father told me, he said Waki' told us, he said Sufyan told us, from Maysarah Abu Hazim, from Raytah Al-Hanafiyyah: That Aisha led women in the obligatory prayer, standing in the middle among them. 3612 - My father told me, he said I heard Abdurrahman bin Mahdi narrating to Yahya bin Sa'id, from Hammad bin Salamah, from Hajjaj, from Al-Rukin bin Al-Rabi', from Hanzalah bin Nu'aim: That Al-Mughirah set a time limit for the impotent man (al-'Innin) from the day she took the case to him. Yahya bin Sa'id said: 'Sufyan and Shu'bah narrated it but did not say it like this'—as if Yahya was criticizing Hajjaj. 3613 - I heard my father say: Perhaps Yahya bin Sa'id would narrate, and I would say: 'Abdurrahman said such-and-such' and 'Abdurrahman said such-and-such.' I would see the joy in his face—meaning Yahya. 3614 - My father said: I heard Ibn Uyainah say: Sufyan Al-Thawri said to me: 'Will you not speak to Mis'ar?'—meaning regarding Irja', i.e., regarding the Hilaliyyah (a group/view). 3615 - I heard my father say: I heard Yahya bin Sa'id say: 'I have not met anyone from our companions, nor has it reached me, except with the exception (Istithna')' [saying Insha'Allah regarding Faith].

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3616 - My father said: I heard Abu Kamil Muzaffar bin Mudrik since about forty years ago—he said: He had dignity and presence and was one of the people of Hadith—saying: 'The most established of people regarding Ibrahim is Mansur.' Abu Kamil said: 'No man has come to us here from the direction of Sham with more sound Hadith than Layth bin Sa'd.' And Abu Ma'shar was a man who did not preserve the chain of transmission precisely. Abu Kamil was among the people of Hadith. When Sharik arrived, they said: 'We are not satisfied with anyone asking him except Abu Kamil.' He was counted among the people of virtue in those days. Ibn Mahdi used to say to me: 'What does Abu Kamil say about a Hadith from the Hadith of Ibrahim bin Sa'd?' 3617 - I asked my father: 'Which of the companions of Ibrahim are most beloved to you?' He said: 'Al-Hakam and Mansur.' 3618 - My father told me, he said Abu Bakr bin Ayyash told us, he said Habib bin Abi Thabit told us: That Abu Bakr freed Bilal. When the Prophet, peace be upon him, passed away, he disliked staying, so Abu Bakr said: 'Go wherever you wish, O Bilal.' So he went out to Sham and died in Sham. 3619 - My father told me, he said Abu Bakr told us, he said Abu Husayn told us, he said: 'I was circumambulating the House (Kaaba) while the Hijr (Hateem) was split like this.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3620 - My father told me, he said Abu Bakr told us, he said Asim bin Abi Al-Najud told us, from Al-Harith bin Hassan Al-Bakri, he said: We arrived in Medina, and behold, the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, was on the pulpit, and Bilal was standing before him, wearing a sword, in front of the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him. And there were banners of the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him. I asked: 'What are these banners?' They said: 'Amr bin Al-As has arrived from a campaign.' 3621 - My father told me, he said Abu Bakr bin Ayyash told us in Kufa, he said Asim said: I asked Abu Amr Al-Shaybani about something, and it was as if he disliked it. He said: So he said to me: 'Stand up.' Whenever I came afterward, he would look at me and say: 'Do you see that one?' 3622 - My father told me, he said Abu Bakr told us in Kufa, from Asim, he said: Abu Wa'il, when he mentioned Umar, would say: 'He was cautious.' And when he mentioned Abu Musa, he would say: 'I will not mention him.' 3623 - My father told me, he said Abu Bakr told us, from Mughirah, he said: Ibrahim said: He did not leave behind him anyone like him—meaning Sa'id bin Jubayr.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3624 - My father told me, he said Abu Bakr told us, he said I heard Mughirah say: A man asked Abu Salamah. He said: 'You do not need to ask'—meaning other than himself. 3625 - My father told me, he said Abu Bakr told us, from a Sheikh, he said: Uthman bin Affan sent Ibn Zahr to us as a tax collector (Musaddiq). 3626 - My father told me, he said Abu Bakr bin Ayyash told us, he said: I heard Abu Yahya—meaning Al-Qattat—seventy years ago saying: Hajar bin Adi said: 'Convey from us to Mu'awiyah that we, by Allah, did not fall into trial (Fitnah), nor did a night pass us but that we prayed in it.' 3627 - Abdullah bin Umar bin Muhammad bin Aban bin Salih bin Umayr Abu Abdurrahman Al-Qurashi told me, he said I heard Husayn Al-Ju'fi say: We entered upon Al-A'mash, I and Za'idah, on the day he died. The house was full of men. A Sheikh entered and said: 'Glory be to Allah! You see the man and the state he is in, and there is no one among you to prompt him (with the Shahada)?' Al-A'mash did like this—and he pointed with his index finger and moved his lips. 3628 - Abdullah bin Umar told me, he said Hafs bin Ghiyath told us, from Al-A'mash, he said: Al-Sha'bi used to say to his companions: 'I forbade you from the boys (students/servants) of Ibrahim'—meaning Ibrahim Al-Nakha'i.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3629 - Abdullah bin Umar told me, he said I heard Hafs bin Ghiyath say: I heard Hisham bin Urwah, from Urwah, he said: 'They took me out with them on the Day of the Camel, but I was considered too young on the way, so I was returned.' Hafs said: 'Happiness overtook him.' 3630 - Abdullah bin Umar told me, he said Husayn bin Ali told us, he said I heard Dhawwad bin Ulbah say: 'I have not seen an Arab nor a non-Arab better than Mutarrif bin Tarif.' 3631 - I asked Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaibah about Abdullah bin Umar Mushkadanah. He said: 'He used to listen and seek [knowledge]. I used to see him seeking Hadith.' I said to him: 'They say that these are the books of Al-Ala bin Usaym.' He said: 'No,' and he denied it strongly, and said: 'I saw him listening and seeking.' End of the license. In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. 3632 - Abu Abdurrahman Abdullah bin Ahmad told us, he said my father told me, he said Abu Dawud told us, he said Imran told us, from Qatadah, from Zurarah, he said: Imran bin Husayn said to a man: 'From whom are you?' He said: 'From Thaqif.' He said: 'Indeed Thaqif is from Iyad, and Iyad is from Thamud.' He said: It was as if the man was distressed by it. Imran said: 'Let it not distress you, for only the best of them survived.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3633 - I heard my father say: Ibrahim bin Nashit is trustworthy, trustworthy. Ibn Al-Mubarak narrated from him. I said to my father: 'Do you memorize this from the Hadith of Abu Asim, from Sufyan, from Abdullah bin Abi Bakr, from Sa'id bin Al-Musayyab, from Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, used to say: "Shall I not guide you to something that expiates sins and increases good deeds?" They said: "Yes, O Messenger of Allah." He said: "Performing Wudu thoroughly during hardships."' My father said: 'This is false'—meaning from the Hadith of Abdullah bin Abi Bakr. My father said: 'Rather, it is the Hadith of Ibn Aqil,' and he rejected it with strong denial and said: 'It is nothing'—meaning the Hadith of Abdullah bin Abi Bakr. He said: 'This is the Hadith of Ibn Aqil.' 3634 - I mentioned to my father the Hadith of Abdus-Samad, from his father Abdul-Warith, from his father, from Al-Hasan bin Dhakwan, from Habib bin Abi Thabit, from Sa'id bin Jubayr, from Ibn Abbas, he said: 'The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, forbade a man to walk in one sandal or one leather sock.' My father said: 'This is a rejected (Munkar) Hadith.' It was said to him: 'Others besides Abdus-Samad narrate it from Abdul-Warith, from Al-Hasan, from Amr bin Khalid, from Habib.' 3635 - My father said: 'We see that Amr bin Khalid's Hadith is worth nothing; he is nothing.' 3636 - I heard my father say: Abdullah bin Abi Bakr bin Amr bin Hazm is satisfying (Shifa').

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3637 - I asked my father about Al-Musayyab bin Sharik. I said: 'What did you reject from him?' He said: 'He narrated from Al-A'mash, he said: The people of the prisons sent to Ibrahim asking him how to pray on Friday. He (my father) rejected this Hadith from him.' 3638 - My father said: 'And Ismail bin Zakariyya has narrated this Hadith from Al-A'mash.' I said to my father: 'Do you think Al-Musayyab bin Sharik used to lie?' He said: 'Allah forbid! But he used to make mistakes.' My father said: 'I heard him making a good supplication, and in his supplication was some of what the Jahmiyyah reject. I heard him say: "Light, for which Your Face has shone."' 3639 - Muhammad bin Al-Sabbah informed us, he said Ismail bin Zakariyya told us, from Al-A'mash, he said: The people of the prisons sent to Ibrahim asking him how to pray on Friday. He sent to them: 'Pray four [Rak'ahs] without Adhan or Iqamah.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3640 - Muhammad bin Al-Sabbah informed us, he said Ismail told us, from Asim Al-Ahwal, from Ibn Sirin, he said: 'They did not use to ask about the Isnad (chain of narration). But when the Fitnah (civil strife) occurred, they said: "Name your men for us." So they would look at the People of the Sunnah and take their Hadith, and look at the People of Innovation and not take their Hadith.' 3641 - Muhammad bin Al-Sabbah informed us, he said Al-Fadl bin Musa Al-Sinani told us, he said: I and Abdullah bin Al-Mubarak took a path, and we ended up at a place where one of us should go first. Abdullah said to me: 'Stay where you are until we calculate which of us is older so he can go first.' He said: 'I was slightly older than him, so I went first.' 3642 - I asked my father about the Hadith of Jarir, from Layth, from Ma'n bin Abdurrahman, from his father, from Abdullah, he said: 'And concluding [well] is better than suspicion.' My father said: 'This Hadith is rejected (Munkar)'—as if he rejected it from the Hadith of Layth. And Abu Ma'mar told me the Hadith, he said Jarir told us. 3643 - My father told me, he said Abu Mu'awiyah told us, he said Al-A'mash told us, from Ibrahim, from Alqamah, he said: Abdullah used to resemble the Prophet, peace be upon him, in his guidance, his conduct, and his manner. And Alqamah used to resemble Abdullah.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3644 - My father told me, he said Abu Mu'awiyah told us, he said Al-A'mash told us, from Ibrahim, he said: Alqamah said to Al-Aswad: 'O Abu Amr.' He said: 'At your service (Labbayk).' He said: 'At your service (Labbay yadayka).' 3645 - My father told me, he said Humaid bin Abdurrahman told us, he said Al-A'mash told us, he said: Ibrahim said to me: 'Stick to Shaqiq, for I have met the people while they were numerous, and they used to count him among the best of them.' 3646 - My father told me, he said Abu Al-Mughirah Al-Nadr bin Ismail bin Hazim Al-Bajali told us, he said Sulayman Al-A'mash told us, he said: I used to enter the mosque with Ibrahim, and he would sit in the circle of the monitors (Al-'Urafa'). He would say: 'O A'mash, give [us] what you have.' 3647 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Sa'id told us, from Al-A'mash, he said: Ibrahim told us that Alqamah said to Al-Aswad: 'O Abu Amr.' He said: 'At your service.' He said: 'At your service (Labbay yadayka).' 3648 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Sa'id told us, he said Shu'bah told us, he said Sulayman Al-A'mash told us, from Ibrahim, from Al-Aswad, he said: Abdullah said to me: 'Convey Salam to Umar.' He said: 'Alayhi (Upon him) or Wa'alayhi Al-Salam (And upon him be peace).'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3649 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Sa'id told us, he said: Shu'bah told us, from Al-A'mash, from Ibrahim, from Al-Aswad, he said: Abdullah said: 'If you meet Umar, give him Salam.' So I gave him Salam, and he said: 'Peace be upon him (Alayhi as-Salam)' or 'And upon him be peace and the mercy of Allah.'
3650 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Sa'id told us, from Shu'bah, he said: Ash'ath bin Sulaym told me, from Al-Aswad bin Yazid, he said: Abdullah said: 'If you meet Umar, give him Salam.' I heard my father say: Yahya bin Sa'id narrated both hadiths to us.
3651 - My father told me, he said: Abd Al-Samad told us, he said: Sawadah—meaning Ibn Hayyan—told us, from Mu'awiyah bin Qurrah, he said: I lived to see three from my household, all of whom accompanied the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace.
3652 - My father told me, he said: Abu Bakr bin Ayyash told us, he said: I heard Ata, the client (Mawla) of Ishaq bin Talha, say: I came with my father to Ali, and he said: 'Who is this with you?' I said: 'My son.' He said: So he wiped my head and prayed for blessing for me. By Allah, I have not ceased to recognize good since then. He said: As for my brother Atiyyah, he was struck at Siffin.
3653 - My father told me, he said: Abdah bin Sulayman told us, he said: Ata Abu Muhammad told us, he said: I saw Ali praying Duha in the mosque.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3654 - My father told me, he said: Al-Walid bin Al-Qasim told us, he said: Ata Abu Muhammad told us, he said: I was in Khurasan, and we ate from the food of the Amir. He said: Ma'qil bin Yasar was with me eating. Then the Mu'adhin called the Adhan, so he got up for prayer and wiped his hands, one against the other, and on his beard.
3655 - I heard my father mention from a man, he said: I said to Sufyan: Did Abu Al-Za'ra survive after Abu Ishaq? He said: Yes.
3656 - My father told me, he said: Husayn bin Muhammad told us, he said: Shu'bah told us, from Abu Yunus Hatim bin Muslim—meaning Hatim bin Abi Saghirah, and he is Abu Yunus Al-Qushayri.
3657 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Adam told us, he said: Sufyan told us, from Yahya bin Abd Allah Al-Jabir Al-Taimi. Yahya said: Sufyan dictated it to us by dictation: The hadith that the first man whose [hand] was cut in Islam had stolen.
3658 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Adam told us, he said: Sufyan told us—and he mentioned the Tashahhud, the Tashahhud of Abdullah—so he said: Abu Ishaq narrated it to us from Abu Al-Ahwas, from Abdullah, from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. And Mansur, Al-A'mash, and Hammad [narrated it] from Abu Wa'il, from Abdullah, from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, similar to it.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3659 - I heard my father say regarding the hadith of Shu'bah from Yazid bin Khumayr, he said: I heard Abdullah bin Abi Musa. I heard my father say: Yazid bin Khumayr is sound in Hadith (Salih Al-Hadith).
3660 - My father said: 'Abdullah bin Musa' is a mistake; Shu'bah made a mistake. It is Abdullah bin Abi Qays.
3661 - I heard my father say: This Abu Aqil is trustworthy; [he is] Abdullah bin Aqil Al-Thaqafi.
3662 - My father told me, he said: Musa bin Dawud told us, he said: Ibn Lahi'ah told us, from Ma'ruf bin Suwayd, that Abu Qaza'ah, a client of theirs, narrated to us—he heard Abdullah bin Amr saying: The name of Pharaoh's wife was Asiyah bint Muzahim.
3663 - My father told me, he said: Abu Ahmad Al-Zubayri told us, he said: Ghalib bin Najih Abu Bishr told us.
3664 - My father told me, he said: Abu Ahmad Al-Zubayri told us, he said: Abu Bakr Al-Nahshali—meaning Ibn Qitaf—told us.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3665 - My father and Yahya bin Ma'in told me, they said: Abu Ahmad Al-Zubayri told us, he said: Sharik told us, from Imran, from Ikrimah, he said: Talut was a water carrier (Saqqa') who sold water.
3666 - My father told me, he said: Sa'd bin Ibrahim told us, he said: My father told us, from Muhammad bin Ishaq, he said: Thawr bin Yazid Al-Kala'i told me, and he was trustworthy.
3667 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il—meaning Ibn Ulayyah—told us, he said: Ibn Jurayj told us, he said: Sulayman bin Musa told me, from Al-Zuhri. He said: Sulayman bin Musa was [a man of status], and he praised him.
3668 - I read to my father: Hammad bin Khalid said: Abu Al-Juwayriyah told us, from Hammad, from Ibrahim.
3669 - I asked my father about Abu Al-Juwayriyah, so he said: He is Kufan, he settled in Medina. Hammad Al-Khayyat named him Abd Al-Hamid bin Imran.
3670 - I heard my father say: Yahya bin Al-Jazzar, his nickname is Zabban.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3671 - My father told me, he said: Abu Al-Nadr told us, he said: Hashraj bin Nubatah Al-Absi—a Kufan—told us, he said: I said to Sa'id bin Jumhan: Where did you meet Safinah? He said: I met him at Batn Nakhlah during the time of Al-Hajjaj, and I stayed with him for eight nights asking him about the hadiths of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. I said: What is your name? He said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, named me Safinah.
3672 - My father told me, he said: Aswad bin Amir told us, he said: Isra'il and Jabir told us, from Amir, from Al-Bara bin Azib, he said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, prayed over his son Ibrahim while he was sixteen months old.
3673 - My father told me, he said: Ibn Numayr told us, he said: Al-A'mash informed us, from Muslim bin Subayh, he said: Al-A'mash said: I think it is from Al-Bara bin Azib, he said: Ibrahim, the son of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, died while he was sixteen months old.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3674 - My father told me, he said: Waki told us, he said: My father, Sufyan, and Isra'il told us, from Abu Ishaq, from Al-Bara bin Azib, he said: We used to discuss that the number of the Companions of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, on the day of Badr was equal to the number of the companions of Talut on the day of Jalut (Goliath): three hundred and ten-something men who crossed the river with him. He said: And no one crossed the river with him except a believer.
3675 - My father told me, he said: Abu Ahmad Al-Zubayri told us, he said: Sufyan told us, from Abu Ishaq, from Al-Bara, he said: Not everything we narrate to you did we hear directly from the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, but our companions narrated to us, as the herding of camels used to occupy us.
3676 - My father told me, he said: Mu'awiyah bin Hisham told us, he said: Sufyan told us, from Abu Ishaq, from Al-Bara bin Azib, he said: Not all the hadith did we hear from the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace; rather, our companions used to narrate to us from him, as the herding of camels used to occupy us.
3677 - My father told me, he said: Husayn bin Muhammad told us, he said: Shu'bah told us, he said: Ibn Abi Thabit informed me, he said: I heard Abu Al-Abbas, a man from the people of Mecca who was a poet, and he was not accused regarding Hadith.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3678 - My father told me, he said: Rawh told us, he said: Shu'bah told us, he said: I heard Habib bin Abi Thabit say: I heard Abu Al-Abbas the poet, and he was truthful (Saduq).
3679 - My father said: Abu Al-Abbas the poet, his name is Al-Sa'ib bin Farrukh, and he is Abu Al-Ala bin Abi Al-Abbas. My father said: Amr bin Dinar narrated from him.
3680 - I read to my father: Ibn Mahdi, he said: Sufyan told us, from Ziyad bin Ilaqah, he said: A man told me that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, granted retaliation to a man regarding a stone.
3681 - I read to my father, and I heard it from him, he said: We copied from the book of Al-Ashja'i—meaning from what his son gave them—from the hadith of Sufyan: Ziyad bin Ilaqah, from Arfajah, he said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, granted retaliation regarding a stone.
3682 - I read to my father: Waki, from Sufyan, from Sulayman Al-Absi, from Abu Hubayrah, from Sa'id bin Jubayr, that Umar prostrated in [Surah] Sad.
3683 - I read to my father: Abdullah bin Al-Walid, he said: Sufyan told us, from Sulayman Al-Absi, from Abu Hubayrah, from Sa'id bin Jubayr, that Umar bin Al-Khattab prostrated in [Surah] Sad.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3684 - I read to my father: Nuh bin Maymun, he said: Abdullah—meaning Ibn Al-Mubarak—told us, from Sufyan, from Sulayman Al-Absi, from Abu Hubayrah, from Sa'id bin Jubayr, from Ibn Abbas, that Umar prostrated in [Surah] Sad.
3685 - I read to my father: Ibn Mahdi, from Hushaym, from Sayyar, from Abu Hubayrah, from Sa'id bin Jubayr, from Ibn Umar, that Umar prostrated in [Surah] Sad.
3686 - My father said: Nuh bin Maymun had two books from Sufyan: one he heard himself from Sufyan, and the other he heard from Ibn Al-Mubarak from Sufyan, and in it were the strange narrations (Ghara'ib).
3687 - I read to my father: Nuh bin Maymun, he said: Abdullah—meaning Ibn Mubarak—told us, from Sufyan, from Abu Husayn, from the niece of Abu Abd Al-Rahman, that Abu Abd Al-Rahman used to pray in a shirt (Qamis).
3688 - I read to my father, he said: Yahya bin Ishaq told us, he said: Abu Bakr—meaning Ibn Ayyash—informed me, he said: Abu Husayn told us, from Mulaykah bint Abi Abd Al-Rahman, she said: My father used to pray at night in a shirt.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3689 - I read to my father: Yahya bin Sa'id, from Sufyan, from Khubayb, from Abd Al-Rahman Al-Yahsubi: If he counts to twenty, command him to pray—meaning the child.
3690 - I read to my father: Ibn Mahdi, from Sufyan, from Khubayb, from the wife of Abd Al-Rahman Al-Yahsubi, from Abd Al-Rahman: If the child counts to twenty, command him to pray.
3691 - I read to my father: Waki, from Sufyan, from Khubayb, from Abd Al-Rahman Al-Yahsubi, he said: If he enumerates the number ten, command him to pray.
3692 - I read to my father: Waki, from Sufyan, from a man, from Tawus, that he disliked for a man to wear a turban and not put it under his beard (chin).
3693 - I read to my father, he said: We took from the book of Al-Ashja'i—meaning from what his son gave them—in the hadith of Sufyan, from Ma'mar, from Ibn Tawus, from his father, that he disliked the turban if he did not put it under the chin.
3694 - I read to my father: Abd Al-Razzaq, he said: Ma'mar informed us, from Layth, from Tawus regarding a man who winds the turban on his head and does not put it under his chin. He said: That is the turban of Satan.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3695 - I read to my father: Waki, he said: Sufyan told us, from a man, that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, sent Aisha to a woman to look at her. When she returned, he said: 'How did you see?' She said: 'O Messenger of Allah, I did not see anything significant.' So the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: 'Indeed, you saw a mole on her cheek, and every hair on you shivered.' She said: 'O Messenger of Allah, no secret is hidden from you.'
3696 - I read to my father: Ibn Mahdi, from Sufyan, from Jabir, from Ibn Sabit, he said: The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, proposed to a woman from Kalb, so he sent Aisha... and he mentioned similar to it.
3697 - I read to my father: Waki, from Sufyan, he said: Someone who saw Ibrahim and Al-Hasan praying on a carpet with images informed me.
3698 - I read to my father, he said: And we copied from the book of Al-Ashja'i—meaning from what his son gave them—from Sufyan, from Abu Sharahil, from Abu Ma'shar, he said: Ibrahim used to pray on a carpet that had figures (images).
3699 - I read to my father: Abu Ahmad Al-Zubayri, he said: Sufyan told us, from Amr bin Dinar, he said: I heard Sa'id bin Jubayr saying: If the blood stops, there is no return (Raj'ah).

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3700 - I read to my father: Waki, he said: Sufyan told us, from a man, from Sa'id bin Jubayr, he said: If she sees purity, she is separated/divorced (Banat), even if she has not bathed.
3701 - I read to my father: Nuh bin Maymun, he said: Abdullah—meaning Ibn Mubarak—told us, from Sufyan, from Zakariyya—meaning Ibn Ishaq—from Amr bin Dinar, from Sa'id bin Jubayr, he said: If the blood stops from the third menstruation, he has no right to take her back (Raj'ah).
3702 - I read to my father: Ibn Mahdi, he said: I asked Sufyan, I said: Do you memorize from Salim from Sa'id regarding the testimony of the slanderer (Qadhif)? He said: From Sa'id: His testimony is not accepted. I said: From Abu Bakrah, that they called him to testify with a testimony? He said: Leave him, leave him.
3703 - I read to my father, and I copied it from the book of Al-Ashja'i—meaning from what his son gave them—in the hadith of Sufyan, from Salim, from Sa'id bin Jubayr and Mujahid, they both said: The slanderer, his testimony is not accepted.
3704 - I read to my father: Ishaq bin Yusuf, he said: Sufyan told us, from Salim, from Sa'id bin Jubayr and Mujahid, that they both said regarding the testimony of the slanderer: Testimony is not accepted for him.
3705 - I read to my father: Amr bin Muhammad—meaning Al-Anqari—told us, he said: Sufyan Al-Thawri told us, from Al-Sumayy, from Al-Nu'man bin Abi Ayyash, he said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: 'Whoever fasts a day in the path of Allah, Allah will distance the Fire from his face by that day for seventy autumns.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3706 - I read to my father, he said: We took it from the book of Al-Ashja'i, from the hadith of Sufyan, from Suhail bin Abi Salih, from Al-Nu'man bin Abi Ayyash, from Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri, from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace: 'No servant fasts a day in the path of Allah...' and he mentioned similar to it.
3707 - I read to my father: Muhammad bin Ja'far, and I heard it from him, he said: Shu'bah told us, from Suhail bin Abi Salih, from Safwan, from Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri, from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace: 'Whoever fasts a day in the path of Allah...' and he mentioned the Hadith.
3708 - I read to my father: Ibn Mahdi, from Sufyan, from Ziyad bin Ilaqah, from a man of his people, that Umar saw a fat man. He said: 'What is this?' He said: 'Lizards (Dhibab).' He said: 'I would wish that in place of every lizard there were two lizards.'
3709 - I read to my father: The son of Al-Ashja'i gave us books from the books of his father, from Sufyan, so we copied from them: Ziyad bin Ilaqah, from Sa'id bin Ma'bad, he said: Umar bin Al-Khattab saw a fat man, so he said: 'How fat you are!' He said: 'From eating lizards.' Umar said: 'I wish that in the hole of every lizard there were two lizards. O Allah, make their provision in the bellies of the valleys and the tops of the hills.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3710 - I read to my father: Waki, he said: Sufyan told us, from Ibrahim bin Muhajir, from Ibrahim, he said: The manumission by a drunkard is valid.
3711 - And I read to my father: Waki, from Sufyan, from Mansur, from Ibrahim, he said: The divorce by a drunkard is valid.
3712 - I read to my father: Ibn Numayr, from Sufyan, from Ibrahim bin Muhajir, from Ibrahim, he said: The divorce by a drunkard and his manumission are valid.
3713 - I read to my father: Ibn Mahdi, from Sufyan, from Ibrahim bin Muhajir and Mansur, from Ibrahim, he said: The divorce by a drunkard is valid.
3714 - I read to my father: Waki, from Sufyan, from a man, from Rabi' bin Khuthaym, that he used to pray Fajr when it became light (Isfar).
3715 - I read to my father, and I heard it from him: Ibn Mahdi, from Sufyan, from a Sheikh of Sadus, a man from the tribe, that Al-Rabi' bin Khuthaym said: 'Make it light, make it light,' regarding the Fajr prayer. I said to Sufyan: Did he hear it from Al-Rabi'? He said: He had caught him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3716 - I read to my father: Waki, he said: Sufyan told us, from Alqamah bin Marthad, from Ibrahim, he said: 'As for me, I say "Wa Barakatuhu" (And His Blessings), and I hide it/say it silently.'
3717 - I read to my father: Yahya bin Sa'id, from Sufyan, he said: Alqamah bin Marthad told me, from Ibrahim, he said: Alqamah said: 'I indeed say "Wa Barakatuhu" and I hide it.'
3718 - I read to my father: I was informed from Al-Ashja'i, from Sufyan, from Alqamah bin Marthad, from Ibrahim, that he used to do that—meaning the Taslim of Al-Aswad—and he would hide 'Wa Barakatuhu'.
3719 - I read to my father: Waki, from Sufyan, from his father, from a man, from Rabi', he said: I do not like the servant imploring (Munashadah) his Lord.
3720 - I read to my father: Ibn Mahdi, from Sufyan, from his father, from Abu Ya'la, from Rabi', he said: I do not like the servant imploring his Lord, saying: 'Lord, You decreed mercy upon Yourself, You decreed upon Yourself such-and-such,' deeming Him slow. And I haven't seen anyone say: 'Lord, I have performed what is upon me, so perform what is upon You.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3721 - I read to my father: Waki, he said: Sufyan told us, from his father, from Mundhir Abu Ya'la, from Al-Rabi', he said: I do not favor anyone over our Prophet, nor do I favor anyone over Ibrahim, the Friend (Khalil) of Allah.
3722 - I read to my father: Ibn Mahdi, he said: Sufyan told us, from his father, from Abu Ya'la, he said: Rabi' bin Khuthaym said: I do not favor anyone over our Prophet, nor do I favor anyone over Ibrahim, the Friend of Allah. Abd Al-Rahman said: Then he doubted—meaning Sufyan—regarding Abu Ya'la.
3723 - I read to my father: Ishaq bin Yusuf, he said: Sufyan told us, from Al-Walid bin Qays, from Al-Qasim bin Hassan, from Fulfulah Al-Ju'fi, from Abu Mas'ud, he said: The Quran was revealed in seven modes (Ahruf), and the Books were revealed from one door in one mode.
3724 - I read to my father: Abu Usamah told us from his memory, he said: Sufyan and Zuhair informed me, from Al-Walid bin Qays, from Al-Qasim bin Hassan, from Fulfulah Al-Ju'fi, he said: Abdullah said: The Quran was revealed from seven doors in seven modes.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3725 - I read to my father: Abu Kamil, he said: Zuhair told us, he said: Abu Hammam told us, from Uthman bin Hassan, from Fulfulah Al-Ju'fi, he said: I panicked among those who panicked to Abdullah regarding the Masahif (copies of the Quran). So we entered upon him, and a man from the people said: 'We did not come to you as visitors, but we came when this news alarmed us.' So he said: 'Indeed, the Quran was revealed to your Prophet from seven doors in seven modes'—or he said 'Ahruf' (letters/modes)—'and indeed the Book before it used to be revealed from one door in one mode.'
3726 - I read to my father: Ishaq bin Yusuf, from Sufyan, from Firas, from Al-Sha'bi, he said: The rider behind (Al-Radif) guarantees [damages].
3727 - I read to my father: Waki, he said: Sufyan told us, from Al-Shaibani, from Al-Sha'bi, he said: The rider behind guarantees.
3728 - I read to my father: Ibn Mahdi, from Sufyan, from Al-Shaibani, he said: I heard Al-Sha'bi say: The rider behind guarantees.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3729 - I read to my father: Abu Ahmad, he said: Sufyan told us, from Al-Suddi, from Abu Malik, that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, prayed over the slain of Uhud.
3730 - I read to my father: Ibn Mahdi and Yahya bin Sa'id, from Sufyan, from Husayn, from Abu Malik, that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, prayed over the slain of Uhud.
3731 - I read to my father: Hushaym, from Husayn, from Abu Malik, that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, prayed over the martyrs of Uhud.
3732 - I read to my father: Waki, he said: Sufyan told us, from Abdullah bin Mubashir, from a Sheikh of theirs, that Uthman saw a citron (Utrujjah) made of gypsum in the Qiblah of the mosque, so he ordered it and it was broken.
3733 - I read to my father: Ibn Mahdi, from Sufyan, he said: A Sheikh from the people of Medina told me, he said: Abdullah bin Abi Habibah told me, he said: I saw Uthman bin Affan breaking or ordering the breaking of a citron in the mosque.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3734 - I read to my father: Al-Adani—meaning Abdullah bin Al-Walid—told me, he said: Sufyan told us, from a Sheikh from the people of Medina, from Abdullah bin Abi Habibah, he said: I saw Uthman bin Affan see a citron made of gypsum in the mosque, so he broke it.
3735 - I read to my father: Mu'ammal, he said: Sufyan told us, from Hisham bin Urwah, from his father, from Abdullah bin Amir: Umar bin Al-Khattab led us in the Morning Prayer (Subh), so he recited Surah Yusuf and Al-Hajj with a slow recitation.
3736 - I read to my father: Al-Adani—meaning from Al-Thawri—in the hadith of Hisham, from Urwah, from Abdullah bin Amir, that Umar recited Surah Yusuf in Fajr.
3737 - My father said: And I read it to Abd Al-Rahman: Malik, from Hisham bin Urwah, that he heard Abdullah bin Amir bin Rabi'ah say: We prayed behind Umar... and he mentioned it.
