3738 - I read to my father, and I heard it from him: Ibn Idris, he said: Hisham bin Urwah informed us, from Abdullah bin Amir bin Rabi'ah, he said: I prayed behind Umar... and he mentioned the hadith of Mu'ammal, except that he did not say 'from his father'.
3739 - I read to my father: Yahya bin Sa'id, from Hisham, he said: Abdullah bin Amir told me, he said: I prayed behind Umar... and he mentioned similar to it.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3740 - I read to my father: Waki, from Hisham bin Urwah, he said: I heard Abdullah bin Amir say: I heard Umar say... and he mentioned similar to it.
3741 - I read to my father: Abu Mu'awiyah, he said: Hisham told us, from Abdullah bin Amir: Umar prayed with us... and he mentioned similar to it.
3742 - I read to my father: Ibn Numayr told us, he said: Hisham told us, he said: Abdullah bin Amir informed me... and he mentioned it.
3743 - I read to my father: Abdullah bin Al-Walid, he said: Sufyan told us, he said: Hisham bin Urwah told us, from Urwah, from Marwan, from Busrah bint Safwan, she said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: 'Whoever touches his penis, let him perform wudu for prayer.'
3744 - I read to my father, and I heard it from him, he said: Yahya bin Sa'id told us, from Hisham, he said: My father informed me that Busrah bint Safwan informed him that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: 'Whoever touches his penis, let him not pray until he performs wudu.'
3745 - I read to my father, and I heard it from him, he said: Yahya bin Sa'id told us, he said: Shu'bah said: Hisham did not hear his father's hadith regarding touching the penis. Yahya said: So I asked Hisham, and he said: 'My father informed me.'
3746 - I read to my father: Hammad bin Khalid Al-Khayyat told us, from Sufyan, from Mutarrif, from Al-Hasan, he said: Umar said: 'Restrain the thief, do not entrap him.'
3747 - I read to my father: Abd Al-Razzaq told us, he said: Sufyan informed us, from Mutarrih, from Al-Hasan, he said: Umar said: 'Scare off the thief, and do not lie in wait for him.' He says: Do not watch the thief in order to catch him, but scare him off, make him jump, shout at him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3748 - I read to my father: Hammad bin Khalid told us, from Sufyan, from Jabir, from Al-Sha'bi and Sa'id bin Jubayr, they said: The examination (Al-Mihnah) is an innovation.
3749 - I read to my father: Waki, he said: Sufyan told us, from his father, from Ibrahim Al-Tamimi: {They are called to prostrate while they are safe} [Al-Qalam: 43]. He said: The prescribed prayer.
3750 - I read to my father: Abu Ahmad, he said: Sufyan told us, from Mansur, from Ibrahim, and from his father, from Ibrahim Al-Tamimi: {They are called to prostrate while they are safe}. He said: The prescribed prayer.
3751 - I read to my father: Mu'ammal, he said: Sufyan told us, from Mansur, from Adi bin Thabit regarding His saying: {And they are called to prostrate while they are safe}. He said: The prescribed prayer.
3752 - My father said: And Al-Ashja'i said likewise from Adi bin Thabit. He said: It reached me regarding His saying: {And they used to be called to prostrate while they were safe}, that it was revealed regarding prayer. I informed him from Al-Ashja'i.
3753 - I read to my father: Muhammad bin Al-Sabbah, he said: Isma'il bin Zakariyya told us, from Abu Sinan Dirar bin Murrah, from Sa'id bin Jubayr regarding His saying: {They used to be called to prostrate while they were safe}. He said: They used to be called to prayer, but they would not answer it without an excuse.
3754 - Abu Abd Al-Rahman said: Ibn Bakkar narrated it to us from Isma'il bin Zakariyya, similar to it.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3755 - My father told me, he said Muhammad bin Ja'far told us, he said Shu'bah told us, from Sufyan, from Abu Sinan, from Sa'id bin Jubayr regarding this verse: {And they used to be called to prostrate while they were sound} [Al-Qalam: 43], he said: 'Prayer in congregation.' 3756 - I read to my father: Ibn Mahdi, from Sufyan. And Waki' said: Sufyan told us, from Asim, from Zirr, from Abdullah, he said: '{As-Sa'ihun} (The travelers/tourists) [At-Tawbah: 112] are the fasting ones.' 3757 - I read to my father, and heard it from him, he said: Muhammad bin Ja'far told us, he said Shu'bah told us, from Sufyan, from Asim bin Bahdalah, from Zirr, from Abdullah, he said regarding '{As-Sa'ihat} (The female travelers/tourists) [At-Tahrim: 5]': 'The fasting women.' 3758 - My father told me, he said Muhammad bin Ja'far told us, he said Shu'bah told us, from Habib bin Al-Shahid, from Thabit, from Anas: That the Prophet, peace be upon him, prayed over the grave of a woman after she was buried.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3759 - I read to my father: Ismail bin Umar, from Sufyan, from a man, from Ibrahim regarding a man who assumes Ihram for Hajj in other than the months of Hajj. He said: 'He waits (remains in Ihram).' 3760 - I read to my father: Abdur-Razzaq told us, he said Al-Thawri informed us, from Mansur and Al-A'mash, from Ibrahim regarding a man who assumes Ihram for Hajj in other than the months of Hajj. He said: 'It is binding (Haram) until he performs the Hajj.' 3761 - I read to my father: Ibn Mahdi said: Sufyan informed us, from Mansur, from Ibrahim, he said: 'Snatching (Nuhab) at weddings is disliked.' 3762 - I read to my father: Ibn Mahdi, from Sufyan, he said a man told me from Al-Sha'bi, he said: 'There is no harm in it.' 3763 - I read to my father: Hammad Al-Khayyat, from Sufyan, from Mansur, he said: 'Ibrahim used to dislike scattering (nuts/coins) for children, while Al-Sha'bi saw no harm in it.' 3764 - I read to my father: Abdur-Razzaq, he said Sufyan informed us, from Mansur, from Ibrahim: That he disliked snatching (Nuhab) at the engagement (Mlak). He said: 'We realized them while they were beating tambourines in the alleyways.' He said: 'And Al-Sha'bi used to see no harm in snatching at the engagement, and he would say: Plundering (Nuhbah) is only when you take what is not rightfully yours.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3765 - I read to my father: Waki', from Sufyan, from Mansur, from Al-Hakam: {And made you kings} [Al-Ma'idah: 20]. He said: 'The house, the woman (wife), and the servant.' 3766 - Sufyan said: Mansur said, from Al-Hakam: 'Or two of these three.' 3767 - I read to my father: Abdullah bin Al-Walid, he said Sufyan told us, from Al-A'mash or Mansur, from Ibn Abbas regarding this verse: {And made you kings}. He said: 'Whoever has'—meaning a servant and a woman (wife). 3768 - I read to my father: Mu'ammal, he said Sufyan told us, from Al-A'mash, from a man, from Ibn Abbas: {And made you kings}. He said: 'The house and the servant.' 3769 - I read to my father: Abu Hudhaifah, he said Sufyan told us, from Al-A'mash, he said: Ibn Abbas said regarding: {And made you kings}. He said: 'The house and the servant.' 3770 - I read to my father: Ali bin Hafs, he said Warqa informed us, from Mansur, from Al-Hakam: {And made you kings}. He said: 'A man among the Children of Israel, if he had a house, a servant, and a wife, was called a king.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3771 - I read to my father, he said: We wrote from the book of Al-Ashja'i, from what his son gave them, in the Hadith of Sufyan, from Al-A'mash, from Mujahid, from Ibn Abbas: {And when Moses said to his people, "O my people, remember the favor of Allah upon you when He appointed among you prophets and made you kings"}. He said: 'Whoever has a wife and a servant is among the kings.' 3772 - I read to my father: Ibn Mahdi, from Sufyan, he said I heard Hammad narrating from Ibrahim regarding a man who dies with a group of people and they do not have water. He said: 'He is given Tayammum (dry ablution).' 3773 - I read to my father: Abdur-Razzaq, he said Ma'mar and Al-Thawri informed us, from Hammad, that they heard him say: 'If a man dies among women and there is no man among them, he is given Tayammum.' 3774 - Sufyan said: 'It reached me from Ibrahim similar to the saying of Hammad.' 3775 - I read to my father: Abdul-Quddus bin Bakr, he said Sufyan informed us, from Hammad, from Ibrahim regarding a woman who dies among men. He said: 'She is given Tayammum.' 3776 - I read to my father: Yazid bin Harun, he said Sufyan informed us, from Hammad, he said: 'If a woman dies among men, they perform Tayammum on her with soil.' 3777 - I read to my father: Ibn Mahdi, from Hammad, from Hammad, from Ibrahim regarding a woman who dies among men. He said: 'She is given Tayammum and buried.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3778 - I read to my father: Waki', he said Sufyan told us, from Abdul-A'la bin Amir, from Abu Abdur-Rahman Al-Sulami: That he used to count {Ha-Mim} as a verse and {Alif-Lam-Mim} as a verse. 3779 - I read to my father: Abu Nu'aym, he said Sufyan informed us, from Ata bin Al-Sa'ib or Abdul-A'la, from Abu Abdur-Rahman: That he used to count {Ha-Mim} as a verse and {Alif-Lam-Mim} as a verse. 3780 - I read to my father: Waki', from Sufyan, from Ibrahim bin Maysarah, from Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib, from Umar: That he gave a grandmother of a man from Thaqif inheritance along with her son, a sixth. 3781 - I read to my father: Ibn Mahdi, he said Sufyan told me. And Abu Nu'aym said: Sufyan informed us, from Ibn Jurayj, from Ibrahim bin Maysarah, from Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib: That Umar gave inheritance to a grandmother while her son was alive. Abu Nu'aym said: 'He gave inheritance to a grandmother along with her son.' 3782 - I read to my father: Waki', he said Sufyan told us, from Abdullah bin Muhammad bin Aqil, from Jumanah—or Ibn Jumanah—a concubine of Ali. She said: Ali used to practice coitus interruptus (Azl) with us. We spoke to him, and he said: 'Do I keep alive something Allah has killed?'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3783 - I read to my father: Ibn Mahdi, he said Sufyan told us, from Abdullah bin Muhammad bin Aqil, he said Umm Jumanah, a concubine of Ali, told us, she said: Ali used to practice coitus interruptus with us. We spoke to him, and he said: 'Do I keep alive something Allah has killed?' 3784 - I read to my father: I was informed from Al-Ashja'i, from Sufyan, from Ibn Aqil, he said: A concubine of Ali called Jumanah told me... 3785 - I read to my father: Mu'ammal, he said Sufyan told us, from his father, from Mujahid regarding His saying, Mighty and Majestic: {So by your Lord, We will surely question them all} [Al-Hijr: 92]. He said: 'About: There is no deity but Allah.' 3786 - I read to my father: Muhammad bin Humayd Abu Sufyan Al-Ma'mari, from Sufyan. And Aswad bin Amir said: Sufyan told us, from Layth, from Mujahid regarding His saying, Mighty and Majestic: {So by your Lord, We will surely question them all. About what they used to do}. He said: 'About: There is no deity but Allah.' 3787 - I read to my father: Waki', from Sufyan, from a man, from Mujahid: {Abqari}. He said: 'Brocade (Dibaj).' 3788 - I read to my father: Qabisah, he said Sufyan informed us, from Rabah, from Mujahid, the like of it.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3789 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Ibrahim bin Khalid Al-Mu'adhdhin Abu Muhammad told us, he said Rabah told me, he said Al-Nu'man bin Ubayd told me, from Wahb bin Sulayman, from Shu'ayb Al-Jaba'i, he said: 'If the water of the earth had not preceded the water of the sky by forty days, the water of the sky, when it came from the sky like mountains with the wrath of Allah, would have ruined the water of the sky, crushed the mountains, and dug trenches in the earth that would never be inhabited. But the gates of the sky were opened, and the water of the sky came, and the earth was a sea. Noah remained in the Ark from the time he boarded it until it was said: {O earth, swallow your water, and O sky, withhold} [Hud: 44] for six months and some days. Then it began to recede for forty days. Then Noah landed on Judi. The Ark had performed Hajj with Noah; it stood at the standing place of Arafah, then departed as the pilgrim departs, then spent the night at Muzdalifah, then departed, then stood with him at the Jamarat, then proceeded with him to the House (Kaaba) and circumambulated it seven times, and went between Safa and Marwa seven times. The water rose above the highest mountain on earth by a distance of five months ascending.' And Ma'mar claimed that the water rose fifteen cubits—or he said fathoms. Rabah said: 'It reached me that the tree from which Noah made the Ark sprouted when Noah was born. Its height was three hundred cubits and its width was eighty or sixty cubits.' Ma'mar said: 'Judi is in Al-Jazirah.' 3790 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Ibrahim bin Khalid told us, he said Rabah told us, he said I was told from Wahb bin Sulayman, from Shu'ayb Al-Jaba'i, he said: 'The name of the believer of the family of Pharaoh was Sam'an.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3791 - I found in my father's book: Ibrahim bin Khalid told us, he said Rabah told us, from Ma'mar, from Qatadah, he said: 'The day on which Adam was forgiven was the day of Ashura.' 3792 - I also found in my father's book: Abdur-Razzaq told us the like of it. 3793 - I found in my father's book: Ibrahim bin Khalid told us, he said Rabah told us, he said I was told from Shu'ayb Al-Jaba'i, he said: 'The tree which Allah forbade Adam and his spouse from was like wheat; its name was Al-Da'ah.' 3794 - My father told me, he said Ibrahim bin Khalid told us, he said Rabah told us, he said Umar bin Habib told me, from Amr bin Dinar, from Mughith that he said: 'The House (Kaaba) was raised on the day of the drowning (flood).' 3795 - I found in my father's book: Ibrahim bin Khalid told us, he said Rabah told us, from Ma'mar, from a man, from Abu Al-Tufayl, he said: 'The House is parallel to the Throne; it is the center of the earth, and from it, [the earth] was spread.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3796 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Sufyan bin Uyainah died in Rajab, and Abdurrahman bin Mahdi in the same year, the year ninety-eight. Yahya died in the beginning of it. Waki' died in the year ninety-six; he died on the road at the beginning of the year one hundred and ninety-seven. 3797 - My father told me, he said Ismail bin Ulayyah told us, he said Ma'mar told us, from Al-Zuhri, from Ali bin Muhammad bin Ali: That the Prophet, peace be upon him, forbade the Mut'ah of women. My father said: 'Rather, it is Abdullah and Hasan, the sons of Ali, from their father. But this is what Ma'mar said.' 3798 - My father told me, he said Ismail bin Ulayyah told us, from Yunus, he said: Al-Hasan said: 'Yusuf, peace be upon him, was thrown into the well when he was seventeen years old. He was in slavery, in prison, and in kingship for eighty years. Then his family was gathered for him, and he lived for twenty-three years.' 3799 - My father told me, he said Ibn Ulayyah told us, he said Shu'bah told us, from Abu Ishaq, he said: I heard Abdullah bin Yazid giving a sermon, he said: Al-Bara told us—and he was not a liar.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3800 - My father told me, he said Abdur-Razzaq told us, he said Ma'mar told us, he said Uthman Al-Jazari informed me, from Miqsam. Ma'mar said: He used to be called Uthman Al-Mushahid. I wrote two scrolls from him on military campaigns (Maghazi), but a man borrowed them from me and went away with them. I had never lent a book before them. 3801 - My father told me, he said Abdur-Razzaq told us, he said Ma'mar told us, he said: Whoever heard Ikrimah informed me, he said: 'The Prophet, peace be upon him, stayed in Mecca for fifteen [years], of which four or five he called to Islam secretly while he was fearful.' 3802 - My father told me, he said Abdur-Razzaq told us, he said Ma'mar told us, from Al-Zuhri in his Hadith from Urwah: 'The Battle of Uhud was in Shawwal, at the head of six months from the Battle of Al-Nadir.' 3803 - My father told me, he said Abdur-Razzaq told us, he said Ma'mar told us, from Qatadah, from Al-Hasan and others, he said: 'The first to believe in him was Ali bin Abi Talib, and he was fifteen or sixteen years old.' 3804 - My father told me, he said Abdur-Razzaq said: He did not hear anything from Yazid bin Abdullah bin Al-Had—meaning Ma'mar. 3805 - I heard my father say: Muhammad bin Abdurrahman bin Yazid, his Kunyah is Abu Ja'far.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3806 - Yahya bin Ma'in told me, he said Al-Sakan bin Ismail told us, he said Al-Hasan bin Dhakwan informed us, from Muhammad bin Sirin, from Abu Hurairah, he said: 'I have two vessels of Hadith from the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him.' 3807 - Muhammad bin Hatim Abu Abdullah Al-Zimmi told me, he said Ali bin Thabit informed us, he said Abdul-Hamid bin Ja'far told us, he said Ubaydullah bin Abi Ja'far told me, from Rabah, his mother's husband—and he was one of the companions of Abu Hurairah: That he asked him about a Hadith he heard from him. Abu Hurairah said to him: 'I do not know that I narrated a Hadith to you except that it is written with me.' He said: So I went with him, and he brought out his books but did not find it in them. Then he opened a chest or a coffer and found in it a scroll containing that Hadith alone.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3808 - Yahya bin Ma'in told me, he said Hajjaj told us, he said Yunus told us, from Abu Ishaq, from Sa'id bin Jubayr, from Ibn Abbas, he said: 'The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, was born on the Day of the Elephant.' Abu Abdurrahman said: 'Rather it is the Year of the Elephant; Yahya made a mistake in it.' 3809 - Yahya bin Ma'in told me, he said Quraysh bin Anas told us, he said Habib bin Al-Shahid informed us, he said: I was with Amr bin Dinar, and he mentioned Tawus. He said: 'By Allah, I have never seen anyone like him.' He leaned towards Ayyub, who was sitting next to me, and said: 'By Allah, if Muhammad had seen him, he would not have sworn to this.' 3810 - Yahya bin Ma'in told me, he said Waki' told us, he said I heard Shu'bah say: 'The Hadith of Abu Sufyan from Jabir is only a scroll (Sahifah).' 3811 - Ubaydullah bin Umar Al-Qawariri told us, he said Ismail bin Ibrahim bin Ulayyah told us, he said Hammad bin Zaid told us, he said: We were with Amr bin Dinar, and Ayyub was with us. Amr mentioned Tawus and said: 'I have not seen a man more abstinent from what is in people's hands than him.' Ayyub signaled to me with his hand: 'He did not see Muhammad, he did not see Muhammad.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3812 - Yahya bin Ma'in told me, he said Jarir told us, from Mughirah, he said: 'When Al-Hakam bin Utaybah arrived from Medina, the pillar of the Prophet, peace be upon him, used to be cleared for him to pray towards.' 3813 - My father and Yahya bin Ma'in told me, they said Abu Usamah told us, from Hisham, he said: 'Al-Zubayr accepted Islam when he was sixteen, and he was killed when he was sixty-something.' 3814 - Yahya bin Ma'in told us, he said Abdullah bin Yusuf told us, he said Yahya bin Hamzah told us, from Al-Awza'i: That Hassan bin Atiyyah told him that Gog and Magog are four hundred thousand nations, no nation among them resembles another. 3815 - Yahya bin Ma'in told us, he said Abdullah bin Yusuf told us, he said Yahya bin Hamzah told us, from Al-Awza'i: That Abdah told him, he said: 'They are a thousand, and we are one.' 3816 - Yahya bin Ma'in told us, he said Abdullah bin Yusuf told us, he said Yahya bin Hamzah told us, from Ibn Amr Al-Awza'i, he said Hassan bin Atiyyah told me, he said: 'The expanse of the earth is a hundred years, the seas are a hundred years, a hundred years is ruin, and a hundred is inhabited.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3817 - Yahya bin Ma'in told us, he said Al-Mu'tamir bin Sulayman told us, he said I heard Iyas bin Daghfal say: We went with Al-Hasan to visit Abu Nadrah. Abu Nadrah said: 'O Abu Sa'id, you correspond to me, so pray over me.' He said: So I witnessed him praying over him in the middle of the graveyards. 3818 - Yahya bin Ma'in told us, he said Mu'tamir told us, he said I heard Hisham narrating from Khalid Al-Raba'i, he said: 'In the Torah—or in some of the books—the sky weeps for Umar bin Abdul-Aziz for forty years, a sorrowful weeping.' 3819 - Yahya bin Ma'in told us, he said Hajjaj bin Muhammad told us, he said Shu'bah informed us, from Abu Iyas, he said: 'My father came to the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, while he was a small boy. He wiped his head and sought forgiveness for him.' Shu'bah said: I said: 'Did he have companionship (Suhbah)?' He said: 'No, but during his time he used to milk and tie (was old enough to work).' 3820 - Yahya bin Ma'in told us, he said Abu Mu'awiyah told us, from Al-A'mash, from Ibn Dhakwan, he said: 'The jurists of the people of Medina are four: Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib, Urwah bin Al-Zubayr, Qabisah bin Dhuwayb, and Abdul-Malik bin Marwan.' 3821 - Yahya bin Ma'in told us, he said Hushaym told us, from Al-Awwam, he said: 'Yusayr bin Amr was born during the emigration of the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, and died in the year eighty-five.' I told my father about it, and he said: 'How strange it is.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3822 - Yahya told us, he said Sufyan bin Uyainah told us, from Amr bin Dinar, from Al-Zuhri, from Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib: That Umar died when he was fifty-four or fifty-five years old. 3823 - I heard Yahya bin Ma'in say: Gundar told me, he said: I confronted Abu Hurrah about the Hadith of Al-Hasan. He said: 'I did not hear them from Al-Hasan.' Or Gundar said: He could not confirm anything of what he heard from Al-Hasan except a Hadith or two. 3824 - I asked Yahya bin Ma'in about a man called Salamah from Ikrimah. He said: 'I have not heard anyone narrate from him except Yahya bin Sa'id.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3825 - He told us it from Salamah Abu Bishr from Ikrimah regarding His saying: {Those who annoy Allah and His Messenger} [Al-Ahzab: 57]. He said: 'The people of images (Tasawir).' 3826 - I heard Yahya bin Ma'in say: It used to be said that three people's Hadith should be avoided: Muhammad bin Talha bin Musarrif, Ayyub bin Utbah, and Fulayh bin Sulayman. I said to him: 'From whom did you hear this?' He said: 'From Abu Kamil Muzaffar bin Mudrik, and he was a righteous man, few resemble him.' And I think he said: 'And I used to take this matter (knowledge) from him.' 3827 - I heard Yahya bin Ma'in, and Muhammad bin Talha was mentioned. He said: He used to say: 'I do not remember my father except like a dream.' And Yahya weakened him. 3828 - Yahya said to me: Talha died ten years before Zubayd. 3829 - I asked Yahya about Muhammad bin Mus'ab Al-Qarqasani. He said to me: 'He is nothing.' And he said: 'He was my companion, and he was a man of many campaigns. He narrated to us one day from Abu Al-Ashhab, from Abu Raja, from Imran bin Husayn: That he disliked selling arms during civil strife (Fitnah). Yahya said: So I said to Muhammad bin Mus'ab: "They narrate this from Abu Raja as his saying (Mawquf)." He said: "This is how I heard it." Then Yahya said to me: "He was not among the people of Hadith."'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3830 - My father and Yahya bin Ma'in told me, they said Abu Ahmad Al-Kufi told us, from Sharik, from Imran, from Ikrimah, he said: 'Talut was a water carrier who sold water.' 3831 - My father and Yahya bin Ma'in told me, they said Yahya bin Abi Bukayr told us, he said Hammad bin Salamah informed us, he said: Humaid took the books of Al-Hasan, copied them, then returned them to him. 3832 - Yahya bin Ma'in told us, he said Yahya bin Abi Bukayr told us, he said Shu'bah told us, he said Hisham bin Hassan informed me, he said: Mansur bin Zadhan finished the Quran once, and in the second time he reached Surat Al-Nahl during Ramadan, after he prayed Maghrib, before Isha. 3833 - Yahya bin Ma'in told us, he said Waki' told us, from Mis'ar, he said: I heard from Abu Bahr Tha'labah. 3834 - Yahya told us, he said Waki' told us, from Abu Linah Al-Nadr bin Abi Maryam. 3835 - Yahya told us, he said Hushaym told us, from Abu Hamzah Imran bin Abi Ata.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3836 - Yahya told us, he said Al-Jarjasi Yazid told us, he said Baqiyyah told us, he said Safwan bin Amr told us, from Abu Ziyad and Yahya bin Ubayd Al-Ghassani. 3837 - Yahya bin Ma'in told us, he said Hajjaj told us, he said Shu'bah told us, from Mansur bin Zadhan, from Ibn Sirin, he said: 'Humaid bin Abdurrahman was among the most learned of the people of Basra ten years before he died.' 3838 - Yahya told us, he said Mu'tamir told us, from his father, from Qatadah, from Abdurrahman bin Adam, from Abu Hurairah, he said: 'Jesus will remain in the earth for forty years. If he were to say to the valley "Flow with honey," it would flow.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3839 - Yahya bin Ma'in told us, he said Hajjaj told us, from Ibn Abi Dhi'b, from Shurahbil—and he was accused. 3840 - I asked my father about Muhammad bin Mus'ab Al-Qarqasani. He said: 'There is no harm in him, and he narrated many Hadiths to us.' 3841 - Yahya bin Ma'in told us, he said Mu'tamir told us, he said my father said: 'You narrated to me from Ubaydullah bin Umar, he said: Umar only broke the Nabidh (jars) due to its intense sweetness.' 3842 - I asked Yahya bin Ma'in, I said: 'Abu Al-Bakhtari Al-Ta'i, what is his name?' He said: 'Sa'id.' I said to Yahya: 'Bin who?' He said: 'He is named.' I said: 'Sa'id bin Abi Imran?' He said: 'Yes.' He said: 'And I heard my father say: The name of Abu Al-Bakhtari is Sa'd.' 3843 - Yahya was asked while I was present about Zaid bin Jubayr and Hakim bin Jubayr, are they brothers? He said: 'There is no kinship between them.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3844 - I asked my father, so he said: 'Hakim bin Jubayr is a client of Bani Umayyah, and Zaid bin Jubayr is a man from Bani Jusham.' 3845 - Yahya was asked while I was present about Hilal bin Khabbab. He said: 'Trustworthy.' And my father said: 'Trustworthy.' 3846 - And Yahya was asked while I was listening about Habib bin Abi Thabit, Habib bin who? He said: 'Habib bin Hindi.' 3847 - And I asked my father, so he said: 'Habib bin Qais bin Dinar.' 3848 - I asked Yahya about Abu Abdullah Al-Jadali. He said: 'It is said Abd bin Abd, and it is said Fulan bin Abd.' 3849 - I asked Yahya about Abbas Al-Jurayri. He said: 'Trustworthy.' 3850 - And I asked my father, so he said: 'Trustworthy.' And he said: 'Yahya bin Sa'id asked one day: "How much does Hammad bin Salamah narrate from Abbas Al-Jurayri?"' 3851 - I asked Yahya about Abu Al-Mu'alla Al-Attar. He said: 'Trustworthy.' I said: 'What is his name?' He said: 'Yahya.' 3852 - I said to Yahya: 'Abu Ishaq from Abu Al-Hajjaj, I said to Salman: "Inform me about belief in Divine Decree (Qadar)." He said: "To know that what missed you was not meant to hit you." Who is this Abu Al-Hajjaj?' He said: 'A Sheikh from whom Abu Ishaq narrated.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3853 - My father told me, he said Abu Mu'awiyah told us, he said Al-A'mash told us, from Abu Ishaq, from Abu Al-Hajjaj Al-Azdi, from Salman, he said: I met him in Sabadhan, so I said to him... 3854 - I asked Yahya about Abu Musa Al-Harawi. He said: 'Trustworthy.' And I asked my father about him, so he recognized him and mentioned him with good. 3855 - Salih bin Ali Al-Hashimi told me, he said I heard Ahmad bin Muhammad bin Hanbal say: 'The Hafiz (preservers) of Hadith and the firm ones in Hadith are four: Sufyan Al-Thawri, Shu'bah, Zuhair, and Za'idah.' 3856 - Yahya was asked while I was listening about Ahmad bin Jamil Al-Marwazi. He said: 'There is no harm in him.' And I saw my father listening to him while I was present with him. 3857 - Yahya was asked about Hibban, a man from the companions of Ibn Al-Mubarak. He said: 'He is not among the people of Hadith, though he heard from Ibn Al-Mubarak.' 3858 - Yahya was asked about Abdullah bin Abdul-Quddus. He said: 'He is nothing; a malicious Rafidi.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3859 - Yahya was asked about Ibn Dahir, a man from the people of Rayy. He said: 'He is nothing. A person in whom there is good does not write from him.' And he mentioned the people of Baghdad and said: 'They are the worst of people; they write from everyone.' 3860 - I asked Yahya about Rabi' bin Abi Rashid and Jami' bin Abi Rashid, I said: 'Are they brothers?' He said: 'Yes.' 3861 - I asked Yahya about Ibn Sakhbarah, a Sheikh from whom Hammad bin Salamah narrated from Al-Qasim from Aisha. He said: 'There is no harm in him. Miskin, Hammad bin Salamah, Waki', and Uthman bin Umar narrated from him. He is Ibn Jabr, a descendant of Abu Bakr Al-Siddiq. There is no harm in him. His nickname is Tulaydan—or Ibn Tulaydan.' 3862 - I asked Yahya about Kulthum bin Jabr. He said: 'Trustworthy.' 3863 - I said to Yahya: 'Hammad bin Salamah, from Abu Hafs, from Abu Al-Ghadiyah.' He said: 'I do not know him. I do not know anyone who narrated from him except Hammad bin Salamah.' I said to Yahya: 'Is he named?' He said: 'No.' 3864 - I asked Yahya about Abu Ishaq Al-Shaibani, Sulayman bin who is he? He said: 'Sulayman bin Khaqan.' 3865 - And I asked my father, so he said: 'Sulayman bin Abi Sulayman Al-Shaibani.' 3866 - Yahya said to me: 'Sulayman Al-Taymi is Ibn Tarkhan.' My father also said to me: 'He is Ibn Tarkhan.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3867 - I asked Yahya about Ahmad bin Ibrahim Al-Mawsili. He said: 'There is no harm in him. He narrated from Hammad bin Zaid.' 3868 - I asked Yahya about Shuja' bin Makhlad. He said: 'I know him, there is no harm in him. He is the brother of Sari. An excellent thing—or an excellent man—trustworthy.' 3869 - I asked Yahya about Abu Ibrahim Al-Tarjumani. He said: 'He was with Abu Ayyub, and there is no harm in him.' 3870 - And I saw Abu Ibrahim come one day to greet my father. He said to me: 'What does he narrate?' I said: 'He narrates from Shu'ayb bin Safwan, from Ata bin Al-Sa'ib, from Sa'id bin Jubayr: {Indeed, the tree of Zaqqum is the food of the sinner} [Al-Dukhan: 43-44]. He said: "The sinner (Al-Athim) is Abu Jahl."' So he wrote it, and he wrote Hadiths with it. 3871 - I asked Yahya about Muhriz bin Awn. He said: 'There is no harm in him, trustworthy.' I saw Muhriz come one day to greet my father. He said to me: 'What does he narrate?' I said: 'From Hassan bin Ibrahim, from Yunus, from Al-Zuhri, from Urwah, from Aisha, she said: "The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, passed away when he was sixty-three."' So he wrote it from him. 3872 - I asked Yahya about Surayj bin Yunus and Shuja'. He said: 'There is no harm in both of them.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3873 - I asked Yahya about Muhammad bin Al-Faraj, a Sheikh in Dar Raqiq. He said: 'There is no harm in him.' Then he said: 'He is the one who narrates from Muhammad bin Al-Zabriqan.' I said: 'Yes.' He said: 'There is no harm in him.' 3874 - Yahya said to me, initiating from himself, and he mentioned Hasan. He said: 'He is nothing.' 3875 - I said to Yahya: 'Sharik from a Sheikh called Salman Al-Muq'ad.' He said: 'I do not know him.' 3876 - I said to Yahya regarding the Hadith of Waki', from Hammad bin Salamah, from Khalid Al-Hadhdha', from Khalid bin Abi Al-Salt, from Arak, from Aisha, she said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said—meaning the Hadith of facing the Qiblah. I said to him: 'They say: From Waki', from Khalid Al-Wasiti'—and I meant Khalaf. He said: 'No. Waki' told us from Hammad bin Salamah from Khalid Al-Hadhdha'.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3877 - I asked Yahya about Abdullah Al-Umari. He said: 'Weak.' Yahya said to me: 'Ubaydullah bin Umar is among the trustworthy ones.' 3878 - I asked Yahya about Ibrahim bin Khalid Al-San'ani. He said: 'He was a friend of mine, and he was trustworthy, but I did not write any Hadith from him.' My father said to me: 'Trustworthy,' and he praised him well. 3879 - I asked Yahya about Ghawth bin Jabir. He said: 'There was no harm in him. I never wrote a Hadith from him; he used to narrate the wisdom of Wahb.' 3880 - I said to Yahya: 'Abdur-Razzaq is advanced in age.' He said: 'As for when we saw him, he had not reached eighty; he had reached around seventy.' Then Yahya said: 'Abu Ja'far Al-Suwaydi informed me that he, a group of Khurasanis, and a group of people of Hadith came to Abdur-Razzaq with Hadiths of Judge Hisham, and they picked out Hadiths from Ma'mar from the Hadith of Hisham and Ibn Thawr.' Yahya said: 'This Ibn Thawr was trustworthy. So they brought them to Abdur-Razzaq, and he looked into them and said: "Some of these I heard, and some I do not know or did not hear." He said: But they did not leave him until he read them. He did not say to them "Haddathana" (He told us) nor "Akhbarana" (He informed us).' Abu Zakariyya said: 'Abu Ja'far Al-Suwaydi, a companion of ours, informed me of this story.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3881 - I heard Yahya say: I saw Abdur-Razzaq in Mecca narrating. I said to him: 'Did you hear these Hadiths?' He said: 'This is upon you' (ambiguous). 'Some we heard, some we presented (Ard), and some is something mentioned, and all of it is hearing.' 3882 - Yahya said to me: 'I did not write a single Hadith from Abdur-Razzaq except from his entire book.' 3883 - I mentioned to Yahya a brother of Abdur-Razzaq. He said: 'He was a friend of mine, and he was with me in the village. I would sometimes send him to buy something for us, and he was the judge of the village.' 3884 - I said to Yahya: 'Harith Al-Naqqal narrates from Ibn Uyainah the Hadith of Asim bin Kulayb, the Hadith of Wa'il: "I came to the Prophet, peace be upon him, and I had long hair..."' He said: 'Whoever narrates the Hadith of Asim bin Kulayb from Ibn Uyainah is a malicious liar. Harith is nothing.' 3885 - I heard Yahya, and he mentioned Muhriz bin Awn. He said to me: 'He died.' I said: 'Yes.' He said: 'What an excellent man; he was a person of prayer.' End of Part Six, Allah willing. I asked Yahya about Sa'id bin Amr bin Ja'dah. He said: 'He is Ibn Ja'dah bin Hubayrah, trustworthy.' And praise be to Allah alone, and may Allah send blessings upon Muhammad the Prophet and his family and grant them peace abundantly.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: The Sixth Part of the Book of Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
It was read to Abu Ali bin Al-Sawwaf in Sha'ban of the year three hundred and forty-three, and I heard: In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. Abu Abd Al-Rahman Abd Allah bin Muhammad bin Hanbal told us:
3886 - I asked Yahya about Sa'id bin Amr bin Ja'dah. He said: He is Ibn Ja'dah bin Hubayrah, trustworthy (Thiqah). Qasim bin Malik narrated to us from him, and Ibn Uyainah and Al-Mas'udi narrated from him.
3887 - I asked Yahya about a Sheikh from whom Jarir narrated, called Hanif the Muezzin. He said: Yes, Jarir narrated to us from Hanif the Muezzin. I said: How is he? He said: He is a Sheikh. Jarir did not say to us 'from Alqamah from Ali'; Jarir said to us 'from Alqamah' as a Mursal (disconnected) report. I said to Yahya: Whose son is he? He said: Jarir did not give us his lineage.
3888 - My father told me, regarding... and regarding Jarir from Hanif bin Rustam.
3889 - I asked Yahya about Harun bin Al-Mughirah Al-Razi. He said: He is truthful (Saduq), trustworthy. We passed by him in a garden of his in Rayy, so we wrote about five hadiths from him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3890 - I asked Yahya about Abd Al-Malik bin A'yan. He said: A Kufan, there is no harm in him. So I said to him: His brother Humran bin A'yan? He said: He is one of the major Shia; his brother's hadiths are Mursal (disconnected) hadiths.
3891 - I asked Yahya bin Ma'in about Hajjaj Al-Ahwal. He said: Ibn Abi Arubah narrated from him; there is no harm in him. I said to Yahya: Is he trustworthy? He said: Yes, Isma'il narrated to us from him. I said: Whose son is he? He said: I do not know.
3892 - I asked Yahya bin Ma'in about Hajjaj Al-Aswad. He said: Trustworthy. Hammad bin Salamah narrated from him, and Rawh claimed that he heard from him. Yahya said: He is Basran, trustworthy. I asked my father, and he said: Trustworthy.
3893 - Yahya was asked while I was listening about Hajjaj bin Abi Uthman. He said: Basran, trustworthy, there is no harm in him.
3894 - I asked Yahya about Hajjaj bin Dinar. He said: Wasiti. And he made a gesture with his hand, shaking it, as if... I said to Yahya: Shu'bah has narrated from him. He said: Yes.
3895 - I asked Yahya about Hajjaj bin Farafisah. He said: An ascetic man, there is no harm in him. Al-Thawri and Ma'mar narrated from him; there is no harm in him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3896 - Yahya was asked while I was witnessing about Muthanna Al-Qassam. He said: Basran, there is no harm in him. I said to Yahya: Did he hear from Anas? He said: Yes.
3897 - Yahya was asked while I was witnessing about Amr Al-Anqari. He said: There is no harm in him; he narrated to us from Ibn Jurayj; there is no harm in him. I asked my father about him, and he said: Trustworthy.
3898 - I asked Yahya about Salm bin Abd Al-Rahman Al-Nakha'i. He said: Trustworthy, Sufyan narrated from him. I asked my father, and he said: Trustworthy.
3899 - I asked Yahya about Salim bin Abi Al-Ja'd, Ubayd bin Abi Al-Ja'd, and Ziyad bin Abi Al-Ja'd. He said: They are all brothers. I asked my father, he said: They are all brothers.
3900 - I asked Yahya about Al-Salt bin Dinar Abu Shu'ayb. He said: Basran, he is nothing. I asked my father, and he said: Abandoned (Matruk).
3901 - I asked Yahya about Abbas Al-Ansari. He said: He is not trustworthy. I said: Why, O Abu Zakariyya? He said: He narrated from Sa'id, from Abbad, from Jabir bin Zaid, from Ibn Abbas: 'When it is the year two hundred...' A fabricated hadith. Then he said: He is not trustworthy.
3902 - I said to Yahya: What about the Readings (Qira'at) from Imran bin Hudayr and from the Sheikhs? He said: He is not trustworthy.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3903 - I asked Yahya about Ubayd bin Sa'id Al-Qurashi. He said: There is no harm in him, trustworthy. I have seen him, and he was younger than Abu Ahmad Al-Zubayri and these young ones, and he is the brother of Yahya bin Sa'id Al-Umawi. I said to him: He narrated from Sufyan from Mansur from Hilal bin Yasaf from Abd Allah bin Zalim from So-and-so bin Hayyan from Sa'id bin Zaid. Yahya rejected it and said: No, Abd Allah bin Zalim heard it from Sa'id bin Zaid.
3904 - I asked Yahya, I said: A Sheikh in Kufa called Zakariyya Al-Kisa'i? He said: An evil man, he narrates evil hadith. I said to Yahya: Indeed, he has said to me that you wrote from him. So Yahya turned his face to the Qiblah and swore by Allah emphatically that he does not know him, nor did he come to him, nor did he write from him, unless he saw him on a road while not knowing him. Then Yahya said: He deserves that a pit be dug for him and then he be thrown into it.
3905 - I asked Yahya bin Ma'in about Isma'il bin Mujalid bin Sa'id. He said: I have written from him; he used to narrate from the Sheikhs, from Abu Ishaq, Simak, and Bayan; there is no harm in him. I asked my father, and he said: I do not see him as anything but truthful.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3906 - I heard Yahya saying: I used to consider this son of his, Umar bin Isma'il bin Mujalid, a little scoundrel (shuwaytir), nothing, a liar, an evil man, malicious. He narrated from Abu Mu'awiyah a hadith that has no basis, a lie, from Al-A'mash from Mujahid from Ibn Abbas from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace: 'Ali is the city of knowledge' or words to this effect.
3907 - I asked Yahya about a Sheikh who resides in Karkh, a teacher called Al-Hasan bin Shabib. He said: I do not know him.
3908 - I asked Yahya about Imran Al-Qattan. He said: Abu Al-Awwam bin Dawar, weak in Hadith.
3909 - I asked Yahya about Isma'il bin Ayyash. He said: If he narrates from the trustworthy Sheikhs, Muhammad bin Ziyad and Shurahbil bin Muslim. I said to Yahya: Did you write from Isma'il bin Ayyash? He said: Yes, I heard something from him, and Yahya narrated to us from him.
3910 - I asked him about Abu Hurrah. He said: Good (Salih) in his hadith from Al-Hasan, but they say he did not hear them from Al-Hasan. And Abu Hurrah's name is Wasil bin Abd Al-Rahman.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3911 - I asked Yahya about the brother of Abu Hurrah. He said: His name is Sa'id bin Abd Al-Rahman, he narrated from Ibn Sirin; there is no harm in him.
3912 - I asked Yahya about Jarir bin Hazim. He said: There is no harm in him. I said to him: He narrates objectionable (Manakir) hadiths from Qatadah from Anas. He said: He is nothing; he is weak regarding Qatadah.
3913 - I asked Yahya about Mubarak bin Fadalah. He said: Weak, he is like Al-Rabi' bin Sabih in weakness.
3914 - Abu Abd Al-Rahman told us, he said: Ahmad bin Ibrahim Al-Dawraqi told us, he said: Hajjaj told us, he said: I asked Shu'bah about Mubarak and Rabi', so he said: Mubarak is more beloved to me than him.
3915 - I heard Yahya say: Al-Hakam bin Musa, there is no harm in him.
3916 - I asked Yahya about Al-Hakam bin Aban Al-Abdi. He said: Trustworthy.
3917 - I asked Yahya about Ibrahim bin Al-Hakam bin Aban. He said: He is nothing; he is not trustworthy.
3918 - I asked my father about Ibrahim bin Al-Hakam. He said: At the time we saw him, there was no harm in him. Then he said: I think he said: His hadith increased after us, and he did not praise him.
3919 - I asked Yahya about Musa bin Abd Al-Aziz. He said: Ibn Al-Qanbari, I do not see any harm in him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3920 - I asked Yahya, I said: A Sheikh from whom Waki' narrated, called Al-Bara' bin Sulaym. He said: Kufan, Waki' narrated to us from him from Nafi' from Ibn Umar. He said: I do not see any harm in him.
3921 - I asked Yahya about Al-Ala' bin Abi Al-Abbas Al-Sha'ir. He said: Trustworthy. I said to Yahya: And his father? He said: Trustworthy; Habib bin Abi Thabit, Amr bin Dinar, and Ata' bin Abi Rabah narrated from him. I said to Yahya: What is his name? He said: Al-Sa'ib bin Farrukh. And I asked my father, and he said: Al-Sa'ib bin Farrukh.
3922 - I said to Yahya: A Sheikh from whom Mu'tamir narrated, called Abu Ubaydah, from Dimam, from Jabir bin Zaid, that he disliked eating while reclining. Who is this Abu Ubaydah? He said: A man from whom Mu'tamir narrated, there is no harm in him, called Abd Allah bin Al-Qasim. I said: Who narrated from him other than Al-Mu'tamir? He said: The Basrans narrate this from him. I said to Yahya: So this Dimam from whom Abu Ubaydah narrated, who is he? He said: A Sheikh from whom Jabir bin Zaid narrated; this Abu Ubaydah narrated from him, and Ma'mar narrated from him—meaning Dimam.
3923 - I asked my father about this Abu Ubaydah. He said: His name is Abd Allah bin Qasim, he is called Kawrin.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3924 - I asked Yahya, I said: Mu'tamir from Abu Ubaydah from Umarah bin Hayyan from Jabir bin Zaid. Who is this Umarah bin Hayyan? He said: A man from whom this Abu Ubaydah narrated, from the companions of Jabir bin Zaid. And Abu Ubaydah has narrated from Salih Al-Dahhan. I heard Yahya say: Abu Ubaydah did not hear from Jabir bin Zaid; [he narrated] from a man from him.
3925 - I said to Yahya: Mu'tamir from Zuhair bin Ishaq from Yunus from Al-Hasan: 'The greeting (Salam) suffices for entering (or leaving).' He said: This is nothing. And he weakened him and said: He is nothing; he is not worth a penny.
3926 - I asked Yahya about Ruh bin Ata bin Abi Maymunah. He said: Abu Dawud narrated from him, and he is weak in Hadith. I asked my father, and he said: Objectionable (Munkar).
3927 - I asked my father, I said: Muhammad bin Marwan Al-Uqayli, a Basran Sheikh from whom Ibn Abi Shaybah narrated to us? He said: There is no harm in him; I have written hadiths from him from Umarah bin Abi Hafsah and from others besides Umarah. I said to him: Did he have a hadith from Abd Al-Malik bin Abi Nadrah from his father from Abu Sa'id? He said: Yes, I heard from him: from Abd Al-Malik from his father from Abu Sa'id: {When you contract a debt for a specified term...} [Al-Baqarah: 282].

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3928 - I said to Yahya bin Ma'in: Does he not narrate from Yunus from Al-Hasan 'The greeting suffices for entering'? He said: No, he narrated it from Hisham from Al-Hasan, so Zuhair bin Ishaq narrated it from Yunus from Al-Hasan, and I do not see any basis for any of them.
3929 - I said to Yahya: A Sheikh from whom Mu'tamir narrated, called Aban Al-Suraymi Abu Mis'ar? He said: There is no harm in him; he litigated before Abd Al-Malik bin Ya'la.
3930 - My father told me, he said: Mu'tamir told us, from Abu Mis'ar Aban Al-Suraymi, he said: I heard Al-Hasan say: 'He narrates the truth'.
3931 - I asked Yahya about Amr bin Al-Walid Al-Aghdaf. He said: He was in charge of the judiciary of Fars; I do not see any harm in him. Then he said to me: From whom does he narrate? I said: From Thawr and from the Sheikhs. He said: And who narrates from him? I said: Ubayd Allah Al-Qawariri narrated to us from him. I heard my father say: Mu'adh bin Mu'adh told us, he said: Al-Aghdaf Amr bin Al-Walid told us.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3932 - I heard Yahya mentioning Yusuf bin Khalid Al-Samti. He said: A liar, malicious, an enemy of Allah, an evil man, an adversary to the religion; no one with any good in him narrates from him. I saw him countless times in Basra.
3933 - I heard Yahya mentioning Umar bin Ali bin Muqaddam. He said: I did not write anything from him. His origin is Wasiti, he settled in Basra. He used to practice Tadlis (concealing sources), but there was no harm in him; he had a good appearance.
3934 - I heard my father mention Umar bin Ali, so he praised him well and said: He used to practice Tadlis.
3935 - And I heard my father say: Hajjaj, I heard him—meaning another hadith. My father said: Thus he used to practice Tadlis.
3936 - And I asked Yahya about his son Asim bin Umar bin Ali. He said: There is no harm in him; he does not know how to lie.
3937 - And I asked him about Sahl Al-Sarraj. He said: There is no harm in him, and he is Sahl bin Abi Al-Salt.
3938 - I asked Yahya about Al-Hakam bin Atiyyah who narrates from Thabit. He said: There is no harm in him.
3939 - He was asked while I was listening about Yazid Al-Nahwi. He said: Khurasani, trustworthy.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3940 - I heard Yahya say: I never wrote a single hadith from Abd Al-Razzaq except from his book. No, by Allah, I never wrote a hadith from him except from his book.
3941 - I said to Yahya: Ibn Uyainah from Qa'nab? He said: A man from the people of Kufa; Ibn Uyainah narrated to us from him.
3942 - Yahya was asked while I was listening about Kadih bin Ja'far. He said: I do not know him.
3943 - I asked my father about him, and he said: There is no harm in him. I said to Yahya: Did Ayyub Al-Sakhtiyani hear from Abu Uthman Al-Nahdi? He said: Yes, he has narrated from him. I said: Did he hear from him? He said: Yes.
3944 - I heard a man say to Yahya: Do you memorize from Abd Al-Razzaq from Ma'mar from Abu Ishaq from Asim bin Damrah from Ali from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, that he wiped over the splints/bandages? He said: False! Ma'mar never narrated this at all. I heard Yahya say: Upon him is a garlanded, covered sacrificial camel [as a penalty for a false oath] if Ma'mar ever narrated this! This is false. And if Abd Al-Razzaq narrated this, his blood would be lawful (Halal). Who narrated this from Abd Al-Razzaq? They said to him: So-and-so. He said: No, by Allah, Ma'mar did not narrate it, and upon him is a Hajj from here—meaning the mosque—to Mecca if Ma'mar narrated this.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3945 - Abu Abd Al-Rahman said: And this hadith, they narrate it from Isra'il from Amr bin Khalid from Zaid bin Ali from his fathers from Ali that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, wiped over the splints/bandages. And Amr bin Khalid's hadith is worth nothing.
3946 - I heard Abbas bin Muhammad Al-Duri saying to Yahya while I was listening: Hammam bin Nafi', the father of Abd Al-Razzaq, did he hear from Ikrimah? He said: Yes, his father heard from Ikrimah, and I hope that there is no harm in his father. I said to Yahya: Has Ibn Al-Mubarak not narrated from him? He said: Yes.
3947 - I asked Yahya about Al-Walid bin Abi Thawr. He said: He is nothing.
3948 - I asked Yahya about Sinan bin Harun and Saif bin Harun. He said: Sinan bin Harun is more trustworthy than Saif, and he is above him. I said: Indeed, Saif narrated from Al-Taymi from Abu Uthman from Salman from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, regarding the towns. He said: Saif is nothing.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3949 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, from Sinan Al-Burjumi. I said to Yahya: Salamah bin Kuhayl from Abu Al-Mughirah: 'I asked Ibn Umar about Al-Ma'un'? He said: He is Ali bin Rabi'ah; this is what Sa'id bin Ubayd said.
3950 - I asked Yahya about Al-Tamimi from whom Abu Ishaq narrated. He said: His name is Arbadah.
3951 - My father told me, he said: Mu'tamir told us, from Abu Mis'ar Aban Al-Suraymi, he said: A dispute was brought to Abd Al-Malik bin Ya'la regarding a slave girl who eats clay. He said: 'If she wished, she would not eat it.' He said: And I heard Al-Hasan reciting: '{He narrates the truth}'.
3952 - Harun bin Ma'ruf and Yahya bin Ma'in told us, they said: Isma'il bin Ayyash told us, from Shurahbil bin Muslim, from Abu Umamah, from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, he said: 'The guarantor is a debtor'.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3953 - I asked Yahya: Did Tawus hear from Abu Musa Al-Ash'ari? He said: Yes, Tawus said: 'I heard Abu Musa.' I said to Yahya: Did he hear anything from Aisha? He said: No, I do not think so. And he heard from Ibn Abbas, Ibn Umar, and Abu Musa—meaning Tawus.
3954 - I asked Yahya, I said: Shu'bah from Abu Shu'ayb Al-Shami? He said: He is actually Basran; he had a son in Basra who narrated. I said: So whoever said 'Al-Shami'? He said: He made a mistake; he is only Basran.
3955 - I asked Yahya about Ubayd bin Sa'id. He said: There is no harm in him; he is the brother of Yahya bin Sa'id Al-Umawi. He was not of that [old] age; he was younger than Abu Ahmad Al-Kufi; he was not old. I have seen him myself.
3956 - My father said: Abu Ru'bah, his name is Shaddad bin Imran Al-Qaysi.
3957 - I asked Yahya about Muhammad bin Abi Isma'il. He said: Yahya Al-Qattan narrated from him; he is Kufan and he is trustworthy, and his father's name is Rashid.
3958 - Yahya was asked while I was listening about Abd Al-Majid bin Abi Rawad. He said: Trustworthy, there is no harm in him.
3959 - I asked Yahya about Shihab bin Sharnafah. He said: Ibn Al-Mubarak and our companions narrated from him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3960 - I said to Yahya: Ibn Abi Rawad narrated from Ibn Jurayj from Yahya bin Sa'id from Amrah from Aisha from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, regarding the Aqiqah. He said: This is in the books of Ibn Jurayj from a man from Yahya from Amrah from Aisha from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace.
3961 - I said to Yahya: Waki' narrated to us from Sufyan from Salamah bin Kuhayl from Bukayr from Sa'id bin Jubayr: 'I heard Ibn Umar saying on Al-Safa: O Allah, forgive me my sins, O Allah, ease me to the easy [path].' Who is this Bukayr? He said: A man from whom Salamah bin Kuhayl narrated. I said to him: Is he Bukayr bin Atiq? He said: No, this is a man from whom Salamah narrated.
3962 - I said to Yahya: Indeed, Ubayd Allah Al-Qawariri narrated to us from Ibn Mahdi from Jami' bin Matar from Abu Zawiyyah: 'I saw a black turban on Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri.' He said: He made a mistake. Others narrated it to us from Jami' bin Matar from Abu Ru'bah. Ubayd Allah misspelled it; he does not know who Abu Zawiyyah is.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
3963 - I said to Yahya: Salamah bin Kuhayl from Abu Al-Za'ra? He said: His name is Abd Allah bin Hani. I asked my father, and he said: Abd Allah bin Hani.
3964 - I asked Yahya about Abbad bin Layth, the owner of the Karabis (clothes/textiles). He said: The one who narrates from Abd Al-Hamid Abu Wahb from Al-Adda' bin Khalid bin Hawdhah? I said: Yes. He said: He is nothing—meaning Abbad bin Layth.
3965 - I asked Yahya about Attab bin Al-Muthanna. He said: There is no harm in him; he narrated from Bahz bin Hakim. I heard Yahya say: Mu'tamir bin Sulayman, when it was Friday, and he was an old man, would tie his waist with a turban due to old age and weakness, and go to the congregational mosque and pray. I said to him: Did you see Mu'tamir having a Jummah (hair reaching the shoulders)? He said: Yes, a small Jummah. I heard Abbas Al-Narsi say: They annoyed Mu'tamir one day, so he swore not to narrate except from a living man. So he narrated from Ibn Uyainah, Ibn Al-Mubarak, and Abd Al-Razzaq. I heard my father say: Mu'tamir had a Jummah, and he used to complete the Quran every Friday. When it was the day of his completion, people would gather to him, then he would supplicate when he finished the completion.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3966 - I heard Yahya say: I heard from Mu'tamar the entire Hadith of Salm bin Abi Al-Dhayyal. He said: And Mu'tamar heard from Salm bin Abi Al-Dhayyal his Hadith regarding the sea; he used to go on military expeditions with him. 3967 - I asked Yahya about Aslam Al-Minqari. He said: He was trustworthy. I said: Whose son is he? He said: I do not know. 3968 - I heard Yahya mention Abu Musa Al-Zaman, and he said: Trustworthy. 3969 - I asked Yahya, saying to him: Ibn Al-Mubarak from Ya'qub bin Al-Qa'qa'? He said: A trustworthy Khurasani. 3970 - Yahya was asked while I was listening about Yahya bin Bishr. He said: A trustworthy man from the people of Khurasan. It was said to him: Ibn Al-Mubarak from Umarah from Ikrimah in Tafsir? He said: A trustworthy Sheikh called Umarah Al-Iskandarani. 3971 - I asked Yahya, saying: Al-Taymi from Al-Hadrami? He said: A Sheikh from whom Mu'tamar narrated, from his father, from Al-Hadrami. I said to Yahya: Is he trustworthy? He said: There is no harm in him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3972 - I heard Yahya say: Ikrimah bin Ammar has narrated from Yahya bin Abi Kathir from Al-Hadrami bin Lahiq, and he is not the one from whom Al-Taymi narrated; this is another man. 3973 - I asked Yahya, saying: Did Ibn Abi Dhi'b hear anything from Al-Zuhri? He said: He presented [readings] to Al-Zuhri, and his Hadith from Al-Zuhri is weak. Then he said: They are considered weak in [narrating from] Al-Zuhri. 3974 - I said to Yahya: Yahya Al-Qattan says about Ibn Abi Dhi'b: 'Al-Zuhri told me.' He said: The proponents of 'presentation' (Al-Ard) view that [as permissible]—meaning by his saying 'He told me' when he had presented [the text to him]. 3975 - Yahya was asked while I was listening about Rayhan bin Sa'id. He said: He narrated from Abbad bin Mansur. It was said to him: What do you say about him? He shook his head and then said: I see no harm in him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3976 - I said to Yahya regarding the Hadith of Abu Mu'awiyah from Suhail, from his father, from Ibn Umar: 'We used to say while the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was alive: Abu Bakr, Umar, and Uthman.' I said to him: Al-Hakam bin Musa narrated it to me and added to it: 'Suhail said to me: I will take you to the one who narrated this Hadith. So he took me to Ibn Nafi', and he narrated this Hadith to me. And Suhail said to me: Keep it secret for me until I die; do not let the Khashabiyyah of the people of Iraq insult me.' Yahya said: This speech is the story of Ibn Nafi'; it has no basis. Al-Hakam is from the Companions of the Cave (Ashab Al-Kahf - implying secluded or old-fashioned). I heard this Hadith from Abu Mu'awiyah multiple times saying: 'It seemed to Al-Hakam regarding this story.' 3977 - Yahya was asked while I was listening about Salm bin Qutaibah. He said: Trustworthy, truthful, there is no harm in him. 3978 - I asked Yahya about Abu Jabir Al-Bayadi. He said: He is not trustworthy. Ibn Abi Dhi'b narrated from him, and his name is Muhammad bin Abdurrahman Abu Jabir Al-Bayadi. 3979 - I asked Yahya about Salih Mawla Al-Taw'amah. He said: He is not strong in Hadith. I said: Abu Bakr bin Ayyash narrated from him? He said: No, that is another man. 3980 - Yahya was asked while I was listening about Al-Wazi' bin Nafi'. He said: He is not trustworthy. He is an Uqayli from the people of Al-Jazirah. And I asked my father about him, and he said: His Hadith is nothing. 3981 - I asked Yahya about Ali bin Thabit Al-Jazari. He said: There is no harm in him if he narrates from trustworthy people.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3982 - I asked Yahya about Nuh bin Abi Bilal. He said: Trustworthy, from the people of Medina. Ali bin Thabit narrated from him. 3983 - I asked Yahya about Abdullah bin Yazid, the client of Al-Aswad bin Sufyan. He said: Trustworthy. Malik and Laith bin Sa'd narrated from him. There is no harm in him. 3984 - I asked Yahya about Abdullah bin Yazid. He said: He narrated from Ali bin Thabit; there is no harm in him, trustworthy. He is Abdullah bin Yazid bin Fantas. 3985 - I asked Yahya about Al-Mustamir bin Al-Rayyan. He said: Shu'bah narrated from him. I said to Yahya: Did he hear from Anas? He said: Yes, and from Abu Al-Jawza'. My father said: Al-Mustamir is a trustworthy Sheikh. 3986 - I asked Yahya about Khulaid bin Ja'far. He said: Trustworthy. Shu'bah narrated from him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3987 - I asked Yahya about Al-Nadr bin Arabi. He said: There is no harm in him. Most of his Hadith is visions: 'I saw so-and-so,' 'I saw Tawus.' There is no harm in him. My father said: Trustworthy. 3988 - I asked Yahya about Ma'qil bin Ubaydullah. He said: There is no harm in him. My father said: Trustworthy. 3989 - I asked Yahya about Imran Al-Qattan. He said: Weak in Hadith. Then he said: He is Imran bin Dawar Abu Al-Awwam. My father said: I hope he is upright (Salih) in Hadith. 3990 - I asked Yahya, saying: A man who is blind—and I named a man—who memorizes some Hadiths and does not memorize others. He said: Do not write except what he memorizes. Meaning: what he does not memorize is nothing. I returned to the subject, and he said: He is nothing. I said: What if I take it from a trustworthy man then ask him? He said: He is nothing. 3991 - I asked Yahya about Asim bin Abi Al-Najud, how is his Hadith? He said: There is no harm in him. And I asked my father, and he said: Asim is among the people of goodness, but Shu'bah used to choose Al-A'mash over him in verifying Hadith.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3992 - Abu Abdurrahman said: Zuhair bin Harb told me—and the Hadith of Asim bin Abi Al-Najud was mentioned—so he said: It is inconsistent (Mudtarib), turn away from it. 3993 - I heard Zuhair bin Harb say: One day we asked Yazid bin Harun about a Sheikh from whom he narrates. I said—or we said—we do not know him. He said: Allah has concealed him from you. 3994 - Abu Khaithamah Zuhair bin Harb told me, from Affan, from Shu'bah, he said: The nephew of Hamid Al-Tawil used to benefit me regarding Muhammad bin Ziyad—meaning Hammad bin Salamah. 3995 - My father told me, he said Affan told us, he said I heard Shu'bah say: Indeed, the nephew of Hamid—may he be rewarded with good—used to benefit me regarding Muhammad bin Ziyad. 3996 - Abu Khaithamah told me, from Abu Abdullah Al-Barkani, from Muhammad bin Jabir, from Al-A'mash, from Abu Wa'il, he said: Rarely did the young camels trample you, and rarely did you eat 'Ilhiz' (a mixture of blood and fur eaten in famine). 3997 - Abu Khaithamah told me, he said Yahya bin Abi Bukayr told me, he said my father told me: Shahr bin Hawshab entered the treasury and took a bag of Dirhams. So the poet said about him: 'Shahr sold his religion for a bag / So who will trust the reciters (Qurra') after you, O Shahr?'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 3998 - I asked Yahya bin Ma'in about Abu Ma'shar Al-Madini who narrates from Sa'id Al-Maqburi and Muhammad bin Ka'b. He said: He is not strong in Hadith. 3999 - I asked Yahya about Yahya Al-Jabir. He said: He is Yahya bin Al-Harith, weak in Hadith. 4000 - My father said: Yahya Al-Jabir, there is no harm in him. But the one whom Yahya Al-Jabir narrates from, Abu Majid, is not known. 4001 - My father said: Yahya Al-Jabir is Yahya bin Abdullah Abu Al-Harith. 4002 - I asked Yahya about Abdul-Aziz bin Suhaib. He said: Trustworthy. 4003 - I asked Yahya about Yahya bin Abi Ishaq. He said: Trustworthy. I said: Which of them is more trustworthy? He said: Both are trustworthy. 4004 - I asked Yahya about Al-Harith bin Ubaid Abu Qudamah Al-Iyadi. He said: Weak in Hadith. 4005 - I asked my father, and he said: He is inconsistent (Mudtarib) in Hadith. 4006 - I asked Yahya about Salam bin Abi Muti'. He said: There is no harm in him. My father said: Trustworthy. 4007 - I asked Yahya about Al-Qasim bin Al-Fadl Al-Haddani. He said: There is no harm in him. 4008 - I asked Yahya about Farqad Al-Sabakhi. He said: There is no harm in him, a poor man (Miskin). 4009 - I asked Yahya about Mughirah bin Ziyad Al-Mawsili. He said: There is no harm in him. 4010 - I asked my father, and he said: He is inconsistent (Mudtarib) in Hadith.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4011 - I heard Yahya say: Mughirah has one rejected (Munkar) Hadith. I said to my father: How so? He said: He narrated from Ata from Ibn Abbas regarding a man whom a funeral passes by. He said: He performs Tayammum and prays. He said: And this was narrated by Ibn Jurayj and Abdullah from Ata as his own saying, without mentioning Ibn Abbas, and these are more established than him. He said: And he narrated from Ata from Aisha: 'Whoever prays twelve Rak'ahs in a day...' He said: While people narrate it from Ata from Anbasah from Umm Habiba. He said: And he narrated from Ata from Aisha that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to shorten the prayer in travel and complete it. He said: And people narrate this from Ata from another man, it is not from Aisha. 4012 - I heard my father say: Every Hadith that Mughirah bin Ziyad raised (attributed to the Prophet) is rejected (Munkar).

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4013 - I asked Yahya about Ibrahim bin Al-Muhajir. He said: Weak in Hadith. I said to Yahya: Al-Suddi? He said: They are close in weakness. 4014 - I asked Yahya about Ata bin Al-Sa'ib. He said: He became confused (mixed up). So whoever heard from him before the confusion, it is good. And whoever heard from him after the confusion, it is nothing. 4015 - I said to Yahya: Is Yazid bin Abi Ziyad below Ata? He said: Yes. 4016 - And Yahya said: Whoever heard from Ata while he was confused, then Yazid is above Ata. I said to Yahya: Is Layth bin Abi Sulaim weaker than Ata and Yazid? He said: Yes. 4017 - I asked Yahya about Sulayman Abu Al-Mughirah. He said: Trustworthy. 4018 - I asked Yahya about Qabus bin Abi Dhabyan. He said: Weak in Hadith. 4019 - My father said: And Jarir was asked about something from the Hadith of Qabus, so he said: 'Qabus has perished (or his goods are worthless), perished.' 4020 - I asked my father about him. He said: People narrated from him. 4021 - I asked Yahya about Abu Al-Muhajjal. He said: Trustworthy. I said: Whose son is he? He said: I do not know. 4022 - I said to Yahya: Mukhariq Al-Ahmasi? He said: Trustworthy. 4023 - I said to Yahya: Tariq bin Abdurrahman? He said: Trustworthy.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4024 - I asked Yahya about Hisham bin Hujair, and he weakened him greatly. I said to Yahya: A Sheikh from whom Ibn Uyainah and Ma'mar narrated, called Amr bin Muslim? He said: The Janadi? I said: Yes. He said: He is weaker than Hisham bin Hujair, and he weakened Amr. 4025 - I said to Yahya: Is Hisham bin Hujair more beloved to you than Amr? He said: Yes.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4026 - I said to Yahya: Husain from Abu Malik, what is his name? He said: His name is Ghazwan. I said to him: Is he the one from whom Al-Suddi narrates? He said: Yes. 4027 - I said to Yahya: Are Ata bin Yasar and Sulayman bin Yasar brothers? He said: Yes. My father said: They are brothers. 4028 - I said to Yahya: Is Sa'id bin Yasar their brother? He said: No. 4029 - I asked my father, and he said: He is not their brother. 4030 - I asked Yahya about Abdullah bin Ma'qil and Abdurrahman bin Ma'qil, are they brothers? He said: Yes, they are from Muzaynah. 4031 - I asked Yahya about Harithah bin Mudarrib and Khalid bin Mudarrib, are they brothers? He said: I do not know; Abu Ishaq narrated from both of them. 4032 - I said to Yahya: Sufyan from Al-Salt Al-Raba'i? He said: Sufyan narrated one letter (Hadith) from him; there is no harm in him. 4033 - I said to Yahya: Did Yunus bin Ubayd hear from Nafi'? He said: He narrates from Ibn Nafi'. I heard my father say: Yunus bin Ubayd did not hear from Nafi'. 4034 - I said to Yahya: Matar Al-Warraq? He said: Weak in the Hadith of Ata bin Abi Rabah.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4035 - I asked Yahya about Abdul-Wahhab Al-Thaqafi. He said: Trustworthy. I said to Yahya: Which is more beloved, he or Abdul-A'la Al-Sami? He said: Al-Thaqafi is more beloved to me than Abdul-A'la. 4036 - I asked Yahya about Mahbub bin Al-Hasan who narrates from Khalid Al-Hadhdha'. He said: The people of Hadith wrote from him; there is no harm in him. 4037 - I asked Yahya about Musa Al-Juhani. He said: Trustworthy. My father said: Musa Al-Juhani is trustworthy. 4038 - I said to Yahya: Waki' from Sufyan from Ata bin Al-Sa'ib from a man called Maimun from Maysarah Abu Salih. Who is this Maimun? He said: I do not know him, or I do not know. 4039 - I asked Yahya about Layth. He said: He is weaker than Yazid bin Abi Ziyad; Yazid is above him in Hadith.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4040 - I asked Yahya about Kaysan Abu Umar. He said: A Sheikh, weak in Hadith; Muhammad bin Rabi'ah narrated from him. I heard Yahya say: No one narrated from Harithah bin Mudarrib except Abu Ishaq. 4041 - Abu Abdurrahman said: Bashir bin Ka'b, his Kunyah is Abu Ayyub. Abu Khaithamah narrated it to me, he said Mu'adh bin Hisham told us, he said my father told me, from Qatadah, from Al-Ala bin Ziyad, from Abu Ayyub Bashir bin Ka'b. 4042 - Abu Khaithamah told me, he said I heard Yahya bin Sa'id say: Whoever wants to write the Hadith of Hammad bin Salamah, let him stick to Affan bin Muslim. 4043 - Abu Khaithamah told me, Yahya bin Sa'id said: Shu'bah used to narrate saying: Al-Taymi said: There is nothing in a drink of Nabidh for which a man would risk his religion. 4044 - Abu Khaithamah told me, he said Quraysh bin Anas told us, he said Habib bin Al-Shahid told us, he said: Ibn Sirin said to me: Ask Al-Hasan from whom he heard his Hadith regarding Aqiqah. I asked him, and he said: I heard it from Samurah—meaning Ibn Jundub. 4045 - Abu Khaithamah told me, he said Sufyan bin Uyainah told us, he said Ali bin Zaid told us: Umar bin Abdul-Aziz wished for a session with Ubaidullah bin Abdullah bin Utbah in exchange for blood money (Diyah).

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4046 - My father told me, he said Waki' told us, he said Ata Abu Muhammad told us, he said: I went with my father to Ali, so he wiped my head and prayed for blessing for me. He said: And I saw a whip with him. 4047 - My father told me, he said Waki' told us, he said Ali bin Salih told us, from Ata Abu Muhammad, he said: I saw Ali bin Abi Talib wearing a cotton shirt, unwashed. 4048 - My father told me, he said Al-Walid bin Al-Qasim told us, he said Ata told us that his father brought him to Ali bin Abi Talib. He said: I had a forelock, so he wiped my head and said: 'O Allah, bless him.' I have continued to see the blessing. 4049 - My father told me, he said Muhammad bin Rabi'ah told us, he said Ali bin Salih told us, he said Ata Abu Muhammad told me, he said: I saw Ali buy a Sunbulani shirt (a type of garment). He said: He wore it and did not wash it, and he prayed in it. 4050 - My father told me, he said Ali bin Bahr told us, he said Isa bin Yunus told us, from Al-A'mash, he said: Sa'id bin Ashwa' came to us, and we asked him about an issue, and he made a mistake. So he went to Al-Sha'bi, and he said to him: 'Did I not tell you not to sit with the companions of Ibrahim?' 4051 - My father told me, he said Abu Mu'awiyah told us, he said Al-A'mash told us, he said: I went and presented a man to Ibn Ashwa' regarding something he mentioned.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4052 - I asked my father about the Hadith of Maimunah bint Al-Harith that she entrusted her matter to Al-Abbas, so he married her to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace; is this Hadith authentic? My father said: This Hadith has no basis. And he said: 'The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace'—is this Hadith authentic? And he said: 'The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, proposed for Hafsa to Umar, so he married him.' Al-Zuhri, from Salim, from Ibn Umar, from Umar: The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, proposed for her—meaning Hafsa—so he married him. And the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, proposed to Abu Bakr, so he married him. My father said: Shu'bah said: Al-Hakam did not hear from Miqsam except four Hadiths, and this is not among them. 4053 - My father said: And Ibn Abi Layla narrated from Al-Hakam, from Miqsam, from Ibn Abbas; Shu'bah narrated it from him saying: From Mujahid. 4054 - I heard my father say: Mughirah bin Ziyad, his Hadiths are rejected (Manakir). He narrated from Ata from Aisha from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace: 'Whoever prays twelve Rak'ahs in a day...' while they narrate it from Ata from Anbasah from Umm Habiba. 4055 - And the Hadith of Ata from Ibn Abbas regarding the funeral passing by someone who does not have ablution, he said: He performs Tayammum. My father said: Abdul-Malik and Ibn Jurayj narrated it from Ata as his own statement (Mawquf), they did not say 'from Ibn Abbas,' and they contradicted Mughirah bin Ziyad. 4056 - And he mentioned Mughirah bin Ziyad and said: His Hadiths are rejected (Manakir). 4057 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Ismail bin Aban—meaning Al-Warraq Abu Ishaq—told us, he said Yahya bin Abi Za'idah told us, from Sulayman bin Bilal, from Yahya bin Sa'id, from Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib, he said: Noah begot three people: Japheth, Shem, and Ham. Japheth is the father of the Arabs, the Romans, and the Persians. Shem is the father of Gog and Magog, the Turks, and the Slavs. And Ham is the father of the Berbers, the Copts, and the Sudanese.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4058 - I found in my father's book: Ishaq bin Sulayman Al-Razi Abu Yahya told us in the year ninety-nine, he said Kathir Abu Al-Nadr told us, from Rib'i bin Hirash. Ishaq said: I met Kathir in Mecca—meaning in the year forty-eight. 4059 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Yahya bin Adam told us, he said Abu Zubaid told us, from Sufyan bin Sa'id, he said: Al-Mukhtar asked Asim bin Damrah about the fear prayer (Salat Al-Khawf) while in residence. Asim said: He prays four. Al-Mukhtar said: We did not find anything with your Uwaisim—or Uwaisim. 4060 - I heard my father say: Abdurrahman bin Zamrad—meaning Al-Adani—his Kunyah is Abu Al-Fath. He narrated from Jabir bin Abdullah. And Al-Hakam bin Aban narrated from Abdurrahman bin Zamrad. 4061 - My father told me, he said: Al-Hakam bin Aban used the Kunyah Abu Isa. He said: Al-Hakam bin Aban died in the year one hundred and fifty-four, and he was eighty-four years old. And Ikrimah entered Aden in the year one hundred.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4062 - My father told me, he said Abdullah bin Mu'awiyah bin Asim bin Al-Mundhir bin Al-Zubair Abu Mu'awiyah told us, he said he came to us in Mecca, he said Hisham bin Urwah told us, from his father: That Al-Zubair bin Al-Awwam, when his sons or children gathered around him, would turn to them—and he mentioned the Hadith. He said: Then he would turn to Abdullah bin Al-Zubair and say to him: 'You are the most resembling of people to Abu Bakr.' 4063 - Mus'ab bin Abdullah Al-Zubairi told us, he said my father told me, from Hisham bin Urwah, from his father, he said: Al-Zubair used to bounce me (on his lap/shoulder) and say: '...White from the family of Abu Atiq... Blessed from the offspring of Al-Siddiq... I find him sweet as I find my saliva sweet.' 4064 - My father told me, he said Mu'ammal told us, he said Sufyan told us, from Asim, from Abu Mijlaz, he said: The name of the companion of Ya-Sin was Habib bin Murri. 4065 - I asked my father about Al-Nadr Al-Khazzaz Abu Umar. He said: Weak in Hadith. 4066 - My father told me, he said Abu Al-Qasim bin Abi Al-Zinad told us, from his brother Abdurrahman, from his father Abu Al-Zinad, he said: Umar bin Abdul-Aziz said: 'A session with the blind Ubaidullah bin Abdullah bin Utbah bin Mas'ud is more beloved to me than a thousand Dinars.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4067 - Abu Khaithamah told me, he said Sufyan told us, from Mis'ar, from Amr bin Murrah, from Abu Ubaidah: He mentioned a Hadith, so it was said to him: 'Who told you?' He said: 'Indeed, I did not lie; Masruq told me.' 4068 - Abu Khaithamah told me, he said Sufyan bin Uyainah told us, he said Amr said: Tawus said to me: 'Let us go and sit with the people.' We found a man with a group around him, and it was Bashir bin Ka'b. Tawus said: 'I saw this man come to Ibn Abbas and start narrating to him. Ibn Abbas said: It is as if I am hearing the Hadith of Abu Hurairah.' 4069 - Abu Khaithamah told us, he said Sufyan told us, from Hisham bin Hujair, from Tawus, he said: Bashir bin Ka'b narrated to him, so Ibn Abbas said to him: 'Repeat Hadith so-and-so.' Two or three times. He said to him: 'I do not know, did you recognize all my Hadith and deny this, or did you deny all my Hadith and recognize this?' Ibn Abbas said: 'We used to narrate from the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, when lies were not told against him. But when people rode the difficult and the easy (i.e., mixed truth and falsehood), we abandoned narrating from him.' In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. 4070 - Abdullah bin Ahmad informed us by license (Ijazah) from here to the end of the book, he said my father, may Allah have mercy on him, told me, he said Husain bin Muhammad told me, he said Abu Bakr bin Ayyash told us, he said: I asked Al-A'mash: 'How many used to sit with Ibrahim?' He said: 'Four, or about that.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4071 - My father told me, he said Husain told us, he said Abu Bakr bin Ayyash told us, he said: No one among the companions of Muhammad, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, struck with the sword in what happened between them except Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-As and his father. 4072 - My father told me, he said Abdur-Razzaq told us, he said Ma'mar informed us, he said I heard Ibn Shubrumah say: '...I judge by what is obligatory in the Book of Allah... And by precedents I judge, and by analogies...' 4073 - My father told me, he said Abdur-Razzaq told us, he said Ma'mar informed us, he said I heard Ibn Shubrumah say: If a man said to him: 'May Allah make me your ransom,' he would get angry and say: 'Say: May Allah forgive me and you.' 4074 - My father told me, he said Abdur-Razzaq told us, he said Ma'mar informed us, he said: Iyas was asked about playing the lute (Barbat). He said: 'If you made a judgment between the deeds of the people of Paradise and the deeds of the people of Hellfire, I would not place the lute among the deeds of the people of Paradise.' 4075 - My father told me, he said Sufyan bin Uyainah told us, he said: Hisham bin Urwah came to Kufa, and they came to him and asked him. He said: 'The Messenger of Allah, or Abu Bakr, or Umar.' I said to him: 'It is not like this. You told me: From the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace.' He said: 'You spoke the truth, by Allah, that is how I said it.' He said: 'Some of my family said: It is the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, or Abu Bakr, or Umar, so I liked to make an exception.' Meaning: in the Hadith of Hisham from his father that a man's wealth passed away—I do not know if it was his own wealth or his father's wealth—so the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: 'Return it.'
