My father said: I did not hear the Hadith from Ibn Uyainah; I only heard this story from him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4076 - I said to my father: The two sons of Abu Shaibah mentioned that they are coming to Baghdad, so what do you think of them? He said: Ibn Al-Himmani came here, and people gathered around him, and he used to lie openly. People gathered around him. The two sons of Abu Shaibah, in any case, tell the truth. And he said: Abu Bakr is more beloved to me than Uthman. I said: Yahya bin Ma'in says Uthman is more beloved to me. My father said: No, Abu Bakr is more pleasing to us and more beloved to us than Uthman. 4077 - I said to my father: Ibn Al-Himmani narrated from you, from Ishaq Al-Azraq, from Sharik, from Bayan, from Qais, from Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah, from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace: 'Cool the prayer (wait for cooler time).' He said: He lied; I did not narrate it to him. I said: They related from him that he said: 'I heard it from him during the discussion (Mudhakarah) at the door of Ismail bin Ulayyah.' He said: He lied. I only heard it after that from Ishaq Al-Azraq, and I did not know in those days that this Hadith was strange (Gharib) until these youths—or he said these young men—asked me about it after that. 4078 - My father said: The time we met at the door of Ibn Ulayyah, we were only discussing Fiqh and chapters (of jurisprudence). In those days, we were not discussing the Musnad (chains of narration). We were discussing the minor issues and Hadiths of Fiqh and chapters. My father said: The book of Al-Azraq from Sharik fell to us, so I selected from it, and this Hadith was in it.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
4079 - I said to him: A man informed me that he heard Ibn Al-Himmani narrating from Sharik, from Mansur, from Ibrahim: {And those who, when tyranny strikes them, they defend themselves} [Ash-Shura: 39]. He said: They disliked being humiliated. A man said to him: This hadith is with us in the book of Ibn Al-Mubarak from Sharik, from Al-Hakam Al-Nasri, from Mansur. So Ibn Al-Himmani said: Sharik narrated it to us from Al-Hakam Al-Nasri, from Mansur. Then my father said: How daring he is! This is severe audacity. And he did not like that, and he said: We have always known him to steal hadiths, or snatch them, or grab them.
4080 - My father told me, he said: Abu Al-Qasim bin Abi Al-Zinad told us, from Abd Al-Rahman bin Abi Al-Zinad, from his father, he said: Umar bin Abd Al-Aziz said: A session with the blind Ubayd Allah bin Abdullah bin Utbah bin Mas'ud is more beloved to me than a thousand dinars.
4081 - My father said: Abu Al-Qasim bin Abi Al-Zinad died shortly after the death of Hushaym. He said: And I saw Abu Ja'far Al-Nufayli here in those days after the death of Hushaym, and I wrote from him in Harran, and I saw him here with us in Baghdad wearing a qalansuwah (tall hat)—meaning Al-Nufayli.
4082 - My father told me, he said: Abu Al-Qasim bin Abdullah bin Dhakwan Abi Al-Zinad told us, he said: Ishaq bin Hazim informed me, from Ibn Miqsam—meaning Ubayd Allah—from Jabir that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was asked about the sea, so he said: 'Its water is purifying, and its dead animals are lawful.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
4083 - My father told me, he said: Ibn Abi Al-Zinad told us, he said: Abd Al-Rahman bin Abi Al-Zinad informed me, he said: My father informed me, he said: I was circumambulating (Tawaf), I and Ibn Shihab, and Ibn Shihab had with him tablets and scrolls. He said: So we used to laugh at him.
4084 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Iyas bin Daghfal Abu Daghfal told us.
4085 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Sufyan said from Busr bin Mihjan or Bishr bin Mihjan Al-Dili from his book—meaning in the hadith of Zaid bin Aslam. My father said: And Waki' said: Jabir bin Yazid bin Al-Aswad, a man from Khuza'ah—meaning the hadith of Ya'la bin Ata.
4086 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us from Sufyan from Ibn Abi Khalid from Al-Sha'bi: 'A time will come upon the people in which they will pray for Al-Hajjaj.'
4087 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us from Sharik from Hilal bin Humayd. Waki' said: 'If you had taken the hadith of Sharik'—meaning you started anew—meaning that he narrated a lot from him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
4088 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us from Al-A'mash from Abu Salih, he said: Abu Hurairah was one of the best memorizers among the companions of Muhammad, but he was not one of the best of them [in jurisprudence/virtue].
4089 - My father told me, he said: Abu Mu'awiyah told us, he said: Ibn Al-A'mash told us from his father from Ibrahim, he said: He only disliked the handkerchief [after wudu] for fear of it becoming a habit.
4090 - My father said: We heard it from Abu Mu'awiyah from Al-A'mash many times, then one day he said to us: 'Ibn Al-A'mash from his father.'
4091 - My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Bukayr told us, he said: Shu'bah informed us from Al-Hakam from Abu Umar Al-Sini from Abu Darda that whenever a guest stayed with him, he would say: 'Are you staying so we can pasture [the animals], or are you departing so we can give fodder?' Shu'bah said: Yunus bin Khabbab informed me from Abu Umar Al-Sini from a man from Abu Darda.
4092 - My father told me, he said: Hajjaj told us, he said: Shu'bah told me from Hammad from Ibrahim from Aisha that she said: A lizard (Dabb) was brought to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and he disliked it or forbade it. So they said: 'Shall we feed it to the servants?' He said: 'Do not feed them what you do not eat.' Shu'bah said: No one mentions this from Ibrahim other than Hammad.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
4093 - My father told me, he said: Rawh told us, he said: Ash'ath told us from Muhammad from Zabban Yahya bin Al-Jazzar from his father that Ibn Mas'ud slaughtered a camel, and his abdomen was smeared with its dung and blood, then he prayed and did not perform ablution (wudu).
4094 - My father said: Ibn Sirin used to call Yahya bin Al-Jazzar 'Zabban'.
4095 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il told us from Ayyub, he said: Ibn Abi Mulaykah said: It reached me that Ziyad Al-Numayri—this one—says that a night in Sha'ban is better than such and such. If he were with me, I would have struck his head here with this piece of wood.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
4096 - My father told me, he said: Isma'il told us, he said: Mansur bin Abd Al-Rahman informed us, he said: Al-Sha'bi said: No one from the Companions of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, witnessed [the Battle of] the Camel except Ali, Ammar, Talha, and Al-Zubayr. If they bring a fifth, then I am a liar.
4097 - My father said: This Sheikh, Isma'il bin Muhammad bin Juhadah, was blind and was a perfume seller (Attar). Abu Abd Al-Rahman said: Whenever I say to you 'My father said', [it means] 'My father told me'.
4098 - My father told me, he said: Muhammad bin Ja'far told us, he said: Shu'bah told us from Al-Walid from Salamah bin Kuhayl from Mus'ab bin Sa'd, he said: It was said to Sa'd: 'You sell grapes to be made into juice?' He said: 'I would be a miserable old man if I sold wine (Khamr).'
4099 - My father said: Abu Dawud said: Shu'bah informed us from Bakkar from Salamah bin Kuhayl. And Rawh said: Shu'bah informed us, he said: A man from the family of Abu Burdah called Waladh told us, he said: I heard Salamah bin Kuhayl.
4100 - My father told me, he said: It was read to Sufyan while I was listening: I heard Al-Walid bin Harb in the hadith of Salamah from Jundub from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace: 'Whoever seeks to be heard, Allah will make him heard.' And Sufyan acknowledged it.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
4101 - My father told me, he said: Yazid bin Harun told us, he said: Abd Al-Malik—meaning Ibn Sulayman—informed us, he said: A man used to invite me and Sa'id bin Jubayr for the whole month of Ramadan. He said: So one night they mentioned Nabidh. Sa'id said: 'I see no harm in it in a water-skin (Siqa'), but I dislike it in a green earthenware jar (Jarr).' He said: So I said: 'Then by Allah, we will not obey you; we will surely drink from the green Jy [pronouncing Jarr with a lisp]'. He said: So Sa'id said to me: 'The green Jy?' mocking his dialect—meaning Abd Al-Malik. Yazid said: And Abd Al-Malik had a lisp.
4102 - My father told me, he said: Abd Al-Wahhab told us from Hisham, he said: I was present with Ibn Sirin and Abu Ma'shar was with him. He said: So Abu Ma'shar mentioned the Nabidh of the jar (Jarr) and said: 'Ibn Mas'ud used to see no harm in it.' He said: So Ibn Sirin raised his head and said: 'O you men, we met the companions of Ibn Mas'ud and they denied what you say, twice or thrice.'
4103 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Abu Hatim Al-Attar told me, he heard it from Ibn Sirin, he said: I came to Kufa and asked about the jar of Abdullah, but I found no basis for it.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
4104 - My father told me, he said: Arim told us, he said: Mu'tamir told us, he said: My father said: A companion of ours told us from Abdullah bin Utbah that the statement of Abdullah regarding the Nabidh of the jar was mentioned to him, so he said: 'Indeed, they lie against him.'
4105 - My father told me, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Qurrah told us from Abu Jamrah Al-Duba'i Nasr bin Imran.
4106 - My father told me, he said: Abd Al-Rahman bin Mahdi told us, he said: Sufyan told us from Mansur from Ibrahim from Alqamah from Abdullah bin Mas'ud, he said: 'Allah has cursed the tattooers and those who get tattooed, and those who pluck eyebrows, and those who file teeth for beauty, those who alter the creation of Allah.' He said: This reached a woman in the house called Umm Ya'qub, so she came to him... and he narrated the hadith. And I heard it from Abd Al-Rahman bin Abis from Umm Ya'qub, he heard it from her, so I was informed of the hadith of Mansur.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
4107 - My father told us, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Yahya bin Ja'far Al-Mazini told us from Mus'ab Hilal bin Yazid. My father said: And Abu Sa'id, the client of Bani Hashim, told us, he said: Yahya bin Ya'fur told us. And Abd Al-Samad also said: Ya'fur. I think my father said: Waki' made a mistake; the correct name is Ya'fur.
4108 - I asked my father about the hadith of Malik from Ibn Qusayt from Muhammad bin Abd Al-Rahman bin Thawban from his mother from Aisha from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, regarding the skins of dead animals. I said: What do you think about this hadith? He said: It contains 'his mother, from his mother', as if he disliked her [presence] in the hadith.
4109 - I heard my father mention Ibn Mahdi, so he said: He was from the mines of truthfulness.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
4109 - I heard my father say: Abu Na'amah Al-Adawi is older than Abu Na'amah Al-Sa'di, except that Abu Na'amah Al-Adawi changed at the end of his life—meaning he became senile. And Abu Na'amah Al-Adawi's name is Amr bin Isa. And Abu Na'amah Al-Sa'di's name is disputed. And Abu Na'amah from whom Al-Jurayri narrated, who narrated from Ibn Umar, is the oldest of them; this is another man.
4110 - I asked my father about Yahya bin Isa Al-Ramli. He said: How acceptable (muqarib) his hadith is. He is Kufan, lived in Ramla, passed by Kufa performing Hajj. I said to him: Did you hear anything from him? He said: No. I said: Then Muhadir? He said: I heard hadiths from him; he was not one of the scholars of Hadith; he was very heedless.
4111 - My father said: Al-A'mash from Amr bin Murrah from Abu Nasr; he is Hamid bin Hilal.
4112 - My father told me, he said: Sufyan bin Uyainah told us, he said: I said to Ibn Abi Laila: Indeed, Qa'nab, regarding his matter, if he wanted to buy something for a dirham, he would seek help for it. He said to me: 'And which of us does not seek help?' So I did not find any relief with him. Sufyan said: Qa'nab said: 'Then he came to me.' He said: Then he hid in a house, and the house collapsed on him. Sufyan said: And he gave Umar bin Sa'id his covenant, so he placed it with him. Sufyan mentioned all of it, and he said: And he fulfilled it.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
4113 - I heard my father say: Abdullah bin Muslim bin Hurmuz, from whom Al-Thawri narrates, is weak in Hadith; he is nothing, weak.
4114 - I heard my father say: Everyone who heard from Al-Mas'udi in Kufa is good, like Waki' and Abu Nu'aym. But as for Yazid bin Harun and Hajjaj and those who heard from him in Baghdad, he was in a state of confusion (Ikhtilat), except for those who heard from him in Kufa.
4115 - I heard my father say: Malik bin Anas used to regret [missing] Bukayr bin Al-Ashajj, and he was absent from Medina. And they say that the Mursal narrations of Malik where he says 'It reached me from so-and-so' he took from the books of Bukayr—they say from his son.
4116 - And Hammad Al-Khayyat said: Makhramah said: I did not hear anything from my father.
4117 - My father said: And Hammad Al-Khayyat narrated to us from Makhramah.
4118 - My father was asked while I was listening about Thuwair bin Abi Fakhitah, Layth bin Abi Sulaym, and Yazid bin Abi Ziyad. He said: How close they are to one another. It was said to him: Ata bin Al-Sa'ib? He said: Whoever heard from him early. He said: And Muslim—meaning Al-A'war—so he said: He is below these.
4119 - My father was asked about Ibn Abi Sabrah. He said: He is nothing. It was said to my father: Makhramah? He said: Trustworthy.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
4120 - My father said regarding the hadith of Habibah bint Jahsh: Ibn Jurayj said: 'Narrated from Ibn Aqil Muhammad bin Abdullah bin Aqil', and this is a mistake. He said: It is only Abdullah bin Muhammad bin Aqil. And he said: 'From Habibah bint Jahsh', differing from the people.
4121 - He was asked about Al-Tara'ifi Uthman bin Abd Al-Rahman. He said: I did not hear from him, and I do not know him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
4122 - He was asked about the hadith of Abu Al-Zubayr from Jabir from Fatimah bint Qais regarding the woman with prolonged bleeding (Mustahadah). He said: It is not authentic or it has no basis—meaning the hadith of Ja'far bin Sulayman from Ibn Jurayj.
4123 - My father was asked while I was listening about Haywah bin Shurayh, Sa'id bin Abi Ayyub, and Yahya bin Ayyub. He said: Haywah is the highest of the group, trustworthy.
4124 - He said: And Ibn Al-Mubarak said: No one was described to me but I found him less than what was described, except Haywah. My father said: Meaning in righteousness.
4125 - And Sa'id bin Abi Ayyub, there is no harm in him. And Yahya bin Ayyub is below them in Hadith, in memorization. My father said: And Yahya bin Ayyub used to sit with Al-Layth bin Sa'd, and he had poor memorization, and he is below these. And Haywah bin Shurayh is distant [in excellence], and he is the highest of them.
4126 - My father was asked about Abu Sakhr. He said: There is no harm in him.
4127 - And he mentioned Abbad bin Mansur, so he said: The hadith of Li'an (mutual imprecation) from Ikrimah as Mursal. Yahya bin Sa'id used to say: Mursal from Ikrimah. It was said to my father: Did he narrate it from Ibn Abi Yahya? He said: Yes, Abbad.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
4128 - My father was asked about Baqiyyah and Isma'il bin Ayyash. He said: Baqiyyah is more beloved to me. I looked into a book from Isma'il from Yahya bin Sa'id [containing] authentic hadiths, and in the Musannaf [containing] disturbed (Mudtarib) hadiths. And if Baqiyyah narrates from people who are not known, then no—meaning do not accept.
4129 - My father was asked about Ibn Shabur, Al-Haytham bin Humayd, and Muhammad bin Humayd. He said: I have known nothing but good.
4130 - My father was asked about Al-Awza'i and Sa'id bin Abd Al-Aziz. He said: They are equal in my view.
4131 - I heard my father say: There is no man in Sham with more authentic hadith than Sa'id bin Abd Al-Aziz Al-Tanukhi.
4132 - He was asked about Warqa bin Umar and Shayban. He said: Both are equal in my view, but Shayban is older; he heard from Al-Hasan. And Shu'bah used to narrate from Warqa.
4133 - My father was asked: Did Ma'mar hear anything from Simak bin Harb? He said: No. And Ma'mar narrated one hadith from Firas which no one narrated from Ma'mar except Ibn Ulayyah. My father said: Ibn Ulayyah came to us after he left Basra in the year eighty-one.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
4134 - My father was asked about Zakariyya bin Za'idah and Dawud bin Abi Hind. He said: Both are equal in my view, but Dawud is older in hearing from Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib and Jabir bin Zaid.
4135 - It was said to him: Isma'il bin Abi Khalid is the highest of Al-Sha'bi's companions? He said: You have not gone far [from the truth].
4136 - He was asked about Abd Al-Malik bin Umair and Asim bin Abi Al-Nujud. He said: Asim has less variance in my view than Abd Al-Malik bin Umair; Abd Al-Malik has more variance. And he prioritized Asim over Abd Al-Malik. My father said: And Shu'bah used to choose Al-A'mash over Asim bin Abi Al-Nujud.
4137 - My father was asked about Abd Al-A'la Al-Tha'labi. [He said]: He is weak. He said: Abd Al-Rahman bin Mahdi said: I asked Sufyan about the hadith of Abd Al-A'la. He said: We used to think that it was from the book of the hadith of Ibn Al-Hanafiyyah, or he did not hear anything from him.
4138 - It was said to my father: Then Abd Al-Malik bin Abi Kathir? He said: Trustworthy.
4139 - My father was asked about Yahya bin Ubaid Allah. He said: Objectionable (Munkar) in Hadith. Yahya bin Sa'id asked about him one day, saying: Who narrates from him? It was said to my father: Ibn Al-Mubarak narrated from him. He said: regarding Raqa'iq (heart-softeners), meaning Asceticism (Zuhd).

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
4140 - My father was asked about Yahya bin Atiq and Salamah bin Alqamah. He said: They are equal in my view. It reached me from Yahya bin Sa'id Al-Qattan that he was not pleased with Salamah bin Alqamah.
4141 - And my father was asked about Al-Jurayri and Maslamah. He said: They are equal in my view, except that Al-Jurayri has more hadith.
4142 - My father was asked about Ziyad Al-A'lam. He said: Trustworthy.
4143 - It was said to him: Zaid Al-Ammi? He said: Good (Salih); Sufyan and Shu'bah narrated from him.
4144 - It was said to him: Al-Fadl bin Isa Al-Raqashi? He said: Weak.
4145 - It was said to him: Yazid Al-Raqashi? He said: Shu'bah used to liken him to Aban bin Abi Ayyash. And my father said: Zaid Al-Ammi is above all of these—meaning Al-Fadl and Yazid Al-Raqashi.
4146 - My father was asked about Abu Malik Al-Janbi. He said: He was truthful, he was not a man of Hadith. My father said: We came to Kufa while he was alive, and we had with us the Book of Inheritance (Fara'id) from Muhammad bin Salim, but we did not hear from him; we heard it from Yazid bin Harun. Then my father abandoned the hadith of Muhammad bin Salim regarding Inheritance.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
4147 - My father was asked about Yahya bin Ya'la Al-Aslami from Abu Al-Muhayyah Al-Taymi. He said: I do not know them.
4148 - I asked him about Al-Azhar bin Al-Qasim. He said: Basran, settled in Mecca, and was trustworthy. Abd Al-Samad bin Abd Al-Warith narrated from a grandfather of Azhar. I see that this Azhar used to say something regarding Al-Qadar (predestination/free will).
4149 - My father was asked about Fa'id Abu Al-Warqa'. He said: Abandoned (Matruk) in Hadith.
4150 - My father was asked about Khulayd bin Da'laj. He said: Weak in Hadith.
4151 - I heard my father being asked about these hadiths from the book of Ibn Zanjawayh from Al-Firyabi regarding which Al-Firyabi erred. I heard my father say regarding the hadith of Al-Firyabi from Sufyan from Hilal bin Qais 'I saw Ubaydah volunteering [prayer] in the mosque' or 'not volunteering'. My father said: It is only Al-Nu'man bin Qais.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
4152 - He was asked about the hadith of Al-Firyabi from Sufyan from Al-Qasim bin Abd Al-Rahman that Umar prayed with them—meaning the people—while he was Junub (in a state of major ritual impurity). My father said: Sufyan did not hear from Al-Qasim bin Abd Al-Rahman; he only narrated from Ash'ath—meaning Ibn Sawwar—from him.
4153 - My father was asked about the hadith of Al-Firyabi from Sufyan from Nuh. Who is this Nuh? My father said: Nuh bin Abi Bilal, a Medinan Sheikh, trustworthy; Al-Thawri and others narrated from him.
4154 - He was asked about the hadith of Al-Firyabi from Sufyan from Khalid Al-Hadhdha from Sa'id bin Abd Al-Rahman. My father said: It is only Abd Al-Rahman bin Sa'id.
4155 - He was asked about the hadith of Al-Firyabi from Isra'il from Zaid bin Jubayr Al-Jushami, he said: Urwah bin Jamil told me from his father. My father said: It is a mistake. It is only Jarwah bin Jamil. And Waki' said: Isra'il said: Jarwah bin Jamil. Waki' said: And Sharik said: Jarwah bin Humayl, and that is correct.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
4156 - My father was asked about the hadith of Al-Firyabi from Sufyan from Mansur: 'Whoever prays towards other than the Qiblah, it suffices him.' He said: And Waki' said in it: 'From Ibrahim.'
4157 - My father was asked about the hadith of Al-Firyabi from Sufyan from a man from Abu Uthman that he saw Umar raising his hands in Qunut. Who is the man? He said: He is Ja'far, the owner of the Anmat (carpets/rugs), and he is not strong in Hadith.
4158 - My father was asked about the hadith of Al-Firyabi from Sufyan from Abu Hashim from Abu Mijlaz from Qais bin Abbad that he used to sit after Witr and recite. He said: It is from Sulayman. This is what Waki' said: From Sufyan from Sulayman Al-Taymi from Abu Mijlaz.
4159 - My father was asked about the hadith of Al-Firyabi from Al-Thawri from Hakim bin Jubayr from Ibn Jubayr from Aisha. He said: Waki' said from Sufyan from Hakim bin Jubayr from Ibrahim from Al-Aswad from Aisha. And Murrah Al-Azraq said: Murrah from Ibrahim from Al-Aswad from Aisha. And once he said: From Sa'id bin Jubayr from Aisha—meaning: 'I never saw anyone hasten the Zuhr prayer more than the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
4160 - My father was asked about the hadith of Al-Firyabi from Al-Thawri from Habib bin Abi Thabit from Ibn Jubayr that he used to pray four [rak'ahs] after Maghrib, separating between them. My father said: Waki' said: Habib bin Abi Amrah.
4161 - He was asked about the hadith of Al-Firyabi from Yunus bin Abi Ishaq from Abu Hilal from Sharik bin Shurahbil. My father said: He is Sharik bin Hanbal.
4162 - My father said: Abu Waki' said from Abu Ishaq from Sharik bin Hanbal from Ali. My father said: And Al-Thawri said from Abu Ishaq from Sharik bin Hanbal as a Mawquf (statement of a Companion, not the Prophet). Both are from Ibn Mahdi.
4163 - He was asked about the hadith of Al-Firyabi from Sufyan from Uqbah bin Al-Ayzar. My father said: It is only Uqbah bin Abi Al-Ayzar.
4164 - He was asked about the hadith of Al-Firyabi from Sufyan from Husayn from Abu Al-Dhayyal. My father said: It is only Amir bin Dhu'ayb, and I do not know if it is a Kunya or not. And Waki' said: From Abu Al-Dhayyal. My father said: And he is, if Allah wills, Amir bin Dhu'ayb.
4165 - My father said: Abu Hazim, the client of Azzah, is the one who narrated from Abu Hurairah; [he is] Ashja'i.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of The Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text:
4166 - He was asked about Ishaq bin Sharafa, the client of Ibn Umar. My father said: Ibn Fudayl said: Ishaq bin Abd Al-Rahman. And Abd Al-Rahman bin Mahdi said from Sufyan: Ishaq bin Mughirah. And some of them said: Ishaq bin Sharafa. Abd Al-Wahid bin Ziyad said: Affan narrated it to us.
4167 - I asked him about Dawud bin Qais from whom Abd Al-Razzaq narrated the hadith of Fanj. He said: This is not Dawud Al-Farr; this is Dawud bin Qais, San'ani, Yamani.
4168 - My father was asked while I was listening about Ishaq bin Rashid and Al-Nu'man bin Rashid. He said: Ishaq bin Rashid is more beloved to me and has more authentic hadith; and Al-Nu'man, he is above [in rank] in my view. It was said to him: Are they brothers? He said: No. Then he said: Al-Nu'man is Jazari, and Ishaq is Raqqi; I do not know of any kinship between them.
4169 - Ata Al-Kaykharani, I think he is attributed to a village.
4170 - I heard my father say: Abd Al-Rahman bin Mahdi used to narrate from Muhammad bin Jabir, then he abandoned him later. He was asked about Mansur from a man called Khalid from Aisha. Who is this Khalid? He said: Khalid Al-Ahwal, a man from whom Mansur narrated.
4171 - He was asked: Did Mansur hear anything from Jabir bin Zaid? He said: Yes, a question he asked him about.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4172 - He was asked about Ubaidullah bin Umar narrating from a man called Bid'ah from Abu Hurairah. He said: I do not know him. 4173 - He was asked about Zaid bin Rafi'. He said: There is no harm in him; Al-Mas'udi and Ma'mar narrated from him. 4174 - Abu Abdur-Rahman said: Abu Shurahbil bin Akhi Abi Al-Yaman told me, he said: Hamid Al-Khazzaz came to us after Abu Abdullah had left us. He said: What kind of Hadith was Abu Abdullah tracking? They said: The Hadith of Abdul-Aziz and Hudair. 4175 - It was said to my father: Then Ibrahim bin Abi Hurrah? He said: A Sheikh, has few Hadith, there is no harm in him. 4176 - He was asked about Muhammad bin Jabir and Ayyub bin Jabir. He said: Muhammad narrates rejected (Manakir) Hadiths, and he is known for listening (hearing Hadith). They say they saw an addition (Lahq) in his books. His Hadith from Hammad has disturbance (Idtirab).

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4177 - My father told me, he said Abdur-Rahman bin Mahdi told us from Hammad bin Salamah from Simak bin Harb from Jabir bin Samurah that the Messenger of Allah (pbuh) stoned Ma'iz bin Malik and did not mention lashing. Ibn Mahdi said: I do not see this except as the statement of Hammad—meaning "he did not mention lashing." 4178 - My father told me, he said Abdur-Rahman bin Mahdi told us from Ubaidullah bin Al-Nadr from his father from Qais bin Abbad that he used to pray Isha with Al-Qiyam (standing/prayer). Abdur-Rahman said: Abdullah bin Al-Mubarak came to us years later, so we went to him—meaning Ubaidullah bin Al-Nadr—and asked him about this Hadith. He said: I do not memorize it. I said: But you narrated it to us! He said: I was better at memorizing then than I am today. 4179 - My father told me, he said Abdur-Rahman told us from Shu'bah from Al-Suddi from Murrah from Abdullah, he said: They enter it or penetrate it, then they come out of it with their deeds. I said to Shu'bah: Israel narrated it to us as Marfu' (attributed to the Prophet). He signaled with his head: Yes.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4180 - My father told me, he said Abdur-Rahman told us from Sufyan from Amr bin Maimun bin Mihran from his father, he said: Sa'id bin Jubayr died, and there is no one on earth except that he is in need of his knowledge. 4181 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Sa'id Al-Qattan told us, he said Sufyan told us from Wasil—meaning Al-Ahdab—he said: I heard Abu Wa'il say: Most of the followers of the Dajjal are the Jews and the children of prostitutes. 4182 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Sa'id told us from Mahdi bin Maimun from Wasil from Abu Wa'il from Ibn Mas'ud something similar to this. Yahya said: And Sufyan rejected it—meaning when he raised it (attributed it) to Ibn Mas'ud. 4183 - My father told me, he said Abdur-Rahman bin Mahdi told us from Sufyan from Sadus, a Sheikh from the tribe, that Rabi' bin Khuthaym said: "Light, Light" during the Fajr prayer. Abdur-Rahman bin Mahdi said: I said to Sufyan: Did he hear it from Al-Rabi'? He said: He had caught up with him. 4184 - My father told me, he said Abdur-Rahman bin Mahdi told us: I said to Sufyan: Did you hear him narrating—meaning Ayyash Al-Amiri—that he heard anything from Shuraih? He said: I do not remember. 4185 - My father told me, he said Abdur-Rahman bin Mahdi told us, he said Sufyan told us from Abdul-Aziz bin Mani' from Abu Thumamah Al-Sa'idi, he said: The disciples said to Isa bin Maryam: What is the sincere one to Allah? He said: The one who does the deed for Allah and does not like for people to praise him for it. Sufyan said: Mansur narrated it to me from him—meaning Abdul-Aziz—so I met him and asked him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4186 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Sa'id told us from Ibn Jurayj, he said: I narrated from Al-Zuhri from Ubaidullah bin Abdullah from Ibn Abbas, he said: The Messenger of Allah (pbuh) forbade killing the bee, the ant, the hoopoe, and the shrike. 4187 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Sa'id said: And I saw in the book of Sufyan from Ibn Jurayj from Ibn Abi Labid from Al-Zuhri similar to it. 4188 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Sa'id told us, he said Sufyan told us regarding the Hadith of Muharib from Sulaiman bin Buraidah from the Prophet (pbuh)—meaning on the Day of the Conquest of Mecca—that he prayed the prayers with one ablution. And Waki' said: From his father. So Yahya said: It is Mursal. 4189 - My father told me, he said Abdur-Rahman bin Mahdi told us: I said to him—meaning Sufyan—did you hear him narrate—meaning Firas—that he witnessed anything from Shuraih? He said: No.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4190 - My father told me, he said Yahya bin Sa'id told us, he said Sufyan told us, he said: Sulaiman told me from Umarah from Huraith bin Zuhair, he said: The death announcement of Abdullah came to Abu Darda, so he said: He did not leave anyone like him after him. 4191 - My father told me, he said Husain bin Muhammad told us, he said Abu Ma'shar told us from Muhammad bin Qais, he said: When the Messenger of Allah (pbuh) performed Hajj, Allah revealed to him: {This day I have perfected for you your religion} to the end of the verse. So Allah perfected His religion, and the Messenger of Allah (pbuh) returned, and he passed away two nights after the month of Rabi' al-Awwal had passed. 4192 - My father told me, he said Husain bin Muhammad told us, he said Abu Ma'shar told us: Baddah bin Muhammad bin Abdur-Rahman bin Ka'b bin Malik told me, he said: The Messenger of Allah (pbuh) said during the expedition of Tabuk to Jadd bin Qais: "O Abu Wahb, go out with us, perhaps you will take the daughters of Banu al-Asfar (the Romans) as captives." He said: "You know my love for women, so excuse me and do not tempt me with the daughters of Banu al-Asfar." So Allah revealed to His Prophet (pbuh): {And among them is he who says, "Permit me [to remain at home] and do not put me to trial." Unquestionably, into trial they have fallen.} [At-Tawbah: 49]. 4193 - My father told me, he said Mu'adh bin Mu'adh told us, he said Ibn Awn told us from Al-Sha'bi, he said: {Say, "He is Allah, [who is] One"} is equivalent to one-third of the Qur'an. I said: From whom did you hear this? He said: He referred it to more than one, among them Amr bin Maimun. He said: And Amr bin Maimun referred it to Abu Ayyub. He said: And Abu Ayyub was... and he was killed here in Rayy.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4194 - My father told me, he said Sufyan told us from Al-Zuhri from Ata bin Yazid Al-Laithi, he said: I heard Abu Ayyub in the expedition of Yazid bin Mu'awiyah. Sufyan said: They say it is the naval expedition. 4195 - My father told me, he said Zaid bin Al-Hubbab told us, he said Abu Sahl Al-Azdi Husam informed me from Qatadah from Sa'id bin Jubayr that he said: The most knowledgeable of people is the most knowledgeable of them regarding differences (of opinion). 4196 - My father told me, he said Abu Ubaidah Al-Haddad told us from Hammam from Qatadah from Abu Al-Aswad, he said: If it pleases you for your companion to lie, then prompt him. 4197 - My father told me, he said Abu Dawud told us: Imran told us from Qatadah, he said: Abu Al-Aswad Al-Dili said: If it pleases you for your companion to lie, then prompt him. My father told me, he said Abdus-Samad told us: Abu Hilal told us: Qatadah told us that Abu Al-Aswad was walking on the road, so a man said to him: "The road!" He said: "From the road you are diverting me."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4198 - My father told me, he said Abdus-Samad told us: Abu Hilal told us: Qatadah told us that a man said to Abu Al-Aswad Al-Dili: "May Allah admit you to the entrance of Ali." He said: "You mean well but you do not perceive." 4199 - My father told me, he said Abu Ubaidah Al-Haddad told us from Hisham and Ibn Awn from Ibn Sirin, he said: Indeed, this knowledge is religion, so look at whom you take it from. 4200 - My father told me, he said: Ibn Sam'an was mentioned in the presence of Ibrahim bin Sa'd while I was witnessing. He said: I never saw him in any circle of jurisprudence (Fiqh) ever. And the nephew of Ibn Shihab informed me, and I asked him about him: Did you see him with your uncle? He said: I never saw him—meaning with his uncle. 4201 - My father told me, he said Gundar Muhammad bin Ja'far told us from Shu'bah from Abu Ma'shar from Ibrahim, he said: There is no village except that in it is someone by whom calamity is repelled from its people, and I hope that Abu Wa'il is one of them. 4202 - My father told me, he said Yahya Al-Qattan told us: Shu'bah said: Abu Bishr did not hear from Habib bin Salim. 4203 - My father told me, he said Yahya told us: Shu'bah used to weaken the Hadith of Abu Bishr from Mujahid—I think he meant the Hadith of the bird: He passed by a people who had set up a chicken and were shooting at it.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4204 - My father told me, he said I heard Yahya say: Abu Nadrah died shortly before Al-Hasan, and Abu Mijlaz shortly before Al-Hasan, and Bakr bin Abdullah shortly before Al-Hasan. 4205 - My father told me, he said Sufyan bin Uyainah told us from Ummi from Al-Ala bin Badr: I entered upon Al-Hasan while he was on a bed. I said: I wished you had not spoken regarding Al-Qadar (destiny). He said: And so do I. 4206 - My father told me, he said Sa'id bin Amir told us from Hisham, the associate of Al-Dastuwa'i, he said: We used to frequent a man among the scholars—and he named him. When the plague occurred, two Rak'ahs prayed by anyone became more beloved to him than seeking Hadith. 4207 - My father told me, he said Ibn Uyainah told us: A man said: I asked here, "Is anyone more knowledgeable than Shuraih?" They said: "Yes, but he is bold (or actively involved)." So I went to him—meaning Ubaidah—and I did not find anyone more refraining from what he did not know than him.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4208 - My father told me, he said Ibn Uyainah told us: I used to say to them: "Bring what you have." So they would bring me [sayings of] Ibrahim. Sufyan said: So we would overcome them—meaning with Isnad (chains of narration). 4209 - My father told me, he said I heard Ibn Uyainah say: Sufyan—meaning Al-Thawri—came to Umm Khasaif—meaning Umm Dawud Al-Wabishiyyah—and did not find the key, so he jumped over the wall. 4210 - My father told me, he said Ibn Uyainah told us from Abu Ishaq, he said: They used to consider affluence as an aid to religion. It was said to Sufyan: Sufyan Al-Thawri mentioned it? He said: Yes. 4211 - Ibn Uyainah said: Sufyan—meaning Al-Thawri—said: I entered upon...—meaning Ibn Al-Mahdi—so I said: What is this? And what is this? Umar bin Al-Khattab performed Hajj and spent sixteen Dinars. 4212 - My father told me, he said Affan told us: Yahya bin Sa'id told me, he said: I used to ask Hamid about something from the Fatwas of Al-Hasan, and he would say: I forgot it. 4213 - My father told me, he said Ibn Idris told us from Laith from Wabrah bin Abdur-Rahman Abu Khuzaimah Al-Musli: My father told me from Abu Ya'qub the client of Abu Ubaidullah from Abbad bin Al-Awwam, he said: He used to say: Abu Al-Hudhail Husain bin Abdur-Rahman said.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4214 - My father told me, he said a man named by my father told us: Ma'n bin Isa told us from Abdul-Malik bin Sami, the client of Abu Bakr, he said: Abu Bakr bin Abdur-Rahman, his name and his Kunyah are Abu Bakr. He said: And he is Ali bin Al-Madini. 4215 - My father told me, he said Hajjaj Al-A'war told us: I heard Shu'bah say: Matar said: And these people are good at narrating. 4216 - Abu Al-Tayyah told us from Abu Al-Fadak. 4217 - My father told me, he said Hawdhah Abu Al-Ashhab told us: Awf told us from Ammar Abu Abdullah, the client of Banu Hashim, and he is Ammar bin Abi Ammar. 4218 - My father told me, he said Abu Ja'far Al-Hadhdha' told us: I said to Sufyan bin Uyainah: This man speaks regarding Al-Qadar—meaning Ibrahim bin Abi Yahya. He said: Inform the people of [his] innovation and ask your Lord for well-being. 4219 - My father told me, he said Maslamah bin Al-Salt Al-Shaibani told us: I heard Umarah bin Abi Hafsah Abu Rawh. 4220 - My father said: Abu Uwais, his name is Abdullah bin Abdullah bin Uwais.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4221 - I heard my father say: Yazid bin Harun came to visit me (when sick)—I think he said regarding an ailment in his eye. When he wanted to leave, his head hit the door (frame), and Yazid was a tall man. 4222 - I heard my father say: Waki' died in the year one hundred and ninety-seven, in the beginning of it, or in the end of Dhu al-Hijjah of the year ninety-six—my father doubted. 4223 - My father said: And Ibn Uyainah died after him in the year ninety-eight in Rajab; news of his death came to us from Abdur-Razzaq. And Ibn Mahdi and Yahya bin Sa'id died in that same year. I heard my father say: Ibn Uyainah said in the year we parted from him and went to Abdur-Razzaq... 4224 - And he was asked about Hadiths, and he began not to remember them. So he said to the one asking him: "You say." So he would say: "Ibn Uyainah, it is such-and-such." Then he recited this verse: {So that one of them may remind the other} [Al-Baqarah: 282]. He used this verse as proof. 4225 - My father said: And Gundar used to fast one day and break fast one day. 4226 - My father said: Matar Al-Warraq is weak in the Hadith of Ata. 4227 - My father told me, he said Abu Nu'aym told us: Amr bin Huraith died in the year eighty-five. 4228 - My father said: I saw Hafs bin Ghiyath having fastened his teeth with gold.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4229 - I heard my father say: Al-Haitham bin Jamil wrote to me [asking] me to write to him about the conquests of Sham (Futuh al-Sham). So I wrote to him. And I said to Al-Haitham bin Jamil in Tarsus the year Harun died, the year ninety-three—and he had heard from Zuhair—so I said to him: Did Zuhair hear from Ali bin Al-Aqmar? He said: No. Then my father said: Al-Haitham was among the scholars of Hadith in Baghdad, he and Abu Kamil and Abu Salamah Al-Khuza'i. And Haitham was the most retaining (memory) of the three, but Abu Kamil was more precise in Hadith than him. 4230 - My father said: I went to Ibn Al-Mubarak to hear from him, but a man met me and said: "He left today." So I returned. And I saw Al-Ashja'i while we were with Abu Badr, and I did not hear from him. And I saw Al-Mubarak bin Sa'id and did not hear from him. 4231 - I asked my father about Al-Ash'ath bin Abdul-Malik Al-Humrani Al-Basri. He said: There is no harm in him. Bishr bin Al-Mufaddal, Yahya, and Mu'adh narrated from him. Shu'bah said: Yunus bin Ubayd used to take these Hadiths from Al-Ash'ath. 4232 - My father told me: Hushaim narrated a Hadith to us one day from Al-Ash'ath. I said: "O Abu Mu'awiyah, who is this Ash'ath?" He said: "Ibn Abdul-Malik"—as if he magnified his status. 4233 - My father told me: Ishaq Al-Azraq told us: Sharik informed us from Ziyad bin Ilaqah from Amr bin Maimun from Aisha, she said: The Messenger of Allah (pbuh) used to kiss while he was fasting.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4234 - My father told me: Ishaq told us from Sharik from Ismail Al-Suddi from Al-Bahi the client of Al-Zubair from Aisha that she said: The Messenger of Allah (pbuh) used to kiss while he was fasting. 4235 - My father told me: And Aswad bin Amir said from Amr bin Maimun from Aisha. Aswad said: And Murrah—meaning Sharik—said: From Al-Suddi OR Ziyad bin Ilaqah. And that is because his son Abdur-Rahman said to him in the house: "They mention from you: 'from Al-Suddi'." So he said: "Al-Suddi OR Ziyad." 4236 - My father told me: Abdur-Rahman bin Mahdi told me, he said: I asked Sufyan about the Hadith of Asim—meaning Ibn Abi Najud—regarding the apostate woman. He said: As for from a trustworthy person, then no. My father said: And Abu Hanifa used to narrate it from Asim. 4237 - He told me: Ibn Mahdi told us from Israel from Mukhariq from Tariq bin Shihab, he said: Our stipends used to come out during the time of Umar not purified (Zakah not taken), so we would be the ones to purify them. I asked Sufyan about it, and he said: I asked Mukhariq about it. And he doubted it.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4238 - My father told me: Abdur-Rahman told us: I asked Sufyan about the Hadith of Ibn Abi Najih from his father: "The Prophet (pbuh) did not fight a people..." He said: I doubt it. My father told me: Bishr bin Al-Sari told us from Sufyan from Ibn Abi Najih from his father from Ibn Abbas, he said: The Messenger of Allah (pbuh) did not fight a people until he invited them. 4239 - I heard my father say regarding the Hadith of Ibn Mahdi from Sufyan from Simak from Abdur-Rahman... 4240 - My father said: And Hafs narrated it to us from Hajjaj from Ibn Abi Najih [should be Ibn Abi Laila] bin Abi Laila, he said: I was next to Ali when he stoned Shurahah. My father said: This is not Abdur-Rahman bin Abi Laila; this is another man. 4241 - My father told me: Ibn Mahdi told us from Sufyan from his father from Al-Sha'bi, he said: Abu Yazid Rabi' bin Khuthaym told us between these two pillars that the debtor is imprisoned by his debt on the Day of Resurrection, complaining of loneliness to Allah, saying: "O Lord, You kept me [alive] while I had nothing." Yahya bin Sa'id narrated it to us from Sufyan: "You resurrected me while I had nothing." Abdur-Rahman made a mistake in it, for it is "You resurrected me." 4242 - My father told me: Abdur-Razzaq told us: Sufyan said: Bukair bin Ata had two Hadiths; Shu'bah heard one of them and did not hear the other.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4243 - My father told me: Waki' told us from Sufyan, and Ibn Mahdi said: Sufyan told us from Al-Suddi from Yazid from Urwah bin Al-Zubair, he said: {Around her neck is a rope of [twisted] fiber} [Al-Masad: 5]. He said: A chain of seventy cubits. Waki' said: Of iron is its length. I asked him: Who is this Yazid? He said: Yazid, the client of Umar bin Abdur-Rahman bin Al-Harith bin Hisham. 4244 - My father told me: Husain bin Muhammad narrated it to us from Israel from Al-Suddi from Yazid the client of Umar bin Abdur-Rahman bin Al-Harith bin Hisham. 4245 - My father told me: Ibn Mahdi told us from Sufyan, and Waki' told us, he said: Sufyan told us from Al-Suddi from Abu Sa'id, he said: I asked Sa'id bin Jubayr about this verse {And when [other] relatives are present at the division} [An-Nisa: 8], and he narrated the Hadith. I said to my father: Who is this Abu Sa'id? He said: Yahya bin Adam narrated it to us, and he said: Abu Sa'id Al-Khuza'i. 4246 - I said to my father: Sufyan from Al-Suddi from Abu Sa'd from Abu Al-Kanud from Abdullah, he said: {Enter the gate prostrating} [Al-A'raf: 161]. I said: Who is this Abu Sa'd? He said... 4247 - Waki' told us from Sufyan from Al-Suddi from Abu Sa'd Al-Azdi. My father told me: Ibn Idris told us: I heard Husain say: We came once to Al-Tayyib bin Shurahil asking about him. They said: He is in a room of his, having worshipped for twelve years. He said: So we entered upon him. 4248 - I heard Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaibah say: The name of Abu Al-Kanud is Abdullah bin Uwaimir.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4249 - My father told me: Hammad bin Mas'adah told us from Ash'ath, he said: We were with Muhammad, so a tray of food was brought to him, and I jumped [to it]. He said: So he called me, "O young man." He said: My youthfulness drove me to proceed. 4250 - My father told me: I heard Ibrahim bin Sa'd swearing by Allah: Indeed, Ibn Sam'an used to lie. 4251 - My father told me: Hammad bin Mas'adah told us: Shu'bah said: Do not leave your share of "I reckon/think" (Ahsibu). 4252 - I heard him say: Kuraib bin Abrahah, his Kunyah is Abu Rushdin, and he is the one from whom Hariz bin Uthman narrates from Sa'id bin Marthad from Thawban bin Shahr from this Kuraib. 4253 - The name of Abu Ma'bad, the client of Ibn Abbas, is Nafidh. Umm Hani, her name is Fakhitah. 4254 - Ubaid bin Nadilah, his Kunyah is Abu Mu'awiyah.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4255 - My father told me: Muhammad bin Salamah told us a Hadith, saying: From Bishr bin Sa'id. So I said to him: It is only Busr bin Sa'id. He said to me like this: "Bishr bin Sa'id" twice, and refused to retract. My father said: He was not among the scholars of Hadith, and there was no harm in him; I see him as a righteous man, and he praised him well. 4256 - I heard my father mention from Yahya bin Sa'id, he said: Ibn Abi Adi came to Ibn Abi Arubah at the end—meaning while he was confused/mixed up. So I said to Ibn Abi Adi: Did Sa'id dictate to you? He said: When we wanted, he dictated to us. 4257 - My father told me: I heard Yahya bin Sa'id say: Ata bin Abi Maimunah died after the plague, and he used to hold the view of Qadar (free will). And Hafs bin Sulaiman [died] shortly before the plague. Shu'bah informed me, he said: Hafs bin Sulaiman took a book from me and did not return it, and he used to take people's books and copy them. And Malik bin Dinar died before the plague. And I see Farqad [was] in those days.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4258 - My father told me: Mus'ab bin Salam told us: Al-Zabriqan told us from Abu Wa'il, he said: I remember while I was a boy of ten years in the Jahiliyyah, herding sheep for my family in the desert, when the Prophet (pbuh) was sent. 4259 - My father told me: Sayyar told us: Ja'far told us: I heard Malik bin Dinar say when Bilal bin Abi Burdah became governor. He said: Woe to you, O nation! You have perished by waste, Bilal has taken charge of your affair. 4260 - I heard my father say: Abu Hudhaifah, about whom Khaithamah narrated from Hudhaifah: "The Prophet (pbuh) was sitting and an Arab came..." and there was food before him. Abu Ishaq narrated from him and named him, saying: "We were with Abu Hudhaifah Salamah bin Suhaibah, we were with him in Sijistan"—the Hadith of prayer. Ali bin Al-Aqmar narrated from him, from Abu Hudhaifah from Aisha: "I imitated a woman to the Prophet (pbuh)..."

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4261 - My father told me: Ibn Mahdi told us from Sufyan from Ali bin Al-Aqmar from Abu Hudhaifah from Aisha. He said: He was one of the companions of Abdullah, and Talha used to narrate from him—meaning Talha bin Musarrif. 4262 - My father said: Affan said: Jarir bin Hazim came to Hammad bin Zaid. Jarir started saying: "Muhammad told us, he said: I heard Shuraih... Muhammad told us, he said: I heard Shuraih..." So Hammad started saying: "O Abu Al-Nadr, from Muhammad from Shuraih? From Muhammad from Shuraih?" (Questioning the direct hearing). 4263 - My father told me: Hamid Al-Ru'asi told us: Zuhair told us from Abu Ishaq from Al-Taymi, he said: I never heard of a land in which there was knowledge except that I came to it. 4264 - My father told me: Yahya bin Sa'id told us: I heard Al-A'mash say: Amr bin Murrah told me, he said: I heard Abu Ubaidah say: Abu Musa said: "A sitting I used to sit with Abdullah is more trustworthy to me than a year's work by myself." My father said: Yahya used to say in it: "I heard Abu Musa," but he did not say it to us.

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4265 - And Ya'la bin Ubaid said from Al-A'mash from Abu Ishaq from Abu Ubaidah similar to it. My father told me: Yazid bin Harun told us: Yazid bin Harun told us [repetition in source]: Ja'far bin Kaysan told us, he said: I saw Mu'adhah hiding herself (veiled) while women were asking her. 4266 - My father said: Sharik narrated from Mughirah from Shibak that Shuraih permitted the marriage conducted by the executor of an executor (Wasiyy Wasiyy). Our neighbor Amir, the father of Abu Ubaidah, rejected it against him and said: "O Abu Abdullah, it is only Simak." My father said: And Sharik erred in it; it is only Simak. Sharik said: "By Allah, I don't think he knows Shibak from Simak." 4267 - My father said: Abu Hamzah Al-Thumali is weak in Hadith. 4268 - My father said: Yahya would not narrate anything from Qatadah from Khilas from Ali—meaning as if he did not hear from him. But he used to narrate from Qatadah from Khilas from others from Ammar. 4269 - I heard him say: Bashir bin Nahik uses the Kunyah Abu Al-Sha'tha.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4270 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ibn Uyaynah narrated to us from Isma'il bin Umayyah: 'We used to seek Nafi' regarding meat, but he would refuse.' My father said: Ibn Uyaynah said: 'Which hadith is more trustworthy than the hadith of Nafi'?'
4271 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ibn Uyaynah narrated to us, saying: Isma'il bin Umayyah said: 'Ata used to prolong his silence and quietness; so when he spoke, it seemed to us that he was being supported [by inspiration].'
4272 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ibn Uyaynah narrated to us from Isma'il bin Umayyah, who said: He said to me—meaning Makhul: 'Most of what I narrate to you is from Sa'id bin al-Musayyib and al-Sha'bi.'
4273 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ibn Uyaynah narrated to us from Anbasah, from a son of Sa'id bin al-As, from Isma'il bin Umayyah, who said: Umar said: 'In isolation (Al-Uzlah) there is relief from bad company.' He meant Anbasah bin Abd al-Wahid al-Qurashi.
4274 - I heard my father say: He said: I heard Sufyan say: Sulayman bin Abi Muslim al-Ahwal, the maternal uncle of Ibn Abi Najih, narrated to me.
4275 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya bin Sa'id narrated to us from Al-Taymi, from Abu Uthman, from Usama bin Zaid, who said: 'The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to take me and Al-Hasan and say: O Allah, indeed I love them, so love them.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4276 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya bin Sa'id narrated to us, saying: Al-Taymi said: 'I used to narrate it, then doubt entered me regarding it, so I said: I narrate it from so-and-so and so-and-so; then I found it written in my possession.'
4277 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya bin Sa'id narrated to us from Mujalid, from Amir, from Ali: 'There is no amputation [of the hand] for fruit, nor for less than the price of a shield.' My father said: And in the hadith [it was]: 'And no amputation for anything left on the ground.' It was said to Yahya: 'They apply this to the grave robber.' So he abandoned it and did not narrate it.
4278 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya bin Sa'id narrated to us from Bahr bin Marrar. It was said to Yahya: 'Is he a Bakrawi?' He said: 'Yes.'
4279 - I heard my father say: Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi died when he was sixty-three years old, and he had dyed [his hair/beard] seventeen years before that.
4280 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya bin Sa'id narrated to us from Humaid, from Anas: That the Banu Salama wanted to move from their homes to the vicinity of the mosque, but the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, disliked that the [area around the] mosque be left bare, so he said: 'O Banu Salama, do you not seek reward [for your footsteps]?' So they stayed.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4281 - Musa bin Abdullah Abu Imran, the owner of the merchandise, narrated to us, saying: Umar al-Abah narrated to us from Sa'id bin Abi Arubah, who said: It was said to Qatada: 'Why do you not narrate from Nafi' while you have narrated from others?' He said: 'Indeed, Nafi' was a foreigner (Ilj) who made grammatical mistakes (Lahhan).'
4282 - My father said: Al-Abah is among the senior companions of Sa'id.
4283 - I heard my father say: This is how Yahya narrated it to me, but it is actually 'That the city (Al-Madina) be left bare,' but he erred—meaning Yahya—and said 'The mosque.'
4284 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya bin Sa'id narrated to us from Shu'bah, who said: Ammar al-Absi narrated to us. I asked my father about him, and he said: 'He is not Ammar al-Duhni.'
4285 - I heard my father say: Uthman bin Ghiyath is trustworthy (Thiqah).
4286 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya bin Sa'id narrated to us from Shu'bah, who said: Amr bin Murrah narrated to me from Abdullah bin Salamah, from Safwan bin Assal, who said: A man from the Jews said: 'Let us go to this Prophet.' He [the other] said: 'Do not say Prophet, for if he hears it, he will have four eyes [out of joy].' And he recounted the hadith. Then they both said: 'We bear witness that you are the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace.' I heard my father say: Yahya bin Sa'id contradicted more than one person, as they [others] said: 'We bear witness that you are a Prophet.' My father said: 'If they had said: "We bear witness that you are the Messenger of Allah," they would have become Muslims, but Yahya erred in it, an ugly error.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4287 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya bin Sa'id narrated to us from Shu'bah, who said: I asked Mansur and Ayyub about reading [back to the scholar], and they said: 'Good'—meaning the presentation (Al-Ard).
4288 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya bin Sa'id narrated to us from Ibn Jurayj, who said: I heard Muhammad bin Abbad bin Ja'far say: I met Jabir bin Abdullah and said: 'Did you hear the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, forbid singling out Friday for fasting?' He said: 'Yes, by the Lord of the Kaaba.'
4289 - I asked my father about Ash'ath bin Abd al-Malik al-Humrani, saying: 'Who is more established (Athbat), Ash'ath bin Abd al-Malik or Ash'ath bin Sawar?' He said: 'Ibn Sawar is weak in hadith; Al-Humrani is above him.'
4290 - My father said: And Yahya bin Sa'id said: 'Al-Ash'ath al-Humrani did not dictate to us; we only memorized from him.' And Khalid bin al-Harith said: 'We used to sit with Al-Ash'ath al-Humrani, and he would say to us: "And he used to say"—meaning Al-Hasan.' My father said: 'It has reached me that he was among the most commandingly dignified of people.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4291 - My father narrated to me, saying: Talq bin Ghannam narrated to me, saying: Ali bin Mudrik died in the year one hundred and twenty, and Ma'bad bin Khalid died during the governorship of Khalid [al-Qasri]. Khalid became governor in the year six [106 AH] and was removed in the year twenty [120 AH].
4292 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Rahman Mahdi narrated to us from Hammad bin Zaid, from Dawud bin Abi Hind, who said: Mujahid said: 'The laws of inheritance (Al-Fara'id) exhausted me [in my efforts] to master them.'
4293 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi narrated to us, saying: Sulaym bin Akhdar informed me from Ibn Awn, from Muhammad [Ibn Sirin], who said: 'I strove to know the abrogating and the abrogated [verses/hadiths], but I did not know it.'
4294 - My father narrated to me, saying: Sufyan bin Uyaynah narrated to us, saying: I heard it from Fudayl bin Iyad, who said: 'Seventy sins will be forgiven for the ignorant person before one sin is forgiven for the scholar.'
4295 - My father said: Ibn Uyaynah said: 'A truthful man—meaning Zurzur—guided me to Zurzur Sandal.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4296 - My father said: The hadith of Muhammad bin al-Harith from Ali al-Asadi was mentioned to Sufyan, and it was said to Sufyan: 'Indeed, Ibn Jurayj narrated it from him.' He said: 'I see that I am the one who narrated it to him'—meaning the hadith of Ibn Umar: 'O boy, reach the two bones.'
4297 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ibn Uyaynah narrated to us from Amr bin Yahya bin Qamta, and he was among the best of the people of Mecca.
4298 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ibn Uyaynah narrated to us, saying: Hisham—meaning Ibn Abd al-Malik or someone else—said to him: 'Ask for your need.' He said: 'I would not ask anyone other than Allah in His House'—meaning Mansur bin Abd al-Rahman, who is Mansur bin Safiyyah.
4299 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ibn Uyaynah narrated to us, saying: 'I might have seen him taking the censer and perfuming the House'—meaning Mansur bin Safiyyah.
4300 - I said to my father: 'Did Qatada hear from Abdullah bin Sarjis?' He said: 'How similar he is [in narration]! Asim al-Ahwal has narrated from him.'
4301 - My father said: Amr bin Hassan al-Burjumi, Abu Mu'awiyah narrated to us from him; I do not see any harm in him.
4302 - My father said: Muhammad bin Qays al-Asadi is trustworthy, trustworthy (Thiqah Thiqah).
4303 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ibn Uyaynah narrated to us, saying: Abu Ishaq used to narrate it from him, and the Kufans would come and ask him about it. I heard him [narrate it] how many times—meaning Ibn Abi Husayn: 'Forgive the one who wronged you, maintain ties with the one who cut you off, and give to the one who deprived you.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4304 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Razzaq narrated to us, saying: Yusuf bin Ya'qub was a judge. My father said: He is from the descendants of Dadawayh.
4305 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Razzaq narrated to us, saying: Al-Thawri said: 'And what a man they have corrupted!'—meaning Yusuf bin Ya'qub. He said: 'How will it be for you when so-and-so stands—meaning on the Day of Resurrection—and they say: The son of so-and-so and his followers'—meaning Abu Ja'far al-Mansur. My father said: He is Yusuf bin Ya'qub bin Ibrahim bin Sa'id bin Dadawayh, and Al-Thawri narrated from him.
4306 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Razzaq narrated to us, saying: Ma'mar said: 'There is no merchandise on earth that stagnates upon its owner more than knowledge.'
4307 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ali bin Hafs narrated to us, saying: Shu'bah informed us from Abu Jamra, who said: I heard Zahdam bin Mudarrib, and he came to me on a horse.
4308 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Ahmad al-Zubairi narrated to us, saying: Sharik narrated to us from Abu Ishaq, from Hubshi bin Junada. I said to Abu Ishaq: 'Where did you hear it from him?' He said: 'He stood over us on a horse of his in a gathering in the graveyard of Al-Sabi'.'
4309 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Ahmad narrated to us, saying: Fitr narrated to us from Abu Ishaq, who said: Urwa bin Abi al-Ja'd stood over us on a horse of his [narrating] the hadith of horses from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4310 - My father narrated to me, saying: Al-Dahhak bin Makhlad narrated to us from Ibn Jurayj: 'We used to gather around Ata [in the year] fifty; none of them remains'—meaning anyone.
4311 - I heard my father say: I heard Abu Abd al-Rahman al-Muqri say: Ibn Awn and Ibn Jurayj died in the year fifty—meaning one hundred and fifty. And Abu Abd al-Rahman said: 'I have never loved anyone with my love for Ibn Awn.'
4312 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Sa'id, the freedman of Banu Hashim, narrated to us, saying: Shu'bah narrated to us, saying: 'The letter of Umar bin Abd al-Aziz was read to us, to the people of Al-Sawad (rural Iraq), that they should gather [for Friday prayer/congregation].'
4313 - I asked my father about a sheikh from whom Damrah narrates, called Ali bin Abi Hamlah. He said: 'Trustworthy (Thiqah), one of the trustworthy ones.'
4314 - And I asked him about Raja' bin Abi Salamah. He said: 'Trustworthy (Thiqah). Hammad bin Salamah and Hammad bin Zaid narrated from him. He is Raja' Abu al-Miqdam, and Damrah narrated from him.'
4315 - I asked him about Bashir bin Talha. He said: 'There is no harm in him; Damrah narrated from him.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4316 - I asked my father about Abu al-Wazi', what is his name? He said: Yahya bin Adam narrated to us, saying: Isra'il narrated to us from Zuhayr bin Malik from Asim bin Damrah who said: 'The completion of the bowing (Ruku') is to say: "O Allah, to You I bowed, to You I humbled myself, to You I submitted, in You I believed, and upon You I relied."' My father said: Zuhayr is Abu al-Wazi'.
4317 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ishaq al-Azraq narrated to us from Sharik from Zuhayr bin Malik, who said: Zuhayr says that. He said: I heard Asim bin Damrah narrating, saying—Zuhayr said: And I do not see that he narrated it except from Ali—he said: 'The prostration (Sujud) of the man during prayer is to keep his limbs apart (Yakhwi) and not spread his forearms. And the prostration of the woman is to spread her thighs against her belly and join them.' I asked my father: 'How does the woman sit in prayer?' He said: 'However is most concealing for her.'
4318 - I heard my father say: Yahya said: 'I spoke to Ibn Jurayj, but he insisted that he heard it from him—meaning from Muhammad bin Abbad bin Ja'far. And I found it'—meaning Yahya—'he says: I found it in the books from Abd al-Hamid bin Jubayr from Muhammad bin Abbad.'
4319 - I heard my father say: Yahya is the best of people in hadith from Isma'il—meaning Ibn Abi Khalid. He says: 'Because in them are reports: Qais narrated to us, Hakim bin Jabir narrated to us.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4320 - My father narrated to me, saying: I asked Yahya bin Sa'id, saying: 'Are all these hadiths authentic?'—meaning the hadiths of Ibn Abi Khalid from Amir, those in which he did not say "Amir narrated to us." He seemed to say: 'Yes.' And Yahya said: 'If he meant that he did not hear it, I would have informed you.'
4321 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya bin Sa'id narrated to us from Yahya bin Sa'id from Sa'id bin al-Musayyib, who said: 'It occurred—meaning the Fitnah (Civil War)—and none of the people of Badr remained.' And Yahya said another time: 'None of the Muhajirin remained.'
4322 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya bin Sa'id narrated to us: And Shu'bah said in the hadith of Ayyub from Abu Qilabah: Umm al-Darda narrated to me that Abu al-Darda used to come to his family and say: 'Do you have anything?'
4323 - I heard my father say: Ibn Abi Adi narrated hadiths from Ja'far bin Maymun, so Ibn Mahdi began looking into them, glancing at a book with a person. I said: 'Was the book with you?' He said: 'No, with another person.' My father said: Yahya bin Sa'id narrated to us from Ja'far bin Maymun, this one.
4324 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya narrated to us from Shu'bah from Qatada from Abu Ayyub: That the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, entered upon Juwayriyah bint al-Harith on a Friday, and she said: 'I am fasting.' He said: 'Did you fast yesterday?' She said: 'No.' He said: 'Will you fast tomorrow?' She said: 'No.' He said: 'Then break your fast.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4325 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya narrated to us from Ibn Abi Arubah from Qatada from Ibn al-Musayyib, who said—meaning Ibn Abi Arubah: 'They contradicted me.' Yahya said: 'And Matar said [it] from Ibn al-Musayyib.'
4326 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya narrated to us from Sufyan from Hisham bin Abi Abdullah from Amir al-Ahwal from Al-Hasan: That the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, forbade that a slave girl be married over a free woman. My father said: The hadith of Sufyan from Hisham bin Abi Abdullah is strange (Gharib); it was only narrated by Amr bin Ubayd, and it is strange from the hadith of Amir al-Ahwal. My father said: And Al-Fazari—meaning Marwan—narrated it to us from Hisham bin Abi Abdullah.
4327 - I asked my father about Kawthar bin Hakim, from whom Hushaym narrated. He said: 'His hadith is worth nothing.'
4328 - I heard my father say: He who heard Ibn Abi Arubah narrated to us that he [Ibn Abi Arubah] heard Asim bin Bahdalah.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4329 - I heard Ahmad bin al-Dawraqi say: Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi narrated to us, saying: 'I looked into the book of Abu Awanah, and I ask Allah for forgiveness.'
4330 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya bin Sa'id narrated to us from Humaid bin Abdullah. My father said: I said to Yahya bin Sa'id: 'Is the one they call Al-Mulla'i a Kufan?' He said: 'Yes.'
4331 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya bin Sa'id narrated to us from Yahya bin Sa'id: Indeed, Sa'id bin al-Musayyib said: 'The Fitnah of Uthman occurred, and none of the Muhajirin remained. And the Harrah [incident] occurred, and none of the people of Hudaybiyah remained. And the third occurred, and it did not lift while there was any strength in the people.'
4332 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya said: Yunus—meaning Ibn Abi Ishaq—used to say: Abu Ishaq said: I heard Adi—meaning in the hadith: 'Guard yourselves against the Fire, even with half a date.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4333 - My father narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: Shu'bah said: 'Al-Hakam did not hear the hadith of Miqsam regarding Cupping while fasting from Miqsam.'
4334 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya narrated to us, saying: Shu'bah narrated to us from Al-Hakam, who said: 'Yahya bin al-Jazzar used to be extreme'—meaning in Shi'ism.
4335 - Ibn Khallad wrote to me, saying: I heard Yahya bin Sa'id [narrate] from Abu Awanah, who said: 'Muhammad bin Juhada used to be extreme in Shi'ism.'
4336 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya bin Sa'id narrated to us from Abd al-Rahman bin Ammar. My father said: He is Ibn Ammar bin Abi Zainab.
4337 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya bin Abdullah bin Yazid bin Abdullah bin Anis narrated to us, saying: 'I saw Abdullah bin al-Hasan dyeing with henna. And I saw Muhammad bin Jabir—meaning Ibn Abdullah al-Ansari—and others from the Sheikhs of the Ansar turning their backs to the sun until I could see the back of one of them turning black, and between his shoulders.'
4338 - My father narrated to me, saying: Azhar bin Sa'd Abu Bakr al-Samman narrated to us in the year one hundred and eighty-six, and Mu'tamar, Bishr bin al-Mufaddal, and Ziyad bin al-Rabi' were all alive [then].
4339 - He said: Ibn Awn said: Muhammad said: 'If a man wants to take the slave girl of his child while they are young, he should evaluate her price against himself and bear witness for them against himself regarding her price.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4340 - Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaybah narrated to us, saying: Affan narrated to us, saying: I said to Azhar: 'Did Ibn Awn narrate this hadith to you from Muhammad?' He said: 'Yes.'
4341 - My father said: It reached me from Yahya bin Sa'id, who said: 'Sufyan used to mimic Al-A'mash saying: Shaqiq narrated to us, Muslim narrated to us.'
4342 - My father said: Shu'bah used to say: 'So-and-so narrated it to me "yahwi" (rushing/falling).' I said to my father: 'What is "yahwi"?' He said: 'Mursal (hurried/disconnected).'
4343 - I asked my father about Salama bin Musa, from whom Ibn Uyaynah narrates. He said: 'I do not see any harm in him.'
4344 - I asked my father about Salama bin Abi al-Tufayl. He said: 'They narrate from him.'
4345 - I asked him about Thabit al-A'raj. He said: 'I do not see any harm in his hadith. Ubaydullah, Malik, and Ziyad bin Sa'd narrated from him.' My father said: 'Thabit al-A'raj is Thabit bin Iyad.'
4346 - I asked my father about Thabit bin Zaid bin Zaid bin Arqam. He said: 'Ibn Abi Arubah narrated from him. And he narrated to us from Mu'tamar; he has hadiths that are objectionable (Manakir).' I said to him: 'Is he narrated from?' He said: 'Yes.' I said to him: 'Is he weak?' He said: 'I narrate from him.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4347 - I asked him about Thabit al-Zuraqi. He said: 'Al-Zuhri narrated from him.' I said to him: 'Did anyone other than Al-Zuhri narrate from him?' He said: 'I do not recall.'
4348 - I heard my father say: Thabit bin Aslam al-Bunani is trustworthy (Thiqah).
4349 - I asked my father about Thabit bin Ubayd al-Ansari. He said: 'This is a trustworthy man (Thiqah) you are asking about; Al-A'mash and Mis'ar narrated from him.'
4350 - I asked my father about Thabit bin Yazid. He said: 'He is Thabit bin Yazid al-Awdi; Yahya bin Sa'id narrated to us from him, and Ibn Abi Za'idah narrated to us from him.'
4351 - I asked him about Thabit al-Makki. He said: 'I do not know anyone who narrated from him other than Amr bin Dinar, and he heard from Ibn Abbas.' Meaning Thabit bin Yazid al-Makki.
4352 - I asked my father about Thabit bin Yazid Abu Zaid. He said: 'Shu'bah guided them to him, and he is trustworthy (Thiqah).'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4353 - I heard my father say: Rafi' bin Umayrah al-Ta'i, who fought alongside Abu Bakr, is kunya-ed Abu al-Hasan. He is Rafi' bin Abi Rafi' bin Umayrah, and he is the one from whom Al-A'mash narrated via Sulayman bin Maysarah, from Tariq bin Shihab, from Rafi' bin Umayrah.
4354 - I asked my father about Thabit Abu Adi bin Thabit. He said: 'Sharik narrated from Abu al-Yaqzan, from Adi bin Thabit, from his father, from his grandfather, those hadiths.' I said to him: 'Did anyone other than Adi—meaning Ibn Thabit—narrate from him?' He said: 'I do not know.'
4355 - I asked my father about Thabit al-Haddad. He said: 'Thabit bin Hurmuz, and it is said Ibn Huraymiz. Al-Hakam narrated from him, and he is trustworthy (Thiqah).'
4356 - I asked him about Thabit bin Abi Safiyyah Abu Hamzah al-Thumali. He said: 'Weak in hadith, he is worth nothing.'
4357 - I asked my father about Thabit bin Amarah. He said: 'Yahya narrated to us from him.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4358 - I asked my father about Thabit bin Ajlan. He said: 'He used to be at the Gate (Al-Bab) and the Gates (Al-Abwab).' I said to him: 'Is he trustworthy?' He remained silent, as if he was hesitant about his matter.
4359 - I asked my father about Thabit bin Khaqan al-Khurasani. He said: 'I do not know him.'
4360 - I asked my father about Thabit bin Thawban. He said: 'He is a Syrian (Shami), and there is no harm in him.'
4361 - I asked my father about Thabit bin Dhirwah. I said to him: 'Is he trustworthy?' He said: 'Hammad bin Zaid narrated from him.'
4362 - I heard my father say: Thabit bin Ubaydullah, or Abdullah bin Abi Bakrah. He said: 'I have indeed heard mention of him.'
4363 - I asked him about Thabit bin Abi Qatadah. He said: 'I do not know him.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4364 - I heard my father say: Abd al-Rahman bin Abdullah bin Umar bin Hafs bin Asim bin Umar used to hold the judgeship of Medina. I tore up his hadith a long time ago; he is nothing. His hadith consists of objectionable narratives (Manakir). He was a liar. He used to say: 'My father and Ubaydullah are equal, exactly the same.' He used to narrate from Suhail bin Abi Salih and Ubaydullah bin Abdullah bin Umar.
4365 - My father said: Abdullah bin Umar al-Umari, his kunya is Abu Abd al-Rahman.
4366 - My father said: And Ubaydullah bin Umar is kunya-ed Abu Uthman.
4367 - I heard my father say: Abu Bakr bin Ubaydullah bin Abdullah bin Abi Mulaykah is the brother of Ibn Abi Mulaykah. He used to be in Medina and was called Abu Bakr al-Ahwal. Ibn Jurayj and Yahya bin Sa'id al-Ansari narrated from him.
4368 - I heard my father say: Abu Bakr bin Abdullah bin Abi al-Jahm; Sufyan al-Thawri, Shu'bah, and Sharik narrated from him. He heard from Fatima bint Qais and heard from Ibn Umar.
4369 - I asked him about Abu Bakr bin Abi al-Ward. He said: 'I have heard of him.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4370 - I asked my father about Abu Bakr al-Ghassani. He said: 'He is Abu Bakr bin Abdullah bin Abi Maryam al-Ghassani, weak in hadith.' Then he said: 'I said to Ishaq bin Rahwayh: Narrate to me from Isa—meaning Ibn Yunus. He said: Isa bin Yunus said: If I wanted Abu Bakr al-Ghassani to combine for me six or seven [chains]—so-and-so and so-and-so—he would have done so.'
4371 - I asked him about Abu Bakr al-Nahshali. He said: 'This is Abu Bakr bin Abdullah bin Qitaf al-Nahshali; a Kufan, trustworthy (Thiqah).'
4372 - I asked him about Abu Bakr bin Khalid bin Urfutah. He said: 'He is narrated from.'
4373 - I asked my father about Abu Bakr al-Zubaidi. He said: 'Sufyan al-Thawri narrated from him.'
4374 - I asked my father about Abu Bakr bin Nafi', the freedman of Ibn Umar. He said: 'This is a Medinan, one of the most trustworthy children of Nafi'.'
4375 - I asked my father about Abu Bakr bin Shu'ayb bin al-Habhab. He said: 'This is a sheikh who is narrated from.'
4376 - I asked him about Abu Bakr bin Asma' bin Ubayd. He said: 'This is a Basran.'
4377 - I asked him about Abu Bakr bin al-Fadl bin al-Mu'tamar. He said: 'He is narrated from.'
4378 - I asked him about Abu Bakr al-Hanafi. He said: 'I narrate from him.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4379 - I asked him about Abu Abdallah bin Abdallah al-Razi. He said: 'I know nothing but good. Al-A'mash, Al-Hakam, Ibn Abi Laila, and Sa'id bin Masruq narrated from him, and I know nothing but good.'
4380 - My father said to me: Yazid bin Maysarah is kunya-ed Abu Yusuf.
4381 - My father said: Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi would not narrate from Yunus bin Khabbab nor from Badham Abu Salih.
4382 - I heard my father say: Kulthum bin Jabr is a trustworthy sheikh (Thiqah). I said: 'So his son, Rabi'ah bin Kulthum?' He said: 'Righteous (Salih); Yahya bin Sa'id narrated from him.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4383 - I asked my father about Abdur-Rahman bin Uthman Al-Bakrawi. He said: 'People discarded his hadith; he is Abu Bahr.' 4384 - I asked my father about Abdullah bin Salamah Al-Aftas. He said: 'People abandoned his hadith.' 4385 - I heard my father say: 'Sahl Al-Aswad was one of the companions of Shu'bah and was among the major scholars of hadith. He was one of those who narrated the most from Shu'bah, yet people abandoned his hadith.' 4386 - I asked my father about Amr bin Hukkam. He said: 'He used to narrate about four thousand [hadiths] from Shu'bah, but his hadith were abandoned.' I said: 'Is he trustworthy?' He said: 'His hadith were abandoned.' He said once: 'Amr bin Hukkam Al-Zanjabili.' 4387 - I asked him about Abbad bin Suhayb. He said: 'I saw him in Basra more than once. The Qadariyyah used to claim him. He was not a liar, and he possessed a great amount of hadith and had heard from Al-A'mash.' 4388 - And I asked my father about Umar bin Muhammad bin Zaid. He said: 'I know nothing but good [about him].'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4389 - I asked my father about Zaid bin Hibban Al-Raqqi. He said: 'Ma'mar narrated to us from him, but we abandoned his hadith.' Then he said: 'Ma'mar used to say: He narrated to us before he became corrupt.' 4390 - I asked my father about Abdur-Rahman bin Yazid bin Tamim. He said: 'He flipped the hadiths of Shahr bin Hawshab and turned them into the hadith of Al-Zuhri.' And he began to weaken him. 4391 - I asked my father about Ja'far bin Rabi'ah. He said: 'Trustworthy.' 4392 - I heard my father say: 'Ja'far bin Abdullah bin Al-Hakam Al-Ansari is the father of Abdul-Hamid bin Ja'far; Yazid bin Abi Habib narrated from him.' 4393 - I heard my father say: 'Ja'far bin Abi Al-Mughirah Al-Qummi, who is Ja'far Al-Musawwir, is trustworthy. He is Ja'far bin Dinar.' 4394 - I asked him about Jarir bin Hazim and Abu Al-Ashhab, which of them is more beloved to you? He said: 'Jarir was adorned with qualities; he was a man of Sunnah. Jarir possessed a great amount of hadith.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4395 - I asked my father about Ja'far bin Burqan. He said: 'If he narrates from other than Al-Zuhri, there is no harm.' Then he said: 'In his hadith from Al-Zuhri, he makes mistakes.' 4396 - I asked my father about Ja'far bin Maimun. He said: 'Yahya, Al-Thawri, and Abu Ubaidah Al-Haddad narrated from him. I fear that he is weak in hadith.' 4397 - I asked my father about Ja'far bin Khalid bin Sarah Al-Makhzumi. He said: 'Ibn Jurayj narrated from him; a man from the people of Mecca.' 4398 - I asked him about Ja'far bin Zaid Al-Abdi. He said: 'The Basrans narrated from him.' 4399 - I asked him about Ja'far bin Ziyad Al-Ahmar. He said: 'Abdur-Rahman and Waki' narrated to us from him, and he used to be a Shi'i.' 4400 - I heard him say: 'Ja'far bin Abi Thawr; Simak bin Harb and Ash'ath bin Sulaym—who is Ibn Abi Al-Sha'tha'—narrated from him.' 4401 - And Uthman bin Abdullah bin Wahb; Jabir bin Samurah is his grandfather from his mother's side. 4402 - My father said: 'Ja'far bin Awn, there is no harm in him; he was a righteous man.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4403 - I asked him about Nafi' the client of Abu Qatadah. He said: 'He is known; Salih bin Kaisan and I think Al-Zuhri narrated from him.' 4404 - I heard my father say: 'Abdur-Razzaq said: I saw Abu Hazim bin Dinar, so I said to him: Did you hear from him? He said: I think I heard him say: Nafi' bin Umar Al-Jumahi is among the trustworthy ones, trustworthy.' 4405 - I heard my father say: 'Nafi' bin Sarjis; Ibn Khuthaym narrated from him.'
