I said to him: 'How is his hadith?' He said: 'I know nothing but good.' 4406 - I asked him about Nafi' bin Malik bin Abi Amir. He said: 'His kunyah is Abu Suhail, and he is the uncle of Malik bin Anas.' He said: '[He is] among the trustworthy ones.' 4407 - I heard my father say: 'Uqbah bin Abi Al-Ayzar is acceptable (Salih) in hadith.' 4408 - I heard him say: 'Uqbah bin Abi Al-Sahba', his kunyah is Abu Khuzaim, is acceptable in hadith.' 4409 - I asked him about Uqbah bin Abi Salih. He said: 'Kufan, he narrated from Ibrahim; acceptable in hadith.' 4410 - I asked him about Habib bin Sahban. He said: 'Abu Husayn and Al-A'mash narrated from him.' 4411 - I asked him about Uqbah bin Jabbar. He said: 'Rib'i bin Hirash narrated from him.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4412 - I asked him about Uqbah bin Sayyar. He said: 'He is Abu Al-Jallas; Shu'bah narrated from him.' I said to him: 'Is he trustworthy?' He said: 'I hope so.' 4413 - I asked him about Uqbah bin Abi Jasrah. He said: 'The Basrans narrate from him.' 4414 - I asked him about Uqbah Al-Asadi. He said: 'Al-Thawri narrated from him.' 4415 - I asked him about Uqbah bin Ubaid. He said: 'This is the brother of Sa'id bin Ubaid Al-Ta'i; Abu Mu'awiyah heard from him.' I said: 'Is he trustworthy?' He said: 'And how much is narrated from him? Only a hadith or three are narrated from him.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4416 - I asked him about Uqbah bin Khalid Al-Sakuni. He said: 'He is called Uqbah Al-Mujaddar.' I said: 'Is he trustworthy?' He said: 'I hope so, Allah willing.' 4417 - I asked him about Umar bin Abdur-Rahman bin Al-Harith bin Hisham. He said: 'Al-Sha'bi narrated from him.' 4418 - I asked him about Umar bin Sulayman. He said: 'Shu'bah narrated from him.' 4419 - I asked him about Umar bin Abdullah bin Urwah. He said: 'Ibn Jurayj and Ibn Ishaq narrated from him.' 4420 - I asked him about Umar bin Nabih. He said: 'He is Medinan; Yahya narrated to us from him.' 4421 - I heard my father say: 'Umar bin Ata bin Abi Al-Khuwar.' He said: 'Ibn Jurayj narrated from him.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4422 - I asked my father about Umar bin Amir Al-Sulami. He said: 'His kunyah is Abu Hafs. Ibn Abi Arubah and Abbad bin Al-Awwam narrated from him, and he is so-and-so [weak]. Yazid bin Zurai' narrated from him, but Yahya did not narrate from him and was not satisfied with him.' 4423 - I asked him about Umar bin Ishaq bin Yasar. He said: 'He is the brother of Muhammad bin Ishaq.' I asked him again, and he remained silent. 4424 - I heard him say: 'Umar bin Abdullah the client of Ghafrah, there is no harm in him, but his hadiths are mursal (loose/disconnected).' 4425 - I heard him say: 'Umar bin Muhammad bin Al-Munkadir, things are narrated from him.' 4426 - I asked him about Umar bin Nafi'. He said: 'This is among the most trustworthy of Nafi's children; Ubaydullah, Zuhair, and Ibn Uyainah narrated from him.' 4427 - I asked him about Umar bin Nafi' Al-Thaqafi. He said: 'I have heard of him; I think Waki' and Abu Mu'awiyah narrated from him.' 4428 - I asked him about Umar bin Sa'id bin Abi Husayn. He said: 'A trustworthy Sheikh.' Then he said: 'He is a Qurashi, a Meccan, one of the most trustworthy people from whom hadith is written.' 4429 - I asked him about Umar bin Sa'id, the companion of Al-Zuhri. He said: 'Abdur-Rahman bin Ishaq narrated from him.' I said to him: 'Is he trustworthy?' He said: 'His hadith is acceptable (Muqarib).'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4430 - I asked him about Umar bin Abdullah bin Al-Ashaj. He said: 'Yazid bin Abi Habib and Bukair bin Abdullah bin Al-Ashaj narrated from him, and he is the brother of Bukair.' 4431 - And I asked him about Umar bin Atiyyah bin Abdur-Rahman bin Dilaf. He said: 'Ubaydullah bin Umar narrated from him.' 4432 - And I asked him about Umar bin Rashid. He said: 'He is from Yamamah.' I said: 'Is he trustworthy?' He said: 'His hadith is weak. He narrated rejected (munkar) hadiths from Yahya bin Abi Kathir; his hadith is not upright.' 4433 - I asked him about Umar bin Ibrahim Al-Abdi. He said: 'He narrated from Qatadah, and he is a Basran.' I said to him: 'Is he weak?' He said: 'Hah! He has rejected hadiths; Abdus-Samad used to narrate from him.' 4434 - I heard him say: 'Umar bin Al-Walid Al-Shanni is a trustworthy Sheikh. Bishr bin Al-Mufaddal and Waki' narrated from him, and all of them narrated from him.' I said to him: 'Did Yahya narrate from him?' He said: 'I do not recall, but he is a trustworthy Sheikh.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4435 - I asked him about Umar bin Kathir bin Aflah. He said: 'This is a client of Abu Ayyub; Ibn Awn narrated from him.' 4436 - I asked him about Umar bin Abdur-Rahman bin Muhaisin. He said: 'Ibn Uyainah narrated from him, and he is a Sahmi.' 4437 - I asked him about Umar bin Abi Za'idah. I said: 'How is his hadith?' He said: 'Acceptable (Salih).' 4438 - I asked him about Umar bin Suwaid Al-Thaqafi. He said: 'Waki' narrated from him.' 4439 - I asked him about Umar bin Uthman bin Sa'id bin Yarbu'. He said: 'I do not know him.' 4440 - I asked him about Umar bin Jabir Al-Yamami, and he is Al-Hanafi. He said: 'Ismail narrated to us from him, and Abdul-Warith bin Sa'id narrated from him.' Abu Abdur-Rahman said: 'He is the brother of Ayyub bin Jabir and Muhammad bin Jabir, and Umar bin Jabir has scarce hadith.' 4441 - I asked him about Umair bin Ishaq. He said: 'Ibn Awn narrated from him.' I said to him: 'Did anyone other than Ibn Awn narrate from him?' He said: 'No.' Then he said: 'Malik was asked about him, and he said: I do not know him.' My father said: 'And he is a Medinan.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4442 - Ahmad bin Ibrahim Al-Mawsili told us, he said: 'Malik bin Anas was asked about Umair bin Ishaq, and he said: I do not know him.' 4443 - And he said: 'A man narrated from him, and he is sufficient for you,' meaning Ibn Awn. 4444 - My father told me, he said Waki' told us, he said Sufyan told us from Qais bin Muslim Abu Amr Al-Jadali. 4445 - I heard him say: 'Al-Sa'ib bin Hubaish; I do not know anyone who narrated from him except Za'idah.' I said to him: 'Is he trustworthy?' He said: 'I do not know.' 4446 - I asked him about Al-Sa'ib bin Umar Al-Makhzumi. He said: 'Yahya bin Sa'id narrated from him. I consider him a trustworthy Sheikh.' 4447 - I heard him say: 'Ata bin Muslim—or Ibn Abi Muslim—the people of Sana'a narrate from him.' 4448 - I heard my father say: 'Ata Al-Khurasani is Ata bin Maysarah and Ata bin Mina, one of the companions of Abu Hurairah. Ayyub bin Musa narrated from him. And Ata Al-Kaykharali—and it is said Al-Kaykharani—Al-Qasim narrated from him, and he is Ata bin Nafi'.' 4449 - I heard my father say: 'Ata the client of Ibn Siba' is Ata bin Ayyub.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4450 - I heard him say: 'Ata bin Qurrah; Abdur-Rahman bin Thabit bin Thawban narrated from him.' I heard him say: 'Ata bin Zuhair; Al-Akhdar bin Ajlan narrated from him, and Al-Akhdar bin Ajlan—I see no harm in him, Yahya narrated to us from him.' 4451 - I heard my father say: 'Ata bin Dinar; I see no harm in him. Ibn Lahi'ah and Sa'id bin Abi Ayyub narrated from him.' I said to him: 'Is he trustworthy?' He said: 'I see no harm in him.' 4452 - 'And Ata bin Farrukh, the client of the Quraysh.' He said: 'Yunus bin Ubayd narrated from him.' 4453 - My father told me, he said Ismail bin Ulayyah told us, he said Umarah Abu Sa'id the Worshipper told us. My father said: 'It reached me that he worshipped Allah until he became skin and bones from worship. He is a trustworthy Sheikh, one of the companions of Al-Hasan, and he is a Basran.' 4454 - Abu Abdur-Rahman said: 'I think Ibn Khallad told me—or wrote to me—he said: Yahya bin Sa'id said: Sufyan Al-Thawri said to me: Ibn Al-Taymi was with me, and I could not distinguish between Layth and Mansur, except that he was a righteous man.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4455 - I heard my father say: 'Sufyan bin Sa'id Al-Thawri said: Mu'tamar is a righteous man who takes from everyone.' 4456 - My father said: 'Mu'tamar would not verify the source; he would say: We take from everyone, Sufyan from a man, and Sufyan it reached him.' Then my father said: 'He is not like Yahya who verifies: Say "He told me," say "I heard".' 4457 - I heard my father say: 'Yahya said: Shu'bah said: Maimun Abu Abdullah—meaning the one whom Awf narrates from—was weak (fasl).' I said to him: 'Did you hear it from Yahya?' He said: 'Insha'Allah.' 4458 - I heard him mention Khalaf bin Khalifah, and he said: 'I saw Amr bin Huraith.' Then he said: 'Ibn Uyainah said: He lied; perhaps he saw Ja'far bin Amr bin Huraith.' 4459 - I asked my father about Umarah bin Ghaziyyah Al-Ansari. He said: 'Trustworthy.' 4460 - My father said: 'Umarah bin Khuzaimah bin Thabit Al-Ansari is famous.' 4461 - I asked him about Umarah bin Abi Hafsah. He said: 'A trustworthy Sheikh.' 4462 - I asked him about Umarah bin Umair. He said: 'Trustworthy and more; do you ask about the likes of this?'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4463 - I asked him about Umarah bin Zadhan Al-Saydalani. I said: 'Is he trustworthy?' He said: 'Waki' narrated from him; I see no harm in him.' 4464 - I asked him about Umarah bin Abd Al-Saluli. He said: 'Abu Ishaq narrated from him.' 4465 - I heard him say: 'Umarah bin Abdullah bin Sayyad; I think he is Medinan.' Then he said: 'Malik bin Anas and Abu Ma'shar narrated from him.' 4466 - 'And Umarah bin Hadid; Ya'la bin Ata narrated from him.' I said to him: 'Did anyone other than Ya'la narrate from him?' He said: 'I do not know.' 4467 - I asked him about Khasib bin Jahdar. He said: 'He has rejected (munkar) hadiths, and he is weak in hadith.' 4468 - My father said: 'And Rafi' bin Abi Rafi' Al-Ta'i, who is Rafi' bin Umairah, his kunyah is Abu Al-Hasan.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4469 - My father said: 'Hushaim said: We parted from Ya'la bin Ata in the year one hundred and twenty.' I said to him: 'Did you hear it from Hushaim?' He said: 'No, it reached me from him.' 4470 - My father said: 'Humran bin Abdul-Aziz is a trustworthy Sheikh, trustworthy.' 4471 - 'And Iyas bin Daghfal is trustworthy, trustworthy.' 4472 - And I asked him about Salm bin Abi Al-Dhayyal. He said: 'I see no harm in him; Mu'tamar narrated from him.' 4473 - My father said: 'Abu Janab, his name is Yahya bin Abi Hayyah. Abu Nu'aym said: He was trustworthy but used to practice Tadlis (concealing the source).' My father said: 'His hadiths are his rejected ones.' 4474 - My father said: 'Jamil bin Murrah is a Basran; I know nothing but good.' 4475 - 'And Jabir bin Subh; Yahya bin Sa'id, Isa bin Yunus, and Muhammad bin Shu'aib bin Shabur narrated from him. I see no harm in him, and he was a wise man.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4476 - My father said: 'Hamid bin Tarkhan; Hammad bin Zaid narrated from him, he is a Sheikh of Hammad. And Ya'qub bin Ata, his hadiths are rejected.' 4477 - My father said: 'Abdul-Wahhab bin Mujahid is nothing; weak in hadith.' 4478 - Abdur-Razzaq said: 'Ma'mar said to me: Ask him—meaning Abdul-Wahhab bin Mujahid—about the hadith of Al-Thaqafi concerning two men who asked the Prophet (pbuh).' 4479 - My father said: 'Salih the client of Al-Taw'amah; I see no harm in him for whoever heard from him early.' 4480 - My father said: 'Al-Wadin bin Ata is trustworthy.' 4481 - I heard my father say: 'Zabban bin Fa'id, his hadiths are rejected hadiths.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4482 - My father said: 'These three: Darraj, Huyayy, and Zabban; these three, their hadiths are rejected.' 4483 - My father said: 'And Zuhrah bin Ma'bad is a trustworthy Sheikh. And Bayan bin Bishr Abu Bishr is Bakh (excellent), trustworthy, among the trustworthy ones.' 4484 - My father said: 'Abbad bin Abbad bin Alqamah Al-Mazini; Mu'tamar narrated hadiths from him; I see no harm in him.' 4485 - My father said: 'Ishaq bin Suwayd is a trustworthy Sheikh.' 4486 - My father said: 'A man asked Ismail bin Ibrahim bin Ulayyah for the hadith of Yazid Al-Rishk regarding such-and-such. He said: So Ismail narrated to him the hadith from Ishaq bin Suwayd. He said: O Abu Bishr, I only want the hadith of Al-Rishk. He replied: I narrate to you from Ishaq bin Suwayd, and you say I want Yazid Al-Rishk!' 4487 - My father said: 'Ishaq bin Suwayd is among the trustworthy ones.' 4488 - I asked my father about Musa bin Shaibah. He said: 'Mu'tamar narrated rejected hadiths from him.' 4489 - And I asked him about Abu Ma'n. He said: 'I do not know anyone who narrated from him other than Mu'tamar.' 4490 - I asked him about Ali bin Badhimah. He said: 'Acceptable in hadith, but he was a leader in Tashayyu' (Shi'ism).'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4491 - I asked my father about Ayyub bin Utbah. He said: 'Inconsistent (Mudtarib) in hadith from Yahya bin Abi Kathir.' I said to him: 'What about from other than Yahya bin Abi Kathir?' He said: 'He is in the same condition.' 4492 - He said: 'And Ikrimah bin Ammar is inconsistent in hadith from Yahya bin Abi Kathir.' 4493 - My father said: 'Sa'd bin Amr; Malik, Ubaydullah bin Umar, and Ayyub bin Jabir narrated from him. His hadith resembles the hadith of the truthful people.' 4494 - 'And Umar bin Yunus Al-Yamami is trustworthy, but I did not hear from him.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4495 - My father told me, he said: 'Ismail bin Ibrahim, meaning Ibn Ulayyah, if they contradicted him in hadith, he would not pay attention to them. They would say: So-and-so and so-and-so contradicted you. He would ask: Did Yazid bin Zurai' contradict me? If they said yes, he would remain silent.' 4496 - My father said: 'Ibrahim bin Uqbah; I know nothing but good.' 4497 - I said to him: 'Muhammad bin Uqbah?' He said: 'I know nothing but good.' 4498 - 'And Musa bin Uqbah; I know nothing but good.' 4499 - I asked my father about Khasif. He said: 'He is not that strong.' 4500 - My father told me, he said Abu Ahmad Al-Zubairi told us, he said I heard Sufyan say: 'I heard Al-Kalbi say: Atiyyah gave me the kunyah Abu Sa'id.' 4501 - My father told me, he said Abu Ahmad Al-Zubairi told us, he said I heard Sufyan say: 'It used to be said: Seek refuge in Allah from the trial of the ignorant worshipper and from the trial of the immoral scholar, for their trial is a trial for everyone tempted.' 4502 - He said: 'And Sufyan, meaning Al-Thawri, used to weaken the hadith of Atiyyah.' 4503 - My father said: 'Hubairah bin Yarim bin Abd.' 4504 - And I asked him about Al-Harith Al-A'war and Hubairah. I said: 'Which of them is more beloved to you?' He said: 'Hubairah is more beloved to us than Al-Harith.' Then he said: 'Hubairah is a righteous man. I do not know anyone who narrated from him other than Abu Ishaq, he and Harithah bin Mudarrib.' Then he said: 'I do not know anyone who narrated from him other than Abu Ishaq.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4505 - I heard my father say: I heard Abu Dawud say: Shu'bah told us, he said: Asim bin Bahdalah informed us, he said: 'I heard Abu Wa'il narrating from Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah that the Messenger of Allah (pbuh) came to the rubbish heap of a people and urinated while standing. And it is not as Al-A'mash says: Abu Wa'il narrated to us only from Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah.' Shu'bah said: 'I had heard the hadith of Al-A'mash from him, so I met Mansur and asked him, and he narrated it to me from Abu Wa'il from Hudhaifah that the Messenger of Allah (pbuh) came to the rubbish heap of a people and urinated while standing.'

book_title: The Defects and Knowledge of Men (Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal)
text: 4506 - I asked my father about Asim bin Bahdalah. He said: 'He is Asim bin Abi Al-Najud, and he was a righteous man. And Bahdalah is Abu Al-Najud. He was a devout man. Zirr recited to Ali, and Zirr recited to Ali (repetition in source), and he recited to Abu Abdur-Rahman Al-Sulami, and Abu Abdur-Rahman recited to Abdullah. He was a reciter of the Qur'an, and the people of Kufa choose the recitation of Asim.' My father said: 'And I choose the recitation of Asim.' 4507 - I asked my father: 'Which recitation is most beloved to you?' He said: 'The recitation of Medina; if not, then the recitation of Asim.' He said: 'And I dislike from the recitation of Hamzah the severe breaking (Kasr) and the inclination (Idja' - Imalah).'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4508 - My father narrated to me, saying: I saw Sulaym al-Muqri reciting in the mosque of Ya'la bin Ubayd in Kufa, and a boy was kneeling before him reading with *Hamz* and *Tahqiq*.
4509 - I heard my father say: Shu'bah said: Sulayman al-A'mash narrated to us from Abu Salih, and Asim bin Abi al-Nujud narrated to us from Abu Salih from Abu Hurairah.
4510 - Shu'bah said: And Sulayman is dearer to us than Asim.
4511 - My father narrated to me, saying: Affan narrated to us, saying: Hammad bin Salamah informed us, saying: Asim bin Bahdalah and Hammad bin Abi Sulayman informed us from Abu Wa'il from Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah: That the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, came to the waste heap of a people and urinated while standing. Hammad bin Abi Sulayman said: So he spread his legs wide.
4512 - My father said: Mansur and Al-A'mash are more established than Hammad and Asim.
4513 - And I asked him about Hammad and Asim, and he said: Asim is dearer to us; Asim is a man of the Quran, and Hammad is a trustworthy man.
4514 - My father said: Ibn Uyaynah said: I saw Asim al-Ahwal next to Ibn Shubrumah—and Ibn Shubrumah was a judge—and Asim was exposing himself to something. Ibn Uyaynah said: Look at this sheikh, how he humiliates himself.
4515 - Asim al-Ahwal said: My companions still recognize my right. And Asim was a righteous man.
4516 - My father said: Yahya bin Sa'id said: I saw Asim al-Ahwal.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4517 - My father said: I witnessed Yahya bin Sa'id mentioning Asim al-Ahwal. He said: Asim al-Ahwal said from Abu Uthman: 'I witnessed Umar.'
4518 - Yahya said: And Al-Taymi [narrating] from Abu Uthman did not say 'I witnessed Umar.' Yahya said: This Asim says 'I witnessed Umar.' My father said: It was as if he disapproved of it.
4519 - My father said: Yahya used to prefer Al-Taymi over Asim.
4520 - My father narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya bin Sa'id when the hadith of Al-A'mash from Muslim from Masruq from Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah was mentioned in his presence. Yahya said: 'Masruq from Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah?'—twice or thrice. Yahya denied it with strong denial. I said to my father: Who followed him [in this narration]? He said: More than one; I think among them was Abd al-Wahid bin Ziyad and Abu Ziyad al-Khallaqani—meaning Isma'il bin Zakariyya. My father said: Ibn al-Sabbah narrated it to us from him.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4521 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Razzaq narrated to us, saying: Sufyan narrated to us from Al-A'mash from Muslim, as *Mursal* (hurried/disconnected).
4522 - My father narrated to me, saying: Mu'awiyah bin Hisham narrated to us from Sufyan from Al-A'mash and Mughirah, who said: We used to fear Ibrahim with the fear due to a prince.
4523 - And my father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Razzaq narrated to us from Sufyan al-Thawri from Al-A'mash from Muslim, as *Mursal*—meaning like the one before it, the hadith of Al-Mughirah. My father said: I was amazed at Yahya and his denial of it.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4524 - I heard my father say: Umar bin Ali al-Muqaddami was a righteous, chaste, Muslim, intelligent man. He possessed an amazing intellect. Then my father said: Umar came to Mu'adh bin Mu'adh and paid me two hundred thousand dirhams or one hundred thousand dirhams. Umar was among the most intelligent of people.
4525 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Ahmad al-Zubairi narrated to us, saying: Sufyan narrated to us from Mughirah, who said: We used to fear Ibrahim with the fear due to a prince.
4526 - I asked my father about Al-Harith bin Yazid, from whom Ibn Lahi'ah narrated. He said: Yahya bin Sa'id al-Ansari narrated from him, and he is a trustworthy sheikh among the trustworthy ones.
4527 - I heard my father say: Yahya bin Sa'id said: I saw Hilal bin Khabbab.
4528 - Abu Hamzah dictated to my father from his books. He said: Anas bin Malik is Abu Hamzah. And Abu Hamzah is Imran bin Abi Ata al-Qassab; Shu'bah, Hushaym, and Abu Awanah narrated from him, and he is righteous in hadith (*Salih al-Hadith*). And Abu Hamzah Maymun al-A'war; Ibrahim narrated from him, and he is weak in hadith; Hammad bin Salamah and Ibn Ulayyah narrated from him.
4529 - And Abu Hamzah, the neighbor of Shu'bah, his name is Abd al-Rahman bin Abdullah. My father said: Bahz bin Asad narrated it to me, and Waki' said: from Shu'bah from Abd al-Rahman bin Kaysan. And Abu al-Nadr said: from Shu'bah from Abd al-Rahman bin Abi Abdullah. My father said: Shu'bah, Yunus bin Abi al-Furat, and Hatim bin Abi Saghirah narrated from him.
4530 - And Abu Hamzah is Sa'd bin Ubaydah.
4531 - And Abu Hamzah is Muhammad bin Ka'b al-Qurazi.
4532 - And Sayyar Abu Hamzah; Ibn Abjar and Al-Salt bin Bahram narrated from him.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4533 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu al-Mughirah informed us, saying: Safwan narrated to us, saying: Abu Hamzah, the freedman of Abu Maryam al-Ghassani, narrated to us.
4534 - My father narrated to us, saying: Amr bin Mujamma' narrated to us, saying: Yunus bin Khabbab Abu Hamzah informed us.
4535 - My father said: And Abdullah bin Jabir al-Abdi is Abu Hamzah.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4536 - Abu Abd al-Rahman said: I found in a book I have—and I do not know if I heard it from my father or from someone else—Abu Ishaq al-Sabi'i from Abu Hamzah, the son-in-law of Masruq.
4537 - Shaiban narrated to us from Abu Hamzah al-Attar, and Ishaq bin al-Rabi' named him.
4538 - I asked my father about Amr bin Qais al-Mulla'i. He said: Trustworthy (*Thiqah*). Then he said:
4539 - Abd al-Razzaq narrated to us, saying: Sufyan al-Thawri informed us—and whenever Amr bin Qais was mentioned, he would elaborate on him and praise him.
4540 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Samad narrated to us, saying: Hazm narrated to us, saying: I heard Al-Hasan say—and he narrated a hadith. So Abdullah bin Buraidah said to him: 'Who informed you of this, O Abu Sa'id?' He said: 'Uthman bin Abi al-As.' He said: 'A trustworthy man, by Allah.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4541 - Abu Abd al-Rahman Abdullah bin Abi Ziyad al-Qatwani narrated to us, saying: Al-Walid bin al-Qasim said: My father died in the year forty-one, and I was a boy of fifteen years, and I had a wet dream four days after that. And he had narrated hadiths to us.
4542 - I heard him say: Yahya bin Sa'id al-Qattan said: 'If what Hammad bin Salamah narrates from Qais bin Sa'd is true, then he is...' I said to him: 'What?' He said: He mentioned some words. I said: 'What is it?' He said: 'A liar.'
4543 - I said to my father: 'Why is this?' He said: 'Because he narrated hadiths from him that he raised [directly] to Ata from Ibn Abbas from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace.'
4544 - My father said: 'The book of Hammad bin Salamah from Qais bin Sa'd was lost, so he used to narrate to them from his memory. This is his story.'
4545 - I heard my father mention Abdullah bin Salamah al-Aftas. He said: 'He was one of Yahya's companions, but he had bad character. We abandoned his hadith, and the people abandoned him.' Then my father said: 'Al-Aftas argued with Yahya in Mecca and said: "Leave me alone, for I am his equal."' This was the saying of Al-Aftas.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4546 - My father said: Al-Aftas used to come to Azhar al-Samman, and when he narrated, he would write on the ground: 'He lied, he lied.' He said: And he had a malicious tongue.
4547 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Nu'aym narrated to us, saying: Yunus bin Abi Ishaq narrated to us from Hilal bin Khabbab Abu al-Ala, who said: Ikrimah narrated to me.
4548 - I heard my father say: Al-Qasim bin al-Walid did not hear anything from Ibrahim al-Nakha'i.
4549 - I heard my father say: Amr bin Khalid is nothing; he is abandoned in hadith (*Matruk al-Hadith*).
4550 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ishaq bin Isa al-Tabba' narrated to us, saying: I narrated to Hammad bin Zaid the hadith of Jarir from Thabit from Anas, who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: 'When the prayer is established, do not stand until you see me.' He denied it and said: 'He only heard it from Al-Hajjaj al-Sawwaf from Yahya from Abdullah bin Abi Qatadah from his father in the gathering of Thabit, so he thought that he heard it—meaning from Thabit.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4551 - I heard my father say: Mujahid did not hear from Ya'la bin Umayyah. My father said: And Ata narrates from Safwan bin Ya'la.
4552 - And Rashid bin Sa'd did not hear anything from Thawban.
4553 - I heard my father say: I saw Al-Ashja'i while we were with Abu Badr, but I did not write anything from him.
4554 - My father said: And I saw Khalaf bin Khalifah when he was old. A person helped him down from his hand [support], and when he put him down, he cried out—meaning from old age. A person said to him: 'O Abu Ahmad, Muharib narrated to you...' and he recounted the hadith. He spoke words that were unclear to me, and I could not understand what he was saying, so I left him and did not write anything from him.
4555 - And I saw Bishr bin Umar—meaning Al-Zahrani—and he was a difficult person with a bad temper, so I could not write anything from him. He said: A person there told us: 'There is a person here who has a book from Ya'qub al-Qummi, and he is a man of the Quran.' So we went and wrote from him; he is Abu Rabi' al-Zahrani.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4556 - He said: And I saw Abdullah bin Wahb in Mecca; I saw him as a man with a light beard. My father said: I mentioned that he used to present [his hadiths] to Ali bin Uyaynah while he [Ali] was sleeping, so I left him. My father said: It reached me that he did not include anything from that presentation in his compilation. My father said: Then I wrote from a man from him later.
4557 - And I saw Zafir bin Sulayman and did not write anything from him.
4558 - Yahya bin Ma'in narrated to me, saying: Zafir bin Sulayman narrated to us from Abu Raja al-Harawi from Ata: {'And send forward for yourselves'} [Quran 2:223]. He said: Naming [Allah] during intercourse.
4559 - My father said: And I saw Abdullah bin Mu'adh al-San'ani and did not write anything from him.
4560 - And I saw Mubarak bin Sa'id bin Masruq, the brother of Al-Thawri, from that side, and I did not write anything from him.
4561 - And I saw Imran bin Uyaynah and did not write anything from him.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4562 - And I saw Nahshal bin Huraith al-Adawi and did not write anything from him. I said: 'How is he?' He said: 'There is no harm in him.'
4563 - My father said: And I saw Muhammad bin Marwan al-Uqayli, and he narrated hadiths while I was present, but I did not write them, though our companions wrote them. He used to narrate from Umarah bin Abi Hafsah. I left him intentionally and did not write anything from him; it was as if he considered him weak. My father said: Ibn Mahdi has narrated from him.
4564 - I asked him about Ubayd al-Rahman bin Fadalah. He said: 'The brother of Mubarak, and he is a trustworthy sheikh among the trustworthy ones.'
4565 - I heard him mention Bishr bin al-Sari. He said: 'Sufyan al-Thawri used to find him burdensome.' I said to him: 'Regarding what?' He said: 'He asked Sufyan about something.' I said to him: 'About what did he ask him?' He said: 'About the children—meaning the children of the polytheists.' He said: So Sufyan said: "What do you have to do with this, O boy?"' He said: 'And he used to visit Sufyan almost secretly.'
4566 - I heard my father mention Bishr bin al-Sari, and he said: 'Masterful in hadith, amazingly masterful.'
4567 - I heard him say: 'Umarah bin Ghaziyyah, I know nothing but good.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4568 - I heard him say: Umarah bin Abi Hafsah is trustworthy. And Umarah al-Saydalani, there is no harm in him. And Umarah bin Abd; Abu Ishaq narrated from him from Ali, may Allah be pleased with him. I heard him say: Ammar bin Abi Mu'awiyah, and he is Ammar al-Duhni, is trustworthy.
4569 - I heard him say: Ammar bin Abi Ammar, the freedman of Banu Hashim, is trustworthy.
4570 - And Ammar bin Abdullah bin Yasar; Ibn Uyaynah and Marwan narrated from him. I said: 'How is he?' But he did not say anything.
4571 - And Ammar al-Absi is a known man; Shu'bah narrated from him.
4572 - Adi bin Adi, his father was among the Companions of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. Do you ask about someone like this?
4573 - I heard him say: Adi bin Dinar; Thabit al-Haddad narrated from him.
4574 - I heard my father say: Adi bin Abi Umarah al-Jarmi. I said: 'How is he?' He said: 'A sheikh.'
4575 - I heard him say: Adi bin Thabit is from the Ansar; Shu'bah and Al-Mas'udi narrate from him.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4576 - And Abu Qatan said: Al-Mas'udi said: We never caught anyone more upright in the doctrine of the Shi'a than him—meaning Adi bin Thabit.
4577 - My father said: Adi bin Thabit, his grandfather is Abdullah bin Yazid from his mother's side.
4578 - I heard him say: Abu Ja'far al-Razi is not strong in hadith.
4579 - I heard my father say: I heard Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi say: Sufyan performed Hajj in the year one hundred and fifty-one, and Sufyan performed Hajj in the year [one hundred and fifty] two, and the year [one hundred and fifty] three. Ibn Mahdi said: And I performed Hajj in the year four, and he performed Hajj in the year four, and he performed Hajj in the year five, six, seven, eight, and nine. In all of them, I met him and heard—meaning from Sufyan.
4580 - My father said: Sufyan left Kufa in the year fifty-four.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4581 - And my father said: Abu Nu'aym said: The year fifty-five. So he did not return to them—meaning he did not return to Kufa afterwards.
4582 - My father said: And I saw Abbad bin al-Awwam dyeing [his hair/beard] with a dye bordering on black, deep red; and his kunya was Abu Sahl.
4583 - I heard my father say: Dawud bin Abi Hind came to Kufa, so the *mustamli* (dictator's assistant) of the people of Kufa stood up to repeat for them. He recited the hadith of Sa'id bin al-Musayyib: 'The Prophet is shrouded in a piece of cloth.' He misread it (*sahhaf*). He wanted to say 'The child' (*Al-Sabiy*), but he said 'The Prophet' (*Al-Nabi*).
4584 - I heard my father say: They recount from Ibn Awn, who said: Hilal bin Abi Zainab narrated to us, saying: Shahr bin Hawshab narrated to us. And they have criticized him (*nazakuhu*)—meaning by that, they accused him of something and weakened him.
4585 - I heard my father say: Ubayd bin Mihran is Ubayd al-Muktib.
4586 - My father said: Amr bin Dinar is older in age than Al-Zuhri.
4587 - I heard my father mention that Hakim bin Hizam's kunya is Abu Khalid.
4588 - And Hamzah bin Abd al-Muttalib is Abu Umarah.
4589 - And Suhail bin Amr is Abu Yazid.
4590 - Utbah bin Rabi'ah is Abu al-Walid.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text: 4591 - I heard him say: Abd Rabbih bin Abi Rashid is a trustworthy sheikh; Yahya al-Qattan narrated to us from him.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4592 - I heard him say: Fulait al-Amiri, I see no harm in him. Then he said: Surayj bin al-Nu'man narrated to us, saying: Abd al-Wahid bin Ziyad narrated to us from Aflat bin Khalifah. Abu Abd al-Rahman said: Al-Thawri says 'Fulait'.
4593 - I said to my father: Abu Rayhanah, who narrated from him other than Shu'bah? He said: Mu'ammal, Shu'bah, and Ali bin Asim from Abdullah bin Matar Abu Rayhanah. I said: Did anyone other than these narrate from him? He said: 'Yes, he is known.' I said: 'How is his hadith?' He said: 'I know nothing but good.'
4594 - I heard my father say: Muhammad bin Suqa has heard from Nafi' bin Jubayr; Ibn Uyaynah narrated it to us.
4595 - I asked my father about Abdullah bin Abd al-Rahman Abu Nasr. He said: The Kufans narrated from him; Sufyan al-Thawri and Ibn Fudayl narrated to us from him that hadith—the hadith of Umm Salamah. He did not raise it [to the Prophet] for me, but he raised it for others.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4596 - I heard him say: Sufyan bin Uyaynah said: Three people were admired for their opinion (*Ra'y*) [jurisprudence]: In Basra, Uthman al-Batti; in Medina, Rabi'ah al-Ra'y; and in Kufa, Abu Hanifa.
4597 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ibn Uyaynah narrated to us, saying: I said to Mughirah: 'Did you hear this from Ibrahim?' He said: 'What do you want with this?'
4598 - My father said: Matar al-Warraq is Matar bin Tahman.
4599 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Sa'id, the freedman of Banu Hashim, narrated to us, saying: Shaddad Abu Talhah narrated to us, saying: I heard Abu al-Wazi' Jabir bin Amr. My father said: Abu Talhah Shaddad is a trustworthy sheikh; Ibn Ulayyah and Waki' narrated from him. My father said: And I saw Muhammad bin Sa'id al-Umawi, the brother of Yahya bin Sa'id, and I did not write anything from him.
4600 - And I heard my father say: Ayyub bin al-Najjar is a trustworthy, chaste sheikh, a righteous man.
4601 - My father narrated to me, saying: Affan narrated to us, saying: Hammad bin Zaid narrated to us from Yunus, who said: Al-Hasan said: 'Seeking reward (*Ihtisaban*).' And Muhammad kept silent about [saying] 'Seeking reward.'
4602 - I heard my father say: We were in the gathering of Hushaym, and Hushaym was narrating the rituals (*Al-Manasik*). I heard Hushaym say: 'I pray to Allah for our brother Abbad bin al-Awwam.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4603 - My father narrated to me, saying: Muhammad bin Ja'far narrated to us, saying: Shu'bah narrated to us from Abu Ishaq, who said: I heard Amr bin Maimun narrating from Abdullah regarding this verse {'The Day the earth will be replaced by another earth'}, and he recounted the hadith. Shu'bah said: Then I heard him say: 'I heard Amr bin Maimun,' and he did not mention Abdullah. Then I returned to him later, and he said: 'Hubairah narrated it to us from Abdullah.'
4604 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Mu'min bin Abdullah bin Khalid al-Absi Abu al-Hasan narrated to us. My father said: Sufyan narrated from his father—meaning Abdullah bin Khalid al-Absi—and Al-A'mash narrated from him. My father said: And we heard from his son Abd al-Mu'min bin Abdullah, and he is Kufan.
4605 - My father said: Sufyan al-Thawri said: When Amr bin Dinar died, Ibn Abi Najih remained after him.
4606 - My father narrated to me, saying: Sufyan narrated to us, saying: Ubaydullah bin Abi Yazid informed me seventy years ago.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4607 - My father narrated to me, saying: Sufyan narrated to us, saying: I said to Ubaydullah bin Abi Yazid: 'With whom did you use to enter upon Ibn Abbas?' He said: 'With Ata and the general public. And Tawus used to enter with the private group.'
4608 - Sufyan said: I used to say to him: 'What did you see Ibn Abbas doing, and how did you see him?' I would extract from him and his son what he desired.
4609 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ibn Uyaynah narrated to us, saying: I did not hear it—meaning the hadith of the *Tashahhud*. It was read to him: Mansur and Al-A'mash from Abu Wa'il. 'But they used to narrate it, and I did not hear it from them.'
4610 - My father said: Sufyan did not hear the hadith of Abdullah regarding the *Tashahhud*.
4611 - I heard him say: I met Sufyan during four Hajj seasons; in all of them, I heard from him. And I stayed in Mecca for a year. The first year I performed Hajj was the year eighty-seven, the year Fudayl died. We arrived, and Fudayl had died. The second was the year one hundred and ninety-one. Al-Walid bin Muslim performed Hajj. Then Al-Walid performed Hajj afterwards in the year four [194], and I did not meet him in that year—meaning year four.
4612 - My father said: Ziyad bin Ilaqah did not hear from Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4613 - My father said: Hayyan al-A'raj is Al-Ju'fi, and he is Al-Azdi. Abu Abd al-Rahman said: Al-Ju'fi is a clan of Al-Azd.
4614 - My father narrated to me, saying: Hushaym narrated to us from Mansur bin Zadhan from Hayyan, and he is this one; Abu Hilal narrated from him, and Ibn Jurayj heard from him in Mecca.
4615 - My father narrated to me, saying: Hajjaj bin Muhammad narrated to us from Ibn Jurayj, who said: Hayyan informed me from Abu al-Sha'tha that he used to say: 'It is slaughtered standing'—meaning the sacrificial camel.
4616 - I asked him about Salim al-Khayyat al-Makki. He said: 'Trustworthy,' or he said: 'There is no harm in him.'
4617 - My father narrated to me, saying: Aswad bin Amir narrated to us, saying: Abd al-Hamid bin Abi Ja'far al-Farra narrated to us. He said: And Sharik praised him with good.
4618 - I heard my father say: Ibn Uyaynah said: 'Muhammad and the *Khamis*'—meaning the army.
4619 - I heard my father say: Uthman bin Abi Rawwad is the brother of Abd al-Aziz bin Abi Rawwad.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4620 - Abu Abd al-Rahman said: Abd al-Aziz bin Abi Rawwad, Uthman bin Abi Rawwad, and Jabalah bin Abi Rawwad are three brothers, and they were a household of righteousness and asceticism. 
4621 - My father narrated to me, saying: Al-Bursani narrated to us from Uthman bin Abi Rawwad. My father said: And Shu'bah narrated from him. 
4622 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi narrated to us, saying: Mu'awiyah bin Salih narrated to us from Sulayman Abu al-Rabi'. My father said: He is Sulayman bin Abd al-Rahman; Shu'bah and Laith bin Sa'd narrated from him. 
4623 - I heard my father say: I asked Abd al-Razzaq about Yunus bin Sulaym. He said: 'He is more exemplary than Amr Barq.' My father said: Ma'mar narrated from him, and he is Amr bin Abdullah. 
4624 - My father narrated to me, saying: Muhammad bin Ubaid narrated to us, saying: I heard Al-A'mash say: 'I used to pass by Qais bin Abi Hazim while I was going back and forth to Zaid bin Wahb.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4625 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ibn Uyaynah narrated to us, saying: Ayyub al-Sakhtiyani narrated to us that when Umar bin Abd al-Aziz became governor of Medina, Sulayman bin Abd al-Malik asked him about Urwah. He did not praise him in private conversation between them. He said: 'He is a righteous man, and I love the righteous'—meaning Umar. 
4626 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Bakr bin Ayyash narrated to us, saying: 'Abu Ishaq heard very little from Al-Harith, [only] three hadiths.' 
4627 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Samad narrated to us, saying: Abu Hilal narrated to us from Qatadah, who said: Khalid bin Abdullah—meaning Al-Qasri—said: 'The Reciters (Qurra') have nothing.' He said: 'Because of the glory of the Quran.' 
4628 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Razzaq narrated to us hadiths regarding the Mahdi. When he finished them, he turned to them and said: 'Were it not for this—or were it not for him—meaning myself, I would not have narrated them to you.' 
4629 - My father narrated to me, saying: Hajjaj narrated to us, saying: Shu'bah narrated to me from Abu Maslamah Sa'id bin Yazid from a man of his people called Abu Idris, who said: 'I saw an umbrella over Ibn al-Zubair.' And Shu'bah said: 'And I saw an umbrella over Ayyub and Yunus.' Shu'bah said: 'The jurists of the people of Basra used to wear it.' Yunus bin Ubaid saw me one day while I did not have it on me. He said: 'Where is the umbrella?' I said: 'I did not wear it.' He said: 'Do not abandon it.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4630 - I heard him say regarding the hadith of Fanj: 'This is not Dawud bin Qais al-Farra. Abd al-Razzaq narrated it to us, saying: Dawud bin Qais al-San'ani narrated to us.' 
4631 - I heard my father say: Abdullah bin al-Zubair, his kunya is Abu Bakr. Ibn Abi Mulaykah is Abu Bakr. Abd al-Rahman bin Yazid al-Nakha'i is Abu Bakr. Al-Zuhri Ibn Shihab is Abu Bakr. Ayyub al-Sakhtiyani is Abu Bakr. Dawud bin Abi Hind is Abu Bakr. Urwah bin al-Zubair is Abu Abdullah. Amr bin Maimun is Abu Abdullah. Sa'id bin Jubair is Abu Abdullah. Mutarrif bin al-Shikhkhir is Abu Abdullah. Ikrimah, the freedman of Ibn Abbas, is Abu Abdullah. Wahb bin Munabbih is Abu Abdullah. Amr bin Murrah is Abu Abdullah. Yunus bin Ubaid is Abu Abdullah.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4632 - My father narrated to me from Ali, who said: Ma'n narrated to us from Abd al-Malik bin Sumayy: Abu Bakr bin Abd al-Rahman is his name and his kunya. 
4633 - My father said: Abd al-A'la bin Hilal is Abu al-Nadr. 
4634 - My father said: Jamil bin Ubaid al-Ta'i is Abu al-Nadr. My father said: Abu al-Awwam al-Jazzar, his name is Fa'id bin Kaysan, the freedman of Bahilah. 
4635 - My father said: Raddad al-Laithi is Abu Malik. Abu Maryam al-Hanafi is Iyas bin Dubayh. And Abu Maryam al-Thaqafi, his name is Qais. Yahya bin al-Walid bin al-Musayyar al-Ta'i is Abu al-Za'ra. Abu al-Wadi' is Abbad bin Nusaib. 
4636 - My father said: Abu al-Awwam al-Qattan is Imran bin Dawwar.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4637 - My father narrated to me, saying: Sufyan bin Uyaynah narrated to us, saying: Abu al-Za'ra Amr bin Amr narrated to us from his paternal uncle Abu al-Ahwas. And Al-Thawri said: 'Amr bin Amir Abu al-Za'ra'; he erred, it is Amr bin Amr as Ibn Uyaynah said. 
4638 - I heard him say: Sa'id bin Abi Arubah is Abu al-Nadr, and Jarir bin Hazim is Abu al-Nadr. 
4639 - And I heard him say: Rifa'ah bin Shaddad is given the kunya Abu Asim; Al-Suddi narrated from him. And Ubaid bin Umair is Abu Asim. 
4640 - Ibn Jurayj has two kunyas: Abu Khalid and Abu al-Walid. And Al-Qassam bin Abi Barrah is Abu Asim.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4641 - And Awf al-A'rabi is Abu Sahl. Qurrah bin Khalid is Abu Khalid. Muhammad bin Abi Humaid is Abu Ibrahim. Salim bin Abdullah bin Umar is Abu Umar. 
4642 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Razzaq narrated to us, saying: Bakkar informed us. My father said: And he is trustworthy, Bakkar bin Abdullah. 
4643 - I heard my father say: Ibrahim bin Abi Hurrah is from the people of Nasibin, trustworthy; Ibn Uyaynah and Ibn Shawdhab narrated from him. 
4644 - I heard my father say: It reached me that Amr bin Jabir al-Hadrami, from whom Ibn Lahi'ah and Sa'id bin Abi Ayyub narrated, used to lie. 
4645 - My father said: He narrates objectionable hadiths (manakir) from Jabir bin Abdullah.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4646 - My father said: Malik bin Anas died in the year seventy-nine, and Hammad bin Zaid died in the year seventy-nine. That is the year in which I sought hadith. 
4647 - My father said: I was sixteen years old on that day. We departed from Hushaym at the end of the Book of Funerals, and they said: 'Hammad bin Zaid has died.' And Yazid bin Zurai' died in the year eighty-two, and Hushaym died in the year eighty-three. I went out to Kufa after his death in the year eighty-three, and I heard from Abd al-Salam bin Harb, Muttalib bin Ziyad, Umar bin Ubaid, Ibn Idris, Hafs, and other sheikhs as well. 
4648 - I heard him say: Awf sat with Al-Hasan before the defeat—the defeat of Ibn al-Ash'ath—before Yunus bin Ubaid sat with him. That is why Awf says: 'From Al-Hasan: It reached me that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to say.' Then Al-Hasan abandoned that saying of 'It reached me' after the defeat and would say: 'The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said.' 
4649 - My father said: I heard Yahya bin Sa'id say: Mutarrif is older than Al-Hasan by twenty years, and Abu al-Ala is older than Al-Hasan by ten years.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4650 - My father said: And Ibn Abi al-Aswad is the brother of Abu Bakr bin Abi al-Aswad, younger than Abu Bakr. Yahya bin Sa'id narrated this hadith to us from Abu Aqil Bashir bin Uqbah. 
4651 - I heard him say: Ata al-Khurasani is Ata bin Maysarah. My father said: Al-Qasim bin Malik narrated it to us from Asim al-Ahwal from Ata bin Maysarah from Ibn al-Musayyib, and he is Ata al-Khurasani. 
4652 - I heard my father say: I heard Yahya bin Adam say: 'Qinan is not of your ilk.' My father said: Yahya rarely mentioned people; I never heard him mention anyone other than Qinan. 
4653 - My father said: I said to Muhammad bin Bakr al-Bursani: 'When did you hear from Sa'id bin Abi Arubah?' He said: 'Before the defeat.' He said: 'I used to see Khalid bin al-Harith—meaning listening to Sa'id.' My father said: Sa'id used to say: 'Your pounding the peppercorns with the pestle'—meaning due to the intensity of memorization. 
4654 - My father narrated to me, saying: Zakariyya bin Adi narrated to us, saying: Ubaidullah bin Amr informed us from Abdullah bin Muhammad bin Aqil, who said: Uthman was killed in the year thirty-five. The fitnah (civil strife) lasted five years, four months of which were for Al-Hasan. And the assembly [under one leader] was for Mu'awiyah in the year forty.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4655 - My father said: Ibn Idris narrated to Shu'bah with this hadith, so he listened to him: the hadith of Asim bin Kulaib from Abu Musa: 'I came to a pregnant woman in Yemen.' This hadith pleased Shu'bah the most. 
4656 - My father said: I asked Abu Amr al-Shaibani about the hadith of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace: 'The most abased (akhna') name in the sight of Allah, Mighty and Majestic, is a man who names himself King of Kings.' He said: 'Akhna' means the vilest.' 
4657 - My father said: Ibn Uyaynah said to us: 'I heard from Yazid—meaning Ibn Khusaifah—seventy-four years ago in Mecca. He and Yahya bin Sa'id came to us, to Ibn Hisham.' 
4658 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ma'an bin Hamdah Abu Mahfuz narrated a hadith to us. He was a truthful sheikh, and Ibn Mahdi had acquired [hadith] from him. 
4659 - I heard him say: Ghassan bin Mudar is a trustworthy, trustworthy sheikh; his kunya is Abu Mudar. 
4660 - My father narrated to me, saying: Uthman bin Uthman al-Qurashi narrated to us; a righteous man among the trustworthy ones. 
4661 - My father said: Hasan bin Nadbah, there was no harm in him. 
4662 - My father said: Muhammad bin Sawa', his kunya is Abu al-Khattab al-Sadusi.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4663 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ibn Uyaynah narrated to us, saying: Abd al-Rahman bin Amir, a sheikh from the people of Mecca who heard Ata bin Yakhnas, narrated to me. Sufyan said: Ata—meaning Ibn Abi Rabah—used to narrate the hadith of Abu Hurairah 'Whoever misses the Asr prayer...' from Ata bin Yakhnas. 
4664 - My father said: Abu al-Minhal, his name is Abd al-Rahman bin Mut'im. My father said: Ibn Abi Najih narrated from Abdullah bin Kathir from Abu al-Minhal from Ibn Abbas. 
4665 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ibn Uyaynah narrated to us, saying: 'Al-Zuhri came to us when I was sixteen. He came with Ibn Hisham, the son of the Caliph. They narrated to me about him—meaning Al-Zuhri—saying: I have not seen anyone of his age seeking this—meaning knowledge.' 
4666 - Sufyan said: The year seventy-seven Al-Zuhri; we sat with him since seventy-four years.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4667 - My father narrated to me, saying: Sufyan narrated to us, saying: 'Al-Zuhri came to us in the year twenty-three and left in twenty-four; he died in that year. I asked him while Sa'd was with him, but he did not answer me regarding the hadith. When he did not answer me, he [Sa'd] said: Answer the boy regarding what he asked you. He said: Indeed, I will give him his due.' Sufyan said: 'And I was sixteen years old.' 
4668 - My father narrated to me, saying: Sufyan bin Uyaynah narrated to us, saying: Ibn Jurayj said: And he came to him—meaning to Al-Zuhri—and said: 'I want to present the book to you.' He said: 'Indeed, Sa'd has spoken to me regarding his son, and Sa'd is Sa'd.' Ibn Jurayj said to me: 'Did you not see him afraid of him?' Sufyan said: And he mentioned the hadith of Abu al-Ahwas. Sufyan said: I heard Sa'd bin Ibrahim say to Ibn Shihab—and he narrated from him—he said: 'Who is Abu al-Ahwas?' He said: 'Did you not see the sheikh who was at such-and-such place describing [it] to him?' 
4669 - I heard some sheikhs say: Al-Zuhri died in the year twenty-four. When news of his death reached Yazid bin Abi Habib, he said: 'Whoever has anything in his satchel from Ibn Shihab, let him preserve it.' He said: Then he died shortly after him. My father said: Yazid bin Abi Habib did not hear from Al-Zuhri; rather, he wrote a letter to him. He used to say: 'Al-Zuhri wrote to me.' 
4670 - And I heard some sheikhs say: When Yazid bin Abi Habib died, they found in his books the Maghazi from Muhammad bin Ishaq. He said: And Yazid bin Abi Habib said: 'My death is in my sandals; if I see something I dislike or hear something I dislike, I put on my sandals and leave.' Yazid bin Abi Habib's kunya was Abu Raja or Abu Hammad. He said: He was black and slender. He entered the bathhouse one day, and a man said to him: 'Stand up and scrub my back.' A man came in and said to him: 'This is Yazid bin Abi Habib!'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4671 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ibn Uyaynah narrated to us, saying: He made him sit with him on his mattress—meaning Ali bin Zaid. And Al-Zuhri had two garments on that had been washed, so it was as if he smelled the scent of potash. So he said: 'Will you not order that these two be perfumed with incense?' 
4672 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ibn Uyaynah narrated to us, saying: Al-Zuhri came at Maghrib time. He entered the mosque—I do not know if he circumambulated or not—and sat in a corner. Amr was near the columns. A person said to him: 'This is Amr.' So he got up and went to him and sat with him. Amr said: 'Nothing prevents me from coming to you except that I am crippled.' He said: 'It is good.' They questioned each other for an hour, then the prayer was established. 
4673 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ibn Uyaynah narrated to us a second time, saying: Al-Zuhri came to Amr bin Dinar, and Amr apologized to him, saying: 'I am crippled.' 
4674 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ibn Uyaynah narrated to us, saying: When Al-Zuhri narrated, he would say: 'So-and-so narrated to me.' And he was among the vessels of knowledge.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4675 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ibn Uyaynah narrated to us, saying: We were not able to get hadith from him—meaning Sa'id bin al-Musayyib—except by coming to him and saying: 'They said such-and-such.' Sufyan said: I did not hear it from him—meaning from Al-Zuhri. 
4676 - I heard my father say: I heard Yahya bin Sa'id say: Ibn Awn is older than Al-Taymi. 
4677 - I heard my father say: I heard Yahya bin Sa'id say: Al-Hakam died in the year fifteen or fourteen. 
4678 - I heard my father say: I heard Yahya say: Sufyan used to consider Abd al-Hamid bin Ja'far weak. My father said: Abd al-Hamid is trustworthy, trustworthy to us. I think [Sufyan did that] because of Qadar (belief in free will). 
4679 - My father narrated to me from Abu Bakr bin Ayyash, who said: I said to Al-Ahwas bin Hakim regarding a hadith—I said to him: 'From the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace?' He said: 'Is not the whole hadith from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace?' 
4680 - My father narrated to me, saying: It reached him from Muhammad bin Sawa', who said: I heard Shu'bah say to Awf al-A'rabi: 'I saw Qatadah with Khilas bin Amr.' 
4681 - My father narrated to me, he heard Yahya al-Qattan say: Hisham bin Urwah died after the defeat; it seems it was in the year following it—meaning the defeat of Ibrahim bin Abdullah bin al-Hasan.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4682 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya al-Qattan narrated to us, saying: Shu'bah used to deny the Qunut in the Witr and in the Fajr, as far as I know. Yahya said: And he—meaning Shu'bah—used to deny the Taslim [narrated] from Abdullah from Ibrahim and Abu Ishaq. 
4683 - My father narrated to me, saying: Affan narrated to us, saying: Uthman al-Barri narrated to us, saying: Abu Ishaq narrated to us from Mukrak bin Umarah. My father said: It is actually Mudrik bin Umarah. 
4684 - My father narrated to me, saying: Affan narrated to us, saying: Yahya bin Sa'id narrated to us, saying: I asked Shu'bah, Sufyan bin Sa'id, Sufyan bin Uyaynah, and Malik bin Anas about a man who does not memorize or is accused regarding hadith. They all said to me: 'Make his matter clear.' 
4685 - And Muhammad bin Yahya bin Sa'id narrated to me, saying: My father narrated to me. And Abu Hafs narrated to us, saying: Yahya bin Sa'id narrated to us. So he mentioned something similar to the hadith 'I asked Shu'bah and Sufyan,' and he mentioned the like of it. 
4686 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ibn Uyaynah narrated to us, saying: Harz, the brother of Hasan bin Muslim [said]: 'If you arrive in Kufa, seek out Laith—or he said: say to him—for he took the book of Ibn Hasan; surely he should return it.' Sufyan said: And Hasan bin Muslim died before Tawus.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4687 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya bin Sa'id narrated to us—he dictated it to Sufyan regarding Shu'bah—he said: I heard Amr bin Murrah say: Abdullah bin al-Harith the teacher narrated to me, saying: Tulaiq bin Qais, the brother of Abu Salih—meaning Al-Hanafi—narrated to me from Abdullah bin Abbas: That the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to supplicate—the hadith of the supplication: 'To You, full of gratitude; of You, full of remembrance.' 
4688 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya narrated to me, saying: Sufyan wrote to the Commander of the Faithful—meaning Al-Mahdi: 'It used to be said: Envy the living for that which you envy the dead.' 
4689 - My father narrated to me, saying: Waki' narrated to us from Ibn al-Walid bin Jami'. My father said: And I have heard it from him, and it is the hadith of the apostate, the hadith of Al-Qasim. 
4690 - My father said: In our book, there was [a narration] belonging to Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi from Sufyan from Al-Suddi from Abu Salih, but he did not narrate it to us from him; he abandoned his hadith. But Yahya al-Qattan used to narrate from him—meaning Badham Abu Salih. 
4691 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ali bin al-Madini narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya bin Sa'id say: A man said to Umm Dawud al-Wabishiyyah: 'Did Shuraih use to dye his beard?' She said: 'Your mother used to dye!' Meaning that Shuraih was distinctively hairless (kawsaj).

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4692 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya bin Sa'id narrated to us from Malik bin Anas, who said: I asked him about Shu'bah, the freedman of Ibn Abbas. He said: 'He did not resemble the Reciters (Qurra').' 
4693 - I asked my father about Muhammad bin Rashid who narrates from Makhul. He said: 'Trustworthy.' Abd al-Razzaq said: 'I have not seen anyone more pious in hadith than him'—meaning Muhammad bin Rashid. 
4694 - My father narrated to me, saying: And Abu al-Nadr said: I was performing ablution for Shu'bah at Al-Rusafah, and Muhammad bin Rashid passed by. Shu'bah said: 'I did not write from this one. Note that he is truthful, but he is a Shi'i—or a Qadari.' My father was unsure. 
4695 - My father said: Ibn al-Mubarak, Waki', and Ibn Mahdi narrated from him. 
4696 - My father said: And Ibn Uyaynah said: Three people were admired for their opinion [jurisprudence]: In Basra, Uthman al-Batti; in Medina, Rabi'ah al-Ra'y; and in Kufa, Abu Hanifa. 
4697 - And perhaps my father said: He said: 'Three are children of the captives of the nations.' This is its meaning. 
4698 - Ahmad bin Khalaf narrated to us from Sufyan, who said: The Banu Amir are three: As for Ubaidullah bin Amir, Ibn Abi Najih narrated to us from him. As for Urwah bin Amir, Amr bin Dinar narrated to us from him. As for Abd al-Rahman, I heard from him myself.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4699 - Abu Abd al-Rahman Abdullah said: Everything I say 'My father said,' I have heard it twice or thrice; the least of it is once. 
4700 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ibn Mahdi narrated to us one day from Ibrahim bin Sa'd from Al-Zuhri from Ibn Ka'b that Umar said in a hadith: 'Ashrafa alayhim' (He looked down upon them). I said to Abd al-Rahman: 'Abu Kamil said "Asrafa alayhim" (He exceeded against them).' He said to me: 'Ask Bahz.' So I came to Bahz and asked him, and he said: 'Ashrafa alayhim.' It was as if Abd al-Rahman would not be satisfied except with Bahz due to his reliability. 
4701 - I heard my father say: I heard Waki' say: Salamah bin Nubait Abu Firas narrated to us, and he was trustworthy. 
4702 - My father said: When Waki' came upon a hadith of Abdullah bin Ja'far, he refused Al-Madini [reading it] and said: 'Skip over it.' And [regarding] Al-Hasan bin Umarah, he said: 'Skip over it.' And when he came upon a hadith of Juwaibir, he said: 'Sufyan from a man he did not name'—meaning considering him weak. 
4703 - My father narrated to me, saying: Waki' narrated to us, saying: My father narrated to me from a man from Sa'id bin Jubair. My father said: He is Muslim al-A'war; he intentionally did not name him, nor did he name Aban bin Abi Ayyash. 
4704 - My father said: I heard Waki' say: Mujahid bin Jabr is the freedman of Al-Sa'ib.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4705 - My father narrated to me, saying: Affan narrated to us, saying: Abu Awanah narrated to us from Mughirah from Umm Musa: That the kunya of Al-Hasan bin Ali was Abu Muhammad. 
4706 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya bin Abi Bukair narrated to us, saying: I heard Shu'bah say: I was at the funeral of Talhah. Abu Ma'shar spoke and praised him, saying: 'He did not leave his like behind him.' 
4707 - My father said: Ibn Mahdi said from Sufyan regarding the hadith of Abd al-A'la: He said: 'We used to think that it was a book from Ibn al-Hanafiyyah.' 
4708 - My father said: Yahya abandoned Jabir al-Ju'fi. Ibn Mahdi narrated to us from him long ago from Shaiban or Sufyan, then he abandoned him afterwards. 
4709 - My father narrated to me, saying: Waki' narrated to us once from Ibrahim bin Sa'd, then he said: 'Skip over him.' He abandoned him at the end.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4710 - My father said: Yahya bin Ma'in spoke one day in the presence of Abd al-Rahman, and we mentioned Ibrahim bin Muhajir and Al-Suddi. Yahya said: 'Two weak ones.' Abd al-Rahman became angry and disliked what he said. 
4711 - My father narrated to me from Abu Qatan, who said: 'I never lent my book, nor did I ever cross-check [my book with others].' He said: 'Abu Dawud came to me and said: Lend me your book. I said: Sit down, I will dictate to you'—meaning the hadith of Hisham al-Dastawa'i. And Abu Qatan said: 'Shu'bah wrote for me to a man'—meaning Abu Hanifa. 
4712 - My father said: Uthman bin Umar narrated to Yahya bin Sa'id the hadith of Usama bin Zaid from Ata from Jabir from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace: 'All of Mina is a place of sacrifice,' and it contained words other than this. So Yahya abandoned him at the end because of this hadith. And Yahya abandoned Amr bin Ubaid at the end, although he had narrated to us from him.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4713 - My father narrated to me, saying: Muhammad bin Ja'far narrated to us, saying: Shu'bah narrated to us from Abu Ishaq from Sulayman al-A'mash from Abu Wa'il from Hudhaifah: 'The protected ones among the companions of Muhammad, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, knew that Ibn Umm Abd was the nearest of them to Allah in means of approach'—meaning Abdullah bin Mas'ud. 
4714 - I heard my father say: The kunya of Aqil bin Abi Talib is Abu Yazid. 
4715 - My father narrated to me, saying: Waki' narrated to us, saying: 'There was a lapse from Hubairah on the Day of Al-Mukhtar.' He said: And Yuraym Abu al-Ala is Abu Hubairah. 
4716 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Razzaq narrated to us, saying: Sufyan al-Thawri said: The name of the Negus (Najashi) is Asmahah, and in Arabic it is Atiyyah. 
4717 - My father said: Isa al-Hannat, his hadith is worth nothing. 
4718 - My father said: Al-Sari bin Isma'il is dearer to me than Isa.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4719 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ibn Uyaynah narrated to us from Ibn Abi Khalid, saying: Umar said: "Be vessels for the Book (Quran) and springs of knowledge, and ask Allah for provision day by day."

4720 - I heard my father say: Ata bin Yazid Al-Laythi, his Kunya (nickname) is Abu Muhammad.

4721 - My father said: Abu Al-Mughirah narrated it to us, saying: Ibn Ayyash narrated to us, saying: Umayyah bin Yazid Al-Qurashi narrated to us from Sulayman bin Ata bin Yazid Al-Laythi from his father's wife, she said: "I said, 'What is that, O Abu Muhammad?'"

4722 - I heard my father say: Aswad bin Amir narrated to us, saying: Ja'far bin Ziyad Al-Ahmar informed us. I said to my father: "Is he trustworthy (Thiqah)?" He said: "He is Salih al-Hadith (good/passable in Hadith)."

4723 - I said to my father: "Abu Salih Al-Samman?" He said: "He is the most trustworthy of them. They said: Trustworthy, Trustworthy."

4724 - I heard my father say: Muhammad bin Al-Hasan Al-Hamdani is weak (Da'if) in Hadith.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4725 - I heard my father say: Umm Umar bint Hassan bin Zaid narrated to us—my father said she was a truthful old woman—from her father, she said: "I entered the Great Mosque, and Ali bin Abi Talib was on the pulpit saying: 'My likeness and the likeness of Uthman is as Allah Almighty said: {And We removed whatever is within their breasts of resentment...} to the end of the verse.'"

4726 - My father narrated to me, saying: It reached me from Sufyan bin Uyaynah that he said: "Ayyub Al-Sakhtiyani and Amr bin Ubayd arrived in Mecca. They performed Tawaf until morning. He said: Then they arrived after that, and Ayyub performed Tawaf until morning, while Amr argued until morning."

4727 - My father narrated to me, saying: Waki narrated to us, saying: Khattab bin Uthman Al-Usfuri narrated to us. My father said: "A Kufan Sheikh."

4728 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Al-Mughirah narrated to us, saying: Sa'id bin Bashir narrated to us, saying: Qatadah narrated to me that Noah, peace be upon him, was sent from the land of Al-Jazirah, Hud from the land of Al-Shihr—the land of Mahra, Salih from Al-Hijr, Lut from Sodom, Shu'aib from Madyan. And Adam, Ibrahim, Ishaq, and Yusuf died in Palestine, and Yahya bin Zakariya was killed in Damascus.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4729 - I heard my father say: The Hadiths of Mughirah bin Ziyad are *Manakir* (objectionable/rejected). He narrated from Ata, from Aisha, from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace: "Whoever prays twelve Rak'ahs in a day..." while they narrate it from Ata, from Anbasah, from Umm Habibah. And the Hadith of Ata from Ibn Abbas regarding the *Khubarah* (soft land/plants) is dates, while he is not in a state of ablution, he said: "He performs Tayammum." He mentioned Mughirah bin Ziyad and said: "His Hadiths are *Manakir*."

4730 - I heard my father say: And he mentioned Yahya bin Adam and said: He erred in the Hadith of Ibn Mubarak, from Khalid, from Abu Qilabah, from Ka'b, who said: "Allah Glorious and Exalted said: I *Ashujju* (wound/break the head) and I heal." Yahya bin Adam said—and he erred a repugnant error—he said: "I *Asharu* (bewitch/perform magic) and I heal."

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4731 - Surayj bin Yunus narrated to us, saying: Abu Qatan narrated to us, saying: Abu Hanifah narrated to us, and he was *zaminan* (chronically ill/paralyzed/very weak) in Hadith.

4732 - Abu Ma'mar narrated to us from Al-Walid bin Muslim, who said: Malik bin Anas said to me: "Is Abu Hanifah mentioned in your land?" I said: "Yes." He said: "It is not fitting for your land to be inhabited." (My father said): And I do not think he heard from Al-Walid.

4733 - Mansur bin Abi Muzahim narrated to us, saying: I heard Malik bin Anas mention Abu Hanifah and say: "He nearly destroyed the religion, he nearly destroyed the religion."

4734 - And Mansur bin Abi Muzahim narrated to us, saying: I heard Sharik say: "For there to be a wine seller in every quarter of the quarters of Kufa is better than for there to be someone among them who says 'Abu Hanifah says'."

4735 - My father narrated to me, saying: Sufyan bin Uyaynah narrated to us from Husayn, from Ibn Khalidah: "If an ant were to walk to the prayer, it wouldn't beat Ibn Umar."

4736 - I heard my father say: This is the Hadith of Abu Sinan Dirar. Sufyan erred; it is not from the Hadith of Husayn.

4737 - My father narrated to me, saying: Sufyan narrated to us from Muhammad bin Abd al-Rahman bin Abi Layla, saying: "I saw a horse belonging to my father being used for stud services for the people."

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text: 4738 - My father narrated to me, saying: Sufyan narrated to us from Ata bin Al-Sa'ib from Arfajah, who said: We were with Utbah bin Farqad, and they mentioned the month of Ramadan. He said: "What did you hear? I heard the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say: 'In it the gates of Paradise are opened, the gates of the Fire are closed, and the devils are chained. And a caller calls out: O seeker of good, come forward! And O seeker of evil, desist!'" I heard my father say: Sufyan used to err in this Hadith. Utbah did not hear from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. A man narrated to Utbah from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4739 - My father narrated to me, saying: Sufyan narrated to us from Al-A'mash, who said: Abu Zabyan informed us three times, and Ibrahim was with me, saying: "I saw Ali come to the courtyard (*Al-Rahbah*), and he urinated while standing until his urine foamed." And Sufyan said once: I heard Al-A'mash from Abu Zabyan: "I saw Ali urinate in the courtyard until it foamed, then he performed ablution (*Wudu*) and wiped over his sandals, entered the mosque, removed his sandals, and prayed." He said: "I heard it from Abu Zabyan three times with Ibrahim. Ibrahim said to me: Ask him."

4740 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi narrated to us from Isra'il from Sa'id bin Masruq, saying: "I saw Ibrahim praying with nothing on him (upper garment) except a sword (belt)." Abd al-Rahman said: "So I asked Sufyan, and he narrated to me from his father from Ibrahim Al-Taymi similar to it."

4741 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi narrated to us from Sufyan from Abu Uthaymah, saying: "I brought a dispute to Abu Hurairah regarding a man to whom I said, 'O doer with his mother' (implying incest). He said: So he lashed me eighty times and said: 'What slander is greater than accusing a man regarding his mother?'"

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4742 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi narrated to us from Shu'bah from Abu Maymunah from Abu Hurairah similar to it, except that he said: "By your life, indeed, on the day I stand being lashed eighty lashes, I am certainly patient."

4743 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi narrated to us, saying: Sharik narrated to us from Salamah bin Al-Majnun, who said: "Abu Hurairah lashed me eighty times. He said: None of them hurt me except a lash that fell upon [the mark of] another lash."

4744 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi narrated to us from Sufyan from Abu Ya'fur from his father, who said: "We used to pray Maghrib, and we would not wait long before Al-Nu'man bin Bashir prayed Isha."

4745 - My father said: Abu Ya'fur is Abd al-Rahman bin Ubayd bin Nistas.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4746 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi narrated to us from Abu Yunus. My father said: Meaning Salm bin Zarir.

4747 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Bakr bin Ayyash narrated to us, saying: The scholars used to say that no group/rebellion emerged better than the People of the Skulls (*Al-Jamajim*) and *Al-Harrah*.

4748 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Bakr narrated to us, saying: Neither Ibn Al-Zubayr, nor Husayn, nor Ibn Umar pledged allegiance to Yazid bin Mu'awiyah during Mu'awiyah's life. He said: So Mu'awiyah left them alone.

4749 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Bakr narrated to us, saying: There remained no land but that Ibn Al-Zubayr possessed it, except Jordan.

4750 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Bakr narrated to us, saying: Al-Sha'bi said to a man, "What is your name?" He said, "Wardan." He said, "What is your horse's name?" He said, "Marran." He said, "And their difference!" (implying a rhyme or similarity).

4751 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi narrated to us, saying: Sufyan narrated to us from Al-A'mash from Muslim Al-Batin from Sa'id bin Jubayr, who said: A man came to Ibn Abbas and said, "I hired myself out to these people, and I deducted from my wage so they would let me perform Hajj and complete the rituals." So Ibn Abbas recited: {Those will have a share of what they have earned}. Abd al-Rahman said: I heard Sufyan say: "Jurayj asked me about it."

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4752 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi narrated to us, saying: Shu'bah narrated to us from Abu Husayn from Yahya bin Waththab from Masruq from Abdullah, who said: "If a man says to his wife 'Succeed by your own command' (*Istaflīḥī bi-amriki*) or 'Your matter is yours' or 'I have gifted her to her family', it is an irrevocable divorce." My father said: Abd al-Rahman said: Shu'bah said: So Abu Fulan said to him—my father said: He is Abu Maryam—to Abu Husayn: "Did Yahya bin Waththab tell you that Masruq told him that Abdullah told them?" He said: "Yes."

4752 - I asked my father, I said: "Khalid Al-Hadhdha from Abu Salih from Abu Hurairah. Who is this Abu Salih?" He said: "This is Qaylawayh Abu Salih."

4753 - My father said: "And he is the one from whom Sulayman Al-Taimi narrated, and I think Abu Khaldah narrated from him."

4754 - I heard my father say: "Abu Ghiyath, from whom Al-Thawri narrated, is the grandfather of Hafs bin Ghiyath."

4755 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi narrated to us, saying: Isra'il narrated to us from Abu Husayn from Yahya—meaning Ibn Waththab—from Masruq, who said: "If a man says to his wife 'Succeed by your own command' or 'Choose' or 'I have gifted her to her family', it is one irrevocable [divorce]."

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4756 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Rahman narrated to us, saying: And I asked Sufyan, and he said: "It is from Masruq," meaning that he did not say "from Abdullah."

4757 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi narrated to us, saying: Abdullah bin Al-Mubarak narrated to us from Yunus bin Yazid from Al-Zuhri from Sa'id Al-Musayyib: That when Abu Bakr sent the armies towards the Levant—Yazid bin Abi Sufyan, Amr bin Al-Aas, and Shurahbil bin Hasanah—Abu Bakr walked with the commanders of his armies bidding them farewell... (and he mentioned the Hadith at length).

4758 - I heard my father say: This is a *Munkar* (rejected) Hadith. I do not think any of this [is valid]. This is the speech of the people of the Levant. My father rejected it from Yunus from the Hadith of Al-Zuhri, as if he considers it from the Hadith of Yunus from other than Al-Zuhri.

4759 - My father narrated to me, saying: Sufyan bin Uyaynah narrated to us from Ibn Jud'an, who said: Thabit said to Anas: "O Anas, did you touch the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, with your hand?" He said: "Yes." He said: "Show it to me, let me kiss it."

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4760 - My father narrated to me, saying: Zaid bin Al-Hubbab narrated to us, saying: Sufyan informed us from Habib bin Abi Thabit from Abu Wa'il, who said: Ibn Masud said: "Indeed, among the people are keys to the remembrance of Allah; when they are seen, Allah is remembered."

4761 - I heard my father say: This is not from the Hadith of Habib bin Abi Thabit; we view that it is from the Hadith of Habib bin Abi Al-Ashras.

4762 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Rahman narrated to us, saying: Sufyan said: I heard Abu Husayn say: "Shurayh used to allow the testimony of the executor (*Wasi*) if he was not a litigant."

4763 - Abd al-Rahman said: I intended to ask him—meaning Sufyan—to repeat it, but he said: "It is similar to this." My father wrote it for me in his handwriting in the Hadith of Sufyan Al-Thawri in other than this place.

4764 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Ibrahim bin Khalid narrated to us, saying: Muhammad bin Majan informed me, saying: "Muhammad bin Yusuf arrived in Sana'a in the year 72. He said: Ibn Al-Zubayr had not been killed yet. Then Ibn Al-Zubayr was killed, and Al-Hajjaj cut off his hand—meaning Ibn Al-Zubayr's hand—and sent it to his brother Muhammad bin Yusuf."

4765 - I found in my father's book: Ghawth bin Jabir narrated to us, saying: I heard Aqil asking Muhammad bin Yusuf [who asked] Wahb about the kingdom of Solomon. He said: "He married a thousand women: seven hundred free women and three hundred concubines. He intended by that a multitude of children from the Children of Israel. But that was something he did not ask of his Lord, Glorious and Exalted, so He spoiled that for him, and he produced no offspring except a defective boy."

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4766 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Ghawth bin Jabir narrated to us, saying: I heard Abu Al-Hudhail Imran bin Abd al-Rahman bin Hirbidh say: I heard Wahb say: "Noah remained hewing the ark for one hundred years while they laughed at him. He said: When the hundred was completed, he boarded it."

4767 - He said: I heard Wahb say: "It is surely said that Jesus, son of Mary, will sit before the Day of Resurrection on the wood (structure) of Jerusalem as a just and fair judge for twenty years."

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4768 - He said: And I heard Wahb say: "They are seven earths and seven seas. The earth we are on is the middle one, and the sea surrounds it, and another earth surrounds the sea, and a sea surrounds it, and another earth surrounds the sea, and a sea surrounds it. Thus it is until seven earths and seven seas are completed. The entire earth is on the back of the whale, and the name of the whale is Bahamut (or Yahmut)."

4769 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Yunus bin Abd al-Samad bin Ma'qil narrated to us, saying: My father informed me, saying: I heard Wahb say: "Everything has a head, and the head of the earth is the Levant (Sham). I settle the people in it as long as they obey Me. If they disobey Me, I expel them from it and replace them with others."

4770 - I found in my father's book: Yunus bin Abd al-Samad narrated to us, saying: Aqil informed me, saying: I heard Wahb say: "Nights and days will not pass until the *Jadd* (luck/greatness/serious matter) is seven years old."

4771 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Ibrahim bin Khalid Al-Mu'adhdhin narrated to us, saying: Rabah narrated to us from Ma'mar, saying: Abdullah bin Muhammad bin Aqil brought out a ring whose engraving had figures. He claimed that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, wore it twice or something like that. So some of those with us washed it and drank its water.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4772 - I found in my father's book: Ibrahim bin Khalid narrated to us, saying: I gave my father many Hadiths from Ibn Sirin. So I said to Rabah: "What is the matter with Ma'mar regarding Ibn Sirin?" He said: "Ayyub used to give him Hadiths, until Ma'mar informed him that they were Ayyub's Hadiths."

4773 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Ibrahim bin Khalid narrated to us, saying: Rabah narrated to me from Ma'mar from Al-Zuhri, who said: "The dowry of every woman among the wives of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was ten ounces (*awqiyah*) of gold."

4774 - I found in my father's book: Ibrahim bin Khalid narrated to us, saying: Rabah narrated to me from Ma'mar, who said: "The distance of the clouds from the earth is three parasangs (*farsakh*)."

4775 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ibrahim bin Khalid narrated to us, saying: Rabah narrated to us, saying: Umar bin Habib narrated to me that Ata did not dye his beard. Ibrahim said: And Rabah died in the year seven and eighty, and he was eighty-one years old.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4776 - I found in my father's book: Ibrahim bin Khalid narrated to us, saying: Rabah narrated to me, saying: Ma'mar narrated to me from Al-Zuhri that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "If the knowledge of the women of this Ummah were gathered, including the wives of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, the knowledge of Aisha would be greater than their knowledge."

4777 - I found in my father's book: Ibrahim bin Khalid narrated to us, saying: Rabah narrated to us, saying: Ibrahim bin Harun narrated to me, saying: I heard Wahb mentioning the Ark (of the Covenant), he said: "It was of gold."

4778 - I found in my father's book: Ibrahim bin Khalid narrated to us, saying: Rabah narrated to me from Ma'mar, saying: "He was the brother of Joseph from his father and mother."

4779 - I heard my father say: Abd al-Razzaq narrated to us, saying: Ma'mar narrated to us from Isma'il bin Sharus Abu Al-Miqdam.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4780 - My father narrated to me, saying: Isma'il bin Ulayyah narrated to us from Abd al-Rahman bin Ishaq. Ibn Ulayyah said: "He is Attab bin Ishaq."

4781 - My father narrated to me, saying: Isma'il narrated to us, saying: Ibn Awn narrated to us from Umair bin Ishaq, who said: "Marwan was our governor for six years; he used to insult Ali every Friday. Then he was dismissed, and Sa'id bin Al-Aas was appointed for two years; he did not insult him. Then Marwan was reinstated, and he used to insult him."
