4782 - My father narrated to me, saying: I asked Isma'il bin Ulayyah: "Did you see anyone of your companions raising his hands in the Qunut of Witr?" He said: "No." I said: "Nor Yunus nor Ayyub?" He said: "No."

4783 - My father narrated to me, saying: Isma'il narrated to us from Yunus from Al-Hasan, who said: Al-Hajjaj said: "What is your best time/period?" He said: "I said: Two years of the Caliphate of Umar." He said: So he (Al-Hajjaj) said: "By Allah, your eye is bigger than your time." (It follows in the Seventh Part, Allah willing). My father narrated to me, saying: Isma'il narrated to us, saying: Abu Raja narrated to us, saying: I said to Al-Hasan: "When was your last time in Medina?" He said: "The nights of Siffin." And praise be to Allah alone, and may Allah bless Muhammad the Prophet and his family and grant them peace.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text: The Seventh Part of the Book of *Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat Al-Rijal* (Illnesses [of Hadith] and Knowledge of Men).

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4783 - Muhammad bin Al-Fadl bin Musa narrated to us, saying: Muhammad bin Yusuf narrated to us, saying: Ibn Jurayj narrated to us, saying: Fafah informed me from Al-A'mash from Shaqiq bin Salamah from Ibn Masud, who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "Whoever swears a firm oath to cut off/misappropriate the wealth of a man, he will meet Allah while He is angry with him."

4783 - It was read to Abu Ali bin Al-Sawwaf in the Hadith of Al-Humaydi: Bishr bin Musa narrated to us, saying: Al-Humaydi narrated to us, saying: Sufyan narrated to us from Ibn Abi Najih, saying: Ibn Umar, when he heard a beggar asking, would say: "Your right is with Mu'awiyah."

4783 - Bishr narrated to us, saying: Al-Humaydi narrated to us, saying: Sufyan narrated to us from Ibn Abi Najih, who said: "I saw a thunderbolt strike two palm trees at Arafah and burn them." Ibn Abi Najih said: "I saw them as if they were two embers."

4783 - Abu Ali bin Al-Sawwaf narrated to us—and from his original I wrote—he said: Abdullah bin Ahmad bin Hanbal narrated to us, saying: My father narrated to me, saying: Ibn Fudayl narrated to us, saying: My father narrated to us, saying: Ibn Shubrumah asked Abdullah bin Al-Hasan about the pilgrim in Ihram kissing. He said: "He owes a blood (sacrifice)." He said: "What if he emits pre-seminal fluid (*Madhy*)?" He said: "He owes a sacrifice, more than a sacrifice."

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4783 - Abu Abd al-Rahman said to us: Ibn Abi Shaibah dictated to us regarding the pilgrim in Ihram kissing his wife. I showed it to my father. He said to me: "What does he say about the female pilgrim in Ihram kissing her husband?" I said: "I don't know." So I returned to Ibn Abi Shaibah the next day and informed him. He said: "I have nothing on this." So what does he have? So I narrated to him this Hadith.

4783 - Abdullah narrated to us, saying: My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Al-Mughirah Abd al-Quddus bin Al-Hajjaj narrated to us, saying: Sa'id bin Abd al-Aziz narrated to us, saying: Ata bin Abi Rabah narrated to me, saying: "On the pilgrim in Ihram, if he kisses his wife, is a sheep. And on his wife is the like of that if she complied."

4783 - Ibn Abi Shaibah said: "I haven't heard this." Then he said: "We came to Baghdad more than forty years ago to [see] Ibn Ulayyah. No one stood in our faces—meaning guarding the doors—except the father of this one." Abdullah bin Ahmad said: "He means me." A man said to him: "And Yahya bin Ma'in?" He said: "He has a severe madness/stupor (*Mu'tah*)."

4783 - Abdullah bin Ahmad bin Hanbal narrated to me, saying: My father narrated to me, saying: Surayj bin Al-Nu'man narrated to us, saying: Abdullah bin Nafi' informed me, saying: Malik bin Anas used to say: "Faith is speech and action." And he used to say: "Allah spoke to Moses." And he said: "Allah is the King in the Heaven, and His knowledge is in every place; nothing is devoid of Him." And he recited this verse: {There is no private conversation of three but He is the fourth of them, nor are there five but He is the sixth of them}. And he was strict in speech regarding this [or found it repugnant]: "Whoever says the Quran is created is to be beaten painfully and imprisoned until he repents."

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4783 - Abdullah narrated to us, saying: My father narrated to me, saying: I heard Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi say: 'Whoever claims that Allah, Blessed and Exalted, did not speak to Moses is asked to repent; if he repents [good], otherwise his neck is struck [he is executed].'
4783 - Abdullah narrated to us, saying: Muhammad bin Ashkab narrated to us, saying: Qurad Abu Nuh narrated to me, saying: I heard Shu'bah say: 'I quenched the Arabs [with knowledge] from Sa'd bin Ibrahim.' He said: And I heard Shu'bah say: 'We never went to a sheikh in Kufa except that we found Qais had preceded us to him.' And Qais used to be called 'The Roamer' (Al-Jawwal). It was read to Abu Ali bin al-Sawwaf in Dhu al-Hijjah in the year three hundred and forty-three. And I heard: In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
Abu Abd al-Rahman Abdullah bin Ahmad bin Muhammad bin Hanbal informed us by license, saying:
4784 - My father narrated to me, saying: Isma'il narrated to us, saying: Abu Raja informed us, saying: I said to Al-Hasan: 'When was your last time in Medina?' He said: 'The night of Siffin.' He said: I said: 'So when did you reach puberty?' He said: 'A year after Siffin.'
4785 - My father narrated to me, saying: Isma'il narrated to us, saying: Al-Hasan al-Basri died in Rajab in the year one hundred and ten. My father said: And in it [that year] Isma'il was born.
4786 - My father narrated to me, saying: Isma'il narrated to us from Abu Raja, who said: Al-Hasan was asked while I was listening about Jerusalem (Bait al-Maqdis). He said: 'David founded it, and Solomon completed its construction.'
4787 - My father narrated to me, saying: Isma'il narrated to us, saying: Ayyub narrated to us from Muhammad bin Sirin, who said: 'The Fitnah (civil strife) erupted while the Companions of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, were ten thousand. Not even one hundred of them participated in it; rather, they did not even reach thirty.'
4788 - My father narrated to me, saying: Isma'il narrated to us, saying: Ayyub narrated to us from Humaid bin Hilal: That Al-Bara' bin Ma'rur died before the arrival of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, so when he arrived, he prayed over him.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4789 - My father narrated to me, saying: Isma'il narrated to us, saying: Raja' bin Abi Salamah narrated to us, saying: Mu'awiyah used to say: 'Stick to the hadith that was [circulated] during the time of Umar, for indeed Umar used to make people afraid regarding the hadith from the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace.'
4790 - My father narrated to me, saying: Isma'il narrated to us from Laith from Abu Muhammad from Sa'id bin Jubair, who said: Ibn Umar said: 'I wish I had seen hands being cut off for stealing copies of the Quran (Masahif).' I asked my father [about the narrator], and he said: Abu Muhammad is Salim al-Aftas.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4791 - My father narrated to me, saying: Isma'il narrated to us from Ayyub, who said: A man asked Ikrimah about something, and he said: 'They were from the Nabateans of your people.'
4792 - My father narrated to me, saying: Isma'il narrated to us, saying: Abd al-Rahman bin Ishaq narrated to us, saying: My father narrated to me from Sa'id bin al-Musayyib, who said: My grandfather, Hazn bin Abi Wahb, came to the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. He said: 'What is your name?' He said: 'I am Hazn (Rough/Sad).' He said: 'Rather, you are Sahl (Easy/Smooth).'
4793 - I heard my father say: Ibn Ulayyah has more understanding of Fiqh than Hushaym.
4794 - My father narrated to me, saying: Isma'il narrated to us from Ibn Jurayj from Sulayman bin al-Ahwal from Tawus from Ibn Abbas regarding His saying, Mighty and Exalted, {Come willingly or unwillingly}: He said: 'Give.' And regarding His saying, Mighty and Exalted, {They said: We come}: They said: 'We give.' My father said: And Hajjaj said from Ibn Jurayj from Amr bin Muslim: It was said to Hajjaj: 'Indeed, Yahya bin Sa'id says [it is] from Sulayman al-Ahwal.' Hajjaj said: 'Tell him to keep warm in cotton.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4795 - I heard my father say regarding the hadith of Ghundar from Isma'il from Qatada from Khilas, and from Abu Hassan from Abdullah bin Utbah bin Mas'ud from Abdullah bin Mas'ud: 'That Subai'ah bint al-Harith gave birth to her child after the death of her husband.' Ghundar erred in it. He said: 'From Abdullah,' but they contradicted him. It is not 'from Abdullah'—meaning it is Mursal.
4796 - I heard my father say: Sa'id bin Abi Arubah did not hear from Ja'far bin Abi Wahshiyah, nor from Al-Hakam, nor from Hammad.
4797 - I heard my father say: Ghundar gave us his books, so we used to copy from them. He used to read to us a lot until we got bored, except for the hadith of Sa'id in Baghdad; we copied those in Baghdad.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4798 - I said to my father: Sa'id bin Abi Arubah from Abu Ubaidah from Sa'id bin Jubair? He said: 'I do not know it.'
4799 - I heard my father say: Sa'id did not hear anything from Abdullah bin Dhakwan nor from Abdullah bin Umar.
4800 - I heard my father say: Sa'id indeed heard from Ayyub.
4801 - I said to my father: Sa'id from Abu Utbah from Hammad? My father said: 'I do not know him.'
4802 - I heard my father say: Whenever Ghundar had a mark—meaning a sign—on something from the hadith of Sa'id, he would say in it: 'Sa'id narrated to us,' and he would say: 'I heard it and presented it to Sa'id.' And if there was no mark on it, he would not say in it: 'Sa'id narrated to us,' [but] he would say: 'I heard it from Sa'id.'
4803 - I heard my father say: Al-Qasim bin Abdullah bin Umar al-Umari, in my opinion, used to lie. And his brother Abd al-Rahman bin Abdullah—meaning Al-Umari—is not someone who is narrated from.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4804 - I heard my father say regarding the hadith of Sa'id bin Abi Arubah from Ghalib al-Tammar from Humaid bin Hilal from Masruq bin Aws from Abu Musa from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, who said regarding the fingers: 'Ten, ten camels [as blood money].' My father said: This Ghalib al-Tammar is not Ghalib al-Qattan. Al-Qattan is Ibn Khattaf.
4805 - I heard my father say: Sa'id did not hear anything from Umar bin Abi Salamah.
4806 - I heard my father say: Ghundar erred in the hadith of Sa'id from Qatada from Sulayman bin Yasar—so said Ghundar—from Jabir: That Umar said: 'The Prophet of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, did not forbid the lizard (dabb), but he found it repugnant.' Ibn Ulayyah contradicted him and said: 'Sulayman al-Yashkuri,' which is the correct one; it is not Sulayman bin Yasar.
4807 - I heard my father say: Sa'id did not hear from Ibn Aqil.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4808 - I asked my father about the hadith of Sa'id from Abd al-Wahhab: That he asked Al-Hasan about ablution. Who is this Abd al-Wahhab? He said: 'I do not know him.'
4809 - I heard my father say: Yahya bin Sa'id used to liken Matar to Ibn Abi Laila in hadith—meaning in the hadith of Ata.
4810 - I read to my father: Wahb bin Isma'il Abu Muhammad al-Asadi is a Kufan.
4811 - My father narrated to me, saying: Sa'id bin Ubaid al-Ta'i narrated to us from Amir al-Sha'bi, who said: A man came to him and said: 'O Abu Amr, I have performed Hajj, and I intended to perform Hajj this year, but I have neighbors in need.' I heard my father say: Sulayman bin al-Mughirah narrated it from Sa'id al-Kufi—meaning Sa'id bin Ubaid.
4812 - I heard my father say: Uqbah bin Ubaid al-Ta'i is the brother of Sa'id bin Ubaid.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4813 - I read to my father: Marwan al-Fazari informed us, saying: Musa bin al-Sa'ib narrated to us, saying: Shahr bin Hawshab narrated to me. I heard my father say: 'It is actually Musa bin al-Musayyib.'
4814 - I heard my father say: They have related from Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi that he said: 'Yazid al-Raqashi is Yazid bin Hurmuz.'
4815 - I heard my father say: Yahya bin Abd al-Malik bin Abi Ghaniyyah is a righteous man; he is trustworthy. He and his father are close in hadith.
4816 - I read to my father: Yahya bin Abd al-Malik bin Abi Ghaniyyah, saying: Sufyan narrated to us from Nafi' from Ibn Umar: That he used to wash his penis.
4817 - My father said: 'It is Mursal (disconnected). I see that between them is Isma'il bin Umayyah.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4818 - I read to my father: Ali bin Thabit from Isma'il from Ibrahim bin Muhajir from his father from Abd al-Rahman bin al-Aswad: That Ibn Mas'ud washed his wife when she died. I heard my father say: 'I do not reject it.'
4819 - I said to my father: Ali bin Thabit from Abu Burdah from Hammad? My father said: 'This is one of the companions of Hammad; Marwan bin Shuja' narrated from him.'
4820 - I heard my father say: Jabir bin Sulaim al-Ansari, I heard from him. He is a trustworthy sheikh from Medina, of good appearance.
4821 - I read to my father: Muhammad bin Rabi'ah Abu Abdullah al-Kufi from Qais bin Abdullah, who said: I saw Al-Hasan praying in the Maqsurah. My father said: 'He is a sheikh of theirs, a Kufan, he is narrated from.'
4822 - I read to my father: Muhammad bin Rabi'ah said: Ibn Awn narrated to us from Ibn Sirin: That Uthman appointed [a governor] for those beyond the river. Isma'il bin Ulayyah said: 'Appointed for those on this side of the river'—meaning the river of Balkh. My father said: 'And that is the correct one.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4823 - I read to my father: He said: I heard it from Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi, he heard it from Malik from Nafi' from Ibn Umar: 'There is no suckling except for a small child; there is no suckling for a grown-up.'
4824 - I heard my father say: Ubaydullah narrated it from Nafi' from Ibn Umar from Umar. And Ibn Dinar—meaning Abdullah—[narrated it] from Ibn Umar from Umar.
4825 - I read to my father: Abd al-Rahman from Malik from Nafi': That Ibn Umar saw a man pray the two rak'ahs of Fajr and then lie down. It was spoken to him regarding that, and he said: 'I wanted to separate [the prayers].' He said: 'And what separation is better than the Taslim (salutation)?' I heard my father say: I read to Abd al-Rahman, and he cross-checked it with me from his book: Malik: That it reached him from Ibn Umar. Abd al-Rahman said: 'And it was read to Malik.'
4826 - I read to my father: Abd al-Rahman said: Malik narrated to us from Al-Zuhri from Urwah from Aisha: That Abu Bakr gifted her the harvest of twenty Wasqs from his property in Al-Ghabah. Thus said Ibn Mahdi. My father said: 'It is actually Al-Aliyah.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4827 - I said to my father: 'What do you say about this hadith, the hadith of Malik from Yazid bin Abdullah bin Qusait from Muhammad bin Abd al-Rahman bin Thawban from his mother from Aisha: That the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, granted permission to utilize the skins of dead animals if they are tanned?' I said to my father: 'What do you say about this hadith?' He said: 'In it is "his mother," from his mother.' It was as if he rejected it because of [the narrator] his mother.
4828 - I said to my father: Malik from Al-Salt bin Zubaid, who said: I asked Sulayman bin Yasar; I said: 'I find wetness?' My father said: 'Malik heard it from him—meaning from Al-Salt. And this one is the son of that one'—meaning Zubaid bin al-Salt.
4829 - I asked my father about a sheikh from whom Malik narrated, Afif bin Amr. My father said: 'An old, chaste sheikh.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4830 - My father narrated to me, saying: Isma'il bin Ibrahim narrated to us, saying: Al-Jurayri informed us from Abu Uthman al-Nahdi from Ibn Mas'ud. He said: He claimed that he used to sit with him in Kufa.
4831 - My father narrated to me, saying: Muhammad bin Salamah Abu Abdullah al-Harrani narrated to us from Khasif from Mujahid, who said: 'Seventy-five prophets performed Hajj.'
4832 - I heard my father say: Muhammad bin Salamah narrated to us, saying: Abu Abd al-Rahim informed us. My father said: His name is Khalid bin Abi Yazid. My father said: There is kinship between him and Muhammad bin Salamah. My father said: Waki' and Hajjaj narrated to us from him, and he was in charge of the Treasury (Bait al-Mal). How approachable his hadith is!
4833 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ali bin Thabit narrated to us, saying: Abu al-Ambas narrated to me, saying: Shaqiq bin Salamah used to dye [his beard] with something. He said: 'The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was sent while I was beardless, and it was not decreed for me to meet him.'
4834 - I heard my father say: I heard Marwan bin Shuja' Abu Amr al-Jazari, from the people of Harran, in the year one hundred and eighty-one. My father said: And I had heard from him before that as well.
4835 - My father said: Furat Abu Abdullah is Furat al-Qazzaz.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4836 - I heard my father say regarding the hadith of Hajjaj bin Artah from Qatada from Abdullah bin Abi Qatada from his father: That he placed water for ablution for him, and a cat drank from it.
4837 - My father said: This Qatada is not Qatada bin Di'amah; he is from the children of Abu Qatada, [narrating] from Abdullah bin Abi Qatada.
4838 - My father narrated to me, saying: Mu'tamir bin Sulayman Abu Abdullah—of good appearance—narrated to us, saying: Maimun bin Mihran said: 'I have not seen three in a house better than Umar bin Abd al-Aziz, his son Abd al-Malik, and his freedman Muzahim.'
4839 - I heard my father say: The hadith of Sufyan al-Thawri from Abu al-Zinad from Busr bin Sa'id from Abu Salih the freedman of Al-Saffah. My father said: 'He is not Dhakwan'—meaning Abu Suhail bin Abi Salih.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4840 - My father narrated to me, saying: Miskin bin Bukair Abu Abd al-Rahman narrated to us from Shu'bah, who said: Mansur wrote to me informing me of a hadith. He said: I met him and said: 'May I narrate it from you?' He said: 'Yes, if I wrote to you, then I have narrated to you.' And regarding Ayyub al-Sakhtiyani, the same.
4841 - My father narrated to me, saying: Miskin bin Bukair narrated to us, saying: Sa'id—meaning Ibn Abd al-Aziz—informed us, saying: Sulayman bin Musa used to present [hadith] to Al-Zuhri or to Makhul, and Al-Zuhri used to present to him—meaning hadith.
4842 - My father narrated to me, saying: Miskin narrated to us, saying: Al-Awza'i narrated to us, saying: Abu Hanifa was asked. My father said: Al-Awza'i did not hear anything from Abu Hanifa; he only criticized him with it.
4843 - My father narrated to me, saying: Khalid bin Hayyan Abu Yazid al-Raqqi al-Khazzaz narrated to us, saying: Furat bin Salman narrated to us, saying: Maimun did not have a circle by which he was known in the mosque.
4844 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Usama narrated to us from Al-Walid bin Hisham, who said: A person who used to sell perfume entered upon the family of Al-Qasim bin Muhammad selling them perfume, while Al-Qasim was preparing for Friday [prayer]. My father said: It is a mistake; it is actually Hisham Abu al-Miqdam. Meaning Abu Usama erred.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4845 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Usama narrated to us, saying: Abdullah bin Awn narrated to us from Al-Hasan, who said: 'They used to punish (yankilun) the one who divorced thrice in one sitting.'
4846 - My father said: 'It is actually "yunkirun" (they used to deny/disapprove), but he erred and said "yankilun".'
4847 - I heard my father say: Harun—meaning Al-Barbari—is trustworthy, trustworthy (Thiqah Thiqah).
4848 - I heard my father say: How good is his hadith—meaning Al-Salt bin Bahram.
4849 - I heard my father say: Sulayman bin Yasir is worth nothing in hadith.
4850 - I heard my father say: Bukair—meaning Ibn Amir—is satisfactory in hadith (Salih al-Hadith), there is no harm in him.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4851 - I read to my father: Muhammad bin Ubaid from Muhammad—meaning Ibn Amr—from Sa'd bin al-Mundhir from Abu Humaid al-Ansari from Ibn Abi Usaid al-Ansari from Al-Harith bin Ziyad, who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: 'Whoever loves the Ansar, Allah loves him.' I heard my father say: Thus said Muhammad bin Ubaid, and he erred in it.
4852 - I heard my father say: Ammar bin Muhammad Abu al-Yaqzan, the nephew of Sufyan al-Thawri, narrated to us in the year eighty.
4853 - I heard my father say: I heard Ubaydullah bin Musa long ago, some of it in the year eighty-five and after that. He said: I saw Ubaydullah bin Musa in Mecca, but I did not approach him; I had no favorable opinion of him.
4854 - I heard my father say: Abu Abd al-Samad al-Ammi narrated to us, saying: Hisham Abu Bakr—meaning Al-Dastawa'i—narrated to us.
4855 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Abd al-Samad al-Ammi narrated to us, saying: Jabir bin Yazid al-Ju'fi narrated to us from Amir: That he saw Ali bin Abi Talib, may Allah's blessings and peace be upon him, and his head and beard were as if they were white cotton.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4856 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Abd al-Samad al-Ammi narrated to us from Salam bin Miskin, who said: Al-Hasan said to me: 'O my son...'
4857 - I heard my father say: Abu Abd al-Samad al-Ammi narrated to us, saying: Abu al-Azhar Salih bin Dirham narrated to me.
4858 - I heard my father say: Sa'id bin Abi Arubah did not hear anything from Al-A'mash, nor from Ubaydullah bin Umar, nor from Hisham bin Urwah, nor from Isma'il bin Abi Khalid; but he heard from Asim bin Abi al-Nujud.
4859 - My father narrated to me, saying: Mu'adh bin Mu'adh narrated to us, saying: Ibn Awn informed us, saying: Among those who followed the practice of narrating the hadith exactly as he heard it were Muhammad bin Sirin, Al-Qasim bin Muhammad, and Raja' bin Haywah. And among those who did not follow that were Al-Hasan, Ibrahim, and Al-Sha'bi. Ibn Awn said: I said to Muhammad: 'Indeed, so-and-so does not follow that.' He said: 'Behold, if he followed it, it would be better for him.'
4860 - My father narrated to me, saying: Mu'adh bin Mu'adh narrated to us, saying: A man from our companions narrated to us in Baghdad, saying: A companion of mine narrated to me, saying: I said to Ibn Awn: 'Indeed, a people claim that Allah did not create evil.' He said: 'I seek refuge with the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing. {Say: I seek refuge in the Lord of Daybreak. From the evil of what He created}.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4861 - My father narrated to me from his original book, saying: Abd al-A'la bin Abd al-A'la al-Sami narrated to us, saying: Yunus—meaning Ibn Ubaid—narrated to us from Al-Ala bin Ziyad from a man of Bakr bin Wa'il: I said to Ibn Umar: 'What do you say regarding the sacrifice (Udhiyah)?' He said: 'Perhaps you consider it obligatory upon you?' My father said: And Hushaym said: 'From Yunus from Al-Ala bin Hilal,' and that is the correct one.
4862 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-A'la bin Abd al-A'la narrated to us from Ma'mar from Al-Zuhri: That the Prophet of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, went out one night in Ramadan, and people prayed with his prayer. Then he went out the second night, and they prayed with his prayer. When it was the third night, they increased until the mosque was full or nearly full, but he did not come out. Umar bin al-Khattab entered upon him and said: 'O Messenger of Allah, the people are waiting for you.' He said: 'Indeed, their location was not hidden from me, but I feared that it would be made obligatory upon them.'
4863 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Razzaq narrated to us from Ma'mar from Al-Zuhri from Salim from Ibn Umar. Then he—meaning Abd al-Razzaq—retracted it and said: 'Strike it out.' So we made it from Al-Zuhri as Mursal.
4864 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ibrahim bin Khalid narrated it to us from Rabah from Ma'mar from Al-Zuhri from Urwah from Aisha—this hadith.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4865 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-A'la narrated to us from Ma'mar from Al-Zuhri from Abu Salamah from Abu Hurairah: That the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: 'There is no contagion, no [bad omen in] Safar, and no Haamah (owl/soul of the dead).' A Bedouin said: 'O Messenger of Allah, what about the camels that are in the sands like deer, then a mangy camel mixes with them and they all become mangy?' The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: 'So who infected the first one?'
4866 - Abu Salamah said: Then I heard Abu Hurairah a time after that saying: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: 'Let no owner of sick camels bring them to the owner of healthy camels.' A man said: 'Did you not narrate to us from the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, that he said: "There is no contagion"?' He said: 'No.' Abu Salamah said: I never heard him forget a hadith before it, and I bear witness by Allah that I indeed heard it from him.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4867 - My father narrated to me, saying: Khalaf bin Ayyub al-Amiri narrated to us from Ma'mar from Al-Zuhri from Abu Salamah from Abu Hurairah regarding this hadith, something similar—meaning Khalaf bin Ayyub al-Amiri. I had previously asked my father about this Sheikh, Khalaf bin Ayyub, and he did not affirm him. I presented to him a hadith of Abu Ma'mar and Abu Kuraib from the hadith of Khalaf, but he did not affirm him. Then, when he narrated to me the hadith of Abd al-A'la from Ma'mar, he said to me following it: 'Khalaf narrated to us from Ma'mar.' So I said to him: 'I had asked you about this Khalaf, and you did not affirm him?' He said: 'I only memorize it from him as mere memorization, and I only mentioned him in the context of the hadith of Abd al-A'la'—or as my father said.
4868 - I heard my father say: Ibn Abi Za'idah erred in the hadith of Al-Thawri from Abu Husayn from Qabisah bin Burmah: 'I heard Ibn Mas'ud say: I do not like for your muezzins to be your blind ones.' My father said: It is actually from Wasil al-Ahdab.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4869 - I heard my father say: Ibn Abi Za'idah omits from this hadith—meaning the hadith of Ibn Abi Arubah from Qatada from Sa'd bin Hisham from Aisha, who said: 'The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to not say Taslim in the two rak'ahs of the Witr out of the three.' My father said: So he omitted Zurarah from it.
4870 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: A man narrated to us, saying: Mu'tamar narrated to us, saying: I heard Humaid narrating from Al-Hasan, who said: Samurah said—and he was denouncing it: 'Islam was in a fortified fortress, and they breached a gap in Islam by their killing of Uthman.'
4871 - Abu Abd al-Rahman informed us, saying: Abu Ibrahim al-Mu'aqqib narrated to me—and his name is Isma'il bin Muhammad bin Jabalah, and he was trustworthy—he said: Yusuf bin al-Majishon narrated to us from Muhammad bin al-Munkadir, who said: I entered upon Jabir bin Abdullah while he was dying, so I said to him: 'Convey my Salam to the Messenger of Allah.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4872 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Abu Ibrahim—meaning Al-Mu'aqqib—narrated to me from Mu'adh, who said: 'Al-Hasan was ten years older than Ibn Sirin.'
4873 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Abu Ibrahim narrated to me, Mu'adh informed us from Al-Sha'bi, who said: 'I accompanied Al-Hasan for eleven years, and he died in the year one hundred and ten.'
4874 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Al-Hasan bin Isa—meaning the freedman of Ibn al-Mubarak—narrated to us: I narrated to Ibn al-Mubarak the hadith of Abu Bakr bin Ayyash from Asim from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, saying 'Hasan.' So I said to him—meaning to Ibn al-Mubarak: 'There is no chain of narration (Isnad) in it.' He said: 'Indeed, regarding Asim, it is possible for him to say "The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said".' He said: So I went early to Abu Bakr, and behold, Ibn al-Mubarak had preceded me to him and was by his side; so I thought he asked him about this hadith.
4875 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Al-Hasan bin Isa narrated to us, saying: I said to Ibn al-Mubarak: 'If only Abu Bakr did not have this trait.' He said: 'What?' I said: 'His reclusiveness from hadith and from people.' He said: 'There is no trait in him dearer to me or better than it.' And Ibn al-Mubarak mentioned Abu Bakr and began praising him.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4876 - And I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Al-Hasan bin Isa narrated to us, saying: Ibn al-Mubarak said: My teacher took me to Al-Rabi' bin Anas during the days of Abu Muslim. He said: And he was in hiding, as Abu Muslim was seeking him. So we entered upon him, and it was said to him: 'Indeed, this one recites the Quran with grammar (Al-Nahw).' He said: 'What does he have to do with this?' As if he did not recognize grammar. He said to me: 'Recite.' So I recited. He said: 'As for this, it is melody.' Someone said to him: 'He recites it with another recitation.' So I recited with the recitation of Hamzah. When I recited, he said to me: 'Stop, stop.'
4877 - I found in my father's book: Al-Hasan bin Isa narrated to us from Abu Bakr, who said: Asim said to me: 'Recite to me every day verse by verse, for it is more likely to become fixed in your heart and for you to be strong in it.' He said: But I feared the Sheikh would die and I would not complete my recitation. He said: So I pressed him, and I used to recite to him five verses by five verses every day.
4878 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Abd al-Jabbar bin Muhammad bin Abd al-Hamid bin Abd al-Rahman bin Zaid bin al-Khattab Abu Abd al-Rahman narrated to us in the year two hundred and eight in Muharram—and he died in Safar—he said: Ubaidullah—meaning Ibn Amr—narrated to me from Abd al-Malik bin Umair, who said: I was a boy. He said: So they began pushing us off the road, saying: 'This is Ali bin Abi Talib, peace be upon him.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4879 - Abu Khaithamah narrated to us, saying: Jarir narrated to us from Abd al-Malik bin Umair, who said: 'I saw Ali bin Abi Talib with a white head and beard.'
4880 - My father narrated to me, saying: Asbat bin Muhammad Abu Muhammad narrated to us, saying: Sulayman—meaning Al-Taymi—narrated to us from Qatada from Abd al-Rahman bin Adam from Abu Hurairah, who said: 'Jesus will be on the earth for forty years.'
4881 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yunus narrated to us, saying: Hammad—meaning Ibn Zaid—narrated to us from Ibn Shubrumah, who said: 'Indeed, among the issues are issues that are not proper for the questioner to ask about, nor proper for the one asked to answer regarding them.'
4882 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Razzaq narrated to us, saying: Ma'mar narrated to us from Ibn Shubrumah: That Abu al-Zinad said to him: 'The oath is with the witness.' Ibn Shubrumah said: So I rejected that from him. Abu al-Zinad said: 'From us knowledge emerged.' I said: 'So when will it return?'—meaning when will it come back.
4882 - My father narrated to me, saying: Mus'ab bin Salam narrated to us, saying: Ibn Shubrumah narrated to us, saying: 'I used to stick to Al-Sha'bi and leave Ibrahim.'
4883 - My father narrated to me, saying: Mus'ab bin Salam narrated to us, saying: Ibn Shubrumah narrated to us, saying: Al-Sha'bi said: 'Who will excuse me from this one-eyed man—meaning Ibrahim—he comes to learn from me at night and issues fatwas by day?'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4884 - My father narrated to me, saying: Mus'ab bin Salam narrated to us, saying: Ibn Shubrumah narrated to us, saying: When Ibrahim died, Hammad sat disseminating his knowledge, saying: 'Ibrahim said, Ibrahim said.' So Amir [Al-Sha'bi] said: 'By Allah, Ibrahim dead is more knowledgeable than him alive.'
4885 - I heard my father say: Waki' had an innate natural memory; he was a hafiz, a hafiz.
4886 - I heard my father say: Umar bin Abi Za'idah is the uncle of Yahya bin Zakariya bin Abi Za'idah.
4887 - I read to my father the hadith of Abbad bin Abbad. When he reached the hadith of Aban bin Abi Ayyash, he said: 'Strike it out.' So I struck it out, and he abandoned it. And he said: 'Strike out the hadith of Ja'far bin al-Zubair.'
4888 - I heard my father say: I heard from Abbad bin Abbad in the year one hundred and eighty.
4889 - My father said: 'Strike out the hadith of Musa bin Ubaidah,' while he was reading the hadith of Quran bin Tamam.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4890 - I heard my father say: I heard from Al-Tafawi Muhammad bin Abd al-Rahman Abu al-Mundhir in the year eighty-one.
4891 - I heard my father say: Abu Usama was precise in hadith and intelligent.
4892 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Usama narrated to us, saying: Hisham informed us, saying: My father informed us, saying: 'I heard Marwan bin Hakam, and I do not think he is accused [of lying] against us.'
4893 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Usama narrated to us from Hammad bin Zaid from Raja' bin Abi Salamah from Isma'il bin Ubaidullah, who said: Mu'awiyah said: 'Stick to the hadith that was [circulated] during the time of Umar.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4894 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Usama narrated to us from Ibn al-Mubarak from Ma'mar from Al-Zuhri, who said: Abu Hurairah said: 'If I were to narrate these hadiths to you during the time of Umar, I would have found the whip on my back.'
4895 - My father narrated to me, saying: Maslamah bin al-Salt narrated to us, saying: Abu Qahdham Al-Nadr bin Ma'bad al-Jarmi narrated to me.
4896 - I heard my father say: Waki' said: Abu Ubaidah—meaning Al-Haddad—used to guide us to the Sheikhs.
4897 - I read to my father: Abu Ubaidah, and he is Al-Haddad, said: Mis'ar Abu al-Harith al-Jarmi narrated to us.
4898 - I heard my father say regarding the hadith of Shu'bah from Yazid Abu Khalid al-Wasiti, who said: 'I saw Ibn Abi Awfa playing with his slave girl.' I heard my father say: 'He is not Al-Dalani'—meaning Yazid Abu Khalid.
4899 - My father said regarding the hadith of Shu'bah from Yazid Abu Khalid from Abu Sufyan from Jabir: 'Laughter does not require ablution.' I heard my father say: 'He is Al-Dalani.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4900 - And my father said regarding the hadith of Shu'bah from Yazid Abu Khalid from Abu Ubaidah from Hudhaifah: 'Whoever sells a house...' I heard my father say: 'This is the last one; I do not know who he is.'
4901 - I read to my father: Abu Ubaidah from Sawwar bin Abdullah, the companion of Al-Basri. I asked my father, and he said: 'He is not the judge.'
4902 - I read to my father: Abu Ubaidah said: Yusuf bin Abi Hakim Abu Bishr narrated to us, saying: Zaid bin Thawb narrated to me.
4903 - I read to my father: Abu Ubaidah said: Abu al-Munabbih Umar bin Mazid informed us. I heard my father say: Waki' bin al-Jarrah said: 'I forbade Abu Usama from borrowing people's books.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4904 - I heard my father say: Kahmas bin al-Hasan and Al-Jurayri were in the same mosque. Kahmas said: 'I and Abu Mas'ud went to so-and-so.' Al-Jurayri said to him: 'O Kahmas, [say] I went with you'—meaning I went and you were with me. As if he preferred that he start with himself [when speaking] about Al-Jurayri.
4905 - I heard my father say: Kahmas is a trustworthy, trustworthy sheikh (Thiqah Thiqah).
4906 - I said to my father: Hushaym narrated from Sufyan al-Thawri. He said: 'He practiced Tadlis (concealment) from him.' Then he said: Hushaym said: 'We came to Isma'il bin Abi Khalid, and when Sufyan saw him, he stood up and left.' My father said: He disliked hearing the questions of Hushaym.
4907 - I heard my father say: Hushaym did not hear from Ayyub except one hadith.
4908 - I heard my father say: I heard Hushaym say: 'Go to the likes of Isma'il.' He said: He was alluding to Ali bin Asim.
4909 - I heard my father say: Marwan bin Salim, who narrates from Safwan bin Amr, is not trustworthy—meaning Marwan.
4910 - I asked my father about Umar bin Sa'id Abu Hafs al-Dimashqi. He said: 'I wrote from him, but I have abandoned his hadith. That is because Abu Khaithamah and I went to him, and he brought out a book for us [as] from Sa'id bin Bashir, but behold, they were the hadiths of Sa'id bin Abi Arubah. So we left him.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4911 - I asked my father about Muhammad bin al-Hajjaj al-Musaffar. He said: 'I have abandoned his hadith,' or 'We abandoned his hadith.'
4912 - And I asked my father about Isma'il bin Aban al-Ghanawi. He said: 'We wrote from him from Hisham bin Urwah and others. Then he narrated hadiths regarding green vegetables (Al-Khadrah), which were fabricated hadiths. I think he said: from Fitr or someone else. So we left him.'
4913 - I narrated to my father the hadiths of Ibrahim bin Uyaynah from Mis'ar, Sufyan, and Shu'bah from Muharib from Jabir: That the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: 'What an excellent condiment is vinegar.' He rejected it.
4914 - I heard my father say—and he mentioned Mansur bin Abi Muzahim—so he said: 'He does not resemble the Reciters (religious scholars).'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4915 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya bin Sa'id narrated to us, saying: I asked Malik bin Anas about Shu'bah, the freedman of Ibn Abbas. He said: 'He did not resemble the Reciters.'
4916 - I asked my father, I said: 'Did Simak bin Harb hear from Abdullah bin Khabbab?' He said: 'No.'
4917 - I asked my father about a sheikh from whom Yahya bin Salih al-Wuhazi narrated, called Muhammad bin Abd al-Malik al-Ansari; he said: Ata narrated to us from Ibn Abbas: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, forbade picking teeth with reed and myrtle, and said: 'They act as a conduit for leprosy.'
4918 - My father said: 'I saw Muhammad bin Abd al-Malik; he was blind, and he used to fabricate hadith and lie.'
4919 - I asked about Abdullah bin Salih, the scribe of Al-Layth. He said: 'At first his affair was solid, then he became corrupt at the end, and he is nothing.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4920 - Abdullah said: Abd al-Aziz bin Abi Salamah bin Ubaydullah bin Abdullah bin Umar bin al-Khattab al-Umari narrated to me, saying: Muhammad bin Awn narrated to me—Al-Umari said: Awn is the freedman of Umm Hakim. I asked my father, and he said: 'This is a known man.'
4921 - I heard my father say: Yahya bin Sa'id narrated to us from Abu Isa Musa al-Saghir.
4922 - I heard my father say: Husain bin Abdullah bin Dumairah and Kathir bin Abdullah bin Amr bin Awf are both worth nothing; they are close to each other [in weakness], neither is anything. And my father struck out the hadith of Kathir bin Abdullah bin Amr bin Awf and did not narrate them to us in the Musnad.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4923 - My father said: I heard Sufyan bin Uyaynah say: 'Some of the Sheikhs used to avoid the hadith of Asim bin Ubaidullah, who narrates from Abdullah bin Amir bin Rabi'ah.'
4924 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ibrahim bin Mahdi narrated to us from Ibn Ulayyah, who said: Shu'bah said: 'As for Jabir al-Ju'fi and Muhammad bin Ishaq, they are truthful (Saduq) in hadith.'
4925 - And Surayj bin Yunus narrated to us, saying: Abbas al-Ahwal narrated to us from Ibn Ulayyah the like of it.
4926 - I heard my father say: Abd al-Karim al-Jazari is more established in hadith than Khasif, more established. And Khasif is severely inconsistent (Idtirab) in the Musnad.
4927 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Ahmad Muhammad bin Abdullah al-Zubairi narrated to us, saying: Sharik said: 'Abu Khalid—meaning Al-Dalani—was a short Sheikh, a Murji'.' 
4928 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yunus bin Muhammad narrated to us, saying: Abd al-Rahman bin al-Ghasil narrated to us, saying: 'I saw Abu al-Abbas Sahl bin Sa'd bin Malik al-Ansari, then al-Sa'idi, changing [the color of] his beard with henna or yellow dye, and I saw his hair was below his ear.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4929 - Abbas bin al-Walid narrated to me, saying: Wahib bin Khalid narrated to us, saying: Al-Ja'd Abu Uthman narrated to us, saying: I heard Al-Hasan say: 'Ayyub is the master of the youth of the people of Basra.'
4930 - Abu Bakr bin Khallad al-Bahili narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya bin Sa'id al-Qattan say: I asked Sufyan about the hadith of Abu Ishaq from Abu Amr al-Shaibani: 'I saw Abdullah expelling women from the mosque on Friday.' He did not authenticate it for me and said: 'I wrote it from Shu'bah who said: Abu Ishaq narrated to me from Abu Amr al-Shaibani, who said: I saw Abdullah expelling women on Friday from the mosque.'
4931 - Abu Bakr bin Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya bin Sa'id say: Shu'bah used to narrate from Abu Ishaq from Amr bin Maimun from Abdullah: 'The pumpkin (Al-Yaqtin) is the gourd (Al-Qar').' Then he doubted it later and said: 'Either he doubted regarding Abdullah or regarding Amr bin Maimun.'
4932 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya bin Sa'id say: Sufyan bin Sa'id did not authenticate the hadith of Ali bin al-Aqmar: 'Abu al-Darda was brought a slave girl.' As if he did not hear it.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4933 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: 'Isma'il did not hear from Amir [al-Sha'bi] when the obituary of Ja'far came; it was either Zakariya or Ibn Abi al-Safar.'
4934 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya being asked about a man whom he named. He said: 'Nothing prevents me from abandoning his hadith except these Nawfalis and their proximity to me, lest they come to me and harm me. If he established anything of his hadith, it is the hadith of the Hajj.'
4935 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: I asked Malik bin Anas about Abu Jabir al-Bayadi, and he said: 'He was not acceptable (Rida).'
4936 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya mention that Hajjaj never saw Al-Zuhri. And he had a very bad opinion of him. I never saw him have a worse opinion of anyone than of Hajjaj, Muhammad bin Ishaq, Laith, and Hammam; no one could argue with him regarding them.
4937 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: Al-Taymi narrated to us, saying: Abu Uthman narrated to us. Yahya said: And Al-Taymi used to say from Usama: 'The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to take me and Al-Hasan and say: O Allah, indeed I love them, so love them.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4938 - Yahya said: Al-Taymi used to say in the hadith of Abu Uthman: 'He narrated to us.' And he used to say: 'I doubted this hadith, so I looked, and behold, it was written with me.'
4939 - Abu Bakr bin Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya: Al-Taymi came one day to Ibn Awn. Al-Taymi said: 'Abu Nadrah narrated to us.' Ibn Awn said: 'I have indeed seen Abu Nadrah.' Al-Taymi said to him: 'If you have seen Abu Nadrah, then so what?' So Ibn Awn remained silent.
4940 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: In my Atraf (collection) from Isma'il bin Abi Khalid from Al-Sha'bi from Abdullah bin Amr: 'I was with him.' I wanted him to confirm it, but he refused. Everything I wrote from Isma'il is 'Amir narrated to us,' unless he names a man other than Al-Sha'bi [in between].
4941 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: Yahya narrated to us, saying: Shu'bah narrated to us from Firas from Al-Sha'bi from Abdullah bin Amr from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, something similar to the hadith of Isma'il from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, regarding major sins.
4942 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: I heard Isma'il bin Abi Khalid narrating from Bayan or from a man from Amir regarding: 'If you trust one another' [Quran 2:283]. Yahya said: And I did not take it from him. He said: 'The matter returned to trustworthiness.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4943 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya al-Qattan say: I came to Maimun al-Mara'i, and he did not authenticate for me anything except these hadiths which I heard.
4944 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: Shu'bah used to deny the Qunut in Witr from Abdullah. But he narrated from Ibrahim bin Muhajir from Ibrahim from Al-Aswad from Abdullah, who said: 'Witr is seven and five.'
4945 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: Ibn Ajlan was shaky in the hadith of Nafi', and he did not have that much value with him.
4946 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi say: An Imam cannot be one who narrates everything he hears, nor can an Imam be one who narrates from everyone.
4947 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Abd al-Rahman say: Three people are not to be narrated from: A man accused of lying, a man with frequent delusions and mistakes, and a man of desire who calls to an innovation.
4948 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: Habib bin Abi Thabit from Ata is not preserved (Mahfuz). I heard him say: 'If it were preserved, he would have stepped down from it'—meaning Ata stepped down from it.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4949 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: Abd al-Malik bin Abi Sulayman or Husain al-Mu'allim—so he said: 'There is something in it: he connects what he disconnects and disconnects what he connects.' And he mentioned Habib and said: 'There is inconsistency in it.' And he gave precedence to Ibn Jurayj in the hadith of Ata.
4950 - I heard my father say: The most established of people regarding Ata are Amr bin Dinar and Ibn Jurayj. He said: And indeed Habib bin Abi Thabit contradicted him in something from the saying of Ata or the hadith of Ata, and the saying was what Ibn Jurayj said.
4951 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: I heard Sufyan being asked about the hadith of Abu Ishaq regarding the Qarin (pilgrim combining Hajj and Umrah). He said: 'I did not hear it.'
4952 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: Sufyan used to authenticate from Wasil from Abu Wa'il: That Ka'b al-Muslim saw a rod with Jarir, and he wanted him to use it on the other [person]; there is no intercession in a prescribed punishment (Hadd). But he did not narrate it to me.
4953 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Abdullah bin Idris say: I was one day with Al-A'mash, and he mentioned Qasamah (collective oath). I said: 'My father narrated to me from Hammad and from Sa'id bin Jubair.' He said: 'Indeed, by Allah, we did not used to rely on Hammad.' And he mentioned the hadith of Qasamah. He said: Then he was silent towards me for a little while, then he patted my back and said to me: 'O Abdullah, I would not narrate to you for a month.' He said: I said: 'No, I have come to you for a year.' When it was after the year, I came to him, and he said to me: 'O Abdullah, your oath is fulfilled and your vow is kept.'
4954 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: When a man came to Yahya bin Sa'id asking him for a long hadith, he would say: 'Narrate to me something else.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4955 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: Yahya narrated to us, saying: Habib bin al-Shahid narrated to us, saying: Al-Hasan narrated to us: That the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said to the People of the Bench (Ahl al-Suffah): 'How are you this morning?' Yahya said: There was long speech in the hadith, but I did not memorize anything other than this.
4956 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: Al-Qawariri narrated to us, saying: Khalid bin al-Harith narrated to us, saying: Shu'bah narrated to us from Abu Hashim, who said: 'They used to dislike narrating from women except from the wives of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace.'
4957 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya al-Qattan say: Counted against Sufyan from Habib bin Abi Thabit 'I heard Ibn Umar' are three things: The hadith of the stray animal, 'And you bring us dilemmas,' and Ibn Umar was asked while I was listening about a man who gifted his son a she-camel. Then he said: 'There is nothing else from Ibn Umar.'
4958 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: Counted against Sufyan from Habib from Ibn Abbas are two things: He heard it regarding money exchange (Sarf), and another.
4959 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: I asked Sufyan bin Sa'id about the hadith of Abu Husayn regarding seeking decision by divining arrows, but he did not narrate it to me.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4960 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: Sufyan narrated to us from Al-A'mash, who said: A sheikh narrated to me from Ali: 'O fire, be coolness and safety.' He [Yahya] said: It is as if he did not reach [meet] Ali.
4961 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Mu'awiyah narrated to us, saying: Al-A'mash narrated to us from Abdullah bin Mulail, a man from the family of Abu Laila, from Ali: 'O fire, be coolness and safety.' He said: 'If He had not said "safety," its coldness would have killed him.'
4962 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: I heard Isma'il narrating from Mujalid from Amir, who said: 'I drank *At-Tila* (thickened juice) with Shuraih.'
4963 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: Yahya narrated to me, saying: Sufyan narrated to us, saying: Mansur narrated to me from Ibrahim, who said: 'There is no harm for the *Junub* (ritually impure) to write a letter.' Then Yahya said: 'Leave it.' I said: 'Then what?' He said: 'Sufyan narrated to us from Mansur from Ibrahim, who said: There is no harm in writing a letter while not having performed ablution.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4964 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: Yahya narrated to us, saying: Sufyan narrated to us, saying: Mansur narrated to me from Ibrahim, who said: Khalid bin Sa'id narrated to me that Abu Mas'ud used to wipe over the stockings and the sandals.
4965 - Mansur said: So I met Khalid bin Sa'id, and he narrated the like of it to me.
4966 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: Shu'bah used to deny the hadith of Qatada from Anas that Umm Sulaim asked the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, about a woman seeing [a dream] in her sleep. It was as if he considered it to be from Ata al-Khurasani. And he used to deny the hadith: 'What is the matter with people who raise their gaze during the prayer?' We think that he [Qatada] did not hear it. And his denial of the hadith of Umm Sulaim was stronger than this.
4967 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: Amr bin Ubaid did not hear anything from Abu Qilabah.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4968 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: Shu'bah used to say: A man came to Mujalid and said: 'Dictate to me.' He said: 'O boy, take him to Isma'il—meaning Ibn Abi Khalid—and tell him to dictate to him until his pen breaks.'
4969 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: Sufyan bin Uyaynah narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Wahid bin Ziyad narrated to me, saying: I asked some of the heretics (Zanadiqah): 'Who are the Qadariyyah among you?' He said: 'They are our Bedouins.'
4970 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya say—and he mentioned Al-Barri, meaning Uthman, one day—he said: 'He narrated something that did not exist—or he claimed—from Nafi' from Ibn Umar: Arafah is all a place of standing.'
4971 - Ibn Khallad narrated to us, saying: Yahya narrated to us, saying: Ibn Jurayj narrated to us, saying: I said to Nafi': 'Did you hear Ibn Umar say: Arafah is all a place of standing?' He said: 'No.'
4972 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: Isma'il—meaning Ibn Abi Khalid—narrated to us, saying: Abu Salih was a schoolteacher, so I never asked him about anything except that he explained it to me.
4973 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: I heard Sufyan say: 'Someone who saw Ibrahim raising his hands under the cloak in prayer narrated to me.' I began asking him for the name of the man, but he kept stalling me. Then he said to me one day when I pestered him: 'Abu al-Sabah Sulayman bin Qasim narrated to me.' Yahya said: And he erred in his name; he meant Sulayman bin Yasir. Yahya said: He only stalled me regarding him because he knew that I would not approve of him.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4974 - Hasan bin Hammad al-Kufi al-Dabbi narrated to me, saying: Yahya bin Adam narrated to us from Sufyan from Sulayman bin Miqsam, who said: 'I saw Ibrahim saying Takbir while his hands were in his garment.'
4975 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya bin Sa'id say: I heard Shu'bah say: 'Ayyub used to doubt in most of his hadith.' And Shu'bah said: 'It would not please me to doubt while I am not in doubt, even if I had such and such.'
4975 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi narrated to me, saying: I heard Hammad bin Zaid say: I heard Ayyub say: 'I indeed say "I think" while I do not doubt, for fear that my hadith might be written down.'
4976 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: I said to Ghassan bin Mudar: 'What was the name of Abu Nadrah?' He said: 'Al-Mundhir bin Malik bin Qit'ah.'
4977 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: Hushaym bin Abi Sasan—and he is Ibn Hisham—narrated to me, saying: Umayy bin Rabi'ah al-Sayrafi narrated to me.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4978 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya al-Qattan say: I heard Shu'bah say: 'Ali bin Zaid narrated to us, and he was one who frequently raised [Mawquf narrations to the Prophet].'
4979 - Ubaidullah bin Mu'adh bin Mu'adh narrated to me, saying: My father narrated to me from Shu'bah from Ali bin Zaid before he became confused.
4980 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: Shu'bah said: 'These [narrations] which Abu Sufyan, the companion of Al-A'mash, narrates are [from] a book.'
4981 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: I heard Sufyan say: 'We used to recognize the superiority of the hadith of Asim bin Damrah over the hadith of Al-Harith.'
4982 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: Yahya narrated to us, saying: Sufyan said to me: 'I used to not narrate to Al-A'mash from anyone except that he would interject against me regarding him; but if I said "Mansur," he would remain silent.'
4983 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya when he was asked about Ibn Harmalah; he weakened him and did not elevate his status.
4984 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: 'The hadith of Abd al-Karim al-Jazari from Ata is of poor quality.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4985 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya bin Sa'id say: I was with Al-Taymi when the funeral procession of Khalid al-Hadhdha' passed by him, but he did not follow it. Sulayman al-Taymi said at that time: 'I do not like for anyone to follow my funeral except one who has a [sincere] intention in doing so.'
4986 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: Sufyan said: 'Ibn Abi Laila died, and I did not follow his funeral, though he was my teacher.' And Sufyan said: 'Do not enter into anything unless it is something in which you have a [sincere] intention.'
4987 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya bin Sa'id say: Qatada did not hear from Muslim bin Yasar.
4988 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: 'I view that Qatada did not hear from Tawus.'
4989 - Abu Bakr narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: Shu'bah or someone else said: 'Qatada did not hear from Humaid bin Abd al-Rahman. He died before Muslim, and I did not hear him mentioned during the Fitnah.'
4990 - Abu Bakr narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: 'Qatada did not establish [authentic narration] from Mu'adhah.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4991 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: Yahya bin Sa'id narrated to me, saying: When Shu'bah narrated from Amr bin Murrah, he would say: 'Amr bin Murrah narrated to me, saying: I heard Abdullah bin Salamah.' And Abdullah was [one whose hadith] you would recognize and reject (mixed).
4992 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: Yahya narrated to me, saying: I heard Shu'bah say: 'Asim—meaning Ibn Abi al-Nujud—narrated to us.' And in the soul there is something about it [hesitation regarding him].
4993 - Ibn Khallad narrated to me, saying: Yahya narrated to us, saying: I asked Ibn Jurayj about the hadith of Ibn Shihab: 'The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, fought alongside some people from the Jews.' He said: 'I do not know if I read it or heard it.'
4994 - Ibn Khallad wrote to me mentioning that Mu'tamar narrated to them from his father, saying: 'Al-Hasan had spent his life in military expeditions, and he was among the best of people in weeping. When he wept, he would make [others] weep with his weeping.'
4995 - Ibn Khallad wrote to me, saying: Mu'tamar narrated to us, saying: 'We used to think that Ash'ath used analogy based on the opinion of Al-Hasan.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
4996 - Ibn Khallad wrote to me: And I heard Ibn Uyaynah say: 'I narrate from one who is criticized.' Then he said: 'Ibn Abi al-Miqdam—meaning Amr.' And he mentioned a hadith.
4997 - Ibn Khallad wrote to me: I witnessed Ibn Uyaynah when Abd al-Rahman bin Abdullah bin Sawwar came to him with a letter from Muhammad bin Harb. He said to him: 'If I narrate to you, I do not narrate to you for religion, nor for worldly gain, nor for the sake of the owner of this letter with me. But I find it blameworthy for a man to use a letter as a means to approach me and then not benefit from it. Bring it, read.'
4998 - Ibn Khallad wrote to me: I heard Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi say: 'Hammad bin Salamah is the most narration-rich of people regarding three: Thabit, Humaid, and Hisham bin Urwah; [regarding] opinion...'
4999 - Ibn Khallad wrote to me, saying: I heard Abd al-Rahman say: It was read to Sufyan from Malik bin Mighwal from Hammad from Ibrahim from Umar and Abdullah: That they used to offer voluntary prayers while traveling.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5000 - Abu Bakr bin Khallad wrote to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: The kunya of Abd al-Rahman bin Abi Laila was Abu Isa. Musa al-Juhani narrated this to me.
5001 - Ibn Khallad wrote to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: I wrote a few hadiths from Abu Hurrah, [specifically] what he said 'I heard' and 'I asked'.
5002 - Abu Bakr bin Khallad al-Bahili wrote to me mentioning that he heard Yahya bin Sa'id mention Al-Ash'ath, and he elevated his status and said: 'I hardly put anyone ahead of him in truthfulness.' And when Al-Ash'ath was mentioned, he would get angry because of what people said about him.
5003 - Ibn Khallad wrote to me, saying: I heard Bishr bin al-Mufaddal say: 'I do not claim that Ibn Awn is above Ash'ath in truthfulness.'
5004 - Ibn Khallad wrote to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: I went out early one day for a need then returned. Sufyan said to me: 'O Yahya, Ibn al-Taymi was with me, and I narrated to him, but he could not differentiate between Mansur and Laith. He is a righteous man'—or 'except that he is a righteous man.'
5005 - Ibn Khallad wrote to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: I heard Sulayman al-Taymi say: 'I saw the killer of Al-Zubair bin al-Awwam, and the [people of] the watering places were cursing him.'
5006 - Ibn Khallad wrote to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: Sufyan said: 'I entered upon Al-Mahdi and said: "Peace be upon you," then I sat down.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5007 - Ibn Khallad wrote to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: Al-Taymi said: 'I have never obtained anything from the ruler.' It was said to him: 'Not even in the days of Ibn Raghban?' He said: 'No, not even in the days of Ibn Raghban.'
5008 - Ibn Khallad wrote to me, saying: I heard Yahya say—and I mentioned to him that Bishr bin al-Mufaddal denied the hadith of Ibn Abi Arubah: 'The shroud is [taken] from the whole estate.' Yahya said: 'And what is his knowledge of the hadith of Ibn Abi Arubah? Bishr only went to him after us.'
5009 - Ibn Khallad wrote to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: When Ibn Abi Arubah was asked about the hadith of Juwayriyah—'The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, entered upon her while she was fasting on a Friday'—he would say: 'They contradict me regarding it,' as if he was wary of it.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5010 - Ibn Khallad wrote to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: Sulayman bin Surad went out in the Army of the Penitents before Al-Mukhtar appeared, when Husain, peace be upon him, was killed, intending [to go to] Sham.
5011 - Ibn Khallad wrote to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: Zakariya bin Abi Za'idah had a book. Yahya said: 'Ali mentioned to us things from his book to Yahya, from Zakariya from Abu Ishaq, and he [Yahya] denied them and said: "He dictated them to me from his book." And he presented the hadith of the Sheikhs to me, but I did not look into them.'
5012 - Ibn Khallad wrote to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: Whenever Abd al-Malik bin Abi Sulayman saw me, he would say to me: 'O son of my brother, O son of my brother.'
5013 - Muhammad bin Ishaq al-Musayyibi narrated to me, saying: Abu Khaithamah narrated to me from Yahya bin Sa'id, who said: Abu Bakr completed, with his caliphate, the age of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace; so he passed away being at the age of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace.
5014 - Ahmad bin Khalid Abu Ja'far al-Khallal narrated to me, saying: Sufyan bin Uyaynah narrated to us from Amr bin Dinar, who heard Jabir say: 'The one who killed Khubaib was Abu Sirwa'ah.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5015 - Ahmad bin Khalid narrated to me, saying: Makhlad al-Shu'ayri narrated to me—Abu Abd al-Rahman said: And I wrote from Makhlad—he said: They asked Ibn Uyaynah about something, and he said: 'Abu al-Ajab (Father of Wonder)! I am Baqiyyah al-Homsi, I am.'
5016 - Ahmad bin Khalid narrated to me, saying: Hasan bin Subayh narrated to me from Ibn Uyaynah, who said: Ayyub al-Sakhtiyani arrived, so Ibn Jurayj said to me: 'Let us go to this Basran.' So we went to him. When I saw him, he did not impress me. But when he spoke, I said: 'Pearls are coming out of his mouth'—or 'out of the mouth of this one.'
5017 - Abu Khaithamah narrated to me, saying: Muhammad bin Ubaid narrated to us, saying: I was with Sufyan al-Thawri, and a man came to him and said: 'I saw in a dream as if a sweet basil plant was lifted from the West.' He said: 'If your vision is truthful, Al-Awza'i has died.'
5018 - Abu Khaithamah narrated to me, saying: Marwan bin Mu'awiyah narrated to us from Asim al-Ahwal, who said: 'I read the hadiths of jurisprudence to Al-Sha'bi, and he permitted that.'
5019 - Abu Khaithamah narrated to me, saying: Abu Bakr—meaning Ibn Ayyash—narrated to us from Al-A'mash from Abu Salih, who said: He mentioned Abu Hurairah and said: 'He was not the best of them, but he was a man who was a Hafiz (preserver).'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5020 - Abu Khaithamah narrated to me, saying: I heard Abu Bakr bin Ayyash narrating from Al-A'mash from Al-Hasan, who said: A man asked him about something, and he ordered him to perform expiation. A man said: 'What if he is needy?' He said: 'Then Allah is more worthy of [accepting] the excuse.'
5021 - Abu Ibrahim al-Tarjumani narrated to us, saying: Abu Awanah narrated to us, saying: I heard Qatada say: 'I have not issued a fatwa based on opinion for thirty years.'
5022 - Abu Khaithamah narrated to me, saying: Hushaym narrated to us, saying: Ubaidah informed us, saying: Muslim al-A'war said to Ibrahim: 'I wish you were a judge.' He said: 'I do not like that.'
5023 - Abu Khaithamah narrated to me, saying: Wahb bin Jarir bin Hazim narrated to us, saying: Juwayriyah bin Asma' narrated to us, saying: Abd al-Malik bin Hassan al-Anbari, the brother of Nasr bin Hassan, narrated to me.
5024 - I heard my father say: Nasr bin Hassan is the grandfather of Mu'adh bin Mu'adh. Abu Salih al-Hakam bin Musa narrated to me, saying: Damrah narrated to us from Al-Awza'i, who said: Abadah bin Abi Lubabah said to me: 'Did you meet Al-Hakam bin Utaybah?' I said: 'No.' He said: 'Then meet him, for there is no one between its two lava fields (Madinah) more knowledgeable than him.' He said: 'So I met him.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5025 - Abu Ibrahim al-Tarjumani narrated to me from Jarir, who said: 'I did not start my hearing [of hadith] from Abu al-Ahwas until after thirty years.'
5026 - Mansur bin Abi Muzahim narrated to me, saying: Isma'il bin Ayyash narrated to us from Al-Muthanna and others from Ata from Abu Rabah, who said: 'The master of the youth of the people of Hijaz is Ibn Jurayj; the master of the youth of the people of Sham is Sulayman bin Musa; and the master of the youth of the people of Iraq is Hajjaj bin Artah.'
5027 - Muhammad bin Hatim Abu Abdullah al-Zammi narrated to me, saying: Ali bin Thabit informed us, saying: Abd al-Hamid bin Ja'far narrated to me, saying: My father informed me from Jabir bin Abdullah, who said: 'We went out on the Day of Al-Aqabah to the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and we were seventy: forty men and thirty boys, each man having his son riding behind him. And I was riding behind my father.'
5028 - Muhammad bin Hatim narrated to me, saying: Amir bin Salih informed us from Hisham bin Urwah from his father from Aisha: That the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, died on a Monday.
5029 - Muhammad bin Hatim narrated to me, saying: I heard Ali bin Thabit say: 'Al-Wazi' bin Nafi' is Meccan, but he ended up in Al-Jazirah.'
5030 - Muhammad narrated to me, saying: I heard Ali bin Asim say: 'Bayan narrated to me, and what an excellent explanation (Bayan) he was.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5031 - Muhammad bin Hatim narrated to me, saying: Abu Nu'aym Shuja' bin Abi Nasr informed us, saying: I said to Muhammad bin Abdullah—meaning Al-Yashkuri—'When did you meet Al-Harith bin Badal?' He said: 'In the time of Abd al-Malik bin Marwan.' I said: 'And how old were you on that day?' He said: 'Twenty years old.' I said: 'And how old was Al-Harith bin Badal on that day?' He said: 'Eighty.' I said: 'So how many of the Companions of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, did you meet?' He said: 'Four.'
5032 - Muhammad bin Hatim narrated to me, saying: Ali bin Thabit informed us, saying: I heard Sufyan al-Thawri say: 'I sought knowledge while I had no intention, then Allah granted me the intention afterwards.'
5033 - Muhammad bin Hatim narrated to me, saying: Nu'aym bin Hammad narrated to us, saying: Dimam bin Isma'il came to the mosque, and the people had already prayed, so he missed the prayer. He took an oath upon himself not to leave the mosque until he met Allah. He said: 'So he made it his home until he died.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5034 - Muhammad bin Bakkar narrated to me, saying: Abu Ma'shar narrated to us, saying: Sa'id bin Kaysan—and Kaysan is Abu Sa'id al-Maqburi—narrated to us from his father from Abu Sa'id.
5035 - Muhammad bin Bakkar narrated to me, saying: Abu Ma'shar narrated to us, saying: 'I saw Abu Umamah bin Sahl bin Hunaif dyeing his beard with henna, and he had a copious lock of hair (Wafrah).'
5036 - Abu Ma'mar narrated to me, saying: Sufyan narrated to us from Asim al-Ahwal, who said: I said to Al-Qasim bin Abd al-Rahman: 'Who is the most knowledgeable of the people of Kufa regarding the hadith of Abdullah?' He said: 'Sulayman al-A'mash.'
5037 - Abu Ma'mar narrated to me, saying: Sufyan narrated to us, saying: Ibn Jurayj said: 'Dawud bin Abi Hind knocks on [the door of] knowledge vigorously.'
5038 - Abu Ma'mar narrated to me, saying: Hushaym narrated to us from Abu Bishr, who said: Al-Sha'bi said: 'I narrate to them from Ibn Umar, and they say: Hammad said.'
5039 - Abu Ma'mar narrated to me, saying: It was said to Sharik: 'For what did you ask Abu Hanifa to repent?' He said: 'For disbelief (Kufr).'
5040 - Ibn Khallad wrote to me: I heard Yahya bin Sa'id say: I heard Sufyan say: 'It is not fitting for anyone to be coerced into judgeship.'
5041 - Ibn Khallad wrote to me, saying: Sufyan bin Uyaynah narrated to us, saying: Amr bin Dinar said: 'Salih bin Kaysan was among our men with Al-Hasan bin Muhammad'—meaning in Medina.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5042 - Ibn Khallad wrote to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: Sufyan narrated to us from Abu Ishaq from Farwah: That the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said to a man from his family or to a wet nurse of his: 'Recite {Say: O disbelievers} at your sleep, for it is a disavowal of polytheism.' Yahya said: And Shu'bah narrated to me from Ishaq from Farwah bin Nawfal something similar. It was with me, but I erased it.
5043 - Ibn Khallad wrote to me, saying: Yahya narrated to me, saying: Fitr narrated to me, saying: Abu Ishaq narrated to me, saying: I heard Silah say: I heard Ammar. And Fitr was a man of 'I heard this,' and Al-Mas'udi had a better memory than Fitr.
5044 - Ibn Khallad wrote to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: I heard Al-A'mash when Abbad bin Kathir asked him about 'Malik' and 'Malik' [in the Quran]. He said: 'Both of them'—meaning you can recite both.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5045 - Ibn Khallad wrote to me, saying: Yahya narrated to me—and he mentioned Sufyan and Shu'bah—so he said: 'Sufyan has fewer omissions because he refers back to a book.'
5046 - Ibn Khallad wrote to me, saying: I asked Yahya about Abdullah bin Sa'id bin Abi Hind. He said: 'He was righteous (Salih); you recognize [some of his hadith] and reject [others].'
5047 - Ibn Khallad wrote to me, saying: Yahya narrated to me, saying: Thawr narrated to us, saying: Al-Ala bin Utbah narrated to us, saying: Abu al-Darda used to pray on the carpets of Jerusalem. [Yahya said]: I asked Thawr, and behold, he [Al-Ala] was of his age or thereabouts.
5048 - Ibn Khallad wrote to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: I heard Malik bin Anas say: 'When Al-Zuhri came to us, we made them into parts (Atraf) and raised them to Ubaydullah bin Umar so he could ask Al-Zuhri to make his matter easy for us.'
5049 - Ibn Khallad wrote to me, saying: I heard Yahya bin Sa'id say: I heard Abu Awanah say: 'Muhammad bin Juhada used to go to extremes'—meaning in Shi'ism.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5050 - Ibn Khallad wrote to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: Ibn Jurayj narrated to me from Muhammad bin Abbad bin Ja'far, who said: I came to Jabir bin Abdullah and said: 'Did you hear the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, forbidding the fasting of Friday?' He said: 'Yes, by the Lord of the Kaaba.' Yahya said: He raised it. He said in it: 'He narrated to us'—meaning Muhammad bin Abbad—and it is in the books from Abd al-Hamid bin Jubair bin Shaybah. And if Ibn Jurayj does not narrate to you from his book, you will not benefit from it.
5051 - Ibn Khallad wrote to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: 'We used to call the books of Ibn Jurayj the Books of Trust (Kutub al-Amanah).'
5052 - Ibn Khallad wrote to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: Sufyan narrated to us, saying: The companions of Abu Hanifa asked Abu Hanifa to repent twice or thrice. And Sufyan was severe in speech regarding Irja' and refuting them.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5053 - Ibn Khallad wrote to me: I heard Yahya, when asked about the hadith of Al-A'mash from Abdullah bin al-Sa'ib from Zadhan from Abdullah regarding the Trust (Al-Amanah), narrate it from Sufyan from Abdullah bin al-Sa'ib from Zadhan from Abdullah regarding the Trust. And he says: Sufyan is more established in it than Al-A'mash. And Sufyan said to me: 'I went with Al-A'mash to Abdullah bin al-Sa'ib.'
5054 - Ibn Khallad wrote to me, saying: And I heard Yahya say: 'Whoever Sufyan and Al-A'mash both met, Sufyan is dearer to me than him [Al-A'mash].'
5055 - Ibn Khallad wrote to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: Kharijah bin Mus'ab came to Shu'bah while no one was with him. He brought out a piece of paper, and Shu'bah became alarmed. So I said: 'They are only excerpts (Atraf).' So he said nothing.
5056 - Ibn Khallad wrote to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: I asked Malik bin Anas about Salih, the freedman of Al-Taw'amah. He said: 'He was not among the Reciters.'
5057 - Ibn Khallad wrote to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: I heard Ubaydullah say: Al-Barri came to Nafi', so he honored him and hosted him. But when he began asking him about Tafsir (interpretation), he shouted at him and drove him away.
5058 - Ibn Khallad wrote to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: Sufyan said: The hadith of Al-A'mash is not from his hadith: 'Indeed this Path (Sirat)...' It is the hadith of Mansur.
5059 - Ibn Khallad wrote to me, saying: I heard Yahya say: Shu'bah said to me: 'When I entered upon Al-Mahdi, I narrated to him from you, from Musa al-Juhani, from Abu Bakr bin Hafs: Aisha came to her father while he was suffering the agonies of death.' Then Ibn Khallad wrote to me in his handwriting: Yahya bin Sa'id al-Qattan narrated to me, saying: Musa al-Juhani narrated to us from Abu Bakr bin Hafs, who said: Aisha entered upon her father, and when she saw his soul [rattling] in his chest, she recited this verse: 'If one day the soul rattles and the chest is constricted by it...' He said: So he looked at her like an angry person.
5060 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya bin Sa'id narrated to us from Musa al-Juhani something similar.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5061 - Ibn Khallad wrote to me: I heard Ibn Uyaynah from Asim al-Ahwal, who said: I came to Ibn Sirin with a book to leave with him, but he said: 'It shall not spend the night with me.'
5062 - Ibn Khallad wrote to me, saying: I narrated to Yahya the hadith of Saif bin Wahb from Abu Harb bin Abi al-Aswad from Umairah bin Yathribi from Ubayy bin Ka'b, who said: 'If the two [circumcised parts] meet—their meeting is from beyond the circumcision—Ghusl (ritual bath) becomes obligatory.' [Narrated] from Sahl bin Yusuf from Shu'bah from Saif bin Wahb. Yahya said: 'I asked Shu'bah about Saif, and he said: Saif was forgetful (or distracted).'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5063 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Ubaidah al-Haddad said: Abu Hurrah did not get anything correct from what he heard from Al-Hasan except for three hadiths.
5064 - Abu Ma'mar narrated to me, saying: Abu Qatan narrated to us, saying: I asked Shu'bah about Abu Hurrah, and he said: 'That is one of the most truthful of people.'
5065 - Shuja' bin Makhlad narrated to me, saying: I heard a man asking Hushaym, saying: 'O Abu Mu'awiyah, did Abu Hurrah inform you from Al-Hasan?' Hushaym laughed, then said: 'Abu Hurrah informed us from Al-Hasan.'
5066 - Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaybah narrated to me, saying: The name of Abu al-Kanud is Abdullah bin Uwaimir.
5067 - I heard my father mention the scribe of Al-Layth bin Sa'd, Abdullah bin Salih, and he disparaged him and disliked him. He said: 'He narrated from him—Layth from Ibn Abi Dhi'b—a book or hadiths.' And he denied that Al-Layth narrated from Ibn Abi Dhi'b.
5068 - Ahmad bin Ibrahim al-Dawraqi narrated to me, saying: Abu Dawud narrated to us: Shu'bah said: 'I used to watch Qatada's mouth closely when he narrated. If he narrated what he had indeed heard, he would say: "Sa'id bin al-Musayyib narrated to us (Haddathana)," "Anas narrated to us," "Al-Hasan narrated to us," "Mutarrif narrated to us." But if he narrated what he did not hear, he would say: "Sulayman bin Yasar narrated (Haddatha)," "Abu Qilabah narrated".'
5069 - Ahmad bin Ibrahim narrated to me, saying: Abu Dawud narrated to us from Shu'bah, who said: I narrated to Sufyan al-Thawri the hadith of Qatada from Abu Hassan from Ibn Abbas: 'That the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, raised his voice in Talbiyah (Ahalla).' Sufyan said: 'And in the world, there was the likes of Qatada!'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5070 - Ahmad bin Ibrahim narrated to me, saying: Hajjaj narrated to us, saying: I asked Shu'bah, saying: 'Which of the two is dearer to you: the hadith of Mubarak or Al-Rabi' bin Subaih?' He said: 'Mubarak is dearer to me than him.'
5071 - Ahmad narrated to me, saying: Abu Dawud narrated to us, saying: Shu'bah informed us from Qatada, who said: I heard Mutarrif say: It was said to Imran bin Husain: 'Samurah has died.' He said: 'What Allah repels from Islam through him is greater.'
5072 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Usama narrated to us, saying: Shu'bah narrated to us, saying: Qatada narrated to us from Mutarrif, who said: Samurah was mentioned, and he mentioned the hadith.
5073 - My father narrated to me, saying: Hasan bin Musa narrated to us, saying: Hammad bin Salamah narrated to us from Hisham bin Urwah from his father, who said: Aisha said: 'The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, married me after the death of Khadija, two or three years before his departure to Medina, while I was a girl of seven years or six years. When we arrived in Medina, some women came to us while I was playing on a swing, and I had my hair cut short (muhajjamah). They took me, prepared me, and adorned me. Then they brought me to the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and he consummated the marriage with me while I was a girl of nine years.'
5074 - Ahmad bin Ibrahim narrated to us, saying: Abu Ja'far al-Suwaydi narrated to us, saying: Waki' narrated to us, saying: Sulayman al-Taymi came to Al-A'mash. Al-A'mash came out at a time when Sulayman al-Taymi was praying. He said: So he [Al-A'mash] passed by during his prayer and did not turn towards Al-A'mash [or Al-A'mash passed by and did not turn to him].

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5075 - Ahmad narrated to me, saying: Hajjaj narrated to us from Shu'bah from Abu Ishaq, who said: I heard Abu Iyas say: 'There is no man in Basra whom I would love to meet Allah with deeds like his more than Abu al-Tayyah.'
5076 - Ahmad bin Ibrahim and my father narrated to me, both saying: Abu Dawud narrated to us, saying: Shu'bah narrated to us, saying: I said to Abu Ishaq: 'How did Abu al-Ahwas narrate to you?' He said: 'He used to pour it out upon us in the mosque, saying: Abdullah said, Abdullah said.'
