5077 - Ahmad narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi narrated to us, saying: I heard Shu'bah say: 'I used to watch Qatada's mouth to see how he spoke; if he said "Haddathana" (he narrated to us)...'
5078 - Ibrahim bin Sa'id al-Jawhari narrated to me, saying: Muhammad bin Kunasah narrated to us, saying: A man praised Mis'ar. He said: 'You praise me while I build with baked brick and accept the gifts of the Sultan?'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5079 - Ibrahim bin Sa'id narrated to me, saying: I heard Abu Mu'awiyah say: It was said to Mis'ar: 'Are you biased (tribalistic)?' He said: 'No, but I love my people.'
5080 - Ibrahim bin Sa'id narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya bin Sa'id al-Umawi say: I saw Mis'ar interceding for a man with Sufyan bin Uyaynah, asking him to narrate to him.
5081 - Ibrahim narrated to us, saying: Muhammad bin Bishr narrated to us: He heard Mis'ar mention Ja'far bin Awn, and he said: 'A young man will not add any virtue over him.'
5082 - Ahmad narrated to me, saying: Abu Dawud narrated to me from Shu'bah, who said: I said to Mis'ar: 'Go with us to Abu Qais so we can hear from him.' He said: 'Would you like something good? You go and leave me.' So he stood up to pray. Shu'bah said: So I went to Abu Qais but did not find him. He said: And I returned while he had prayed such and such [amount].
5083 - Ahmad narrated to me, saying: Abu Dawud narrated to us from Shu'bah, who said: Al-Mas'udi took us to a garden of his, me and Mis'ar.
5084 - Ahmad narrated to us, saying: Abu Dawud al-Tayalisi narrated to us from Shu'bah, who said: I heard Al-Hakam say to Al-Mas'udi: 'You are a man from the offspring of Abdullah; if you were to come to a land, people would come to you. Listen to hadith and ask.'
5085 - Abu Aqil Muhammad bin Hajib al-Marwazi narrated to us, saying: Abd al-Razzaq informed us from Ibn Jurayj from Safwan bin Sulaym from Abu Sa'id the freedman of Ibn Amir from Abu Hurairah from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, who said: 'The cupper and the one being cupped have broken their fast.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5086 - My father narrated to me, saying: Waki' narrated to us, saying: Sufyan narrated to us from Habib—meaning Ibn Abi Thabit—from Maimun bin Abi Shabib from Abu Dharr: That the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said to him: 'Fear Allah wherever you are, and follow up a bad deed with a good deed, it will wipe it out, and behave with people with good character.'
5087 - Waki' said: And Sufyan said once 'from Mu'adh,' but I found in my book 'from Abu Dharr,' and that is the first hearing.
5088 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yunus bin Muhammad narrated to us, saying: Dawud—meaning Ibn Abi al-Furat—narrated to us from Ibrahim bin Maimun al-Sa'igh.
5089 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya bin Ishaq al-Saylahini narrated to us, saying: Ja'far bin Kaysan informed us, saying: Amrah bint Qais al-Adawiyyah narrated to me.
5090 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Qatan narrated to us, saying: Abu Khaldah informed us from Abu al-Aliyah, who said: 'A great and severe matter will befall me by the crescent moon. I saw [in a dream] as if I was eating grapes and fresh dates the likes of which I have never eaten.' He said: His wife said: 'He claims that he will die.' He said: So he died after the crescent moon on the third day of Shawwal, Monday, in the year ninety.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5091 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Hafs al-Mu'ayti Umar bin Hafs narrated to us, saying: Hisham bin Urwah narrated to us from his father from Aisha, who said: The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: 'Will you not take a Kunya (nickname)?' I said: 'By whom should I take a Kunya?' He said: 'Take the Kunya of your son Abdullah'—meaning Ibn al-Zubair. He said: So she used to be nicknamed Umm Abdullah.
5092 - My father narrated to me, saying: Waki' narrated to us from Hisham bin Urwah from a man from the family of Al-Zubair from Aisha: That she said: 'O Messenger of Allah, all of your wives have a Kunya except me.' He said: 'You are Umm Abdullah.'
5093 - I asked my father, I said: 'Abdullah bin Zaid who saw the Adhan [in a dream]?' He said: 'I see [he is] in Medina.'
5094 - I asked my father about Muhajir al-Shami who narrated from Ibn Umar. He said: 'Uthman bin al-Mughirah and Layth bin Abi Sulaym narrated from him.'
5095 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Hafs al-Mu'ayti narrated to us, saying: Abu Hayyan al-Taymi narrated to us from his father from Ali, who said: 'I have not regretted anything except that I should have asked the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, for the [right of] Adhan for Al-Hasan and Al-Husain.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5096 - My father narrated to me, saying: Jarir narrated to us from Mansur from Mujahid from Abu al-Hakam or Al-Hakam bin Sufyan al-Thaqafi, who said: 'I saw the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, urinate, then he performed ablution and sprinkled his private part [with water].'
5097 - My father narrated to me, saying: Aswad bin Amir narrated to us, saying: Sharik said: 'I asked the family of Al-Hakam bin Sufyan, and they mentioned that he did not meet the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace.'
5098 - My father narrated to me, saying: Affan narrated to us, saying: Abu Awanah narrated to us from Asim from Abu Wa'il from Izrah bin Qais from Khalid bin al-Walid, who said: A man stood up and said: 'O Abu Sulayman...'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5099 - My father narrated to me, saying: Muhammad bin Bakr—meaning Al-Bursani—narrated to us, saying: Ubaidullah bin Abi Ziyad informed us, saying: Abdullah bin Kathir al-Dari narrated to me from Mujahid: A sheikh who lived during the Jahiliyyah narrated to us while we were in the expedition of Rudis, called Ibn 'Is. He said: 'I was driving a cow belonging to a family of ours.' He said: 'Then I heard from inside it—from the slaughtered one (al-dhabih)—eloquent speech, a man shouting: "There is no god but Allah."' He said: 'So we came to Mecca and found that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, had emerged in Mecca.'
5100 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yazid bin Harun narrated to us, saying: Sufyan—meaning Ibn Husayn—informed us from Al-Zuhri from Urwah from Aisha, who said: 'A sheep was gifted to Hafsa while we were fasting. She made me break my fast—and she was the daughter of her father (i.e., strong-willed). When the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, entered upon us, we mentioned that to him. He said: "Make up a day in its place.".'
5101 - My father narrated to me, saying: Kathir bin Hisham narrated to us, saying: Ja'far bin Barqan narrated to us, saying: Al-Zuhri narrated to us from Urwah from Aisha, who said: 'Hafsa and I were fasting...' and he mentioned the hadith.
5102 - My father narrated to me, saying: Rawh narrated to us, saying: Malik narrated to us from Ibn Shihab: That Aisha and Hafsa started the morning fasting voluntarily, then food was gifted to them and they broke their fast on it. So the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: 'Make up a day in its place.'
5103 - My father narrated to me, saying: Rawh narrated to us, saying: Salih bin Abi al-Akhdar narrated to us, saying: Ibn Shihab narrated to us from Urwah: That Aisha and Hafsa started the morning fasting... and he mentioned the hadith.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5104 - My father narrated to me, saying: Sufyan narrated to us, saying: Al-Zuhri said: Aisha and Hafsa started the morning fasting, then food was gifted to them, so they ate from it. The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, entered upon them. Aisha said: So Hafsa rushed ahead of me—and she was the daughter of her father—and said: 'We were fasting, and food was gifted to us, so we ate from it.' He said: 'Replace it with a day in its place.'
5105 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Razzaq narrated to us, saying: Ma'mar narrated to us from Al-Zuhri, who said: Aisha and Hafsa started the morning fasting... and he mentioned the meaning of Sufyan's hadith.
5106 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Razzaq and Ibn Bakr narrated to us, saying: Ibn Jurayj and Rawh informed us. He said: Ibn Jurayj narrated to us, saying: I said to Ibn Shihab: 'Did Urwah bin al-Zubair narrate to you from Aisha from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace: "Whoever breaks a voluntary fast must make it up?"' He said: 'I did not hear anything from Urwah regarding that. But a person narrated to me during the Caliphate of Sulayman'—and Ibn Bakr said: 'people'—and Rawh said: 'people'—'from some of those who used to ask Aisha: That she said: "I and Hafsa started the morning fasting. Food was brought to us, so we rushed to it and ate. The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, entered upon us, and I hastened to him"—Rawh said: "So Hafsa hastened ahead of me to him, and she was the daughter of her father, and she mentioned that to him. So the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: Fast a day."'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5107 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Dawud narrated to us, saying: Shu'bah informed us from Ja'dah from Umm Hani: That the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, entered upon her and called for a drink. He drank, then handed it to her, and she drank. She said: 'O Messenger of Allah, I was fasting.' The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: 'The voluntary faster is the trustee of himself—or the commander of himself; if he wishes he fasts, and if he wishes he breaks fast.' [Shu'bah] said: I said to him [Ja'dah]: 'Did you hear it from Umm Hani?' He said: 'No, Abu Salih and our family narrated it to me from Umm Hani.'
5108 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Dawud narrated to us, saying: Shu'bah narrated to us, saying: I used to hear Simak say: 'The two sons of Umm Hani narrated to me.' Shu'bah said: So I came to the better and superior of the two and asked him—and he was called Ja'dah.
5109 - My father mentioned Muhammad bin Kathir al-Massisi and weakened him greatly. He said: 'He heard from Ma'mar, then he was sent to Yemen and took them [the books/hadiths] and narrated them.' He weakened his hadith from Ma'mar greatly and said: 'He narrates objectionable hadith (Munkar al-Hadith),' or he said: 'He narrates objectionable things.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5110 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdullah bin Idris narrated to us, saying: I heard Harun bin Abi Ibrahim from Abdullah bin Ubaid, who said: 'Indeed, the easiest of asceticism (Nusk) is dress and walking.' My father said: Harun is trustworthy; he is the one called Al-Barbari.
5111 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Sa'id al-Ashajj narrated to us, saying: I asked a man from the children of Harun al-Barbari. He said: 'He is Harun bin Maimun.'
5112 - My father narrated to me, saying: Azhar bin Sa'd Abu Bakr narrated to us from Ibn Awn from Muhammad [Ibn Sirin], who said: 'Ubaidah was the monitor (Arif) of his people.'
5113 - I heard my father say: Rizam bin Sa'id is trustworthy. How approachable his hadith is! Waki' and Abu Ahmad narrated from him.
5114 - I heard my father say: Uthman bin Sa'id bin Kathir bin Dinar is trustworthy.
5115 - I heard my father say: Azhar read a session to us in Basra in the year one hundred and eighty-six containing about seventy hadiths. In all of them, he said: 'Ibn Awn informed us, Ibn Awn informed us.' He said: Then I did not hear him mention reports after that.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5116 - My father narrated to me, saying: Mis'ar narrated to us from Ibn Awn, who said: A man read a book to Ibrahim containing: 'And I seek refuge in You from the evil of everything with feathers.' Ibrahim disliked it.
5117 - I heard my father say: Yahya bin Hassan is trustworthy, trustworthy (Thiqah Thiqah), a righteous man.
5118 - I heard my father say: Haywah did not hear anything from Al-Zuhri, nor from Bukair bin al-Ashajj, nor from Khalid bin Abi Imran.
5119 - My father said regarding the hadith of Al-Awza'i from Abu Bakr from Mujahid: He is Wasil bin Abi Jamil.
5120 - I asked my father about Ayyub bin Nahik who narrated from Al-Sha'bi. He said: This Ayyub is from the people of Aleppo.
5121 - My father said: Na'im—meaning the freedman of Umm Salamah—is Na'im bin Ajil.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5122 - I asked my father about Khalid bin Amr al-Qurashi. He said: 'He is not trustworthy. He is the cousin of Abd al-Aziz bin Aban. He narrates false hadiths.'
5123 - I heard my father say regarding the hadith of Abd al-Malik bin Abi Sulayman from Ata from Jabir: 'The sun eclipsed.' Ibn Jurayj contradicted him [narrating] from Ata from Ubaid bin Umair. He said: 'Tell me who is most truthful?' I thought he meant Aisha. My father said: Qatada narrated it from Ata from Ubaid bin Umair from Aisha. My father said: 'I judge in favor of Ibn Jurayj over Abd al-Malik in the hadith of Ata.' And my father said another time—and he mentioned Ata: 'The most established people regarding Ata are Ibn Jurayj and Amr bin Dinar. And indeed Habib bin Abi Thabit—I think he said—contradicted Ibn Jurayj in something from the hadith of Ata or the saying of Ata, and the [accepted] saying was what Ibn Jurayj said.'
5124 - I heard my father say regarding the hadith of Isma'il bin Abi Khalid from Abu Hazim from Ibn Abbas: My father said: This Abu Hazim is the freedman of Ibn Abbas.
5125 - And Yazid bin Harun said from Isma'il from Nabtal—meaning Abu Hazim is Nabtal.
5126 - I heard my father say: Ash'ath bin Ishaq al-Qummi is more upright in hadith than Ya'qub al-Qummi.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5127 - I said to my father: Hushaym from Hajjaj bin Artah from Yazid bin Imran: I asked Al-Sha'bi about the woman pardoning the killer of her husband. I said: 'Who is this Yazid bin Imran?' He said: 'I do not know him.'
5128 - I said to my father regarding the hadith of Hushaym from Atiyyah Abu Wahb: 'When we came to Al-Hasan, he used to say: May Allah greet you with peace.' He said: 'He is a sheikh of theirs, a Wasiti, from whom Yazid bin Harun narrated.'
5129 - I said to my father: Yahya bin Sa'id al-Ansari from Abd al-Wahhab from Ibn Umar: 'Whoever's intercession prevents a prescribed punishment (Hadd) from the limits of Allah, Mighty and Majestic...' He said: 'I do not see him to be anyone other than Abd al-Wahhab bin Bukht.'
5130 - I asked my father: 'Did Hushaym hear from Ziyad bin Mikhraq?' He said: 'Yes, the hadith of Abu Iyas from Abu Kinanah from Al-Ash'ari regarding the Quran.' I said to him: 'A sheikh from whom Hushaym narrated called Abu Muhammad, freedman of Quraysh, heard Abu Kinanah from Al-Ash'ari regarding the Quran as well, the like of it.' I said to my father: 'Who is this Abu Muhammad?' He said: 'He is Ziyad al-Jassas, and he is Ziyad bin Abi Ziyad al-Jassas.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5131 - My father said: And Ibn Ulayyah prayed beautifully; he would raise his hands in prayer, raising them with intention. And Yazid bin Harun used to raise his hands as well. Ibn Ulayyah used to raise them distinctly; how beautiful his raising of his hands was! My father said: And Ibn Uyaynah might raise his hands, and might not raise them.
5132 - I heard my father say: Ibn Ghaylan—meaning Mahmud—I saw him with Abu al-Nadr here in Baghdad. And Abu Bakr al-Balkhi Muhammad bin Aban was with Waki'; he was staying with him listening to the books. And he was with us at Abd al-Razzaq's.
5133 - I heard my father say: Ibrahim bin Shammas was with us; Waki' narrated from him. And I knew Qutaibah [was] with Waki', and Ibn Rahwayh was at Abd al-Razzaq's. He would perhaps select from the books, then I would return and write what he left out. Abu Tulaiq was also in Yemen with us. I heard my father say: Khalid bin Khidash dictated to me in Yemen while we were at Abd al-Razzaq's the hadith of Hammad bin Zaid regarding Ayyub from Al-Hasan from Sakhr. He said: 'What do the People of Hadith deny?' I said: 'This hadith.' He said: 'He dictated this to us in Yemen long ago.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5134 - My father said: And I saw Khalid bin Khidash; he came to us in Yemen. And Abd al-Razzaq was—I think he said—narrating to him alone. He said: I wrote hadiths from him in Yemen. I think he was involved in some matters—meaning regarding the Sultan—or as my father said. And Mahfuz—meaning Ibn Abi Tawbah—was with us in Yemen, except that he did not write all that much. He used to listen from Ibrahim the brother of Aban and others; he did not copy [books], and his condition was very weak. And Muhanna bin Yahya was with us in that year. And Hamid was with me in Mecca at Ibn Uyaynah's.
5135 - My father said: I spoke to the nephew of Sufyan bin Uyaynah, so he spoke to Sufyan for me. He narrated to me hadiths that I asked him about. Then Ibn Abdullah bin Sawwar came and listened with me. I said: 'Is this Sawwar the judge?' He said: 'No, I think this is a brother of his.'
5136 - I heard my father say: I and Hamid al-Balkhi went to Shu'ayb bin Harb in Mecca. He said: 'Bring me the book of Ibn Uyaynah from Al-Zuhri.' So I brought it to him. He stayed for days, then we asked him for it. We came, but he had fallen ill. He said to us regarding this hadith: 'Did Ibn Uyaynah hear it from Al-Zuhri?' We said: 'We do not know.' He said: And Shu'ayb died while we were in Mecca; we buried him at night—or as my father said. I think he said: 'He had a stomach ailment.'
5137 - My father said: Shu'ayb bin Harb narrated to us, saying: Sufyan bin Uyaynah narrated to us a hadith from Ibn Abi Najih from Ata regarding the sacrificial animal (Hady). He said: 'Riding for two days and walking for two days.' Shu'ayb said: I said to Sufyan: 'Did you hear it from Ibn Abi Najih?' He said: 'So you are among those who heard it!' Shu'ayb said: I said to him: 'I heard it from Ibrahim bin Nafi' from Ibn Abi Najih.' Sufyan said: 'And I heard it from Ibrahim bin Nafi' from Ibn Abi Najih.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5138 - My father narrated to me, saying: I heard Waki' say to Abu Abd al-Rahman—meaning Al-Darir—and he narrated the hadith of Zam'ah regarding washing the pebbles for Jamarat. He said: 'If you were at Al-Waqidi's, he would have narrated to you regarding it such and such'—meaning a lot.
5139 - My father said: Al-Waqidi used to send to Al-Munabbihi—meaning Abd al-Mun'im—to borrow his books. He says: 'I insert them into his books.' We used to think that he had books from the books of Al-Zuhri or the books of Al-Zuhri's nephew. He used to transfer [references] and perhaps combine them, saying: 'So-and-so and so-and-so from Al-Zuhri.' I suspect the hadith of Nabhan from Ma'mar—and Ma'mar did not narrate the hadith either; it is the hadith of Yunus. Abd al-Razzaq narrated it to us from Ibn al-Mubarak from Yunus. He [Al-Waqidi] used to transfer the hadith; this is not from the hadith of Ma'mar.
5140 - I heard my father say: Malik and Ibn Jurayj are two Hafizs (preservers). He mentioned them a second time and said: 'They are two meticulous confirmers (Mustathbitan).'
5141 - I heard my father say: Abdullah bin Abi al-Safar; Shu'bah narrated from him and from his father Abu al-Safar. And Al-A'mash, Malik bin Mighwal, and Shu'bah narrated from Abu al-Safar. I said to him: 'Al-A'mash from Abu al-Safar from Abdullah bin Amr—did he hear from Abdullah bin Amr?' He said: 'Yes, he heard from him.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5142 - My father narrated to me, saying: Muhammad bin Fudayl narrated to us, saying: Muhammad bin Abdullah bin Abi al-Safar narrated to us—and he mentioned a hadith.
5143 - I heard my father say: Waki' said: Abu Ubaidah—meaning Al-Haddad—used to guide us to the Sheikhs.
5144 - I heard my father say: I said to Ibn Sawa' regarding the hadith of Musa bin Sarhan: 'Abu Ubaidah says Musa bin Sarwan.'—and that is Ibn Sawa'. He said: 'Musa bin Sarhan.' Then he returned to the saying of Abu Ubaidah. Ibn Sawa' and Abu Ubaidah used to seek hadith together. Abu Ubaidah did not narrate anything in Basra; he only narrated to us here with us.
5145 - I heard my father mention from Hamid bin al-Aswad, who said: 'The people of Medina did not adopt a saying [of anyone] after Zaid bin Thabit as they adopted the saying of Malik bin Anas'—meaning due to their acceptance of the saying of Malik bin Anas.
5146 - I asked my father about Hanzalah. He said: 'Trustworthy.' And Waki' used to say: 'Trustworthy.'
5147 - His brother is Amr bin Abi Sufyan; Al-Thawri and Ibn al-Mubarak narrated from him.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5148 - My father said: Saif—they differed regarding him, Ibn Sulayman or Ibn Abi Sulayman—is trustworthy. Zakariya bin Ishaq is trustworthy. Shibl is trustworthy. How close these are [in status]: Saif, Zakariya, and Shibl. And Ibrahim bin Nafi' is trustworthy. The companions of Ibn Abi Najih are mostly Qadariyyah, but they are not people of theology (Kalam), except perhaps Shibl; I do not know.
5149 - I asked my father: 'Whose hearing is older (earlier), Al-A'mash or Mughirah?' He said: 'Al-A'mash heard from Al-Ma'rur. And the oldest one from whom Mughirah heard is Abu Wa'il.' I said: 'Did Mughirah hear from Khaythamah?' He said: 'He should have.' I said: 'So Yahya bin Wathab?' He said: 'Yes.' Except that Yahya bin Sa'id used to say: 'Mansur's hearing is older than Al-A'mash; he heard from Rib'i bin Hirash'—meaning Mansur.
5150 - My father said: Al-A'mash heard from Al-Ma'rur.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5151 - My father said: Mutarrif's chain of narration and Firas's chain are one. Mutarrif did not hear from Ibrahim; rather, he heard from Al-Sha'bi. He only narrates from Al-Hakam and Hammad from Ibrahim.
5152 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Ya'qub, the client of Abu Ubaydullah, narrated to us saying: I benefited from Abdur-Rahman b. Mahdi regarding a hadith from Jarir in Mecca, from Ghalib b. Najih, from Hammad, from Sa'id b. Jubayr. He [Abdur-Rahman] began saying to me: May Allah reward you with goodness.
5153 - I heard my father say to a man from the people of Khurasan, who asked him about Muhammad b. Al-Azhar Al-Jawzjani, so he said: Do not write from him until he repents. That is because it reached him that he spoke regarding the matter of the Quran [its createdness]. So he said to him: Do not write from him so that he does not narrate from the liars. And he mentioned the Tafsir of Al-Kalbi and Abdul-Mun'im, meaning the hadiths of Wahb b. Munabbih.
5154 - My father was asked, while I was listening, about Muhammad b. Aban Al-Balkhi. He said: I know him. It was said to him: Should we write from him? He said: Yes, and he nodded his head in agreement.
5155 - I heard my father say: Abdullah b. Abi Bakr b. Muhammad b. Amr b. Hazm, his hadith is a healing. And Muhammad b. Abi Bakr, there is no harm in him; Shu'bah narrated from him, and he was a judge.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5156 - I asked my father: Where did Qatadah hear from Salim b. Abi Al-Ja'd? He said: In Kufa. Or in Mecca. And he denied that he heard from him in Sham (the Levant), and he said: Qatadah came to Kufa to Al-Sha'bi.
5157 - I heard my father say regarding the hadith of Husayn b. Muhammad, from Isra'il, from Abu Ishaq, from Amr Dhi Murr, that Ali, when the statement of Anas reached him... My father said: This is a mistake from Husayn, others contradicted him; there is no mention of Anas in it. He means the hadith: "Take as a patron whoever he took as a patron, and take as an enemy whoever he took as an enemy."
5158 - I heard my father say: I heard Abdur-Rahman b. Mahdi say: The Book of Prayer and the rest of the books were read to Malik. He said: I read them to him.
5159 - I heard my father say: Yahya b. Sa'id said: The presentation (reading back) of Abdur-Rahman b. Mahdi is more beloved to me than the hearing (audition) of anyone else.
5160 - I asked my father about Abu Al-Husayn. He said: A Meccan. Ibn Mahdi narrated from him. He narrated to us from him, from Ibn Jurayj and Ata, who said: It is from the Sunnah that someone other than its people be appointed as governor over the people of Mecca.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5161 - I heard my father say: Abu Idris Al-Azdi's name is Ibrahim b. Hadid. My father said: Yahya b. Ghaylan narrated it to us from Abu Awanah from Isma'il b. Salim.
5162 - My father said: Sulayman Al-Ahwal is Sulayman b. Abi Muslim, and he is the maternal uncle of Ibn Abi Najih. Ibn Uyaynah and Ibn Jurayj narrated from him.
5163 - My father said: Gundar did not provide a chain (isnad) from Shu'bah for the hadith of Amr b. Murrah from Al-Hasan b. Muslim that a girl's hair fell out. He decreased its chain [omitted the companion], meaning Aisha.
5164 - I heard my father say: Umm Salamah's name is Hind. And Umm Habibah bint Abi Sufyan's name is Ramlah. Abu Qatadah Al-Adawi's name is Tamim b. Nadhir.
5165 - I heard my father say: Abu Al-Furat, from whom Abu Hayyan Al-Taymi and Sufyan Al-Thawri narrated, his name is Shaddad b. Abi Al-Aliyah.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5166 - I heard my father say: I do not doubt regarding Al-Waqidi that he used to flip them, meaning hadiths. And he mentioned among them the hadith of Nabhan from Umm Salamah: "Are you two blind?" He says: He refers the hadith of Ma'mar Yunus to Ma'mar.
5167 - I heard my father say when the death of Uthman b. Abi Shaybah was announced to him: "Those hadiths which he narrated," and he rejected them strongly. He mentioned among them the hadith of Jarir from Shaybah b. Na'amah from Fatimah, and the hadith of Jarir from Al-Thawri from Ibn Uqayl from Jabir that the Prophet (peace be upon him) witnessed an Eid of the polytheists. He said: "His brother's soul would have disdained such hadiths." This hadith was narrated to us by Uthman from Jarir from Sufyan, while Jarir used to narrate it from Sufyan from Abdullah b. Jarir b. Ziyad Al-Qummi as Mursal (hurried/disconnected).
5168 - I heard my father say: Abu Malik Al-Ash'ari, how likely it is that his name was Amr.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5169 - I heard my father say: I memorized from Waki' that the name of Abu Al-Safar is Sa'id b. Ahmad Al-Thawri, from Thawr of Hamdan.
5170 - I said to my father: A sheikh from whom Ibn Mahdi narrated, called Muqarrin b. Karzamah, he narrated from Abu Kathir Al-Suhaymi. Do you know him? He said: No.
5171 - I heard my father say: Musa Al-Juhani is Musa b. Abdullah. This is what Yahya b. Sa'id said.
5172 - I heard my father say: Waki' makes mistakes in hadiths from Malik b. Anas. Among them is the hadith of Muhammad b. Abi Bakr Al-Thaqafi: "We went out early with Anas." Waki' did not say "Muhammad b. Abi Bakr Al-Thaqafi"; he said something other than Muhammad. Ibn Mahdi contradicted him.
5173 - He was asked about Nasr b. Ali Al-Jahdami. He said: I do not know him, but there is no harm in him, if Allah wills, and he approved of him. It was said to him: Abu Bakr b. Khallad, do you know him? He said: Yes, an old acquaintance. We met him during the days of Al-Mu'tamar b. Sulayman in Basra, and in Baghdad as well, and with Yahya b. Sa'id, sticking closely to him.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5174 - It was said to him: Abbas Al-Anbari? Ibn Khallad said: [He is] from the Sheikhs. Abu Abdur-Rahman said: He avoided him because of the Inquisition (Mihnah), for he was beaten during the Inquisition.
5175 - I heard my father say: The first time we sat with Al-Mu'tamar, he was reading Al-Maghazi (military expeditions), Mursal hadiths from his father and others, so we did not understand and did not write anything from it. Then he read to us hadiths from his father from Mughirah, and I gathered from it some good hadiths from his book, a worn-out book. As for the hadiths of Kahmas, we wrote them down as he read them to us. He would also recite from a book that was not his own book. And the book of Fudayl b. Maysarah, we wrote every Mursal (disconnected) narration and abandoned every Musnad (connected) narration except for one hadith which we wrote. And he also greeted (read peace) from a book. As for the hadith of Mughirah, it was from his book alone. My father said: Mu'tamar did not have a good memory.
5176 - Yahya b. Ma'in said: Mu'tamar brought out a book to us and read to us, meaning the hadiths of Abu Ubaydah. My father said: He is called Korin, his name is Abdullah b. Al-Qasim.
5177 - I heard my father say: I heard from Mu'tamar in the year eighty-six [186 AH], and that was the first year we entered Basra. We entered the second time and Mu'tamar had died.
5178 - I heard my father say: I was born in the month of Rabi' al-Awwal in the year one hundred and sixty-four [164 AH], and he died in the month of Rabi' al-Akhir in the year two hundred and forty-one [241 AH], and he was seventy-eight years old.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5179 - I heard my father say: Mas'adah b. Al-Yasa' is nothing. We tore up his hadith, or we abandoned his hadith ages ago.
5180 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Al-Nadr narrated to us, saying: Shu'bah narrated to us, saying: Habib b. Abi Thabit informed me, saying: I heard Abu Al-Abbas, a man from the people of Mecca, and he was a poet and was not accused regarding hadith.
5181 - My father said: His name is Al-Sa'ib b. Farrukh, and he is Abu Al-Ala b. Abi Al-Abbas.
5182 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Ubaydah Al-Haddad narrated to us from Bakr Al-A'naq from a man who said: I came to Al-Sha'bi and found him rocking back and forth. He said: It is good for back pain.
5183 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Ubaydah narrated to us from Hammam from Farqad, who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "The most lying of people are the dyers and the goldsmiths."
5184 - I heard my father say: Isma'il b. Aban Al-Warraq narrated to us, he is trustworthy (Thiqah).
5185 - Hudbah b. Khalid narrated to us, saying: Hammam narrated to us, saying: Farqad narrated to us in the house of Qatadah, from Yazid Abu Al-Ala, from Abu Hurayrah, from the Prophet (peace be upon him) who said: "The most lying of people are the dyers and the goldsmiths."

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5186 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yazid b. Harun narrated to us from Hammam, saying: Farqad narrated to us from Yazid Abu Al-Ala, from Abu Hurayrah, from the Prophet (peace be upon him) with the like of it.
5187 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdul-Wahhab b. Hammam, the brother of Abdur-Razzaq, narrated to us, saying: I heard Ikrimah b. Ammar say: Abu Zumayl Simak b. Yazid from Banu Abdullah informed us, saying: Ibn Abbas narrated to us.
5188 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdul-Wahhab b. Hammam narrated to us, saying: I heard Ibn Jurayj say: I used to ask Ata about everything that amazed me. But when I asked him about Al-Baqarah and Al-Imran, or about Al-Baqarah, he said: Excuse me from this, meaning from its explanation (Tafsir).
5189 - I heard my father say: Hammad b. Salamah is the most established of people regarding Thabit Al-Bunani.
5190 - My father narrated to me, saying: Khalid, meaning Ibn Khidash, narrated to us, saying: Ibn Wahb said to me when he saw me not writing the hadith of Ibn Lahi'ah: "I am not like others regarding Ibn Lahi'ah, so write them." And he said regarding his hadith from Uqbah b. Amir that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "If the Quran were in a hide, the fire would not touch it." Ibn Lahi'ah raised it to us [as a marfu' hadith to the Prophet] only in the early part of his life.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5191 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Al-Mughirah the Storyteller narrated to us, saying: Isma'il narrated to us from Qays, who said: I saw Abu Bakr Al-Siddiq holding the tip of his tongue and saying: "This is what brought me to the watering holes [of calamity]."
5192 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdul-Quddus b. Bakr b. Khunays narrated to us, saying: Al-Hajjaj narrated to us from Hammad, who said: "Indeed, knowledge will cover the scholar on the Day of Resurrection like a cloud, then it will be placed in his scale. He will say: What is this? It will be said: The knowledge that you taught to the people."
5193 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdul-Quddus narrated to us from a man he named, meaning Abu Hanifah, from Hammad, the like of it.
5194 - Abu Bakr Al-A'yan narrated to us from Al-Hasan b. Al-Rabi' who said: Ibn Al-Mubarak crossed out the hadith of Abu Hanifah a few days before he died.
5195 - My father narrated to me, saying: Rawh narrated to us, saying: Ibn Abi Dhi'b narrated to us from his brother Al-Harith b. Abdur-Rahman, from his father, from Abdur-Rahman b. Al-Mughirah b. Abi Dhi'b, from his father who said: Umar b. Al-Khattab saw me walking and said: "The walk of his father! By the One in Whose hand is my soul, the walk of Abu Dhi'b." He said: So he charged at me with the whip, but I outran him.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5196 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Sa'id, the client of Banu Hashim narrated to us, saying: Bishr b. Kathir Abu Talhah Al-Usaydi narrated to us. My father said: He is trustworthy, trustworthy (Thiqah Thiqah).
5197 - I heard my father say: Abu Al-Mutawakkil Al-Naji's name is Ali b. Dawud.
5198 - My father narrated to me, saying: Muhammad b. Abi Adi informed us from Ibn Awn from Umayr b. Ishaq who said: We were sitting with Abu Sufyan when Ziyad came out from Uthman b. Affan. He [Abu Sufyan] said: "Woe to his mother! A man, if only he had a tribal backbone to trace back to."
5199 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Ubaydah Al-Haddad Abdul-Wahid b. Wasil narrated to us, saying: Abdul-Malik b. Ma'n narrated to us from Jabr b. Habib that two men reached Al-Ahnaf [with the news] that the Prophet (peace be upon him) had prayed for him, so he prostrated.
5200 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdullah b. Yazid Al-Muqri narrated to us, saying: Kahmas b. Al-Hasan Abu Al-Hasan narrated to us, and his maternal uncles are Qays, and he is from Al-Namar b. Qasit, and he was living among Banu Qays.
5201 - My father narrated to me, saying: Sulayman b. Harb narrated to us, saying: Hammad b. Zayd narrated to us, saying: Al-Mu'alla b. Ziyad informed us, saying: Murrah b. Dabbab narrated to me, saying: I passed by Uqbah b. Abd al-Ghafir when the people were defeated, and he was lying in the trench, wounded. He called out to me: O Abu Al-Mu'adhdhal! O Abu Al-Mu'adhdhal!

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5202 - My father narrated to me, saying: I asked Abdur-Razzaq about Yunus b. Sulaym. He said: He is better than Amr b. Riqq. And I heard my father say: He is above Amr b. Riqq. My father said: He is Amr b. Abdullah; Ma'mar narrated from him.
5203 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ishaq b. Isa Al-Tabba' narrated to us, saying: Abdullah b. Zayd b. Aslam narrated to us from his father from a man from the people of Sham that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "Three things do not break the fast of the fasting person: Vomiting, wet dreams, and cupping." My father used to weaken Abdur-Rahman b. Zayd b. Aslam, and that is because he narrated this hadith from his father from Ata b. Yasar from Abu Sa'id from the Prophet (peace be upon him).
5204 - My father said: Abdullah b. Zayd is trustworthy. My father said: Abdur-Rahman also narrated another rejected (Munkar) hadith: "Two dead things and two bloods have been made lawful for us."

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5205 - My father narrated to me, saying: Affan narrated to us, saying: Abdul-Wahid b. Ziyad narrated to us, saying: Yunus b. Ubayd narrated to us from his mother who said: I saw Abu Safiyyah, a man from the Companions of the Prophet (peace be upon him). She said: He was our neighbor here, and when morning came, he would glorify Allah (Tasbih) using pebbles.
5206 - Al-Qawariri narrated to us, saying: Abdul-Wahid b. Ziyad narrated to us, saying: Yunus narrated to us from his mother who said: I saw Abu Safiyyah, a man from the Companions of the Prophet (peace be upon him), and he mentioned the like of it.
5207 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Al-Nadr narrated to us, saying: Muhammad b. Talhah narrated to us from Zubayd who said: If one of them used the kunya Abu Al-Qasim, we would call him Abu Al-Qasim [spelled with Sad instead of Sin to avoid the exact title of the Prophet].
5208 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdur-Razzaq narrated to us, saying: My father informed me, saying: Mina narrated to me, saying: I took Al-Baqarah and Al-Imran from the mouth of Abu Hurayrah. And I performed Hajj with Aisha; I would untie for her and comb [her hair? or mount/dismount help?], and I had a wet dream when allegiance was pledged to Uthman b. Affan.
5209 - My father narrated to me, saying: Hajjaj b. Muhammad narrated to us, saying: Shu'bah narrated to us, saying: I found a few days ago in a book I have, from Mansur from Mujahid who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) did not get cupped while he was in a state of Ihram. Shu'bah said: I do not know how I wrote it, and I do not remember that I heard it.
5210 - My father narrated to me, saying: Hajjaj narrated to us, saying: Shu'bah narrated to us from Mansur from Hayyan from Suwayd b. Ghaflah from Ali, that he was asked about a woman who left behind her husband and her mother. He assigned the half to her husband and the third to her mother, then he returned what remained to her mother. Shu'bah said: I had heard it from Hayyan, Sufyan narrated it to us. Then Sufyan went to Mansur and narrated it to him. Then I forgot it, so I asked Mansur about it, and he informed me of it, so I memorized it from Mansur. But I do not think Mansur heard it from Hayyan.
5211 - My father said: He is called Hayyan, the owner of the carpets (Sahib al-Anmat).

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5212 - My father narrated to me, saying: Hajjaj narrated to us, saying: Shu'bah narrated to us from Mansur from a man from Abu Zabyan from Abdullah b. Amr that he used to dislike praying in the bathhouse (Hammam). Shu'bah said: The man whom Mansur narrated from is Habib, meaning Ibn Abi Al-Ashras; I know that just as I know that you haven't killed ten people.
5213 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Al-Nadr narrated to us, saying: Muhammad, meaning Ibn Talhah, narrated to us saying: Talhah and Zubayd used to dye their hair with yellow.
5214 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdullah b. Thawr narrated to us, saying: My mother narrated to me from Al-Ayna bint Abi Al-Halal. Ubaydullah said: And Daniyah bint Abi Al-Halal narrated to us that Abu Al-Halal died the day he died while he was one hundred and twenty years old.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5215 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ubaydullah b. Thawr narrated to us, saying: Daniyah bint Abi Al-Halal narrated to us: Al-Muhallab b. Abi Sufrah sent a slave girl to Abu Al-Halal to see if there was any remainder [of strength/virility] left in the sheikh. So he deflowered her, and he was on that day one hundred and ten years old. He said: His daughter Daniyah said to me: So I went out, and I was sixty years old, behind his funeral procession with my hair let loose over a camel saddle.
5216 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ubaydullah b. Thawr narrated to us, saying: My mother narrated to me, saying: I saw Shumaysah bint Aziz b. Ghafir Al-Wasiqiyyah - Ubaydullah said: A clan from us, meaning Al-Atik - wearing two anklets, and she was a very old woman.
5217 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ubaydullah b. Thawr b. Awn b. Abi Al-Halal narrated to us, saying: Al-Halal b. Thawr, meaning his brother, narrated to me from Abdul-Majid b. Wahb from Abu Al-Halal Rabi'ah b. Zurarah. My father said: Ubaydullah dictated these hadiths to me and to Ali b. Al-Madini.
5218 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ya'qub b. Ibrahim b. Sa'd narrated to us, saying: My father narrated to me from Ibn Ishaq, saying: Al-Muttalib b. Abdullah b. Qays b. Makhramah b. Al-Muttalib b. Abd Manaf narrated to me from his father from his grandfather Qays b. Makhramah, who said: I and the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) were born in the Year of the Elephant, so we are contemporaries (liddan), meaning we were born at the same time.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5219 - I heard my father say: I came to Hushaym and found Hajjaj b. Muhammad and Ishaq b. Al-Tabba' with him. So he narrated to us the hadith of Mu'aththir b. Afazah, the hadith of Dhul-Qarnayn, the hadith of Al-Fadl b. Atiyyah, and the hadith of Abu Al-Jahm. Yahya b. Ma'in was with us. I said to him: Did you know Yahya in those days? He said: Yes, and Abu Khaythamah also wrote for me at Hushaym's; I believe he mentioned a session.
5220 - My father narrated to me, saying: Waki' narrated to us from Sufyan from someone who heard Ata dislike that a man has intercourse facing the Qiblah. My father said: This is Talhah b. Amr; Hammad Al-Khayyat narrated it to us, meaning from Sufyan.
5221 - Yahya b. Ma'in narrated to me, saying: Hajjaj narrated to us from Yunus b. Abi Ishaq from Abu Ishaq from Sa'id b. Jubayr from Ibn Abbas who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) was born on the Day of the Elephant. Then it reached me from Yahya b. Ma'in that he retracted it and said: The Year of the Elephant.
5222 - My father said: Abu Mujahid's name is Sa'd Al-Ta'i.
5223 - My father narrated to me, saying: Mu'ammal b. Isma'il narrated to us, saying: Hammad b. Zayd narrated to us, saying: Muhammad b. Dhakwan narrated to us, saying: It was mentioned in the presence of Hammad, meaning Ibn Abi Sulayman, that the Prophet (peace be upon him) freed two [slaves] and kept four in slavery, casting lots among them. Hammad said: This is the opinion of the Sheikh, meaning Satan. Muhammad said: I said to him: The pen has been lifted from three, [including] the insane person until he recovers. He said: What do you intend with this? I said: What did *you* intend with that?

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5224 - My father narrated to me, saying: Mu'ammal narrated to us, saying: I heard Hammad b. Salamah mention Abu Hanifah, and he said: Indeed, Abu Hanifah confronted the traditions (Athar) and the Sunan and rejected them with his opinion.
5225 - My father narrated to me, saying: Mu'ammal narrated to us, saying: I heard Sufyan Al-Thawri say: Indeed, Abu Hanifah was asked to repent twice.
5226 - My father narrated to me, saying: Mu'ammal narrated to us, saying: Hammad b. Zayd narrated to us, saying: Muhammad b. Dhakwan narrated to us - he said: he is his son, meaning Hammad b. Zayd's [student/source] - I said to Hammad b. Abi Sulayman: Did Ibrahim used to speak with your opinion regarding Irja'? He said: No, he was a doubter like you.
5227 - My father narrated to me, saying: Mu'ammal narrated to us, saying: Ibn Jurayj died in the year fifty [150 AH] before the Hajj came.
5228 - My father said: And Mu'ammal b. Isma'il had heard from Ibn Jurayj.
5229 - My father narrated to me, saying: Mu'ammal narrated to us from Hammad b. Zayd, saying: Muhammad b. Dhakwan narrated to me, saying: I wrote to Hammad: Inform me of what you narrated to us from Ibrahim; did you hear it from Ibrahim? He said: Some of it I heard, and some of it others narrated to me from Ibrahim, and some of it I compared by my opinion to Ibrahim['s views].

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5230 - My father narrated to me, saying: Mu'ammal narrated to us, saying: Sufyan, meaning Al-Thawri, narrated to us, saying: Abbad b. Kathir narrated to me, saying: Amr, meaning Ibn Ubayd, said to me: Ask Abu Hanifah about a man who says, "I know that the Kaaba is true and that it is the House of Allah, but I do not know if it is the one in Mecca or the one in Khurasan." Is he a believer? He said: He is a believer. And he said to me: Ask him about a man who says, "I know that Muhammad is true and that he is the Messenger of Allah, but I do not know if he is the one who was in Medina or another Muhammad." Is he a believer? He said: He is a believer.
5231 - Harun b. Sufyan or someone else narrated to us, saying: Talq b. Ghannam narrated to us, saying: Hafs b. Ghiyath was asked about an issue, and he was slow to answer it. He said: So I said to him: O Abu Umar! He said: Leave me, for I am only cutting into my own flesh. I have seen Abu Hanifah being asked about an issue, and he would give ten different opinions on it in a single sitting.
5232 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Usamah narrated to us from Sufyan from Isma'il b. Abi Khalid from Salman the Muezzin from Murrah who said: Al-Harith said to me: You are to me in the position of one who learned the Quran in a year, and the Revelation in such and such. My father said: I do not know if it was Sufyan Al-Thawri or Ibn Uyaynah.
5233 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Usamah narrated to us from Malik b. Mighwal from Muharib who said: I accompanied Imran b. Hittan, and I never saw anyone like him.
5234 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Usamah narrated to us, saying: Shu'bah narrated to me from Qatadah from Mutarrif who said: A man said in the presence of Imran b. Husayn: "Samurah has perished." Imran said: "Nay! Whatever he defended Islam with is better."

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5235 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Usamah narrated to us from Abdullah b. Al-Walid from a man who said: Umar b. Abdul-Aziz said to me: Where is your residence? I said: Kufa. He said: Move away from it, for no one has ever lived in it except that a piece of punishment was cut out for him.
5236 - I heard my father say: Ammar b. Abi Ammar is trustworthy and firm in hadith. They related from Shu'bah that he said: Hammad b. Salamah benefited me with hadith from Ammar b. Abi Ammar, so I asked him [Ammar], and he began to doubt, meaning in the hadiths. My father said: Shu'bah had heard one hadith from him.
5237 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdul-Wahhab Al-Khaffaf narrated to us from Sa'id from Hajjaj Al-Ahwal. My father said: Ibn Ulayyah narrated to us from him, meaning this Hajjaj. My father said: And Yazid b. Zuray' and Sa'id, meaning Ibn Abi Arubah, and Umar b. Amir narrated from him. He is Al-Hajjaj Al-Ahwal, and he is Hajjaj Al-Bahili, and he is Hajjaj b. Abi Al-Hajjaj.
5238 - My father narrated to me, saying: Hajjaj narrated to us from Shu'bah who said: I asked Abu Ishaq, and he said: "By Allah (Al-Ilah), they used not to sleep until they prayed," meaning sleeping before the prayer.
5239 - My father narrated to me, saying: Hajjaj narrated to us, saying: I said to Al-Mas'udi: Did Al-Qasim use to dye with black? He said: It was something [he did] once, then he abandoned that, and he used to dye with redness.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5240 - My father narrated to me, saying: Hajjaj narrated to us, saying: Layth narrated to us, saying: Mu'awiyah b. Salih narrated to me from Ali b. Abi Talhah. Hajjaj said: And I have seen Ali b. Abi Talhah. My father said: Ali b. Abi Talhah refers to two men. This Levantine one, Mu'awiyah b. Salih and Abu Fadalah narrated from him, and Dawud b. Abi Hind narrated from him. As for the one whom the Kufans narrated from, Al-Thawri and Hasan b. Salih narrated from him. The one whom Hajjaj saw, he only saw this one from whom Sufyan and Hasan narrated, and I do not think he reached the Levantine one.
5241 - My father narrated to me, saying: Azhar narrated to us from Ibn Awn who said: I saw Musa b. Talhah b. Ubaydullah dyeing with black.
5242 - My father narrated to me, saying: Hajjaj narrated to us, saying: Hamzah Al-Zayyat narrated to us from Dithar b. Abi Shabib. My father said: Sufyan Al-Thawri also narrated from him, and he is the one who is called Al-Qattan.
5243 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdur-Rahman b. Mahdi narrated to us, saying: Sufyan said to me: Do you memorize this? Dithar narrated to me from Muslim Al-Batin from Sa'id b. Jubayr who said: "Entering the bathhouse without a waist wrapper (izar) is forbidden (Haram)." He said: I said, "Yes." He said: Sufyan said to me: "I see that you have heard; I see that you have heard."
5244 - It was said to him: Abu Nukhailah, what is his name? He said: I do not know.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5245 - My father narrated to me, saying: Hajjaj narrated to us, saying: Abu Isra'il said: I was born one year after [the Battle of] Al-Jamajim. And Al-Jamajim was in the year eighty-three. He said: And I am seventy-eight years old.
5246 - My father narrated to me, saying: Hajjaj narrated to us, saying: I heard Sufyan say: May Allah have mercy on Abu Hazim Al-Madini. He said: "The people today are satisfied with knowledge and have abandoned action."
5247 - My father narrated to me, saying: Hajjaj narrated to us, saying: Layth narrated to us, saying: Ibrahim b. Abi Ablah informed me, saying: Raja' b. Haywah stood over Makhul while I was with him, and said: O Makhul! It has reached me that you have spoken regarding something of Al-Qadar (Destiny). By Allah, if I knew that, I would never have associated with you among the people. He said: Makhul said: No, by Allah, may Allah improve you, that is not my concern nor my speech, or something similar. Layth said: Makhul used to be impressed by the speech of Ghaylan, so if he mentioned him, he would say: "Kul Kalilah," intending to say "Qul Qalilah" (Say [it happens] rarely/Say a little), meaning: How few are like him among the people, meaning Ghaylan. And there was a lisp in his speech, meaning Makhul.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5248 - My father said: The person who narrated most from Abu Ma'shar is Ibn Abi Arubah. He says: 'Abu Ma'shar narrated to us.' Yahya al-Qattan narrated them to us, saying: Ibn Abi Arubah narrated to us, saying: Abu Ma'shar narrated to us. With Ghundar from him—meaning from Sa'id [Ibn Abi Arubah]—there are about twenty [hadiths] and two hundred from Abu Ma'shar. This story regarding the hearing has been clarified.
5249 - Abdullah narrated to us, saying: Sawwar bin Abdullah narrated to us, saying: Mu'adh narrated to us from Ibn Awn, who said: I saw Ghaylan crucified on the gate of Damascus.
5250 - My father was asked about Ruhayl, the brother of Zuhayr. He said: Zuhayr narrates from him, and he is an early figure (qadim).
5251 - He was asked about Hudayj, the brother of Zuhayr. He said: I have no knowledge of his hadith. It was said that he narrates from Abu Ishaq from Al-Bara' that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to say Taslim to his right and to his left. He said: This is Munkar (objectionable).

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5252 - My father was asked about Ahmad bin Ishaq al-Hadrami. He said: I did not write from him. It was said to him: Why? He said: Because he was with Yahya—meaning Ibn Aktham.
5253 - My father said: I saw Ya'qub al-Hadrami come to Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi. It was said to him: Why do you write from him? He said: They used to say that he was young [when he was] with Shu'bah, and he was truthful (saduq), and he used to come to Yahya al-Qattan and greet him.
5254 - My father was asked about the hadith of Al-A'mash from Abu Ayyub from Abdullah bin Amr from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, who said: 'The Hour will not be established until obscenity and severing of ties of kinship appear.' He said: Who narrated this from him? They said: Abdullah bin Kasib. He said: I do not know who this Abu Ayyub is. It was said to him: Do you think he is Yahya bin Malik from whom Qatada narrated? He said: I do not know.
5255 - He was asked about Al-Awwam bin Murajim. He said: I do not know anyone who narrated from him other than Shu'bah.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5256 - He was asked about Aslam al-Minqari, whose son is he? He said: I do not know. He said: He is trustworthy (thiqah) according to us. It was said to him: Is he dearer to you or Ja'far bin Abi al-Mughirah? He said: Ja'far is not well-known, and he gave precedence to Aslam over him.
5257 - My father was asked about Ibrahim bin Abd al-A'la and Uthman bin Muslim. He said: Two trustworthy men (thiqatan).
5258 - He was asked about Al-Rukayn bin al-Rabi' and Al-Miqdam bin Shuraih. He said: Two trustworthy men (thiqatan).
5259 - And he said: Ali bin Abd al-A'la, there is no harm in him; Hushaym and Zuhayr narrated from him.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5260 - He was asked about Aban bin Taghlib and Ziyad bin Khaythamah. He said: Aban is trustworthy (thiqah); Shu'bah used to narrate from him. It was said to him: Aban and Idris al-Awdi? He said: Aban is more prolific (akthar).
5261 - He was asked about what Sa'id bin Jubayr narrated from Aisha regarding hearing [directly]. He said: I do not think he heard from her; [it is] from a trustworthy person from Aisha.
5262 - He was asked about Sulayman bin Yasar, did he hear from Aisha? He said: He indeed heard from her and entered upon her.
5263 - He was asked: Did Amr bin Dinar hear from Sulayman al-Yashkuri? He said: Sulayman was killed in the Fitnah (civil war) of Ibn al-Zubair, and Amr is an early figure. Shu'bah has narrated from him: from Amr from Sulayman, and I see that he indeed heard from him. It was said to him: Did Qatada hear from Sa'id bin Jubayr? He said: No, he says: 'We wrote to Sa'id bin Jubayr.' It was said to him: Then did Qatada hear from Tawus? He said: Tawus saw him and sought refuge from him. It was said to him: Then Al-Qasim, Salim, and Urwah? He said: He did not hear from them. It was said: Then Abdullah bin Mughaffal? He said: He did not hear from him.
5264 - It was said: Did Qatada hear from Abdullah bin Sarjis? He said: Yes, Hisham narrated from him—meaning from Qatada from Abdullah bin Sarjis—one hadith, and Asim al-Ahwal has narrated from him.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5265 - He was asked about the hadith of Ibn Uyaynah from Ibn Jurayj from Ibn Abi Mulaykah from Aisha from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace: 'He cursed the women who imitate men.' He said: Hajjaj al-A'war narrated it from Ibn Jurayj with another chain of narration, and it is not from Ibn Abi Mulaykah.
5266 - I asked my father about the hadith of Ibn Jurayj from Ibn Abi Mulaykah from Aisha or someone else from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, if Allah wills: 'Whoever accepts Islam upon something, then it belongs to him.' He said: Ibn Jurayj narrated it: 'I said to Ata: Whoever accepts Islam upon something...'
5267 - He was asked about what Amr bin Dinar narrated from Ibn Abbas and Ibn al-Zubair regarding the Qira'at (readings), is it hearing (Sama')? He said: Ibn Uyaynah said: Amr used to not say in them 'I heard Ibn Abbas.'
5268 - He was asked about Sa'id al-Maqburi from his father from Abu Hurairah. He said: His father, there is no harm in him. It was said to him: His son? He said: Both of them, there is no harm in them.
5269 - My father was asked about his son Abdullah bin Sa'id. He said: Weak (da'if).

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5270 - My father was asked about Ibn Ajlan and Ibn Abi Dhi'b. He said: Ibn Ajlan got confused and made it all from Sa'id from Abu Hurairah. Layth bin Sa'd is the most correct of people in narrating from him, and he is dearer to me than them—meaning regarding the hadith of Sa'id. And he said in another place: Ubaidullah bin Umar is foremost in the hadith of Sa'id.
5271 - My father said: Ibn Jurayj narrates it—meaning the hadith of Hamnah—he says: 'I was told from Ibn Aqil,' he did not hear it. And he says: 'From Muhammad bin Abdullah bin Aqil,' inverting his name. He said: They say Al-Nu'man bin Rashid agreed with him. He said: Ibn Jurayj narrates from Al-Nu'man bin Rashid, and I do not see it except that he heard it from him. And Al-Nu'man bin Rashid is not strong in hadith; you recognize weakness in him.
5272 - My father was asked about Uyaynah bin Abd al-Rahman. He said: There is no harm in him, he is satisfactory in hadith (Salih al-Hadith). It was said: His father? He said: He is not famous. It was said to him: Is Uthman al-Shahham from Muslim bin Abi Bakra from his father dearer to you, or Uyaynah from his father from Abu Bakra? He said: How close they are!
5273 - He was asked about Ubadah bin Nusay. He said: A trustworthy (thiqah) Syrian. It was said: Hatim bin Abi Nasr narrates from him—meaning objectionable hadiths (manakir). He said: Who is Hatim bin Abi Nasr? Ubadah bin Nusay is trustworthy.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5274 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Razzaq narrated to us, saying: Sufyan informed us from Abu Salamah from Al-Rabi' bin Anas. I asked my father: Who is this Abu Salamah? He said: This Abu Salamah is Al-Mughirah bin Muslim, the brother of Abd al-Aziz bin Muslim al-Qasmali.
5275 - My father narrated to me, saying: Muhammad bin Ja'far narrated to us, saying: Shu'bah narrated to us from Abu Abdullah, the freedman of Juhaynah, who said: I heard Mus'ab bin Sa'd. My father said: Abu Abdullah, the freedman of Juhaynah, is Musa al-Juhani.
5276 - My father narrated to me, saying: Qutaibah bin Sa'id narrated to us, saying: Hatim bin Isma'il narrated to us from Muhammad bin Yusuf from Al-Sa'ib bin Yazid that he said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, performed the Farewell Pilgrimage while I was seven years old.
5277 - Muhammad bin Abbad narrated to us, saying: Hatim bin Isma'il narrated to us from Muhammad bin Yusuf from Al-Sa'ib bin Yazid, who said: My father performed Hajj with me with the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, for the Farewell Pilgrimage while I was seven years old. My father said: From Qutaibah, 'My father performed Hajj,' and Muhammad bin Abbad said, 'He performed Hajj with me.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5278 - My father narrated to me, saying: Isma'il bin Ibrahim narrated to us, saying: Yunus informed us from Al-Hasan that Aqil bin Abi Talib was called: 'O Abu Yazid.'
5279 - My father narrated to me, saying: Affan narrated to us, saying: Hammad bin Salamah narrated to us, saying: Abu al-Husayn informed us. My father said: He is Khalid bin Dhakwan; Bishr bin al-Mufaddal narrated to us from him.
5280 - My father narrated to me, saying: Affan narrated to us, saying: Abu al-Ashhab narrated to us, saying: Khulayd al-Asri narrated to us. Abu Jazi said to him: Where did you meet Khulayd? He said: I do not know.
5281 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-A'la narrated to us from Ma'mar from Al-Zuhri from Kharijah bin Zaid bin Thabit from Zaid bin Thabit: That the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: 'Perform ablution from what fire has touched.'
5282 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Razzaq narrated to us, saying: I read in the book of Ma'mar from Al-Zuhri from Abd al-Malik bin Abi Bakr from Kharijah from Zaid from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, regarding ablution from what fire has touched.
5283 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yazid bin Harun narrated to us, saying: Khalid bin Rabah Abu al-Fadl informed us.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5284 - My father narrated to me, saying: Sufyan narrated to us from Abu Hazim from Sahl bin Sa'd, who said: It was made of the tamarisk of Al-Ghabah—meaning the pulpit of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace.
5285 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ya'qub narrated to us, saying: My father narrated to me from Ibn Ishaq, who said: Abu Hazim al-Afzar, the freedman of Al-Aswad bin Sufyan al-Makhzumi, narrated to me. My father said: Abu Hazim al-Madini who speaks regarding asceticism is this one; his name is Salamah bin Dinar.
5286 - My father narrated to me, saying: Musa bin Dawud narrated to us, saying: Ibn Lahi'ah narrated to us from Khalid bin Abi Imran from Hanash al-San'ani from Ibn Abbas, who said: The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was born on a Monday, became a Prophet on a Monday, left Mecca as an immigrant to Medina on a Monday, arrived in Medina on a Monday, raised the [Black] Stone on a Monday, and passed away on a Monday, may Allah bless him and grant him peace.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5287 - My father narrated to me, saying: Affan narrated to us, saying: Hammad bin Salamah narrated to us, saying: Ammar bin Abi Ammar informed us from Ibn Abbas, who said: The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, stayed in Mecca for fifteen years: seven years seeing the light and hearing the voice, and eight years receiving revelation. And he stayed in Medina for ten years.
5288 - I read to my father: He said: Waki' narrated to us, saying: Sufyan narrated to us from Abd al-Karim al-Jazari from a man from Ibn Umar, who said: The apostate is asked to repent three times.
5289 - And I read to Ibn Mahdi, who said: Sufyan said in the hadith of the apostate: He is Abu Umayyah; Sufyan narrated it to me.
5290 - My father said: We copied it from the book of Al-Ashja'i—meaning from what the son of Al-Ashja'i gave them from his father's books—from Sufyan from Abd al-Karim al-Basri. My father said: He is Abu Umayyah with the like of this hadith.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5291 - I read to my father: Abu Nu'aym said: Sufyan narrated to us from Ibrahim bin Uqbah from Sa'id bin al-Musayyib, who said: 'If it enters his stomach, it creates prohibition [of marriage due to suckling], and I do not say as Ibn Abbas said.'
5292 - I read to my father: Ibn Mahdi said: I asked Sufyan about the hadith of Ibrahim—meaning Ibn Uqbah—regarding suckling—meaning this one. He said: 'I did not hear it; Ma'mar narrated it to us from him.'
5293 - I heard my father say: And Mu'adh bin Mu'adh erred in the hadith of Ikrimah from Damdam bin Jaws al-Hazzani—so said Mu'adh. My father said: Mu'adh erred; he is Al-Haffani.
5294 - My father narrated to me, saying: Isma'il bin Ibrahim narrated to us, saying: Ayyub narrated to us from Muhammad, who said: I met Abu Ghallab Yunus bin Jubair al-Bahili, and he was reliable (thabt).
5295 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi narrated to us, saying: I heard Sufyan say: Regarding a man who marries a Magian woman or a woman in her waiting period (Iddah): 'From Jabir from Hammad.' And I heard him say: Regarding what was narrated about the clarification (Al-Muwaddihah): 'From Jabir from Hammad.'
5296 - And I heard him say: 'The Jewish woman and the slave girl are not fortified (Muhsanah) [in terms of adultery punishment]: From Jabir from Hammad.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5297 - He said: Sufyan said in the hadith of the apostate: Abd al-Karim said: He is Ibn Umayyah; Sufyan narrated it to me.
5298 - My father narrated to me, saying: Muhammad bin Ja'far narrated to us, saying: Shu'bah narrated to us from Furat, who said: I heard Abu Hazim say: I sat with Abu Hurairah for five years.
5299 - My father narrated to me, saying: Al-Fadl bin Dukayn narrated to us, saying: Yunus—meaning Ibn Abi Ishaq—narrated to us from Hilal bin Khabbab Abu al-Ala.
5300 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu al-Mughirah narrated to us: I said to Abu Bakr—meaning Ibn Abi Maryam—'You narrate to us from Habib bin Ubaid, referring back to Auf bin Malik al-Ashja'i?' He said: I heard Habib say: 'I met eighty-something men from the Companions.' And I asked Abu Bakr, saying: 'Humaid bin Uqbah, I see him as old, and you narrate from him from Abu al-Darda?' He said: 'He narrated to me that everything he narrated to me from Abu al-Darda, he heard it from Abu al-Darda.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5301 - My father narrated to me, saying: Sufyan narrated to us from Al-Zuhri, who heard it from Anas: 'The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, arrived—meaning in Medina—when I was ten years old, and he died when I was twenty. And there were mothers urging me to serve him.' And Sufyan said once: 'Al-Zuhri said: Anas informed us.'
5302 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Razzaq narrated to us, saying: Abdullah bin Umar narrated to us from Nafi', who said: Umar bin Abd al-Aziz asked me about something he named. I said: 'I asked Al-Mughirah bin Hakim about it.' Umar bin Abd al-Aziz said: 'He is just and trustworthy.'
5303 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Razzaq narrated to us, saying: Ibn Jurayj informed us, saying: The name of the sword of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was Dhu al-Fiqar, and the name of his armor was Dhat al-Fudul—or Al-Fudul; Abd al-Razzaq doubted. Ibn Jurayj said: And his sword was adorned with silver. Ibn Jurayj said: Muhammad bin Murrah informed me of that.
5304 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Razzaq narrated to us, saying: Ibn Jurayj narrated to us, saying: I was informed from Anas bin Malik that he said: 'The pommel of the sword of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was of silver.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5305 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Razzaq narrated to us, saying: Ibn Jurayj informed me, saying: Ja'far bin Muhammad informed me from his father that the name of the sword of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was Dhu al-Fiqar.
5306 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Razzaq narrated to us, saying: Ibn Jurayj narrated to us, saying: Ja'far bin Muhammad informed me, saying: I saw the sword of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace; its hilt was of silver and its chape was of silver, and between that were rings of silver. He said: 'It is with these people now'—meaning the family of Al-Abbas.
5307 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ibrahim bin Ishaq narrated to us, saying: Abdullah bin al-Mubarak narrated to us, saying: Al-Hakam bin Hisham narrated to me—and I asked about him in Mecca, and they said: 'You are asking about a man whose primary concern is himself.'
5308 - He said: Al-Fudayl bin Ghazwan narrated to me, saying: Al-Muwajjah al-Khurasani narrated to me while we were circumambulating the House. He said: 'We fought the Turks.'
5309 - My father narrated to me, saying: Hushaym narrated to us, saying: Some of our companions informed us that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, selected on the Day of Badr the sword of Munabbih bin al-Hajjaj, which was called Dhu al-Fiqar.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5310 - I heard my father say: Izrah bin Dinar al-A'war; Asim al-Ahwal, Qatada, Khalid al-Hadhdha', Al-Taymi, Dawud bin Abi Hind, and Abu Hashim al-Rummani narrated from him. And Waqa' bin Iyas said: 'I saw Izrah frequenting Sa'id bin Jubayr with a Tafsir (exegesis) that he was correcting in an inkwell.'
5311 - My father said: Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi narrated it to us from Abd al-Wahid bin Ziyad from Waqa', who said: I saw Izrah. My father said: And Izrah bin Tamim, Qatada narrated from him from Abu Hurairah. I do not know anyone other than Qatada who narrated from him. Abdullah said: And it is the old one, and I did not hear it from the hadith of Qatada except from Hisham; his son Mu'adh bin Hisham narrated it.
5312 - I heard my father say: Shaiban al-Nahwi was mentioned in the presence of Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi. Abd al-Rahman said: 'This is Bishr bin al-Mufaddal, ask him about him.'
5313 - My father said: Bishr and Ibn Mahdi narrated from him. He mentioned Shaiban and praised him.
5314 - My father narrated to me, saying: I said to Isma'il bin Ulayyah: 'When did you sit with Sa'id or hear from Sa'id? Before the plague and after it?' He said: 'Yes.' I said: 'And before the defeat?' He said: 'Yes.' I said: 'And after the defeat?' Then he said: 'I do not know, I do not know, except that I used to come to him, I and companions of mine, and he would dictate to us or to me. And he did not do that with everyone.' My father said: The plague was fourteen years before the defeat, so Ibn Ulayyah's hearing from Sa'id is old. My father said: The defeat was in the year one hundred and forty-five.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5315 - My father narrated to me, saying: I said to Al-Sahmi: 'When did you sit with Sa'id bin Abi Arubah?' He said: 'Two or three years before the defeat.' My father said: The defeat was in the year one hundred and forty-five, and this is the defeat of Ibrahim bin Abdullah bin al-Hasan who had rebelled against Abu Ja'far.
5316 - My father narrated to me, saying: A sheikh from Tayy called Isam bin Amr Abu Humaid narrated to us, saying: Yahya bin al-Walid al-Sanbusi narrated to us. Abdullah said: His kunya is Abu al-Za'ra al-Ta'i, from Mahall bin Khalifah from Banu Tha'l, then one of Banu Adi.
5317 - I asked my father about Mus'ab bin Salam. He said: The hadiths of Yusuf bin Suhaib got mixed up for him; he made them from Al-Zibriqan al-Sarraj. And Ibn Abi Shaybah came once and began discussing with him hadiths from Shu'bah which were the hadiths of Al-Hasan bin Umarah; they also got mixed up for him.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5318 - I asked my father about Ali bin Ghurab al-Muharibi. He said: I have no news of him. I heard one session from him. He used to practice Tadlis (concealment). I only consider him to have been truthful.
5319 - I asked my father about Al-Nadr bin Isma'il Abu al-Mughirah the storyteller. He said: He did not memorize the chain of narration. Isma'il narrated a rejected (Munkar) hadith from him from Qais: 'I saw Abu Bakr holding his tongue.' We narrate from him, but this is actually the hadith of Zaid bin Aslam.
5320 - I asked my father about a sheikh from the people of Medina, Dawud bin Ata. He said: I have seen him; his hadith is nothing.
5321 - I asked my father about a sheikh from the people of Medina called Abd al-Aziz bin Imran. He said: I did not write anything from him.
5322 - I asked my father about Muhammad bin Ziyad, called Al-Maimuni, who used to narrate from Maimun bin Mihran. He said: A malicious, one-eyed liar who fabricates hadith.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5323 - I asked my father about Abu Sayfi who narrates from Mujahid. He said: We wrote from him from Mujahid and from Sa'id al-Maqburi. Then he came to us later and narrated to us from Al-Hakam bin Utaybah, and he is nothing.
5324 - I asked my father about a woman called Umm Umar bint Hassan who narrates from her father and her husband. He said: I have narrated to you about her; I see no harm in her. And he said in another place: She was a truthful old woman.
5325 - I asked my father about Ziyad bin Abdullah al-Bakka'i. He said: There is no harm in him; his hadith is the hadith of truthful people.
5326 - I asked my father about Abd al-Aziz bin Aban. He said: I did not include anything from him in the Musnad. I have excluded him for reasons other than the hadith itself since he narrated the hadith of the appointed times (Mawaqit), the hadith of Sufyan from Alqamah bin Marthad; I abandoned him.
5327 - I read to my father: Ziyad bin Abdullah al-Bakka'i said: Hakim bin Jubair narrated to us from Al-Sha'bi, who said: Ali said: 'The best of people after the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, are Abu Bakr and Umar, and if I wished, I would name the third.' And I wrote from Yahya bin Sa'id from Sharik in a manner other than [formal] hadith narration—meaning discussion (Mudhakara).

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5328 - I asked my father about Muhammad bin al-Hasan bin Abi Yazid al-Hamdani. He said: I do not consider him worth anything. He used to stay near the cemetery of Al-Khayzuran. He began narrating to us hadiths, bringing them just as Ibn Abi Za'idah and Abu Mu'awiyah narrate them.
5329 - I asked my father about Muhammad bin al-Hasan, the companion of Abu Hanifa, the proponent of opinion (Sahib al-Ra'y). He said: I do not narrate anything from him.
5330 - I asked my father about Muhammad bin al-Hasan al-Wasiti, who is called Al-Muzani. He said: There is no harm in him; a large sheikh. Abdullah bin Khazim had beaten him. I have narrated to you from him; I wrote from him strange hadiths (Ghara'ib) from Isma'il—meaning Ibn Abi Khalid. I wrote from him in the first year I went down to Basra, and I did not meet him in the second year; he had died long ago.
5331 - I asked my father about Al-Hakam bin Abdullah Abu Muti' al-Balkhi. He said: It is not proper to narrate from him. They related about him that he used to say: Paradise and Hell are created but will perish. This is the speech of Jahm; nothing is narrated from him.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5332 - I asked my father about Asad bin Amr. He said: He was truthful (Saduq), and Abu Yusuf was truthful, but it is not proper to narrate anything from the companions of Abu Hanifa.
5333 - I asked my father about Abu Hafs al-Abdi. He said: We abandoned his hadith and tore it up.
5334 - I asked my father about Hisham bin Lahiq. He said: He used to narrate hadiths from Asim; there was no harm in him. He raised (attributed to the Prophet) hadiths from Asim that were not raised, attributing them back to Salman. Shababah denied a hadith Hisham narrated to us from Nu'aym bin Hakim from Abu Maryam from Ali regarding Hajj: 'Two prostrations.' Shababah said: 'I indeed heard the hadith of this sheikh from him,' and he denied—meaning the hadith of Nu'aym.
5335 - I asked my father about Khalid bin al-Qasim al-Mada'ini. He said: I do not narrate anything from him.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5336 - I asked my father about Abu Ayyub al-Tammar who narrates from Thabit al-Bunani and Yunus. He said: He is nothing; we tore up his hadith. He used to be prompted with hadiths.
5337 - I asked my father about Sa'id bin Zakariya al-Mada'ini who narrates from Zam'ah. He said: There is no harm in him, God willing. We wrote the hadiths of Zam'ah from him, then I presented them later to Abu Dawud al-Tayalisi, and he narrated all of them to me except for a small amount—four hadiths or five, or less or more.
5338 - I asked my father about Nasr bin Bab. He said: People only disapproved of him when he narrated from Ibrahim al-Sa'igh, and there was no harm in him. I said to him: Abu Khaithamah said Nasr bin Bab is a liar. He said: I do not dare to say this; I ask Allah for forgiveness.
5339 - I asked my father about Ali bin Yazid al-Sada'i. He said: There was no harm in him.
5340 - I asked my father about Al-Khaffaf. He said: As for me, I narrate from him.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5341 - My father said: The hearing of Yazid bin Harun from Sa'id bin Abi Arubah is authentic, except for three or four hadiths.
5342 - My father narrated to me, saying: I asked Ibn Ulayyah about Al-Jurayri. I said to him: 'O Abu Bishr, did Al-Jurayri become confused [due to old age]?' He said: 'No, the Sheikh grew old and became apprehensive.'
5343 - I asked my father: Which of the two is dearer to you regarding Sa'id: Al-Khaffaf or Asbat bin Muhammad? He said: Asbat is dearer to me because he heard in Kufa.
5344 - I said to my father: Which of the two is dearer to you: Al-Khaffaf or Abu Qatan regarding Sa'id? He said: Al-Khaffaf has an older hearing than Abu Qatan.
5345 - I asked my father about the hadith of Imran bin Husain that a group of people came to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and said: 'You have given us glad tidings, so give us [materially].' For Al-A'mash and Sufyan both say: From Jami' bin Shaddad from Safwan bin Muhriz from Imran bin Husain. And Yazid bin Harun narrated it from Al-Mas'udi from Jami' from Ibn Buraidah bin Husaib from his father. I said: Which of the two is correct? He said: The correct one is what Al-A'mash and Sufyan narrated. And the hearing of Yazid from Al-Mas'udi was at the end [of his life].
5346 - My father said: And Yahya bin Ma'in said: I did not hear it from Abu Mu'awiyah.
5347 - My father said: But Abu Mu'awiyah narrated it to us in Baghdad, and Yahya might have missed something.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5348 - I asked my father about the hadith of Rabi'ah from Yazid, the freedman of Al-Munba'ith, from Zaid bin Khalid al-Juhani: That a man asked the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, about the lost property (Luqata). He said: 'Know its drawstring (Wika'aha) and its container (Afasaha).' And some of them say 'Aqasaha' (with Qaf). I said: Which of the two is correct? He said: The correct one is 'Afasaha' with Fa'.
5349 - I asked my father about the hadith of Ishaq bin Yusuf al-Azraq from Sufyan from Mansur from Ibrahim from Al-Aswad from Aisha, who said: 'I never saw anyone hasten the Zuhr prayer more than the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace.' He said: The hadith is the hadith of Hakim bin Jubair; this is not from the hadith of Mansur. Al-Azraq narrated it to us from Sufyan from Hakim from Sa'id bin Jubair from Aisha; he erred in it for us. And once Al-Azraq said: From Sufyan from Hakim bin Jubair from Ibrahim from Al-Aswad from Aisha. And my father denied that this could be from the hadith of Mansur.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5350 - I asked my father about the hadith of Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi from Za'idah from Musa bin Abi Aisha from Ubaidullah bin Abdullah, who said: I entered upon Aisha and said: 'Tell me about the illness of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace.' So she described it until she reached: 'That the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, found some relief, so he went out supported between two men while Abu Bakr was leading the people in prayer. The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, prayed behind Abu Bakr sitting, and Abu Bakr was leading the people in prayer while he was standing praying.' My father said: Abd al-Rahman erred in this place, or it might be that Za'idah erred to Abd al-Rahman. My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Samad bin Abd al-Warith and Mu'awiyah bin Amr narrated to us, and they contradicted Abd al-Rahman. And the correct version is what Abd al-Samad and Mu'awiyah said.
5351 - I heard my father say regarding the hadith of Aisha: 'The husband of the woman with Istihadah (irregular bleeding) may have intercourse with her.' Waki' narrated it from Sufyan from Ghaylan from Abd al-Malik bin Maysarah from Al-Sha'bi from Qumayr from Aisha—meaning this hadith. And I saw it in the book of Al-Ashja'i from Sufyan from Ghilin—this is how it was written. And Ghundar narrated it from Shu'bah from Abd al-Malik bin Maysarah from Al-Sha'bi—this hadith—and Al-Sha'bi said from his own opinion: 'The husband of the woman with Istihadah should not have intercourse with her.' And Hajjaj said from Shu'bah as Waki' said from Sufyan, raising it to Aisha. Hajjaj contradicted Ghundar. My father said: It reached me from Ibn Mahdi that he said: 'I found it in the book of Husayn bin Arabi as Hajjaj said from Shu'bah and as Waki' said from Sufyan.'
5352 - My father narrated to me, saying: Muhammad bin Uthman bin Safwan bin Safwan bin Umayyah al-Jumahi narrated to us, saying: Hisham bin Urwah narrated to us from his father from Aisha from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, who said: 'Charity (Sadaqah) never mixes with wealth but it destroys it.'
