My father said: Its interpretation is that a man takes charity—which is Zakat—while he is wealthy or rich; it is only for the poor.
5353 - I heard my father mention Bishr bin al-Sari, and he said: How precise he was in hadith! An amazing precision.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5354 - My father said: I spoke to Ayyub bin al-Najjar Abu Isma'il al-Yamami about a hadith he heard from Yahya bin Abi Kathir. He said: 'We were in the time of Yahya.' My father said: I was amazed by his piety.
5355 - I said to my father: The hadith of Ja'far bin Barqan from Al-Zuhri from Sa'id al-Makhzumi: That Abu Hurairah informed him from Sa'id al-Makhzumi. He said: Sa'id—meaning Ibn al-Musayyib.
5356 - My father said: Ja'far bin Barqan indeed heard from Ikrimah more than one thing.
5357 - My father said: When Ja'far bin Barqan came to Kufa, people gathered around him. Sufyan—meaning Al-Thawri—came to him and sat by his side and began saying: 'What did Umar bin Abd al-Aziz write to you?' Asking him exclusively without the group.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5358 - My father said: I saw Ayyub bin al-Najjar with a rope—meaning a bucket—drawing water from Zamzam with it. Meaning he did not use the rope of these people.
5359 - My father narrated to me, saying: Makhlad bin Yazid al-Harrani informed us, saying: Al-Awza'i narrated to us from Abd al-Wahid bin Qais from Abu Hurairah, who said: 'The expiation for every quarrel (Liha') is two rak'ahs.' My father said: Its interpretation is that a man quarrels with another man, disputes with him, so he prays two rak'ahs as his expiation—meaning his atonement.
5360 - I said to my father: Hushaym from Abu Abd al-Rahman from Qatada? My father said: Abu Abd al-Rahman, I see him to be Sa'id bin Bashir.
5361 - I found in my father's book: Abu al-Mughirah narrated to us, saying: Safwan narrated to us that Utbah bin Abd al-Sulami's name was Nashbah, so the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, named him Utbah.
5362 - I found in my father's book: Abu al-Mughirah narrated to us, saying: Safwan narrated to us, saying: Abu al-Muthanna al-Awsabi narrated to me, saying: The name of Iblis was Nayil, but when Allah became angry with him, he was named Santayil.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5363 - I found in my father's book: He said: Abu al-Mughirah narrated to us, saying: Safwan narrated to us, saying: Hawshab bin Saif narrated to me, saying: I heard Nawf al-Bakali say: 'The name of the devil who tempts people in the markets is Mikhwad; he wades (yakhudu) into evil among the people.'
5364 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdullah bin Numair narrated to us, saying: Isma'il bin Abi Khalid narrated to us from Abu Hazim from Ibn Abbas, who said: 'While a man was walking, dragging his lower garment (in pride), Allah caused the earth to swallow him, so he will continue sinking into it until the Day of Resurrection.' I heard my father say: Abu Hazim is the freedman of Ibn Abbas. Yazid bin Harun said: His name is Nabtal.
5365 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ibn Numair narrated to us, saying: Isma'il bin Abi Khalid narrated to us from Imran from Amir: He was asked about four people who testified that so-and-so is not the son of so-and-so, and four others testified that he is the son of so-and-so. He said: 'I avert the punishment from these because they are four, and I believe the other four.' I heard my father say: Ibn Numair said: 'I sought him out, and he was alive'—meaning this Imran—'but I did not'—meaning hear from him—'and he was in Juhaynah or Kindah.'
5366 - My father narrated to me, saying: Waki' narrated to us, saying: Sa'id bin Ubaid Abu al-Hudhail narrated to us from Ali bin Rabi'ah Abu al-Mughirah.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5367 - My father narrated to me, saying: Waki' narrated to us, saying: Ziyad bin Abi Muslim narrated to me; a sheikh who was reliable (thabt)—thus said Waki'. My father said: He is called Abu Umar al-Qurra'.
5368 - I heard my father say: Abu Hani, from whom Ibn Abi Za'idah narrated to us—Abu al-Nadr and Waki' narrated from him to us—his name is Umar bin Bashir.
5369 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ali bin Thabit narrated to us, saying: Sa'id bin Abi Arubah said to me: 'I used to go with Qatada to Al-Hasan and hold his donkey, so he would come out and narrate to me, and I would memorize from him.'
5370 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yazid—meaning Ibn Harun—narrated to us, saying: Isma'il bin Abi Khalid narrated to us from Qais bin Abi Hazim from Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah, who said: 'No one asked the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, about the Dajjal more than I asked him. He said to me: O my son, what distresses you about him?'
5371 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Abd al-Samad al-Ammi narrated to us from Salam bin Miskin, who said: Al-Hasan said: 'O my son...'
5372 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ali bin Thabit narrated to us, saying: Sa'id bin Abi Arubah said: Qatada would perhaps narrate a hadith to me, then recite a line or two of poetry after it.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5373 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ali bin Thabit narrated to us, saying: Sa'id bin Salih narrated to me, saying: I saw Abu Wa'il listening to wailing and weeping. And I heard him saying to a black slave girl of his: 'O Barakah, peace be upon you.'
5374 - And I heard my father say: Ata bin al-Sa'ib is a righteous man.
5375 - My father narrated to me, saying: Waki' narrated to us, saying: I heard Al-A'mash in the year one hundred and forty-five, and the news of Muhammad—meaning Ibn Abdullah bin al-Hasan—came to us in Medina.
5376 - Waki' said: And Hisham bin Urwah was with us. Al-A'mash died in the year one hundred and forty-eight, and we went out to Basra in that year. And Isma'il bin Abi Khalid died shortly before him.
5377 - I heard my father say: Abdullah bin Numair said: 'Everything I narrated to you, Al-A'mash informed us of it'—meaning the hadiths of Al-A'mash.
5378 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Razzaq narrated to us, saying: Sufyan narrated to us from Al-A'mash from Abu Mudrik from Abu Zur'ah.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5379 - My father said: And Waki' narrated to us, saying: Al-A'mash narrated to us from Ali bin Mudrik al-Nakha'i and Abu Zur'ah.
5380 - My father said: And Isa bin Yunus said from Hamzah al-Zayyat from Al-A'mash from Ali bin Mudrik al-Nakha'i from Abu Zur'ah.
5381 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Mu'awiyah narrated to us, saying: Al-A'mash narrated to us from Abu Mudrik from Abd al-Rahman bin Yazid.
5382 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ya'la narrated to us, saying: Al-A'mash narrated to us from Abu Mudrik—and he is Ibn Mudrik—from Abd al-Rahman bin Yazid, who said: Abdullah said: 'Three things are incumbent upon Allah to do...'
5383 - I heard my father say: Yahya bin Abd al-Malik bin Abi Ghaniyyah is trustworthy. He and his father are close in hadith. He is a righteous man with a good appearance.
5384 - I asked my father about the hadith of Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi: He said: Za'idah narrated to us from Musa bin Abi Aisha from Ubaidullah bin Abdullah, who said: I entered upon Aisha and said: 'Will you not tell me about the illness of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace?' She said: 'Yes. The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, became heavy. He said: "Have the people prayed?" We said: "No, they are waiting for you."' Then she mentioned the hadith at length. 'Then the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, found some relief, so he went out between two men, one of whom was Al-Abbas, for the Zuhr prayer. When Abu Bakr saw him, he went to step back, but he signaled to him not to step back. He ordered them, so they sat him by his side. Abu Bakr began to pray standing, and the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and the people were praying with the prayer of Abu Bakr.' I heard my father say: Abd al-Rahman erred in this place, or it might be that Za'idah erred to Abd al-Rahman. Abd al-Samad bin Abd al-Warith and Mu'awiyah bin Amr narrated it and contradicted Abd al-Rahman. And the correct version is what Abd al-Samad and Mu'awiyah said.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5385 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Samad and Mu'awiyah bin Amr informed us, saying: Za'idah narrated to us, saying: Musa bin Abi Aisha narrated to us from Ubaidullah bin Abdullah, who said: I entered upon Aisha and said: 'Will you not tell me about the illness of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace?' She said: 'Yes. The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, became heavy...' and he mentioned the hadith. And he said: 'So the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, signaled to him not to step back and said to them: "Sit me by his side." So they sat him by his side.' She said: 'So Abu Bakr began to pray standing with the prayer of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and the people were praying with the prayer of Abu Bakr, may Allah have mercy on him, while the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was sitting.'
5386 - I found in my father's book: Yazid bin Abd Rabbih al-Jarjasi narrated to us, saying: Baqiyyah bin al-Walid bin al-Sa'id bin Jarir al-Maytami narrated to us.
5387 - I found in my father's book: Yazid bin Abd Rabbih narrated to us, saying: Uthman bin Sa'id—meaning Ibn Kathir bin Dinar—narrated to us, saying: Hariz narrated to us from Sulaym bin Amir, who said: Mu'awiyah said: 'Even if Ka'b had knowledge like the panic grass (Thumam)...'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5388 - My father said: The children of Abd al-Rahman bin Awf, the eldest of them is Ibn Abd al-Rahman, then Humaid, then Abu Salamah.
5389 - Abdullah bin Ahmad bin Hanbal informed us by license, saying: My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi narrated to us from Malik bin Anas, who said: A man asked Nafi': 'Where was the walking of Ibn Umar on the evening of Arafah from him on the morning of Jam' (Muzdalifah)?' I saw his face change, and he said: 'I did not have a scale with me.'
5390 - I asked my father about the hadith of Zaid bin Abi Unaisah from Abu Hazim from Abu Umamah, who said: 'A man was brought to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, who had committed adultery. He asked him, and he confessed.' I said to my father: 'Who is this Abu Umamah?' He said: 'He is Abu Umamah bin Sahl bin Hunaif; he is not Abu Umamah the Companion of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace.'
5391 - I asked my father, I said: 'A sheikh from whom Abu Usama narrated, called Isa bin Sinan, narrating from Umar bin Abd al-Majid?' He said: 'He is Isa bin Sinan Abu Sinan al-Qasmali; Hammad bin Salamah narrated from him.'
5392 - My father said: Some people deny that Muhammad bin Sirin heard anything from Masruq.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5393 - I heard my father say: Muhammad bin Thabit is the brother of Izrah bin Thabit, and his grandfather is Amr bin Akhtab Abu Zaid, the Companion of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace.
5394 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Samad narrated to us, saying: Hammad—meaning Ibn Salamah—narrated to us, saying: Ali bin Zaid narrated to us from Sa'id bin al-Musayyib, who said: 'Jesus was raised up when he was thirty-three years old, and Mu'adh died when he was thirty-three years old.'
5395 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Ahmad al-Zubairi narrated to us, saying: Ali bin Salih narrated to us from Uthman bin al-Mughirah from Malik bin Juwayn from Ali.
5396 - And my father narrated to me, saying: Aswad bin Amir narrated to us, saying: Sharik narrated to us from Uthman from Malik bin al-Jawn—he is the maternal uncle of Salamah bin Kuhail, meaning Malik bin Jawn—who said: I was with Ali in the courtyard (Al-Rahbah), and a man asked him about usury and theft being among the major sins. He said: 'The major sins are associating partners with Allah, killing a soul, disobedience to parents, accusing a chaste woman of adultery, fleeing from the battlefield, and returning to Bedouin life after migration (Al-Ta'arrub ba'd al-Hijrah).'
5397 - I heard my father say: Abu Usama said: 'I wrote one hundred thousand hadiths with my own hand.'
5398 - I heard Shuja' bin Makhlad say: Ibn Idris narrated to us from Husayn from Maysarah Abu Jamilah. So I asked my father, and he said: 'This is not Maysarah, the companion of Zadhan; this is another man whose kunya is Abu Jamilah.'
5399 - I heard my father say: Zakariya bin Siyah, from whom Abu Usama narrated, his kunya is Abu Yahya.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5400 - Muhammad bin Ja'far al-Warkani narrated to me, saying: Hammad al-Abah informed us from Thabit from Anas, who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: 'The example of my Ummah is the example of rain; it is not known whether its beginning is better or its end.' And Muhammad died in the year two hundred and twenty-eight in Ramadan, and my father attended his funeral. I asked my father about this hadith, and he said: 'It is a mistake. This hadith is only narrated from Al-Hasan.'
5401 - My father narrated to me, saying: Hasan bin Musa al-Ashyab narrated to us, saying: Hammad bin Yahya narrated to us, saying: Thabit narrated to us from Anas bin Malik from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, that he said: 'The example of my Ummah is the example of rain; it is not known whether its beginning is better or its end.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5402 - My father narrated to me, saying: Hasan bin Musa narrated it to us, saying: Hammad bin Salamah narrated to us from Thabit, Humaid, and Yunus from Al-Hasan from the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, who said: 'The example of my Ummah...' and he mentioned it.
5403 - My father narrated to me, saying: Rawh narrated to us, saying: Sa'id and Abd al-Wahhab narrated to us, saying: Sa'id narrated to us from Qatada from Abu al-Tufayl, who said: Mu'awiyah did not pass by a corner of the corners of the House without touching it. Ibn Abbas said: 'The Prophet of Allah only used to touch these two corners.' My father said: Abd al-Wahhab said in his hadith: 'The Black Stone and the Yemeni Corner.' Mu'awiyah said: 'There is nothing of its corners that is abandoned.'
5404 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya bin Sa'id narrated to us from Shu'bah, who said: Qatada narrated to me from Abu al-Tufayl, who said: Ibn Abbas and Mu'awiyah performed Hajj. Ibn Abbas began touching all the corners. Mu'awiyah said: 'The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, only touched these two Yemeni corners.' Ibn Abbas said: 'There is nothing of its corners that is abandoned.'
5405 - My father narrated to me, saying: Hajjaj narrated to us, saying: Shu'bah and Muhammad bin Ja'far narrated to me, saying: Shu'bah narrated to us, saying: I heard Qatada narrating. Hajjaj said: He said: I heard Abu al-Tufayl say: Mu'awiyah and Ibn Abbas arrived, so Ibn Abbas circumambulated... and he mentioned the like of it.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5406 - And Hajjaj said: Shu'bah said: 'People contradict me regarding this hadith. They say Mu'awiyah is the one who said: "There is nothing of the House that is abandoned." But I memorized it from Qatada like this.'
5407 - My father narrated to me, saying: Hasan bin Musa narrated to us, saying: Abu Khaithamah—meaning Zuhair—narrated to us from Abdullah bin Uthman bin Khuthaym from Abu al-Tufayl, who said: I saw Mu'awiyah circumambulating the House with Abdullah bin Abbas to his left, and I was following them at their backs hearing their conversation. Mu'awiyah began touching the two corners of the Stone (al-Hajar) [and the Yemeni corner?]. Abdullah bin Abbas said to him: 'The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, did not touch these two corners.' Mu'awiyah said: 'Leave me be, O Ibn Abbas, for there is nothing of it that is abandoned.' So Ibn Abbas began not leaving him alone; whenever he placed his hand on something of the two corners, he said that to him.
5408 - I asked my father: What is kissed of the House? He said: 'The Black Stone.' I said: 'The Yemeni?' He said: 'No, only the Black Stone is kissed.'
5409 - My father said: Umar bin Ata bin Waraz is not strong in hadith. And Umar bin Ata who is called Ibn Abi al-Khuwar—meaning another man—narrated from Ikrimah from Ibn Abbas.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5410 - My father said: Musa bin Ali was a governor over Egypt; Abu Ja'far appointed him, and he was a righteous man.
5411 - My father said: Wabarah is Abu Khuzaimah.
5412 - My father said: Isma'il bin Ibrahim Abu Bishr—and he is Ibn Ulayyah—is a freedman of Banu Asad.
5413 - My father said: Shu'bah used to honor Yahya bin Sa'id and used to say: 'Were it not for him, I would not have narrated to them.'
5414 - My father narrated to me, saying: Affan narrated to us, saying: Khalid bin al-Harith Abu Uthman narrated to me.
5415 - Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaybah narrated to us, saying: Qabisah narrated to us, saying: Sufyan informed us from Imran bin Muslim from Suwaid bin Alqamah, who said: I heard Umar say: 'If I were able to call the Adhan with the Caliphate, I would have done so.' I narrated this hadith to my father. He said: 'This is not from the hadith of Imran bin Muslim. It is only from the hadith of Isma'il or Bayan from Qais; Qabisah imagined it.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5416 - I said to my father: Muhammad bin Abi Bakr al-Muqaddami narrated to us, saying: Ayyub bin Waqid narrated to us from Harun bin Antarah. My father said: Ayyub bin Waqid is weak in hadith.
5417 - Abdullah bin Umar Abu Abd al-Rahman narrated to me, saying: Mu'awiyah bin Hisham narrated to us, saying: Sufyan and Furat al-Qazzaz narrated to us from Sa'id bin Jubayr from Ibn Abbas, who said: 'When the heat becomes intense, cool off with the Zuhr prayer, for the intensity of the heat is from the exhaling of Hell.'
5418 - I asked my father [about it]. He said: 'This is nothing; this is baseless (Batil). He denied it from the hadith of Mu'awiyah bin Hisham from Sufyan.'
5419 - I presented to my father hadiths I heard from Isma'il bin Abdullah bin Zurarah al-Sukkari al-Raqqi from a sheikh called Abd al-Aziz bin Abd al-Rahman al-Qurashi al-Balisi who used to live in Balis. Among them: from Khasif from Abu Salih from Asma bint Yazid al-Ansariyyah from Khuzaimah bin Thabit al-Ansari, who said: 'I was standing under the neck of the she-camel of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and it was chewing its cud over me, and its saliva was dripping on me...' then he mentioned the hadith. And in it: 'There is no bequest for an heir, the child belongs to the bed, the borrowed item is to be returned, the gift of milk/fruit (Minhah) is to be returned, the debt is to be paid, and the guarantor is responsible—and he is the Kafil.' And he also has hadiths other than this with different chains of narration. My father said: 'Abd al-Aziz—and he is the one who narrates from Khasif—strike out his hadiths; they are lies,' or he said: 'Fabricated,' or as my father said. So I struck out the hadiths of Abd al-Aziz bin Abd al-Rahman.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5420 - And Luwayn narrated to us from him after a long time, saying: Abd al-Aziz bin Abd al-Rahman al-Balisi narrated to us; he used to be in Balis.
5421 - My father narrated to me, saying: Muhammad bin Ja'far narrated to us, saying: Shu'bah narrated to us from Qatada, who said: It reached me that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, sold a free man for a debt he owed. I said to Qatada: 'Who narrated to you?' He said: 'A youth who used to stick to Al-Zuhri narrated it to me.'
5422 - I heard my father say: Yazid bin Hurmuz is Yazid al-Farisi, and Abdullah bin Yazid whom Malik narrates from is his son.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5423 - My father narrated to me, saying: Waki' narrated to us, saying: Abd al-Aziz bin Abdullah bin Abi Salamah al-Majishon narrated to us from Abu Sakhr—a man who used to sell cloaks (aba')—from Kaysan Abu Sa'id al-Maqburi, who said: I was a Mukatab (slave with a contract for freedom), so I came to Umar bin al-Khattab with the Zakat of my wealth, two hundred dirhams. He said to me: 'Have you become free?' I said: 'Yes.' He said: 'Go and distribute it yourself.' My father said: This Abu Sakhr, I think he is Humaid bin Ziyad al-Madini; Hatim and Ibn Wahb narrated from him. Abu Abd al-Rahman said: Hatim errs in his name; he says 'Humaid bin Sakhr,' but he is actually Humaid bin Ziyad Abu Sakhr.
5424 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Abu Bakr Yunus bin Bukair narrated to us, saying: Muhammad bin Ishaq bin Yasar al-Qurashi informed us from Makhul, who said: 'I toured all the lands (Al-Amsar) seeking knowledge, and I did not meet a man more knowledgeable than Sa'id bin al-Musayyib.'
5425 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting—and I think I heard it from him or read it to him—he said: Abu Sa'id Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi said: I witnessed Malik; I read these hadiths to him. Then I said to him—meaning Malik: 'Is what I read to you or what was read to you exactly as I read and was read?' He said: 'Yes, so narrate them, for you have verified.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5426 - I heard my father say: Abdur-Rahman b. Mahdi said to me: "What I did not hear from Malik, I narrated to you [as such]. And what I read to Malik or was read to him, he affirmed it for me." My father said: So I read to him what Abdur-Rahman had read to Malik and what was read for him to Malik, and I heard the rest from Abdur-Rahman through hearing; he had heard them from Malik.
5427 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting, saying: I said to Rawh b. Ubadah: "When did you hear the Tafsir from Sa'id? Was it before the defeat?" He said: "Yes, by Allah."
5428 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting, from some Sheikhs he did not name, saying: Warqa' said to me: "I presented [the hadiths] to Abu Al-Zinad and to Ibn Abi Najih." And I heard Shu'bah say: "Simak b. Harb was an eloquent man; he used to adorn the hadith with his eloquence and speech."
5429 - And from this Sheikh, from Hammad b. Salamah, from Ali b. Zayd, who said: "Whenever I went out to Mecca, Al-Hasan would say to me: 'Ask Sa'id for me about such-and-such, and ask Sa'id for me about such-and-such,' meaning Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib."
5430 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya b. Sa'id Al-Qattan narrated to us from Abu Awanah from Abu Bishr from Mujahid that he disliked hunting birds.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5431 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya b. Sa'id narrated to us, saying: Shu'bah used to weaken the hadith of Abu Bishr from Mujahid, and he said: "The hadith of the birds is the hadith of Al-Minhal."
5432 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: I was informed regarding Abdullah b. Yahya b. Abi Kathir that his father died in the year one hundred and twenty-nine.
5433 - I heard my father say: Abdul-Wahid b. Sulaym, his hadith is rejected (Munkar) hadith; his hadiths are fabricated.
5434 - I heard my father say: Salm b. Salim, meaning Al-Balkhi, is not that [strong] in hadith. It is as if he weakened him.
5435 - I asked my father about the hadith of Muhammad b. Juhadah, who said: Abu Salih narrated to me from Ibn Abbas, who said: "The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) cursed the women who frequently visit graves." I said to my father: "Who is this Abu Salih?" My father said: "Abu Salih is Badham."
5436 - I heard my father say: These men whom Qatadah introduced between himself and Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib, from whom he narrated from Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib—among them are Dawud b. Abi Hind, Yazid Al-Rishk, Muhammad b. Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib, Dawud b. Abi Asim, and Isma'il b. Imran Al-Anazi. My father said: Isma'il b. Imran, Amir Al-Ahwal and Sa'id b. Yazid narrated from him—and he is not Abu Maslamah—and Asim b. Sa'id Al-Hudhali, Khalid Al-Bajali, and a man called Al-Qasim.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5437 - I asked my father about this Qasim, and he said: "I do not know him." And Muhammad b. Ubayd and Awn, my father does not know who he is.
5438 - My father narrated to me, saying: Bahz b. Asad narrated to us, saying: Hammam narrated to us, saying: Qatadah was asked about a man who accused his wife [of adultery] then declared himself a liar after they had engaged in Lian (mutual cursing). He said: Al-Hasan said: "The Book of Allah has separated them, so they shall never reunite."
5439 - He said: And Al-Nakha'i said: "He is flogged, and the child is attributed [to him]." He said: And Dawud narrated to us from Sa'id that he said: "He is flogged, and his wife is returned to him during the waiting period (Iddah), and he proposes to her after the waiting period among the suitors."
5440 - My father narrated to me, saying: Bahz narrated to us, saying: Hammam narrated to us, saying: Qatadah narrated to us from Dawud—Hammam said: I do not know who Dawud is—from Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib that he said regarding a man who broke the fast one day in Ramadan intentionally: "He fasts a month."

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5441 - My father narrated to me, saying: Bahz narrated to us, saying: Hammam narrated to us, saying: Qatadah said: Dawud b. Abi Asim narrated to me five hadiths from Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib which I did not hear from him—meaning from Sa'id—and this is one of them: That a woman borrowed a necklace and denied it, so it was found on her. She was raised to the Prophet (peace be upon him) and he cut off her hand.
5442 - He said: And he narrated to me that a man married a woman and she gave birth in four months. She was raised to the Prophet (peace be upon him), and he stoned her and made her son a slave to him.
5443 - And he narrated to me that Umar b. Al-Khattab divorced his wife, the mother of his son Asim b. Umar. The boy disputed with her [regarding custody], so they brought the dispute to Abu Bakr. He judged that her scent and her bed are better for him until he grows up; so when he grows up, he chooses for himself.
5444 - And he narrated to me that Duba'ah bint Al-Zubayr asked the Prophet (peace be upon him) for instructions regarding her Umrah, so he ordered her to make a condition.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5445 - He said: And he narrated to me from Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib that a man came to the Prophet (peace be upon him) and said: "I spent last night dragging silk [metaphor for intercourse] until I reached the time of Suhur, then I came to my family..." and he mentioned the hadith.
5446 - My father narrated to me, saying: Bahz, Yazid b. Harun, Abdus-Samad, and Waki' narrated to us, saying: Hammam narrated to us, saying: Qatadah narrated to us from Yazid Al-Rishk. Yazid said in his hadith: "Yazid Al-Rishk narrated to us." And Abdus-Samad said in his hadith: "Qatadah narrated to me from Yazid Al-Rishk, who said: I asked Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib about the earnings of the divider (Qassam), and he disliked it. I asked him again, saying: 'I work in it until my forehead sweats.' He said: So he did not grant me a concession." He said: And Al-Hasan used to dislike it. He said: And Ibn Sirin used to say: "If it is not evil, then I do not know what it is."
5447 - He said: And Sa'id b. Abi Al-Hasan used to say: "How strange for people who take wages for judgment."
5448 - My father narrated to me, saying: Bahz narrated to me, saying: Hammam narrated to us, saying: Qatadah informed us from Yazid Al-Rishk that he asked Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib about a man who left behind his wife and his parents. He said: "Zayd divided it from four shares."
5449 - My father narrated to me, saying: Affan narrated to us, saying: Hammam narrated to us, saying: Qatadah informed us from Yazid Al-Rishk that he asked Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib about a man who left behind his wife and his parents. He said: "Zayd divided it from four shares: a share for the wife, a share for the mother, and two shares for the father." Hammam said: "I do not know if I heard it from Yazid or not." Affan said: "Hammam memorized it for us from his book."

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5450 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdus-Samad narrated to us, saying: Hammam narrated to us, saying: Qatadah narrated to us from Dawud b. Abi Asim from Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib that Umar b. Al-Khattab said regarding a man who covered [had intercourse with] a slave girl [shared] between him and another man: "He is flogged one hundred lashes less one whip, and she is evaluated against him, along with her child, at the highest value."
5451 - My father narrated to me, saying: Affan narrated to us, saying: Mu'adh b. Hisham narrated to me, saying: My father narrated to us from Qatadah from Muhammad b. Sa'id, meaning Ibn Al-Musayyib, from Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib; and from Qatadah from Sulayman Al-Yashkuri that Tu'mah bint Jurayy asked permission from the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) while she was in Itikaf to go to a daughter of hers who was bleeding after childbirth, but he did not grant her permission.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5452 - My father narrated to me, saying: Mu'adh b. Hisham narrated to us, saying: My father narrated to me from Qatadah from Sa'id b. Yazid—my father said: he is not Abu Maslamah—from Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib that a man married a woman and she gave birth while with him at four months. The Prophet of Allah (peace be upon him) stoned her and made her child a slave to him, and he ordered him to take what he found of his belongings.
5453 - My father narrated to me, saying: Bahz narrated to us, saying: Hammam narrated to us from Qatadah, saying: Sa'id b. Yazid narrated to me from Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib that a man married a woman and she gave birth while with him in four months. So the Prophet (peace be upon him) established the Hadd punishment on her, made her child a slave to him, and whatever he recovered of her belongings belonged to him.
5454 - My father narrated to me, saying: Bahz narrated to us, saying: Hammam narrated to us, saying: Qatadah informed us that Muhammad b. Ubayd and Sa'id b. Yazid narrated to him—Hammam said: as far as I calculate—he said: We said to Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib: "Ata Al-Khurasani narrated to us from you regarding the one who falls upon his wife in Ramadan that the Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Free a slave'." He said: "Ata lied. The Prophet (peace be upon him) only said to him: 'Give charity, give charity,' three times." He said: "I do not find anything." He said: So the Prophet (peace be upon him) was brought a basket containing close to twenty Sa' [of dates]. He said: "Give this in charity."

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5455 - My father narrated to me, saying: Mu'adh b. Hisham narrated to us, saying: My father narrated to me from Qatadah, saying: Al-Qasim narrated to me from Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib, who said: "The Imam is a guarantor for the prayer of the people, whether he does well or badly, and whether he advances or delays."
5456 - My father narrated to me, saying: Affan narrated to us, saying: Hammam narrated to us, saying: Qatadah informed us: A man narrated to me that Sa'id... My father said: And in the copy it was "from Al-Qasim," but Affan did not memorize it. He said: "If you stay in a land for four [days], then pray four [rak'ahs]."
5457 - My father narrated to me, saying: Affan narrated to us, saying: Hammam narrated to us from Qatadah that Muhammad and Awn narrated to him that they said to Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib that Ata Al-Khurasani narrated to them from you regarding the one who falls upon his wife in Ramadan that the Prophet (peace be upon him) ordered him... and he mentioned the like of the hadith of Bahz from Hammam.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5458 - My father narrated to me, saying: Affan narrated to us, saying: Hammam narrated to us, saying: Qatadah narrated to us, saying: Isma'il b. Imran Al-Anazi narrated to me that his father married him off while he was small. When he grew up, he divorced his wife. So I asked Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib, and he said: "If you have counted the prayer [reached age of prayer] and fasted the month of Ramadan, then your divorce is valid."
5459 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdus-Samad b. Abdul-Warith narrated to us, saying: My father narrated to me from Amir Al-Ahwal from Isma'il b. Imran who said: My father married me to a female cousin of mine while I was a boy. I divorced her before I consummated the marriage with her. So I asked Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib, and he said: "Did you count the prayer and fast Ramadan?" I said: "Yes." He said: "Then your divorce is valid."
5460 - My father narrated to me, saying: Bahz narrated to us, saying: Hammam narrated to us, saying: Qatadah narrated to us, saying: I said to Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib: "If I do not catch the prayer with the Imam, how should I pray?" He said: "Pray four, for I do not see you on a journey (Rijl?)."
5461 - Qatadah said: And Al-Qasim narrated to me that Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib said: "If you stay in a land for four [days], then pray four [rak'ahs]."
5462 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdullah b. Bakr narrated to us, saying: Sa'id informed us from Qatadah from Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib. My father said: And Muhammad b. Bakr Al-Bursani said: Sa'id informed us from Qatadah, saying: Sa'id b. Yazid informed us from Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5463 - My father said: Al-Khaffaf narrated it to us, saying: Sa'id informed us from Qatadah from Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib that Umar b. Al-Khattab divorced his wife, the mother of Asim. Umar passed by her while Asim was in her lap, and he wanted to take him from her. They pulled him back and forth until the boy cried. They went up to Abu Bakr, and Abu Bakr said to Umar: "Her wiping, her scent, and her lap are better for him than you until the boy grows up and chooses."
5464 - My father narrated to me, saying: Mu'adh b. Hisham narrated to us, saying: My father narrated to me from Qatadah from Sa'id b. Yazid from Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib that a woman from Banu Makhzum borrowed jewelry from the tongue of a people [spokesperson/intermediary?] and denied it. So the Prophet (peace be upon him) ordered concerning her, and [her hand] was cut off.
5465 - My father narrated to me, saying: Mu'adh b. Hisham narrated to us, saying: My father narrated to me from Qatadah from Sa'id b. Yazid from Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib that the Prophet of Allah (peace be upon him) said to Duba'ah bint Al-Zubayr when she performed Umrah: "Stipulate that my place of release is where You hold me back, for indeed the Muslim is entitled to his condition."
5466 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdullah b. Bakr narrated to us, saying: Sa'id narrated to us from Qatadah and Matar from Sa'id b. Yazid from Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib that a woman gave birth at four months. So the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) decreed that her child was a slave to her husband and that whatever he recovered of her belongings was his, and he established the Hadd punishment on her.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5467 - My father narrated to me, saying: Bahz narrated to us, saying: Hammam narrated to us from Qatadah, saying: A man from Bajilah narrated to me that he asked Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib about the prayer over the dead, so he scolded me—or he said: he rebuked me. He said: When I turned away, he said: "As for Umar, he used to say: 'O Allah, this is Your slave; he has become free from the world and left it to its people, and has become in need of what is with You, and You have become free of need for him. We have come as intercessors for him, so forgive him.'" And if he was an evildoer, he said: "We have reached the evening."
5468 - My father narrated to me, saying: Bahz narrated to us, saying: Hammam narrated to us, saying: I heard Qatadah say: And a man narrated to me from Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib that he was invited to a wedding feast and accepted. Then he was invited the second day and accepted. Then he was invited the third day, so he threw pebbles at the messenger and did not accept, and he said: "People of reputation (Sum'ah) and showing off (Riya')."

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5469 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdur-Rahman b. Mahdi narrated to us, saying: Hammam narrated to us, saying: Qatadah said: A man narrated to me that Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib was invited, and he mentioned the like of it.
5470 - My father narrated to me, saying: Bahz, Abdus-Samad, and Affan narrated to us, saying: Hammam narrated to us, saying: Qatadah narrated to us, saying: And a man informed me from Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib from Zayd b. Thabit regarding a man who married a woman, and she died before he consummated the marriage with her, so he inherited from her; he disliked that he marry her mother. But if it was from a divorce, then there is no harm.
5471 - My father narrated to me, saying: Affan narrated to us, saying: Hammam b. Yahya narrated to us, saying: Qatadah informed us, saying: Asim b. Sa'id Al-Hudhali informed me from Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib that Zayd b. Thabit disliked that the daughter of a woman who died while with him [as a wife] before he consummated the marriage with her, be married.
5472 - My father narrated to me, saying: Muhammad b. Ja'far and Abdullah b. Bakr narrated to us, saying: Sa'id narrated to us from Qatadah from Isma'il b. Imran from Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib that he said: "If the boy has counted the prayer and fasted Ramadan, his divorce is valid."
5473 - My father narrated to me, saying: Waki' narrated to us, saying: Hammam narrated to us from Qatadah from Isma'il b. Imran Al-Anazi, who said: I saw on Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib a Taylasan (shawl) whose buttons were of brocade. I spoke to him about it, and he said: "Indeed, it is more lasting."

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5474 - My father narrated to me, saying: Muhammad b. Ja'far narrated to us, saying: Sa'id narrated to us from Qatadah from Isma'il b. Imran from Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib that he said: "If he counts the prayer and fasts Ramadan, his divorce is valid."
5475 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdur-Rahman b. Mahdi narrated to us, saying: Hammam narrated to us from Qatadah from Isma'il b. Imran, who said: I saw on Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib a Saj (garment) whose buttons were of brocade. He said: So I spoke to him about it, and he said: "We found it to be more lasting."
5476 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ali b. Ishaq narrated to us, saying: Abdullah, meaning Ibn Al-Mubarak, informed us, saying: Sa'id narrated to us from Qatadah from Sa'id b. Yazid from Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib who said: A slave girl gave birth, so the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "If not for what preceded of the oath, I and she would have had a matter [punishment]." Meaning the one who engaged in Lian during the time of the Prophet (peace be upon him).
5477 - My father narrated to me, saying: Waki' narrated to us, saying: Hammam narrated to us from Qatadah from Isma'il b. Imran Al-Anazi, who said: "I divorced while I was a boy who had not reached puberty. So I asked Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib, and he said: 'If you have counted the prayer and fasted Ramadan, your divorce is valid.'"

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5478 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Sa'id the client of Banu Hashim and Abdus-Samad narrated to us, saying: Hammam narrated to us from Qatadah from Al-Qasim, who said: Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib said: "If you stay in a land, pray four [rak'ahs]."
5479 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdus-Samad narrated to us, saying: Hammam narrated to us, saying: Qatadah narrated to us from Dawud that Sa'id said: "Whoever breaks the fast one day in Ramadan, upon him is the fasting of a month."
5480 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdus-Samad narrated to us, saying: Hammam narrated to us, saying: Qatadah narrated to us from Yazid Al-Rishk from Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib that Zayd b. Thabit divided [inheritance for] a wife and two parents from four shares.
5481 - My father narrated to me, saying: Affan narrated to us, saying: Hammam narrated to us, saying: Qatadah informed us that Dawud b. Abi Asim narrated to him from Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib that Duba'ah bint Al-Zubayr asked the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) for instructions regarding her Ihram, so he ordered her to make a condition.
5482 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdus-Samad narrated to us, saying: Hammam narrated to us, saying: Qatadah narrated to us from Khalid Al-Bajali: I asked Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib about the prayer over the dead, so he rebuked me. When I turned away, he called me and said: "As for Umar b. Al-Khattab, he used to say: 'O Allah, this slave of Yours has become free from the world and left it to its people, and has proceeded to You. He has become in need of what is with You, and You have become free of need for him. We have come as intercessors, so forgive him.'" And if he was an evildoer, he said: "We have come as intercessors, so forgive him."

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5483 - Muhammad b. Aban b. Imran Al-Wasiti narrated to me, saying: Aban b. Yazid Al-Attar narrated to me from Qatadah from Sa'id b. Yazid Al-Harithi from Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib that a woman gave birth at four months, so the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) assigned to the man whatever he recovered of his belongings.
5484 - My father narrated to me, saying: Sufyan narrated to us—I heard from him seventy-four years ago in Mecca; he came to us, he and Yahya b. Sa'id, to Ibn Hisham, meaning Yazid b. Khusayfah.
5485 - My father narrated to me, saying: Sufyan said: I do not memorize it except from Salim, meaning the hadith of Zabra [or Bad Omen?], the hadith of Al-Zuhri.
5486 - My father narrated to me, saying: Sufyan said: I memorized it, meaning from Al-Zuhri. He said: Abu Bakr b. Ubaydullah informed us, meaning: "When one of you eats..."
5487 - My father narrated to me, saying: Sufyan said: We memorized from Sa'id: "When the reciter says Amen." Then he said: We only memorize from Salim, meaning: "Bad luck is in three."

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5488 - My father narrated to me, saying: Sufyan said: I did not hear it. Then he said: From Salim: "There is no fasting for the one who does not resolve [to fast]..." meaning Al-Zuhri.
5489 - Muhammad b. Bashshar Bundar narrated to me, saying: Muhammad b. Abi Adi narrated to us from Shu'bah from Mansur from Sadus from Al-Bara' b. Qays from Hudhayfah, who said: "I do not care if I touched it or my ear."
5490 - I asked my father about this hadith, and he said: Shu'bah erred in it regarding Mansur. It is only Mansur from Iyad b. Laqit Al-Sadusi; he made a mistake and said "Sadus."
5491 - I heard my father being asked about Isma'il b. Abi Khalid, so he said: He is the highest of the companions of Al-Sha'bi, and he narrates from ten of the companions of Al-Sha'bi from Al-Sha'bi, like Bayan, Firas, and others.
5492 - My father narrated to me, saying: Muhammad b. Ja'far narrated to us, saying: Shu'bah narrated to us from Isma'il, meaning Ibn Abi Khalid, from Al-Mutarrif from Al-Sha'bi that Abdul-Malik b. Marwan said to a man from Banu Asad: "Witness the fighting with me." He said: "Indeed, my father and my uncle witnessed Badr and Al-Hudaybiyah with the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him), and they ordered me not to kill a Muslim man." So I said: "...And I am not one to kill a man who prays... for the sake of another authority from Quraysh... ...He has his authority and upon me is my sin... I seek refuge in Allah from foolishness and recklessness... ...Shall I kill a Muslim for nothing... Then you would not benefit me as long as I live my life..."

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text: 5493 - Ubaydullah Al-Qawariri narrated to me, saying: Mu'tamar b. Sulayman narrated to us from Isma'il b. Abi Khalid from Mutarrif from Amir from Hudhayfah b. Usayd who said: "I saw Abu Bakr and Umar not sacrificing (Udhiyah) for their families for fear that it would be taken as a Sunnah."

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5494 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya b. Zakariyya b. Abi Za'idah narrated to us, saying: Isma'il b. Abi Khalid informed me from Firas from Al-Sha'bi, who said: "There is no harm in the refuge-seeking with the Quran being hung on the human."
5495 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya b. Zakariyya narrated to us, saying: Ibn Abi Khalid informed me from Bayan, who said: Amir was asked about a man who was told: "Have you divorced your wife?" So he signaled with his fingers: "Yes." So he separated her from him.
5496 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdullah b. Numayr narrated to us, saying: Isma'il, meaning Ibn Abi Khalid, informed us from Abdullah b. Abi Al-Safar from Amir, who said: "The Prophet (peace be upon him) took ownership (married) Maymunah while he was in Ihram, and he was cupped while he was in Ihram."
5497 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdullah b. Numayr narrated to us, saying: Isma'il informed us from Ibrahim b. Bashir from Amir, who said: "Ali did not give inheritance to the brothers from the mother, nor the woman, nor the husband from the blood money (Diyah) at all."

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5498 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ibn Numayr narrated to us, saying: Isma'il informed us from Tariq from Amir that he was asked about a people who disputed regarding a certain matter, and a slave struck a free man and killed him. So his master proceeded to free him. Amir said: "His master is liable for the blood money, and his emancipation is valid."
5499 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdullah b. Numayr narrated to us, saying: Isma'il informed us from Imran from Amir, who was asked about four men who testified that so-and-so is not the son of so-and-so, and four others testified that he is the son of so-and-so. He said: "I avert the punishment from these because they are four, and I believe the other four." Ibn Numayr said: "I sought him out, meaning this Imran, while he was alive, but I did not meet him, and he was in Juhaynah or Kindah."
5500 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ubaydah b. Humayd narrated to me, saying: Isma'il narrated to me from Abu Al-Safar from Al-Sha'bi, who said: "The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) was cupped while he was fasting, and he took ownership (married) Maymunah, the Hilali woman, while he was in Ihram."
5501 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yazid b. Harun narrated to us, saying: Isma'il informed us from Abdullah b. Abi Al-Safar from Amir, who said: "The Prophet (peace be upon him) was cupped while he was in Ihram, and he took ownership (married) Maymunah while he was in Ihram." Abdullah said: "The correct one is what Yazid b. Harun said."

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5502 - Abdul-Warith b. Abdul-Hakam Al-Warraq narrated to me, saying: And Yahya b. Sa'id, meaning Al-Umawi, informed us from Isma'il, meaning Ibn Abi Khalid, from Hajjaj from Amir, who said: A man who had a fistula asked him; it used to flow all day long. He said: "How do you order me to pray?" So he said to him: "Pray, even if it flows from your head to your foot."
5503 - My father, Abu Kurayb Muhammad b. Al-Ala, and Zahmawayh narrated to me, saying: Ibn Abi Za'idah narrated to us from Isma'il. My father said in his hadith: Isma'il b. Abi Khalid informed me from Firas from Al-Sha'bi, who said: "There is no harm in the refuge-seeking of the Quran being hung on the human."
5504 - Wahb b. Baqiyyah Al-Wasiti narrated to me, saying: Khalid informed us from Isma'il from a man called Abu Talhah from Amir that a man divorced his wife and she gave birth. Then it was said to him: "There is another in her belly." So he took her back. He [Amir] said: "She is his wife."
5505 - Wahb b. Baqiyyah narrated to me, saying: Khalid informed us from Isma'il from Ibrahim Al-Kindi from Amir from Ali that he did not give inheritance to the brothers from the mother, nor the husband, nor the woman from the blood money (Diyah) at all.
5506 - And my father narrated it to me, saying: Yahya b. Sa'id narrated to us from Isma'il from a man from Amir from Ali that he used to not give inheritance to the brothers from the mother from the blood money.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5507 - Wahb bin Baqiyyah narrated to me, saying: Khalid informed us from Isma'il from Tariq bin Abd al-Rahman, who said: Amir was asked about a man who killed his slave unjustly (Hurran), so his master freed him. Amir said: His master is liable for his blood money, and his emancipation is valid.
5508 - Zakariya bin Yahya bin Zahmwayh narrated to us, saying: Ibn Abi Za'idah narrated to us, saying: Isma'il bin Abi Khalid narrated to me from Firas from Amir, who said: 'There is no harm in hanging amulets from the Quran on a person.'
5509 - Abu Bakr bin Khallad narrated to us, saying: I heard Yahya bin Sa'id say: I heard Isma'il bin Abi Khalid narrating from Bayan or from a man from Amir regarding: 'If you trust one another' [Quran 2:283]. Yahya said: And I did not take it from him. He said: 'The matter returned to trustworthiness.'
5510 - Ahmad bin Mani' narrated to me, saying: Yazid bin Harun narrated to us, saying: Isma'il bin Abi Khalid informed us from Abdullah bin Umair from Al-Sha'bi: That he met Abdullah bin Abi al-Hayyaj and said: 'Your father narrated to me, saying: Umar wrote to Ammar bin Yasir: "A drink made in Sham (Syria) was brought to me, so I asked about it and found that it had been cooked until two-thirds of it had gone, and one-third remained. Its foulness, impurity, and unlawfulness had gone, and the lawful and good part of it remained. So when this letter of mine reaches you, order those with you of the Muslims to use it in their drinks. And peace."'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5511 - My father narrated to me, saying: Waki' and Abdah narrated to us, both saying: Isma'il narrated to us from Ibrahim al-Basri, who said: Amir was asked about the woman who divorces herself through Khul' (Al-Mukhtali'ah): Does she have maintenance (Nafaqah)? He said: 'How can she have maintenance when he takes from her?'
5512 - Muhammad bin Abbad narrated to us, saying: Marwan al-Fazari narrated to us from Isma'il, who said: Ibrahim al-Basri informed me, saying: Al-Sha'bi was asked about the woman who divorces herself through Khul': Does she have maintenance? He said: 'How can she have maintenance when he takes her wealth from her?'
5513 - Muhammad bin Abbad narrated to us, saying: Marwan narrated to us, saying: Isma'il narrated to us, saying: Hajjaj informed me, saying: I asked Al-Sha'bi: 'I have a fistula (Nasur) that bleeds all day long; what should I do regarding prayer and ablution?' He said: 'Pray, even if it flows from your head to your feet.'
5514 - My father narrated to me, saying: Muhammad bin Ja'far narrated to us, saying: Shu'bah narrated to us from Isma'il, who said: I heard Al-Sha'bi narrating that he disliked being a neighbor in Mecca.
5515 - He said: And someone who heard Al-Sha'bi say: 'I do not care whether I am a neighbor in Mecca or a neighbor in Baniqiya' informed me.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5516 - Abd al-Wahhab bin Abd al-Hakam narrated to me, saying: Yahya bin Sa'id—meaning Al-Umawi—informed me from Isma'il—meaning Ibn Abi Khalid—from a sheikh who informed him from Amir, who said: 'For me to give two dirhams in charity is dearer to me than sacrificing a sheep.'
5517 - Abd al-Wahhab bin Abd al-Hakam narrated to me, saying: Yahya bin Sa'id narrated to me from Isma'il from someone who narrated to him from Amir, who said: I asked him about a slave who married a free woman and told her: 'I am free.' Then she learned after that that he was a slave. He said: 'Her affair is in her hand; she has the choice.'
5518 - Abd al-Wahhab narrated to me, saying: And Yahya bin Sa'id informed us from Isma'il from someone who narrated to him from Al-Sha'bi regarding a man who hires an animal to carry loads on it. He said: 'If the animal carries the goods and something happens to it, he is liable.'
5519 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdullah bin Numair narrated to us, saying: Isma'il narrated to us from a man from Amir, who said: Someone who saw Husain bin Ali being cupped while fasting informed me.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5520 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdullah bin Numair narrated to us from Isma'il from a man from Amir: That he disliked benefiting from anything of the pledge (Al-Rahn).
5521 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdullah bin Numair narrated to us, saying: Isma'il narrated to us from some of his companions from Amir: That he was asked about a female slave who ran away and came to a land where she claimed she was free. A man married her, and she bore children from him. Then her master appeared (found her). He said: 'He takes his slave girl, and her children are valued against him (the father) at a fair price, so their father takes them.'
5522 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdullah bin Numair narrated to us, saying: Isma'il narrated to us from a man from Amir: 'If a funeral surprises you while you are without ablution, pray over it.' Abdullah said: He is Muti' al-Ghazal—meaning the man.
5523 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdullah bin Numair narrated to us, saying: Isma'il informed us from a man from Amir: That he used to hold liable the rider, the driver, the leader (of the animal), and the one who places his animal on the back of the Muslims' road for whatever his animal caused.
5524 - Isma'il narrated to us from Mujalid from Al-Sha'bi.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5525 - Abd al-A'la bin Hammad al-Narsi narrated to me, saying: Mu'tamar bin Sulayman informed us, saying: Isma'il—meaning Ibn Abi Khalid—narrated to us from Mujalid from Amir, who said: Fatima bint Qais narrated to me that she was divorced, so she came to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, asking him for maintenance. She said: So he did not assign her residence or maintenance, and he ordered me to spend my waiting period (Iddah) in the house of Ibn Umm Maktum.
5526 - Abd al-A'la bin Hammad narrated to me, saying: Mu'tamar bin Sulayman narrated to us, saying: I heard Isma'il bin Abi Khalid say: Mujalid bin Sa'id narrated to us from Amir, who said: Fatima bint Qais informed me that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, prayed Zuhr then ascended the pulpit—and he did not used to ascend it except on Friday before that day. The people found that unusual. While some were standing and some sitting, he signaled to them with his hand to sit down. He said: 'Indeed, by Allah, I have not stood in this position of mine for a matter to urge you towards desire or out of fear. But Tamim al-Dari came to me and informed me of news that prevented me from taking the midday nap due to joy, so I loved to spread the joy of your Prophet to you.' Then he mentioned the hadith. The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: 'To here my joy ended; this is Taybah (Medina). By the One in Whose hand is my soul, there is no narrow or wide easy path in it, nor a mountain, except upon it is an angel with a drawn sword until the Day of Resurrection.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5527 - Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaybah narrated to me, saying: Muhammad bin Bishr al-Abdi narrated to us, saying: Isma'il bin Abi Khalid narrated to us from Mujalid bin Sa'id from Al-Sha'bi from Amir bin Shahr, who said: I heard a word from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and a word from the Negus (Najashi). I heard the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say: 'Look at Quraysh and listen to their speech, but leave their actions.' He said: And I was with the Negus when a son of his from the scribes came and read a verse from the Gospel. I understood it and laughed. He said: 'What are you laughing at? Do you laugh at the Book of Allah? By Allah, it is indeed in the Book of Allah which He revealed to Jesus: That the curse will be upon the earth when its rulers are children (boys).'
5528 - Abu Bakr bin Khallad narrated to me, saying: I heard Yahya bin Sa'id narrating from Mujalid from Amir, who said: 'I drank At-Tila (thickened juice) with Shuraih.'
5529 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi narrated to us, saying: Abdullah bin al-Mubarak narrated to me from Sa'id bin Yazid. My father said: He is a trustworthy sheikh called Abu Shuja' al-Qitbani; Layth bin Sa'd and Abdullah bin Wahb narrated from him.
5530 - Mujahid bin Musa narrated to me, saying: Muhammad bin Ubaid narrated to us, saying: Mis'ar narrated to us from Yazid al-Faqir from Jabir, who said: Some weeping women came to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. He said: 'O Allah, give us rain, abundant, reviving, pleasant, fertile, beneficial not harmful, sooner not later.' He said: So it rained heavily upon them. I narrated this hadith to my father. My father said: 'Muhammad bin Ubaid gave us his book from Mis'ar, and we copied it, and this hadith was not in it. This is nothing.' It was as if he denied it from the hadith of Muhammad bin Ubaid.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5531 - My father said: And Ya'la, the brother of Muhammad, narrated it to us, saying: Mis'ar narrated to us from Yazid al-Faqir as Mursal (hurried/disconnected), and he did not say 'weeping women' (bawaki); he contradicted him.
5532 - Abu Musa al-Harawi Ishaq bin Ibrahim narrated to me, saying: Isa bin Yunus informed us, saying: Ma'mar bin Rashid informed me from Al-Razzaz from Abu Salamah bin Abd al-Rahman from Abu Sa'id al-Khudri: That the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, prayed in water and mud, so I saw the trace on his forehead and nose tip in the water and mud. I narrated it to my father. He said: Isa erred in it. Ma'mar only narrated it from Yahya bin Abi Kathir from Abu Salamah from Abu Sa'id as a long story. It is not from Al-Zuhri; it is only from Yahya bin Abi Kathir.
5533 - I heard my father say: Hanzalah bin Ubaidullah is the Imam of the mosque of Qatada.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5534 - I said to my father: Abu Musa al-Harawi narrated to us, saying: Muhammad bin Fudayl narrated to us, saying: Al-Ajlah narrated to us from Abu al-Dhayyal. My father said: It is actually Al-Dhayyal bin Harmalah. Who is Abu al-Dhayyal? It was as if he denied that there is an Abu al-Dhayyal.
5535 - My father narrated to me, saying: Isma'il bin Ibrahim narrated to us, saying: Hisham narrated to us from Yahya bin Abi Kathir from Ya'ish bin al-Walid from Ibn Ma'dan from Abu al-Darda: That the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, vomited and broke his fast. So I met Thawban in the mosque of Damascus and asked him about that. He said: 'I poured the water for ablution for the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace.' He said: Yahya only narrated it from Al-Awza'i from Ya'ish from Ma'dan from Abu al-Darda.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5536 - My father narrated to me, saying: Isma'il bin Ibrahim narrated to us from Khalid al-Hadhdha', who said: Ammar, the freedman of Banu Hashim, narrated to me, saying: I heard Ibn Abbas say: 'The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, died when he was sixty-five.'
5537 - My father narrated to me, saying: Isma'il bin Ibrahim narrated to us from Abd al-Rahman bin Ishaq from Al-Zuhri from Sa'id bin Zaid from Abu Ayyub from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, who said: 'It is not lawful—or it is not proper—for a man to desert his brother for more than three [days]. They meet, and this one turns away and that one turns away; and the better of them is the one who starts with the greeting (Salam).' My father said: Thus said Ibn Ulayyah: 'From Sa'id bin Zaid.' But it is actually 'Ata bin Yazid.'
5538 - My father narrated to me, saying: Isma'il bin Ibrahim informed us from Ayyub, who said: Ibn Abi al-Zinad mentioned visiting graves and vessels. I said: 'O Abu Bakr, who narrated to you?' He said: 'Abu al-Zinad narrated to me from some Kufans.'
5539 - My father narrated to me, saying: Waki' narrated to us, saying: Yazid bin Ibrahim Abu Sa'id—meaning Al-Tustari—narrated to us.
5540 - My father narrated to me, saying: Waki' narrated to us, saying: Hammad bin Abi al-Darda narrated to us.
5541 - My father said: Hammad is trustworthy.
5542 - My father narrated to me, saying: Waki' narrated to us, saying: Hilal bin Salman Abu Muhallim narrated to us. My father said: There is no harm in him.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5543 - My father narrated to me, saying: Waki' narrated to us, saying: Uthman bin Abi Hind narrated to us, saying: I saw Abu Ubaidah putting his hands together between his knees (Tatbiq) when he bowed. My father said: Uthman bin Abi Hind is a trustworthy Kufan.
5544 - My father narrated to me, saying: Mu'ammal narrated to us, saying: Hammad—meaning Ibn Zaid—narrated to us: Abdullah bin Sa'd bin Ibrahim, the companion of Al-Ziyadi, said...
5545 - Ibrahim bin Sa'id narrated to me, saying: Abu Usama narrated to us from Hilal bin Salman Abu al-Muhallim, who said: I heard Al-Sha'bi say: 'Mu'awiyah used to call Al-A'sha—A'sha of Banu Mazin—the cymbal player (Sannajah) of the Arabs.'
5546 - Abu Abd al-Rahman said: I arrived from Kufa in the year two hundred and thirty. I presented to him the hadiths of Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaybah from Sharik. He said: 'Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaybah has beautiful, strange hadiths from Sharik; if he were here, we would have heard from him.'
5547 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ya'qub bin Ibrahim bin Sa'd narrated to us, saying: My father narrated to us from Al-Walid bin Kathir, who said: Muhammad bin Amr bin Halhalah al-Du'ali narrated to me that Ibn Shihab narrated to him that Ali bin Husain narrated to him: That when they arrived in Medina from Yazid bin Mu'awiyah after the killing of Husain bin Ali, Al-Miswar bin Makhramah met him and said to him: 'Indeed, Ali bin Abi Talib proposed to the daughter of Abu Jahl while married to Fatima. So I heard the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, addressing the people regarding that on this pulpit of his—and I had reached puberty by then. He said: Indeed, Fatima is part of me, and I fear that she may be tested in her religion.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5548 - Uthman bin Muhammad bin Abi Shaybah narrated to me, saying: Mu'awiyah bin Hisham narrated to us, saying: Shaiban narrated to us from Yahya bin Abi Kathir from Abu Salamah from Aisha and Ibn Abbas: That the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, stayed in Mecca for ten years while the Quran was being revealed to him, and in Medina for ten [years].
5549 - Uthman bin Abi Shaybah narrated to me, saying: Salamah al-Abrash narrated to us from Ishaq bin Rashid from Kathir bin Abi Sulayman from Miqsam from Ibn Abbas, who said: 'The number of the people of Badr was three hundred and thirteen.'
5550 - My father narrated to me, saying: Waki' narrated to us, saying: Saif bin Abi Sulayman Abu Sulayman narrated to us—and they [also] say Ibn Sulayman.
5551 - I asked my father about the hadith of Sufyan bin Uyaynah from Imran al-Kufi, who said: Isa bin Maryam said to the disciples: 'Do not take from people based on what you know, except similar to what you have given me.' My father said: Imran al-Kufi is Imran bin Uyaynah, the brother of Sufyan bin Uyaynah.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5552 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Nu'aym narrated to us, saying: Mis'ar bin Kidam bin Zuhayr bin Ubaidah bin al-Harith al-Hilali narrated to us. My father said: Abu Nu'aym recited the hadith of Mis'ar in one sitting from memory in Kufa in the graveyard (Al-Jabban) in the year one hundred and eighty-five.
5553 - Abu Abd al-Rahman said: Abbas al-Duri said to me: 'In this year I was born.'
5554 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya bin Adam narrated to us, saying: Fudayl bin Marzuq, the freedman of Banu 'Itr, narrated to us.
5555 - Surayj bin Yunus narrated a hadith to me, saying: From Lamazah bin Ziyad. So I asked my father, and he said: 'Lamazah bin Zabbar—meaning Abu Labid.'
5556 - I heard my father say: Ali bin Hashim did not hear from Mahall bin Khalifah; Shu'bah only narrated from him. The one from whom Ali bin Hashim heard is only Mahall bin Muhriz.
5557 - I asked my father: Who is the most established person regarding Ibrahim? He said: 'Al-Hakam bin Utaybah, then Mansur.'
5558 - Someone who heard Ibn Uyaynah narrated to me, saying: I used to say to Ibn Jurayj: 'I do not see Ibn Tawus arriving.' That would distress him, and he would say: 'By Allah, you will indeed find him difficult (strict/knowledgeable).'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5559 - And someone else said from Ibn Uyaynah, who said: So Ibn Tawus arrived. He said: So I began saying to him: 'What did your father say regarding such-and-such? What did your father say regarding such-and-such?' His companion said to him: 'This one is harder on you than the governor when he took you and beat you.'
5560 - Yusuf al-Saffar, the freedman of Banu Umayyah, narrated to me, saying: Ma'n bin Isa al-Qazzaz narrated to us from Al-Zuhri's nephew, who said: Al-Zuhri died in the year one hundred and twenty-four.
5561 - Yusuf al-Saffar narrated to me, saying: Ma'n narrated to us, saying: Ibrahim bin Sa'd informed me, saying: Sa'd—meaning Ibn Ibrahim—died in the year one hundred and twenty-five.
5562 - I asked Sa'id bin Yahya al-Umawi about Yusuf al-Saffar. He said: 'That is one of our righteous freedmen.'
5563 - Ibrahim bin Khalid al-Kalbi Abu Thawr narrated to me from his father, who said: I saw Salim al-Aftas—and he said once: Indeed, Salim was beheaded in Harran. I reckon he said: On a Friday; Abdullah bin Ali beheaded him.
5564 - Shuja' bin Makhlad narrated to me, saying: Mu'adh bin Mu'adh narrated to us, saying: Abbad bin Mansur narrated to us. Mu'adh said: 'I do not like narrating from him because of [his belief in] Qadar (free will).'
5565 - Someone who heard Hatim bin Isma'il narrated to me from Ja'far bin Muhammad from his father, who said: 'Badr was on the seventeenth of Ramadan, a Friday.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5566 - Someone who heard Hisham bin Yusuf narrated to me from Ma'mar from Sulayman bin Ulaythah, who said: 'Part of the perfection of a man's knowledge is that he is trustworthy regarding what he brings [narrates].'
5567 - Muhammad bin Abdullah al-Makhrami narrated to me, saying: I heard Waki' say: I saw Ghalib bin Ubaidullah circumambulating the House—and he mentioned his appearance and his dye. So I asked him about a hadith. He said: 'Sa'id bin al-Musayyib and Sulayman al-A'mash narrated to us.' So I left him and did not ask him.
5568 - Muhammad bin Abdullah narrated to me, saying: Abu Dawud narrated to us, saying: I heard Shu'bah say: Sa'id bin Masruq informed me. He said: I said: 'O Abu Bistam, who is Sa'id bin Masruq?' He said: 'Abu Sufyan, that jurist.'
5569 - Muhammad bin Abdullah narrated to me, saying: Abu Dawud narrated to us from Shu'bah, who said: 'Al-Hakam narrated to us from Abd al-Rahman bin Abi Laila from Ali something; if I narrated it to you, you would dance. By Allah, you will never hear it from me.'
5570 - And Mahmud bin Ghaylan narrated it to us similarly, and he said: 'You would become Rafidis.' Abu Abd al-Rahman said: And this is more likely.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5571 - Muhammad bin Abdullah narrated to me, saying: Zakariya bin Adi narrated to us, saying: Ibn al-Mubarak narrated to us from A'idh al-Tusi, who said: I said to Ayyub: 'What do you say about Al-Zuhri?' He said: 'A man who revived the knowledge of that town from a man who used to associate with the Sultan.'
(Follows in the Eighth Part, God willing. I heard my father say: I heard Abd al-Razzaq say—and he mentioned Yahya bin Ma'in and his going to Hisham bin Yusuf... And praise be to Allah, Lord of the Worlds, and may Allah bless Muhammad the Prophet and his good and pure family and grant them peace.)

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
(Part Eight of the Book of Defects and Knowledge of Men)
This part is in the handwriting of Ibrahim bin Muhammad bin Ya'qub bin al-Hasan bin al-Ma'mun; he used to listen with Abu al-Hasan.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful.
5572 - Abdullah bin Ahmad narrated to us, saying: I heard my father say: I heard Abd al-Razzaq say—and he mentioned Yahya bin Ma'in and his going to Hisham bin Yusuf—he said: 'You are coming to a man; even if the Sultan changed him, he has not changed his hadith.'
5573 - Abdullah narrated to us, saying: Muhammad bin Abdullah narrated to me, saying: Zakariya bin Adi narrated to us, saying: Ibn al-Mubarak informed us from Hammad bin Zaid from A'idh—meaning Al-Tusi—who said: I said to Amr bin Ubaid: 'It has reached me that you say [it is] from the saying of Al-Hasan.' He said: So he remained silent. Ibn al-Mubarak said to him: So I met A'idh and asked him. He said: 'I met him, and he said: Whatever I say.'
5574 - Abdullah narrated to us, saying: My father narrated to me, saying: Affan informed us, saying: I memorized it from a trustworthy sheikh, Abd al-Mu'min al-Sadusi; he said: 'Al-Hasan al-Basri is Al-Hasan bin Yasar.'
5575 - Abdullah narrated to us, saying: Abu Musa Muhammad bin al-Muthanna narrated to us, saying: Amir bin Abi Amir al-Khazzaz said to me: 'Al-Hasan bin Abi al-Hasan is Al-Hasan bin Yasar.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5576 - Abdullah narrated to us, saying: Abu Musa narrated to me, saying: Amir bin Abi Amir said: 'Ayyub al-Sakhtiyani is Ayyub bin Kaysan. Dawud bin Abi Hind is Dawud bin Dinar. And Aban bin Abi Ayyash is Aban bin Fairuz.'
5577 - Abdullah narrated to us, saying: Abu Musa narrated to me, saying: And Abd al-Aziz bin Abd al-Samad said to me: 'Abu Imran al-Jawni's name is Abd al-Malik bin Habib. And Abu Harun al-Abdi's name is Umarah bin Juwayn.'
5578 - Abu Musa narrated to me, saying: Muhammad bin Abdullah al-Ansari narrated to us, saying: I was with Salam bin Abi Muti', and we mentioned Aban bin Abi Ayyash. He said: 'Do not narrate anything from him. And look to your hadith from Humaid, and cherish his hadith.'
5579 - My father narrated to me, saying: Mu'awiyah bin Hisham narrated to us, saying: Sufyan narrated to us from Ubaid al-Muktib from Abu al-Tufayl Amir bin Wathilah from Salman, who said: 'I am from Jayy.'
5580 - Muhammad bin Bashar Bundar narrated to me, saying: Hammad bin Mas'adah narrated to us, saying: Awf informed us from Abu Uthman, who said: Salman said to me: 'Do you know Ramhormuz?' I said: 'Yes.' He said: 'I am from its people.'
5581 - My father dictated to me, saying: Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi said to me: I said to Sufyan: 'You narrated from Shu'bah from Al-Hakam from Ibrahim from Ubaidah regarding the man who has a slave girl under him (as a wife), then he divorces her, so the master has intercourse with her?' He said: 'She is not lawful for him (the master) until she marries another husband.' He said: 'I did not narrate it.' My father said: Al-Dhamari narrated it to us from Sufyan—meaning Abd al-Malik al-Dhamari in Yemen.
5582 - My father said: Thuwayr bin Abi Fakhitah is Abu al-Jahm.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5583 - My father narrated to us, saying: Ubaidah bin Humaid narrated to us, saying: Thuwayr narrated to us, saying: Abu Ja'far said to me: 'O Abu al-Jahm.'
5584 - Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaybah narrated to me, saying: Ali bin Hashim bin al-Barid narrated to us from Ibn Abi Laila from Thabit, who said: I was sitting with Abd al-Rahman bin Abi Laila in the mosque when a huge man with two braids came to him and said: 'O Abu Isa.' He said: 'Yes.' He said: When he turned away, I said: 'Who is this?' They said: 'This is Suwayd bin Ghaflah.'
5585 - I heard Muhammad bin Abdullah bin Numair say: Sa'id bin Salam, the Basran, is a liar; he narrates from Al-Thawri, a liar. And my father said to me: 'Strike out the hadith of Sa'id bin Salam.'
5586 - I heard Muhammad bin Abdullah bin Numair say: Abu Bakr bin Ayyash narrated a hadith to us, and he said: 'From Ma'mar bin Abi Habibah.' As for him, he is Ma'mar bin Abi Habibah, but the correct [name] is Ibn Abi Habibah.
5587 - Abu Abd al-Rahman bin Numair said: Talq bin Mu'awiyah is the grandfather of Hafs bin Ghiyath.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5588 - I heard Abu Abd al-Rahman Muhammad bin Abdullah bin Numair say: I heard Abu Khalid al-Ahmar say: I heard Al-A'mash say: 'I heard one thousand hadiths from Abu Salih.'
5589 - Muhammad bin Abdullah bin Numair narrated to me, saying: Uqbah bin Khalid—meaning Al-Sa'di—narrated to us, saying: Isma'il bin Abi Khalid narrated to us, saying: 'I saw Ibn Abi Awfa, and he had two braids.'
5590 - Muhammad bin Abdullah narrated to me, saying: Yunus bin Bukair narrated to us from Hisham bin Urwah, who said: 'I saw Sa'id bin al-Musayyib, and he had shoulder-length hair (Jumma).'
5591 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Razzaq narrated to us, saying: Ma'mar informed us, saying: Abd al-Rahman al-Sarraj informed me, and he had retained knowledge.
5592 - My father narrated to me, saying: Hammad al-Khayyat narrated to us from Makhramah bin Bukair, who said: 'I did not hear anything from my father.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5593 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya bin Adam narrated to us, saying: Ibn Mubarak narrated to me, saying: Makhramah narrated to me, saying: I read in the book of Ibn Bukair from Sulayman bin Yasar from Zaid bin Thabit: That Ibn Umar asked him about a man who was prevented (Muhsar) during Hajj. He said: 'He sends a sacrificial animal, and when he slaughters it, he becomes lawful [exits Ihram], and he owes an Umrah and a Hajj.'
5594 - My father narrated to me, saying: Mu'adh bin Mu'adh al-Anbari narrated to us, saying: Sulayman al-Taymi narrated to us from Abdullah al-Dana.
5595 - I heard my father say: Some of them say Al-Danaj and Al-Dana, and it is one [person].
5596 - I heard my father say: Abu Mu'awiyah narrated to us, saying: Hajjaj al-Sawwaf informed us from Abdullah al-Danaq from Ibn Umar: That he saw a man slaughtering a sacrificial camel facing other than the Qiblah. He said: 'If you are a Muslim, then face it towards the Qiblah.'
5597 - I narrated to my father the hadith of Al-Muharibi from Ma'mar from Al-Zuhri from Sa'id bin al-Musayyib from Abu Sa'id al-Khudri, who said: The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was asked about confusion (Tashbih) in prayer. He said: 'He should not leave until he hears a sound or smells an odor.' My father denied it and regarded it as grave. My father said: 'Al-Muharibi from Ma'mar?' I said: 'Yes.' And he denied it strongly. The hadith was narrated to me by Abu al-Sha'tha and Abu Kuraib; both said: Al-Muharibi narrated to us. Abu Abd al-Rahman Abdullah bin Ahmad said: We did not know that Al-Muharibi heard anything from Ma'mar, and it has reached us that Al-Muharibi used to practice Tadlis (concealment of sources).

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5598 - I heard my father say: Ja'far bin Awn bin Ja'far bin Amr bin Huraith Abu Awn narrated to us, and he was a worshiper among worshipers.
5599 - My father narrated to me, saying: Rib'i bin Ulayyah, the brother of Isma'il bin Ulayyah bin Ibrahim, narrated to us, and he was a worshiper.
5600 - Abu al-Fadl Shuja' bin Makhlad narrated to me, saying: Isma'il narrated to us from Ayyub from Muhammad bin Sirin, who said: I mentioned to Abu Mu'awiyah Ubaid bin Nadhilah something from Yahya bin Sirin. He said: 'This was when he became knowledgeable.'
5601 - Ahmad bin Ibrahim al-Dawraqi narrated to me, saying: Isma'il bin Ulayyah narrated to us from Yunus bin Ubaid, who said: 'Ziyad al-A'lam used to give gifts to Thabit al-Bunani, to Yazid al-Raqashi, to Yazid al-Dabbi, and to Al-Hasan.' Ahmad said: It was said to Isma'il bin Ulayyah: 'Was Ziyad al-A'lam the son of Yunus bin Ubaid's maternal aunt?' He said: 'Yes.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5602 - Ahmad narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi informed us: Shu'bah said: 'Writing knowledge hinders from the remembrance of Allah, from prayer, and from maintaining kinship ties; so will you desist?'
5603 - Ahmad bin Ibrahim narrated to me, saying: Affan bin Muslim narrated to me, saying: I heard Hammad bin Salamah say: 'We used to liken the characteristics of Isma'il bin Ulayyah to the characteristics of Yunus bin Ubaid.'
5604 - Abu Musa narrated to me, saying: Umayyah bin Khalid al-Qaysi narrated to us, saying: Shu'bah narrated to us, saying: A man said to Abu Ishaq: 'Indeed, Shu'bah claims that you saw Alqamah but did not hear from him.' He said: 'He spoke the truth.'
5605 - Abu Musa narrated to me, saying: I heard Khalid bin al-Harith say: 'Hisham bin Urwah read it to me.'
5606 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Muqatil bin al-Muhallab Abu al-Hasan al-Balkhi narrated to us, saying: 'My grandfather from the side of Ibn Sulaym bin Maysarah—and he is the brother of Ata bin Maysarah, the executor of Ata al-Khurasani—is from the people of Balkh. Their origin in the early times was from Jurjan, then they moved to Balkh. And Ata left Khurasan before Al-Maysarah.' And Muqatil said: 'Al-Shawdhab is a neighbor of ours worth such and such'—meaning in Balkh—meaning Abu Abdullah bin Shawdhab.
5607 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: He said: I was narrated to from Musa bin Ubaidah bin Nashit bin Ubaid bin al-Harith, the brother of Banu Amir bin Lu'ayy, Abu Abd al-Aziz al-Zubdi.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5608 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: He said: I was narrated to from Zakariya bin Abi Za'idah al-Hamdani. The name of Abu Za'idah is Maimun bin Fayruz. I heard Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaybah say: The name of Abu al-Kanud is Abdullah bin Uwaimir.
5609 - Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaybah narrated to me, saying: I heard Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi say: 'Isra'il was a thief in hadith.' Ibn Abi Shaybah said: He did not mean to disparage him.
5610 - Abu Abd al-Rahman said: Al-Thawri used to narrate ten or so hadiths from a man, but he would narrate twenty or thirty from Isra'il. And Isra'il was a man of a book (had written records), while Al-Thawri relied on memory.
5611 - Ibn Numair narrated to me, saying: Hafs—meaning Ibn Ghiyath—narrated to us from Ash'ath, who said: Ikrimah used to narrate to us and say: 'Everything I narrate to you from Ibn Abbas is from Ibn Abbas.'
5612 - I narrated to my father the hadith of Al-Ashja'i and Waki' from Sufyan from Abu Qais from Huzayl from Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah, who said: 'The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, wiped over the stockings and the sandals.' My father said: 'This is not narrated except from the hadith of Abu Qais.' My father said: 'Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi came to narrate it, and he said: "It is Munkar (objectionable)"—meaning this hadith of Al-Mughirah—"it is not narrated except from the hadith of Abu Qais".'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
