5613 - My father narrated to me, saying: Mu'tamar bin Sulayman al-Taymi narrated to us from Kahmas from a man from Al-Sha'bi.
5614 - And Mu'awiyah bin Shu'bah al-Basri narrated to me, saying: Mu'tamar narrated to us from Kahmas from Dawud bin Abi Hind from Al-Sha'bi, who said: 'If I met this one—meaning Al-Hasan—I would have forbidden him from his saying: "The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said." I accompanied Ibn Umar for six months and did not hear him say: "The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said," except in one hadith.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5615 - I asked my father about the hadith of Ibn Uyaynah from Amr bin Dinar, who said: I heard Muslim bin Yasar say: I asked Ibn Umar: 'Did Umar use to take tithes from the Muslims?' He said: 'No.' My father said: This is Muslim bin Yasar bin Sukrah, a Meccan.
5616 - I heard my father say: Abu Ghaffar's name is Al-Muthanna bin Sa'd.
5617 - My father narrated to me, saying: Sa'd bin Ibrahim bin Sa'd narrated to us, saying: Abu Uways Abdullah bin Abdullah bin Uways narrated to us.
5618 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Dawud narrated to us, saying: Khalid bin Abi Uthman narrated to us, and he was trustworthy.
5619 - My father narrated to me, saying: I heard Waki' say: 'Qais bin al-Rabi' narrated to us, and Allah is the One whose help is sought.'
5620 - My father narrated to me, saying: Musa bin Dawud narrated to us, saying: Hizam bin Hisham bin Hubaish narrated to us from his father, who said: I saw Umar bin al-Khattab. He said: And my grandfather Hubaish witnessed the Conquest with the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5621 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ibrahim bin Mahdi al-Massisi narrated to us from Ibn Ulayyah, who said: Shu'bah said: 'As for Jabir al-Ju'fi and Muhammad bin Ishaq, they are truthful in hadith.'
5622 - My father narrated to me, saying: Sulayman bin Harb narrated to us, saying: Hammad—meaning Ibn Zaid—narrated to us from Ayyub from a man: That Ikrimah sat narrating, and among them were people from the companions of Ibn Abbas, including Sa'id bin Jubair. He said: So he began narrating, and the man began saying 'Like this'—and Sulayman gestured thirty—or gesturing with his head. Sulayman said: Meaning they were confirming him. Until he reached this place: He mentioned the fish. He said: 'He was walking alongside them in shallow water.' Sa'id bin Jubair said: 'I bear witness regarding Ibn Abbas that he said: They were carrying it in a basket.'
5623 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Mu'awiyah narrated to us, saying: Al-A'mash narrated to us from Shaqiq, who said: I was sitting with Abu Musa and Abdullah. Abu Musa said: 'O Abu Abd al-Rahman, what do you think if a man does not find water and is in a state of major impurity (Janabah) for a month, should he perform Tayammum?' He said: 'No, even if he does not find water for a month.' Abu Musa said to him: 'What do you do with this verse in Surah Al-Ma'idah: {And if you do not find water, then seek clean earth}?' Abdullah said: 'If they were granted permission in this, or they complained, when the water became cold for them, they would perform Tayammum with earth'—then they mentioned the hadith—'then pray.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5624 - My father said: And Ya'la bin Ubaid narrated to us, saying: Al-A'mash narrated to us from Shaqiq, who said: I was sitting with Abdullah and Abu Musa... and he mentioned the hadith similar to the hadith of Abu Mu'awiyah, but the hadith of Abu Mu'awiyah is more complete and better.
5625 - My father narrated to me, saying: Muhammad bin Ja'far narrated to us, saying: Shu'bah narrated to us from Sulayman from Abu Wa'il, who said: Abu Musa said to Abdullah bin Mas'ud: 'If he does not find water, he does not pray?' And he mentioned it. And the hadith of Abu Mu'awiyah is more complete.
5626 - My father narrated to me, saying: Affan informed us, saying: Abd al-Wahid bin Ziyad informed us, saying: Sulayman al-A'mash informed us, saying: Shaqiq informed us, saying: I was sitting with Abdullah and Abu Musa al-Ash'ari... so he mentioned something similar to the hadith of Abu Mu'awiyah and its meaning.
5627 - My father narrated to me, saying: Affan narrated to us—and Yahya bin Sa'id denied it. So I asked Hafs bin Ghiyath, and he said: Al-A'mash used to narrate it to us from Salamah bin Kuhail, and he mentioned Abu Wa'il.
5628 - I said to my father: Amr al-Naqid narrated to me, saying: Ya'qub bin Ishaq al-Hadrami informed us, saying: Shu'bah informed me, saying: Abu al-Fayd informed me from Abdullah bin Murrah from Abu Sa'd al-Zuraqi from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, that he was asked about Coitus Interruptus (Al-Azl). My father said: 'This is Abu Sa'id al-Zuraqi.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5629 - I said to my father: Amr al-Naqid narrated to me, saying: Al-Haitham bin Jamil narrated to us, saying: Asim bin Muhammad—meaning Ibn Zaid—informed us. My father said: Al-Haitham bin Jamil is trustworthy, and Asim bin Muhammad is also trustworthy.
5630 - I said to my father: Amr al-Naqid narrated to me, saying: Abu Yusuf the Judge, Ya'qub bin Ibrahim, informed us, saying: Hisham bin Urwah informed us from his father: That Abdullah bin Ja'far came to Al-Zubair bin al-Awwam and said: 'I bought such and such, and Ali intends to go to the Commander of the Faithful Uthman...' and he mentioned the hadith of legal interdiction (Hajr). Uthman said: 'How can I place an interdiction on a man in whose transaction Al-Zubair is a partner?' My father said: 'We did not hear this except from Abu Yusuf the Judge.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5631 - I said to my father: Amr bin Muhammad narrated to me, saying: Abbad bin al-Awwam narrated to us from Ash'ath from Jahm bin Abi Subrah: That Al-Zubair used to have a man pray behind him to preserve his prayer for him. My father said: This is a mistake; Abbad erred in it. It is actually Ash'ath from Jahm from Abu Subrah al-Nakha'i. My father said: And he is Jahm bin Dinar.
5632 - I found in my father's book: He said: It was said to Safwan bin Isa: Who narrated to you? He said: Al-Harith bin Abd al-Rahman from Sa'id al-Maqburi from Abu Hurairah, who said: He said: When Allah created Adam and breathed the spirit into him, he sneezed and said: 'Praise be to Allah, praise be to Allah,' by the permission of Allah to him. So his Lord, Mighty and Majestic, said to him: 'May your Lord have mercy on you, O Adam.'
5633 - My father said: Layth bin Sa'd contradicted him, [narrating] from Ibn Ajlan from Sa'id from Abdullah bin Salam.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5634 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yazid bin Harun and Abu Amir informed us, both saying: Ibn Abi Dhi'b informed us from Ajlan, the freedman of Al-Mushma'ill.
5635 - My father said: Abu Amir said in his hadith: 'Freedman of Hakam.' And Abu Ahmad al-Zubairi said: 'Freedman of Himas.'
5636 - My father said: And Isma'il bin Umar narrated it to us, saying: 'Freedman of Al-Mushma'ill.'
5637 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi narrated to us, saying: Hammad bin Salamah informed us from Abu Muhammad al-Hashimi from his father from Ali, who said: 'Thunder is an angel, and lightning is a whip of iron.'
5638 - My father narrated to me, saying: Affan informed us, saying: Hammad bin Salamah informed us, saying: Mughirah bin Muslim or someone else informed me that Ali bin Abi Talib said: 'Thunder is an angel, and lightning is the clouds being struck by a whip of iron.'
5639 - My father narrated to me, saying: Hasan bin Musa narrated to us: Hammad bin Salamah informed us from Al-Mughirah bin Muslim, the freedman of Al-Hasan bin Ali, from his father: That Ali said: 'Thunder is an angel.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5640 - I said to my father: Abu Musa al-Harawi narrated to us, saying: Hafs bin Ghiyath narrated to us from Al-Rabi' al-Hanafi from Abd al-Rahman bin Sabit. My father said: It is actually Al-Rabi' bin Sa'd al-Ju'fi, and he is not Hanafi.
5641 - I heard my father say: Abu al-Tufayl Amir bin Wathilah al-Laithi indeed saw the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace.
5642 - I read to my father: Zaid bin al-Hubab said: Yahya bin Ayyub narrated to me, saying: Ja'far bin Zam'ah al-Qurashi narrated to me from Imran bin Abi Anas from Abu al-Tufayl Abdullah. I asked my father about this Abu al-Tufayl. He said: He is Abdullah bin Amir al-Aslami.
5643 - Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaybah narrated to me, saying: Muhammad bin Sawa' informed us from Sa'id bin Abi Arubah from Abu al-Tufayl Sa'id bin Hamal from Ikrimah, who said: 'The waiting period of the woman divorced by Khul' is one menstrual cycle. The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, decreed it regarding Jamilah bint al-Salul.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5644 - Muhammad bin Ubaid bin Hisab narrated to me, saying: Abu Raja al-Kulaibi narrated to us from Abu al-Tufayl, who said: I saw Anas bin Malik wiping over the socks.
5645 - Muhammad bin Abbad al-Makki narrated to me, saying: Marwan narrated to us, saying: Isma'il—meaning Ibn Abi Khalid—narrated to us from Abu al-Tufayl Shubayl bin Awf.
5646 - Nasr bin Ali al-Jahdami narrated to me, saying: Wahb bin Jarir narrated to us from his father, who said: I saw Abu al-Tufayl in Mecca in the year one hundred in the Sacred Mosque, and he had a dyed beard (Musawwabah).
5647 - My father narrated to me, saying: Husain bin Muhammad al-Marwadhi narrated to us, saying: Abu Ma'shar narrated to us from Abdullah bin Nafi', who said: Zaid bin Thabit was asked, so it was said to him: 'O Abu Sa'id.'
5648 - My father said: And it is narrated in another hadith that it was said to him: 'O Abu Kharijah.'
5649 - My father said: And Qabisah bin Dhu'aib also has the Kunya Abu Sa'id.
5650 - I asked my father about a sheikh from whom Abu Dawud al-Tayalisi narrated, called Ja'far bin Abdullah bin Uthman al-Qurashi. He said: Ja'far is trustworthy.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5651 - Abdullah bin Sandal narrated to me, saying: Khalaf bin Khalifah narrated to us, saying: I saw Amr bin Huraith, the Companion of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, while I was six years old at that time.
5652 - I heard my father say: It reached me from Sufyan bin Uyaynah that he said: He erred. If it was anyone, perhaps he saw Ja'far bin Amr bin Huraith.
5653 - I heard my father say another time: It was said to Sufyan bin Uyaynah that a man in Kufa—I think he said called Khalaf bin Khalifah—claims that he saw Amr bin Huraith. He said: 'He lied; perhaps he saw Ja'far bin Amr bin Huraith.'
5654 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ishaq Abu Amr al-Shaibani informed us, saying: I heard Shu'bah say: 'The Quran was revealed in the dialect of the two Ka'bs: Ka'b bin Lu'ayy and Ka'b of Khuza'ah.'
5655 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya bin Adam narrated to us, saying: Qutbah bin Abd al-Aziz al-Awfi, from Banu Sa'd bin Zaid Manat bin Tamim, informed us.
5656 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya bin Adam narrated to us, saying: Yazid bin Abd al-Aziz bin Siyah al-Asadi informed us.
5657 - My father narrated to me, saying: He said: Affan informed us, saying: Aban informed us from Asim: That Zirr used to take the Quran from Ibn Mas'ud.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5658 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Malik bin Amr informed us, saying: Al-Rabi' bin Abdullah narrated to us from Hafs bin Sulayman. I asked my father about Al-Rabi' bin Abdullah, and he said: Trustworthy.
5659 - My father narrated to me, saying: Zaid bin al-Hubab informed us, saying: Al-Rabi' Abu Muhammad al-Qurashi informed me, saying: Hafs bin Sulayman narrated to me from Al-Hasan.
5660 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Razzaq informed us: Ibn Jurayj informed us from Ata from Ibn Abbas, who said: 'Whoever listens to or hears a verse from the Book of Allah, Mighty and Majestic, it will be a light for him on the Day of Resurrection.' My father said: 'This hadith is Munkar (objectionable).' It was as if he rejected its chain of narration.
5661 - My father narrated to me, saying: Isma'il bin Aban al-Warraq informed us, saying: Ya'qub—meaning Al-Qummi—informed us from Ja'far from Ibn Abza, who said: 'Between the Elephant and the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, being sent, there were ten years; then the Quran was revealed to him.'
5662 - My father said: And Husain—meaning Al-Ashqar—said. My father said: I think he said: 'Forty [years].'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5663 - My father narrated to me, saying: Rawh informed us, saying: Hammad bin Salamah informed us from Ali bin Zaid from Sa'id bin al-Musayyib, who said: 'Jesus, peace be upon him, was raised up when he was thirty-three.'
5664 - My father narrated to me, saying: Muhammad bin Ja'far narrated to us, saying: Shu'bah informed us from Ata bin al-Sa'ib from Ali: That he said regarding [the words] 'unlawful', 'irrevocable', 'separated', 'released', and 'absolved': 'Three, three.' Shu'bah said: Warqa' said to me that he narrates it from Zadhan. So I met Ata and said: 'Who narrated to you from Ali?' He said: 'Abu al-Bakhtari.'
5665 - My father narrated to me, saying: Rawh narrated to us, saying: Hammad narrated to us from Ata bin al-Sa'ib from Abu al-Bakhtari and Maysarah: That Ali said regarding [the phrase] 'Al-Haram' (unlawful): 'She is unlawful for me, just as he said.'
5666 - My father narrated to me, saying: Muhammad bin Fudayl narrated to us from Ata from Al-Hasan from Ali something similar.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5667 - Abu Salih Muhammad bin Yahya bin Sa'id al-Qattan narrated to me in Basra, and Muhammad bin Abdullah al-Ruzzi, both said: Hatim bin Wardan narrated to us, saying: Ayyub narrated to us, saying: The memorizers (Huffaz) of Ibn Abbas gathered with Ikrimah; among them were Sa'id bin Jubair, Ata, and Tawus. Whenever he narrated a hadith, Sa'id bin Jubair would say: 'Like this.' And Abu Salih gestured 'thirty'—meaning he was correct. Until he came to the hadith of the fish. Ikrimah said: 'He was walking alongside them in shallow water.' Sa'id bin Jubair said: 'I bear witness regarding Ibn Abbas that he said: He was carrying it in a basket.' Ayyub said: And I think he—meaning Ibn Abbas—used to say both statements.
5668 - Abu Salih Muhammad bin Yahya bin Sa'id narrated to me, saying: I heard my father narrating from Shu'bah, who said: I asked Amr bin Murrah about Uwais al-Qarni, but he did not know him.
5669 - Muhammad bin Yahya bin Sa'id narrated to me, saying: I heard my father mention: He said: I said to Shu'bah—and he asked me about a man, so I said: 'He is trustworthy.' He said: 'Abdullah bin Uthman said...' as if he did not approve of him. So I said: 'I tell you, and you tell me?' He said: 'You are stricter regarding men [narrators] than him.'
5670 - I heard Muhammad bin Yahya bin Sa'id say: I heard from him in Mecca in the year seventy-seven—meaning Ibn Ayyash Isma'il.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5671 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Yahya al-Himmani narrated to us from Humaid bin Ata al-A'raj, who said: We were in the kuttab (school) of Abdullah bin al-Harith, and he would not take anything [payment] from us, and he was one of the companions of Abdullah.
5672 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Yahya al-Himmani narrated to me, saying: Salamah bin Nubait narrated to us, saying: My grandfather and my uncle were with the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace.
5673 - My father narrated to me, saying: Jabir bin Nuh narrated to us, saying: Al-A'mash informed us from Ibrahim, who said: 'They only began asking about the chain of narration (Isnad) during the days of Al-Mukhtar.'
5674 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Hasan bin Musa informed us, saying: Ya'qub informed us from Ja'far from Sa'id bin Jubair, who said: When the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, conquered Mecca, Abu Barzah al-Aslami—and he is Sa'id bin Harb—caught Abdullah bin Khatal and struck his neck (killed him). He is the one whom Quraysh used to call 'The Possessor of Two Hearts'.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5675 - I asked my father about a hadith narrated to us by Al-Fadl b. Ziyad, who is called Al-Tasi. He said: Isma'il b. Ayyash narrated to us from Musa b. Uqbah from Nafi from Ibn Umar from the Prophet (peace be upon him): "The Junub (person in a state of major impurity) and the menstruating woman should not recite anything of the Quran." My father said: This is false (Batil). He rejected it from Isma'il b. Ayyash, meaning that it is an illusion (Wahm) from Isma'il b. Ayyash.
5676 - I heard my father say: Dahtham b. Quran is nothing; his hadith is dropped. He narrated later from Yahya b. Abi Kathir from a book. He was only known for these two hadiths: the hadith of Nimran b. Jariyah b. Zafar from his father that two slaves went out..., and the hadith of Aqil b. Dinar, the client of Jariyah b. Zafar, from Jariyah b. Zafar: "If a house is between two brothers, and a wall is built in the middle of it..."

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5677 - I asked my father about Suwayd b. Najih Abu Qutbah. He said: I do not see any harm in him. Waki', Muhammad b. Ubayd, and Marwan narrated from him.
5678 - I heard my father say: Abu Al-Jarud Ziyad b. Al-Mundhir is abandoned in hadith (Matruk Al-Hadith), and he weakened him severely.
5679 - My father narrated to me, saying: Waki' informed us, saying: Sufyan informed us from Ghalib Abu Al-Hudhayl, and he is Ibn Al-Hudhayl. This is what Waki' said.
5680 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Ahmad Al-Zubayri narrated to us, saying: Rabah b. Abi Ma'ruf informed us, saying: Al-Mughirah b. Hakim Al-San'ani informed us, saying: I said to Abdullah b. Sa'd, meaning Ibn Khaythamah: "Did you witness Badr?" He said: "Yes, and [the pledge of] Al-Aqabah with my father, riding behind him."

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5681 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ali b. Bahr informed us, saying: Isa b. Yunus informed us, saying: Al-A'mash informed us, saying: I used to approach Ibrahim [Al-Nakha'i] from the side of his healthy eye, seeking to make things easy for him. If a person approached him from the side of his other eye, he would have to turn towards him, and that would be difficult for him.
5682 - I asked my father about the hadith of Humayd Al-Ru'asi from Hasan b. Salih from Harun Abu Muhammad, who said: Muqatil b. Hayyan narrated to me from Qatadah from Anas. My father said: This is not Harun b. Sa'd from whom Sharik narrated. This is another man called Harun Abu Muhammad.
5683 - I heard my father say: Sufyan [Al-Thawri] could not see well with it [his eye]. He said: And I used to sit on the side next to it [the bad eye] so he wouldn't see me writing. He said: He had a stick with him, and if he saw anyone writing, he would point at him with it, or come and stop him. He said: And I did not see Sufyan dictate anything to us except one hadith, the hadith of Abu Sa'd Al-Baqqal, for he dictated it to us. I said: Why? He said: Because of the weakness of Abu Sa'd in his view.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5684 - Uthman b. Abi Shaybah narrated to me, saying: I asked Jarir about Layth, Ata b. Al-Sa'ib, and Yazid b. Abi Ziyad. He said: Yazid is the best of them in uprightness in hadith, then Ata b. Al-Sa'ib. And Layth was the most confused (Takhlit) of them. I asked my father about this, and he said: I say as Jarir said.
5685 - My father narrated to me, saying: Hajjaj b. Muhammad Abu Muhammad Al-Tirmidhi narrated to us from Ibn Jurayj, saying: Sulayman b. Umayyah Al-Thaqafi informed us that Hud is from Banu Abd Al-Sahm from Hadramaut.
5686 - My father narrated to me, saying: Waki' narrated to us, saying: Mis'ar narrated to us from Uthman Al-Thaqafi. Waki' said: He is Uthman Al-A'mash, and he is Ibn Abi Zur'ah b. Al-Mughirah.
5687 - My father narrated to me, saying: Waki' informed us, saying: Abu Khuzaymah Al-Sabbagh informed us from Yusuf b. Maymun.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5688 - My father narrated to me, saying: Waki' informed us, saying: Abu Talut Al-Jurayri [is] Abdus-Salam b. Shaddad informed us.
5689 - I asked my father about the hadith of Hisham b. Urwah from Abu Bakr b. Abi Mulaykah that Aisha used to be led in prayer by a slave of hers who was a Mudabbar (promised freedom upon death). My father said: It is only Abdullah b. Abi Mulaykah.
5690 - My father narrated to me, saying: Waki' informed us, saying: Sulayman b. Al-Mughirah informed us from Muhammad b. Sirin, who said: I asked Ibn Umar about reciting behind the Imam. He said: The recitation of the Imam suffices you. My father said: Waki' said "Muhammad b. Sirin," but in our copy it was not Muhammad b. Sirin. My father said: This is only known from Anas b. Sirin. It is as if he sees that Waki' was mistaken in it.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5691 - I heard my father say: Abu Nu'aym Al-Nakha'i is nothing. I presented to him his hadith from Sharik from Ibrahim b. Muhajir from Ziyad b. Hudayr from Ali: "There is no covenant (Dhimmah) for the Christians of Banu Taghlib."
5692 - My father narrated to me, saying: Waki' informed us from Malik b. Anas from Bukayr b. Abdullah Al-Ashajj. My father said: Malik did not hear anything from Bukayr b. Abdullah.
5693 - My father narrated to me, saying: Waki' informed us from Sufyan from Sulayman Al-Absi. My father said: He is trustworthy, meaning Sulayman b. Abi Al-Mughirah.
5694 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdur-Rahman b. Mahdi informed us, saying: Muhammad b. Hilal informed us, saying: I heard Umar b. Abdul-Aziz. My father said: Muhammad b. Hilal is a trustworthy Sheikh.
5695 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdur-Rahman b. Mahdi informed us from Shu'bah from Abdullah b. Yazid from Abu Zur'ah from Abu Hurayrah from the Prophet (peace be upon him) who said: "Name yourselves with my name, but do not use my Kunya." And he used to dislike the Shikal (having three white legs and one different, or vice versa) in horses. My father said: He is Silm b. Abdur-Rahman, but Shu'bah made a mistake.
5696 - My father said: Sufyan Al-Thawri did not hear from Abu Awn except this single hadith, meaning the hadith of Wudu from what fire has touched. And the rest, he narrates them from him as Mursal.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5697 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdur-Rahman b. Mahdi narrated to us, saying: Hammad b. Salamah informed us from Hisham b. Urwah from Yahya b. Sa'id from Urwah b. Al-Zubayr, who said: The runaway slave (Abiq) is [hand] cut if he steals.
5698 - Hammad b. Zayd said: A man asked Hisham b. Urwah about it. He said: I did not hear it from my father, but the trustworthy one whom I trust with what is hidden from me, Yahya b. Sa'id, narrated it to me.
5699 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdur-Rahman b. Mahdi narrated to us from Hammad b. Zayd, who said: I met Yahya b. Sa'id and asked him about it. He narrated it to me that the governor of Medina asked Al-Qasim b. Muhammad and Salim about the runaway slave if he steals. Salim said: "He is cut." And Al-Qasim recited: {And the thief, male and female, cut off their hands}.
5700 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdur-Rahman b. Mahdi narrated to us from Sufyan from Salih, meaning Al-Thawri [from Salih b. Salih? or Salih b. Nabhan? Context usually implies Sufyan Al-Thawri narrates], from Abu Ma'shar that the Prophet (peace be upon him) used to tend to his pubic area with his own hand. And from Mansur from Habib b. Abi Thabit.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5701 - Abu Abdur-Rahman said: And Aban, meaning Al-Attar, informed us from Abu Hashim from Abu Ma'shar from Habib b. Abi Thabit that the Prophet (peace be upon him), meaning he used to tend to his pubic area with his own hand.
5702 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdur-Rahman b. Mahdi narrated to us from Sarrar Abu Ubaydah from Ibn Abi Arubah. My father said: This Sarrar was one of the senior companions of Sa'id b. Abi Arubah, and he is trustworthy.
5703 - My father narrated to me, saying: Waki' informed us, saying: Shu'bah informed us from Umm Salamah Al-Atakiyyah. My father said: Umm Salamah is Shumaysah.
5704 - I asked my father about the hadith of Ammar b. Muhammad, the nephew of Sufyan, from Sufyan from Abu Ishaq from Al-Bara regarding His saying, Mighty and Glorious is He: {Look at its fruit when it bears fruit}. He said: Its ripening is when it becomes ripe.
5705 - My father said: This is not from the hadith of Abu Ishaq. He is confused [in it]. It is as if he rejected it from the hadith of Ammar, implying it is an illusion (Wahm). Ibrahim Al-Harawi narrated the hadith to us.
5706 - I asked my father about a hadith narrated to us by Ibrahim Al-Harawi, saying: Ammar b. Muhammad informed us, saying: Al-Salt b. Quwayd Al-Hanafi informed us from Abu Ahmar, who said: I heard Abu Hurayrah say: I heard my close friend Abu Al-Qasim (peace be upon him) say: "The Hour will not be established until a horned [sheep/goat] does not butt a hornless one." My father said: Ammar narrated it to us from Al-Salt b. Quwayd, and it does not contain "from Abu Ahmar." Others besides my father informed us from Ammar from Al-Salt b. Quwayd [from] Abu Ahmar.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5707 - I asked my father about the hadith of Khalaf b. Khalifah, who said: Abu Yazid informed us from Amir. My father said: Abu Yazid is Dawud Al-Awdi, the uncle of Ibn Idris.
5708 - I asked my father about a hadith narrated to us by Al-Harawi, saying: Hushaym informed us, saying: Abdul-Hamid b. Ja'far Al-Ansari informed us from his father from Samurah, who said: "My mother became a widow and came to Medina." My father said: I heard the hadith of Samurah twice from Hushaym saying: "Indeed Samurah..."
5709 - My father narrated to me, saying: Waki' informed us from Shu'bah, who said: Qatadah narrated to me from Abu Talib Al-Hajjam (the Cupper), and he was trustworthy. This is how it is in the hadith.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5710 - My father narrated to me, saying: Waki' informed us, saying: Umarah b. Zadhan informed us from Makhul Al-Azdi. My father said: This is not Makhul Al-Shami (the Levantine); this Makhul Al-Azdi is a man from the people of Basra.
5711 - My father narrated to me, saying: Sufyan b. Uyaynah informed us from Ibrahim b. Maysarah, who said: Mujahid said: I have not seen anyone after Ibn Abbas having more understanding (Fiqh) than Abu Iyad.
5712 - My father narrated to me, saying: Sufyan informed us, saying: Al-Hudhali Abu Bakr said to me: "We have not seen the like of this one," meaning Al-Zuhri. And Al-Hudhali said to me: "Memorize this hadith for me," and it is with Al-Zuhri, meaning the hadith of Al-Zuhri from Abu Idris from Ubadah b. Al-Samit: "We were with the Prophet (peace be upon him) and he said: Pledge allegiance to me that you will not associate anything with Allah."
5713 - My father narrated to me, saying: Sufyan informed us, saying: I memorized it from Al-Zuhri from Urwah from Abdur-Rahman b. Abd Al-Qari that Umar performed Tawaf around the House after the morning [prayer] seven times, then he went out and did not pray the two rak'ahs except at Dhu Tuwa after the sun had risen.
5714 - I heard my father say: Ibn Abi Dhi'b and others said: Yahya b. Sa'id narrated it to us from him, from Al-Zuhri from Humayd b. Abdur-Rahman from Abdur-Rahman b. Abd Al-Qari that Umar performed Tawaf around the House. And this is the correct version, meaning from Humayd.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5715 - My father narrated to me, saying: It was said to Sufyan: Did Al-Zuhri narrate the Tashahhud to you? He said: Yes, but we did not memorize it from him. It was said to him: From whom did he mention it? He said: Urwah from Ibn Abd Al-Qari who said: I heard Umar teaching the people the Tashahhud on the pulpit.
5716 - My father narrated to me, saying: I heard Sufyan say: Ibn Abi Husayn is Abdullah b. Abdur-Rahman b. Abi Husayn b. Al-Harith b. Amir b. Nawfal.
5717 - I heard my father say: Isma'il b. Umayyah b. Amr b. Sa'id b. Al-Aas.
5718 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ibrahim b. Mahdi informed us, saying: I heard Hammad b. Zayd say: I saw Sufyan b. Uyaynah as a boy with a side-lock (Dhu'abah), carrying tablets, at Amr b. Dinar's.
5719 - My father narrated to me, saying: I heard it from Abu Sa'd Al-Saghani Muhammad b. Maysar from Mis'ar, who said: Ma'n b. Abdur-Rahman died in Al-Sawad [rural Iraq], so he was carried to Kufa.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5720 - I asked my father about the hadith of Hajjaj b. Muhammad from Isma'il b. Ayyash, who said: Abdullah b. Dinar narrated to me. My father said: He is called Abdullah b. Dinar Al-Bahrani, and he is not the one who narrates from Ibn Umar.
5721 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ali b. Ishaq informed us, saying: Abdullah b. Mubarak informed us, saying: Sufyan informed us, saying: Nahshal b. Mujammi' Al-Dabbi informed me, and he was satisfactory (Mardiy).
5722 - My father narrated to me, saying: Hajjaj and Aswad b. Amir informed us, saying: Sharik informed us from Abdullah b. Ism Abu Alwan Al-Hanafi.
5723 - I asked my father about Abu Aqil from whom Abu Al-Nadr narrated. He said: This is Abu Aqil Al-Thaqafi, Abdullah b. Aqil; he is sound in hadith (Salih Al-Hadith), trustworthy.
5724 - Abu Abdur-Rahman Abdullah b. Umar narrated to me, saying: Abu Khalid Al-Ahmar informed us from Hajjaj from Ibn Abi Mulaykah from Aisha from the Prophet (peace be upon him): "Whoever buys palm trees that have been pollinated..." And from Hajjaj from Nafi from Ibn Umar from the Prophet (peace be upon him) with the like of it.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5725 - And from Hajjaj from Ibn Abi Mulaykah, Ata, and Makhul from the Prophet (peace be upon him). I asked my father about this hadith. He said: This, they narrate it from Hajjaj from Ibn Abi Mulaykah as Mursal. And this, Ubaydullah and Ayyub narrate it from Nafi from Ibn Umar from Umar as Mursal.
5726 - I asked my father about Sulaym b. Muslim. He said: I saw him in Mecca. His hadith is worth nothing; he is nothing. My father said: He used to be accused of the opinion of Jahm.
5727 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ya'qub informed us, saying: My father informed us from Ibn Ishaq, saying: Imran b. Abi Al-Marajim narrated to me—Amir b. Lu'ayy narrated to me, and he was trustworthy—from Abu Al-Qasim Miqsam, the client of Abdullah b. Al-Harith b. Nawfal.
5728 - I heard my father say: Al-Fadl b. Anbasah is trustworthy, from the senior scholars of hadith.
5729 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Badr Shuja' b. Al-Walid informed us from Ali b. Abd Al-A'la.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5730 - My father said: And Hasan b. Musa narrated to us, saying: Zuhayr narrated to us, saying: Ali Abu Al-Hasan Al-Ahwal informed us, and he is Ali b. Abd Al-A'la.
5731 - I heard my father say: Mu'arrif b. Wasil is trustworthy, trustworthy (Thiqah Thiqah).
5732 - I heard my father say: Abu Al-Muthanna is called Al-Amluki—and some of them said Al-Mulayki—his name is Damdam. Safwan b. Amr and Hilal b. Yasaf narrated from him.
5733 - I heard my father say: Umm Haram, Anas b. Malik narrated from her, and she is his maternal aunt. She went on a military expedition with her husband Ubadah b. Al-Samit. She is Umm Haram bint Milhan, the sister of Umm Sulaym.
5734 - Muhammad b. Abi Bakr Al-Muqaddami narrated to me, saying: Hammad b. Zayd informed us from Khalid from Abu Qilabah from Abu Al-Ash'ath that he heard Uthman say regarding the Sadaqat al-Fitr (Zakat of breaking the fast): "A Sa' of dates or a Sa' of barley or half a Sa'"—meaning of wheat—"on behalf of every small and large person, male and female, free or slave." I narrated this hadith to my father, and he said: Sulayman b. Harb informed us from Hammad b. Zayd from Ayyub with this hadith. My father said: So I narrated it to Abdur-Rahman b. Mahdi, and he said: He made a mistake. So I returned to Sulayman later, and he retracted and said: It is from Khalid.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5735 - Muhammad b. Abi Bakr Al-Muqaddami narrated to me, saying: Hammad b. Zayd narrated to us from Khalid, saying: Abu Qilabah said to us: "Abu Umayyah [Abdul-Karim], the owner of the cloaks (Sahib Al-Aksiyah) came to you, and I narrated it." My father said: He means Abu Umayyah Abdul-Karim.
5736 - I heard my father say: Glory be to Allah! How much better was Waki's memory than Abdur-Rahman's, very much so, very much so.
5737 - I asked my father about the hadith of Waki' from Sufyan from Ibrahim b. Abi Hafsah, who said: I said to Ali b. Husayn: "Indeed, Al-Thumali says..." My father said: He is not the brother of Salim b. Abi Hafsah.
5738 - I heard my father say: Sufyan did not hear from Ibn Ashwa' Sa'id except this hadith, meaning the hadith of Shurayh b. Al-Nu'man from Ali regarding the sacrificial animal: "No slit ear from the front (Muqabalah) nor from the back (Mudabarah)."
5739 - I asked my father about the hadith of Hisham Al-Dastawa'i from Abu Al-Zubayr from Abdullah b. Salamah from Ali or Al-Zubayr, who said: The Prophet (peace be upon him) used to give us a sermon and remind us of the Days of Allah. My father said: I do not think he is the Abdullah b. Salamah from whom Amr b. Murrah narrated; I think he is another man.
5740 - Mansur b. Abi Muzahim informed us, saying: Isma'il b. Ulayyah informed us from Ayyub from Qatadah from Anas, who said: The Prophet (peace be upon him), Abu Bakr, Umar, and Uthman used to open the recitation with {Al-Hamdu lillahi Rabbil-Alamin}. I narrated this hadith to my father, and he said: Isma'il b. Ulayyah informed us of it from Sa'id, and it is not from Ayyub, and he rejected it.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5741 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: He said: I was narrated to from Abu Amr Nu'aym b. Maysarah, who said: Al-Zubayr b. Adi Abu Adi Al-Imami informed us.
5742 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Qatan narrated to us, saying: Al-Mas'udi informed us from Awn b. Abdullah, who said: Abu Hurayrah used to say Takbir when he lowered his head and when he raised it. Al-Mas'udi said: And he had met Umm Al-Darda the Younger. And Abu Hurayrah had met him, meaning Awn.
5743 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Al-Nadr Hashim b. Al-Qasim informed us, saying: Al-Hashraj b. Nubatah Al-Absi Al-Kufi informed us.
5744 - I heard my father say: And I asked him about Muhammad b. Al-Fadl, and he said: He is nothing.
5745 - I heard my father say: Ya'qub b. Muhammad Al-Zuhri is nothing; he is worth nothing.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5746 - I heard my father say: Yahya b. Sa'id informed us, saying: Isma'il b. Abi Khalid narrated to us, saying: Qays b. Abi Hazim narrated to me from Al-Sunabih.
5747 - My father narrated to me, saying: Waki' informed us, saying: Isma'il informed us, saying: Qays narrated to me from Al-Sunabihi.
5748 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ibn Numayr informed us, saying: Isma'il narrated to us from Qays from Al-Sunabihi Al-Ahmasi.
5749 - My father said: And Yazid, meaning Ibn Harun, said: Al-Sunabihi is a man from Bajilah, then Ahmas.
5750 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yunus narrated to us from Hammad b. Zayd from Mujalid from Qays from Al-Sunabih. My father said: And perhaps he said Al-Sunabihi.
5751 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ali b. Ishaq narrated to us, saying: Abdullah, meaning Ibn Al-Mubarak, informed us, saying: Isma'il b. Abi Khalid informed us from Qays b. Abi Hazim from Al-Sunabihi.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5752 - I heard my father say: Abbad b. Abbad from Al-Mujalid b. Sa'id from Qays b. Abi Hazim from Al-Sunabihi.
5753 - My father narrated to me, saying: Muhammad b. Ja'far narrated to us, saying: Shu'bah informed us from Isma'il b. Abi Khalid, saying: I heard Qays b. Abi Hazim say: I heard Al-Sunabihi Al-Bajali.
5754 - My father narrated to me, saying: Al-Walid b. Muslim narrated to us, saying: Sa'id b. Abdul-Aziz narrated to me, saying: Makhul narrated to us from Kathir b. Murrah from Nu'aym b. Hammar Al-Ghatafani.
5755 - My father narrated to me, saying: Al-Hakam b. Nafi' informed us, saying: Isma'il b. Ayyash narrated to us from Bahir b. Sa'd from Khalid b. Ma'dan from Kathir from Nu'aym b. Hammar Al-Ghatafani that a man asked the Prophet (peace be upon him): Which Tashahhud is best?
5756 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdur-Rahman b. Mahdi narrated to us, saying: Mu'awiyah, meaning Ibn Salih, narrated to me from Abu Al-Zahiriyyah from Kathir b. Murrah from Nu'aym b. Hibbar.
5757 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Sa'id, the client of Banu Hashim, informed us, saying: Muhammad b. Rashid Al-Dimashqi narrated to us, saying: Makhul narrated to us from Kathir b. Murrah Al-Hadrami from Nu'aym b. Khammar.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5758 - My father narrated to me, saying: Hammad b. Khalid narrated to us, saying: Mu'awiyah b. Salih narrated to us from Abu Al-Zahiriyyah from Kathir b. Murrah from Nu'aym b. Hibbar.
5759 - My father narrated to me, saying: Mu'awiyah b. Amr narrated to us, saying: Abu Zayd, meaning Thabit b. Yazid, informed us from Burd from Sulayman b. Musa from Makhul from Kathir b. Murrah Al-Hadrami from Qays Al-Judhami from Nu'aym from the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) that he said: "O Son of Adam! Pray four rak'ahs for Me at the beginning of the day, I will suffice you for the end of it."
5760 - My father narrated to me, saying: Waki' informed us from Malik b. Anas from Ubaydullah b. Abi Bakr Al-Thaqafi from Anas. My father said: And this is a mistake; Waki' made a mistake in it.
5761 - And Ibn Mahdi informed us of it from Malik from Muhammad b. Abi Bakr Al-Thaqafi.
5762 - My father narrated to me, saying: Waki' narrated to us, saying: Mughirah b. Ziyad Abu Hashim narrated to us.
5763 - My father narrated to me, saying: Waki' informed us, saying: Sufyan informed us from Abu Umar Al-Bazzar. Waki' said: And he was trustworthy.
5764 - My father narrated to me, saying: Waki' narrated to us from Sufyan from Ziyad Al-Musaffar Abu Uthman.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5765 - My father narrated to me, saying: Waki' narrated to us from Sufyan from Ziyad Al-Musaffar Abu Uthman, who narrated to me. He [my father] said: Waki' narrated to us, saying: Mis'ar and Sufyan narrated to us from Imran b. Muslim b. Riyah. My father said: He is not Imran b. Muslim Al-Ju'fi.
5766 - I said to my father: Shayban b. Abi Shaybah Al-Ubulli narrated to us, saying: Sulayman b. Al-Mughirah narrated to us from Humayd b. Hilal from Ziyad b. Abdullah Al-Uqayli from a man who said: I came from Sham, and when I was wherever Allah willed on the road, suddenly the land made the people level [disappeared? or smooth terrain?]. I said: Where are these people going? He said: They are going to a monk at the top of this mountain. So my father said: Bahz b. Asad Abu Al-Aswad Al-Ammi narrated to us, saying: Sulayman narrated to us, saying: Humayd informed us from Ziyad b. Matar from a man who had met Ka'b and asked him and heard from him. He said: I came from Sham... and he mentioned the like of Shayban's hadith.
5767 - My father narrated to me, saying: I heard Abdur-Rahman b. Mahdi say: A man said to Sulayman b. Al-Mughirah: "How did you hear these long hadiths?" He said: "I used to wade through the mud (Al-Rudagh) for them."

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5768 - I heard my father say: Sulayman bin al-Mughirah used to memorize these long hadiths, and they were not in a book with him.
5769 - My father narrated to me, saying: Affan narrated to us, saying: Shu'bah narrated to us from Abu Mu'adh Ata bin Abi Maimunah.
5770 - Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ayyub al-Balkhi narrated to us, saying: Hammad bin Zaid narrated to us, saying: Abu Mu'adh Ubaidullah bin Abi Bakr bin Anas bin Malik informed us.
5771 - I said to my father: Ishaq bin Mansur al-Kawsaj narrated to me, saying: Abu Hisham al-Makhzumi informed us. My father said: This Abu Hisham is trustworthy and acceptable (Thiqah Radiy), and he is a Basran.
5772 - I heard my father say: The first time I arrived in Basra was in the year eighty-six; we heard from Bishr bin al-Mufaddal, Marhum, Ziyad bin al-Rabi', and [other] sheikhs. The second was in the year ninety; we heard from Ibn Abi Adi, and we heard the book of Ghundar—meaning the hadith of Shu'bah, Sa'id, Awf, and others. The third was in the year ninety-four, and I stayed with Yahya bin Sa'id for six months. The fourth was in the year two hundred; we heard from Abd al-Samad and Ibn Dawud al-Bursani.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5773 - Abu Salih al-Hakam bin Musa narrated to me, saying: Isma'il bin Ayyash narrated to us from Abd al-Malik bin Abi Ghaniyyah or someone else from Al-Hakam bin Utaybah from Mujahid from Abdullah bin Abbas, who said: When the polytheists turned away from the slain of Uhud, the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, went over the slain. He saw a bad sight; he saw Hamza with his belly ripped open, his nose cut off, and his ears mutilated. He said: 'Were it not that the women would grieve, or that it would become a Sunnah after me, I would have left him until Allah, Mighty and Majestic, resurrected him from the bellies of predatory beasts and birds. And I will surely mutilate seventy of them in his place.' Then he called for a cloak and covered his face with it, but his feet were exposed. So he covered his feet with it, but his face was exposed. So the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, covered his face with it and placed some Idhkhir (lemon grass) on his feet. Then he brought him forward and said Takbir over him ten times... and he mentioned the hadith. I narrated this to my father, and he said: This is from the hadith of Al-Hasan bin Umarah. This is not from the hadith of Ibn Abi Ghaniyyah; Ibn Abi Ghaniyyah is too God-fearing to narrate the likes of this.
5774 - Abu Ma'mar narrated to me, saying: Sufyan bin Uyaynah informed us, saying: Ibn Abi Ghaniyyah narrated to us—Abu Ma'mar said: Meaning Yahya bin Abd al-Malik—from his father: That Salman said: 'If the soul secures its sustenance, it becomes tranquil.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5775 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yazid bin Harun narrated to us, saying: Sulayman bin al-Mughirah informed us, saying: Humaid bin Hilal narrated to us from Abdullah bin al-Samit, who said: Abu Dharr said: We left our people, Ghifar... and he mentioned the hadith of Abu Dharr's conversion. He said: We were cautious of the people of Mecca, for they looked at him with hostility (Shanifu lahu) and gathered against him. My father said: Affan said 'Shifu lahu' and misread it (Sahhaf), but Bahz said 'Shanifu lahu'. He said: And Abu al-Nadr said 'Shanifu'. He said: While the people of Mecca were in a moonlit night (Layla Qamra' Adhiyan). My father said: Affan said 'Adhiyan', and Bahz said 'Adhiyan', and likewise Abu al-Nadr said. We traveled until we came to our people, Ghifar, and some of them accepted Islam before the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, arrived in Medina. Their leader was Khufaf bin Ima' bin Rahadah al-Ghifari, and he was their master. My father said: Bahz said: 'Their leader was Ima' bin Rahadah,' and Abu al-Nadr said 'Ima''.
5776 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya bin Adam and Yahya bin Bukair narrated to us, both saying: Zuhayr informed us from Mutarrif—and Ibn Abi Bukair said in his hadith: Mutarrif narrated to us—from Abu al-Jahm, the freedman of Al-Bara', and he praised him with good, from Khalid bin Wahban.
5777 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya bin Sa'id narrated to us from Abd al-Hamid bin Ja'far, who said: Yazid bin Abi Habib narrated to me from Suwayd bin Qais from Mu'awiyah bin Hudayj from Abu Dharr, who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: 'There is no Arabian horse except that it is permitted with every dawn to supplicate with two supplications. It says: O Allah, You have entrusted me to whom You have entrusted me from the sons of Adam, so make me among the most beloved of his family to him, or the most beloved of his family and wealth to him.' I heard my father say: Amr bin al-Harith contradicted him, so he said: From Yazid from Abd al-Rahman bin Shamasa. My father said: And Al-Layth also said from Ibn Shamasa.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5778 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu al-Yaman informed us, saying: Shu'ayb informed us from Al-Zuhri, who said: Sahl bin Sa'd al-Ansari—and he had seen the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and heard from him—mentioned that he was fifteen years old the day the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, died.
5779 - And he said: Ubayy bin Ka'b narrated to me that the verdict (Fatwa) they used to give stating that 'water is from water' (Ghusl is due only upon ejaculation) was a concession that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, granted at the beginning of Islam, then he ordered us to perform Ghusl (ritual bath) afterwards.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5780 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya bin Ghaylan narrated to us, saying: Rishdin bin Sa'd narrated to us, saying: Amr bin al-Harith narrated to me from Ibn Shihab, who said: Some of those whom I approve of narrated to me from Sahl bin Sa'd al-Sa'idi that Ubayy bin Ka'b narrated to him that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, made it a concession for the believers due to the scarcity of their clothes, then the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, forbade it—meaning the saying 'water is from water'.
5781 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Amir al-Aqadi narrated to us from Muhammad bin Ammar Kashakish. My father said: He is trustworthy.
5782 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Amir narrated to us, saying: Fulaih bin Sulayman narrated to us from Na'im bin Abdullah al-Mujmir.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5783 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: He said: We heard that six of the Prophets have two names in the Quran: Muhammad and Ahmad, Ibrahim and Abraham, Ya'qub and Isra'il, Yunus and Dhu al-Nun, Ilyas and Ilyasin, and Isa and Al-Masih.
5784 - I found in my father's book: Those who narrated from the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, among the women: Fatima bint Muhammad, the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, the Master of the Muslims, the Imam of the Pious, and the Messenger of the Lord of the Worlds, Muhammad bin Abdullah bin Abd al-Muttalib bin Hashim bin Abd Manaf bin Qusayy bin Kilab bin Murrah bin Ka'b bin Lu'ayy bin Ghalib bin Fihr bin Malik bin al-Nadr bin Kinanah bin Khuzaymah bin Mudrikah bin Ilyas bin Mudar. And the wives of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace: Aisha bint Abi Bakr, Hafsa bint Umar, Umm Salamah bint Abi Umayyah, Umm Habiba bint Abi Sufyan, Sawda bint Zam'ah, Zainab bint Jahsh, Maimuna bint al-Harith, Safiyya bint Huyayy,

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text: and Juwayriyah bint al-Harith. These are nine women from the wives of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, who narrated from him. And among those who narrated from him from the women of Quraysh other than his wives: Umm Hani bint Abi Talib, Asma bint Abi Bakr, Umm Kulthum bint Uqbah, and Duba'ah bint al-Zubair bin Abd al-Muttalib. And among those who narrated from him from the women of Medina: Asma bint Umais, Fatima bint Qais, Busrah bint Safwan, Khansa bint Hizam, Umm al-Fadl bint al-Harith, Umm Qais bint Mihsan al-Asadiyyah, Umaymah bint Ruqayqah, Rabi' bint Mu'awwidh, Umm Khalid bint Khalid, Rumaythah—and her hadith is 'The Throne shook at the death of Sa'd bin Mu'adh'—Salamah bint Mughaffal, Judhamah bint Wahb al-Asadiyyah, Umm Ayyub, Umm Sharik, Umm Hisham bint Harithah bin al-Nu'man, Fatima bint Abi Hubaish, Umm Haram bint Milhan the maternal aunt of Anas bin Malik, Umm Mubashshir, Zainab the wife of Abdullah bin Mas'ud, Umm al-Mundhir bint Qais al-Ansariyyah, Raytah, Khawlah bint Qais, Umm Sulayman bin Suhaim the freedwoman of Al-Hakam al-Ghifariyyah, Al-Sumayta, Aisha bint Qudamah, Umm Sabiyyah al-Juhaniyyah, Umm Ruman who is the mother of Aisha, Furay'ah bint Malik, and Umm Humaid the wife of Abu

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text: Humaid, Al-Shifa' bint Abdullah, Umm Amir bint Yazid, Umm Farwah, Umm al-Tufayl the wife of Ubayy bin Ka'b, Umm Sulaym the mother of Anas bin Malik bint Milhan, Khawlah bint Hakim al-Sulamyyah, Buqayrah the wife of Al-Qa'qa' bin Abi Hadrad al-Aslami, Salma bint Qais—and she was one of the maternal aunts of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, who had prayed to both Qiblas with him, Layla bint Qanif al-Thaqafiyyah, a woman from Banu Ghifar—her hadith is 'I came to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and said: We intend to go out with you'—Hamnah bint Jahsh, Umm Bujayd, the paternal aunt of Husain bin Mihsan, Anisah bint Khubaib, Habibah bint Sahl, Durrah bint Abi Lahab, Umm Habiba bint Jahsh, Salma—and she used to serve the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, Umm al-Ala al-Ansariyyah—Kharijah bin Zaid narrated from her, a woman from the early believers (Al-Sabiqat)—her hadith is that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: 'Shall I not inform you of the expiators of sins?', Khawlah bint Thamir, Khuwaylah bint Tha'labah, Umm Ma'qil al-Asadiyyah, Umm Ayman, Umm Malik al-Bahziyyah, a woman whom Ibn Damrah bin Sa'id narrated from his grandmother from a woman of their women who had prayed to both Qiblas, a woman from whom Ata bin Yasar narrated that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, woke up laughing, the wife of Rafi' bin Khadij—her hadith is that Rafi' was wounded with the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and a woman from the Ansar who said: 'The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, entered upon me while I was eating with my left hand.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text: That is fifty-eight women from the people of Medina. My father said: And among those who narrated from him, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, from the people of Mecca: Habibah bint Abi Tajrah—and it is said the mother of the son of Shaybah, and it is said she is Umm Uthman bint Sufyan, and she is the mother of Banu Shaybah the elders—and Umm Razn al-Ka'biyyah, and a woman who said: 'My grandfather was with the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and I was with him wearing two gold earrings, so the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "Two arrows" or "Two brands of fire".' And the grandmother of Abd al-Rahman bin Abi Amr—she is called Kubayshah, and it is said Kabshah—that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, entered upon her and she had a hanging water skin. That is four women. And among those who narrated from him from the people of Sham: Umm al-Darda, Asma bint Yazid bin al-Sakan, and the sister of Abdullah bin Busr, who is called Al-Samma', and Umm Ayman—Makhul narrated from her that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: 'Do not leave the prayer intentionally.' That is four women. And among those who narrated from him from the Kufans: Maimuna bint Sa'd the freedwoman of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, Fatima the sister of Hudhaifah, the daughter of Khabbab,

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text: Umm Sulayman bin Amr bin al-Ahwas—and it is said she is Umm Jundub al-Azdiyyah—Umm al-Husayn al-Ahmasiyyah, a woman from Banu Abd al-Ashhal—her hadith is the hadith of Al-Dayl—Yasirah—her hadith is the hadith of the fingertips: 'Count with the fingertips', Umm Muslim al-Ashja'iyyah—her hadith is that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, came to her while she was in a dome-tent, the sister of Abdullah bin Rawahah—her hadith is 'Going out is obligatory upon every woman wearing a waistband', Qutaylah bint Saifi—her hadith is 'Whatever Allah wills, then you will', Umm Tariq—her hadith is she said: 'The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, came to Sa'd and asked permission to enter, but Sa'd remained silent', Salamah bint al-Hurr, and Umm Waraqah bint Abdullah bin al-Harith—that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to visit her every Friday. That is thirteen. And among those who narrated from him, peace be upon him, from the people of Basra: Maimuna bint Kardam, Umm Ishaq—her hadith is that she ate with the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and with Dhu al-Yadayn, Umm Atiyyah al-Ansariyyah, Qaylah, Bahisiyyah—her hadith is she said: 'My father asked permission from the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, so he entered between him and his shirt', an old woman from Banu Numayr—that she deloused the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, while he was praying at Al-Abtah, an old woman from the Ansar—she said: 'The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, took a pledge from us that we should not wail', the grandmother of Hashraj bin Ziyad—her hadith is 'We went out with the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, in the expedition of Hunayn', a woman from whom Abdullah bin al-Qasim narrated—he said: A neighbor of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, narrated to me that she used to hear the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say at the break of dawn: 'O Allah, I seek refuge in You from the torment of the grave', and the wife of Khalid bin Abdullah bin Harmalah—she said: 'The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, addressed us while his finger was bandaged.' That is ten.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5785 - My father narrated to me, saying: Waki' narrated to us from Sufyan from Ash'ath bin Abi al-Sha'tha' from his paternal aunt from her paternal uncle: 'I was in the market of Dhu al-Majaz wearing a gray cloak of mine which I was dragging. Suddenly, a man poked me with a staff he had. I turned around, and behold, it was the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. He said: "Raise your lower garment (Izar), for it is cleaner and more pious (or longer lasting). Do you not have an example in me?" So I looked, and his Izar was halfway down his shins.'
5786 - My father narrated to me, saying: Bahz informed us, saying: Shu'bah narrated to us, saying: Ash'ath bin Sulaym narrated to us, saying: I heard my paternal aunt narrating from her paternal uncle that he was walking in Medina, and suddenly a man said: 'Raise your Izar, for it is longer lasting and more pious...' and he mentioned the hadith.
5787 - My father narrated to me, saying: Muhammad bin Ja'far narrated to us, saying: Shu'bah and Hajjaj narrated to us, saying: Shu'bah informed me from Al-Ash'ath bin Sulaym, who said: I heard my paternal aunt narrating from her paternal uncle, who said: 'I was walking in Medina, and suddenly a person called me from behind me: "Raise your Izar, for it is longer lasting and more pious"...' and he mentioned the hadith.
5788 - My father narrated to me, saying: Hashim and Hasan bin Musa narrated to us, both saying: Shaiban narrated to us from Al-Ash'ath from Sulaym, who said: My paternal aunt narrated to me from my paternal uncle Abu Ubaidah bin Khalid, who said: 'I came to Medina while I was a young Bedouin man dragging my Izar, so a man caught up with me...' and he mentioned the hadith.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5789 - My father narrated to me, saying: Husain bin Muhammad narrated to us, saying: Sulayman bin Qarm narrated to us from Al-Ash'ath from his paternal aunt Ruhm from Ubaidah bin Khalaf, who said: 'I came to Medina while I was a young man wearing a gray cloak of mine as an Izar...' and he mentioned the hadith.
5790 - I said to my father: Amr al-Naqid narrated to me, saying: Abu Khalid al-Ahmar narrated to us, saying: Khalid narrated to us from Ata from a freedman of his wife from Ali bin Abi Talib, who said: 'Whoever says "Sah" (Hush) has no Friday prayer.' 'I heard it from your Prophet, peace be upon him.' My father said: This is Ata al-Khurasani.
5791 - My father narrated to me, saying: Waki' narrated to us, saying: Sufyan and Abd al-Rahman narrated to us from Sufyan from Simak from Suwayd bin Qais, who said: 'I and Makhramah al-Abdi brought clothes from Hajar. The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, came to us and bargained with us for trousers. We had a weigher weighing for a wage. So the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said to the weigher: "Weigh and tip the scale (give more)."' And Abd al-Rahman added in his hadith: 'And we were at Mina.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5792 - My father said: And Muhammad bin Ja'far and Abd al-Rahman narrated it to us, both saying: Shu'bah narrated to us from Simak bin Harb, who said: I heard Abu Safwan—Ibn Ja'far said in his hadith: 'I heard Abu Safwan Malik bin Umairah.'
5793 - And my father narrated it to us, saying: Yazid narrated to us, saying: Shu'bah informed us from Simak, who said: I heard Abu Safwan Malik bin Umair al-Asadi say: 'I sold the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, a pair of trousers...' and he mentioned the hadith.
5794 - My father narrated to me, saying: Waki' narrated to us, saying: Thawr al-Shami bin Yazid Abu Khalid narrated to us.
5795 - Abu Ibrahim al-Mu'aqqib Isma'il bin Muhammad bin Jablah narrated to us, saying: I said to Marwan al-Fazari: 'What was the name of Abu Ya'fur?' He said: 'Abd al-Rahman bin Ubaid bin Nistas.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5796 - Nasr bin Ali al-Azdi narrated to me, saying: Nuh bin Qais narrated to us, saying: Ash'ath bin Jabir narrated to us from Al-Hasan, who said: 'Abu Bakr al-Siddiq ruled for twenty months.'
5797 - Nasr bin Ali narrated to me, saying: Nuh bin Qais narrated to us, saying: Al-Ash'ath bin Jabir narrated to us from Al-Hasan, who said: 'Adam left Paradise while his language was Syriac, and he will never return to it.' Abu Amr said: I saw Ibn Mahdi and Abu Dawud, and they wrote these two hadiths from Nuh.
5798 - Ibrahim bin al-Hajjaj al-Naji narrated to me, saying: Hammad bin Zaid narrated to us from Ibn Awn, who said: Ibrahim said to us: 'Beware of Al-Mughirah bin Sa'id and Abu Abd al-Rahman'—and some of them said: 'Abu Abd al-Rahim'—'for indeed, they are two liars.'
5799 - Muhammad bin Abbad narrated to me, saying: Sufyan was asked: 'Who was the oldest of the Companions of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace?' He said: 'I thought Ibn Jad'an'—I think from Anas—he said: 'Abu Bakr and Suhail bin Bayda'.'
5800 - Ahmad bin Ibrahim al-Dawraqi narrated to me, saying: Abu Dawud al-Tayalisi narrated to us from Abu Awanah, who said: I said to Shu'bah when I intended to go to Kufa: 'Who should I stick to?' He said: 'Haitham'—meaning Al-Sayrafi.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5801 - Ahmad narrated to me, saying: Abu Dawud narrated to us from Abu Awanah, who said: We were with Al-Hakam one day, and he mentioned a hadith that was not connected (Musnad). He said: 'This is not from his area'—Shu'bah [said?]. He said: So Shu'bah said: 'It is not fitting to narrate much from The Syrian.'
5802 - Ahmad bin Ibrahim narrated to me, saying: Abu Dawud narrated to us, saying: Shu'bah said to me: 'You will not meet the likes of Warqa' until you return.'
5803 - He said: And I heard Shu'bah say: 'If Jarir bin Hazim arrives, isolate me [keep me away].'
5804 - Ahmad bin Ibrahim narrated to me, saying: Uthman bin al-Yaman bin Harun narrated to us, saying: Muhriz bin Huraith narrated to us, saying: Amr bin al-As died in the year forty-three. His son brought him forward on the Day of Fitr (Eid), prayed over him, then led the people in the Eid prayer. End of Part Fifteen of the parts of Abdullah bin Ahmad.
5805 - Abdullah bin Ahmad informed us by license, saying: My father narrated to me, saying: Ya'qub read to me in the Maghazi of Ibn Ishaq from what he narrated from his father: Then Abd al-Muttalib bin Hashim bin Abd Manaf, while he was sleeping in the Hijr (of the Kaaba), was commanded to dig Zamzam. It was buried between Asaf and Na'ilah at the place where Quraysh sacrificed animals. Jurhum had buried it when they departed from Mecca. It is the well of Isma'il bin Ibrahim which Allah gave him to drink from when he was thirsty and young. When Abd al-Muttalib dug it, and Allah guided him to it and singled him out with it, Allah increased him in honor and status among his people. Every watering place in Mecca was abandoned when it appeared, and people flocked to it seeking its blessing and recognizing its virtue due to its location by the House and because it was the drink provided by Allah, Mighty and Majestic, to Isma'il, peace be upon him.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5806 - My father narrated to me, saying: Rawh narrated to us, saying: Hammad—meaning Ibn Salamah—narrated to us from Ali bin Zaid from Sa'id bin al-Musayyib, who said: While Al-Abbas was at Zamzam and they were draining its water fearing it would run dry, Ka'b came and said: 'Drain it and do not fear. By the One in Whose hand is my soul, I find it in the Book of Allah as "Al-Rawa" (the quencher).' Al-Abbas said: 'Which of its springs is most abundant?' He said: 'The spring that comes from the direction of the Hijr.' Al-Abbas said: 'You spoke the truth.' Al-Abbas said: 'Who are you?' He said: 'Ka'b.'
5807 - My father narrated to me, saying: Rawh narrated to us, saying: Sa'id said from Qatada, who said: Ka'b was asked about Zamzam. He said: 'Gabriel struck it with his wing.'
5808 - My father narrated to me, saying: Rawh narrated to us, saying: Ibn Jurayj narrated to us, saying: Ubaidullah bin Abi Yazid informed me from Abdullah bin Ibrahim bin Qarith that Zuyayd bin al-Salt informed him that Ka'b said regarding Zamzam: 'It is a withheld goodness, withheld for you. The first one for whom it was brought forth was Isma'il bin Ibrahim, peace be upon them. And we find it to be food for the hungry and a cure for illness.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5809 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ibrahim bin Khalid al-San'ani the Muezzin narrated to us, saying: Rabah narrated to us from Ibn Jurayj from Ibn Abi Mulaykah regarding His saying, Mighty and Majestic, {And Allah took Ibrahim as a friend}: He said: Ibrahim entered his house, and behold, the Angel of Death was in it. Ibrahim said to him: 'Who allowed you in?' He said: 'Its Lord.' He said: 'Who is its Lord?' He said: 'Your Lord.' He said: 'You have spoken the truth.' He said: And he was forbearing as Allah, Mighty and Majestic, said. So Ibrahim said to him: 'And who are you?' He said: 'The Angel of Death.' He said: 'You have been described to me with signs that I do not see in you.' He said: 'Turn around.' So he turned around. He said: 'So look.' So behold, there were eyes looking forward and backward, and on every hair of his was the likeness of a standing man. Ibrahim said: 'I have never seen a sight more horrific than this sight, and I just saw you in a form better than this form.' He said: 'Indeed, when I come to one whom Allah, Mighty and Majestic, loves'—or he said something similar—'I come to him in that form. And when I come to one whom Allah, Mighty and Majestic, dislikes, I come to him in this form.'
5810 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: He said: Muhammad bin Idris—meaning Al-Shafi'i—narrated to us, saying: The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, is Muhammad bin Abdullah bin Abd al-Muttalib. And Abd al-Muttalib is Shaybah. And the name of Hashim is Amr bin Manaf. And the name of Abd Manaf is

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text: Al-Mughirah bin Qusayy. And the name of Qusayy is Zaid bin Kilab bin Murrah bin Ka'b bin Lu'ayy bin Ghalib bin Fihr bin Malik bin al-Nadr bin Kinanah bin Khuzaymah bin Mudrikah bin Ilyas bin Mudar. The first people to meet him [in lineage] are Banu Abd al-Muttalib. And the progeny among them are in Banu al-Abbas bin Abd al-Muttalib and in the family of Abu Talib bin Abd al-Muttalib. From them are Ali, Ja'far, and Aqil, the sons of Abu Talib. And Banu Abu Lahab and Banu al-Harith bin Abd al-Muttalib. Then Banu al-Muttalib bin Abd Manaf meet him. Among them are Al-Shafi', the family of Rukanah, and the family of Ujayr, Banu Abd Yazid bin Hashim bin al-Muttalib. And among them are Ubaidah, Al-Husayn, and Al-Tufayl, the sons of Al-Harith bin al-Muttalib, and Mistah bin Uthathah bin al-Muttalib; these four are Badris (witnessed Badr). And among them is the family of Abu Makhramah bin al-Muttalib, and they are the family of Abu Nabqah bin al-Muttalib. And Banu Abd Shams bin Abd Manaf. Among them are Uthman bin Affan bin Abi al-As Umayyah bin Abd Shams bin Abd Manaf, and Marwan bin al-Hakam bin Abi al-As bin Umayyah. And among them is Mu'awiyah bin Abi Sufyan bin Harb bin Umayyah. And among them is Sa'id bin al-As bin Sa'id bin al-As bin Umayyah bin Abd Shams. And among them is Abu Hudhaifah bin Utbah bin Rabi'ah bin Abd Shams, and he is a Badri. And among them is Abdullah bin Amir bin Kurayz bin Habib bin Abd Shams. And Banu Nawfal bin Abd Manaf. Among them is Jubair bin Mut'im bin Adi bin Nawfal bin Abd Manaf.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text: And among them is Ubaidullah bin Adi bin al-Khiyar bin Adi bin Nawfal bin Abd Manaf. And among them is the family of Abu Husayn, and they are from Banu Sirwa'ah who killed Khubaib. And among them are Banu Amir bin Nawfal bin Abd Manaf. And from him is Qarazah bin Abd Amr bin Nawfal bin Abd Manaf. Then Asad bin Abd al-Uzza bin Qusayy and Banu Abd al-Dar bin Qusayy—who are the Hajabah (custodians of the Kaaba)—meet him. And from Banu Asad is the Mother of the Believers Khadija bint Khuwaylid bin Asad. And the closest person to her is Hakim bin Hizam bin Khuwaylid, who accepted Islam one day before the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, conquered Mecca. And among them is Al-Zubair bin al-Awwam bin Khuwaylid, and his kinship and Hakim's kinship from her are the same. And among them is Waraqa bin Nawfal bin Asad, about whom it is said that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: 'Do not insult Waraqa, for I saw one or two gardens for him.' And among them is the family of Humaid bin Zuhayr. And from Banu Abd al-Dar Qusayy is Mus'ab bin Umair, who was killed at Uhud. And among them is Al-Nadr bin al-Harith, whom the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, killed in captivity upon his return from Badr. And among them are the sons of Abu Talhah, and they are the Hajabah; most of them were killed on the Day of Uhud as polytheists, and they were the standard-bearers of Quraysh.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text: And from Banu Abu Talhah are the family of Shaybah bin Uthman and the family of Nabih bin Wahb. Then Banu Zuhra bin Kilab. Among them are Abd al-Rahman bin Awf, Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas, Al-Miswar bin Makhramah, Abd al-Rahman bin Azhar bin Abd Awf, Ibn Shihab—Muhammad bin Muslim bin Ubaidullah bin Shihab al-Zuhri—and Al-Aswad bin Abd Yaghuth. Then Banu Taym bin Murrah and Banu Makhzum bin Yaqzah bin Murrah. From Banu Taym bin Murrah is Abu Bakr al-Siddiq—and he is Abdullah bin Uthman—and Aisha, the Mother of the Believers, and Talhah bin Ubaidullah. And among them is the family of Jad'an bin Amr and the family of Hisham bin Zuhra. And among them is a people called Banu Shatim, and they have a good lineage among them. And the family of Mu'adh bin Abd al-Rahman. And among them is Muhammad bin Ibrahim bin al-Harith al-Taymi. And from Banu Makhzum is Abu Salamah bin Abd al-Asad bin Hilal bin Abdullah bin Umar bin Makhzum. And among them is the family of A'idh bin Abdullah bin Umar bin Makhzum. And from the family of A'idh are Al-Saifi and Al-Sa'ib bin Abi al-Sa'ib, the partner of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and Abdullah, the two sons of Abbad bin Ja'far. And among them are Banu al-Mughirah bin Abdullah bin Umar bin Makhzum. From Banu al-Mughirah bin Abdullah is the Mother of the Believers Umm Salamah bint Abi Umayyah, and her brother Abdullah bin Abi Umayyah, who witnessed [the battle of] Ta'if with the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text: Among them is Khalid b. Al-Walid b. Al-Mughirah; the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) sent him to his enemy, and at his hands was the conquest of most of the Apostasy wars, and he had a commendable performance in Islam. Among them are Al-Walid b. Al-Walid and Ayash b. Abi Rabi'ah, for whom the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) supplicated in the prayer. Among them is Al-Muhajir b. Abi Umayyah, who witnessed the conquest of Al-Nujayr, and Ziyad b. Labid Al-Ansari. Among them is Ikrimah b. Abi Jahl b. Hisham; he had a commendable performance in Islam, his Islam was praiseworthy and good when he entered into it. Among them is Al-Harith b. Hisham, who died in the plague in Sham. Among them is Abdullah b. Abi Rabi'ah, Umar's governor over a part of Yemen, which is Al-Janad. From Banu Makhzum are the family of Imran b. Makhzum, and they are the maternal uncles of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him); Ibn Abdullah b. Abdul-Muttalib is from them. So, from Banu Imran b. Makhzum is Sa'id b. Al-Musayyib. Then Jumah. And among them are maternal uncles. And Adi b. Ka'b, the Prophet (peace be upon him) meets with them [in lineage]. So from Banu Adi b. Ka'b is Umar b. Al-Khattab, Hafsah bint Umar the Mother of the Believers, Abdullah b. Umar, and Salim. Among them is Sa'id b. Zayd b. Amr b. Nufayl. Among them are the family of Muti' and the family of Suraqah. In Banu Suraqah there is precedence [in Islam], and they have an alliance. And from Banu Jumah are the family of Maz'un; they migrated entirely. So from Banu Jumah are Uthman and Qudamah. And from Banu Jumah are the family of Abdullah b. Safwan and the family of Ubay b. Khalaf.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
And from Banu Sahm: Abdullah b. Hudhafah, Amr b. Al-Aas, Hisham b. Al-Aas, the family of Nabih and Munabbih the sons of Al-Hajjaj, and the family of Abu Wada'ah; among them is Al-Muttalib b. Abi Wada'ah, and among them is Kathir b. Kathir b. Al-Muttalib. And from Banu Sahm are the family of Qays b. Adi; among them is Abdullah b. Al-Ziba'ra b. Qays the poet. Then from Banu Amir b. Lu'ayy; among them is Abu Subrah b. Abi Rahm, a Badri (veteran of Badr). Among them are the family of Masahiq and the family of Sahl b. Amr, the brother of Suhayl b. Amr, the holder of the contract for Quraysh on the Day of Hudaybiyah, and the one who stood speaking in Mecca on the day the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) died. He died in Sham in the plague, and his Islam was praiseworthy from the time he entered it in the Year of the Conquest. Among them is Huwaytib b. Abd Al-Uzza; his Islam was praiseworthy, and he was the oldest of Quraysh in Mecca as a chieftain in the Jahiliyyah. Among them is Amr b. Abd, who was killed as a polytheist on the Day of the Trench. Among them are the family of Aws. And Banu Fihr; among them are Banu Al-Harith b. Fihr, and the house of Banu Al-Harith is the family of Al-Harith b. Amr. And from Banu Al-Harith is Al-Hilm(?). And from Banu Muharib b. Fihr is Abu Ubaydah b. Abdullah b. Al-Jarrah. And the mother of the Prophet (peace be upon him) is Aminah bint Wahb b. Abd Manaf b. Zuhrah. And Sa'd b. Abi Waqqas b. Wuhayb b. Abd Manaf b. Zuhrah.
5810 - B: I found in my father's book: Muhammad b. Idris, meaning Al-Shafi'i, narrated to me, saying: When Umar b. Al-Khattab wanted to establish the Diwans (registries) and place people according to their tribes—and there was no Diwan before him—he consulted the people. He said: "With whom do you see [that we should start] forever?" A speaker said to him: "Start with your own kin." He said: "No, rather I will start with the closest, then the closest to the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him)."

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text: So he began with Banu Hashim and Banu Al-Muttalib. He said: "I was present with the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) in the year of Hunayn when he gave them the Khums (one-fifth share) together, excluding Banu Abd Manaf." If seniority was found in Banu Hashim, he gave it precedence, and if it was in Banu Al-Muttalib, he gave it precedence. He used to do the same with all the tribes, inviting them according to age. Then he looked, and the kinship of Banu Abd Shams and Banu Nawfal to the Prophet (peace be upon him) was equal to him. He saw that Abd Shams was the full brother of Hashim (by mother) unlike Nawfal, so he considered him closer due to this. He also saw in them precedence [in Islam] and marriage ties to the Prophet (peace be upon him) which Banu Nawfal did not have, so he prioritized their call over the call of Banu Nawfal, then [Nawfal] after them. Then the kinship of Banu Asad b. Abd Al-Uzza and Banu Abd Al-Dar became equal to him. He saw that Banu Asad had precedence and marriage ties—meaning to the Prophet (peace be upon him)—and that they were from the Mutayyabin (Scented Ones) and from the Hilf al-Fudul (Alliance of Virtues), and that they were more defensive of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him), so he prioritized them over Banu Abd Al-Dar. Then he placed Banu Abd Al-Dar after them. Then he considered the family of Banu Zuhrah, and no one disputes them. Then the kinship of Banu Taym b. Murrah and Banu Makhzum b. Yaqzah b. Murrah became equal to him. He saw that Banu Taym had precedence and marriage ties to the Prophet (peace be upon him), for Banu Taym were from the Mutayyabin and from the Hilf al-Fudul, so he prioritized them over Banu Makhzum. Then he placed Banu Makhzum after them. Then the kinship of Banu Jumah, Sahm, and Adi b. Ka'b—his own clan—became equal to him. He said: "As for Banu Adi b. Ka'b and Sahm, they are together, and that is because Islam entered upon them while they were like that. But with whom do you see that I should begin? With Sahm or Jumah? Indeed, I see that I should begin with Jumah, but I do not know if seniority belongs to Jumah or the other." Then he placed Banu Sahm and Banu Adi after them. Then he placed Banu Amir b. Lu'ayy, then Banu Fihr. They claimed that when Abu Ubaydah b. Al-Jarrah saw who was being placed before him, he said: "Is it claimed that [someone] is placed before me?" He said: "You are where Allah placed you." So when he saw his distress...

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
...he said: "As for myself and my household, I am happy to put you forward. Speak to your people; if they are happy with that, I will not prevent you." Banu Al-Harith b. Fihr claimed that Umar prioritized them and placed them after Banu Abd Manaf or after Banu Qusayy. I asked the people of knowledge among his companions about that, and they denied it and said: Abu Ubaydah is from Banu Muharib b. Fihr, not from Banu Al-Harith. This claim of precedence is misplaced for Banu Al-Harith, not for Banu Muharib. Rather, Mu'awiyah b. Abi Sufyan prioritized them because of maternal uncles he had among them.
5811 - My father narrated to me, saying: Bahz narrated to me, saying: Ibrahim b. Sa'd narrated to me, saying: Ibn Shihab narrated to us from Mahmud b. Al-Rabi', who remembered (aqala) a mouthful of water the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) spat (majja) into his face from a bucket from a well belonging to them.
5812 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ibrahim b. Khalid narrated to us, saying: Rabah narrated to us from Ma'mar from Al-Zuhri, who said: Mahmud b. Al-Rabi' narrated to me, and he remembered a mouthful of water the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) spat into his face from a bucket from a well belonging to them.
5813 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ibrahim b. Khalid narrated to us, saying: Rabah narrated to us from Ma'mar from Al-Zuhri, who said: He narrated to me—and he remembered a mouthful of water the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) spat into his face from a bucket from a well belonging to them which was in their house.
5814 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdur-Razzaq narrated to us, saying: Ma'mar narrated to us from Al-Zuhri, who said: Mahmud narrated to me that he remembered the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him), and he remembered a mouthful of water the Prophet (peace be upon him) spat from a bucket that was in their house.
5815 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Al-Mughirah narrated to us, saying: Ibn Ayyash, meaning Isma'il, narrated to us, saying: Shurahbil b. Muslim Al-Khawlani narrated to me, saying: I saw seven individuals; five had accompanied the Prophet (peace be upon him), and two had consumed blood in the Jahiliyyah and did not accompany the Prophet (peace be upon him). As for the two who did not accompany the Prophet (peace be upon him), they are Abu Inabah Al-Khawlani and Abu Falih Al-Anmari.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5816 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting in another hadith from the hadith of Abu Inabah Al-Khawlani: He said: I heard the Prophet (peace be upon him) say: "Allah continues to plant in this religion [people] whom He employs in His obedience."
5817 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdur-Razzaq narrated to us, saying: Ma'mar narrated to us from Qatadah from Al-Hasan and others, who said: The first to believe in him was Ali b. Abi Talib, and he was fifteen or sixteen years old. Ma'mar said: And Uthman Al-Jazari informed me from Miqsam from Ibn Abbas that Ali was the first to accept Islam. Ma'mar said: So I asked Al-Zuhri, and he said: We do not know of anyone who accepted Islam before Zayd b. Harithah.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5818 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdur-Razzaq narrated to us, saying: Ma'mar narrated to us from Al-Zuhri in his hadith from Urwah, who said: Then the Battle of Uhud was in Shawwal, exactly six months after the incident of Banu Al-Nadir.
5819 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdur-Razzaq narrated to us, saying: Ma'mar narrated to us, saying: Someone who heard Ikrimah say narrated to me: The Prophet (peace be upon him) stayed in Mecca for fifteen years; of which four or five he called to Islam secretly while he was fearful. Then he was ordered to leave for Medina, so he arrived when eight nights had passed of the month of Rabi' al-Awwal. Then was the Battle of Badr. And two months before the Battle of Badr was a platoon (Sariyah), the day Ibn Al-Hadrami was killed. Then was Uhud. Then the Day of the Confederates (Al-Ahzab) was two years after Uhud. Then was Al-Hudaybiyah, which is the Day of the Tree, and the Prophet (peace be upon him) made peace with them on that day. Then he went out to Khaybar after twenty nights. Then to Ta'if. Then he returned to Medina. Then he appointed Abu Bakr over the Hajj. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) performed Hajj the following year. Then he bid farewell to the people.
