Then he returned and died (peace be upon him) when two nights had passed of the month of Rabi' [al-Awwal]. When Abu Bakr returned from the Hajj, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) raided Tabuk.
5820 - My father narrated to me, saying: Al-Hakam b. Nafi' narrated to us, saying: Isma'il b. Ayyash narrated to us from Damdam b. Zur'ah from Shurayh b. Ubayd who said: Utbah, meaning Ibn Abd Al-Sulami, used to say: "Irbad is better than me." And Irbad used to say: "Utbah is better than me; he preceded me to the Prophet (peace be upon him) by a year." My father narrated to me, saying: Abdus-Samad b. Abdul-Warith narrated to us, saying: Abu Khaldah informed us, saying: I heard Abu Al-Aliyah say: During the time of Ali and Mu'awiyah, and I was a young man then, fighting was more beloved to me than good food. He said: I equipped myself with good equipment until I came to them, and behold, two rows [of armies] whose ends could not be seen. I said: "Who compelled me to do this?" He said: So I did not touch anything until I returned.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5821 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ibrahim b. Ishaq, meaning Al-Taliqani, narrated to us, saying: Abdullah b. Al-Mubarak narrated to us from Yahya b. Hassan from the people of Bayt al-Maqdis (Jerusalem)—and he was an old Sheikh with good understanding—from Rabi'ah b. Amir who said: I heard the Prophet (peace be upon him) say: "Persist with [saying] 'O Possessor of Majesty and Honor' (Ya Dhal-Jalali wal-Ikram)."
5822 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Sa'id the client of Banu Hashim narrated to us, saying: Mahdi b. Imran Al-Mazini narrated to me, saying: I heard Abu Al-Tufayl being asked: "Did you see the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him)?" He said: "Yes." It was said: "Did you speak to him?" He said: "No."

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5823 - My father narrated to me, saying: Zayd b. Al-Hubab narrated to us, saying: Abdur-Rahman, meaning Ibn Thabit b. Thawban, narrated to me, saying: Umayr b. Hani narrated to me, saying: Ibn Munqidh, a companion of Al-Hajjaj, narrated to me: When Al-Hajjaj killed Sa'id b. Jubayr, he did not sleep for three nights, saying: "What is between me and Sa'id b. Jubayr?"
5824 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya b. Hammad narrated to us, saying: Abu Awanah informed us from Ya'la b. Ata from Waki' b. Hudus Abu Mus'ab Al-Uqayli from his uncle Abu Razin, who is Laqit b. Amir b. Al-Muntafiq, that he said: "O Messenger of Allah, we used to slaughter sacrifices in Rajab, and we would eat from them and feed whoever came to us." The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "There is no harm in that." Waki' said: "So I will never leave it."

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5825 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdur-Rahman b. Mahdi narrated to us from Hammad and Bahz, who said: Hammad b. Salamah narrated to us from Ya'la b. Ata from Waki' b. Hudus from his uncle Abu Razin Al-Uqayli: I said, "O Messenger of Allah, how will we see our Lord?" And he mentioned the hadith. And I think my father said: In the book of Al-Ashja'i from Sufyan from Ya'la b. Ata from Waki' b. Hudus.
5826 - My father narrated to me, saying: Hushaym narrated to us, saying: Ya'la b. Ata informed us from Waki' b. Udus from his uncle Abu Razin.
5827 - My father narrated to me, saying: Muhammad b. Ja'far narrated to us, saying: Shu'bah narrated to us from Ya'la b. Ata from Waki' b. Udus from his uncle Abu Razin. My father said: The correct one is what Hammad b. Salamah, Abu Awanah, and Sufyan said: they said "Waki' b. Hudus." The error, in his view, was what Shu'bah and Hushaym said. And I think he said: Hushaym used to follow Shu'bah.
5828 - My father narrated to me, saying: Mu'tamar b. Sulayman narrated to us from Humayd that Anas lived for one hundred years minus one year, and he died in the year ninety-one.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5829 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yazid b. Harun narrated to us, saying: Abu Janab Al-Kalbi Yahya b. Abi Hayyah informed us from Yahya b. Hani b. Urwah from Farwah b. Musayk, who said: I came to the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him). He said: I said, "O Messenger of Allah, what do you say about Saba? Is it a valley or a mountain?" He said: "No, rather it is a man who was from Taghlib. He begot ten [sons]; six went south (Yaman) and four went north (Sham). Those who went south are Al-Azd, Al-Ash'ariyyun, Himyar, Kindah, Madhhij, and Anmar—from whom are Bajilah and Khath'am. And those who went north are Lakhm, Judham, Amilah, and Ghassan."
5830 - My father narrated to me, saying: Husayn b. Muhammad narrated to us, saying: Shayban narrated to us from Al-Hasan b. Al-Hakam from Abdullah b. Abis from Farwah b. Musayk, who said: I came to the Prophet (peace be upon him) and heard a man say: "O Messenger of Allah, is Saba a land or a woman?" He said: "It is neither a land nor a woman, but he is a man who begot ten from the Arabs. Four of them went north and six went south. As for those who went north, they are Akk, Lakhm, Ghassan, and Judham. As for those who went south, they are Al-Azd, Kindah, Madhhij, Himyar, Al-Ash'ariyyun, and Anmar." A man said: "O Messenger of Allah, what is Anmar?" He said: "Those from whom are Khath'am and Bajilah."
5831 - My father narrated to me, saying: Khalaf b. Hisham, meaning Al-Bazzar, narrated to us, saying: Abu Usamah narrated to us, saying: Al-Hasan b. Al-Hakam narrated to us, saying: Abu Subrah Al-Nakha'i informed us from Farwah b. Musayk Al-Ghutayfi, who said: I came to the Prophet (peace be upon him), and he mentioned it, except that he said in his hadith "and Judham," and in the hadith of Shayban it is "Akk."

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5832 - And Abu Firas, the client of Abdullah b. Amr b. Al-Aas, his name is Yazid b. Rabah. My father narrated it to me, saying: Zayd b. Al-Hubab Abu Al-Husayn Al-Ukkli narrated to us, saying: Abdur-Rahman, meaning Ibn Shurayh, narrated to me, saying: Ubaydullah b. Al-Mughirah narrated to me, saying: I heard Yazid b. Rabah Abu Firas.
5833 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Zakariyya b. Adi narrated to me, saying: Ubaydullah b. Amr informed us, saying: I, Ayyub, and Ma'mar were together when a beggar came and asked Ayyub. He said: A man lied about him [the beggar], so he [the beggar] made his wealth charity if he forgave [?]. He said: So Ayyub said: "Ask this Yemeni," meaning Ma'mar. He said: So Ma'mar narrated to us from Ibn Tawus that his father granted a concession in turning him away [not giving]. He said: Then Ayyub said: "I heard Ata granting a concession in turning him away."
5834 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: He said: Abu Al-Nadr Hashim b. Al-Qasim narrated to us: The children of Abu Bakrah are Abdur-Rahman, Ubaydullah, Muslim, and Sahl. And in what my father narrated to me from some of his Sheikhs, he said: And Yazid b. Abi Bakrah.
5835 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: He said: Abdullah b. Yazid Abu Abdur-Rahman Al-Muqri narrated to us, saying: Sa'id, meaning Ibn Abi Ayyub, narrated to us, saying: I heard Ata b. Dinar say: Mu'adh accepted Islam when he was eighteen years old.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5836 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: He said: Abu Abdur-Rahman Al-Muqri narrated to us, saying: I heard Al-Mas'udi say: I came as a delegate to Umar b. Abdul-Aziz, and he allocated a stipend for me. He said: And I heard him recite this verse: {And they cease not to differ, except those on whom your Lord has mercy, and for that He created them}. He said: "He created the people of His mercy so that they would not differ."
5837 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: He said: Abdullah b. Yazid Abu Abdur-Rahman narrated to us, saying: Sa'id, meaning Ibn Abi Ayyub, narrated to us, saying: Imran b. Yahya Al-Mu'afiri narrated to me, saying: I heard Ibn Al-Musayyib say: "Abraham was circumcised when he was forty years old."
5838 - I heard my father mention Shu'ayb b. Harb, and he said: I only knew him to be a righteous man. He said: He had a hadith that we did not hear from him. I said to my father: "What is it?" He said: From Malik b. Mighwal that Abdur-Rahman b. Al-Aswad used to recite Talbiyah saying: "Labbayk, I am the Hajj (pilgrim), son of the Hajj. Labbayk, I am the Hajj, son of the Hajj."
5839 - I heard my father say: I heard two hadiths from Abdullah b. Raja Al-Makki Abu Imran.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5840 - Abdullah b. Raja Al-Makki narrated to us from Hisham that Al-Hasan and Muhammad [Ibn Sirin]'s opinion was not to recite "Bismillah Al-Rahman Al-Rahim" aloud.
5841 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdullah b. Raja narrated to us, saying: Ubaydullah said: Nafi said: Ibn Umar said: "He wipes [over boots] as long as he does not take them off." And he did not set a time limit for taking them off. My father said: So I said to Ibn Raja: "Say: 'Ubaydullah narrated to us'." My father said: But he used to say: "Ubaydullah said, Nafi said, Ibn Umar said." This is how he used to say it. My father said: I heard these two hadiths from Ibn Raja, but I did not write them down.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5842 - And I heard two hadiths from Abdullah b. Dawud Al-Khuraybi but I did not write them down. And I heard two hadiths from Asim b. Ali but I did not write them down. And I heard one hadith from Yahya b. Sulaym. Then, years later, I saw my father write these hadiths, or some of them. He wrote them from his memory. I thought he feared he might forget them, so he wrote them down.
5843 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdullah b. Dawud narrated to us from Sufyan from Mughirah from Ibrahim and Al-Sha'bi: "If he puts on the garland, then he has entered Ihram," meaning the pilgrim.
5844 - My father narrated to me, saying: Waki' and Abdullah b. Dawud narrated to us from Al-A'mash from Abu Salih, who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "I was sent as a gifted mercy."
5845 - I heard my father say: Husayn b. Muhammad narrated to us, saying: Al-Artabani narrated to us. My father said: They said he is the cousin of Awn. My father said: I do not see any harm in him.
5846 - I heard my father say: Abdullah b. Awn b. Artaban Abu Awn. Abu Abdur-Rahman said: Nasr b. Ali named him for us [as] Al-Artabani, saying: Abdullah b. Hafs Al-Artabani narrated to us.
5847 - I heard my father say: Affan is more established (Athbat) than Abdur-Rahman b. Mahdi. I said to him: "More established than Abdur-Rahman b. Mahdi?" He said: "Yes. Although Abdur-Rahman is a trustworthy man, distinctively good, righteous, and a Muslim. And Abdur-Rahman is Abdur-Rahman." And Yahya b. Sa'id said: "I love that if I am contradicted, Affan agrees with me."
5848 - I heard my father say: We stuck with Affan for ten years, meaning in Baghdad.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5849 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdus-Samad narrated to us, saying: Abu Hilal narrated to us, saying: Abdullah b. Subayh narrated to us from Ibn Sirin, who said: "Samurah [b. Jundub], as far as I knew, was of great honesty, truthful in hadith, and loved Islam and its people."
5850 - I heard my father say: Abu Usamah is Hammad b. Usamah b. Zayd. My father said: And some people say "Hammad b. Zayd narrated to us," attributing him to his grandfather.
5851 - I heard my father say: Abdul-A'la [narrated] from Ibn Al-Hanafiyyah from Ali about the description of the wind. It was as if he did not consider it authentic. I said to my father: "Why?" My father said: "The book of Al-Harith Al-A'war fell into his possession."
5852 - I heard my father mention Harun b. Ma'ruf. He said: He was one of those who stuck closely to Hushaym. He used to spend the night at Hushaym's door, he and a companion of his called Ibn Abi Al-Kabsh.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5853 - I heard my father say: I heard from Sufyan b. Uyaynah the hadith of Ibn Isam from his father: "The Prophet (peace be upon him) sent us in a platoon..." and it contained the poetry completely, but I did not capture the poetry precisely; it got interrupted for me, so I left it, meaning the poetry.
5854 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yunus narrated to us from Shayban from Qatadah: "Kal-Sarim" [like a plucked/burnt garden]: "As if it had been harvested (surimat)."
5855 - I heard my father say: I passed by it between Sana'a and the village of Abdur-Razzaq. I saw the land, and it is called Sarwan. It is a black land where nothing grows. When you exit it, the land is red. You know that it is burnt.
5856 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya b. Hammad narrated to us, saying: Abu Awanah said: I was told that Abu Bishr was in the book of Sulayman b. Qays, meaning Al-Yashkuri.
5857 - I heard my father mention from Ya'qub b. Ibrahim from his father, who said: Muhammad b. Ishaq revised the Maghazi (Military Expeditions) three times. I witnessed and was present for all of that.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5858 - Fadl b. Sahl Al-A'raj narrated to me from Nuh Al-Mu'addib from Ibrahim b. Sa'd, who said: Muhammad b. Ishaq said to me: "You left me cleaner than the night of the return from Hajj (Laylat al-Sadr)."
5859 - I heard my father mention from Waki' b. Al-Jarrah, who said: Qays narrated to us—and Allah is the One whose help is sought—meaning Qays b. Al-Rabi'.
5860 - I heard my father say: The first one to come to us at the end of Hushaym's life seeking the Musnad was Nu'aym b. Hammad. He came to us at the end of Hushaym's life. I think he said: He was a scribe for Abu Asmah. Abu Asmah used to narrate rejected hadiths (Manakir) or abominations (Munkarat). I think he said: He was not that [strong] in hadith. He said: And Abu Asmah was severe against the Jahmiyyah and in refuting them, and Nu'aym b. Hammad learned the refutation of the Jahmiyyah from them. I believe he said: We used to call him Nu'aym the Obligatory (Al-Farid).
5861 - I heard my father mention Yahya b. Yahya and he praised him with good. And I think he said: Khurasan has not produced anyone after Ibn Al-Mubarak like Yahya b. Yahya. He said: We used to call him Yahya the Doubter (Al-Shakkak), meaning because of how often he used to doubt in hadith.
5862 - I heard my father say: I knew Qutaybah b. Sa'id at Waki' b. Al-Jarrah's.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5863 - And I presented to my father the hadiths of Mubarak b. Suhaym, regarding whom Suwayd narrated to us, and he rejected them and did not praise him. I think he said: "He is not trustworthy," and he rejected them strongly, as if he said: "Strike them out."
5864 - I asked my father about Muhammad b. Kathir who narrates from Layth b. Abi Sulaym and Al-Harith b. Hasirah. He said: We tore up his hadith, and he did not approve of him.
5865 - I heard my father mention Ibrahim b. Bashar Al-Ramadi. He said: He used to attend with us at Sufyan b. Uyaynah's. He would dictate to the people what they heard from Sufyan, but sometimes he would dictate to them what they did not hear. He says: As if he changes the wording, so there becomes an addition that is not in the hadith, or something like what my father said. So I said to him one day: "Do you not fear Allah? Woe to you! You dictate to them what they did not hear." My father did not praise him for that and criticized him severely.
5866 - I said to my father: Do you memorize anything from Yahya b. Sa'id from Mu'tamar b. Sulayman? He said: No. Then he said to me: He narrated something from him. I said: Yes, he narrated from Mu'tamar from his father from Ibn Sirin a hadith.
5867 - I heard my father say: Muhammad b. Salamah Al-Harrani would hardly ever say in any of his hadith "Haddathana" (He narrated to us). And likewise, Abu Badr Shuja' b. Al-Walid would not say "Haddathana" nor "Akhbarana" (He informed us). He used to say: "Sulayman b. Mihran mentioned," and "So-and-so mentioned." My father said: How rarely he used to say "Haddathana."

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5868 - My father narrated to me, saying: Bahz and Affan narrated to us, saying: Abu Awanah narrated to us, saying: Ya'la b. Ata narrated to us from Waki' Al-Uqayli from his uncle Abu Razin, and he is Laqit b. Amir.
5869 - I heard my father say: I heard Muhammad b. Salamah say: I heard Ali b. Badhimah, or Ali b. Badhimah narrated to us. And he did not narrate from him except one hadith.
5870 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya b. Hammad narrated to us, saying: Abu Awanah narrated to us from Ya'la b. Ata from Waki' b. Hudus Abu Mus'ab Al-Uqayli from his uncle Abu Razin, and he is Laqit b. Amir.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5871 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yahya b. Adam narrated to us from Sufyan Al-Thawri from Abu Ishaq from Abdullah b. Yazid Al-Ansari, and he had met the Prophet (peace be upon him).
5872 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Bakr b. Ayyash narrated to us, saying: Abu Husayn narrated to me from Abu Burdah who said: I was sitting with Ubaydullah b. Ziyad, and the heads of the Khawarij were brought. Whenever a head was brought, I said: "To the Fire!" So Abdullah b. Yazid said to me: "Do you not know, O nephew, that I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) say: 'Indeed, the punishment of this nation has been placed in its beginning'?"
5873 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Kamil and Al-Hasan b. Musa narrated to us, saying: Zuhayr narrated to us. He said: And Abu Ishaq narrated to us that Abdullah b. Yazid Al-Ansari had seen the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him).

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5874 - My father narrated to me, saying: Husain bin Muhammad narrated to us, saying: Shu'bah narrated to us from Adi bin Thabit, who said: I heard Abdullah bin Yazid—and he is his maternal grandfather—from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, that he forbade plunder and mutilation.
5875 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Samad bin Abd al-Warith narrated to us, saying: Abu Khaldah narrated to us, saying: I said to Abu al-Aliyah: 'Give me some of your books.' He said: 'I did not write anything. If I had written anything, I would have given it to you and honored you. I only wrote three things: the greetings of prayer (Tashahhud), the chapters of divorce, and the rituals of Hajj.'
5876 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Razzaq narrated to us from Ma'mar from Al-Zuhri, who said: Abd al-Rahman bin Azhar used to narrate that Khalid bin al-Walid bin al-Mughirah was wounded on that day, and he was commanding the cavalry, the cavalry of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. Ibn Azhar said: I saw the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, after Allah defeated the disbelievers and the Muslims returned to their camps, walking among the Muslims, saying: 'Who will guide me to the camp of Khalid bin al-Walid?' I walked—or he said I ran—before him, and I was a boy who had reached puberty, saying: 'Who will guide to the camp of Khalid?' until we guided him to his camp.
5877 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdullah bin al-Harith narrated to us, reading to Yunus from Ibn Shihab, who said: Abdullah bin Tha'labah narrated to me, and the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, had wiped his face.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5878 - My father narrated to me, saying: Hajjaj informed us, saying: Layth narrated to us, saying: Uqayl narrated to me from Ibn Shihab from Abdullah bin Tha'labah bin Su'air al-Udhri, and the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, had wiped his face, and he met the Companions of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace.
5879 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu al-Yaman narrated to us, saying: Shu'ayb informed us from Al-Zuhri, who said: Abdullah bin Tha'labah bin Su'air al-Udhri narrated to me, and the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, had wiped his face during the time of the Conquest (of Mecca).
5880 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yazid bin Abd Rabbih narrated to us, saying: Muhammad bin Harb narrated to us, saying: Al-Zubaidi narrated to me from Al-Zuhri from Abdullah bin Tha'labah bin Su'air, who said: And the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, had wiped his face during the time of the Conquest.
5881 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ya'qub narrated to us, saying: My father narrated to us from Ibn Ishaq, who said: Muhammad bin Muslim al-Zuhri narrated to me from Abdullah bin Tha'labah bin Su'air al-Udhri.
5882 - My father said: And in what was read to Ya'qub al-Udhri, the ally of Banu Zuhrah, he said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, looked over the companions of Uhud...

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5883 - My father narrated to me, saying: Affan narrated to us, saying: Abu Khalaf Musa bin Khalaf narrated to us; he was considered one of the Budala' (Substitutes - a rank of righteous people).
5884 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: He said: Ibn Lahi'ah died in the year one hundred and seventy-four. Layth died fourteen months after Ibn Lahi'ah. Bakr bin Mudar died three or four months after Ibn Lahi'ah. And Mufaddal remained for about two years after Al-Layth.
5885 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi narrated to us, saying: Sufyan narrated to us from Abu Ishaq from Abdullah bin Saif, who said: Aisha said: 'Who was appointed over the Hajj season?' They said: 'Ibn Abbas.' She said: 'He is the most knowledgeable of people regarding Hajj.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5886 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi narrated to us, saying: Al-Harith bin Umair narrated to us from Ayyub from Muhammad bin Sirin, who said: They used to think that there was no one more knowledgeable regarding the rituals (Manasik) after Ibn Affan than Ibn Umar. And he said once: Ibn Umar was the most knowledgeable of the Companions of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, regarding the rituals after Ibn Affan.
5887 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi narrated to us, saying: Abdullah bin Umar narrated to us from his brother Ubaidullah from Al-Qasim, who said: 'I never saw anyone more knowledgeable regarding the rituals than Ibn al-Zubair.'
5888 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ibn Fudayl narrated to us, saying: Aslam al-Minqari narrated to us, saying: I was sitting with Abu Ja'far when Ata passed by him. He said: 'There is no one left more knowledgeable regarding the rituals of Hajj than Ata.'
5889 - I heard my father say: I never saw anyone among the jurists and scholars more knowledgeable regarding the Quran and the rituals than Ibn Uyaynah. When he was asked about something regarding the matter of divorce, he would say: 'Let him be asked.'
5890 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ali bin Ishaq narrated to us, saying: Abdullah—meaning Ibn al-Mubarak—narrated to us, saying: Sufyan informed us, saying: Nahshal bin Mujamma' al-Dabbi informed me, and he was acceptable (Mardiy).

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5891 - My father narrated to me, saying: Sulayman bin Harb narrated to us, saying: Hammad bin Zaid narrated to us from Ibn Awn, who said: My father narrated to me from my grandfather Artaban, who said: When I was freed and had gathered wealth, I came to Umar with its Zakat. I said: 'O Commander of the Faithful, this is the Zakat on my wealth.' He said: So he said to me: 'Do you have wealth?' He said: I said: 'Yes.' He said: 'May Allah bless you in your wealth.' He said: I said: 'O Commander of the Faithful, and my child?' He said: 'Do you have a child?' I said: 'Yes.' He said: 'May Allah bless you in your wealth and your child.' Abdullah said: They say that Ibn Awn was indeed reached by the supplication of Umar.
5892 - My father narrated to me, saying: Sulayman bin Harb narrated to us, saying: Nasr Abu Khuzaimah narrated to us—his home is among Banu Kharus. Abu Abd al-Rahman said: I think he is the one from whom Waki' narrated: from Abu Khuzaimah from Anas bin Sirin.
5893 - My father narrated to me, saying: Bakr bin Isa al-Rasibi Abu Bishr narrated to us, saying: Jami' bin Matar al-Habati narrated to us, saying: Abu Ru'bah Shaddad bin Imran al-Qaysi narrated to us.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5894 - My father narrated to me, saying: Rawh narrated to me, saying: Shu'bah narrated to us from Al-Hakam, who said: I heard Urwah bin al-Nazzal or Al-Nazzal bin Urwah narrating from Mu'adh bin Jabal. Shu'bah said: So I said: 'Did he hear it from Mu'adh?' He said: 'He did not hear it from him, but he met him.' That he said: 'O Messenger of Allah, inform me of a deed that will enter me into Paradise.' Al-Hakam said: And I heard it from Maimun bin Abi Shabib.
5895 - I found in my father's book: Husain bin Muhammad narrated to me, saying: Abu Bakr Fitr bin Khalifah al-Hannat narrated to us.
5896 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: He said: I was informed from Hushaym, who said: Abu al-Yusr bin Amr freed Abu al-Hasan.
5897 - He said: And Abu Abdullah al-Misri narrated to me from Ibn... from Ibn Abi Mulaykah, who said: Amr bin al-As said: 'I indeed remember the night Umar bin al-Khattab was born. I was with Quraysh one night when a slave girl of Al-Khattab came to us asking for a firebrand. It was said to her: "What will you do with it?" She said: "I left Hantamah in labor." When we woke up, it was said: A boy was born to Al-Khattab last night.'
5898 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: He said: I was informed from Abdullah bin Yahya bin Abi Kathir that his father died in the year one hundred and twenty-nine.
5899 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Malik bin Ni'wal Abu Abdullah al-Bajali.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5900 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Umar bin Abi Za'idah Abu Hafs is the brother of Zakariya bin Abi Za'idah, and he was older than Zakariya. He said: And Umar narrated from his brother Khalid, who was older than Umar and Zakariya.
5901 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: A sheikh of ours narrated to us, saying: I heard Abu Awanah say: Hammad bin Abi Sulayman said to me: 'Does Abu Hashim narrate among you in Basra?' I said: 'Yes.' He said: 'So why does he name me between him and Ibrahim?'
5902 - I read this speech to my father, and he acknowledged it, and some of it I heard from my father directly. He said: The first year I arrived in Basra was at the beginning of Rajab in the year one hundred and eighty-six. Mu'tamar performed Hajj in it and returned, then died shortly after arriving in the year seven [one hundred and eighty-seven]. And Bishr bin al-Mufaddal became tongue-tied before we left, and he died in the year one hundred and eighty-six. And Ziyad bin al-Rabi' died before we left. We left in Ramadan in the year one hundred and eighty-six.
5903 - My father said: And I arrived the second year in the year ninety [one hundred and ninety]. We stayed with Ghundar, and we used to visit Abd al-Rahman and Ibn Abi Adi. And Ibn Sawa', Abu Abd al-Samad, and Marhum had died.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5904 - My father said: And I arrived in the third year in the year one hundred and ninety-four in Dhu al-Qi'dah. I stayed with Yahya bin Sa'id until the year five [one hundred and ninety-five]. So I stayed the rest of Dhu al-Qi'dah, Dhu al-Hijjah, Muharram, Safar, Rabi' al-Awwal, and Rabi' al-Thani, and I left at the end of Jumada al-Ula.
5905 - My father said: And Muhammad bin Ja'far Ghundar, Ibn Abi Adi, and Al-Thaqafi had died before I arrived. I was informed that Muhammad bin Ja'far died in the year ninety-three, and Ibn Abi Adi and Abd al-Wahhab al-Thaqafi died in the year ninety-four before I arrived.
5906 - My father said: And I arrived in the fourth year, the year two hundred. We stayed with Abu Dawud, and he used to hold sessions [of hadith]. Then we moved to Abd al-Samad. We also used to visit Al-Bursani, and I had heard from him before that in the year ninety-four what I wanted from the hadith of Ibn Jurayj. I used to visit Abd al-Rahman and Bahz while staying with Yahya bin Sa'id. And I used to visit Uthman bin Umar in the year two hundred. The news of Sufyan bin Uyaynah's death came to us while we were with Abd al-Razzaq in the year ninety-eight. And Yahya bin Sa'id and Abd al-Rahman died while we were with Abd al-Razzaq in the year ninety-eight.
5907 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Qutaibah bin Sa'id narrated to us, saying: Al-Layth bin Sa'd narrated to us from Abu al-Aswad that Al-Zubair bin al-Awwam accepted Islam when he was eight years old. His uncle began torturing him with smoke so that he would leave Islam, but Al-Zubair refused. When his uncle saw that he would not leave it, he left him alone.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5908 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Qutaibah narrated to us, saying: Layth narrated to us from Abu al-Aswad from someone who narrated to him: That Ali bin Abi Talib accepted Islam when he was eight years old.
5909 - I found in my father's book: Qutaibah bin Sa'id informed us, saying: Abdullah bin al-Harith al-Khatmi—meaning Ibn Fudayl—narrated to us from his father, who said: I saw Abu al-Yusr, the Companion of the Prophet, wearing an Izar (lower garment) reaching halfway down his shins.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5910 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Abu Ibrahim Isma'il bin Muhammad—meaning Al-Mu'aqqib—narrated to me, saying: Yusuf—meaning Al-Majishon—narrated to us, saying: Sulayman bin Abd al-Malik became Caliph in the year ninety-six, and Umar bin Abd al-Aziz became Caliph in Safar of the year ninety-nine.
5911 - I found in my father's book: Rawh bin Ubadah narrated to us from Shu'bah, who said: Hilal al-Wazzan is a freedman of Juhaynah.
5912 - My father narrated to me, saying: Waki' narrated to us, saying: Abu al-Mu'tamar narrated to us from Ibn Sirin. My father said: Abu al-Mu'tamar's name is Yazid bin Tahman. From Mu'awiyah, who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: 'Do not ride on silk nor on leopard skins.' Ibn Sirin said: Mu'awiyah was not accused [of lying] in hadith from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace.
5913 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdullah bin Yazid al-Muqri' narrated to us, saying: Sa'id bin Abi Ayyub narrated to us, saying: Abu Aqil Zuhrah bin Ma'bad al-Taymi narrated to me from his grandfather Abdullah bin Hisham—and he had met the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. His mother, Zainab bint Humaid, took him to the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and said: 'O Messenger of Allah, accept his pledge of allegiance.' He said: 'He is young.' So he wiped his head and prayed for him.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5914 - My father narrated to me, saying: Haywah bin Shuraih and Yazid bin Abd Rabbih narrated to us, both saying: Baqiyyah bin al-Walid narrated to us, saying: Bahir bin Sa'd narrated to me from Khalid bin Ma'dan from Ibn Amr al-Sulami from Utbah bin Abd al-Sulami: That he narrated to them that a man asked the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, saying: 'How was the beginning of your affair, O Messenger of Allah?' He said: 'My nurse was from Banu Sa'd bin Bakr...'
5915 - Al-Sa'ib bin Khallad is Abu Sahlah.
5916 - My father narrated to me, saying: Shuraih bin al-Nu'man narrated to us, saying: Abdullah bin Wahb narrated to us from Amr bin al-Harith from Bakr bin Sawadah al-Judhami from Salih bin Khaywan from Abu Sahlah Al-Sa'ib bin Khallad.
5917 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Abd al-Rahman al-Muqri' narrated to us: Ibn Lahi'ah narrated to us from Abu Qabil, who said: I did not hear anything from Uqbah bin Amir al-Juhani except [this] hadith.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5918 - Ibn Lahi'ah said: And Yazid bin Abi Habib narrated it to me from Abu al-Khayr from Uqbah bin Amir, who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say: 'The destruction of my Ummah is in the Book and milk.' They said: 'O Messenger of Allah, what are the Book and milk?' He said: 'They learn [the Book] and interpret it contrary to what Allah, Mighty and Majestic, revealed. And they love milk, so they abandon the Friday prayers and congregations and go out into the desert (Ya'iddun).'
5919 - Hawtharah bin Ashras Abu Amir al-Adawi narrated to me, saying: Ja'far bin Kaysan Abu Ma'ruf narrated to me.
5920 - My father narrated to me, saying: Yazid bin Harun narrated to us, saying: Ja'far bin Kaysan informed us, saying: Shuwaysh Abu al-Ruqad narrated to me.
5921 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdullah bin Idris narrated to us, saying: My father used to say to me: 'Memorize, and beware of the book. But if you come [home], write it down; for if you need it one day or your heart becomes occupied, you will find your book.' He said: 'And I never wrote a single hadith in the presence of Layth, nor Al-Ash'ath, nor Al-A'mash.'
5922 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdullah bin Idris narrated to us, saying: I heard Abu Shaybah Abd al-Rahman bin Ishaq.
5923 - My father narrated to me, saying: Aswad bin Amir narrated to us, saying: Shu'bah narrated to us, saying: Abdullah bin Dinar informed me, saying: I heard Ibn Umar narrating from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, regarding the Night of Decree (Laylat al-Qadr). He said: 'Whoever among you is seeking it, let him seek it on the night of the twenty-seventh.' Shu'bah said: A trustworthy man mentioned to me from Sufyan that he used to say: 'He only said: Whoever is seeking it, let him seek it in the remaining seven.' Shu'bah said: 'And I do not know if he said this or that.' My father said: 'I think this trustworthy man is Yahya bin Sa'id al-Qattan.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5924 - My father narrated to me, saying: A sheikh whom he named narrated to us, saying: Harb bin Maimun narrated to us from Al-Nadr bin Anas, who said: 'He used to not engage in Tafsir (exegesis) in his presence'—meaning in the presence of Anas bin Malik.
5925 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Razzaq narrated to us, saying: Mu'tamar bin Sulayman informed us from his father from Mukhannath bin Sulaym—and he had Companionship—who said: 'Going out on the Day of Sacrifice equals a Hajj, and going out on the Day of Fitr equals an Umrah.'
5926 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Samad bin Abd al-Warith narrated to us, saying: Harb bin Shaddad narrated to us, and he was trustworthy.
5927 - I heard my father say: 'The ancient treasure (Al-Kanz al-'Adi) is what is from the minting of the Chosroes (Persian kings). And what is from the minting of Islam is lost property (Luqata) to be announced.'
5928 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abdullah bin Idris narrated to us, saying: I heard Isma'il say: 'I saw Abu Juhaifah placing the bier on his shoulder, saying: O Allah, forgive me and Abu Maysarah.'
5929 - I heard my father mention Abd al-Rahman bin Malik bin Mighwal, and he said: 'I tore up his hadith a long time ago.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5930 - I heard my father say: I have no doubt about it, except that I tore up his hadith. And it is among what he narrated to us, God willing—Abd al-Rahman bin Malik bin Mighwal narrated this hadith to us from Muhammad bin Suqa, and I have no doubt about it—meaning the hadith of Muhammad bin Suqa from Ibrahim al-Nakha'i from Al-Aswad bin Yazid from Abdullah bin Mas'ud from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace: 'Whoever consoles an afflicted person has the like of his reward.'
5931 - And I heard my father mention a hadith from Abd al-Rahman bin Malik bin Mighwal from Abu Husayn during discussion (Mudhakarah), not as formal hadith narration, so I wrote it from him. And he had a very bad opinion of him.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5932 - I heard my father say: It reached me from Ibn Idris that he said: 'I asked Al-A'mash about something, but he did not answer me.' Ibn Idris said: 'So I did not go to him for a year.'
5933 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Usama narrated to us from Al-A'mash—and I did not hear it from Al-A'mash—from Salim bin Abi al-Ja'd from Ali bin Alqamah from Hudhaifah or Abdullah—Abdullah bin Ahmad doubted—who said: 'For everything there is a bane, and the bane of this religion is Banu so-and-so.'
5934 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abd al-Razzaq narrated to us, saying: Ibn Jurayj narrated to us, saying: Ayyub bin Musa narrated to me that Ata bin Mina' informed him. And Ayyub claimed that Ata bin Mina' was among the most righteous of people.
5935 - I said to my father: Muhammad bin Khalid bin Athmah? He said: 'I see no harm in him.' I heard my father say: Talid bin Sulayman Abu Idris informed us, and he was lame in both legs.
5936 - I heard my father say: Ubaidullah bin Musa narrated to us, saying: Rabi' bin Habib narrated to us. My father said: This is Rabi' bin Habib, the brother of A'idh bin Habib.
5937 - My father said: And I heard from A'idh.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5938 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu al-Muwarri' Muhadir bin al-Muwarri' narrated to us, saying: Al-A'mash narrated to us from Ibrahim al-Taymi, who said: 'I met sixty Sheikhs from the companions of Abdullah in this mosque of ours; the youngest of them was Al-Harith bin Suwayd.'
5939 - My father narrated to me, saying: Sufyan bin Uyaynah narrated to us, saying: Kathir bin Kathir bin al-Muttalib bin Abi Wada'ah narrated to me; he heard some of his family narrating from his grandfather.
5940 - And Sufyan said once: From someone who heard his grandfather: That he saw the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, praying near the gate of Sahm, and people were passing in front of him, and there was no Sutrah (barrier) between them. And he said once: There was no Sutrah between him and the Kaaba.
5941 - Sufyan said: And Ibn Jurayj had informed us from Kathir from his father. So I asked him, and he said: 'I did not hear it from my father, but from some of my family from my grandfather: He saw the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, praying near the gate of Banu Sahm; there was no Sutrah between him and the Tawaf (circumambulation).'
5942 - I heard my father say: Isa bin Tahman is a trustworthy sheikh.
5943 - I heard my father say: Qais al-Kharifi is Qais bin Yazid.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5944 - My father narrated it to us, saying: Waki' narrated to us from Sufyan from Abu Hashim Al-Qasim bin Kathir from Qais bin Yazid al-Kharifi.
5945 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: He said: I was narrated to from Mu'adh bin Mu'adh from Ash'ath from Muhammad bin Sirin from Khalid al-Hadhdha' from Abu Qilabah from Abu al-Muhallab from Imran bin Husain the hadith of casting lots (Al-Qur'ah).
5946 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: He said: Budayl al-Uqayli is Abu Abdullah.
5947 - I heard my father say: Abu Dawud narrated to us, saying: Khalid bin Abi Uthman narrated to us, and he was trustworthy—thus said Abu Dawud.
5948 - I heard my father say: I heard Waki' say more than once: 'Qais bin al-Rabi' narrated to us, and Allah is the One whose help is sought.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5949 - I heard my father say: Harun al-A'war did not hear from Al-A'mash; he only narrated from Hamzah and Isma'il bin Muslim.
5950 - My father said: Hazm is a trustworthy, trustworthy sheikh (Thiqah Thiqah).
5951 - I asked my father about a hadith narrated to us by Khalaf bin Hisham al-Bazzar, who said: Ubayis bin Maimun narrated to us from Thabit al-Bunani from Anas bin Malik, who said: I heard the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say: 'Any woman who takes care of three daughters of hers will be with me in Paradise'—and he gestured with his two fingers. 'And any man who spends on three sisters or the like of them will be with me in Paradise like this'—and he gestured with his two fingers. My father said: This is a rejected (Munkar) hadith.
5952 - I asked my father about a hadith narrated to us by Khalaf bin Hisham al-Bazzar, who said: Ubayis narrated to us from Awn bin Abi Shaddad from Abu Uthman al-Nahdi from Salman al-Farisi, who said: I heard the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say: 'Whoever goes early to the Morning Prayer is given a quarter of faith. And whoever goes early to the market is given the banner of Iblis, and he is with the first who goes early and the last who returns.' My father said: This is a rejected (Munkar) hadith.
5953 - I asked my father about a hadith narrated to us by Khalaf bin Hisham, who said: Ubayis narrated to us from Musa bin Anas from his father Anas from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace: 'Do not say Surah Al-Baqarah, nor Surah Al-Imran, nor Surah Al-Nisa, and likewise the whole Quran. But say: The Surah in which the Cow is mentioned, and the one in which the Family of Imran is mentioned, and likewise the whole Quran.' My father said: A rejected (Munkar) hadith—meaning the hadith of Ubayis from Musa bin Anas.
5954 - I heard my father say: The hadiths of Ubayis are objectionable hadiths (Manakir).
5955 - The kunya of Ghunaym bin Qais is Abu al-Anbar.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5956 - My father narrated it to me, saying: Yahya bin Sa'id narrated to us from Thabit—meaning Ibn Umarah—who said: Ghunaym narrated to us, saying: Abu Musa said to us: 'You are according to the number of the companions of Talut on the day of Jalut.' He said: I said: 'How many were you, O Abu al-Anbar?' He said: 'Two hundred and fifty or three hundred and fifty.'
5957 - My father narrated to me, saying: Sufyan bin Uyaynah narrated to us, saying: Mansur bin Hayyan bin Abi al-Hayyaj informed me from Amr bin Maimun, who said: I was praying Fajr with Umar. When we finished, I looked at the face of my companion, but I did not recognize him. Sufyan said: He has two hadiths; I heard one of them and did not hear the other—as if he doubted it.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5958 - My father narrated to me, saying: I heard Sufyan say: Hisham—meaning Ibn Abd al-Malik—came to us in the month of Rabi' al-Awwal or al-Akhir in the year one hundred and twenty-five.
5959 - My father narrated to me, saying: Ishaq—meaning Ibn Isa al-Tabba'—narrated to us from Abu Ma'shar, who said: He died when six nights had passed from the month of Rabi' al-Akhir—meaning Hisham bin Abd al-Malik.
5960 - My father narrated to me, saying: Sufyan said—when it was mentioned to him that Hammad bin Zaid used to say in the hadith of the two pregnant women (Al-Hublayayn): Ka'b bin Sur—he said: 'I memorize it from him.' And he denied Ka'b bin Sur; it was as if he meant Ka'b al-Ahbar.
5961 - My father narrated to me, saying: The hadith of Al-Zuhri from Ja'far bin Amr bin Umayyah regarding ablution from what fire has touched was mentioned to Sufyan. He said: 'It is not among what I memorized from Al-Zuhri.'
5962 - My father narrated to me, saying: I heard Sufyan say: 'Al-Awfad were from the People of the Bench (Ahl al-Suffah), and Abu Hurairah was among them.'
5963 - My father narrated to me, saying: I heard Sufyan say: Suhaib prayed over Umar because Umar ordered Suhaib to lead the people in prayer until they agreed upon a man.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5964 - My father narrated to me, saying: I heard Sufyan say: 'The house of Abu Bakr was near the Minaret (Al-Manarah). And I saw a pavilion (Suradiq) when leaving the mosque, so I said: "Whose is this?" They said: "It belongs to Aisha bint Talha." Her mother was the daughter of Abu Bakr, so I think it was from there'—meaning from the side of Abu Bakr.
5965 - My father narrated to me, saying: I heard Sufyan say: 'As'al means small-headed, and Asma' means small-eared.'
5966 - I asked my father about Abu Amir al-Ash'ari Abdullah bin Barrad. He said: 'There is no harm in him; he was with us in Kufa and had good character.'
5967 - I asked my father about Muhammad bin Abi Bakr al-Muqaddami, and he recognized him. I said: 'Where did you know him?' He said: 'In Basra, with Yahya bin Sa'id al-Qattan. He used to come to him with a man from the people of Hadith called Sufyan'—meaning Sayfan al-Ra's (Sword-headed?). He said: 'He'—meaning Al-Muqaddami—'was very silent, hardly speaking, except that he used to visit Yahya bin Sa'id with Sufyan.' My father said: 'So Sufyan came to us, or I heard him in Basra discussing Hadith, and he used to say: "Ibn Thawa narrated to us"—intending Muhammad bin Sawa, for Sufyan had a lisp. And he was among those who memorized Hadith,' or as my father said.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5968 - I asked my father about a sheikh whom Muhammad bin Abi Bakr al-Muqaddami narrated to us from, called Suhayl bin Sabrah. My father said: 'Suhayl is trustworthy (Thiqah); Affan narrated to us from him.'
5969 - Muhammad bin Abi Bakr al-Muqaddami narrated to us, saying: Yahya bin Sa'id said: 'Suhayl used to leave Shu'bah, then come and sit, dictating to them what Shu'bah had narrated.'
5970 - Muhammad bin Abi Bakr al-Muqaddami narrated to us, saying: 'There was no one in Basra who had memorized more from Shu'bah than this one'—meaning Suhayl bin Sabrah.
5971 - I heard my father say: Yazid bin Harun narrated to us, saying: Abu Malik al-Ashja'i informed us, saying: Abu Khalid narrated to me, saying: Abu Hurairah narrated to me.
5972 - I asked my father: 'Who is this Abu Khalid?' He said: 'He is the father of Isma'il bin Abi Khalid.'
5973 - I heard my father say: 'The kunya of Abdullah bin al-Zubair is Abu Bakr.'
5974 - I heard my father say: 'Sa'id bin Abi Sa'id al-Maqburi is Sa'id bin Kaysan.'
5975 - I heard my father say: Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi said: I said to Sufyan: 'You narrated from Shu'bah, from Al-Hakam, from Ibrahim, from Ubaidah regarding a man who has a slave girl under him (as a wife), then he divorces her, so the master has intercourse with her?' He said: 'She is not lawful for him until she marries another husband.' He said: 'I did not narrate it.'
5976 - My father said: 'And Al-Dhamari'—meaning Abd al-Malik—'narrated it to us from Sufyan.'
5977 - I heard my father say: 'This is a trustworthy sheikh'—meaning Abu Asim Ali bin Ubaidullah al-Ghatafani.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5978 - I heard my father say: 'Musa bin al-Musayyib is Abu Ja'far'—meaning his kunya—'I know nothing but good [about him].'
5979 - I narrated to my father a hadith which Khalid bin Ibrahim Abu Muhammad the Muezzin narrated to us, saying: Salam narrated to us from Razin, the Judge of Antioch, who said: Al-A'mash narrated to us from Shaqiq from Abdullah bin Mas'ud, who said: 'While I was with the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, in one of the paths of Medina, suddenly I saw a man who had fallen (in a fit/epilepsy). I approached him and recited in his ears, and he sat up straight. The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "What did you recite in his ear, O son of Umm Abd?" I said: "May my father and mother be your ransom, I recited: {Did you then think that We created you in vain and that to Us you would not be returned?} [Al-Mu'minun: 115]." The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said to me: "By the One Who sent me with the truth, if a firm believer (Muwqin) recited it upon a mountain, it would move."' My father said: 'This hadith is fabricated (Mawdu'). This is the hadith of liars; it has an objectionable chain (Munkar al-Isnad).'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5980 - I asked my father about Abu Usama and Abu Asim, which of them is more established in Hadith? He said: 'Abu Usama is more established than a hundred like Abu Asim.'
5981 - I heard my father say: 'Abu Usama was precise in Hadith and intelligent.'
5982 - I narrated to my father a hadith which Ubaidullah bin Umar al-Qawariri narrated to us, saying: Mu'adh bin Mu'adh narrated to us, saying: Al-Ash'ath—meaning Ibn Abd al-Malik al-Humrani—narrated to us from Muhammad from Abdullah bin Shaqiq al-Uqayli from Aisha, who said: 'The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used not to pray in our hair (blankets/coverings) or our quilt.' My father said: 'I have never heard a hadith from Ash'ath more objectionable (Munkar) than this,' and he denied it with extreme denial.
5983 - Ziyad bin Ayyub Abu Hashim narrated to me, saying: Ali bin Muhammad, the nephew of Ya'la bin Ubaid, narrated to us, saying: Waki' narrated to us, saying: 'I have not heard a hadith regarding the Mahdi more authentic than a hadith narrated to us by Al-A'mash from Ibrahim al-Taymi from Al-Harith bin Suwayd, who said: I heard Ali saying: "Islam will decrease until no one says: Allah, Allah." And he said: "I indeed know the name of their leader and the resting place of their mounts."' 
5984 - He said: 'As for the hadith of Zaid al-Ammi from Abu al-Siddiq, it is nothing.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5985 - 'And the hadith of Ibrahim from Alqamah from Abdullah is nothing'—meaning the hadith of Yazid bin Abi Ziyad.
5986 - Ziyad bin Abi Ayyub narrated to me, saying: Ali bin Muhammad narrated to us, saying: Ishaq bin Sulayman narrated to us from Abu Ja'far al-Razi from Al-Rabi' bin Anas, who said: 'I sat with Al-Hasan for ten years, and I never heard him repeat a hadith.'
5987 - Ziyad bin Ayyub narrated to me, saying: Ali bin Muhammad narrated to me, saying: Abdullah bin Idris narrated to us, saying: 'Isma'il bin Abi Khalid dictated to me'—meaning the long hadith of Yazid bin al-Nu'man bin Bashir.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5988 - Ziyad bin Ayyub narrated to me, saying: Ali bin Muhammad narrated to us, saying: Abdullah—meaning Ibn Idris—narrated to us from his father, who said: 'I have not seen among the companions of Ibrahim anyone like Hammad.'
5989 - Abdullah said: And Ammar bin Saif informed me, saying: 'The books of Sufyan were with me.'
5990 - Ziyad bin Ayyub narrated to me, saying: Ali bin Muhammad narrated to us, saying: Abu Mu'awiyah narrated to us, saying: Al-A'mash obscured (the chain) for us; he said: 'Amr bin Abdullah—and he is Abu Ishaq—narrated to us from Awf bin Malik—and he is Abu al-Ahwas—who said: Abdullah said: "Indeed, part of a man's good Islam is that he sees a man as a Muslim and loves him."' 
5991 - Ziyad bin Ayyub narrated to me, saying: Ali bin Muhammad narrated to us, saying: Abu al-Husayn al-Ukli narrated to us, saying: Harun bin Abi Ibrahim informed me, saying: I asked Muhammad bin Sirin: 'How many [wives] did the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, die leaving behind?' He said: 'Leaving nine: Aisha, Umm Salamah, Maimuna, Sawda, Umm Habiba, Zainab, and Hafsa. And among those whom he took captive and married: Safiyya and Juwayriyah.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5992 - Ziyad bin Ayyub narrated to me, saying: Ali bin Muhammad narrated to us, saying: I heard my brother say: Hafs bin Ghiyath said: 'I never heard Al-A'mash mention a man ever except Amr bin Murrah, for I heard him say: May Allah have mercy on him, he was trustworthy regarding what he carried.'
5993 - Uthman bin Abi Shaybah narrated to us, saying: Abu Mu'awiyah narrated to us, saying: Al-A'mash narrated to us from Amr bin Murrah, and he was a Murji'.
5994 - Salamah bin Shabib narrated to me, saying: Al-Humaidi narrated to us, saying: Sufyan narrated to us, saying: 'I saw Mansur; when he heard the knocking of the boards, he stood up.' He said: 'And Mansur was in the Diwan (administration/roster), so when his turn came, he wore his clothes and stood guard.'
5995 - Salamah bin Shabib narrated to me, saying: Al-Humaidi narrated to us, saying: Sufyan bin Uyaynah narrated to us, saying: 'We had a small old man, a Basran called Durust. He said to me: "Humaid has become confused about what he heard from Anas. There is only a little from Thabit and Qatada from Anas. And I used to say to him: Inform me of what establishes it from Anas, and he would inform me. So we would come to Humaid and say: Did you hear Anas?"'
5996 - Salamah bin Shabib narrated to me, saying: Al-Humaidi narrated to us, saying: Sufyan narrated to us from Dawud, who said: Al-Sha'bi said: 'The most noble of Yemen are Banu Dhi.' A man asked him: 'Who are you from, O Abu Amr?' He said: 'I am from Banu Dhi Busr bin...'—meaning Ibn Adam.
5997 - My father said: Al-Sha'bi is Amir bin Sharahil bin Abd bin Dhi Kibad.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
5998 - Salamah narrated to me, saying: Al-Humaidi narrated to us, saying: Sufyan narrated to us from Dawud bin Abi Hind, who said: 'I never sat with anyone more knowledgeable than Al-Sha'bi.'
5999 - Salamah narrated to me, saying: Al-Humaidi narrated to us, saying: Sufyan narrated to us, saying: I heard Hajib al-Azdi narrating from Amr bin Dinar, who said: I heard Abu al-Sha'tha'. Sufyan said: 'And he was a leader among the Ibadhiyyah'—meaning Hajib al-Azdi.
6000 - Salamah narrated to me, saying: Al-Humaidi narrated to us, saying: Sufyan narrated to us, saying: Abu Musa—meaning Isra'il—narrated to us, saying: I heard Al-Hasan say: 'Al-Hasan bin Ali met Mu'awiyah with battalions like mountains...' and he mentioned the Hadith. He said: 'And he—meaning Mu'awiyah—sent Abd al-Rahman bin Samurah bin Habib bin Abd Shams.' Sufyan said: 'He had Companionship.' And Abdullah bin Amir bin Kurayz bin Habib bin Abd Shams.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
6001 - Salamah bin Shabib narrated to me, saying: Al-Humaidi narrated to us, saying: Sufyan narrated to us, saying: I heard Abd al-Karim from Mujahid, who said: 'Abu Ma'mar Abdullah bin Sakhbarah al-Azdi used to be counted as the tenth of ten of Abdullah's companions.'
6002 - Salamah narrated to me, saying: Al-Humaidi narrated to us, saying: Sufyan narrated to us, saying: Abd al-Karim narrated to us, saying: 'I ate horse meat in the time of Ibn al-Zubair and found it sweet.'
6003 - Sufyan said: 'And Abd al-Karim was the first one I sat with before Amr bin Dinar. In much of his Hadith he would not say "I heard," but would say "So-and-so said." So I fled from him and went to Amr bin Dinar, for he used to say "I heard," "I heard," and "He narrated to us."' Sufyan said: 'And when Abd al-Karim met me, he would spend my day not leaving me, saying: "Come, narrate to me what you heard," so I would narrate to him.'
6004 - Hudbah bin Khalid narrated to us, saying: Yazid bin Zurai' narrated to us, saying: 'My father slaughtered a horse in the neighborhood, and I saw its meat was yellow.'
6005 - Salamah narrated to me, saying: Al-Humaidi narrated to us, saying: Sufyan narrated to us, saying: Sa'id bin Abi Arubah, Yahya bin Subaih, and Hammam bin Yahya narrated to me from Qatada from Al-Nadr bin Anas from Bashir bin Nahik from Abu Hurairah from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and he mentioned the Hadith: 'Whoever frees a share of his in a slave...'
6006 - I asked my father about Yahya bin Subaih. He said: 'He is the grandfather of the children of Ghundar.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
6007 - Salamah narrated to me, saying: Al-Humaidi narrated to us, saying: Sufyan narrated to us, saying: Sa'id bin Abi Arubah informed us from Qatada, who said: 'I presented the scroll of Jabir to Sa'id bin al-Musayyib, and he did not reject it.'
6008 - Salamah narrated to us, saying: Al-Humaidi narrated to us, saying: Sufyan narrated to us, saying: Ibn Abi Arubah said: 'Aban bin Abi Ayyash came to me offering his daughter to me, and [offering] to pay her dowry from his own wealth.'
6009 - Salamah bin Shabib narrated to me, saying: Al-Humaidi Abdullah bin al-Zubair narrated to us, saying: Sufyan bin Uyaynah narrated to us, saying: I heard Wahb bin Uqbah say: 'I was born with two years remaining from the Caliphate of Uthman.' Abdullah said: 'And he is Wahb bin Uqbah al-Kufi.'
6010 - Salamah narrated to me, saying: Al-Humaidi narrated to us, saying: Sufyan narrated to us, saying: Abu Zuhair Mu'awiyah bin Hudayj narrated to us, saying: 'I saw Tawus squatting (on his heels).'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
6011 - Salamah narrated to me, saying: Al-Humaidi narrated to us, saying: Sufyan narrated to us, saying: I heard Ali Abu Husain al-Ju'fi say: I heard Mujahid.
6012 - Salamah narrated to me, saying: Al-Humaidi narrated to us, saying: Sufyan narrated to us, saying: 'I sat with Ammar'—meaning Al-Duhni—'in the year one hundred and twenty-three at Amr bin Dinar's.'
6013 - Salamah narrated to me, saying: Al-Humaidi narrated to us, saying: I heard Sufyan being asked about this Hadith of Abd al-Malik: 'Did you hear it from Abd al-Malik?' He said: 'I did not hear all of it.' Then I heard Sufyan narrate from Abd al-Malik from Qabisah bin Jabir, who said: 'I accompanied Talhah bin Ubaidullah, and I never saw a man who gave large amounts of wealth without being asked more than him.' And he mentioned that he heard it from Abd al-Malik, so I thought that he did not hear all of it.
6014 - Salamah narrated to me, saying: Al-Humaidi narrated to us, saying: Sufyan narrated to us, saying: I said to Mis'ar: 'Who have you seen most cautious regarding Hadith?' He said: 'Al-Qasim bin Abd al-Rahman and Amr bin Dinar.'
6015 - Salamah narrated to me, saying: Al-Humaidi narrated to us, saying: Sufyan narrated to us from Asim—meaning Al-Ahwal—who said: Al-Qasim—meaning Ibn Abd al-Rahman—said: 'There is no one in Kufa more knowledgeable about the Hadith of Ibn Mas'ud than Sulayman al-A'mash.'
6016 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: 'Abu Bakr bin Abd al-Rahman, Ali bin Husain, Sa'id bin al-Musayyib, and Urwah bin al-Zubair died in the year ninety-four, and it was called the Year of the Jurists. Mujahid and Jabir bin Zaid died in the year one hundred and three. Tawus and Salim died in the year one hundred and six. And Ata died in the year fifteen (115).'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text: 6017 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: He said: Yazid bin Harun said: 'Mansur bin Zadhan... Zadhan was the doorkeeper of Al-Hajjaj, and he resembled a non-Arab (Ajami).' He said: 'And Al-Fadl bin Dalham was a butcher among us, a poet, and a Mu'tazili. And Sahl bin Abi al-Salt was a Mu'tazili; I used to dictate with him in the mosque but I would not listen to him, and I knew that about him.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
6018 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: We asked Yazid bin Harun about the People of Sunnah: 'What do you say regarding Ali and Uthman?' He spoke as if he equated them and said: 'If one favors one of them over the other, it is not a fault.'
6019 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: 'The first time I came to Mecca was in the year eighty-nine (189 AH), the second in the year ninety-one (191 AH), and the third in the year ninety-six (196 AH).'
6020 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Abdullah bin Yazid Abu Abd al-Rahman al-Muqri narrated to us in the year one hundred and ninety-seven, saying: Abu Zur'ah Haywah bin Shuraih al-Tujibi, then al-Kindi, narrated to us.
6021 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Abdullah bin Yazid narrated to us, saying: Haywah bin Shuraih and Ibn Lahi'ah narrated to us, saying: Abu Isa Sulayman bin Kaysan narrated to us.
6022 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: He said: Abu Abd al-Rahman narrated to us, saying: Abu Hafs Harmalah bin Imran al-Tujibi, then al-Kindi, narrated to us.
6023 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: He said: Abdullah bin Yazid Abu Abd al-Rahman said: 'Al-Miqdad bin Amr, and he is his father, and Al-Aswad is his mother's husband.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
6024 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: He said: Abu Abd al-Rahman narrated to us, saying: 'I heard from Al-Mas'udi in either forty-eight or forty-seven, and I do not recall seeing him after the year fifty-two.'
6025 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Abu Abd al-Rahman al-Muqri narrated to us from his memory, saying: Abu Yahya Sa'id bin Abi Ayyub—his father's nickname was Miqlas, the freedman of Abu Hurairah—narrated to us.
6026 - Abu Abd al-Rahman said from his father: 'Al-Muqri's memory was poor, and I used to not listen to him except from a book.'
6027 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Abu Abd al-Rahman al-Muqri narrated to us, saying: Haywah narrated to us, saying: Abu Yunus Shu'ayb bin Abi Sa'id informed me that Abu Hurairah used to say: 'Whoever gives a strap (of a sandal) in the path of Allah, let him not take it back.'
6028 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Abu Abd al-Rahman al-Muqri narrated to us, saying: Haywah narrated to us, saying: Al-Hajjaj bin Shaddad al-San'ani informed me that Abu Salih Sa'id bin Abd al-Rahman al-Ghifari informed him that Sulaym bin Itr al-Tujibi was preaching to the people while standing, so Silah bin al-Harith al-Ghifari—and he was one of the Companions of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace—said to him... My father said: 'In what Abu Abd al-Rahman read to us from his book, we had it as Sulayman bin Itr, but he said from his memory: Sulaym bin Itr.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
6029 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Abu Abd al-Rahman narrated to us, saying: Ayyash bin Uqbah al-Hadrami, the uncle of Ibn Lahi'ah, narrated to us; a truthful sheikh.
6030 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: He said: The Hadith of Ubaidullah bin Abi Yazid from Ubaid bin Umair was mentioned to Sufyan, so he said: 'Al-Basri—meaning Hammad bin Zaid—informed me of it: He said: He cups (performs Hijama) as long as he does not shave his hair.'
6031 - I heard my father say: 'Abu Quza'ah Suwayd bin Hujair is trustworthy, reliable (Thabt) in Hadith; Shu'bah and Dawud bin Shabur narrated from him.'
6032 - I heard my father say: A man said to Sufyan: 'O Abu Muhammad, we have a man called Khalaf bin Khalifah who claims that he saw Amr bin Huraith.' He said: 'He lied; perhaps he saw Ja'far bin Amr bin Huraith.'
6033 - Ziyad bin Ayyub narrated to me, saying: Ali bin Muhammad, the nephew of Ya'la bin Ubaid, narrated to us, saying: Abu Mu'awiyah narrated to us from Shabib bin Shaybah, who said: 'Al-Hasan died in the year one hundred and ten.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
6034 - Ziyad bin Ayyub narrated to us, saying: Ali bin Muhammad narrated to us, saying: I heard Abu Bakr bin Ayyash say: Abd al-Malik bin Umair said to me: 'I am one hundred and three years old.' I said: 'I have never seen anyone narrate like you.'
6035 - Ziyad bin Ayyub narrated to us, saying: Ali bin Muhammad narrated to us, saying: Waki' narrated to us from Abu al-Ambas bin Kathir, who said: I said to Abu Wa'il: 'Did you catch the time of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace?' He said: 'I caught his time while I was a beardless boy, but I did not see him.'
6036 - Ziyad bin Ayyub narrated to us, saying: Ali bin Muhammad narrated to us, saying: Yahya bin Isa al-Ramli al-Khazzaz narrated to us from Al-A'mash, who said: 'I saw Al-Ma'rur bin Suwayd with black hair (head), and he had reached one hundred and twenty [years].'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
6037 - Abu Abd al-Rahman, a relative of Husain Mushkdanah, narrated to us, saying: Yahya bin Isa narrated this Hadith to us.
6038 - Zakariya bin Yahya Zahmwayh narrated to us, saying: I heard Khalaf bin Khalifah say: 'Umar bin Abd al-Aziz assigned a stipend for me when I was eight years old, and assigned one for a brother of mine who was six years old, and attached us to our patrons (Mawali).'
6039 - Zakariya bin Yahya narrated to us, saying: Sinan bin Harun narrated to us from Tu'mah from Yazid bin Abi Ziyad from Abd al-Rahman bin Abi Laila, who said: 'Uwais al-Qarni was killed on the Day of Siffin.'
6040 - Muhammad bin Tawbah al-Anbari Abu Safwan narrated to me, and I asked him about Tawbah al-Anbari, whose son is he? He said: 'Tawbah bin Abi al-Asad.'
6041 - Muhammad said: 'And my father is the eldest child of Tawbah al-Anbari. And Tawbah has another son called Isma'il bin Tawbah.' He said: 'The grandfather of Abbas al-Anbari.'
6042 - Abu Sa'id al-Ashajj narrated to me, saying: Hafs bin Ghiyath narrated to us, saying: We asked Al-A'mash about the name of Abu Razin. He said: 'Mas'ud bin Malik.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
6043 - Abu Sa'id al-Ashajj narrated to me, saying: Ibn Idris narrated to us from Abu Ishaq al-Shaibani from Abd al-Malik bin Iyas, who said: I said to Ibrahim: 'Who should we ask after you?' He said: 'Hammad.'
6044 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: Ibn Idris narrated to us, saying: 'I never heard Abu Ishaq al-Shaibani mention Hammad except that he praised him well.'
6045 - Abu Sa'id narrated to us, saying: Ibn Idris narrated to us from his father from Ibn Shubrumah, who said: 'I have never seen anyone more reliable (aman) regarding knowledge to me than Hammad.'
6046 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: Ibn Idris narrated to us from Shu'bah, who said: I heard Al-Hakam say: 'If a man catches the people on Friday while they are in the Tashahhud, he has caught [the prayer].' I said: 'Does any of your companions say this other than one man?' He said: 'And who is he?' I said: 'Hammad.' He said: 'And who among them is like Hammad?'
6047 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: Ibn Idris narrated to us, saying: I said to Al-A'mash: 'My father informed me from Hammad from Sa'id bin Jubair.' He said: 'We did not use to turn to Hammad.'
6048 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: Ibn Fudayl narrated to us from Mughirah, who said: 'He used to say: Fudayl bin Amr is the successor of Ibrahim after him.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
6049 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: Ibn Fudayl narrated to us from Abd al-Malik bin Abi Sulayman, who said: 'They used to ask Sa'id bin Jubair for fatwas, and he would say: "You ask me for fatwas when Ibrahim is among you?"'
6050 - Abu Safwan al-Anbari, whose name is Muhammad bin Tawbah, narrated to me, saying: Mu'adh bin Mu'adh narrated to us, saying: Sawwar bin Abdullah sent for me seeking me at home, but I was not found. He sought me in the market, but I was not found. When evening came, I went to him. He said to me: 'O my son, it is disliked for a man to be sought in his home and not be found, or in his market and not be found, or in his mosque and not be found'—or as Abu Safwan said, this or something similar.
6051 - Abu Sa'id al-Ashajj narrated to me, saying: Ibn Idris narrated to us from Ibn Awn, who said: 'When Ibrahim died, we took him out at night and buried him. Then I met Al-Sha'bi, and he said: "Were you among those who attended Ibrahim?" I said: "Yes." He said: "May Allah have mercy on him. Indeed, he has left no one like him." I said: "In Kufa?" He said: "Neither in Kufa, nor in Basra, nor in such and such, nor in such and such." He said: It was as if he meant himself.'
6052 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: Ibn Ulayyah narrated to us from Ibn Awn, who said: 'When Ibrahim died, we went out and buried him at night. Then I met Al-Sha'bi, and he said: "Were you among those who attended Ibrahim?" So I turned to him. He said: "May Allah have mercy on him. Indeed, he has left no one like him." I said: "In Kufa?" He said: "Neither in Kufa, nor in Basra, nor in Sham, nor in such and such."' 
6053 - Abu Sa'id narrated to us, saying: Ibn Fudayl narrated to us from Asim al-Ahwal, who said: 'I informed Al-Hasan of the death of Al-Sha'bi. He said: "May Allah have mercy on him; he held a high status in Islam."'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
6054 - Al-Hasan bin Isa narrated to us, saying: Abdullah bin al-Mubarak narrated to us, saying: Al-Muthanna bin Sa'id informed us from Qatada from Sa'id bin al-Musayyib, who said: 'The closest part of the earth to the heaven is the Rock (in Jerusalem), and the furthest part of the earth from the heaven is Ayla.'
6055 - Hasan bin Isa narrated to me, saying: Jarir bin Abd al-Hamid said: I asked Yahya bin Sa'id al-Ansari—and I never saw a sheikh nobler than him—I said: 'Who did you meet from the Companions of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and the Successors (Tabi'in)? What was their saying regarding Ali and Uthman?' He said: 'Those whom I met from the Companions of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and the Successors did not differ regarding Abu Bakr and Umar and their superiority.' He said: 'The difference was only regarding Ali and Uthman.'
6056 - Al-Hasan bin Isa narrated to me, saying: I heard Ibn al-Mubarak say: 'I was with Sufyan when the news of Shu'bah's death came to him. He said: "Today, Hadith has died."' 
6057 - Al-Hasan bin Isa narrated to me, saying: I heard Ibn al-Mubarak [say]: 'We do not choose anyone over Sufyan.'
6058 - Al-Hasan bin Isa narrated to me, saying: I heard Ibn al-Mubarak say: 'I never sat with a man whose company was more beneficial than Wuhaib bin al-Ward.'
6058b - My father narrated to me, saying: Affan narrated to us, saying: Hammad bin Salamah narrated to us, saying: Hisham bin Urwah informed us from Urwah from Aisha: That Abu Bakr said to her: 'Which day did the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, die?' She said: 'On Monday.' He said: 'Whatever Allah wills. I indeed hope [to die] between now and the night.' So he died on the night of Tuesday and was buried at night. And Aisha died at night, and Abdullah bin al-Zubair buried her at night.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
6059 - My father narrated to me, saying: Affan narrated to us, saying: Hammad b. Salamah narrated to us, saying: Abdullah b. Shaddad informed us from Abu Udhrah—he said: And he had met the Prophet (peace be upon him)—from Aisha.
6060 - Dawud b. Amr narrated to us, saying: Nafi' b. Umar Al-Jumahi narrated to us. Dawud said: Nafi' died in the year one hundred and sixty-nine during the incident of Al-Husayn.
6061 - Dawud said: And I heard Sufyan b. Uyaynah say on the day Nafi' b. Umar died: "He did not leave anyone like him behind."

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
6062 - Dawud b. Amr narrated to us, saying: I heard Abdur-Rahman b. Mahdi mention, saying: Sufyan b. Uyaynah was among the most knowledgeable of people regarding the Hadith of the people of Hijaz.
6063 - Dawud, meaning Ibn Amr, narrated to us, saying: I heard Abdur-Rahman b. Mahdi mention, saying: Sufyan Al-Thawri saw a note (Ruq'ah) with me while he was hiding in Basra with us. He said: "What is this note?" I said: "A note belonging to a Sheikh here called Al-Aswad b. Shayban, and he used to narrate from Abu Nawfal b. Abi Aqrab." He said: So he looked into the note and said to me: "If you want to go to this Sheikh, let me know."
6063 - b Harun b. Ma'ruf narrated to me, saying: Damrah b. Rabi'ah informed us from Al-Sari b. Yahya who said: Al-Hasan died in the year one hundred and ten, and Ibn Sirin died one hundred nights after Al-Hasan.
6064 - Harun b. Ma'ruf narrated to me, saying: Damrah narrated to us from Ibn Shawdhab who said: I witnessed the funeral of Tawus in Mecca in the year one hundred and six. I heard them saying: "May Allah have mercy on you, Abu Abdur-Rahman; he performed Hajj forty times." He said: And Salim died in the year one hundred and six. He said: Hisham b. Abd al-Malik visited him [when he arrived] initially, and visited him after the Hajj, then Salim died, and Hisham prayed over him.
6065 - Yunus b. Abdur-Rahim Al-Asqalani narrated to us, saying: Damrah narrated to us, saying: Uthman b. Ata narrated to us, saying: My father's birth was in the year fifty of the dating system. Ibn Ata said: My birth was in the year eighty-eight.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
6066 - Yunus b. Abdur-Rahim narrated to us, saying: The name of Abu Qirsafah is Jundarah b. Khayshanah b. Murrah b. Wa'ilah b. Al-Fakih b. Amr b. Al-Harith b. Malik b. Al-Nadr b. Kinanah.
6067 - Yunus b. Abdur-Rahim narrated to us, saying: Ayyash b. Yazid narrated to us, saying: Attiyah b. Sa'id narrated to me, saying: I saw Abu Qirsafah wearing a Buriyun burnous, holding a stick in his hand, walking in Sanajiyah.
6068 - Yunus narrated to us, saying: Ayyash b. Yazid narrated to us, saying: Ziyad b. Al-Ja'd narrated to me, saying: I saw Abu Qirsafah wearing a black Buriyun burnous, holding a stick in his hand upon which he leaned, removing harmful objects from the road wherever he went, and he was walking in Sanajiyah and Baqita.
6069 - Hasan b. Isa narrated to me, saying: I heard Ibn Al-Mubarak mention Ibn Mahdi, and he said: "That is a man who, since we have known him, increases in goodness every day."
6070 - Hasan b. Isa narrated to me, saying: I heard Ibn Al-Mubarak say: I used to come to Sufyan and listen along with the people. Then Sufyan would stand up, and I would not ask him about anything but follow him. He would signal to me, then turn to one of the mosques and sleep a good sleep. Then he would wake up and say to me: "What do you have?" So I would take out a note containing between fifty to a hundred hadiths, and he would narrate to me. I had this from him every day.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
6071 - Hasan b. Isa narrated to me, saying: I heard Ibn Al-Mubarak say: Do not write from Jarir b. Abd al-Hamid the hadith of Al-Sari b. Isma'il, Muhammad b. Salim, and Ubaydah b. Mu'attab.
6072 - Hasan b. Isa narrated to me, saying: I heard Ibn Al-Mubarak say: "Is the matter anything but what Dawud Al-Ta'i was upon?"
6073 - Hasan b. Isa narrated to me, saying: Ibn Al-Mubarak did not equate anyone with Sufyan, nor [did he equate anyone] with Abu Bakr b. Ayyash during the time of Abu Bakr.
6074 - Hasan b. Isa narrated to me, saying: Ibn Al-Mubarak abandoned Al-Hasan b. Dinar, Amr b. Thabit, Ayyub b. Khut, Muhammad b. Salim, Ubaydah, and Al-Sari b. Isma'il, meaning he abandoned narrating hadith from them.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
6075 - Hasan b. Isa narrated to me, saying: I heard Abdullah b. Al-Mubarak—and I asked him about Abd al-Salam b. Harb—say: "I have known him." And if he said "I have known him," he had destroyed him.
6076 - My father said: We used to mention something regarding Abd al-Salam b. Harb; he used not to say "Haddathana" (He narrated to us) except in one or two hadiths in which I heard him say "Haddathana."
6077 - My father said: It was said to Ibn Al-Mubarak regarding Abd al-Salam, and he said: "My legs will not carry me to him."
6078 - Hasan b. Isa narrated to me, saying: I asked Ibn Al-Mubarak about Asbat and Muhammad b. Fudayl b. Ghazwan, so he remained silent. When it was a few days later, he saw me and said to me: "O Hasan, your two companions—I do not think our companions approve of them."

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
6079 - Abu Hammam b. Abi Badr narrated to us, saying: Ali b. Al-Hasan b. Shaqiq narrated to us, saying: I heard Ibn Al-Mubarak say: Do not narrate from Amr b. Thabit, for he insults the Predecessors (Salaf).
6080 - Hasan b. Isa narrated to me, saying: We attended the door of Sufyan b. Uyaynah at night, waiting for him, and this was at the time of the last Isha prayer. One would say: "He is with Yahya b. Khalid," and another would say: "He is with Ja'far b. Yahya." A man among them said: "O Lord! Is it not fitting that You delight my eye with a single man who levels this knowledge among the people?" A man said: "Good! Was he from the people of Basra?" He said: "Yes, Abdullah b. Al-Mubarak Al-Khurasani." Another said: "Give us someone else." So he remained silent. I then came to Kufa and narrated this to Ibn Al-Mubarak, except that I did not tell him: "You named a man." It was as if he realized, then he said: "Why didn't they say Fudayl b. Iyad?" I said: "They did not say [him]." So he remained silent.
6081 - Hasan b. Isa narrated to me, saying: Ibn Al-Mubarak narrated to us, saying: Yunus informed me, saying: I said to Al-Zuhri: "You have known my service, my devotion, and my inclination towards you." He said: "Yes, so what do you wish?" He said: I said: "Give me your books." He said: "O maid, bring out my books." He said: So she brought out a bundle of books. He said to me: "Take them." He said: So I looked into them, and behold, they were books from his brothers to him. He said: I said: "These are not the books I want; I only want the books of knowledge." He said: "I have never written a hadith."
6082 - Hasan b. Isa narrated to me, saying: Ibn Al-Mubarak narrated to us, saying: We entered upon Musa b. Uqbah and asked him to narrate to us. He said: "If you eat, I will narrate to you; and if you do not eat, I will not narrate to you." He said: We said: "Then we will eat." He said: So he brought out a tray to us with many loaves of bread on it, and nothing else. He said: So I ate.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
6083 - Abu Abdur-Rahman said: Habba Al-Urani, his kunya is Abu Qudamah. Dawud b. Amr narrated it to us, saying: Hassan b. Ibrahim Al-Kirmani narrated to us, saying: Muhammad, meaning Ibn Salamah b. Kuhayl, narrated to us from Salamah from Habba Abu Qudamah Al-Urani.
6084 - Ishaq b. Mansur Al-Kawsaj Al-Marwazi narrated to us, saying: Yunus b. Abi Ishaq informed us, saying: Habba Al-Urani said to Al-Harith b. Abdullah Al-A'war: "O Abu Zuhayr, Abu Ma'shar died in the year one hundred and seventy, and he had changed before that." He said: And Abu Ma'shar said to me: "I wrote when I was a boy of ten, and I remember a tree that was in my land."
6085 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: He said: Abu Kamil narrated to us, saying: Abdul-Aziz Al-Majishun b. Abi Salamah Abu Al-Asbagh narrated to us.
6086 - Abu Abdur-Rahman said: Abu Khushaynah, the companion of Al-Ziyadi—Hammad b. Zayd narrated from him—his name is Abdullah b. Sa'd. My father narrated it to me, saying: Mu'ammal narrated to us, saying: Hammad b. Zayd narrated to us, saying: Abdullah b. Sa'd Abu Khushaynah, the companion of Al-Ziyadi, narrated to us. As for the other Abu Khushaynah, his name is Hajib b. Umar, the brother of Isa b. Umar the Grammarian; Shu'bah and others narrated from him.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
6087 - Shayban b. Abi Shaybah narrated to us, saying: Salam b. Miskin narrated to us from Imran b. Abdullah Al-Khuza'i who said: I asked Ibn Umar about an issue. He said: "Where are you from?" I said: "From the people of Iraq." He said: "From which of them?" I said: "From the people of Basra." He said: "Then where is the Client of the Ansar among you?" Meaning Al-Hasan b. Abi Al-Hasan.
6088 - Shayban b. Abi Shaybah narrated to us, saying: Suwayd, meaning Abu Hatim the owner of the food, narrated to us, saying: I witnessed Al-Hasan when a woman from Banu Taym Allah, from the worshippers of the people of Basra—there was no one better than her in her time—came to him. She said: "O Abu Sa'id, I saw in a dream, similar to what a sleeper sees, as if I was asking a group of angels for a verdict regarding a woman with irregular bleeding (Mustahadah). They said: 'Do you ask us for a verdict while Al-Hasan is among you, holding the ring of Gabriel (peace be upon him)?'"
6089 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Abdullah b. Ja'far b. Abdur-Rahman b. Al-Miswar b. Makhramah Al-Zuhri; Abu Ja'far is his kunya.
