6090 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Abdullah b. Muhammad b. Abi Yahya Al-Aslami, he is called Sahbal; Abu Muhammad is his kunya.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
6091 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: He said: Al-Hasan b. Al-Rabi' narrated to us, saying: Abu Bakr b. Ayyash was born in the year ninety-five. Hasan b. Al-Rabi' said: And I asked Ibn Al-Mubarak before he died, and he said: "I am sixty-three." And he died in the year eighty-one [181 AH].
6092 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Ahmad b. Muhammad Abu Ja'far, meaning Al-Saffar, narrated to us, saying: I heard Yazid b. Zuray' say: "We have a brother in Baghdad called Abdul-Wahhab Al-Khaffaf." He said: And I heard Yazid b. Zuray' say: "We used to say: Whoever did not enter the room of Ibn Abi Arubah has not heard Fiqh."
6093 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Abdah b. Abdullah narrated to us, saying: Abu Ishaq Al-Fazari died in the year one hundred and eighty-five, and Makhlad b. Husayn died in the year one hundred and ninety-one.
6094 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Abu Sa'id the client of Banu Hashim narrated to us, saying: I met him, meaning Ibn Lahi'ah, in the year sixty-four [164 AH] while he was in the judiciary.
6095 - I found in my father's book in his handwriting: Abu Abdur-Rahman Al-Muqri said: It reached me that the crow lives five hundred years.
6096 - I heard my father say: Abu Sa'id the client of Banu Hashim narrated to us, saying: Yahya b. Ya'fur Abu Al-Namir Al-Mazini narrated to us, saying: Abu Mus'ab Hilal b. Yazid narrated to us. My father said: And Waki' said "Yahya b. Ja'far." My father said: Waki' made a mistake; it is only Yahya b. Ya'fur.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
6097 - I heard my father say: Abdur-Razzaq b. Hammam b. Nafi' Abu Bakr Al-San'ani narrated to us, saying: Umar b. Hawshab, a San'ani from the Abna' (Persian descendants), the cousin of Muthanna b. Al-Sabbah, narrated to me.
6098 - Abu Sa'id Al-Ashajj narrated to me, saying: Abdullah b. Idris narrated to us from Isma'il b. Hammad b. Abi Sulayman from his father, who said: We gave Ibrahim the good news of Al-Hajjaj's death, so he wept and said: "I did not think that anyone would weep out of joy."
6099 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: Isa b. Hanifah Al-Kindi narrated to us, saying: Al-Ala b. Al-Mughirah Al-Bundar narrated to me, saying: I gave Al-Hasan the good news of Al-Hajjaj's death, so he prostrated.
6100 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: Abu Amr Hani b. Sa'id Al-Nakha'i narrated to us from Ash'ath b. Sawwar from Al-Hakam and Hammad, who said: Ibrahim used not to speak until he was asked.
6101 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: Hafs narrated to us from Ash'ath from Ibn Sirin that he used not to speak by his opinion, except something he had heard.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
6102 - Abu Sa'id narrated to us, saying: Atham narrated to us from Al-A'mash who said: I never heard Ibrahim speak by his opinion regarding anything ever.
6103 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: Ibn Idris narrated to us, saying: My father and Malik b. Mighwal informed me from Al-Hakam who said: The first one to judge over Kufa was Salman b. Rabi'ah Al-Bahili; for forty days no litigant came to him.
6104 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: Ibn Idris narrated to us from Mis'ar from Muharib b. Dithar who said: When Abu Bakr took charge, he appointed Abu Ubaydah over the Treasury and appointed Umar over the Judiciary. So he remained for a year with no one bringing a dispute to him.
6105 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: Ibn Idris narrated to us from his father who said: I saw Sa'd b. Ibrahim when he came to Khalid b. Abdullah. He came out from his presence wearing a garment of fur/silk (Khazz), and the students of Hadith surrounded him.
6106 - I found in my father's book: Al-Nadr b. Muhammad Al-Khurasani said: Talhah b. Musarrif said: If I see these hanging Mushafs (copies of Quran) that are not read from, I remember the Isra' (Bani Israil?).
6107 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: Ibn Idris narrated to us, saying: I heard Shu'bah say: Between the death of Al-Hasan and Ibn Sirin was one hundred days.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
6108 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: Ibn Idris narrated to us, saying: I asked Shu'bah: "In what year did Al-Hakam die?" He said: "In the year one hundred and fifteen." Ibn Idris said: "And in it I was born."
6109 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: I heard Hafs on the day Ibn Idris died saying to Abdullah b. Numayr in the house of Ibn Idris: "He was older than me by two years."
6110 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: Hafs died in the year one hundred and ninety-four.
6111 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: I heard Abu Bakr b. Ayyash say: I asked Al-A'mash: "How old was Ibrahim on the day he died?" He said: "Sixty." Abu Bakr indicated it with his hand.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
6112 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: I heard Abu Bakr b. Ayyash say: I asked Mughirah: "How old was Ibrahim on the day he died?" He said: "He died having risen above youth but descending from old age."
6113 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: Abu Bakr b. Ayyash narrated to us, saying: I asked Sulayman b. Bashir: "How old was Ibrahim on the day he died?" He said: "Between forty-eight to fifty."
6114 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: Abdur-Rahman b. Muhammad Al-Muharibi narrated to us from Ash'ath b. Sawwar who said: Shurayh died when he was one hundred and ten years old, and Suwayd b. Ghaflah died when he was one hundred and twenty years old.
6115 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: I heard Abu Usamah say: Ubaydullah said from Nafi': Umar was killed when he was fifty-seven. Abu Abdur-Rahman said: This is the correct [view] regarding the killing of Umar.
6116 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: Abu Usamah narrated to us from Ibn Uyaynah from Ja'far who said: Ali was killed when he was fifty-seven.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
6117 - My father narrated to me, saying: Abu Bakr b. Ayyash narrated to us from Abu Yahya Al-Qattat who said: Muhammad b. Ka'b Al-Qurazi came to Kufa and stayed there for some time. Then he came to us, and we said: "How did you see the people of Kufa?" He said: "The like of a single one of them cannot be found [elsewhere]."
6118 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: Abu Bakr b. Ayyash narrated to us from Abu Yahya Al-Qattat who said: I arrived with Habib b. Abi Thabit in Ta'if, and it was as if a prophet had arrived among them.
6119 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: Ibn Idris narrated to us from Shu'bah who said: I asked Al-Hakam and Salamah b. Kuhayl about Zadhan. Al-Hakam said: "He narrated much." And Salamah b. Kuhayl said: "Abu Al-Bakhtari is more pleasing to me than him."
6120 - Abu Sa'id said: Zadhan was the Muezzin of Kindah, Al-Hakam was also the Muezzin of Kindah, and Abu Layla was the Muezzin of Kindah.
6121 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: Ibn Idris narrated to us, saying: I said to Shu'bah: "This Sufyan, what can you say about him?" He said: "He narrated from Abu Shu'ayb the Madman." Ibn Idris said: Meaning Al-Salt b. Dinar.
6122 - He said: I said: "Mahdi b. Maymun?" He said: "Trustworthy." I said: "He informed me from Salm Al-Alawi that he saw Aban writing in the presence of Anas on a tray (Saburjah)." He said: "Salm sees the crescent moon before the people [meaning he has sharp sight or sees what others don't]."
6123 - Abu Sa'id and Abu Ma'mar narrated to me, saying: Ibn Idris narrated to us, saying: I asked Shu'bah about Amr b. Murrah and Mansur. He said: "Amr was the more silent of the two men."

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
6124 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: Ibn Idris narrated to us from Hisham from Ibn Sirin who said: I have not seen a people with black heads [Arabs/Iraqis] more knowledgeable than the people of Kufa.
6125 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: Ahmad b. Bashir the client of Amr b. Hurayth narrated to us, saying: Mis'ar narrated to us, saying: I heard Abdullah b. Maysarah say: "I have not seen..." and he mentioned Amr b. Murrah, so he said: "Indeed, I consider him the best of the people of the earth."
6126 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: Ibn Idris narrated to us from Layth from Mujahid who said: The most pleasing of the people of Kufa to me are four: Talhah, Zubayd, and Yahya b. Ubaydullah.
6127 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: Ibn Idris narrated to us from Harish who said: I witnessed Talhah, Abu Ishaq, Salamah b. Kuhayl, Habib b. Abi Thabit, and Abu Ma'shar; all of them saying: "I have not seen the like of Talhah, and I have not met the like of Talhah." Ibn Idris said: And they had seen the companions of Abdullah [b. Mas'ud].
6128 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: Ibn Idris narrated to us from Harish who said: I said to Zubayd: "You have seen the people." He said: "I have not seen anyone more pleasing to me than Talhah."

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
6129 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: Ibn Idris narrated to us from Abdur-Rahman b. Abd al-Malik b. Abjar from his father who said: I never saw Talhah among a people except that he had superiority over them.
6130 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: Abdullah b. Wahb Al-Hadrami—and Abu Usamah used to visit him—narrated to us from Harish b. Sulayman who said: I have not seen with my eyes anyone better than Talhah b. Musarrif. And he is not Ibn Wahb Al-Masri.
6131 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: Hafs b. Ghiyath narrated to us from Uqbah b. Ishaq who said: I heard Malik b. Mighwal say to Al-Qasim b. Al-Walid: "Did you see with your eye the like of Talhah b. Musarrif?" He said: "Yes, Husayn b. Abdur-Rahman Al-Nakha'i."
6132 - Abu Sa'id narrated to us, saying: Abu Usamah narrated to us from Mis'ar who said: I was sitting with Wabarah, and an old man passed by. I wanted to stand up for him, but he [Wabarah] grabbed my garment and said: "Sit; what you missed of the hadith is more [valuable]."
6133 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: Ibn Idris narrated to us from Shu'bah from a man from Abu Al-Sha'tha who said: I asked the Ocean, meaning Ibn Abbas.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
6134 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: Abu Khalid Al-Ahmar said: I came to the house of Al-A'mash after his death. I said: "Where are you, O Umayrah?"—the wife of Al-A'mash. "Where are you, O Hud?"—his daughter. "Where are the nobles (Ghatarif) of the Arabs who used to come to this assembly?"
6135 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: Abu Khalid Al-Ahmar said: We were with Al-A'mash, and they asked him about a hadith. He said to Ibn Al-Mukhtar: "Do you see any of the people of Hadith?" He closed his eye and said: "I do not see anyone, O Abu Muhammad." So he narrated it.
6136 - Abu Sa'id narrated to us, saying: Abu Khalid Al-Ahmar said: Amr b. Qays and Sufyan b. Sa'id went to Musa Al-Juhani and forbade him from narrating the hadith of Asma bint Umays. So whenever he was asked about it, he would say: "Amr b. Qays and Sufyan forbade me."
6137 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: Ibn Idris narrated to us from Harun b. Abi Ibrahim from Abdullah b. Ubayd b. Umayr that Aisha gave the one who brought her the good news of Ibn Al-Zubayr's life on the Day of the Camel ten thousand.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
6138 - Abu Sa'id narrated to us, saying: I asked Ibn Harun b. Abi Ibrahim about the name of his grandfather. He said: Harun b. Ayman, the client of Aqqar b. Al-Mughirah b. Shu'bah.
6139 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: Ibn Idris narrated to us, saying: I saw Qabus riding on a horse in the land of Jukha, reciting a verse of poetry. Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: Abu Usamah narrated to us, saying: Ibn Awn, when he mentioned someone who impressed him, would mention Raja b. Haywah.
6140 - Abu Sa'id, Abu Bakr b. Abi Shaybah, and Shuja' b. Makhlad narrated to me, saying: Hafs narrated to us from Ja'far, meaning Ibn Muhammad, from his father who said: There was nothing between [the births of] Hasan and Husayn except a period of purity (Tuhr).
6141 - And my father narrated to me, saying: Abu Bakr narrated to us... and he mentioned the hadith.
6142 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: Abu Bakr b. Ayyash narrated to us from Jarad Al-Dabbi who said: I came upon Al-Hasan while he was storytelling (preaching).
6143 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: Ibn Idris narrated to us from Musa b. Sa'id b. Abi Burdah who said: Al-Sha'bi used to come to our house and say: "Where is the Moon of the House?" Meaning Sa'id b. Abi Burdah.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
6144 - Abu Sa'id said: And his mother was a Hamdani woman, Qaylah bint Abdur-Rahman b. Sa'id b. Qays Al-Hamdani.
6145 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: Ibn Idris narrated to us from Musa b. Sa'id b. Abi Burdah who said: Ibrahim b. Umar b. Sa'd used to pass by us and say: "We and you are but one household."
6146 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: I heard Abu Bakr b. Ayyash say: I saw Mansur, when he stood in prayer, tuck his beard into his chest.
6147 - Abu Sa'id narrated to us, saying: Abu Khalid Al-Ahmar narrated to us, saying: I heard Shu'bah say: I said to Ayyub: "Did you narrate a thousand from Al-Hasan?" He said: "Yes, and a thousand, and a thousand."
6148 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: Ibn Fudayl narrated to us from his father who said: I heard Kurdus say: Khabbab was the sixth of six; he had a sixth of Islam.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
6149 - Abu Sa'id narrated to me, saying: Al-Hudhayl b. Umar b. Abi Al-Gharif narrated to us from Yahya b. Zakariyya b. Abi Za'idah from Mujalid from Al-Sha'bi who said: Al-Ash'ath b. Qays came and sat on a cushion belonging to Shurayh. So Shurayh said to him: "O Abu Muhammad!" He said: "A litigant is coming."
6150 - Zakariyya b. Yahya Zahmawayh narrated to me, saying: Sharik was born in the year ninety-five and died in the year one hundred and seventy-seven.
6151 - Zakariyya narrated to me, saying: Shadhan said to me while I was sitting with Husayn Al-Ashqar: "O Zakariyya, do not let Husayn corrupt you."
6152 - Zakariyya narrated to me, saying: Sharik narrated to us from Mughirah from Ibrahim who said: Ubaydah saw me while I was writing in his presence. He said: "Do not immortalize any writing from me."

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
6153 - Zakariya narrated to me, saying: Sharik narrated to us from Mughira and Abu Hamzah from Ibrahim regarding the one who prays behind the row alone. He said: 'It counts for him.' Zahmawayh said: Sahl al-Balkhi said to Sharik: 'O Abu Abdullah, does he repeat it?' Sharik said: 'Correct your book; it counts for him.'
6154 - I heard Zahmawayh in the year two hundred and thirty-three say: 'I entered the year seventy-nine.'
6155 - Zahmawayh narrated to me, saying: Ibn Abi Za'idah narrated to us, saying: Al-A'mash narrated to us, saying: I asked Ibrahim about the fuller (Al-Qassar). He said: 'He is liable [for damages].' Al-A'mash said: Then it reached me from Hammad from Ibrahim that he said: 'He is not liable.' So I met Hammad and said: 'Are you the one narrating from Ibrahim such and such? I do not know if I ever saw you with Ibrahim or not.' He said: 'Do not do that, O Abu Muhammad, for this is hard on me.'

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
6156 - Muhammad bin Bakkar narrated to me from his book, saying: Abd al-Rahman bin Abi al-Zinad narrated to us from his father, who said: Umar bin Abd al-Aziz used to come to Ubaydullah bin Abdullah bin Utbah asking him [questions] while he [Umar] was the governor. Sometimes he permitted him [entry], and sometimes he turned him away. And he used to narrate from Abdullah bin Abbas.
6157 - Muhammad bin Abi Bakr al-Muqaddami narrated to me from Sa'id bin Amir, who said: Shu'bah said: 'I have not narrated from a man except that I visited him more times than I narrated from him.' He said: And I heard Shu'bah say: 'I recall Hadith at night until my heart aches.'
6158 - My father narrated to me, saying: Shuja' bin Makhlad narrated to us, saying: Abdullah bin Idris narrated to us, saying: I heard Mukhtar bin Fulful—and he was among the best of Muslims—narrating to us while his eyes were shedding tears.
6159 - He said: Abu Abd al-Rahman narrated to us: There is nothing with Ibn Uyaynah of Hadith similar to 'Al-Ard' (presentation/reading back to the teacher) except two hadiths. He said: I said to Amr bin Dinar: 'O Abu Muhammad, did you hear Jabir say: A man passed through the mosque with arrows, so the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said to him: "Hold them by their blades so they do not scratch a Muslim"?' He said: 'Yes.'
6160 - He said: And I said to Abd al-Rahman bin al-Qasim: 'Did you hear your father narrate from Aisha that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, kissed her?' He said: So he remained silent towards me for a little while, then said: 'Yes.' He said: And Abd al-Rahman only refrained from narrating this hadith out of shyness.

book_title: Al-Ilal wa Ma'rifat al-Rijal
text:
6161 - My father narrated to me, saying: I heard Sufyan say: Umar bin Qais—meaning Sandal—said to me: 'He will not narrate it to you, he will not mention it.' Sufyan said: So I said to Abd al-Rahman: 'Did you hear your father narrate from Aisha?' He remained silent for a while, then said: 'Yes.'
Praise be to Allah alone, and may Allah and His angels send blessings upon Muhammad the Prophet and his family and grant them peace. End of Part Sixteen of the parts of Abdullah, and it is the end of the book. Praise be to Allah alone, and may Allah and His angels send blessings upon Muhammad the Prophet and his family and grant them peace.
